description:
Amazing atmosphere and the freshness of the food was to die for. I had the lobster roll and my husband the chowder. Both tasted very fresh, crisp, and clean. You could taste the butter on the roll before you even took a bite and the lobster in the roll was all high quality claw meat. 

A bit pricey when looking at the menu but the quality is definitely worth the pricing.
author: Lindsay B.

description:
"I date white women. This makes a lot of people unhappy, mostly black women." - Dennis Rodman

Location: Lower Pacific Heights, San Francisco. 

I came here with one of my Yelp sisters... "Yo E! I'm in yo hood!" So we spontaneously decide to meet up. The trendy part of Fillmore was a great meeting spot, and if you know San Francisco, y'know... with your latest Lululemon yoga pants, and overpriced LattéZ. Nonetheless we figured to meet on Fillmore after perusing a bunch of cafes in the area. Since we both craved seafood it was an easy decision on Woodhouse at say noon-ish.

After meeting up at the Kabuki we stroll to Fillmore. Yes, walking to your meals is a pro tip on staying fit! Lululemon or not! And after a few blocks we arrive to a very clean, country kitchen setting, with everything so white... the walls, silly. We are both famished so order almost immediately after receiving the menus. I order the Anchor Beer Battered Fish & Chips. My trendy friend orders a Maine Split Top Lobster Roll. I add the House Iced Tea and she adds the Arnold Palmer.

As we sit and chat about Yelp (I know sad), girl talk, and yesterday's gossip, we can't help watching the upper crust people. And before we can scream "white picket fence" our lunch is delivered to our table. After a few bites, more chit-chat, we both agree it's a fabulous lunch. My Fish & Chips was pretty perfect, crisp outside, moist inside. My friend also really enjoyed the Lobster Roll. I'm stuffed, but my friend decides to order dessert too. She chooses the Sourdough Bread Pudding. Delicious! 

In the end, I recommend Woodhouse Fish Company to all. It's a really cute café as described above, and in this case the neighborhood pretty much set the tone. Ok, what I'm trying to say is, yes it's delicious, but on the pricier side. I'm not being cheap, I'm just saying I don't need to spend extra to impress Reese Witherspoon. Hey now, the food was delicious, and my friend.. well whiter than white... D'uh!
author: Eric R.

description:
Enjoy this hidden gem (IMHO) on Fillmore. We didn't plan well for the meal as we rush to the city. Wanted seafood but know that the areas in North Beach and wharf are chock full of tourist (and horrendous parking).

So, looked into Fillmore. Parking STILL sucked but at least traffic was better. After 10 minutes found a great spot as someone pulled out--score!

At Woodhouse, we ordered the marque dishes, namely the cioppino and the lobster roll. I went for the larger version, i.e. 6 oz. My lobster roll was hearty on a toasted bread that was not soggy. The sauce for the lobster was understated but fine. My meal came with fries and cole slaw. The fries were perfectly done (I wonder if they were in duck fat? Cuz they taste like something I had elsewhere)--crispy. The cole slaw was light--maybe a bit more vinegar to give it some tang would help. Overall, I think the lobster roll is good and authentic but may instead next time go for...

The Cioppino! It was amazing. My other half ordered it and was it great. Chock full of seafood from Massachusetts (mussels) and locally. It is very hearty. A little more kick/spice than I would like but good. Also pretty amazing price for that.

Ambience is a regular meal place. We were seated next to an adorable toddler but with premonition of what's to come, we moved to a table farther away with bar-type seating. Lucky! cuz soon the kid did not want to eat...(by the way, the fish and chips looked great at that table).

Overall, I will bookmark and keep this place in mind for another meal.
author: Sonny W.

description:
Everyone must come oysters Tuesday's..!! Got myself 2 dozens and yes I shared.. 
$1 each point Reyes oysters so chilled cold and sweet clean n popping into my mouth. So happy we only waited about 20 minutes. But please do go earlier without wait.. other items in menu like lobster rolls r good too. But most of all oyster craving people come come fast!! And order uppp..
author: Crisy G.

description:
Yo! $1 oysters Tuesday is where it's at!!! 

Oysters HH is the best HH. And Woodhouse is da spot. First of all, this place is small and quite popular so the wait can be long. I came with three other ppl and we waited for about 30 mins. They also don't sit everyone until your party is all present so keep that in mind. 

Between the four of us, we destroyed 5 dozens aka 60 raw oysters. The oysters were decent sized and juicy. Keep in mind they were only $1 each. What a steal!! My dining companions also ordered clam chowder and crab cakes. I got myself a small lobster roll. I had not had a legit lobster roll for so long since Rhode Island. Man, the lobster roll at Woodhouse did not disappoint!!! The bun was toasted just right, the big chunks of lobster were so fresh, and the flavor was spot on! It came with slaws and French fries. I'm not usually a fried food eater but those fries were finger-licking good! 

Now forget about Taco Tuesday, Oysters Tuesday is the new black! I've definitely found a good reason to like Tuesdays more. Can't wait for the next Oysters HH!!!
author: Angela F. W.

description:
Best lobster roll place in SF!

This is the best lobster roll I've ever had in my life. I always get small size and It is very fulfilling! Ok, so their bun is toasty, buttery and just perfect and their lobster meats are juicy, buttery and very flavorful! This place is great for a date night. The atmosphere is cozy and cute. Service is fast and amazing. Oh and that sourdough bread pudding was unexpectedly amazing! Try it, you will love it!

Highly recommended! Hands down the best lobster roll in sf! Solid 5 stars!
author: Clare L.

description:
Was eager to eat here yet our female Server yesterday for lunch was a bit on the moody non helpful side... killed the fun.

Ordered: 
- Crab Louie Salad- light and good
- Bluepoint Oyster- meh 
  - Was told by server that they were large not medium- Not True- Small to medium size 
- Mussels w garlic bread- Very Small mussels and basic broth
- DIY Arnold Palmer- Enjoyable 

PRO: Helpful busters 
          Cute ambience

CON: Female Server 
           Small place a lil cramped seating
author: Cat Zaimi, M A.

description:
I have been coming to Woodhouse Fish Company with my wife and family for many years and every single time has been an amazing culinary experience.  I have tried many things on their menu including the clam chowder, calamari, dungeness crab, crab sandwich, lobster roll, ciopinno, and pasta.  Every single thing on their menu is delicious and consistently good.  

The one thing I come here for the most is their lobster roll, which is just out of the world delicious.  It is so moist, tender, and juicy that you will literally eat yourself into a food coma.  Every time I have it I am so full I feel like my pants are going to burst open because of how incredibly delicious it is.  Last time I was there I had their cioppino, which was equally amazing, although I did not care for the fish in it that much.  But other than that, it was the best ciopinno I've ever had.  The clams, mussels, squid, and other seafood in it were outstanding, as was the sauce.  

My only suggestion would be to offer something other than french fries with the lobster and crab roll sandwiches because it cheapens the experience.  The fries are good, but I would suggest serving freshly baked potato chips instead - it would be a more appropriate match.  Keep the coleslaw, though, because that stuff is amazing.  I don't even normally like coleslaw but the one they serve with the lobster roll is so yummy.

Parking nearby is hellacious and there is absolutely no room in this restaurant to move around - it can get quite crowded, so I wouldn't come here if you are feeling claustrophobic.  I don't think there is anything they can do about it because this place is so damn popular that they have to make use of every last square foot of space in it to pack everyone in. 

Another highlight of Woodhouse is their customer service.  Every server is friendly and accomodating.  They have such good service and will do their best to keep you happy and keep your water cups full.  The food always comes out hot and steamy.  

Prices are about what you would expect for food of this quality, so it isn't cheap, but it isn't overly expensive either.  It's definitely not a place I can afford to go to regularly, but I will come here periodically to satisfy my lobster craving.  

Definitely check this place out.  They set the bar so high it will be difficult to go anywhere else for seafood afterwards.
author: Howard B.

description:
I joined a friend for lunch here & had a lobster roll & cup of New England Clam Chowder & Arnold Palmer. My chowder was excellent, not thick or runny and can excellent flavor & clam pieces. My lobster roll was perfect too, delicately dressed, tender & flavorful. For the lobster roll, you have a choice of small for $24 or large for $38.
My dining partner had the fish & chips which he said was excellent. 
The do it yourself Arnold Palmer was fun, arrived for assembly so you can adjust your sweetness.
We shared the sourdough bread pudding for dessert which a bit dense & heavy (it is a bread pudding after all) but it had good flavor.

Service is very friendly & helpful.
author: Pam M.

description:
Yummers!  Had to get their iconic lobster roll. It didn't disappoint at all. The roll was authentic to east coast, and I got a small which was 3 Oz of lobster. Came with French fried & coleslaw. My friends got the crabcakes, and we shared the BBQ oysters- also done excellently. 

We truly had a nice girls out day lunch, and the service was also amazing!  

Will come back again.
author: Meme E.

description: Been wanting to check out this place for a while, and finally had the chance to. We got a mix of fresh and fried foods, with the tartar, the fried calamari, and some oysters. We paired this with a bottle of wine, and came to a total of just over a hundred. If you are in the area and are looking for seafood, then I recommend stopping by. If you are on a mission to find the best seafood in the city, then I think there are some better options for the price that you are paying here.
author: Ross S.

description:
Been here twice for lunch. We love this place! They are centrally locates to the shops on Fillmore and a great place to fuel up before or after your sartorial adventures.

During our most recent visit, we enjoyed:

Blue Point oysters
- these were one of the featured oysters on their daily specials board
- we discovered these during a recent trip to Seattle & we're pleasantly surprised to find them here
- they were creamy, fresh, and delicious (but not quite as good as fresh out of the water in WA) Still VERY tasty!!

Fried Ipswich clam bellies 
- first time trying these and so glad we did!
- they were nicely breaded and freshly fried
- served with lemon, homemade tartar sauce and cocktail sauce 
- we'd get these again despite the higher price ($24/order)

New England Clam chowder- delicious and loaded with bits of clam & small cubes of potatoes 

Crab Louis salad - loaded with fresh crab atop fresh, cold lettuce. LOVED it!

Fried Ipswich Clam roll with fries. More of that deliciousness in sandwich form

Host, server, waitstaff all so professional, friendly and attentive. Our water glasses were never empty long and they anticipated our every need. Great job! It's such a pleasure coming here!
author: Bella L.

description:
Hands down amazing. We had a little bit of a wait, but not too bad considering there were 5 of us and it's $1 oyster Tuesday. 

Started with $1 Oysters and the tuna tartare as apps. Both came out extremely fast. The tartare was so good and juicy. I wish we had ordered two. 

I ordered the crab melt for my meal. Really good, although The bread was slightly over-toasted, as you can see on the pic. Not enough to take away a star though. I tried a coworkers mussels, the juice was to die for. 10/10. Crab cakes were amazing, and the crab fettuccine I tried was also so good!!! Will come back next time I'm in SF!!!!
author: Mandie C.

description:
Really good lobster roll, fresh and the sauce is tasty too. The clam chowder is definitely up there with ones I've had in Boston!

I didn't love the fries, a little to hard and crispy for me.

The restaurant is nice and relaxed, I've tried the one on Market Street too and found them both great for eating solo, without a load of additional attention!
author: Cassandra G.

description:
Great seafood place!

My friend and I were just walking around the street finding what was left opened after 10pm since the place we wanted to go to was closed. Behold! Woodhouse Fish Co. was still opened and the menu looked very appetizing.

We each ordered a cup of new england clam chowder and shared a dungeness crab fettuccine. The clam chowder was yummy and I didn't taste any sand, which is a huge plus. The dungeness crab fettucine was also delicious. The flavors were incorporated very well and the crab was tasty.

Service was great. I was dehydrated so I was chugging my water, but the waitresses never failed to refill my water.

Will definitely be back!
author: Julian Y.

description: Yum! Out of all the delicious foods, I always have to get the bbq oysters from this place every time I go to Outsidelands! On our 4th year in a
author: Kaz S.

description:
$1 oysters on Tuesday!

We were craving some seafood and Woodhouse was highly recommended on Yelp, so away we went. 

This location is pretty small and they're walk-in only, but we managed to snag a table around 6:45pm. About 5 mins after being seated, there was a wait, so we got lucky.

The $1 oysters are a great deal and we slurped down almost two dozen Point Reyes oysters. We also shared the dungeness crab steamed in white wine, lemon, and garlic butter. The crab was a let down and all legs. We thought it was going to be an entire crab, but were sadly mistaken. They left out all the best parts of the it! The crab wasn't fresh and you could totally tell it was pre-cooked, then steamed again in the wine/lemon. The whole thing lacked flavor and salt, but at least we were able to drown our sorrows in $1 oysters.....
author: Jonelle T.

description:
I recently had my birthday meal at Woodhouse Fish Co. I have no doubt they serve the best lobster rolls in town! We were served with lobster rolls, fish & chips and some cioppino. Customer service was equally good. One minor complaint, the seating area/chairs were rather unclean.

-Ambiance: 4.5/5
-Price: 4.4/5
-Service: 4.8/5
-Taste: 4.8/5

Bon Appétit @41fearless10
author: Andrew J.

description:
Pretty cool to find a tasty and casual seafood place that's not near the water.

The small restaraunt is a snug fit but the seating is efficient with tables all along both walls. There's no reservations so be ready to wait or go hang at the bar.

Over the couple of times I've been here I've enjoyed the cheddar cheese crab melt and the standard lobster roll. Both rolls are great and you can't go wrong with either however, for me the standard lobster roll is a better play. The lobster is fresh, bright and refreshing while satisfying my hungry belly. Couple either roll with the creamy clam chowder and you'll feel like you're on the pier.

Per usual parking in the area sucks but it's SF so it's par for the course. Don't pass up this unassuming restaraunt as the Woodhouse will not disappoint.
author: Stan W.

description: My husband and I went to San Fransisco to catch a baseball game and to check out the city, we stumbled across the Woodhouse Fish Company, and took a chance and stopped in, this place was fabulous.  The Crab Roll was incredible and more than enough to satisfy my seafood craving.  The service was good, not exceptional.  The atmosphere was a total hole-in-the-wall, with seafaring decor that was quaint. This place is a must!
author: Jessica M.

description:
When I lived in the Castro, Woodhouse was one of my favorite restaurants. It was easy to get to, and the wait was always worthwhile. Now, it's not as easily accessible... But I happened to attend a concert at the Fillmore and was tasked with finding a dinner venue. The choice was obvious.

I like that this Woodhouse can seat more people. We made a reservation online, which was thankful because it was a pretty full house on a Friday evening. We were seated immediately, and our wait staff was super friendly.

I got the usual... My Toasted-Buttered Dungeness Crab Roll. The small is always enough food for me. The fries and coleslaw at both Woodhouse locations are just ok, but the crab roll makes the whole culinary experience awesome. Would highly recommend.

I should probably try few other things on the menu, but I'm too married to the crab roll. Oh, we also had the octopus special, which was phenomenal. All the seafood tastes so fresh, which is what they're known for. Thanks for living up to all your promises, Woodhouse!
author: Stefanie C.

description: My family is originally from New Orleans so I'm always nervous bringing them to local seafood places.... they're picky. This place was the first time everyone has had only extremely positive things to say. The clam chowder was authentic and just the right amount of clammy and the fish and chips were delicious. The only negative was the dessert but all in all you should definitely try this place. I know I'll be back for sure.
author: Beth M.

description:
Favorite place for lunch when I'm craving seafood.

I usually get the lobster or the crab roll. Tons of crab or lobster is stuffed into a buttery bread roll with cole slaw. Your taste buds will not be disappointed. Make sure you order an Arnold Palmer as well to wash it down.

Two thumbs up
author: Mabel Y.

description:
TUESDAY- $1 OYSTERS!!! Need I say more? I respected that the restaurant did not downgrade the quality or size of the oysters despite the lower price. They were all very fresh- and came paired with some cocktail sauce, garlic, and a lemon.

The Clam Chowder has three flavor options. I chose the Hartford, which is a mix of New England and Tomato Manhattan chowders. This was AMAZING. The flavors worked together so well and they didn't skimp on clams. There was some sand, but I feel that's sometimes unavoidable. I added a hint of Tabasco and lemon to it for fun as well, but definitely try the soup without altering it first. 

Lobster roll- the best I have ever had!! Most places make it so rich or creamy that I can't stand to take another bite after a few. This lobster roll was really light, fresh, and tasted very clean; it wasn't heavy at all. The bun was toasted perfectly. Low key that bun was a star of the show too. I chose the 3 Oz version and that was definitely the way to go. The 6 Oz would had been way too much lobster. 

The service here is extremely attentive as well. Expect your waters to be filled continuously!
author: Amber T.

description:
I used to dine here back when I lived in the neighborhood (see my previous review). Although it's been a few years since my last visit, I'm happy to report that this place is just as good as I remember. And judging by the 30-minute wait to get seated (FYI, they don't accept reservations; walk-ins only), Woodhouse Fish Company is just as popular as ever.

My go-to dish continues to be their Baja-Style Fish Tacos (crispy battered cod topped with cabbage, chipotle aioli, pico de gallo & avocado slices). Could be my favorite fish taco in town. Each bite just melts in your mouth. Make sure you get an order of their garlic bread to share with the table.

Service is friendly and efficient. They have a decent selection of beers, wine, and non-alcoholic beverages. 

Be warned, this place is small, so it can get pretty loud when it's full. Also, the food isn't exactly cheap. My fish taco dish was $18. Although you get 3 tacos for the price, I kind of wish you could just order 2 tacos for $14 or $15 (because 3 tacos is just way too much food). 

All in all, these are minor gripes. I really dig Woodhouse Fish Company. If you're looking for solid seafood in SF without all the tourist traps of Fisherman's Wharf, you should pay a visit to this restaurant. Hook, Line, and Sinker!
author: Kevin B.

description:
Been here twice but the visits came with a 5 year gap and my latest visit confirms why. This place has limited options but if done well I'm fine with it. He $24 lobster roll was a joke, 3oz of lobster claw.  Absolutely no true lobster meat.  It was also tossed in shallots Mayo dressing that didn't do much but mask the true flavor of the lobster. The bread was on point using a toasted sourdough that holds well with the filling.  I had a nice cider there.  Service was fine.  Overall the food experience could have been better.

Food 3
Service 4
Overall 3.5
author: Patrick C.

description:
I gry coast ew up on the water in the Northeast. I have been in Colorado for nearly fifty years. Every time I visit any coastline, I hope for great seafood. the Woodhouse delivers. I had steamed little necks, followed by
a fried oyster and pork belly Po' Boy. I was in bivalve heaven tonight.
author: Jeff F.

description:
We came here for an early-ish dinner a while back and here's the short version of it:
- The service was phenomenal until they wanted to kick us out as soon as they saw us almost done with our meal.
- It was very loud
- The fish was nice and crispy
- The crab in the crab roll was outstandingly buttery and delectable and is a must order

So would I come back? Yes, the food was just that good and the interior very kitsch. Just expect to eat and leave if they're busy because you will get an evil eye. The prices are a bit expensive, but the quality of the food meets it.
author: Carolen M.

description:
The wife yelped this place for a weekend visit. It is a small venue with great food.

Started out with clam chowder, really good.
Wife had fish and chips. Cod was very lightly battered and was some of the best we ever had. I enjoyed the crab cakes with a side salad. The chipotle sauce was good and spicy. 

For sure we will recommend this place and we will be back.
author: Jimmie M.

description:
What I ordered.
- Large lobster Roll
- Fathom IPA

What I thought.
- The lobster roll was just so damn tasty. I've pretty new to eating lobster in general but I feel like this experience solidified my like for it. 

Will I return?
- If I'm in the area.. yes!
author: Herbert G.

description:
Clam chowder, clam chowder, clam chowder!! 

This place was phenomenal! We stopped here after an Uber driver recommended this place and I'm so glad we stopped in. We made reservations and were seated promptly upon arrival. The service was friendly and attentive.

I ordered the clam chowder to share with the hubby and I also ordered the lobster roll. Can you guess that the clam chowder was good? It was delicious, actually- the texture was perfect, flavor was amazing, nice and meaty; a must get!

The lobster roll was also very tasty. The lobster was fresh and the roll was crunchy on the edges with a soft center.

Overall, I highly recommend this place!
author: Naema K.

description:
This little restaurant was jam-packed and we had to wait for a few min to get a table. Their seafood was amazing. Although the price was a bit higher than Portland, but it's normal in SF. 
The decor was decent but the mixed seafood dish was to die for. Ladies, they have high stools here so if you're gonna wear mini skirt, be aware!!
author: Ping K.

description: This has been one of my favorite neighborhood restaurants until tonight we ask for a table for 2 and we are told it will be a 15-20 minute wait but there is an empty table in front of me?  I asked why can't we be seated at the table and the sweet young hostess tells me her manager is saving the table for 4 people.  I asked what 4 people since no one is waiting for a table except us.  The hostess apologizes and explains her manager said we had to wait and she could not seat us.  Needless to say - we left so the manager could continue to save the table for the 4 invisible people that were not present and as a result two long time customers will never return nor recommend the restaurant to anyone.
author: Franzetta H.

description:
Great place love the grilled calamari , 
I've been to both location . Good stuff 
They're always busy
author: Joyce C.

description:
Whenever I visit San Francisco, I'm always on the hunt for Dungeness crab. On this particular day, I was craving it in a roll. Came here because of the good reviews and it definitely didn't disappoint. 

I asked the waitress what the difference was in the prices. She says that it's the amount of meat - 3 vs. 6 ounces of meat, but the same amount of bread. Signed up for the 6. I wish I could go into detail about the meal, but I honestly blacked out. I took one bite, my eyes widened, my jaw unhinged, and I scarfed down the rest. It was so delicious that I don't even remember eating it. I get bits and pieces from time to time - I think I remember the bread being buttery and the crab meat just melting in my mouth. 

I enjoyed the fries a bit slower (but not that much slower) - they were crispy and salted just right. I was pretty full by the end, but I really wish I had room for another roll. Maybe next time I'll try to breathe between bites.
author: Victoria P.

description:
This is a smaller restaurant and they do not take reservations; so it'll be a long wait if you have a large group but it was evident that the host was trying to get us a seat ASAP which is nice. 

It's an extra $2 to sub for any side which threw me off when the bill came - which isn't that big of a deal but I did regret subbing my fries for onion rings as the batter for the rings wasn't very fresh. It was dark brown and was extremely hard which wasn't too satisfying to eat. A friend got fries and they were really good - similar to McDonald's. Everything else was really good so this restaurant is definitely a must for me!
author: Jacklyn C.

description: Came here at 3pm, and there were only two other people in the restaurant. Food came quick, and as always was amazing (ordered the dungeness crab roll). I think I prefer the location on Fillmore as I can imagine it would be very hard to find parking during a busier time. But then again, that's SF for ya. Will be back.
author: Sarah M.

description: Wanted to try a seafood restaurant in SF, and this place had many reviews. Service was excellent but I was underwhelmed by the food?? Went with lobster roll and one of each oyster; maybe I'm just not a fan of lobster rolls? There's big chunks of meat and the bread is soft and good, but overall I feel like it's lacking in some flavor? Have had much better experience with baked lobster fresh out the shell dipped in butter and lemon sauce- I guess chilled lobster takes away from the palate picking up intensity of flavor. Oysters were just ok, have had better at EMC, didn't find them exactly flavorful. Not sure if something's wrong with my tastebuds, it seems many other people enjoy this place, it's not bad! But for this price point I was expecting something more memorable, I feel like I've forgotten the taste of what I've eaten here already. Great service though!
author: Vincent H.

description:
Solid seafood restaurant with appropriate decor, very friendly and efficient staff, and good quality food, albeit at a steep price for what it actually is. 

We came in for lunch and the hostess and the rest of the staff were very friendly and always smiling. The waitress was on top of everything and attentive without being annoying. The rest of the staff was quick to refill our waters and take away dishes when we were done. 

The atmosphere was well executed with tasteful and appropriate decor all the way down to the lights above the bar area. The TV in a painting frame was also interesting. 

The food was delicious but nothing that will blow your mind away. The price was also rather high.

We ordered the large clam chowder to split. I'm glad we did as we saw a table next to us get the small later and it was a tiny cup. It was prepared to perfection, it was fresh and definitely ranks in my top 5 chowders I've ever had.

We also had the cheese melt. It was nice and gooey but perhaps not warm enough by the time it was served to us. It left us feeling like there was something missing though. Can't quite put my finger on it. 

The lobster roll was the reason why we came here and what we were craving. The bun was cooked to perfection with the right amount of hardened crust and buttery flavor. You can tell they've perfected making those. However, even with the bigger 6oz lobster option ($37 price tag!! Ouch!), the bun seemed to take over and it was too big and too fat. The lobster itself consisted of large (sometimes too large) lobster chunks, covered lightly with mayonnaise and topped with chives. The fries on the side were nicer and crispy with good structure but weren't very absorbent of salt and pepper. The coleslaw was mediocre and lacked flavor (both the lobster roll and the melt came with coleslaw and fries, on the side).

Again, everything was delicious and the service was great, but at that price point, it was missing that extra oomph to justify it.
author: Mario B.

description:
Craving seafood for lunch and Woodhouse Fish Company did NOT disappoint!  We were shopping in the area on a relaxing Sunday in the City when we stopped in for lunch.

Started with champagne- why not!!  Started with the grilled squid special, then moved onto clam chowder- both Manhattan and New England style.  Both were equally delicious!  

Up next came the fish & chips, lobster roll and crab rolls!  Generous amount of meat in both of the rolls. The fish and chips were crispy and light!

Great gem and will be back!
author: Bella C.

description:
Woodhouse sports a focused ocean-based menu and great service. Grilled squid was smokey excellence, crab cakes were good (creamy citrus sauce cuts the breadiness), and clam chowder chunky and fresh. Service was helpful and did not rush us at any point.

Overall really pleased, definitely returning. $15 corkage (as of July 2018).
author: Jacob P.

description:
Summary: I love this place, hand down!  The food was amazingly delicious and I would definitely come back for more $1 Tuesday oysters. I didnt even look at the menu, just looked at yelp and planned my order before my visit. 

City parking is a nightmare, so dont even bother. I took the bart then uber, so that solve the problem.

My waitress with the red hair gave me a blank look, maybe because I was a party of one ? I sat close to the kitchen, to make sure I didnt have to flag her down so often. Overall she was tentative and semi-friendly. 

My orders were... 

1) $1 oyster : super! Not too small or large. They were very fresh, and with a hint of lemon - couldnt get any better deal elsewhere! (+1 star)

2) New England clam chower : I was taking by surprised because it was so hot! My maxillary wall got slightly burned :( All the clam chowers I have had previously was luke warm. This one came with a bit of chives, and a lot of clams to chew on. Not too watery or too many potatoes filler. It was simply heart warming (+2 stars) 

3) Small Lobster roll: no fillers ( such as a big lettuce - like the roll in pleasanton, checked my review) no overly dressing with mayonnaise. Simply pure chunks of fresh lobster. Add in a bit of Tabasco sauce, lemon and every bite will transport you to the beach. The bread was perfectly toasted and not soggy. Overall, I was please with my roll, but I have had better - check out my vegas loster roll review.  This one havent quite reach that high level yet. I will come back for a bigger lobster roll to compare the two (+1)  

4) chocolate moose with whip cream and raspberry : out of this world! It wasnt overly sweet, just my definition of the prefect dessert. Because it felt so light and the taste was OH so refreshing, that i was eating by a big spoon full (+1) 

Negative : Since I didn't even check the menu, I was surprised to see that they have increased their prices. I asked when, and they said last week, so I will keep an eye out for the price on my next visit :)
author: hong m.

description: So in love with this place! It's pretty small inside but that's part of its charm... food is delicious. I ate every bite! Oysters were fresh and the lobster roll was to die for. So much flavor and love the bread they use. The shrimp Louie salad was good too. I'll be coming back, often!! :)
author: Kristen B.

description:
If you can hear the Tuesday noon emergency sirens during your lunch at Woodhouse, you're at the right place. ($1 oysters on Tuesdays!)

I've never visited Cape Cod, but I'd venture to say that Woodhouse feels like a more upscale version of a timeless mom-and-pop restaurant in some summer beach destination. With a lot less seersucker, of course, because this is San Francisco we're talking about. 

We came here with the lobster roll in mind, but we also ordered some oysters, a bowl of clam chowder, and the shrimp roll. I abandoned any thoughts of Massachusetts as soon as I spotted the generous amount of avocado resting on top of the shrimp roll -- what a Californian take on a classic. I'm usually fairly ambivalent about clam chowder, but just a spoonful of this rich, flavorful chowder destroyed everything I had thought was true.

And the lobster roll: perfectly buttered and toasted bread and tender, fresh lobster meat. Unpretentiously nautical, Woodhouse's claim to the best lobster roll in the city is well deserved, even if the food is a bit pricey.
author: Amy C.

description:
MMM MMM MMM!! On vacation in San Francisco and what I wanted to eat the most was seafood! Woodhouse Fish Co had the best lobster roll I've ever had! The roll was stuffed with lobster that tasted so creamy and fresh with a side of fries and slaw. 

MUST GO BACK
author: Molly M.

description:
Can you really get better than $1 oysters?

The oysters we enjoyed were fresh and juicy, even at 9 pm at night. I also got to try the fried clam roll, which, while delicious, made me realize I should have just gotten the fried clams appetizer ($22 at the time of this review). My friends ordered the fish tacos and the seared ahi tuna roll - a special - and enjoyed both of those.

I will definitely be back on Tuesdays for more of those delicious oysters and maybe fried clams!
author: Hannah H.

description:
The stars aligned when I came by Woodhouse for lunch, we swooped parking right in front, and it just so happened to be DOLLA DOLLA OYSTER timeeeeee! Whooo! If theres anything I love more than oysters, it's dollar oysters. They came out so clean and fresh that every bite just melted away in my mouth like butter. 

Next came the whole reason why I wanted to come here, THE LOBSTER ROLL. You can get this in two sizes, a smaller one or a larger version. We opted for the small one, only because we had a long food adventure day ahead of us and didn't want to get too full. It ended up coming out so stuffed and full that I'm glad we were all sharing this! The roll was so toasty and buttery and they are not shy with the lobster *heart eyes.* Our fish and chips were tasty too! Fish that's beautifully flaky, crispy, and moist - that's how fish n chips should be! All together, this lunch had me thinking we were eating seaside even though we were actually deep into the city.
author: Maleah M.

description:
One of the best lobster rolls out there! I stopped by on a Tuesday and I was surprised there was no wait. Mind you they have $1 oysters on Tuesdays. 

Got sat down right away and ordered half a dozen of oysters. They came out right away and man! They were pretty bomb! 

Ordered the lobster roll and shrimp roll shortly after. Big mistake! I should've placed the order when ordering oysters. The food took roughly 30 minutes to arrive...
However, the lobster roll made up for it! I thought the fries were mediocre. Love ordered the shrimp and avocado roll and just as good! 

Overall, very, very good food! The wait for the food can take some time. I will be back to try the clam chowder  and fish and chips.
author: Elaine C.

description:
Came to lunch with my friends. We shared several items. 

The grilled squid special was good but I wasn't keen on the sauce. I am more of a plain seafood gal. But the additions of the cucumber, grapes and almonds added a nice touch. The texture and flavor of the squid was just right!

We also tried the fish and chips. Chips were crunchy and I, unfortunately, finished my share on the chips (French fries). Fish was a bit too battery for me. It did come out piping hot!

The lobster roll was great. Every place has their own take of the lobster -- with mayo or seasonings, etc.  Lots of lobster chunks with a bit of mayo and some seasonings. The actual roll seemed bigger than others I have had and was toasted to perfection.  Not bad but I thought the $23 was steep for the roll (there was a $37 option as well!)
author: Mitzi W.

description:
Good spot for some seafood. The calamari had a good crunch but the dip could use a bit more flavor. I ordered the fish tacos and I liked that there were three on the plate & was more than enough for my appetite. The fish portion was huge but wasn't too impressed with the slaw that came with it. 

We were seated as soon as we walked in. Small place but it was clean. I liked how the waiter served water right away, not many places do this anymore. The TV was disguised as a picture frame. It caught my attention when I noticed there were several men on a boat & it was moving! 

Parking was tough to find but it's expected when in this city. We came to eat around 3pm when everyone else was done with lunch. Will come back & try other items on the menu.
author: Ammie A.

description:
AMAZING cioppino. Bread that comes with it is not very good. Giving this spot 5 stars, regardless. 

Lobster roll is generously portioned and the roll is perfectly toasted and buttery.

Yes to the fresh oysters.

Crazy chocolate mousse with housemade whipped cream and fresh raspberries. Had a strawberry shortbread dessert here as well, which was overshadowed by the aforementioned mousse.
author: Michelle K.

description: This place is great! What more do you want? Great food, great lively vibe, and friendly staff. I must say, my lobster roll was phenomenal: perfectly cooked lobster, not overly-drenched with mayonnaise, beautifully toasted garlic-(light)-butter-bun....it's the perfect place to go for that allllmost "I'm in Maine" feeling where you catch fresh lobster and contemplate those sunsets...Yum, yum, yummm and yes please, one more glass of wine!
author: Roberta B.

description:
I've been here 3 Times now and the fish and chips have been delicious every single time. It is the main, flaky, crispy, oily reason I come back to Woodhouse, but their other dishes are great as well! 

We got seated right away at the bar on a Friday night around 7:30pm. The seating is a little tight but not overly so. The gf and I started off with the mussels and thought the broth was lovely. Then came out crab cakes and fish and chips. The spill on the crab cakes gave it a night savory kick. The salad that it came with was good but nothing special. Now onto the star; their fried fish. It was hot, the fish was flaky, and their tarter sauce has the right amount of tartness to balance the grease of the fish. 

The service there that night was fantastic. The gf had a glass of wine and accidentally dropped it, causing it to shatter as it hit the marble counter top. Our waiter came by and asked if we were ok while wiping down the counter. He asked if we had a full glass or half before it went all over the counter. We said half, but he came by with another glass that was more than the first! Now that's customer service!

I will definitely come back when I'm in the food for fried fish or seafood in general.
author: robin w.

description: Just walked out of the restaurant. The food was below average. I tried the calamari and lobster roll and the only thing that was ok was the calamari. The lobster roll is $24 for a small or $33 for a large and I got the small one. The way they prepare the lobster is not helping the taste in any way. My husband just spent $75 and it definitely was not worth it. Don't waste your time or money do not come here to try the lobster roll. I thought the 4 star yelp review was for a reason and must be good but it definitely wasn't.
author: Priscila V.

description: My family and I went to the city for the day and we always like to try foods that we normally can't get in the bay. We ordered lots of oysters, got soft shell crab blt, and fish and chips. We got four barbecue and two of each of the specials. The Kumamoto was a little salty for me personally, but the other oysters I enjoyed a lot. The soft shell crab sandwich was delicious. I love fried food so this was perfect for me to have the sandwich and fish and chips. The fries were perfectly seasoned. I always enjoy eating fries so having fried food and fries was perfect for this late lunch meal. This restaurant also had a beautiful picture of the beach up in Santa Cruz. My family and I loved staring at it. The waitress was also really sweet, and the service was great. Everyone was always smiling and making sure we were good.
author: Kaitlyn C.

description:
The clam chowder was really good and I got a Chardonnay with it. Service was good and if I was more hungry I would've gotten more food! 

Place is also cute with all this seafood decoration and everyone there also seemed pretty happy with the food and experience.
author: Stephanie K.

description: I will be back to eat at this place! First, the people at the restaurant are so friendly! We brought in coffee drinks and they didn't care but rather joined in on the conversation. They always smiled and made sure we were happy. Food was good! Oysters and the soft-shell crab were amazing! The fish and chips was subpar but I had a good time. Food came out fast and that's important to me. Overall this place had s great impression!
author: Kimberly C.

description: The clam chowder was soooooo fresh, hot, and flavorful. Great spot for a party of two, but not much more. Friendly staff and quick service. I'm sure this place fills up fast during the lunch hour. Definitely need to bookmark this spot!!!
author: Shaunice C.

description: Crab roll was delicious! The crab and cheese melt was even better. Fish and chips are great too! We liked the BBQ oysters too! The girls were sweet and had great service. I wanna try everything on the menu! Definitely coming back!
author: Anna A.

description: I had a fabulous brunch with friends at Woodhouse. The service was good - attentive. I had the salmon fettuccini and it was delicious. It's a good brunch spot if you have kids as well. I saw little ones all over the restaurant.
author: Danielle S.

description:
I came here with a friend around 8pm and we got seated right away. Service was friendly, the workers came by periodically to check up on my friend and I asking us how was the food and everything.

We ordered 4 oysters, I got the shrimp with avocado sandwich, and my friend got the large lobster sandwhich.

The raw oysters were delicious! However we got 2 big ones and 2 really tiny ones. I wish they would have told us in advance what kind of oysters we were getting before hand. There was barely any meat in one of them totally not worth the $3. 

I enjoyed my sandwhich as did my friend. The large lobster sandwhich is the same length as mines. I think by large they gave more meat than a regular sandwhich would get. It was a lot of meat! Yum!

Besides some minor misconceptions, I enjoyed the food and the whole atmosphere of this place!
author: Grace Z.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here for lunch right when the place opened. The place is a little small but I thought it was cute. The only thing is that the tables are really close together so you'll be pretty close to other groups. 

I had the Dungeness Roll and my boyfriend had the Lobster Roll. It was delicious and the fries were nice and crispy. Definitely recommend!
author: Tabetha S.

description: Got a round of beer and oysters here with some friends. Food was great and the service good. Felt the local vibes here in a positive way. Would definitely go back.
author: Angelo W.

description:
Ordered the crab roll with fries, and it was SO good. The crab was delicious, and stuffed into the perfectly buttered bread. The fries were good too.

I had a bite of my friend's lobster roll, which was good, but I think I'd stick with the crab.

Seafood is pricey,about $22 for my meal, but worth it for the delicious food and great service.
author: Corinna T.

description:
I  coming back to this delicious seafood locale again.  Short wait for a great table and just oogled everyone's plates as we were seated.  

I really don't know what the best dish was because it was all incredibly good.  Fresh local fish selections,  high energy and smiles on all patrons faces.

We all quickly ordered Arnie Palmers which came with really sour lemon juice and side of simple syrup, sparkling water and tea.  Concoct your own.  Loved it!

Come hungry because the portions are large.  Calamari as an appetizer was served quickly.  Large portion which we gobble down faster than it could have possibly swam away.  Main orders followed quickly. I had the grill artichokes which were stuffed with crab and bay shrimp, delicious fresh salad on the side.  Not a huge amount of seafood but enough to satisfy.  We ordered way too much food as we just couldn't decide what to eat.  My hubby ordered the crab cakes with salad.  My daughter , the Cioppino (actually this was the best).  Great wait staff.

Well done!
author: Susan C.

description:
Service was great! Cool local spot and very quaint. Wife and friends loved their meals. 

$1 oysters on Tuesday nights!
author: Alex S.

description:
We came at 3pm on a Saturday afternoon so there was no wait. 

Hartford clam chowder soup: a must get, clam chowder soup with part tomato soup in the middle. Really delicious.

Cheddar cheese crab melt: the fries reminded me a bit of McDonalds' fries, the sandwich was presented well, tasted okay.

Oysters: each oyster is $3 or $4 for the most expensive one as of this writing. You really taste the ocean with each bite.
author: Tom P.

description:
Food: 3.5/5 
We got the lobster roll, crab cakes, clam chowder, and fish and chips. All in all, I think this is a great place for a bit of seafood nostalgia. Lobster roll was delicious and A+, I think it's highly worth it. The cod in the fish and chips was also amazing. Cooked to fluffy perfection. Crab cakes and clam chowder were decent, but the fries leave a lot to be desired. So definitely come here for the quality of the main dishes, but the side accompaniments left me wanting. At the price, I still think the lobster and fish were worth it (especially the fish and chips), but it's not my favorite overall meal.

Service: 5/5 
Our waiter and hostess were both amazing, I really appreciated their helpfulness and friendly service! Water always filled quickly, dishes cleared quickly, food came fast, but never felt hurried. The place was packed, but I never feel like our waiter disappeared, and the hostess was very accommodating and got us two spots at the counter very quickly.

Atmosphere: 5/5
I love the feel of this restaurant, it has the cutest decor without being overly kitschy. It's pretty small, but it's really popular and worth the wait.
author: Whitney G.

description: Favorite place go when I'm craving lobster roll. The bread they make the roll with is probably dipped in butter, but it's pretty damn good. Ordered a few things on the specials menu. Oysters were amazing which were all $3 each. Tried the scallop ceviche (would never order again). That was probably the worst dish I've tried here. The clam chowder and the lobster roll are my usuals. Always super good!
author: Bonnie T.

description:
I gotta tell ya, I'm a big fan of woodhouse fish co. Any establishment that knows how to make amazing lobster rolls, cioppino and fish & chips gets a five star rating. Is it a little pricey? Yes. Do you have to pay up to get great seafood? Yes. 

Last week I finally ordered something other than the lobster roll and it was really hard to break away from tradition. Instead, I got the cioppino and it was delicious! Piled high with amazing scallops, clams, crab, muscles, etc. there's no shortage of seafood. The broth is flavorful and the pesto garlic bread is a perfect accompaniment. 

Woodhouse. Thanks for existing. :)
author: Benjamin F.

description:
Came here for lunch on a weekday. We were seated immediately. Tables were full but we didn't mind sitting at the bar. It was plenty of space for two. We ordered appetizers and entrees to share. It was so delicious! Everything we ordered was so good. We definitely left full and satisfied. Servers were great. They came around refilling water for everyone. 

Ordered: 
-Clam Chowder - Yum! Really good chowder to start the meal. 

-Crispy Calamari - comes with two dipping sauces. It was fried perfectly!

-Lobster Roll(small) - A small is definitely enough if you're ordering appetizers. It's loaded with juicy lobster! The roll was soft. Every bite was juicy. It comes with a side fries and cole slaw. 

-Baja Style Fish Tacos - They made it right! I was craving fish tacos and I was definitely satisfied. The fish was fried to perfection; crispy on the outside, tender and juicy on the inside. Each bite was heavenly! The combination of the garnish and sauce on the fish taco was perfectly executed. I wouldn't change a thing. My photos speaks for itself. *Yummmm. I shall be back for more! 

Parking: Street/Meter parking.
author: Lucy L.

description:
So, pretty much come here on a regular. Still siting here waiting for my strawberry shortcake. As I write this review. You guys ever see that movie WAITING? So there's this stuck up lady who complains about her steak being well done. They do the most nasty things to her plate... lol it was funny. But, shit. I ordered the King Salmon. I was gonna half it with my boyfriend it was so RAW in the middle. Some People like it like that.... not me sorry. The lady with the tattoo on the right arm helped us. She tried to explain that's how it is sometimes. I Know lady. They fixed it, made it well done. It was great! But, shit I got a negative vibe after that. Being at third generation San Franciscan hurts now a days. If you get me. Maybe, I'll just go to the one on Market 


Shit. On top of that I dropped my ray bans the girl says "oh, that $10 is stuck on the floor." I know! I'm picking up my sunglasses...
author: Sasha M.

description:
Happy Friday, that's what it was. My boyfriend & I decided to eat out on this beautiful night in San Francisco. Deciding where to go isn't always easy, but thanks to Yelp. I always turn to my Yelp app to narrow down my decision on where to eat. I'm a seafood type of gal so it's seafood night it is! Woodhouse Fish Company Restaurant was on my San Francisco restaurants bucket list to try. 

So here we are at Woodhouse. A cute little restaurant with very interesting decors. I loved the atmosphere. Felt like I was on an island eating delicious seafood. We ordered two beers, one was an IPA & obviously I ordered something light (forgot what it was ). We also ordered their delicious Hartford Clam Chowder, Six Kumamoto oysters, Bay Shrimp & Avocado Roll Sandwich & Fish & Chips. I'm glad my boyfriend loved eating raw oysters as much as I do. The Kumamoto oysters were to die for!!!! 

Furthermore; it'll be our first time here, but it won't be our last visit. Their customer services was very outstanding. I commend their attentiveness when their service were needed. I hope you enjoy reading my review & check out this cute restaurant.
author: Jamie T.

description: I came here in the late afternoon on Father's Day and I made no reservations for a table of four. With a small but cute area, I was relieved that I only waited about 10 min for a table. I was craving  clam chowder that day and this place did not disappointment. The waitress was friendly and although it was a small place, I did not feel cramped and uncomfortable. I was able to get a taste of their lobster roll but when I go next time I want to give their Cioppino a try because it looks delicious!
author: Joanne C.

description:
Whether you are a New Englander homesick for seafood that's not poke (which is essentially on every corner) or a San Franciscan trying to look sophisticated, Woodhouse Fish Co. is an SF staple for cioppino, clam chowder, fish n chips, and lobsta rolls P:

To start off with the elephant in the room: How does the lobster roll compare to Boston? 
Obviously, there's no comparison--the lobster wasn't as fresh and tasted relatively more bland, as if it had been frozen and shipped across the country (which is literally the case, if it's truly Maine lobster), the flavor was overcompensated by the mayo so it turned out very creamy, and the roll could have used a tad bit more butter for a more brioche-y profile. The coleslaw was tiny (and also excessively creamy), placed in what is usually the size of a sauce cup. The fries turned out quite perfectly: warm but not too hot, with a satisfying crisp. 

The $22/small (3 oz) is a decently filling portion size, especially since you get stuffed with fries. After tax/tip/SF mandate it totals closer to $28. The menu price is similar to New England Eatery ($23.50) in Burlingame, the other lobsta roll eatery in the Bay. 

Service is friendly, and the vibe of the restaurant is more of a traditional seafood restaurant, in contrast to the many hipster places in SF. It's a nice sit-down place that's good for taking your visiting friends (unless they are from the East Coast), since it doesn't get too loud and features a unique repertoire of seafood. They also have a specials board, on which I noticed a pork belly shrimp po-boy. 

The verdict? Good SF option to satisfying lobsta roll cravings, but do not come with Boston-level expectations.
author: Edna C.

description:
We walked in, and it was about a 15min wait for a table. The front staff was extremely friendly and our waitress was really nice and professional. Our iced teas were refilled regularly which is always great. My fiancé and I both got their fish and chips, always really good from our experiences; the fish was hot, and the breading was light and crispy. 

Honestly, it's hard to find anything bad to say about this place; if I were to be nit picky, the tables are a tad bit too close to each other, and the place was a little too warm and stuffy. 

But this place is great :)
author: Aiko H.

description:
If you like seafood this is the place!! Try the specials - I recently had the scallops ceviche which was on point!! Loved it. Their sandwiches are also quite good - the shrimp/avocado one - I'm a big fan of. The buns are super soft and buttery and the side of fries were really good too! 

Will be back!!
author: Caley Z.

description:
Came here for lunch the other day. I've eaten their food before but only ordered to go. Decided it was time to sit down!

I got the lobster roll, which is good but could have been less bland. I paired it with the Drakes Hefeweizen, which turned out nicely. The food is delicious, but for the price, I honestly expect a little bit more. My friend ordered the Arnold Palmer - it all comes I separate containers and you get to pick your ratio of lemonade (which looked amazing), iced tea, and simple syrup.

The service was good and we didn't have too long of a wait for the food. I would definitely come here again, maybe because I'm too lazy to cook my own lobster.
author: Neda S.

description:
I was yelping around for somewhere to eat for an early dinner. I mentioned this restaurant to my friend and she said this was one of her favorite places to have seafood.

The hardest thing was choosing what to order. I was told to order the fish and chips, but I also wanted to try the clam chowder. So we ordered a 3 piece order of the fish and chips and a cup of the clam chowder. We also order the garlic bread because we wanted to have a little sample of it.

So the portions are very filling here. I could have had the 2 piece order and still not finished it. You could tell that the fish was fresh and they had a nice batter. The fries were nice and crispy.  I couldn't stop nibbling on them even when I was full. The clam chowder was amazing. It had huge chunks of clam and a nice amount of garlic. Order through side of garlic bread. It's not on the menu, but you can order it if you ask for it.

I came in around 5 pm which was perfect for me to get my food quickly and get home. Will definitely be back when I'm in San Francisco.
author: Alanna T.

description:
My "go to" for some seafood in the city!

I always find myself coming back to Woodhouse when I venture into the city. Not my first time here, but I decided to try something different and was so glad I did. I normally start with a cup of New England clam chowder, then get the fish n chips for my main course - so flaky and so good! This time, we started with a dozen oysters and I branched out and ordered the steamed clams for dinner. The garlic wine broth really made the entree, especially with the garlic bread for dipping! 

I am a big seafood person and love the consistency and freshness that Woodhouse offers. Although not in the most touristy neighborhood (which I like), I definitely recommend over anything offered at the infamous Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Jillian F.

description: Good but not GREAT. Service was ok, expected better for such a small venue and having gone so late in the evening. The calamari was on point but my son disliked his butter parmesan pasta as it lacked flavor. I ordered the lobster roll and fries. The lobster meat was incredible but it didn't seem to pair well with the bread. I've had better.
author: Brittany C.

description: The best fish and chips I had in the city was an outlier at the Tee Off when it was still around.  I've spent a lot of time searching for that high of perfectly fried white fish, beer batter crust that's flakey, and melts in your mouth, with a tartar sauce that melds it all together into a seafood ecstasy in your mouth.  Sadly, it took me years.  Happily, this is the place where I can now get my fish and chips fix.  My wife and I have been here twice in one month and are loving it.  The atmosphere is nice, it's not too loud, but has enough bustle to keep awkward silence at bay.  The fries here are also crispy crunchy delicious.
author: Chris G.

description:
Hello Lobster Roll! Stopped by for lunch on a Sunday, were quickly seated and soon had one of those delicious lobster rolls in front of us. Buttery toast, loaded with fresh lobster and man, those fries! Delicious!

It doesn't come cheap, so it's more of a special occasion lunch or when you just want to treat yourself. But I like the simplicity of this place: the menu fits on one page and unless you hate seafood, you should be able to find something you like. 

Bonus points for the atmosphere: I was actually able to hear and have a conversation. Not a given in many of those hip restaurant where the music blasts like it's Saturday night in a club or the acoustics are just terrible.
author: Katja S.

description: Great service and food.  Anna our waitress was so patient with us.  It took us a while to decide what we wanted and she handles our indecisiveness with a smile the entire tome.  We decided on clam chowder and Baja fish tacos.  The clam chowder was perfect.  The tacos had HUGE pieces of fish on each and tasted great mixed with the sauce.  They had a bathroom in the back of the restaurant.  The decor was simple with a small section of table seating and a bar area with stools.  The menu is simple with two dozen options - I imagine this allows them to focus and produce amazing dishes!
author: Elizabeth S.

description: My group was craving a crab sandwich and Woodhouse had a high rating. Two of us ordered the crab and cheddar cheese melt, one ordered the swordfish and one ordered the fish and chips. They were all delicious.
author: Donna F.

description: Love their dungeoness crab. $36 for a full crab which isn't cheap but not outrageous. Check for their $1 oyster happy hour specials. That's what got me in the door years ago but now it might only be one day a week. Tuesdays i last checked. You might want to call first to be sure. Also their fish & Chips is fantastic. Skinny fries and a heft but smooth beer batter deep fry. Delicious!
author: David A R.

description: Love this little place!  The lobster rolls that I have eaten were excellent and the Sourdough Bread Pudding was amazing.  The staff was friendly and fun and the decor was well suited.  I'm from Utah and I will not miss an opportunity to come here when I'm in town.
author: Ben P.

description: I bookmarked Woodhouse because of their Maine lobster roll, so of course that's what I ordered. The meat was succulent and there was a good amount. There's a choice to add more meat if you want. Even so, I didn't feel it was anything special. I should've ordered the squid ink pasta instead. What I really enjoyed was the clam chowder. It was full of potatoes and meaty pieces of clams. It warmed me up quickly.
author: Helen H.

description:
What a pleasure. I've been wanting to come for years...I used to traipse up and down Fillmore while my son rehearsed with the SF Boys Chorus back in the day when they rehearsed on Post. But I never really wanted to eat there by myself...although it would be perfectly comfortable to do so, I wanted to enjoy it with someone.

Finally came with the hubby during our weekend-long anniversary celebration. We were meeting friends at the Fillmore for a concert that began at 9 so stopped in to Woodhouse at 7:15 to see how long the wait would be. They could take us at the counter right away. We love a good counter. Their counter only holds about 6 people in its L-shaped configuration, and we got the end that has 2 seats looking towards the kitchen. 

From the moment we sat down we felt a warm and friendly vibe from everyone...the hostess, the bartender who took care of us with drinks and food, the servers...even the other people sitting with us at the counter. When I asked if they had a stout beer, the bartender replied "I wish" and I said "ME TOO!" and we laughed. I love that he could feel my pain. Anyway, hubby had some kind of beer and I had some red wine...perfectly fine.

It was painfully difficult to narrow our choices. From oysters to local-caught squid to soft shell crab sandwich to clam rolls to lobster rolls to a whole trout - it was a huge problem for me. Finally decided to split an iceberg crab louie salad and then hubby got the cioppino and I got the full lobster roll. The salad was very good - loads of crab did not disappoint. Hubby loved and scarfed down the cioppino. The lobster roll was also delicious but I will recommend that it is A LOT of lobster so I should have gone with the smaller portion offering. Although, I did take it back to the hotel fridge, and dipped back into it around 11am the next day and it held up extremely well so I was pretty happy with my two-meal lobster roll.

Anyway, service was exactly as it should be with timing and checking in and explaining different items so we always felt cared for but not bugged.

So glad we finally came and I will not hesitate to come again!
author: Laurie H.

description:
Came here with my boyfriend around 8pm on a Friday night and we were seated immediately! I expected a wait so this was a wonderful surprise. We decided to order a small lobster roll ($22) and a large lobster roll ($36) to split. We felt ordering two smalls would not give us enough lobster meat and two larges would be too much but also too pricey. In addition, we had the hefeweizen and the ipa, both were great but we both loved the ipa alot more. 

The lobster rolls were amazing! I definitely had my lobster craving satisfied but I wouldn't have if we had only gotten small rolls. They use the same size rolls for both and the only difference is that there's double meat on the large. What we did was we each took half a small and half a large and split the meat evenly over both rolls. Therefore, we each ended up with a lobster roll containing around 4.5 ounces of meat...and boy oh boy was the meat good! The lobster tasted so fresh and juicy and despite it having some mayo sauce on it, the flavor was not masked by it. It was by far the best lobster roll I have ever had (here on the west coast, since I have not yet tried east coast rolls so its unfair to compare). In addition, the coleslaw was refreshing and creamy and the fries were a great compliment. 

I totally recommend this place for the lobster rolls. Its pretty damn pricey but its totally worth!
author: Lina P.

description: Deliciousness!! Came here with my girl, been looking for a place in Nor Cal who has Lobster rolls for basically a year and here we are. Proper Lobster roll with a good slaw and fries paired with a suprisingly good dry cider. Usually i'm not into dry, but it worked. I will definitely be back.
author: Shana B.

description:
I'm not very often around this part of town. We didn't have definite plans on dinner, but on seeing (spying) a crab roll through the window, we couldn't resist. 
I started with the clam chowder (New England) - it was good, but not the best in the city - and the portion isn't huge. It did however come with some oyster crackers - which I thought was cute. 
I obviously then went for the crab melt. My god it was good. For something smothered in cheese, it was so light and fresh. The ratio of crab to mayo was perfect, not at all claggy or heavy. The fries were good, though perhaps a little under-seasoned, though they did come with a really nice ketchup. 
My mum went for the three-piece fish and chips which was also really good. The batter was super light and crispy. 
Service was friendly, relaxed and not pushy or rushed. It's all very casual, which I enjoy. It's not the cheapest of places - but that goes without saying in SF.
author: Poppy C.

description:
Everything here was so good!

The fish and chips have a thin super crispy batter that's best at the spots with herbs, the tartar sauce is amazing with a sharp pickle taste (I never like tartar sauce I devoured this) 

The crab melt is interesting, definitely a good fresh take on it, but ground crab with that much cheese looks a little unappealing, still a great tasting sand which.

Service is quick seating is a little crowded but nice and the neighborhood is great to shop at after
author: Robin H.

description: Fresh seafood, great location, hip "pub" vibe!  We brought our own wine...and paid the nominal $15/bottle corkage.  The cute and friendly waitress (who had some seriously cool Tatts, which I complemented her on) recommended the "Dungeoness Crab Sandwich" that comes on a toasted, buttered roll...LOADED with succulent crab meat.  OMG!  This one is a MUST HAVE!  We also had the AMAZING perfectly battered and sweet-crunchy onion rings, the nicely prepared fried calamari.  Restaurant was bright and cherry, felt very "nautical", with an almost-New-England decor.  Great find!!  Afterwards, we headed down the street just a few blocks to the original legendary FILLMORE auditorium for a cool rock show!  I gotta go back and try the Cioppino!
author: Scott B.

description:
My friend found this place on Yelp after we were craving some oysters and had trekked all the way to Swan Oyster Depot, only to find out it was closed on Sundays.

So we came in at around 4 pm and the place wasn't too filled up (probably because it was a weird time to eat). We were seated immediately and ordered some oysters, clam chowder, and a lobster roll - all to share. Again, since it was a weird time to be eating and we hadn't had lunch yet, we also didn't want to be too full since we were still planning to have dinner later.

The oysters were okay - nothing to write home about. Nothing you can't get for a dollar in NYC. But then again, I can't really tell the difference between most oysters; just that it's saltier and/or plumper. The clam chowder was pretty good. As for the lobster roll, this was again just okay. The cole slaw that it came with had way too much mayo.

Overall, I would say that Woodhouse is an okay choice if you're in the area. But if you're willing to travel, I'm sure there are better places in SF.
author: Mel T.

description:
Amazing Italian dishes with a San Francisco spin on it! 

Fish and chips- Go for the 3 pieces option, the fish is amazing! The batter is light and cripsy, and the fish was fresh, juicy and tender. There is no rubbery texture to the fish, it was on point. Fries on the side were great as well, crispy and slightly salted. Simple ingredients, high quality, and excellent execution. Who knew a simple dish can be this delicious? 

Cioppino- I took a sip of the tomato broth, and my smile went ear to ear. The broth tastes very strongly of tomato, but what I like most is the natural sweetness of the tomato, it was SO delicious. I dip the garlic break into the broth, but I could not remember much about the bread because my taste buds where dancing to the tomato base. I will be content just with the broth without the seafood. There are crab, mussel, clams, shrimp, etc, an actual feast of seafood! All items were fresh and had the taste from the ocean. So fresh, so good. My favorite dish by far, with such an amazing broth with a variety of fresh seafood!

The restaurant is quite small, so expect a wait. Decoration is beautiful, I find myself looking at the ships models and ocean mural on the wall a lot. Staff were friendly and efficient. Great dining experience, I will definitely be back!
author: Karen C.

description: Just ate here and absolutely love it! I had the lobster roll (which is what this restaurant is known for) and it was amazing. We stopped in for a quick break from work for lunch and the service was excellent, our table for 3 got served immediately and the food came out quickly.
author: Adam G.

description: I was craving a lobster roll with clam chowder and googled "best lobster roll in SF". This place popped up. Since it was close to my apartment I figured why not try it out?!? I must say now there's no other spot that compares. The lobster roll has huge chunks of lobster, the coleslaw is refreshing, and the fries are perfectly crispy. The clam chowder can definitely stand on its own as well. It's so easy to order one thing after the next here, but beware, the price adds up in no time!
author: Ali R.

description: I really wanted to like this place. Really really wanted to, I've had this place bookmarked for YEARS! I had split with a friend both the crab sandwich and lobster roll. The lobster roll came with fries and coleslaw, it was ok...it didn't wow me like New England Lobster Market in Burlingame. I liked the crab sandwich more, it tasted much better! If I were to come back I'd probably get fish n chips and the chowder, not the sandwiches.
author: Kylie L.

description: This cozy restaurnat never disappoints us. My husband and I have a quick dinner in Feb2018 and both of us were really satisfied again.
author: Sujung S.

description:
Pros- tasty food, $1 oyster Tuesdays, fast service 

Con- very tiny place, no reservations, pricey for amount of food you get
author: Eleanor F.

description:
Awesome shrimp sandwich, cool intimate marine vibe, and good prices. I ordered one of each of the oysters available at the time and all were amazing. As was the shrimp sandwich with fries.

This place is just what you'd expect from a seafood place in San Fransisco. Good quality for reasonable prices.
author: Kirk M.

description:
Holy lobsters! I really enjoyed my lobster roll sandwich and thought it was worth the $20. The bread is super soft and lightly fried in butter with a bit of herbs, then the lobster itself is so fresh and tasty. Fries and cole slaw on the side were a plus.

Came here at a nonbusy 2PM on a Saturday. Had pick of tables and service was attentive.

Boyfriend had the soft shell crab which was also delicious but I definitely preferred my lobster roll.
author: Mimi T.

description:
I really like the Clam Chowder here.  It's not the best, but it's very satisfying and consistent.

I usually order the Bay Shrimp and Avocado Roll, as the price/taste ratio is pretty even.  The toasted awesome bread with that fresh yummy shrimp has me coming back every time.

I had the Lobster Roll before and it was all fucking claw meat.  So fucking disappointed; I was pissed.  Give me some of that tail!

I prefer the Fillmore location over the Market Street one.  The one on Market is a little depressing the last time I went.  Just a strange location and vibe.
author: John M.

description: The fish and chips tasted great and stayed warm throughout our meal. Sincere, friendly service added further warmth.
author: Brian W.

description:
Came here on a Saturday at ~2:30 pm. The tables were full, so we sat at the counter. Service was prompt and friendly. We were craving lobster rolls, and Food & Wine listed Woodhouse's as one of best in the country: https://www.google.com/amp/amp.foodandwine.com/slideshows/americas-best-lobster-rolls.

We weren't super hungry, so we ordered a bowl of clam chowder and a large lobster roll to share.

The chowder was New England style with a nice balance of small cubes of potatoes and meaty pieces of clam. It was a tad heavy on the garlic, but the oyster crackers did a good job of (mostly) neutralizing it.

I'm sad to say that the lobster roll was disappointing. It wasn't bad; it was just OK. It was also kind of small. The largest thing about it was the price at $37. I thought at first that the server hadn't heard us ask for a large, but, unfortunately, the bill confirmed that he'd heard. The lobster didn't have much flavor. It's a Maine-style roll, so the lobster is served cold with a house-made mayo dressing. The toasted bun was good. The roll is served with coleslaw (too heavy on the mayo for me) and a generous serving of French fries. The fries were nicely crisp outside and soft inside. 

Would I come again? Yes, if I'm in the neighborhood but not for the lobster roll.  I'd like to try the squid ink linguine with salmon & lobster. It looked yummy, and the woman sitting next to  us gave it a thumbs up.
author: Rexi S.

description:
We are visiting from the LA area. We wanted fish/seafood for dinner. We got on MUNI to Pacific Heights area
We started off with a cup of Hartford chowder - which is a combination of New England and Manhattan clam chowder 
My husband had the fish tacos. The fish was crispy (not greasy) on the outside and moist and tender inside. I had the grilled artichoke stuffed with crab and shrimp. The seafood was fresh and delicious.
author: Paula K.

description:
Great food and service....Well sort of....

When the host at the door was told there were no paper towels in the only bathroom, he responded with a lame "yeah".

3 customers later, I told a "manager" after I left the bathroom, and he seemed agitated that I brought it up, holding keys in his hand, I guess, to unlock some cabinet..... Why snark at me?
author: Pat H.

description: One of the better seafood places in the city. Comes without the inflated prices or the ocean views in this quaint little spot on Fillmore. If you live in the city this is a great spot because it isn't touristy at all. The staff is friendly and the food has been spot on both times we went. The menu is a mix between San Francisco classics and New England favorites - fried calamari, clam chowder, fried clams, lobster rolls, fish/chips, etc. The food comes out fast and fresh and everything is very well executed. Great date spot and then you can walk around Fillmore afterwards. Prices are fair and reasonable. Beer and wine only. Love this place. Highly recommend!
author: Sam R.

description:
Great food and service totally recommend this place if ur in the area and in the mood for some good seafood.
Love this place.
author: Mai D.

description:
TOTALLY enjoyed this gem during the weekend.  Was in town and decided to check out the Filmore Street Jazz Fest and after looking over the street food fare, my best friend and I wanted a sit down experience.  We popped in here and were lucky to score a seat at the bar, the place was PACKED!  

We ordered chowder and I grabbed a glass of wine.  Their chowder is AMAZEBALLS!  SO fresh and flavorful.  I've had chowder at high end spots in Seattle - BLAH!  This took the cake, cookie, pie and then some!  So glad we stopped here.  WINNER!
author: Trina M.

description: Found this local spot in Pacific Heights during a recent visit to SF. The fish was fresh and fantastic, loved the calamari and swordfish. Highly recommend this cool neighborhood spot.  If you appreciate good seafood, check it out!
author: Carol K.

description:
Came to visit friends living in SF. I was so thankful that she knows her seafood. The ciopinno was amazing! My favorite part was the squid and large prawn. The tomato sauce was so flavorful compared to its competitors around north beach.
The dish was large enough to share between 2 people. I would visit this place every time I visit the Bay.
author: Cindy N.

description:
I started to write this review in the Fall of 2016, but I was traveling at the time, and set it aside. The content of this review, therefore, pertains to a meal eaten more than a year ago. Having said this, I have checked their current menu, which looks unchanged from a year ago.

We were a party of six, three couples, so we had enough people to try nearly everything on the menu, and share amongst us. Everything was excellent, but there were a few standouts: the raw oysters, fried clams, lobster roll, and the cioppino. We were there because I asked for an excellent cioppino restaurant, and WFC did not disappoint. Delicious broth, a variety of seafood with every element fresh and tender, and, importantly, the right size. Too small a serving leaves you disappointed, too large a serving and you are faced with leftovers of a dish that truly cannot be eaten reheated.

So why only four stars? They confused one of the orders, and left a member of our party waiting to receive their main course. Fortunately, we were sharing much of the meal, but it was embarrassing and awkward nonetheless.

I would visit WFC again, perhaps at the Market Street location next time.
author: Nicholas L.

description:
We came here on a Friday night to satisfy our seafood fix. It was a rainy day so we were looking forward to some warm food.

I ordered the cioppino and my fiancee ordered the dungeness crab roll. We figured we would try the crab roll given it's still crab season. 

The cioppino was tasty - the soup had a good flavor and they didn't skimp on the seafood! Plenty of fish and prawns in the soup. However, was it worth $32? Hard to say.

However, the crab roll was underwhelming and definitely not worth the $37 price tag. The meat was dry and warm and did not have much flavor.
author: Peck Y.
