description: Very good crab melt sandwich. The decor is fun and the crabs were excellent. (My friend was a bit disappointed with her fish being overly salty.) Overall quick, nice service, and good food.
author: Kelsey W.

description: This is my favorite seafood restaurant at fillmore st. I haven't tried all the menu yet but everything I tried was all very very good. I've tried raw oysters, clamchowder soup, fish tacos, fish &chips, crispy calamari, stuffed artichoke, squid ink linguini & smoked trout. I just cant pick which dish is my favorite. They are all so good!
author: Jane K.

description: I ordered a cup of New England Clam Chowder and the portion was pretty small. It still tasted good like every other New England Clam Chowder. Then I ordered the Cheddar Cheese Crab Melt which was delicious! Although, the cheese wasn't really melted which I did not enjoy how the cheese texture was dried up.
author: Kristi A.

description:
While visiting San Francisco I decided to try some coastal seafood and stumbled upon this treat with some friends. Normally, I am not big on seafood; however, being near the coast I wanted to give it an another whirl. We went there Tuesday night and they had #1 raw oysters on special. I got a half a dozen of these. I also decided to try the lobster roll. I was pleasantly surprised by the oysters. The first one I sprinkled with some hot sauce and it was good. The second I used their house made cocktail sauce which had an extra dollop of horseradish. I enjoyed this sauce even more so I finished the rest of the oysters this way. The lobster roll was good. I did not do any cartwheels over it but I liked the toasted bread it was on. It added a little extra to the sandwich. I thought it was expensive at $22 for 3 oz. Of course, I may be used to smaller town prices.

For a late Tuesday night, it was quite crowded. It was a smaller place so not as many seats. We called ahead and there was an hour wait. My best advice is to make reservations to avoid any wait time any night of the week. Of course, you know they are serving it up good to fill up the seats like they do.
author: Jessica B.

description: 5 stars for service!! I really wanted to love this place really cool little spot and I got great service but the lobster roll was just a little bland for me. Could have been seasoned a tad more the hot sauce at the table helped it out but it still fell short. Would I go back? Yup maybe the lobster roll just wasn't the right choice. Still was fresh and tasty but with room for improvement.
author: Shaun M.

description: So this place is amazing. Anna (our host) and Bella (our server) went above and beyond. The food was also amazing. Ambiance up the wazoo. Eat here if you like seafood and good service!
author: Sev W.

description:
My experience was one where I was satisfied, sort of got exactly what I was looking for (seafood!), but I just wasn't blown out of the water (lol!). We were looking for some crab but foolishly thought it would be available. Little did we know the wild crabs are mating so their sex is not to be disturbed just so humans could eat their bodies.

We had:
1) Clam chowder bowl--very creamy and delicious!
2) Fish and chips--perfectly flaky batter with tender/juicy fish meat on top of a bed of fries that were a little above average.
3) Lobster roll--not the best ever, but gets the job done if you're looking for that succulent lobster meat sitting between some buttery sourdough bread. The buttery lobster taste could've been more apparent and not as drowned out by the celery/mayo sauce.

I guess after eating seafood around the world, in my opinion this place just didn't have that oomph that makes it stand out from the rest. Everything was good, but won't be the best. If anything, this is a great place to take a date to enjoy the interior design, the area around Japantown, some good seafood paired with an SF brew.
author: Marlon T.

description:
Here for Oyster $1 on Tuesday. We had the point Reyes. They were goooood. Service was ok considering there's only 1 guy (same guy that will get you table, get you drink and take your order) 

Tried the lobster roll. Generous portion of meat! With fries n tiny slaw on the side. 

We also had the squid ink & crab linguine which was great n creamy but not so creamy that u feel sick after having a plate. 

Our 2nd visit was on Friday. Much busier. Service was struggling (2 waitress n full house - understandable). 

We tried Ciopinno based on Friends recommendation.. but they came out way too salty. The kind service offered us to change other menu or for them to make another portion (he said "we will make another one from scratch without salt") 
We opt for #2. It was great.. a lot of clams vs prawn & crab. We still prefer the cioppino at Anchor Oyster Bar in Castro. 

Not a biggie but they serve wine on a short glass.. I think it would be nicer to sip wine from a proper wine thin glass. Hmm. But maybe it's just me! :-) 

Will come back for the Oysters.
author: Hester D.

description:
One of my favorite seafood place to go in the city when i slide through and make sure you come to this location rather than the Market st. as i feel the food at this location tastes better (or it could just be me). My go to dishes from here would be the oysters, fried whole-belly ipswich clams, toasted-buttered dungeness crab roll, baja-style fish tacos and the cioppino.

The ipswich clams are perfectly battered and fried with great flavor bite after bite. I really liked the dungeness crab roll and prefer it over the lobster roll any day of the week but i'm just being bias because i love crab and i can eat it for days. The mayo mixed with the real crab meat was very light and the toasted bread was perfectly buttered and did not anyway over power the star of the sandwich, the crab. Our usual dish we order is the cioppino due to the amount of seafood you get with a light yet chunky broth and the clams they serve here are really large.

The staff are always friendly and attentive everytime my friends and i stop by. Our orders always come in a timely manner and steamy hot. Unfortunately, this little place does not take reservations and parking sucks during the day but, I don't mind the wait and i realize if you come during the evening on a weekday it's not as busy and parking was pretty plenty down the corner.
author: Alex T.

description: Great atmosphere and even better food! We ordered the mussels w garlic bread as an appetizer - fish n chips and lobster roll as entrees. The mussels were fresh and dressed in a sauce from outta this world. The garlic bread had baked cheese on top. Crispy is an understatement. The fish and chips were amazing. Fresh tasting fish with a batter that was crispy yet fluffy and not overwhelming. Came in a basket with fries (bomb), coleslaw (bomb), and tarter sauce - very fulfilling. The lobster roll was perfection - the small was enough to fill me up - the bread it was in was toasted very well and coated with butter. The lobster was fresh and was given in a healthy serving - came with fries and coleslaw as well. This place is top tier seafood! A little pricey but you get what you pay for 100%
author: Darius R.

description:
Today I used WFC to cater a lunch, and OMG they killed it!

Our menu consisted of herbed carrots, white cheddar mac and cheese, coleslaw, spring salad, flank steak (so juicy/tender!) Cod fillets (perfectly seasoned and flaky) and a vegan, gluten-free stuffed acorn squash that was truly a sight to behold.

Woodhouse pulled off an upscale meal for almost 1000 people, while managing to ensure their food withheld the same standard as that served at either of their SF store-fronts (I've been to, and loved it at both). That on it's own is no easy-feat.

Needless to say, I have a new found respect for this Bay-Area cult-fave. 

Also shout-out to the owner who personally stirred 190lbs of mac and cheese all morning for us- YOU DA REAL MVP!
author: Camille B.

description: Very delicious - went for lunch with my boyfriend.  We had calamari to start and it was so crunchy and flavorful and the portion was giant, too much for just us 2.  I had the fish tacos which were huge and crunchy but still light.   He had the shrimp and avocado roll - not a good menu choice.  Had a ton of mayo on it, we'll be back for sure but definitely need to skip that and get something else.  Inside is small but cozy, great New England-y feel
author: Margo B.

description:
Under the sea type of dinner. I came in for the $1 oysters and was not disappointed. They are a smaller in size, and served over a tray of ice with a side of ketchup and horseradish sauce. Mmmm.. Great for sharing or for yourself if you're feelin' a little greedy.

We also tried the famous lobster and Dungeness crab rolls with a side of avocado. I preferred the lobster roll because it was dressed better with more flavor. The crab roll was a tad bland. The bread used for the rolls is so soft and light, and toasted perfectly. Each roll also comes with a side of fries and coleslaw, as well! 

I was a little disappointed in their wine list. There's only a few listed and very limited. I suggest also taking a look at their specials menu for the day, posted on the wall. You might find something appetizing on there too.

Overall, this place has decently priced seafood that won't hurt your wallet. I love the ambiance and their ocean theme decorations.
author: Rachelle Y.

description: Pretty decent. I enjoyed all of the dishes but it's been like a week and I don't remember a single one. The oysters were shucked very well, the pasta was fine, but it's overall something of a middling experience.
author: Lauren B.

description:
5 stars just for the food. We had dinner here this Saturday after a 40-min wait.

Every bite we had from this restaurant was delicious. We ordered the linguini with trout, which had some tomato based sauce and was amazing. The other entree we had was the crab cakes(3) with salad, which was also great. For dessert, we had the Sourdough bread pudding which was tasty as well.
author: Mia C.

description:
Solid place with friendly service. Dropped by on Tuesday night and had no problems getting seating. We started off with a bowl of the clam chowder, which had a healthy portion of clams. For mains, I opted for the soft shell crab BLT special. Though the bacon part was lacking and the lettuce part was actually some microgreens on top, the soft shell crab was yum, and I liked the buttered roll. Had a bite of the smoked trout linguini, which I was not a huge fan of.

P.S. Dollar oyster nights on Tuesdays
author: Eva W.

description: I came here with a friend & we were seated immediately. Parking may be a hassle, but we found a spot right out front. The host was friendly & although the restaurant is rather small, it doesn't feel congested. I ordered the crab grilled cheese & my friend got a lobster roll. We both enjoyed the food but my bun was BURNTTTTTT. I didn't say anything because I had already eaten half (2 bites = half the sandwich). But it was still a different dish I hadn't experienced before. The prices at lunch were also very reasonable.
author: Faith C.

description: Good Italian seafood place with mix of simple pastas, sandwiches and seafood dishes.  The ciopionno is very good and representative of the real thing.  I also had the stuffed artichoke which was grilled and then stuffed with crab meat and bay shrimp.  Quite tasty.  We didn't have room for desert so can't comment on that.  There is not a lot of choice on the menu but if you are in the mood for that type of fare it is a good place to go
author: Shankar S.

description: Definitely one of the best Dungeness Crab sandwich I've had. Great food, cool neighborhood results in an awesome outing.
author: Saad Z.

description:
Yum! Lenten Fridays for the win :) Woodhouse Fish Co. was a 10-15 min wait for 4 of us at primetime last Friday. The food was delicious, fresh, and quick. The shared steamed clam appetizer is a great group starter (we got two!) and all the mains were pretty delicious.

Being from Maryland, I wasn't completely taken by their crabcake. It did seem to have a lot of breadcrumbs, and not as much crabmeat as it should have. Next time, I'll just straight up order the crab.
author: Kerry G.

description: Clam chowder was BOMB. Not a fan of lobster but it was too good not to like. And the fries were crispy
author: Eva A.

description:
Really disappointed with the dinner here tonight. The restaurant was so stuffy and hot, it was really uncomfortable that I had to come out during the meal. The restaurant was also small so made it worse.

I might have too high expectations with their food. Lobster roll was Maine style, too much celery could barely taste the lobster!! There weren't that much lobster in the bun either, only 2/3 of the bun was filled. 

The bun was good itself, tasted very much like Raising Canes Texas Toast. I may give it a try, but needs some improvements.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
We love this place!...Never had a bad meal here.  The clam chowder is exceptional, with lots of tender clams and bits of potato in a flavorful New England style (white) base.   
Tonight, we started with sharing a bowl of the chowder, then had a couple crabcake, and the whole Dungeness crab.  
The crab is served with either cold with lemon or steamed in a white wine, lemon, garlic butter sauce. THE WHITE WINE SAUCE IS A MUST, as is some bread to soak it up (which they will provide upon request).  The crab itself was very fresh and had an almost sweet flavor, and the portion was huge and all for a very reasonable price. We always leave here totally stuffed and satisfied, and we will be back!
author: Melissa H.

description: Food was great! The waitress was too until I heard her talking smack about the tip we left her. She was super rude. Not going back because of her.
author: Mayra C.

description: Pretty greasy, mostly just fried crab and shellfish. Soup was good, but real fish like salmon or trout etc.
author: Stella H.

description: We went on a Tuesday. One dollar Oyster night. What a deal. Fresh and delicious oysters.  Can't get any better than that. We had two meals. We also had the Fish and Chips, Delicious. We also had the Squid Ink Linguini & Smoked Trout, Delicious.
author: M P.

description: We really enjoyed the fresh seafood and service at Woodhouse Fish. My family shared some fresh yummy oysters for appetizers - Point Reyes and Kumamoto. Our daughter had a cup of clam chowder and the crab melt with a side of fries. Hubby had the delicious seafood linguine, and I had the classic large split-top Maine lobster roll with fries. The lobster was sweet and tender, and the sandwich was large enough to share with my hubby and daughter.
author: Racquel E.

description:
I came here with my family (6 people) on the fly and we were seated within 40 minutes, which is pretty incredible on its own! 

Coming from Seattle, we're all big seafood fans, and I must say we weren't disappointed. The portion sizes were great and the prices fit accordingly. My parents and brother really enjoyed their Hartford clam chowder, which is a mix of two-thirds New England and one-third Manhattan. I was pleased with the crab cakes, although they were a bit heavy on the bell pepper side. 

The decor was fun and nautical. The rolling film on the kitchen-side wall was a nice touch and the photos of San Francisco from the fire up to the present were interesting. 

Overall, nothing particularly wowed or stuck out, but it was a nice restaurant with friendly service and tasty food, and somewhere I'd go again.
author: Haley M.

description: Great choice for a shrimp avocado roll or crab melt. Friendly, helpful, bustling staff.  Prices $15 and up. Wait time: 10 min. on a Sunday night for 2-top. Filled with locals, not so touristy.  Great mellow vibe.
author: r s.

description:
The dinner decision for the evening was up to me, and I settled on Woodhouse because of the famous lobster rolls. You can't find them at too many places in Hawaii (at least, in sandwich form), so I was anxious to try the entrée here. Plus, I was craving fresh lobster.

Woodhouse doesn't take reservations, so our group of four showed up around 6:15 p.m. on a Saturday evening and were told the wait was 20-30 minutes. There are neighboring stores you can browse in while waiting for your name to be called. Just check back in with the hostess close to your time to make sure your entire party is present. 

The restaurant isn't that big and seating is rather crowded, so if you have a larger party, it's a good idea to go early. I must say, even though Woodhouse was busy, their customer service was on point. One of our group member's entrees was super delayed in coming (the stuffed artichokes took a long time to prepare, I guess). But, to compensate for the long wait time, our server brought a huge bowl of soup for her and comped one of our beers. That was a nice gesture on the restaurant's behalf, but the food was delicious. It was worth waiting for.

Here's what we ordered:

"Stuffed Artichokes": This was probably the most unique entrée on our table. It featured split, grilled and stuffed artichokes that were filled with Dungeness crab and bay shrimp. I was impressed with the sheer size of this dish, as well as the fillings -- they didn't skimp on the crab or the shrimp. Even though this entrée took a while to make, my friend said it was delicious and it was definitely different. It also comes with dipping sauces and garlic toast. 

"Baja-Style Fish Tacos": This entrée comprised crispy, battered cod with cabbage, chipotle aioli, pico de gallo and avocado. It featured three fish tacos. Having spent some time in San Diego, I feel like my standard for fish tacos is high ... but this dish really wowed me. Instead of being grilled, the fish was crispy. It was lightly battered and perfectly fresh; not too crispy, oily or greasy. My friend and I were pleasantly surprised by how much we enjoyed it! And, the tacos weren't puny - three per order was a good size. The chipotle aioli was also delicious; it added a nice kick to the tacos. If you're craving fish but don't want all the fries (from the fish and chips), I highly recommend giving this entrée a try. 

"Split-Top Maine Lobster Roll": You could get the smaller version for $22 or the larger version for $36. I was hungry by this time, but I opted for the smaller version because I didn't know how large the large actually was. The small ended up being the perfect size - the sandwich itself wasn't super duper big, so I was able to finish it all because I was starving. I had leftovers of the fries, which was fine. The sandwich itself was just as tasty as I imagined it to be - the bread was warm, buttery and slightly chewy, and I actually really liked the coleslaw. It was refreshing and tasty. The lobster chunks were juicy, fresh, buttery and flavorful. The fries are thin fries, and since I don't use ketchup, I coated them liberally with malt vinegar to give it added taste. Yum! I would recommend this lobster roll because it's worth trying if you haven't before and it hits the spot if you're craving it. But, go with the smaller option so you can perhaps try some of the other entrees your group orders. 

"Cioppino": My friend wanted to compare this cioppino dish to others he had gotten in the past. This entrée came with garlic bread and was deemed "the grand San Francisco seafood dish." There was too much tomato for my personal preference in this dish, but it was a good seafood medley if you want things with shells (clams, mussels, etc.) in a hearty broth. 

"Cheddar Cheese Crab Melt": I was thinking of ordering this or the lobster roll, since I really wanted a sandwich for dinner. But, since I knew I was going to get something with crab the next morning for brunch, I decided to pass on the crab cheese melt for dinner that evening. I read good things about it though, and I want to try it next time. It seems like this sandwich includes the same buttery bread that's used to make the lobster roll, and the sandwich itself comes generously stuffed with chunks of crab and lots of melted cheese. 

"Fish and Chips": This was another entrée I was debating on getting, since I love a good fish and chips and SF is known for their seafood. You have the option of getting two or three pieces. I would probably opt for two pieces if I ever order this dish. Now that I know the fish here really is phenomenal--and I like the way it's battered and prepared--I look forward to ordering this one day.
author: Kelli S.

description: Coming here for the second time .ordered   a few lobster rolls for us . It wasnt what we expected . Not the same as before . Dry , no sauce , no flavor , plain .Not really good. The fries was good tho .
author: Gret C.

description:
It's warm in here, be able to take off a layer.  But you are there for the food and the food is good.

BBQ Oysters ($14): Pretty good, worth trying
Cioppino ($32): TR thought is was very good
Whole Fish ($32): well cooked, flavorful, tender, flaky, good piece of fish
author: Malcolm J.

description:
I was really wanted to like this place more than I did based on all the delicious looking pictures on here, but sadly I will have to keep looking for the best lobster roll...

My friend and I were in SF visiting our other friend. I suggested Woodhouse Fish Co. for dinner. Finding parking was the worst! We circled around for a good half hour just looking for a spot - it didn't even have to be nearby, but no such luck. Finally we saw a car pull out on the street and grabbed that baby fast!

Walked a decent way until we reached the extremely busy and packed restaurant with the line waaay out the door. Put our name down. Waited for what felt like forever... (probably around 40 minutes). 

I was hesitant to know that the tables were so close to one another. Although we were only a party of 3, we definitely needed more space. It felt very cramped.

All of us ordered their famous lobster roll with a side of fries. I also got a cup of clam chowder. The chowder was fine, but I've had better at Monterey, down at the Fisherman's Wharf. The fries were nice, very crispy. The lobster roll though... the dish I've been dreaming and drooling about for months... was kind of a disappointment. Their was way too much dressing compared to the extremely little lobster meat in the roll. The portion was much smaller than I had anticipated seeing all the pictures on Yelp. And to top it off, my roll was practically all tiny little claw meat, very salty and chewy.

The search for an amazing lobster roll continues...
author: Cindy C.

description:
Overall, come to Woodhouse for some delicious solid seafood and friendly atmosphere. I wish SF had more places like Woohouse. 

Food 5 stars: Overall, my friend and I ordered the main from the menu and chose specials thereafter. The chocolate mousse was the best I've ever had in they city
-Stuffed artichoke - YUM! Delicious crab with with the artichoke was so good
-Mahi Mahi ceviche - friend and I loved the flavors
-Chocolate mousse - A must. This was the best chocolate mousse I've had in the city. It was light yet full of flavor. It didn't get too dense like some rich mousses tend to.

Atmosphere: 4 stars: I enjoy the high celilings and more casual dining. 

Service: 5 stars. All our servers were very friendly along with the hostess and table runners

The very nice part about Woodhouse was even though it was a busy Friday and they don't offer reservations, we had less than a 15 minute wait. SF has way too many restaurants that are overpriced with long waits or reservations that have to be made a month in advanced.
author: Jessica C.

description:
I LOVE this place! When I'm craving for a Lobster or Crab roll, this is the place! I been here so many times and tried almost everything on the menu. I love everything but...

My favorites are **Steamed Littleneck Clams, served with garlic bread. It's huge clams, not the tiny ones. So much meat to them. The broth was delicious, garlic, yum! Amazing to dip your bread it. 

**Split-top Maine Lobster Roll - So freaken delicious! You can get a large or regular. The bread is buttery crunchy goodness. Every belt is filled with lobster. I normally get the regular size because it served with fries and slaw. The fries are amazing too. LOVE everything! 

**Toasted-buttered Dungeness Crab Roll - is just like the lobster roll but instead its filled with Crab. OMG yum, totally depending on what you are craving for that day. 

**Cioppino - A big bowl of seafood, always fresh served in tomato base broth. Never too salty. Served with garlic bread. My second favorite cioppino in the city. 

Everything is amazing. Totally depends what you want that day. Services is always friendly. Small restaurant. No reservations. Wait is never too long. Great neighborhood.
author: Sandy B.

description: Came in at 5pm on a weekday and were seated right away. We had the fried calamari, mussels and fries, and the Hartford clam chowder. They were great except the mussels had very little meat. Service is great.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Ok. I might get pummeled by some for saying this but here it goes. 

Best lobster roll ever. 

There, I said it. I'm not including the price factor here. I'm just talking about overall taste. I got the 6oz version. It was not over mayonaised. The lobster was perfectly cooked and moist. 

Was it a little costly? Sure. But hey, you get what you pay for. 

Clam chowder was pretty damn good too. Not too salty and had just the right thickness. Good portion of clams also. 

You know it's legit if you have a swordfish hanging on the wall. 

Ok here's a weird tidbit: in the restroom, there's a cool aerial picture of SF taken after the 1906 quake. If you're a bit of a history buff, check it out. Just don't spend too long in there or other people might get mad.
author: K M.

description:
excellent food
served hot
classic seafood restaurant
would recommend
author: Steven M.

description: Don't pay attention to the restaurant decor.  This is not important. Great food. Good quality. And good wines. I had the Sauvignon from New Zealand, just perfect!
author: Sophie C.

description:
Street parking wasn't hard to find on a Thursday night. 

The restaurant is fairly small. For a table of 3 we had to wait for 15 mins for a table which wasn't too bad. They have a little corner seating area that fits a few people.  

Our group ordered stuffed artichoke, fish tacos, and 3oz lobster roll. 
First time trying the lobster roll and loved it !! The bread was toasted and buttery and the lobster was so flavorful. Good portion of lobster. The lobster roll came with fries and cole slaw for $22. 
For the fish tacos, one order came with 3 tacos. They know how to cook their fish!! One of the best fish tacos I've ever had. The crispy lightly battered fish was fairly big it could barely fit into the soft taco shell! The taco was stuffed with crispy battered cod, cabbage, chipotle aioli, pico de gallo, and avocado. Full of flavor and deliciousness!!! 

I really enjoyed dinner at Woodhouse - the food was fresh and delicious. Highly recommended !!

Will be back for $1 oysters on Tuesday and to try the Dungeness crab roll.
author: Karen L.

description:
San Fran! Coming here and walking around fisherman's wharf you can get suckered into ordering the lobster rolls on the side of the road. We didn't order one of these.

We decided to google best lobster roll in San Fran and ended up here. It is a nice sit down restaurant and super casual. 

We got the lobster roll and split it because we were full from a bbq place that was not satisfying at all.

And it was great! The fries were simple and perfectly cooked.

We even came back the next day for another lobster roll.
author: Sandy T.

description: The customer service was great. We had the lobster roll, fish and chips, and Kumamoto oyster. Everything was fresh!
author: Renato V.

description:
Was out in SF watching a football game in the cold gloomy weather late at night. Watched two games and it was so it was so cold I couldn't feel my hands. Something nice and warm after those games sounded perfect. 

I saw Woodhouse was open till 10pm with great review so I gave it a try. Once we got there we were quickly seated and served drinks. The host was very friendly and welcoming. Our server checked if we needed anything's every time she walked by. 

Shortly after our drink we got our food probably 10-15 minutes after. The food was great!!! I got the clam chowder and garlic bread. Let me tell you.... this combination was a blessing. I quickly felt warm and cozy. This definitely did the dead. 

Overall I 100% recommend this restaurant. What else can you ask for, from great welcoming service to delicious fulfilling food. I'll definitely return.
author: Faofizah S.

description:
Lost my lobster roll virginity to Woodhouse, and it was satisfying. Is the price of $35 for double meat justifiable? No, not at all (most expensive sammich I've ever had). But it was still delicious. I can't believe that at our table of 4 Seattlelites, none of us asked for the clam chowder (I just stared at the dude next to us and his giant bowl of goodness). If I ever come back here, I'll have to get that.

Got the bay shrimp avocado roll, the lobster roll, baja fish tacos, and the crab melt. The baja fish tacos were actually the best out of the 4 of them. Maybe it's just because they use cod, and I love cod. The shrimp and avocado roll wasn't my cup of tea; the shrimp was sweet and it was a weird combination with the giant slices of avocado.

Overall, my tummy was happy. Wallet not so much.
author: Denise L.

description: It's my 4th time here and I'm still happy . First time for dinner so about a 35 minute wait on a Friday night at 6:30. What a nice vibe and smells so yummy. Started with a crisp wedge salad garnished with beets, croutons and tomatoes. The small lobster roll was more than enough to fill me for $23. Not cheap but worth the splurge. Squid pasta with smoked trout was also a hit. Cleaned our plates well  . $59
author: Laine G.

description: My husband took us here for my birthday. Our waiter did forget to bring us our drinks, but no big deal. Lobster roll & clam chowder were our favorite. Fish & chips was wayyy too oily.
author: Halina N.

description: I enjoyed my lunch at Woodhouse. The service was exceptional and my server helped me find something new outside my usual fish and chips. I ordered the Toasted-Buttered Dungeness Roll which is made with crab. It came with fries and a side of slaw. I put my slaw inside my roll and it added a bit of a sweet kick to the buttered crab. Next time I'm in the area I'd like to try some other things of their menu like their crab cakes or their fish and chips. I look forward to dining with Woodhouse again.
author: Christopher W.

description: The best fish & chips I've ever experienced. Their service is only second to their deliciously flaky, light, and tasty meal.
author: Sophia E.

description:
I love this Fillmore District location of this San Francisco seafood chain. The layout is much more pleasant than the Castro location. Noise level is much better too. Staff was great. Decent and reasonable house Chardonnay too. 

Blue Point Oysters were amazing. Calamari was wonderful.
author: T.J. L.

description: Great service and good food! Will definitely keep this as a "go-to" for seafood in that area!
author: Joshua C.

description:
Grew up in NYC and went to school in Boston--so I'm no stranger to fresh seafood.  Love this place.  They don't take reservations but tables empty quickly so don't be afraid to wait.

I love the lobster rolls, fried calamari, fresh crab and crab cakes.  Also, don't miss the strawberry shortcake.  Everything is so fresh!
author: Timan G.

description: Nice place, best thing I love about this place is Tuesday 1$  oysters all day long,good variety of drinks and fish dishes. If you never been here come on Tuesday !
author: Askhat E.

description:
The Lobster Squid Ink Linguine is absolutely incredible. I'm not much of a fan for pasta. Not at all, but this dish had me lickin the bowl like a puppy that had not ate in weeks. I darn licked & cleaned that bowl so clean you couldn't tell it'd been used.  This dish is insane.
Also had the Wedge Salad w/ Blue Cheese as well, which for a basic ass sounding dish of salad, this plate had incredible flavor. I don't know how to explain it. It was just awesome. It's salad. It's supposed to be whatever. Naw, this ish was good.
I've had the lobster sandwich before and recently tried the Dungeness Crap sandwich as well. Of all things it was whatever. Crap, butter, sandwich roll. Crap was great, but the sandwich is nothing special. Regardless, this place is off the chain. It's 5 stars Most def. I will going back a many times.
author: Gilbey G.

description: Small place so hard to get a spot in rush hours (which in SF apparently are almost all day...) but the food is really good. Prices are, well, SF prices. Coming from Denver, everything here seems expensive but I guess you just have to get used to it. So comparing to other places in this town, I would say this is not a very expensive place and you get good food for your money. I had a seafood pasta and others had the artichoke and fish+chips and they were all very happy.
author: Gil S.

description: I had to try the cioppini.  Not my thing but I can understand why others like it. It was loaded with fish. Next up was fish and chips a couple of months later.  Perfect.  My family in from Ohio gobbled this up.  Among the best I have ever had.  We got it to go and it did not suffer for the tiny wait in eating it. As a rule I am not a fish eater.  This could change.
author: Vickie B.

description: We had excellent service!  Very friendly hostess and waitress. Helpful in answering questions about the menu and explaining the dishes. The food was wonderful as well! Great place for seafood.
author: Stephany B.

description: Super good food. Highly recommend going on Tuesdays since they have $1 oysters. Also had the lobster roll, which had plenty of meat really refreshing flavors and not heavy whatsoever. The fish and chips came with gigantic pieces of fish which is a plus! Super fresh seafood and very tasty.
author: Sarah L.

description: This place is popular, but we were unimpressed.  Cioppino was disappointing in both portion size and flavor.
author: Ed D.

description: In my stay at San Francisco, I was lucky enough to eat at some pretty nice restaurants. This place was my favorite. I arrived here at the suggestion from of a coworker because we heard about their dollar oysters. This was my first time eating raw oysters. Though this was not my favorite thing, I could see how these were enjoyable for others. Everything on the menu looked good, and at the recommendation of some coworkers I decided to order Lobster Roll. This was hands down the most amazing meal I have ever enjoyed. There was a perfect balance of sweetness, fish, bread and vegetables. To top it off the atmosphere was fantastic. The servers were polite and prompt and everyone at this place seemed to really be enjoying themselves. If I can help it... I will be back!
author: Christopher C.

description: I'm so happy I found this place on yelp! Everything was wonderful, from the staff, to the atmosphere, to the food. It's nautical theme and reminds me of Cape Cod in the New England area. I was lucky enough to stop in on a Tuesday because that's always $1 oyster night. I started with a 1/2 oysters and a cider and they were delicious. The oysters came out right away. Next I got the shrimp and crab stuffed grilled artichoke and it was amazing. It came with beets and cheese garlic toast. I asked for a side of butter and dipped my crab and shrimp it in then put it on a bite of toast - it was amazing and full of flavors! The artichoke was perfectly cooked and flavored as well. Last, I took strawberry shortcake home and that was wonderful as well. Did I also mention how great all the staff was?! I will certainly stop back here next time I visit San Fran!
author: Ashley K.

description: Came here based on yelp review.  Since they do not take reservations, we got there around opening time on Saturday.  There's only 3 parties around 11:30.  We got to try clam chowder, calamari, soft shell BLT, fish tacos, crab roll & crab cakes.  All seafoods were super fresh.  I'd highly recommend chowder, calamari, soft shell BLT & fish tacos.
author: Chloe H.

description:
Decent little neighborhood place.  The New England clam chowder was great, some of the best I've had.  Not too creamy, and not too thin.  The red wasn't bad, but not as good.  They gave it a cioppino type spicy kick.  The fried calamari app was avg. 

The lobster roll was pretty good.  Light on the mayo, with small dice celery and chives with a buttered split bun.  I haven't had one in Maine, but if they were going for buttery sweetness, I think they hit it.  Tasty, but I'm pretty sure one with crab or shrimp would taste about the same.  Fries were good, and the coleslaw was  meh.

The place is smallish and the tables are close together, which makes it pretty noisy.  Don't expect to have any subtle conversations, and older folks with hearing issues...well, just eat your food.

I'd go back for the chowder, and to try something new.  But, I wouldn't go out of my way for it.
author: Chris C.

description:
Came here on a Sunday afternoon and it wasn't that crowded at all. Was sat immediately at a table. It took me a while to browse through the menu and actually find out what i wanted to eat. Had the hardest time choose between the sandwich rolls...Crab or Clam so i ended up just getting the steamed clams with fries while my homie got the mussels and garlic bread.  

I'm personally a huge fan of Hog Island at the Ferry building and i found this to be very similar. I had high hopes for this place because i've heard so much about it. The clams being $16 and the mussels being $14 although considered appetizers were actually pretty good. It wasn't a meal to fill someone up but it was just the right amount to help with hunger. The sauce for the clams was a garlic creamy butter type flavor, very similar to hog island and the fries just went well with the sauce. Tasted like a garlic butter clam chowder but i personally would drink the sauce on it's own. I think Hog island wins it for me though because the flavor there was much more balanced and clams were plenty. Plus, you get to enjoy the beautiful view of the bay bridge.

Overall a good experience but more on the pricey end. I've heard the maine lobster rolls were beyond amazing so that i must try on my next adventure!
author: Auden W.

description: Meh. I thought the food was ok a little overpriced IMO.
author: Edgar C.

description: One of thee best lobster rolls I've had in a while. Mike was extremely friendly to me and my boyfriend. It was a great way to say goodbye to sf. Yummy food and a friendly host.
author: Alejandra G.

description:
While in San Francisco a few weeks ago I was determined to find a good seafood place before the end of my trip. After a quick Yelp search Woodhouse seemed like the best option. I went here with some friends and was excited to hear that they had $1.00 oysters on Tuesdays.

I got the lobster roll and half a dozen oysters. First off, the oysters were out of this world. They tasted so fresh and I couldn't have been happier. That is until I tried the lobster roll, and was blown away. It was so good. Toasted bread with a huge amount of lobster and a side of fries was plenty of food. 

It's truly a shame that this place is so far away, but it left quite the impression on me. If you ever find yourself in San Francisco for any reason, you have to stop here. It's too great not to.
author: Seth C.

description:
You guys this place was amazing. 
For some reason I was CRAVING fish. I've been wanting to get my hands on some clams for a while now so I was stoked to see it offered as an appetizer. They were amazing - definitely get the garlic bread instead of the fries with this meal, the garlic bread was legendary. 

The also got the crab roll, I was between this and the lobster roll, but I've never seen a crab roll before. This was great, Although I'll admit I saw someone order the lobster roll and I had a little fomo. 

The restaurant was very cute but it was also very small. I could imagine long waits sometimes, but I would wait for this food again.
author: Alyssa S.

description: The Dungeness crab roll is to die for!!! Seriously my most favorite sandwich I've ever had. It was amazing! Recommend this place as a must see to everyone visiting San Francisco!
author: Jessica H.

description: I love this place - used to live on Fillmore street and would stop by every week or so. Hands down the best chowder I've tried (and I've tried it maybe at 50 different places), amazing lobster rolls and bread pudding. The setting is very casual, but if just want some great seafood and a cozy place for lunch/dinner, this is a great pick-hence, 5 stars
author: Irina E.

description: $36 sounds is a lot to pay for a lobster roll - and it is, but it is a lot better than paying $20 for a cold baguette full of mayo and a teaspoon of lobster from a stand at Fisherman's Wharf. Woodhouse delivers a really tasty lobster roll! Though I don't usually order cold lobster rolls because warm butter is superior in my opinion, I would definitely get the lobster roll again here.
author: Austin W.

description: Had soft-shell crab sandwich, crab cakes, stuffed artichoke, oysters, and beer. We would only go back for the beers and oysters. The rest of the food was ok and a little pricey for what it was. Also the service was just ok.
author: Danny D.

description:
Great restaurant. Very good cioppino. That is all you need to know.

Also come early since they don't take reservations. Street parking can be challenging but there's a nearby paid parking lot. So I would definitely recommend coming a good 30 mins earlier.
author: Kevin N.

description: Their lobster rolls was great. Crispy, tasty batter and moist fresh fish! I miss that lobster roll so much. The service is also normal and there is a good atmosphere.
author: Santiago C.

description:
Am I the only one who gets lobster on the brain?

You know...you see it somewhere, read it about it somewhere etc...

And then all you can think of is Lobster!!

Well I have the cure for your lobster on the brain:  Woodhouse Fish Company.

This location is on Fillmore street and is as cute as a button. I can only assume it gets very busy. Very charming interior. 

I ordered the large Lobster roll and the lobster meat was delicious. The bun was ridiculously small....but who cares. The Lobster roll comes with fries , which were perfectly seasoned and perfectly fried, and a small portion of coleslaw....wish it was a larger portion.

Service was okay.

Price is spendy.....but it is Lobster.

Next time you get the hankering Woodhouse will set you right!
author: David G.

description:
Walk-ins only (no reservations).

When we walked in at around 12:30pm on a rainy Sunday there were tons of tables, but by about 1pm, the restaurant was packed and there was a line, so good luck when you come.  Seating at tables and at the counter top.

CLAM CHOWDER: not too seafoody (how I like it) but still full of clams and potatoes and herbs.  Very tasty.

FISH AND CHIPS: tasty and light and the fries were tasty and cooked perfectly

Make your own LEMONADE: a little odd at first where they bring you a glass of ice and a little bit of lemon (juice) on the bottom, a carafe of water, and a small carafe of sugar water.  So you mix whatever you want.  I will admit I added a fair amount of sugar but it was great that it was super fresh and tasty!

Most people seemed to be ordering the LOBSTER ROLLS to be honest - the 3oz or 6oz - it's the same roll and plate but one sandwich just has twice as much meat.  You can get the traditional lobster roll or you can ask for it hot with butter (not listed on the menu but if you ask they will do it!

Single unisex bathroom in the back.
author: Traci H.

description:
Excellent Fish and Chips! Excellent setting. Fantastic price!
My only complaint would be that I'd have preferred it served on a plate instead of a basket.
author: Jan S.

description: Service good, meal came right away, enjoyed the tasty salmon entree. Much better than what you'd expect. We'll be back.
author: Debra M.

description:
This was our first meal in SF... we were starving and excited to eat! We were kind of let down. They were pretty busy in between lunch and dinner, and I could already tell the service experience wasn't going to be a good one. Our waitress was boring and didn't make much of an effort. The busboys were okay though, and stayed on top of clearing the table and refilling water. We did our best to eat and get outta here.

I love trying clam chowder everywhere, especially coastal cities. Their New England style clam chowder was a let down. Extremely average chowder, and the only reason I finished it was cause I was hungry. My girlfriend had the rock shrimp linguine that was pretty flawless, very good. I had the lobster roll, and it was just okay. The bread was amazing.. but the lobster and the whole sandwich didn't work well for me. I've had far better lobster rolls and clam chowder elsewhere.

An average meal in SF, but what was terrible was their dish washing. I got a dirty spoon for my clam chowder, and I asked for a new spoon. They brought me out another dirty spoon! Instead of telling them again, I used water and my napkin to clean it. Clean dishes are a must at any establishment. There are far too many better places for seafood in SF, explore other options.
author: Brandon F.

description: My husband and I had a great meal here - oysters were delish and the lobster roll was surprisingly full of lobster.  Our server was great as well.  We will definitely be back!
author: Tyler T.

description: The food is always excellent and the service is fantastic. Don't forget to ask about the board specials and how they're prepared.
author: Samson J.

description: came here for dinner on a Monday at 9 and our party of four was immediately seated in this small Fremont St resto. we had the soft shell crab BLT and the clam chowder. food and service were great. I'd still give this resto 5 stars even if it's pricey because that's expected of SF.
author: Arnel E.

description:
I was craving a crab roll and that was the highest review seafood restaurant. 

Make sure to try their Arnold Palmer 
Crab rolls were excellent
author: Eric M.

description:
This place was stellar! I went here with a group of fellow Community Ambassadors while we were in San Francisco. One of the other CA's found it on Yelp and it had great reviews, so we were there! 

First off, I love seafood. Living in Florida, we get a pretty good array. But Gainesville is lacking in that department (since we aren't on the coast). We happened to be there on $1 oyster night! I don't care for the texture of oysters, but my teamates were thrilled! We got around 50 oysters for the 6 of us. I had one so we could all do cheers! It was super cute! 

I was debating between the Lobster Roll and the Crab Melt. I love tuna melts - they are right below mac n cheese for me. But, the Lobster roll had tons of good reviews and photos on Yelp. I ended up going with the Crab Melt and trying my friend's Lobster roll. They were both fantastic! They were well seasoned, moist, and fresh! There was a perfect ratio of bread to meat, and overall I was so happy. 

I only wish that this place was here in Gainesville so I could eat it again! If you are in San Fran go check it out!
author: Cheyenne C.

description:
Nice Frogs Leap Chardonnay.  Really good wedge salad with maytag blue cheese and tomatoes! My boyfriend thought the clam chowder was very good with good chunks of clam throughout. Liked the Baja fish tacos - 3 of them per order on corn tortillas with fresh with avocado slice on each and yummy chipotle sauce ... 

Nice atmosphere - great location in Fillmore District.  Great service.

Will return to try it again :) definitely wanted to try the grilled jalapeño crab!
author: Darlene C.

description:
I found this place when I was craving a lobster roll thanks to the great reviews on Yelp. I was happy to hear it was $1 oyster night on Tuesdays, the day I was there. This made my dinner choice a little bit harder. 

Ultimately I decided to stick with my craving and ordered the smaller sized lobster roll. The small size is still a decent portion, especially with the fries and cole slaw that come along with it. The lobster roll came with huge chunks of lobster covered in mayo and celery. The lobster itself was very tasty and fresh. I added some lemon to the roll and was in culinary heaven.

Knowing me, I was not able to resist the $1 oyster, so I ordered a half dozen. At a normal going rate of $3, it was just too good of a deal to miss out on. The oysters were very fresh as well. They were a good size and came with cocktail sauce. I personally prefer mignonette, but again I sprinkled some lemon juice on them and was good to go! 

If you're craving seafood in San Francisco I would definitely recommend this place. I am not from the area, so I am unable to compare it to other nearby restaurants but it was quite good in my opinion!
author: Kerry O.

description: The food was very average and so was the service. We had the shrimp roll, crab cakes and clam chowder. The seafood was average and the crab cakes were too doughy. The clam chowder was a little better but I've had better.
author: Nancy A.

description:
Lobster Rolls! Where do I line up? I remember when I first came here I was so impressed with everything all around. I would claim it was the best Lobster roll that you can get around ever. I would brag that to my friends and anyone who ever spoke of getting a lobster roll. Well, after going here a couple more times my feelings have changed. I feel like the rolls here are just decent. The clam chowder I once thought was top of the line isn't anymore. I just think the food now is just missing something that would put the food over the top. 

The items I had a couple times are
*The Dungeness Crab roll - The meat is cool, but the sandwich overall is just too dry. Maybe if they used or gave some hot butter on the side, because its literally a mound of crab inside, nothing else. I had to resort to using the cole slaw to put inside to make it taste a little better.

*Lobster Roll - This was the roll was made me fall in love in the first place. The flavor is this roll is a lot better, but same thing... its just missing something to put it over the top. It is a little bit pricy, seems like they tone down the amount of lobster they pack inside, so if your trying a roll, this has to be the one you get.

*Fish tacos - Crispy and crunchy, but they're decent. Nothing memorable about these.

*New England Clam Chowder - Just your average clam chowder. Unfortunately it doesn't taste better than what you can get on the pier. 

I used to once rave about how good Woodhouse is, but upon trying other places, I feel like this isn't the home-run go-to place that stole my heart the first time I came. A simple comparison is that the Crazy crab sandwich, and clam chowder bread bowl taste way at AT&T Park than the crab and soup they serve here. 
Anyways if your wondering if you should give this place a try, I still would say yes, just be cautious on what you order.
author: Arron E.

description: Great and fresh, took a little while to get food but well worth the wait. Clam chowder is recommended!
author: Monica L.

description: Hand down the best fish and chips I have ever had! Tied for the best meal I have had. I cannot offer a praise for the flavor, texture, and service. The fact that anyone can order anything else on the menu is beyond me.
author: Eura E.

description: Sunday lunch craving for seafood. Found easy parking 2 blocks away. Great service and great food. A bit pricey but the portions were pretty good. My husband had clam chowder with his lobster sandwich, which was stuffed with lobster and we shared calamari for appetizers. I had the crab sandwich, not disappointed at all.
author: Leen D.

description: My favorite lobster roll place. Lobster roll is consistently good  every time. Crab cakes are yummy, too. Sometimes the fries don't come out super hot. Might have to wait a while if you come during peak lunch hours. Can be pricey but worth it.
author: Christina H.

description:
Finally got to try this place! Went here on a Saturday afternoon with a friend and the wait wasn't as bad cause we got a spot near the counter for a 5 minute wait. The wait would have been longer for a table. It was kind of squishy but the food made up for it. 

The waiters automatically came with waters and menus. My friend and I both got the smaller split-top Maine lobster roll which came with fries and slaw! And I got a Arnold Palmer ( half lemonade and iced tea)! The Arnold Palmer came in three separate jars, one for iced tea, one for syrup, and the lemonade in the glass so you can adjust the sweetness and taste to your liking. 

The lobster roll was SO GOOD! Definitely worth it! The fries and slaw were good complements to the roll! Friend also enjoyed the food. It's a bit pricey but a good experience!
author: Jeanette Q.

description:
I suggested lobster rolls for lunch to my boyfriend and there are very few restaurants in the city that serve them but luckily found this cute spot! 

It's really small here but it has a nice cozy feel to it which I loved. We were seated right away and beat the lunch rush! 

We ordered lobster rolls and the mussels which were very yummy. You can order the mussels with either bread or fries and we got the bread since the lobster rolls already come with fries lol. And since it would've been such a waste to not finish the sauce of the mussels they gave us some sourdough bread to dip with the sauce! Which I thought was very nice that they offer that.

All the way through, really great service everybody was nice and welcoming. This isn't really the best spot to bring a huge group, better for you and a friend to catch up over a nice meal. I'll definitely come back next time I'm in SF!
author: Samantha L.

description: On a recent visit to specialist in San Francisco, we were walking along Fillmore and I spotted this place. A look at the window menu made me go in. The shrimp cocktail was very tasty, but longing for at least another large shrimp. It came with 4. Oh well. The clams in sauce were delicious. I also tried their clam chowder and mussels. All was very good and price was in line with the other food places around
author: Alex G.

description:
Cute spot that's a little on the pricey side. There was no wait for lunch on a weekend but dinner was over an hour wait when I tried before. Service is really nice and attentive.

Oysters are $2.50 each. There's no option to order a dozen at once for cheaper. I ordered the crab melt sandwich ($14) that comes with fries and cole slaw. The fries had a perfect texture and flavor. The sandwich was filled with crab and cheddar cheese and was pretty good. It looks small at first but is actually very filling. My friend got the fish and chips ($12 for 2 pieces) and he said he really liked it. 

Overall good place for seafood in a great neighborhood!
author: Linda X.

description:
So delicious! I'll be coming here very often from now on.

It's definitely on the pricey side, but it's totally worth it. The presentation was beautiful. 

A small lobster roll (fries + slaw included) was just enough to fill my belly with joy. The bread was also very yummy. 

Surprisingly, it wasn't super busy on a Thursday night. Or, it's probably because we arrived at 8pm? Anyways, so glad I got to try it!
author: Jenny H.

description:
TUESDAYS are legit. If you like oysters.

Came here after window shopping along Fillmore, and shared $1 oysters (Point Reyes) with the sister! It was delicious, but small. That's what you get with the $1 deal, I guess.

It wasn't too long of a wait when we put our names down with the host. We were told a 30-minute wait, so we decided to walk around/shop some more besides standing outside in the cold. By the time it was 7:30PM we were sat in a closely-quartered two-top table. The ambiance is pretty New England-y/preppy and the tables are extremely close to the point where you can rub elbows with your neighbors. 

Because we ate small portions all day, (Fraiche right before), we decided to start with the oysters and share a lobster roll. Prices are HIGH here, even for seafood standards. But it was delicious. Lobster is in large portions, but the bread was a bit too buttery for me. Fries are terrific, not too oily or overdone. I would definitely come for their Tuesday deal, but I think SF has better seafood spots that dole out bigger portions for the price you're paying.

Service was slow during the dinner rush, but we had a cheerful server. Props to him! The servers are working their tails off, so remember to tip them at least 20%! Shoutout to our smiley server--we work in customer service too :)
author: Jodi H.

description: Best clam chowder in town!! Without the hassle of the touristy wharf. Classy place good for both dine in and take out. I love the bbq oysters, fish & chips, and calamari. Minus one star for price, but that's SF I guess!
author: Jessica V.

description: Came here a while ago and didn't think to post a review until now but fish and chips were very good! Definitely recommended for fish and chips kind of people haha. Lobster roll is good too
author: Dinah V.

description:
Dang son, that lobster roll expensive! $19 (3 oz meat) or $27 (6 oz meat). Que lastima, the price you pay for a hipster SF meal. The lobster meat was good though. 

There's limited seating here and often a line. They'll only seat you once your entire party comes. 

Oysters are $2.50 each (usually).
author: Joanna L.

description: Ordered the clam chowder, little bit too thick in cheese. Also ordered the oysters, which most of them do not have water in it, which I don't quite prefer.
author: Kelvin Y.

description: Excellent! Excellent! Excellent! Oyster were fresh and delicious. Crab in butter sammy was all crab and delicious as well. Location is small although it is worth the wait. Service was very good, I think the bus person was the hardest worker in the joint as he was the one who made sure our water was filled and table cleared. Kudos to him.
author: Manny G.

description: They have good oysters for $3 each, $1 each on Tuesdays. Shrimp and avocado roll is my favorite. It comes with fries and coleslaw on the side.
author: Zaldy T.

description: Nothing special, dinner prices were on the expensive side and can't imagine what the dinner prices are for mediocre food quality at best. Food quality needs to improve immensely and service too.
author: Nicole S.

description: Raced here to grab some grub, walked in 30 minutes til their closing time expecting some hostile "damnit we're almost closed" mood but the waiter/host was so friendly, welcoming, and patient when my gluten-free partner asked all her questions. She had the crab salad and I had the crab cakes. Both were so delicious. Oh! And we had some Kumamoto oysters that just hit the spot so good I can't wait to go back!
author: Alicia T.

description:
I'm a sucker for New England clam chowdah, and this place hit the spot.

They even ship in their oyster crackers from Vermont, so you know it's legit. Not sure about their "Hartford" clam chowder, which is a made-up dish wherein a dollop of Manhattan clam chowder defiles a bowl of the white creamy stuff...but I might try it out next time.

The chowder could use some bread on the side, but they make you buy it.
author: .Alan Y.

description:
Great lunch spot in SF if you want some delicious and fresh seafood, fish and chips. This place small and gets packed so come early! 
We got two bowls of creamy clam chowder which had an abundant amount of clams and you can ask for sour dough bread!! Great combo! :)
We also got the regular OZ lobster roll which comes with crunchy fries and fresh cole slaw. We almost got the larger ounce roll but I think the regular roll still had a good amount of lobster. I highly recommend the lobster roll!
The last thing we got was the fish tacos and it was $15 for 3. I remember this because I paid half the price somewhere else. The tacos were definitely good, but I don't think it was worth it because it was too much fried batter compared to the fish.
Glad we got to visit this place on our trip to San Francisco! It is more on the pricer side so don't be afraid to share!
author: Judy L.

description: I came here on a Thursday evening for a solo meal and was promptly seated at the bar. The waitress was friendly and helpful and introduced me to my new favorite way to eat clam chowder. If you're into clam chowder GO and order "The Hartford". It's literally the best of both worlds. Why have I never heard of this before?! I'm only here for the weekend but I HAVE to go back and get that before I go. The lobster roll was good but a little too much celery for my liking. I also could have did with a little more mayo. The celery slightly overpowered the roll. Overall, service was great. Food came out quickly. Prices were reasonable. I'd like to try their cioppino before I go. It looked and smelled amazing. This is a really good spot.
author: Kimberly L.

description:
This place is real San Francisco and real,real great. The Chiappino  was better than any including Tadich Grill. Definitelywill repeat.  
Jim Beaty
author: Jim B.

description: I felt like the food was really expensive for what it was and the food wasn't even that good. I think the best thing we had here were the fries and that says something about the rest of the food. I was really disappointed because this place had really good reviews and it looked really cute and promising. I've definitely had better lobster rolls for much cheaper. Same with the chowder. This place is ridiculously overpriced and because the food was only decent I don't think it's really worth it.
author: Jamie L.

description: When this restaurant opened it was pretty good. Although the menu was limited, the fact that it served wonderful fried clam, lobster and crab rolls made it worth going to. The last two times we've gone, however, the food has been awful. Deeply over-fried in oil that tastes like it's been sitting around for days, leading to an afternoon of indigestion experienced by all diners at our table. The menu is very slight; they should have a chef who has perfected the cooking of the few seafood items on it by now. There were fewer diners than there've been in the past - perhaps the word is spreading that this once fresh restaurant is no longer worth its steep, steep prices (my $21 soft-shell crab BLT - in a small hot-dog bun - had burnt bacon and crab that was fried to the point where it was not recognizable as crab). $160 lunch bill and nobody enjoyed the meal.
author: Alison H.

description: This was a very fun place to eat. Nice decoration, very nautical without being too in your face. Tasty food - nice seafood sandwiches! - with well thought out presentation and overall a very positive vibe. Not my favorite place ever, but it was a fun and flavorful experience.
author: Blake A.

description:
Late afternoon lunch with daughter and boyfriend (hers). Street parking was ample and we were seated immediately in the small interior. First vibe: probably a go-to place for a lot of locals in the Lower Pacific Heights. 

Lucky them.

Here's what we ordered (to share): split-top Maine lobster roll sandwich, three piece fish and chips, and stuffed artichoke, split, grilled and stuffed with Dungeness crab and bay shrimp.

My daughter had never eaten a lobster roll. Last one I had was thirty years ago in Cape Cod. This is just how I remembered them, and honestly, once you get past the sweet succulent lobster here, which was plentiful but not indulgent, there's not much to review. The shoestring fries were dece,as was the slaw.

Now we get to the good part. Awesome fish and chips (and I know a thing or two about fish and chips, hailing from Seattle). Batter was perfect, light and not greasy, and the wild Alaskan cod was copious and delish! And maybe some of the best tartar sauce around!  I will be back for this!

Though maybe a bit skimpy on the crab (I know, a cliché with crab reviews), the split artichoke was presented and executed with perfection. Tasted wonderful! (And next time I'll get extra aioli because it was great and well, just because.)

Reviews tend to bypass the lemonades and Arnold Palmers, but Woodhouse's deserves a special mention for their nifty presentation of these beverages--you get your own cordial of simple syrup to sweeten as you may. 

It's this attention to detail--simple syrup, tartar sauce, aioli--that lifts this place above the rest. I will be back.
author: Beej J.

description:
I came here with a couple of friends for a Friday night dinner a while back. We heard this was the best Cioppino in town, so of course we had to try it! The wait for a table was probably around 30 minutes, which is not bad at all for Friday dinner. We were able to walk around and chitchat while we waited.

We weren't super hungry, so we got a few things to share: Poke, Cioppino, and Crab Cakes. At the recommendation of our waitress, I paired this with a Sauvignon Blanc. I would say skip the Poke, because it just tasted like ahi tuna drenched in soy on a chip. The crab cakes are a perfect balance of crispy on the outside and melt-in-your-mouth goodness on the inside. Finally, the cioppino was truly the star of the show. It might not look like much when it arrives, but it's definitely filling and there's plenty of good stuff (read: seafood) in it.

For a seafood place in San Francisco, I would say this place is average price. Definitely not cheap, but you're also not paying as much as you would elsewhere in the city. Also, service was fine. Nothing really noteworthy there. Overall, I enjoyed our dining experience and I would come back here to try other stuff.
author: Eryn H.

description:
My favorite lunch spot in SF.
You can get a Great Lobster Roll and Crab Roll.
Crunchy Fish and Chips is pretty nice as well.
Want to give 5, but -1 because of not being able to reserve a table.
However, when I visited on Saturday, right before noon, I was still able to grab a table for 4 :)
author: Toshi T.

description:
$1 oysters FTW!!!! This was the first stop on our $1 oyster happy hour tour of this city. It was a weekday so it wasn't super busy, even around lunchtime but we did check with the host AND the server that they were cool with us taking up a table for a round of drinks and a few dozen oysters. There is a bar too but there wasn't room for the four of us, so a table it was.

They oysters were good, the accompaniments were good and the beer was good. I was watching the baskets of fish and chips go by to other tables and they looked and smelled amazing! I want to come back here for a meal to get a proper feel for the spot but my first impressions were great. Bright, clean, good service and yummy yum yums!!!
author: Sarah S.

description:
I always suggested Woodhouse to my out-of-town friends even though I'd never had it so I was excited to finally get to try it today. There was still a fair amount of seating when my friend and I arrived at noon, so we chose the high top tables in the back for a little more privacy than the regular tables. Loved the decor of the place: lots of seafood/marine-themed art, but also a little panda bear wearing a Giants hat hehe ^_^

Tuesdays are $1 oysters all day so there's no crowd like at HH places. The Point Reyes oysters were on the saltier/brinier side than I'm used to, and the horseradish could've been stronger, but for the price I'll take it LOL. We also shared a small lobster roll and the daily special, a shrimp and pork belly po'boy. I liked that the rolls had a nice crunch on the edges but were fluffy on the insides, and that they weren't overly buttered so you could really taste the flavor of the meat. The pork belly came out tender and juicy, while the sprouts countered the saltiness of the meat, and the jalapenos added a nice kick to the whole sandwich; the shrimp, sadly, was disappointing and over-breaded. The lobster roll may have looked small, but it was packed with lobster meat, including an enormous claw. I loved that it wasn't covered in mayo either so all you tasted was pure fresh sweet lobster. What was drenched in mayo, however, was the cole slaw, so I recommend you eat the sandwich before your palate is ruined by that. Fries were thin, crispy, and not too oily, just the way I like them.

This was a way more expensive lunch that I'm used to (came out to just under $30 each) but I'd be willing to splurge here once in a while! Our server was very attentive and we didn't have to wait long at all for our food to come out. Definitely a solid place if you're looking for a quality lobster roll in the city.
author: KC W.

description:
Lobster roll was good!! Too over priced!
You can go on the pier for that!!

Horrible waitress! With the short hair, sad to say she was kind of racist! Seemed like she didn't want to help at all! 
Seated way before the table next to us, & they got their food before us, and we literally ordered the exact same dish!
Sad to say people still Judge by the color of their skin! 
Never would I come back again..
author: S T.

description: Woodhouse has been on my bookmarks forever. I finally got a chance to go and I was not disappointed at all. The lobster roll is to die for. The crab cakes were delicious but the sauce was a little over powering. And the clam chowder was the best I've ever had. A must try in SF.
author: Mike T.

description:
Came for the cioppino after a day in Marin with an out-of-town friend over Memorial Day weekend.  No reservations but the wait wasn't too long at around 8pm.  Cute place in a good location - found parking no problem and walked around afterwards to window shop (there is a Smitten a few blocks away!).

Ordered oysters, cioppino and smoked trout linguini.  Friend said the cioppino was the best meal of his life.  Linguini was passable, and wouldn't order again.  Oysters tasted fresh and we should have gotten more!!  Will definitely return for the oysters and cioppino.

BTW, they serve their cioppino with the crab meat already out of the shell, so no bibs or cracking instruments necessary (though to be fair, sometimes that is part of the fun).  Not sure if they serve it differently during crab season or not.
author: Tina L.

description:
Utterly in love with this place! This was easily my favorite meal of our entire three-day trip to SF.

We went for lunch on a Saturday (it definitely feels like more of a "lunch" spot than dinner) and it was pretty much perfect.

Got there around 1:00 and had a short wait for a table, which was no problem as it gave us time to work up an appetite.

The menu isn't huge, but it's got all your favorites (or at least mine)--oysters, calamari, lobster rolls, baja fish tacos, crab cakes, cioppino...even an ipswich clam sandwich.

A well-edited  beer and wine list features local brews and varietals. I went the non-alcoholic route and had a diy Arnold Palmer, which came with mini carafes of fresh lemon juice, tea, and simple syrup so I could craft it to my liking.  Honestly, I was so giddy over the diy concept that we could have stopped there and I would have been happy.

But of course we didn't stop there.

We started with oysters and chowder. They offer both east and west coast, but if you're in SF, why would you get east coast? Why pay for plane fare for your food? The oysters were plump, briny, and delicious.

Next we shared the calamari and the smaller size of the lobster roll (love that it comes in two sizes!), both of which were some of the best we've ever had. The calamari came with a marinara or cocktail sauce (I'm not sure which), but truly, it needed nothing. The lobster roll was deeply, deeply satisfying.

Despite being full, I spied a strawberry shortcake on the menu, and I can never ever pass that up, especially in a place where I couldn't imagine not loving it.

It was ambrosial. A flaky, soft biscuit, with plump, sweet, juicy strawberries, and fluffy whipped cream. So good, I want to die with one in each hand.

Service was friendly and swift, just as I'd expect from a place that excels in seemingly everything.

I will never not come here when I'm in San Francisco.
author: Melanie S.

description: My husband was in the food for some Lobster rolls and we were in the area and this place came up with great reviews. So we decided to check it out and hoped that there was not a long wait. We finally arrived and were seated right away which was a plus as it seemed like they were quite busy with all the other tables filled up. I got the Crab cakes and my husband got the lobster rolls. Both of the dishes were extremely flavorful and were super tasty. With Both enjoyed it very much. The prices seem a little high but that is what you should expect in SF! We will defiantly come back here again.
author: Regina R.

description:
We stopped here to grab a lovely lunch in a cute little neighborhood on my first time visit to San Francisco - we had to try the Dungeoness crab and Cioppino 

The place is nice and airy albeit a bit small but we sat at the bar which was comfortable.  With the name Woodhouse Fish Company I would've expected it to be more of a loud  "in the rough" place but it's light, quiet  and sunny and the service was spot on.

Both meals were tasty however of the two I think I would just get their cioppino again - it was chock full of fish, mussels scallops and a healthy portion of the crab.  With my girlfriend getting a whole crab (it was quite a bit- a half size would have been fine) and me getting the cioppino we just had too much crab.  (never thought I'd be saying that but yes, you CAN have too much crab) 

All around it's a solid stop off to take in some of the local cuisine.
author: Michael M.

description:
This place is right down the street of my friends work so we came here a few times to grab dinner. 

Best time to go is obviously for $1 oysters (either Tues/Wed night, I forget). It's usually always packed for dinner so you may have to wait a bit, but there is a wine bar near by that you can just grab a drink at to kill time. 

The fish and chips are pretty good, the fish isn't greasy at all. 

The crab cocktail looks cute (like an ice cream sundae), but it's not worth it since the cup is mostly filled with shredded lettuce. 

The shrimp linguine was pretty good. Pretty creamy/cheesy. 

Would definitely recommend the cioppino though! Big pieces of seafood, and the sauce with the garlic bread is lit.
author: Linda D.

description: I had the crab sandwich and it was fucking delicious the portion was relatively small, but it's so worth it. Will come back soon.
author: Natasha O.

description: Loved the fresh fresh very fresh Cioppino that has Scallops, Crab, Mussels, Shrimp and Clams in this red sauce that was spicy just the way I like it. I had this same meal the other day and the end of Fisherman's Wharf and that does not compare to this exquisite meal. I also asked for some Linguini on the side and it came with two pieces of Garlic Bread. Listen forget everything else on the menu this was a great meal and very filling. But I did save some space for the Strawberry shortcake. Then I'll need to take a nap. I give this meal and restaurant 5 stars plus.
author: Charles W.

description: Seafood heaven!!! Everything tastes so good here. The service is outstanding, you feel so comfortable dine in here. Seafood lovers can't miss here!
author: Grace C.

description: Thus far best lobster and crab rolls in the bay! Excellent service both lunch and dinner. True seafood restaurant with nice view inside kitchen! Definitely worth the drive if from out of town!
author: Stephanie P.

description: I try to eat here every time I'm in the city! Perfect crab cakes and a cute waiter that reminds me of Adam Levine.
author: Katie N.

description:
Placed in the glorious Fillmore Street, this restaurant has amazing seafood at affordable prices! Just went here with my family before dinner and it was the perfect amount of food and drinks for a mid afternoon treat! 

Dolla Dolla Oysters on Tuesdays? HELLL YAHHHH!!!!! For dollar oysters, they aren't big, but they do the job! Paired with a horse radish sauce, malt vinegar, lemon, and tobasco - and you got a tasty oyster. Also appreciate how clean and consistent the oysters are! I suggest getting at least 6 per person if you really want your taste buds fulfilled :) 

SALADS on SALADS on SALADS - The Ice Berg and Bleu cheese salad seriously just hit this spot. This goes perfect with the oysters and is seriously addicting. For around 7-10 dollars for a salad, you can even share it with friends! I definitely need to come back for the lobster rolls!! That looked super huge! 

The DRINKS here are on point. Your regular 6 dollar fare for some SF beers and classy selections of wine! 

For going here at 5 pm on a Tuesday weekday, there was plenty of seating and the ambiance and overall vibe of the place is awesome! The service was truly great and our server always asked if we needed anything. Kudos to Woodhouse for a great time on a beautiful day!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
My boyfriend and I have been wanting to try this place for a while and we were really excited that we finally had time and the opportunity to come here. We came here on Saturday around 12pm and there was no wait. I really liked the ambiance. It felt like I was dining next to the ocean waves...or inside Krusty Krabs. They have a cool gigantic picture frame that they put over a tv that is showing ocean waves moving and makes it look like the picture is actually moving. It fooled me at first because I though it was an actual picture that was moving but I realized it was a TV underneath the frame. I wonder how many people are fooled from this =)

For appetizers, we got 6 oysters and a bowl of clam chowder. The oysters were delicious! I was fresh and slimey. It came in a small cute tray filled with ice underneath and cocktail sauce. The clam chowder was also really good. It was very flavorful, very creamy, and the potatoes and clams were on point. I wanted another bowl!

We ordered a Maine Lobster Roll and a Dungeness Crab Roll and both ate half of each.  My first impression was wow, this looks small but it looks super delicious. As I started eating, it was really nothing special. I've had better lobster rolls and the flavor was pretty bland. The bread roll was good but it was a little greasy. The fries were just fries.It tasted like fries I can get at a local diner. However, the cole slaw was good. For $19 a roll, I think I would pass next time. I honestly though the roll would be bigger and tastier. 

Our bill was about $70. Pretty expensive. Maybe next time if I come again, I'd stick with appetizers but I'd go elsewhere for the lobster roll.

The service was just ok. Nothing stood out. The waitress took our order, delivered out food, and refilled our water once.
author: Allie Y.

description: I love this place! I've been at least five times. I'm from New England and have really high seafood expectations. This place meets them consistently.
