This is one of two places I've been to in SF that has oysters I enjoy eating (I normally don't like West Coast oysters). The service is great, menu is great, food is great.
author: Emma B.

description: It seems like Woodhouse Fish Co. is my go-to place for lunch whenever I have an eye appointment at Invision Optometry across the street. I'm adding an update, because I tried something different on my most recent visit. I started with a cup of clam chowder (okay, that's not new) and then I tried their fish and chips. Oh man, those were excellent fish strips. The fish was moist and the batter was super light and crispy, not like your typical beer batter. It didn't have the same texture as a tempura batter. For those of you who have ever eaten a fried taro dumpling at dim sum, that airy, light texture was very similar to the fish sticks. I have no idea what they used, but that's what it reminded me of. Excellent quality. Thanks for another great lunch, Woodhouse!
author: Lorianne L.

description: Lives up to SF's high standards for seafood.  Classic menu with fresh ingredients.  Indulged my craving for Crab Louie, which was outstanding.  The chowder was also great, though I have a couple of other favorite eateries for that particular dish. Overall, great place for an delicious Sunday lunch.
author: Inspector G.

description: Always have to eat. Never been disappointed. You can't go wrong with their salad bar, even seafood.
author: Melody C.

description:
After visiting a mutual friend in a nearby hospital, my friend Dolores & I were deciding if we were hungry enough to stop in for a bite for dinner. It didn't take much convincing, as there was a pretty big crowd of diners for as early as it was, so we stopped in.

I ordered the Bay Shrimp & Avocado Sandwich. Wow, was it tasty. Plump juicy shrimp, and quite honestly it looked like they put a whole avocado in-between (you know there's never too much avocado!) Served on a lovely brioche bun, which was slightly sweet, yet even grilled. AHHMMAAZZING!  It came with these yummy fries (that tasted like McDonalds fries) thin, yet crispy and a side of cole slaw, which wasn't too tart, yet totally refreshing. Loved every bite!!  My friend had the Dungeness Crab Melt with the same fries & slaw & loved it! 

For dessert we splurged and went with the Sourdough Bread Pudding. Its served hot. Surprisingly the Sourdough bread had a nice  sweetness at the end, which was very different. 

Great service, topped with scrumptious food in a well designed & casual environment.

Overall, this nautical- theme restaurant was a great spot and truly satisfying. Just not a great neighborhood, and parking can be tricky.
author: Janet T.

description:
*** 3.5 STARS ***

I thought Woodhouse Fish Co. was pretty good, but not worthy of 4 stars. Maybe it was just what I ordered? I would probably give it another shot the next time I go to SF though. 

// FOOD //
Clam chowder: The clam chowder here had the right creamy texture and nice chunks of potato and clams, but it lacked flavor. I had to add salt, black pepper and tabasco to it and it still wasn't enough. I would definitely skip the clam chowder the next time I come here. 

Baja-style fish tacos: Crispy battered cod with cabbage, chipotle aioli, pico de gallo and avocado. The fish was nice and crispy, but it also lacked a lot of flavor. It would have been so much better if they had a salsa that had a little kick to it. 

Overall, I was slightly disappointed with the food here at Woodhouse Fish Co. They have pretty good reviews so I would definitely come back and give this place another shot.
author: Ryan W.

description:
Best lobster roll in the bay.
(Where else I tried - http://www.tiantianeats.com/tiantian-ranks-lobster-roll-sf-bay/)

Woodhouse is one of my favorite spots to bring tourist friends who care less for the signaturely authentic-within-america asian cuisines in the Bay Area if they just came straight from actual asia.

I typically take my tourists to Fisherman's Wharf for the touristy experience, but Woodhouse for much less touristy food.

Must Get:
-Lobster roll, best lobster roll I've had in the Bay and most comparable to New England standards, adequately seasoned generous chunks of lobster flown from Maine in warm buttered toast
-Clam chowder, delicious with good amount chunks of clam, my top spot for traditional clam chowder (aside from Hog Island for a fancier version)
-Grilled squid, usually on the specials board, great texture and flavors without tasting burnt, on a bed of some of the best sauteed spinach I've had
-Lobster pappardelle, very fresh and lightly-sweet pasta with fresh pesto and lobster, pleasantly surprised by how well-put-together this dish is compared to the cream-loaded-olive-garden-generic-pasta-with-dollop-of-lobster I was expecting

Good:
-Sourdough bread pudding
-Dungeness crab roll

Pass:
-Shrimp and corn fritters, too salty
-Stuffed artichokes, very predictable and too heavy on the sauces and/or cheese

Drinks:
-Simple but good selection of adult beverages
-Cute DIY arnold palmer with deconstructed ingredients

Service:
-Good, never had a problem
author: Tian Q.

description:
I am all for high quality food being priced  as such. But while the lobster roll here was pretty good, it took overpriced to a whole new level!

My friend is super in love with all things lobster so naturally I suggested we split a large order of the lobster roll ($26). 

While I didn't expect it to be ginormous in size, we were both a bit surprised at just how small a large order was when brought out. The whole roll was smaller than my hand and I have the world's tiniest hands! But while the actual bread roll was small, they definitely did not skimp on the lobster, as there were huge lobster chunks literally spilling off the bread roll. Which is strange cause how much more could it possibly cost to just use bigger bread rolls?! 

The roll also came with some french fries (average, typical fries) and a small bit of cole slaw. We did enjoy the lobster chunks on our lobster roll and thought the lobster was really fresh, but just could not get over the sizing of the bread roll.

If you are craving a lobster roll, this did a solid job, but for me, it just wasn't worth the $30 price-tag for a less than filling portion size.
author: Jingxi Z.

description: My favorite place to go to for a crab roll and the do-it-yourself lemonade is to die for! Words cant explain how good this place is! Ive recommended it to a couple of friends and they can agree that this place has the best food!!
author: Emina M.

description:
-Food: the lobster roll is delicious, and generous I portion. The side salad is also fresh and tasty. Food is served very quickly. 
-Service: very attentive.

-Downsides:
-I asked to change the French fries for onion rings, but the waitress didn't tell me that it costed extra money. And the onion rings didn't taste good. 
-the lobster meat was too cold, which I guess was taken out of the refrigerator, and maybe that's why they made it so quickly.
author: Yuqun F.

description:
I actually loved my experience here which means I recommend this place for you. 

I felt like I ate so shellfishly when I was here. So much seafood, and I am no doubt a seafood lover. Mmm. The raw oysters were no doubt the highlight of my shellfish night. My waitress was really helpful when it came to ordering these little pearls. There were three types: Point Reyes, Kumamoto, and some other type that costed $1.50 extra. I enjoyed the Kumamoto oyster because it was more creamy than the other. The Point Reyes, however, was subtly on the sweeter and juicier end. Both were fresh and that's all I can say. So EAT THE OYSTERS haha. 

Well every other choices that my fam and I ordered were delicious also. We got the Cioppino, Trout, Crab Cakes, and Fried Calamari. All were great, so I'm guessing you can't really go wrong with any of their options. 

If you're a drinker and want to order some beer, my dad really enjoyed the IPA. If you're uncertain about what drink is for you, you can ask the waiters and they'll bring you a tiny sample! Great service right? I really do recommend this place. The atmosphere is very calm even when it's crowded af in there. The decorations are serious on point. Love it just love everything about it. COME.
author: Wendy T.

description: This place never lets me down! Had the fish tacos and they were delicious. I also think that the service here is great. Our waiter was friendly, knowledgeable, and respectful. We had a great lunch! The only thing that makes me sad about this place is the no reservations! I will definitely be back.
author: Makenzi B.

description:
We were wandering around the city, mad craving some clam chowder. I did a quick yelp search, and this place came up. All of us really wanted creamy new england clam chowder and not the buttery broth variety, and Woodhouse definitely offers it. This place is really small and cozy (probably only seats 30-35), and we had a table of 6 people, so we had to wait 1.5 hours to get a seat. I liked that they took down my phone number so that they could text me when our table was ready. We took the opportunity to wander around Japantown and take some sticker pictures to kill some time. So, I'd recommend to either call ahead or go with a small party.

I ordered a cup of NE clam chowder and a small lobster roll. They also have a large lobster roll, which is the same sized roll with double meat. The clam chowder was absolutely delicious!! It was creamy, rich, and flavorful, and it came with a ton of clam. I really wish I had ordered a full bowl instead. The lobster roll, in my opinion, was just ok. The bread was great--buttery, perfectly toasted. The lobster itself didn't wow me in flavor or texture. But overall, I really enjoyed the feel of the restaurant, and I'll be back for the chowder eventually!
author: Stacy Y.

description: The only place I know that serves the belly and strip fried soft shell clams outside of Cape Cod and the east coast.  Disappointed in a small portion on the clam platter.  Cole slaw was extra. Seemed a bit miserly.
author: Kathryn S.

description: Really love the quality of the food. They don't cut corners, even the side salads are fresh and quality ingredients. I get the crab cakes, fish tacos, and fish and chips. All so good. The only downside is it's always too crowded and way too noisy.
author: James L.

description:
I've had this bookmarked for years now and finally got the chance to try it out. I'm a huge fan of lobster rolls and always try to find a restaurant that serves this wherever I go. 

I ordered their 3oz lobster roll with fries and coleslaw (4/5).
The bread is extremely buttey and tastes pretty amazing. That was probably the best part of the sandwich. The lobster itself is covered in mayo and mixed with green onions and celery. I'm actually not a huge fan of celery so I wish I knew that in advance, but my review won't reflect my bias hatred towards celery.

Woodhouse gives you a pretty proportional amount of lobster to your bread serving so you definitely get lobster with every bite. I personally wish the sandwich was a bit larger considering that it was already over $20. I know they have a "large" option to double the amount of lobster, but I think it's too pricey ($30+), and doesn't reflect on the rest of the sandwich, meaning the bread (same size).

The fries were super crispy and still warm even though I didn't touch them until I finished my sandwich. So that's a plus!

Overall, I was still extremely satisfied with my sandwich, just wish it was larger!
author: Joanne Y.

description: OMG!! This place is over the top. I went with my family for the first time and we loved the food here. Everything was delicious! Great seafood place with lots on the menu. My dad had the Cioppino -- amazing .... need I say more?  My sister, who is quite picky, was able to get a salad with her exact pickings: tomato, onion, half lobster, half shrimp, many sides of delicious dressing. I would absolutely hands down recommend eating at this golden hide away. Will be back.
author: J V.

description: Great post movie spot to eat. The menu is simple so easy to figure out what you want. I also liked that they had daily specials, even though I didn't order one. I had the clam chowder manhattan style which was great. There were large chunks of clams and it was pipping hot!! I them opted for the Crab Louie salad, which was amazing. I opted for the non Louie dressing which was great.
author: Korynne B.

description:
The cioppino and lobster roll were amazing!
I definitely am coming back soon!
author: Lamia R.

description:
I absolutely loved their lobster roll!  It wasn't too rich or heavy, but still had the perfect amount of flavor!  It's a bit pricy, starting at $19 for a small and $27 for a large, but it's worth it.  

Their clam chowder is a must also! A cup is $7 and a large is $10.  It's creamy, flavorful, and filled with just the right amount of clams.
author: Marissa D.

description: This restaurant makes great food but everything is dirty....salt&pepper shakers, Tabasco bottles were downright grimy....bathroom (YUCK) & floor.....this stuff matters folks, I probably won't be back, if this is what u see as a customer, makes me wonder how clean it looks in the kitchen
author: Deidre R.

description: $35 each for LOBSTER ROLL or CRAB ROLL both delicious and recommend.  I recommend CRAB ROLL over the LOBSTER because of the buttery, crispy bread and overall is more delicious.  The give an abundant amount of meat but there are definitely a good amount fries and coleslaw to fill you up.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Good beer, good food, good value. Good start in SAN Francisco:)
We had too wait 10 min = lot's Of visitors = good place.
God öl, god mat och prisvärt. 
Vi fick vänta pga många besökare = bra ställe.
Bra start på vårt besök här i SAN Francisco
author: Anders G.

description: Best hole in the wall place ever! Decided I wanted some good seafood, and found this place via Yelp. Absolutely amazing, and delicious. Ordered the clam chowder as well as the crab stuffed artichoke. Ended up leaving with a doggie bag and everyone was asking me what I had because it smelled so good. Wish there was a location in Dallas!
author: Kim A.

description: I had a cup of clam chowder and the lobster roll. The soup was too heavy, I think it had too much cream. The lobster roll was really good. Since I lived in Maine years ago, I can tell when a lobster roll is really good and when is not. I will come back to try other dishes.
author: Diego R.

description:
Great shellfish at Woodhouse. They've got a simple menu with the classic seafood options - chowder, mussels, crab, etc. Most people come on Tuesdays for the $1 oysters. I don't like lines, so I've only been here for lunch. 
The space is bright and refreshing with a seaside theme. The panoramic painting of a beach above the bench really brightens up the venue. The framed flat screen tv displays scenes of the pier on a loop, a very nice touch. There is a bar area towards the back of the restaurant. The rest of the decor has some knick knacks here and there, but not done in an overwhelming cheesy way like some seafood places.

Split-Top Maine Lobster Roll - $22 for 3 oz., $36 for 6 oz. lobster meat, same-sized roll:
It's a little pricey for a lobster roll, but not an egregiously high price. Most lobster rolls have about 3-3.5 ounces of lobster meat and average a little under $20 (depending on location, seasonality, and the type of restaurant). I wouldn't have cared had I not noticed it is quite a jump (~20-30%) from just the past year. 
Anyways, the lobster is richly dressed Maine style with mayo and scallions & celery. It looks like a lot of tender claw meat, but once I turned the roll to the side, I saw that most of the meat was lying on top of the sandwich and didn't sit too well in the thin roll. The roll was buttery and toasted to a golden brown crunch while still soft inside. Mr. Joy would have preferred it without celery and Connecticut style with butter instead of mayo, but it was still an excellent Maine lobster roll. It also comes with fries, slaw, and a lemon wedge.

They change up the pasta options every so often. The one I tried last was their Dungeness Crab & Uni Linguine. It was topped with a good amount of shredded crab. Some uni was interspersed throughout the linguine. The white wine sauce was buttery and creamy, but not too thick and heavy. The bacon bits added some smokey, salty flavor, while the chives and lemon wedge brightened up the dish. 

I'd like to try their cioppino next time. The server we had was very friendly and outgoing. Maybe one day I'll make it down on a Tuesday if I get here early enough to beat the crowd, since they don't take reservations.
author: Joy W.

description: Ate here for the first time tonight. I had the crab Louie salad and my son had the fish tacos. We shared some crab cakes. All the food was excellent. The service was great. The do-it-yourself lemonade was so cool and tasty! The only thing missing was some good sourdough French bread which should have just come with the table.
author: Steve M.

description:
Came here on a Sunday right when it opened. And it got packed within 10 minutes. So get here early if you don't want to wait.

Service was average. Once we got our meal, no one came to check on us or anything.

We ordered a lobster sandwich , fried clam sandwich and Manhattan tomato chowder. The lobster sandwich was a disappointment, wasn't as good as I expected. What I liked alot was the fried clam sandwich. Super delicious pairing with the soft bread. The Manhattan tomato chowder tasted like it came out of a can.

Overall, the only thing I would come back for is the Fried clam sandwich. Thinking about it got me drooling
author: Ronny Y.

description: Take out was good. Had the lobster roll,  and rolled over after such a tasty bite! Definitely will explore the rest of the menu, but next time I'll enjoy the experience in-house.
author: Fabiola V.

description:
Came here with my friends for my birthday and it was good!  We got seated right away (probably cause it was raining hard!!) and started to order.  There were 4 of us and we got 2 Large Lobster Rolls, 1 Small Lobster Roll, Fish Tacos, Fish and Chips, and Crab Cakes.  Yes, we love food!!

I'll start off with the lobster rolls, which are kind of pricey, but they're delicious!  The bread is so buttery and soft and there was SOOOO much lobster for the large.  The lobster wasn't overcooked and was pretty simple, but delicious.

I only had a couple bites of the crab cake, but you could definitely taste the crab in it, there wasn't too much "filler" ingredients.  The fish taco was basically the fish n chips, but in taco form and the fish seemed a bit smaller.  The fish was so crispy and they used a meaty fish that doesn't just fall apart right away.  But the fish was flaky too which was good!  

For the price, I probably wouldn't come back too often, but on special occasions!!
author: Jonathan W.

description: Amazing fish & chips, really good oysters (especially the BBQ ones) decent beer selection and generally good service across the board! The fried clams were delicious.
author: Milan S.

description:
Came here for an early dinner - there was no wait before 6pm and the staff were friendly. Looking around, everyone seemed to be ordering lobster rolls or the shrimp/crab stuffed artichoke entree. Ok, that'll do. We'll take those! 

My god, this was an amaaaaaazing lobster roll! The bread was buttery and toasted, the lobster was seasoned perfectly and the ratio of lobster to mayo was on point, the fries -- well, who doesn't like fries??? The artichoke entree, on the other hand, was "meh." In comparison to the roll, it was just okay. This is a pricey place to eat, but if you love lobster as much as I do, it will fulfill that lobster-shaped hole in your stomach and you will leave content.
author: Jane L.

description: Came here on a Sunday night at 7:30 with a party of 4. Wait was about 15 mins. The place isn't that big. We got lucky with parking but it seems like it would usually be a pain. We ordered the 3 oz lobster roll and clam chowder. They have 3 kinds of clam chowder. We asked to try the tomato based one and it was basically like tomato soup. Nothing like chowder. So we got the regular New England. It was very basic. None of us were impressed. We didn't get to try the third option which was a mix of the 2 but it probably would not have been amazing either. They don't do bread bowls here. The lobster roll was small and decent. The coleslaw it came with was tiny and ok. Fries were decent. It's a bit pricey. Especially for the lobster roll. If the food was amazing then we would not mind but it was mostly mediocre. I haven't tried too many chowders but hog island is a better alternative
author: Tim H.

description:
I've bookmarked this place for so long!! Finally got a chance to make it out to the Fillmo' (*the NICE part of Fillmore) this weekend. I didn't come here specifically since there's always a crowd everytime I walk by.. but it was 2 PM on a Saturday and there was only two of us. There were people standing outside (still) but I figured it wouldn't hurt to ask how long the wait time was. 10-15 minutes?! DEAL.

The place isn't too big, maybe 30-40 people? They keep it really clean and nice.. the interior and decor is reminiscent of someone's vacation by the beach - super cute! 

Service is really nice and food came surprisingly fast (like, 10 minutes after ordering!)

Opted for:
Cup of clam chowder ($7) - pretty good clam chowder: good, creamy consistency but kinda wish it had more clam flavor.

1/2 lobster roll ($18 - pictured) - HUGE, fresh pieces of lobster - thankfully they did not skimp!..... ate half of it in like, 3-4 bites (:x I hella devoured it)..... I like that they kept the mayo-sauce so you could still enjoy the lobster on its own.. but I think it could have used some pepper or something (hey, nothing you can't do yourself!). They used a toasted piece of white bread, which was a bit disappointing - if they used a high quality roll, it would have taken it to the next level. But really good nonetheless if you are a lobster lover :) Came with a heap of fries and coleslaw - which were just OK. If the fries were a taaaaad crispier, it would have been better.. Or hey, maybe it would have been better if I ordered a beer ;)

3-piece fish & chips ($15: 2 piece was $12) - the pieces of fish were HUGE!! I think one person would be fine with the 2 piece. The fish was fresh and the batter was light and crispy. Definitely among the best I've had in the city so far!

Would like to return someday for happy hour if I have a random Tuesday off.. and also to try their crab melt or clam roll :0!!
author: Emily C.

description:
This was my second time at Woodhouse Fish Co. First time was to try their lobster roll. OMGz. Yes. A bit of a splurge, but that's how lobster rolls typically, right? Ha ha. So yummy. 

Visit #2: wait wasn't too bad for two even though it was $1 oyster Tuesday evening. Highly recommended. I would have just come in and gotten two dozen for myself lol. I also decided to try one of the specials: pork belly and fried shrimp po boy. It was good, but for $19...I would pass. I would have rather spent a bit more for a more satisfying lobster roll. All in all, wait wasn't too bad 15-20 mins, our server was super nice/attentive, and we got our food fairly quickly. :)

Until next time, Woodhouse! Coming back for sure to turn up on another Tuesday :D
author: Mariel A.

description:
This was the place that capped off my recent San Francisco trip. I ate here for lunch. Thought, San Fran is so close to the ocean, might as well try out some seafood! I couldn't have made a better choice!

This place is located in a very cute part of town. Not very far from the downtown area. Lots of people walking around for other cafes and little shops. Fillmore street is like a little town inside of the city.

As you walk in you may notice that they are limited on space and it's quite intimate feel for the restaurant, but don't let that deter you away; there is plenty more space on the counter top area. That's where I sat. Great place because the servers don't have to come from behind they can place it nicely in front of you. The two things that I loved in the restaurant were the framed tv that shows stills of cool sea related things and from time to time will show a webcam shot of fishermen unloading crab. And two: the Picasso drawing of a fish. Awesome!

To start off I had the Big Eye IPA, which I highly recommend being that I am a big fan of IPAs. Love the bite of the drink. I ordered the fish and chips and my friend ordered the avocado roll shrimp sandwich. They are served on the classic red checkered paper. It was like a mix between a fancy restaurant and something you get on the warf. Everything tasted great. I'd highly recommend this place for a first date or even a second.
author: Andrew D.

description: I've been dying to try this place out when I heard about it. The restaurant itself is kind of small so f you want to get seats and not wait, I suggest coming nearly or making reservation/calling in. Parking around this area is also kind of difficult to find. I got the lobster roll and the clam chowder there. The clam chowder is decent. There wasn't that much stuff in the chowder itself and they didn't give you much. I had better but this was decent. I also ordered the lobster roll which was one of their popular items on the menu. When our food came out, the portions looked kind of small and I thought I be hungry still but it's actually really filling! The bread was sweet and nicely toasted and the crab mixed with sauce wasn't too heavy and super flavorful! Adding a lemon on it gave it much more flavor which I really liked as well. Only downside of this experience is the price but it's lobster so it makes sense. All in all, would come back.
author: Kelly N.

description: We had to wait about 30 minutes for our table on a Saturday evening which is better than what I expected. Their menu is not large but that is okay. The four of us were very satisfied with our selections.  The fish and chips were lightly battered and delicious. Stuff artichoke, seafood pasta and Ahi sandwich were just as good. Jen our server was on top of things and very pleasant. I'd go back again.
author: Teresa J.

description:
Was walking around in the area and was craving some seafood, we'll specifically lobster rolls.  Searched on Yelp and this place popped up with great reviews.

Service was good but the lobster roll was the the most bland thing I've ever ate.  The tastiest thing on my plate was the bread. Didn't try anything else here but was disappointed.
author: Yas J.

description:
I love seafood. Especially crab and lobster. January of last year, I decided to finally tackle my bookmark for Woodhouse Fish Company. Came by and grabbed some take out.

*Split top maine lobster roll ($18): served with fries and slaw
*Crab cakes ($12 for 2): crab meat cakes topped with spicy chipotle sauce and a side salad

I had a hard time deciding between the lobster roll and crab roll, so I decided getting the lobster roll and crab cakes was a good solution. The lobster was delicious! Sweet and tender. I could have gone without the fries though as they weren't that good after I got them home. The crab cakes however were great! Crispy with a good amount of crab. I was as happy as a clam with both the lobster and crab.

Now that it's crab season, I really need to come back and try the crab roll. I'm sure I'll be in shellfish heaven!
author: Elena N.

description:
This place is tiny. It has one shared/unisex bathroom in the back, which is dirty. 

The food: we both got the lobster roll with double lobster meat. It came out looking real skimpy, definitely not double lobster meat. It was definitely A-OK if you were in the area and craved a lobster roll, but I wouldn't come back if I had another choice. The cole slaw was also alright, nothing really was great about the food.
author: Lisa N.

description:
Came on Tuesday for the $1 oysters ! Came around 11:30am and there was no wait and found street parking nearby. The food was all very delicious and service was attentive. 

My boyfriend and I ordered the mahi mahi ceviche, clam chowder, small lobster roll, and the raw oysters. 

Clam chowder: standard clam chowder, was good but pricey as it was $7 for a small cup. 

Mahi mahi ceviche: eh it had sweet potatoes in it which was kind of weird, was lacking flavor and not worth for 13 bucks 

Raw oysters: definitely come for $1 oysters on Tuesday!! Super fresh and yummy oysters, was sweet and delicious definitely must order 

Lobster roll: bf loved this, bread was nice and buttered and lobster was not overloaded with mayo. Fries were really good as well !
author: Melinda C.

description: Service was good, although it's a tiny bit crowded inside. Ordered the clam chowder, which was tasty, and the pesto pasta dish they had. It was supposed to come with prawns but they were out, so I asked them to use crab instead. No upcharge and they loaded crab onto the plate.
author: JessLynn N.

description:
Pretty good crab cakes! I enjoyed my meal here. To be honest I came for the lobster roll but it was $36 for the large size roll. That's just crazy - I can get a steak at a great steakhouse for that much.

Nevertheless, it's a nice place and I'd come back.
author: Jen R.

description: Stopped in for lunch and had a great experience. I had the calamari starter and fish and chips lunch. Flaky, crispy and delicious. Generous portions. Great service. Everybody seems happy in here. They've got fun art on the wall. They framed a large screen TV with some big fat antique frame that makes it look like it's just a picture. But if you stare at it you begin to see it move. Very creative.
author: Greg G.

description:
The fiancé and I dropped by Woodhouse on the way home after the cinema, craving something buttery and delicious to bring back home with us. Initially, we had planned on eating there, but were a little turned off by the atmosphere (overly dim, loud dishes clattering in the kitchen, and a little cold feeling [not temperature-wise]), so to-go was our end result.

THE HIGHLIGHTS.
+ Delicious, buttery lobster rolls stuffed with the good stuff
+ Thick, creamy clam chowder (but be sure to add hot sauce!)
+ Friendly staff at the front of house
~ Bland French fries that honestly tasted frozen to me, but were maybe just under-salted?
~ Kind of a drab and loud environment to dine in, so I'd recommend against eating in person

I think I'd pass on returning as it's a bit out of the way for me just to get take-out each time, but it's a good (albeit pricey) meal if you're in the area.
author: Claire S.

description:
I've been meaning to try this place because I heard such great raves about it but it was sadly a disappointment.

The clam chowder was way to garlicky. Does anyone else have this problem? It was the end of the night so I might've gotten just the last bit of the pot where all the garlic was simmering away at.

I decided to get a dungeness crab roll instead of the popular lobster roll because I've been obsessed with dungeness crab rolls, and that lacked flavor. My friend that I also went with told me the last time she went here, her lobster roll lacked flavor as well. 

If you want to try a real good dungeness crab roll, try Mission Rock Resort. They don't have lobster rolls though, but their crab rolls are off the chart! That way you can also enjoy a great view :)

I would come back to Woodhouse though, but this time... for their $1 Tuesday oysters.
author: K B.

description: Super amazing lobster roll! Everything was perfect! I've never had a lobster roll before and this was a perfect first-time experience. We also ordered blue point, they were HUGE! It was so good. Definitely hit this place up for a good lobster roll and some oysters.
author: Victoria C.

description: Clam Chowder was pretty good. Had the lobster and squash ravioli which was a complete fail.  They should have said that the lobster was just two bits rather then in the ravioli.  The ravioli was a bit hard and overly sweet. Also tried the swordfish special, it was just ok.
author: Deborah H.

description:
So far the best lobster roll I have in san francisco!

Foods: 5 stars

Lobster Roll : Must try item! Lobster is fresh and seasoning with mayo. Serves with small cole slaw and fries on the side, can choose garlic bread/salad/onion ring instead of fries. 

Half Half clam chowder: Another must try item. Only available on Fillmore st. Half clam chowder with half tomato manhattan. Bowl size is like 2.5 cup, good to share.

Cioppino: Have crab, shrimp , clam , mussels and fish and serve with two garlic bread. Cioppino is ok but the bread is really food
 
Serives: 5 stars
We order a large clam chowder, 2 lobster roll and Cioppine for 3 ppl to share. We told the waiter that we're doing family style, the lobster roll was cut in half already when they serve it.
 
Waiting & Parking: NO reservation, recommend to arrive early to avoid the line. 11-12pm for lunch, 5-6:30 for dinner, if you don't want to wait. Only street parking is available, easy to find parking before 12pm if you go there for lunch. 

中文的食評：https://www.facebook.com/kamhc.cookbook
author: Ada C.

description: The lobster rolls are delicious ... the roll is lightly toasted and super soft.  The small is $23 .. comes  w a side of fries.  A little pricey ... but it was good.   The trio of tacos w avocado cole slaw was better than the lobster roll.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
First time here, and my wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our meals. We kept it simple:

Crispy Calamari to start. DELICIOUS! I consider myself a calamari snob, and this was some of the best I've ever eaten. My wife agrees. Sweet mama, I could have eaten two plates all by myself. 

For mains, we shared two crab cakes and a whole, hot Dungeness crab with butter. The cakes were delicious -- and the somewhat spicy chipotle sauce was a great addition. The Dingeness crab was great, as well. Perfectly steamed, and nothing to cover-up the flavor of the crab -- except when we bathed the bites in melted butter, ha.

Service and staff were excellent and attentive. We would recommend this restaurant, and we'd go back for sure.
author: Maury M.

description:
I liked the food here. We had ahí tuna for appetizer, it was flavorful and fresh. The fish tacos are big and very tasty. And the fish and ships was awesome. 
I really liked the work of Art they have on the right wall (as you come in) I appreciate    the restaurant  even more bc management cares for the decor.  The art , the delicious food and the fast service made my dinner experience exceptional.
author: Coté M.

description: Fresh hot fish n chips, a tiny bit heavy on the batter but all good if you like that stuff. Very cool place. Some amazing foods. Friendly wait staff.
author: FastFijian S.

description: If you're out in the city near Filmore, you're going to definitely want to check out this place. It's a very spacious & simplistic resto that's near some shopping boutiques. Downside is the street parking! But, their food makes up for it. Whenever I'm craving for a lobster roll this is my go to place. It's a bit expensive, but if you're a foodie like me you spend a little more on food. Oh, and def. try their daily specials!
author: Gerlie P.

description:
Wow great service - great food
Very clean 
Seated very fast 
Friendly staff - 
A must stop if your looking for some great food
author: Philip C.

description: This is a go-to neighborhood place for my fiancé and I. The crab roll is soo good and buttery. The French fries kind of seem like an afterthought but the seafood is their focus so it's ok with me. On my last visit I tried the stuffed artichoke. Such a yummy/semi-healthy choice for a lighter dinner. My fiancé always enjoys the fish and chips. Next visit I am going to have to splurge a little and try the chippino. Over all a great place for a chilly, foggy, SF evening.
author: Emily S.

description: Came by on Friday night and lucked into a seat at the little bar in back next to the open kitchen.  My friendly server filled me in on the special, a fried shrimp and pork belly po'boy.  Of course I said yes.  Definitely a good choice!  Crisp well-done fries, great lobster-roll type roll on the po'boy, piping hot juicy fried morsels of pork belly and fried shrimp, and a wonderfully cold beer to wash it down.  I definitely need to come back and try more off the menu, unless the specials keep hooking me!
author: Larry C.

description: I haven't tried anything else other than Cioppino in this restaurant. Therefore, this review is just regarding the Cioppino and the beer selection. Well, even on a busy night, service ran very efficiently. The Cioppino had a very deep broth and flavor with plentiful mussels, cod, shrimp, clams and so forth, which I really liked. The beer recommendation by the waitress was also fantastic. I would go to this place again when I am visiting SF again.
author: Dan K.

description:
Tonight my lady and her friend dined at this fine restaurant. This place is small (as are most places in SF) but the ambiance is great. This place is known for quite a few dishes. So the three of us decided to try three very flavorful dishes; the mussels, the large lobster role and the crab cakes. 

The mussels were awesome. They came in a bath of buttery garlic white sauce that was loaded with tons of flavor. They also came with some garlicky-cheesy bread that just soaks up all that sauce and it's flippin' crazy delicious. 

The lobster role did not disappoint. It was not and I repeat NOT over mayonnaise'd. It was just right mix of creamy goodness. The role was toasted to perfect and it was crispy yet soft. It came with fries that were ok but still good. 

The crab cakes were super moist and had a delectable crunch on the outside. The spices use to create these were awesome. They were not greasy at all. So they paired nicely with the salad that it comes with. 

I definitely recommend this little place. It's packed with flavor and character and you won't be disappointed. 

Mahalo!
author: Gil L.

description: Simply the best lobster roll I have ever had!! Hands down!! It's a must!!! Make sure you get there early.. cause you will have to wait other wise... but still make sure your wait!!
author: Mike W.

description:
This was my second visit.
At my first dinner, I enjoyed the Fish and Chips along with $1 Oysters on Tuesdays.
It was a great meal and fair value.

This time, I tried the Lobster Roll and Cioppino.

The Cioppino was delicious, filled with an assortment of fish, clams, mussels, shrimp and scallops.  I would recommend this if you're looking for a full meal.

The Lobster Roll was bland and had no flavor.   Plenty of huge chunks of lobster were loaded in the bread, yet with each bite, I asked myself, would I eat this again?  It definitely needs something...
author: Andrew H.

description: I come to woodhouse basically every Tuesday for lunch. It's generally not crowded which is AHMAZING. They have $1 oysters all day on Tuesdays so I order as many oysters as I can eat in one sitting. And then split the steamed littleneck clams or the stuffed artichoke with my lunch date. i LOVEEEEEEE both.
author: Bianca W.

description: Just walked off the street and sat down.  Quick service.  Great atmosphere..  The crab sandwich was great.
author: Troy H.

description: Another cute small place to enjoy some fresh seafood. Put your name down and stroll along looking through the shops while you wait. They will text you when your table is ready. Calamari and chowder were my favorite.
author: Christa B.

description: Food is good but service awful. We waited over 45mns for a table for 2 when they had two tables ready. Worst experience ever. And the host was very rude. Told us getting us sited fast wasn't her problem. What a sense of entitlement. It's not because the food is good that you can talk to your customers that way. Keep it going and people will stop coming.
author: Marion B.

description:
LOBSTER ROLLS!

Parking: Not the easiest to find, we were able to find some on the street a few blocks down which seemed like an eternity when walking down several blocks.

WAIT: It was a Saturday night around 7pm but we only had to wait about 10 minutes before getting seated.

ATMOSPHERE: It's pretty small inside so I could see how it would get crowded.  The wait area is TINY so hope you don't get one of the tables near the front because it'll seem like you are right next to those people.  The inside reminded me of a restaurant I would find in Boston with low lighting, nautical and seafood themed decor, high and low wooden tables and a semi-open kitchen.

FOOD: Get the lobster roll.  The larger portion has the same bread, just more lobster so I'm not sure it's worth it.  It comes with fries on the side or you can sub for the beet salad but the fries were really good.

The lobster roll was perfectly sized for me to finish it all.  A good amount of lobster, fresh and not too buttery or mayo tasting.  The bun was toasted on the edges and had a great fresh but slightly crispy taste.  The fries were also thin cut shoe string with a slight crisp on the outside. mmm..., definitely wasn't disappointed with this place.

It also comes with a little bit of cole slaw on the side, which was had a little too much mayo for my liking.

Overall, for what you pay an the quality/amount you get it's worth coming.
author: Brittany T.

description:
3 stars because it was good and not bad. 

Good
- Decor: 5/5 - Loved the decor of the restaurant!  Very nautical themed with a giant squid in the front, giant swordfish in the back, video of the bay as if you're in a boat, poster of oysters in the restroom, etc.
- Clam Chowder - 5/5 - YUM! Extremely creamy and delicious, I was quite impressed.  This is a must get.
- Oysters - 4/5 - kumamoto ($3), blue points, and henderson ($2). Bit salty, add the sauce 
- Location - 4/5 - def like the location! Located in Fillmore street where there is just so much to see/do.  Walk around before or after your meal!

Bad
- Lobster roll: 3/5 - It was okay....did not taste fresh, had too much mayo sauce, I hate celery, and it was so expensive.  The picture I attached was $27!! You can get it for $18 for less lobster, but holy crap.  That was $27?  And it wasn't even the best lobster roll I've had, which was at New England Lobster Market in Burlingame: http://www.yelp.com/biz/new-england-lobster-market-and-eatery-burlingame?hrid=qryDNXZZ1zDVM7U7adLXDA

Overall
Yes the decor was cute and the clam chowder was amazing, but the lobster roll was the main entree and unfortunately it did not impress me.  But if you like mayo and celery, then maybe it would impress you!
author: Raquel Y.

description: It was a long time coming here to eat for dinner. It's busy but the food was great.  I enjoyed my Seafood stew.
author: Jboogie L.

description: We walked by with our dog during lunch and ordered fish and chips to go.  Best fish and chips ever!  So good.  The hostess was really nice and helpful.  She took our order and brought it outside to us.  They even package oysters to go (which we had one).  Everything was packaged really nicely to go with liners and leak proof containers.  Nice thick napkins too.
author: Stan H.

description:
It's really hard to find a reasonably priced lobster or crab roll in San Francisco. Most of the time it's a super expensive and not particularly fresh. 
Woodhouse is a cool little spot in a great neighborhood serving up awesome food. 
The lobster roll is super good and priced fairly at $19.
author: Sam A.

description:
A solid spot to hit that seafood craving--but be wary it can get prettyyyy pricey for the portions if you're trying to go for the lobster roll. 

They have two options for the lobster roll, $19 for the regular and $27 for double the meat. Honestly I recommend sticking with the regular because there's a decent amount of meat that comes with the very buttery roll and fries. Instead, order a small side of clam chowder--it won't blow you out of the water, but I love dipping the lobster roll in the chowder

And to top it off, the fries have always been piping hot and fresh. A good way to satisfy that American classics craving
author: Jay P.

description: Jesus the best food I've had on my trip!!! The lobster sub is amazing HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!! I've had a lot of seafood and love it!!! Def a picky person when it comes to seafood and this is def a place I will come back to when I return San Fran!!!! love The clam chowder soup!!
author: Vanessa V.

description:
I love the ambiance at this shop.  It's intimate enough w/out being claustrophobic.  

My favorite items on the menu are the lobster rolls and the grilled squid kale salad.   Lobster rolls had plenty of lobster on delicious buns and it comes with yummy thin fries.  The squid kale salad was very refreshing on warm summer day.  The deep fried clams were delicious also.  The cioppino was decent but I still prefer Anchor's over Woodhouse. 

Very good service.  Do make a reservation.
author: Kris H.

description: Stumbled across this great place after a long day. Food was wonderful-try the stuffed, grilled artichoke with crab and bay shrimp. Salad with fresh beets was refreshing and high quality. The service was fantastic and friendly. Went early on a Monday evening so not busy. Their lemonade is uniquely made and yummy! Definitely going back!
author: C. W.

description: Lovely lunch of clam chowder (delicious) and Dungeness crab (double delicious!!) with Do-it-Yourself Arnold Palmer.  After a day of sightseeing, this local restaurant was perfect.  Great and friendly staff with lots of fresh seafood options.  Will definitely be back.
author: Tina L.

description:
Very very good, excellent lobster sandwich, calamari is also excellent and so is the fresh oyster, Tuesday is the best day to go for fresh oyster because they do a$1.00 oysters on Tuesday 

I only disadvantage is parking and they also get crowded so you need to get there early otherwise you'll have to wait in line, NO RESERVATIONS
author: Marie R.

description:
After hanging around Fishermans Wharf for a few hours, we were craving some awesome seafood, but did not want to dine anywhere touristy related. Using my trusty Yelp app, I typed in lobster rolls and found Woodhouse with a rating of just about 5 stars. After reading a couple of reviews, we were sold and proceeded to Pacific Heights. Before even entering the restaurant, we fell in love with the neighborhood and the awesome boutiques....if only I could afford to live here...NOT, but I can afford to dine and Wood house was every bit worth the ratings.
We arrived on a Thursday around 7pm and was promptly greeted by the hostess with the mostest and we were lucky enough to get seated at a high top table right away. Sarah was our waitress and she was fantastic!! Loved her! We ordered the barbecued grilled oysters, lobster roll, dungeness crab roll, and fish and chips. I am not a fan of raw oysters, but my interest was piqued when I read their take on oysters and damn, they were delish! The rolls and fish and chips were equally as good and if I am ever in the area again, I will make a point to come back.
author: Quin T.

description: We had a great lunch there! Shared the calamari, crab sandwich and a wedge salad. All really good. I loved that this was some quality seafood in a cute cozy setting that was perfect for a lunch drop-in but not stuffy at all. All of their daily specials looked pretty great, too. Right on the Filmore shopping strip so lots to wander around and see if you have to wait for a table or need to walk off some fried seafood!
author: Charlie B.

description: Cute little spot near Pacific Heights. Doesn't take reservations but its worth the wait. The seafood in the Ciappino was super fresh and tasted amazing!
author: Alyssa K.

description:
If you like lobster rolls, wait if you like fresh seafood you will love this spot! We had an amazing lunch full of fresh oysters, one of the best lobster rolls we've ever had and great wine.

Can't wait to go back and try the Toasted Buttered Dungeness Crab roll, the Fried Ipswich Clam Roll, Stuffed Artichoke, and the Cioppino. 

For real goodness.
author: Dottie A.

description:
OF COURSE you'll need to try their lobster roll- huge chunks that are proportionate to the buttered thick toast that surrounds it. BUT the fish and chips deserves some love too! My bf got it and I almost wanted to trade plates with him.
Their Arnold Palmer is DIY which I pretty neat. They give u lemon juice, tea and simple sugar and let you pour to your own liking, but even will all the simple sugar dumped into my drink it was still a bit sour! Next time I visit I'll probably ask for more sugar.
author: Amelia C.

description:
The food is alright, not a definite must try, but if you're feeling a little adventurous and have some money to spare then check it out.

I've been here a couple times, the fish tacos are pretty good. Had the pleasure of trying the lobster rolls the other day, and it was good. Although the lobster was seemingly fresh, I felt like something was still missing from my roll... It was definitely missing that "WOW" factor. I would say the lobster roll was not particularly TO DIE FOR, and nothing I would drive to SF for.

Overall, food was good and the service was great, but not really my cup of tea.
author: Yannie S.

description:
My bf took me here for my birthday on a Sunday evening (around 6:30ish) knowing that I love seafood.

The restaurant is on the smaller side, so if you have a big group, this is not a good spot! There were some seating at the bar area but we wanted to get a table so we had to wait for 15 minutes. It was our first time here but it looks like this place is quite a favorite spot as the line kept growing even when we were already seated.

Most tables seem to order the grill artichokes stuffed with crab and shrimp plate...so I opted to order it for my dinner. The Bf ordered 3 pieces fish and chips.

The order came out a bit slow but the waiter did alert us as I placed my grill artichokes order.

My plate came with a side salad, two pieces of garlic bread and a medium/large artichoke split into two halves. They put about 1 table spoon of crab meat on one half and one table spoon of small size shrimp on the other half... 

They seasoned the artichokes with some butter and garlic ...I like the flavor but it was probably not something that I would order again as it wasn't cheap ($19) and there weren't a lot of seafood on the plate....

BF's fish and chips were greasy and the batter was pretty thick. I also didn't care for the fish that they used (I think cod) as it didn't have much flavor to it.

Overall... it was just an ok restaurant and there are certainly better seafood places with more extensive menu and comparable price range in SF.
author: Yun C.

description: Got here just before the rush.  I've been wanting to try this place for quite some time and I'm glad I finally did.  Ordered the fried calamari appetizer which was really tasty and very tender. My daughter had the crab louie...nice pieces of crab leg  with a generous amount of crab. I ordered the fried shrimp and pork belly po boy...delicious...served with fries and coleslaw. No disappointment here! Everything tasted fresh.  Looking forward to going back and trying the shrimp cocktail and clam chowder. Service was good.
author: Kathleen F.

description: Service was very friendly and unobtrusive. Food was good, but not spectacular. The raw oysters were fresh. The chowders (both styles) were both good, but the taste of the New England Clam Chowder was more spot on. The fish and chips is good if you're set on getting fried food, the batter on the fish was perfectly textured. The artichoke entrée was a little strange to eat, it almost seemed like they just threw a bunch of random things on the plate. The artichoke was hot but the bay shrimp and shredded crab, lumped separately on top of each half of the artichoke, was cold. There was a salad underneath the artichoke, which was good, but just didn't make much sense underneath. Still, I'd definitely return for the clam chowder and I want to try the cioppino.
author: Alex D.

description:
1st time at this location (have been to their market street location before) - still super delicious!  on a random tuesday the wait for 2 was 15 minutes - not bad at all.  the restaurant is very cozy and tables are pretty close together, but we snatched a prime spot. celebrating my friend's birthday early - i brought a nice bottle of chardonnay from grigich - perfect because corkage is only $15 - so reasonable! service is fast and friendly, but they forgot my order for 6 oysters - not a huge deal because we werent really feeling like oysters anyway but were pressured since it was tuesday and theyre only $1 each!

we proceeded to order - fried ipswich clams, seafood pasta for my friend, and i had the smaller lobster roll (was tempted to get the 6 ounce, but it was only a tuesday and didnt want to go overboard!).  everything was delicious as expected - the pasta was super duper creamy - so luxe! haha definitely treat yourself here and dont worry about the carbs (i ate my entire brioche for the lobstah). still my fave lobster roll of all time - but next time (and next and next) i will be getting the larger 6 ounce!
author: Christina L.

description:
Best place ever on Fillmore for dinner hands down, but it still doesn't compare to the oyster depot down at the castro. I was a little disappointed in the greasiness of the ciopianno and the portion size of the bread that came along with it. 

Pasta was fresh and oysters were definitely on point.
author: Eleana H.

description: The best fish and chips I've had in The City! The cod is plentiful and moist, the batter is so light and flaky it literally shatters when you bite into it, and it's served with salty hot fries and perfectly dressed slaw. I wash it down with an Anchor Steam and I'm content for the afternoon.
author: Doug V.

description: This restaurant is very small and the wait time is pretty long but I see why!  I had the crab cakes and it was delicious.  It is more on the pricer side and their menu is limited but if you're into seafood and oysters then this is the place for you.  They were busy but the customer service wasn't bad but as I mentioned, you will have to wait awhile for a seat inside here since it is small.
author: Mikayla M.

description:
This place has been on my bookmarks for a really long time and i've been dying to try their lobster roll. 

The wait wasn't bad on the Thursday night around 7pm. 10 minutes for a party of 4. Make sure your entire party is present or they won't seat you. 

We sat down and ordered the following:

Chowder - i didn't have any, but my friend said it was the best chowder she's ever had.

Lobster roll - i wasn't a fan of this. the 3oz is actually pretty small. i wish i opted for the bigger size. also, there isn't a "naked" lobster roll option, so this one was drenched in mayo and celery....

Crab roll - i liked this one a lot better than the lobster. i would recommend this over the lobster roll for those who like the "naked" fill of their seafood.

Fries - just fries. pretty good, nothing special.

I really liked the atmosphere and the location though. there are a few bars nearby to go to after.
author: Andy H.

description:
Come here for oysters but nothing else. 

The sauce on the tuna tartare was overly greasy and the dish was way over priced for the size of the serving. The cod in the fried fish tacos was over breaded and the fried exterior overpowered the bland flavors of the rest of the taco. The petite shrimp and avocado sandwich used far too much mayonnaise, probably to overcompensate for its lack of flavor.   

They serve their white and rose wines in a cup, not a wine glass, which causes it to warm up as you drink it. When I complained to my waitress that I would like a wine glass, she said she could bring me ice. WTF?!
author: K T.

description:
Came here as a lunch date with my bf. Got there lucky with no wait needed :D

 I got 3 raw oysters to start and was yummy. Add the sauce, sprinkle some pepper, and use the lemons provided. 

Our dishes order were 3 crab cakes and the Dungeness Crab Melt sandwich. Waiters were prompt and we got the food pretty fast. 

I do want to return for more oysters!
author: Corie L.

description: Skip the line at Swan, and come here! Excellent, freshly sourced seafood at a great price. The Mrs. and I had a variety of their fresh oysters, the grilled artichoke dish, and the shrimp salad -- all were excellent. The service was awesome--prompt, polite, and persistence with full glasses of wine! Locals and tourists alike NEED to come here and enjoy what Woodhouse is bringing to the table!
author: Aaron W.

description: Small place. Amazing food. Wine selection could be expanded, but the food is ridiculous. Oysters, clam chowder, and seafood artichoke are all top notch.
author: S D.

description:
The lobster roll. Oh the lobster roll.

Served Maine-style, cold and dressed in a mayo-lemon dressing and packed into a butter-grilled brioche bun. This thing is worth the $35. The clam chowder was strong and generously loaded with meat and the oysters were the best money can buy (Connecticut Blue Point and Point Reyes).

Few things are as good as getting classic seafood right. Woodhouse Fish Co. hits the mark. They destroy the mark. They kill the mark.

Don't forget your pocket book ;)
author: Grayson K.

description:
Can we talk? - This review is in honor of Joan Rivers

Just needed someplace casual to go for Friday early dinner.  The place can get busy and parking can be very difficult.  We got there at 5:30 and sat at a nice window table as the place was 25% full.  By 6pm people had to submit their names and wait.  Any party larger than 4 is going to have to split up in this small location.  We later saw a group of 9 split between a table top and counter seating.

Be sure to always check the specials board. As it is close to the end of soft shell crab season, I went with the soft shell crab BLT over the Pork Belly & Oyster Po-Boy off the specials menu.  My gal went with the Dungeoness Crab Sandwich.  The entrees are all served with slaw and garlic fries.  The fries are not too garlicky. 

Although I did not get them this time, the onion rings and the fish and chips are great options especially for those with kids.  Oh I went with my standard Arnold Palmer which is also fun because they let you pour in the sugar to make it just right for you.   Its like a fun chemistry kit.  Also great for the kids!

I should mention that I do usually come for the signature lobster roll and its buttery goodness, but told myself I could get that any day!  I was also told that the Po Boy might get added to the full menu as it is popular.  

Food came out fast and service was friendly.  The soft shell crab was excellent.  I almost forgot about the bacon which as we all know- everything tastes better with bacon!! I will definitely be looking forward to that item coming back on the specials menu!!  

Shortcoming of the restaurant is the 2 item dessert menu, but that is okay since there are good options along Fillmore for that!  Let me also say that if you do have to wait for a table, there is some good shopping all around you so relax and enjoy.

PS - is there anyone who isn't mesmerized by the movie picture frame of fishing?  I still watch it every time!
author: Erik H.

description: Excellent food, nice atmosphere. We stopped in with a party of 6 and dinner was fantastic. I ordered the crab cakes and my partner had the fish tacos. We decided to share both meals. The crab cakes were very rich and delicious but the fish tacos were to die for!!! We ordered some oysters also, very good especially the BBQ. Someone else at the table ordered the fish and chips which looked light and flaky not oily like most. Highly recommend for a great meal.
author: Trish B.

description: Had lunch here today. The service was on point and the food tasted really good. I would highly recommend this place.
author: Rick D.

description:
This is one of the few seafood places around this area -- unfortunately, the seafood in the Bay Area just isn't that great, especially after having recently gone to Seattle, which has AMAZING seafood everywhere. I'd been here 2 or 3 times now, but have never been wowed by the food. I've tried the crab cakes, shrimp/avocado roll, New England clam chowder, lobster roll, fettuccine with prawns, and iceberg louis salad with shrimp. The crab cakes were good with the sauce, but nothing suuuuper exciting. The shrimp/avocado roll was all right - small shrimp is used, with slices of avocado on top. It felt like a lot of bread relative to the filling. My clam chowder bowl was really disappointing, especially after having so much delicious chowder in Seattle. It was weird - it didn't really have any flavor or taste, yet it was still salty and peppery at the same time. It was just missing that clam chowder taste?? The lobster roll is pretty good, and the smaller size is pretty small, but the fries help fill you up. (You have to ask for ketchup separately, they don't have any on the table by default)

What I really wanted to include in this review was the fettuccine pasta dish I got for dinner today. It had a sort of pesto-y, white wine sauce, with large prawns. It looked really good, but it was WAY too salty. I tasted all the salt immediately in my first bite. I tried another bite but it was just so salty that I couldn't eat it anymore. The flavor, besides all the salt, was pretty good otherwise. Lots of herbs and pesto flavor. We told our server that the dish was just too salty for us, and he apologized and took it away, and asked if we wanted to get another dish instead. We replaced it with the iceberg louis salad with shrimp, which came with lots of the small bay shrimp. It was good - but they drenched the salad in a lottttt of thousand islands dressing :( which rendered a lot of the salad at the bottom of the dish way too wet and soaked in sauce. Sigh. But I did like it otherwise. 

We weren't charged for the salty fettuccine, but were charged for the salad - just in case anybody was wondering how sending dishes back work. I don't eat here super regularly, only occasionally when I want some seafood, but after the salty dishes I had tonight, it might be awhile before I try it again :/ service is stellar though and the people working there are chill and super reasonable, so that stops me from saying that I'll *never* come back!

tl;dr lobster roll is my fave thing to get here; fettuccine dish was too salty, clam chowder meh. Great service though
author: Grace D.

description:
I've had this place on my bookmark list for a while now, so my boyfriend and I finally made our way out to SF.  We didn't even want to try to look for street parking, so we parked at the Japantown garage and walked the two blocks. I'd recommend this as their prices are pretty affordable. 

When we arrived at 11 we realized they weren't open until 11:30 on the weekends, so we shopped at Crossroads Trading Co. across the street.  As soon as they opened at 11:30 we were the first ones in, with other customers coming in right behind us.  I was excited because that meant other people thought they were good. We got a nice little table right by the front window.

We already knew what we wanted to order (I always do my Yelp research lol).  We shared a bowl of clam chowder and the lobster roll.  The waiter brought us water and refilled them throughout our meal.

The clam chowder arrived first. It was garnished with chopped chives and came with a packet of oyster crackers.  It had a good amount of clams and was not loaded with potatoes like other places. It was not too hot, so we were able to enjoy it.

The lobster roll comes with crispy fries, a small side of coleslaw, and a lemon wedge.  They have two sizes for the lobster roll, but we opted for the smaller. Judging from pictures, it looks like you just get more lobster, not a bigger roll too.  I didn't want to be overwhelmed with lobster and I wasn't sure the price jump justified getting a more lobster that would just fall out of the roll anyway. The server already brought us plates and the roll was cut in half, which I thought was nice since they already knew we were sharing. The lobster portion was very generous and there were big pieces - claws and all.  It was tossed in a creamy mayonnaise with chopped celery.  I was afraid it might be too mayonnaise-y, but it was perfect. The squeeze of lemon over the top really brightened everything up too.  The roll was nice and buttery and grilled so the outside had a slight crunch, but the inside was soft.  Mmmm. The only other time I've had a lobster roll was at the wharf where it comes in a hard, untoasted sourdough bread.  This was way better!

Their fries were all crispy!  This is very rare as you seem to always get one soggy one, but these were great.

I'm not a fan of coleslaw usually, but I had to try theirs because everything else was good.  I would say it was better than I expected.  My boyfriend doesn't typically like coleslaw either, but he put some in his lobster roll and enjoyed it.  

On the table they have a container/bucket that has salt, pepper, tobasco, malt vinegar, and ketchup.  I like how instead of a bottle of heinz ketchup it's more of a jar.  The wider mouth makes the ketchup come out faster.

Overall the experience and food was very tasty. The restaurant is small, but it's decorated nicely.  It seems to get busy quickly, so come early.  The waiters were all friendly and the food was delicious.  I would come again and recommend.
author: Allison L.

description:
Stopped by with my family after an impromptu trip to SF. We arrived at around 5 and only waited a few minutes to be seated. We got clam chowder (New England), calamari, steamed mussels, lobster rolls, the pasta, and the crab cakes. Basically, half the menu...

Everything was delicious! The food tasted fresh and came out nice and hot. Our lobster rolls were jam packed with lobster, I don't even think there was anything more than lobster and mayo. The pasta was great and the kids really enjoyed the clam chowder as well. 

Definitely will be returning to try some other items on the menu!
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Delicious! I decided to find this place after seeing a friend post their crab sandwich on their Instagram. I love crab but dislike having to work for it (cracking it) :) We decided to try the lobster and crab roll and the clam chowder. We also got the calamari for appetizers.
The crab roll was so meaty and gooood!! We only ordered the small which was good enough. I prefer the crab over the lobster sandwich. The lobster was a cold sandwich while the crab was warm. The clam chowder came in the cup size. I would love to go back again. It's pricey which is why we ordered small portions.. But it's not a surprise given its in SF and its fresh seafood. Craving for that crab sandwich now!
author: Joy B.

description:
As a celebration for the start of our SF Crab Season, we went to Woodhouse to find a great deal of $19/whole crab served up with a side of kale and potatoes. This was a good value meal and the crab is fresh. I'm a fan for this seasonal menu item.


Fish and Chip is flakey and the breading is crumbly light--everything falls apart even when you're trying to pick it up. I like their casual ambiance and really attentive service. Food is fresh and adequate.
author: Taffany H.

description:
Had a late lunch here today around 3! Ordered one small lobster roll and one large; if you're trying to get your money's worth, definitely go for the large because for just a few extra bucks, you get so much more lobster meat! But for small people like me, the regular lobster roll was a good size. ^_^ The bread was so deliciously buttery and the lobster was delicious! It also 
came with a side of fries and a small tin of coleslaw too. The only bad thing was that there was a small lobster bone (is it a bone..? well whatever the white inedible things are LOL) inside one of our lobster rolls! Also, the lobster rolls did seem like they took a while to prepare, or that might've just been because I was really hungry.. We also tried the calamari which was fried perfectly and came with cocktail sauce and another sauce! 

The  service is good here, not bad but not exceptionally good or anything. The waiter did fill my water cup twice though, so props for that.

There's this cool TV or moving art frame thing on the wall. Check it out and let me know if it's a tv please hahahaha
author: Tara A.

description: Delicious Clam Chowder, it had no bacon which I am happy for. Very inspiring marine theme. Perfect service and mussels where great. Although not with a view at the water, it still reminds you being at the ocean.
author: Cătălina B.

description: Stopped in for a quick bite before our departure and had the clam chowder, wedge salad, stuffed artichoke. It was all very yummy and the location is very nice. Will def come here again.
author: Christian M.

description: I have been going to this restaurant for 10 years and 10 years I have ordered the same thing.  The shrimp sandwich.  It started off at 9 dollars and now it costs 13.  The portions are still generous but what happened??? they only gave me bay shrimp?  Not a shrimp salad as in the past!  Whyyyyy????  Did they think I would not notice?
author: Emilia G.

description:
I would say this place is average. Nothing really stood out. The food was good, the service was alright. The space was very cozy (tables right next to each other). The restaurant was well decorated. Pricing was SF standard, so a little pricy for what you order.

My friend and I came her in search of clam chowder, which they had and was good. I got the fish and chips--the fish was tasty, but the fries were okay. We ordered some garlic bread, yet it had no trace of garlic. The best item I had were the oysters on the half shell which required no cooking.
author: Nat K.

description:
Wait time here definitely varies by day. First time we came on a Saturday (about 2 months ago) at around 730 and the wait was over an hour. Came for valentines day around 730 and the wait was literally 10 minutes! Kind of crazy right? This place literally has mouthed watering seafood and it's absolutely delicious! My boyfriend and I love their clam chowder and crab/lobster rolls!

Crab roll: 5/5: plenty of tasty crab piled high into a buttered roll. The roll itself is warm and extremely soft. I think they drizzle butter on top of the crab because it tasted amazing. I actually loved it way more than the lobster roll.  I want this again!

Lobster roll: 4.5/5: tons of lobster piled into a buttered roll. The lobster is mixed in a mayo dressing and it's pretty tasty. I'm not the biggest mayo fan that's why I docked 1/2 off. But overall the lobster roll is amazing, I wouldn't mind getting it again!

Clam chowder: 4/5: so creamy and delicious. It has plenty of clams in the soup and it's extremely comforting on a cold day. A bit pricy for a cup which is $7 I believe bit this is pretty good. 

Steamed clams: 5/5: loved the broth that it came in. It was a wine, garlic and cream sauce. Tasted amazing and it went well with the tasty garlic bread that came with it. The clams were cooked perfectly!

This is probably one of my favorite seafood places, I will definitely be back to try other dishes. 

Total for 2 w/ tax and tip: $100
author: Stella J.

description: Would give a 3.5. We dropped by for a late lunch and were seated right away.  The restaurant decor was nice and there were a lot of specials on the board. However, they were out of the local dishes and they didn't have whole crab either. I felt we didn't get anything we couldnt get at many other places that would have been far cheaper. We settled on oysters, fried clams, crab roll and Manhattan clam chowder.  Food was good and fresh, the service was good also, but nothing special. I get it, we came late, but I didn't get to try any dishes that probably would warrant a true 4 or 5 star rating.
author: Art H.

description:
Considering there are 1081 reviews, this review is likely superfluous. I'm okay with that. 

We arrived at WH on a Saturday night. Let me preface this review by noting that we had been drinking all day in Napa (ugh). When we got back to SF, I quickly switched to beer (self-five!), and I was 2.25 pints in by the time I arrived at WH (self-five!). 

We started with the calamari and clam chowder. The calamari was mighty tasty--it was definitely flash-fried perfectly--light, flaky and crunchy. I could have easily murdered that entire dish by my lonesome. But never mind the calamari, you're going to want to start directly with the clam chowder. Oh my goodness, I'm a bit of a clam chowder (as well as idiot) savant. If clam chowder is available, I'll probably order it. This is easily one of, if not the, best I've ever had. Please note the gravity of this statement, as I grew up on the east coast and have extensively traveled across the east coast in my adulthood. 

The ingredient that seems to make WH's clam chowder especially delicious is onion. I don't know what they did with that onion, but it makes WH's clam chowder kind of outstanding. I think I'd like to take a bath in it. 

For my entree, I ordered the crab and uni linguine, light on the bacon. I ordered it with light bacon, against my better judgment, because my friend had been there for dinner  on NYE 2014 and said the bacon flavor had overpowered the dish. I took note and I'm glad I did. The dish was delicious--perfectly portioned (you're going to want to share anyway because it's pretty rich), served with a creamy sauce and topped with fresh crab. The bacon keeps the dish a little interesting.  It. Is. Good. 

What's on tap? Anchor Steam and Scrimshaw Pilsner.  I was so surprised at the quality of the Scrimshaw Pilsner (which I did not order myself). I generally prefer to order what's on tap, because it tastes fresher and better to me. I ordered an Anchor Steam because I knew nothing about the Scrimshaw. Maybe I was buzzed, or maybe I'm developing a taste for pilsners,  or maybe both, but that was a nice beer. 

Anyway, this restaurant was great. I could bore you with service details, but she could have served me that clam chowder in an old boot and I would still give it five stars. Good times.
author: Sunny S.

description: Go on Tuesdays for $1 oysters all day. Best tasting oysters I've had in a while. Their clam chowder is also one of my favorites. It's just so creamy and thick and full of flavor. They also have great shoestring fries. You really can't go wrong with any of the dishes if you happen to like seafood. From cioppino to the mussels in wine sauce, you'll have plenty of sauce left over to take home and make yourself a pasta is you didn't manage to soak it all up with the complimentary bread.
author: Binh P.

description:
Came by lunch the other day and there were numerous tables available. The hostess informed us that there would be a few minute wait as there was only 1 waitress?!?

Service was friendly by the staff.

Started off with the New England Clam Chowder that was very rich.

Moved on to the 2 Crab Cakes and they were merely okay. I've had bigger and fresher ones before. The salad was also mediocre.

The highlight of the meal was the 3 oz lobster roll that seemed pretty large. The lobster was pretty good and the onion rings were okay, seemed frozen.

Food: 3.5 stars
Service: 4 stars

$23.53/head after tax and tip lunch.
author: Derek S.

description: Worst place to ever go to, waited so long for overpriced and small portion food and it wasn't even as good as I thought it was gonna be. Fuckin rip off, worst $78 dollars ever spent. I would've been better off at In-n-out, could've saved a good 60$.
author: Raizzabel A.

description:
I struggle with this review because the three other people in my party really enjoyed the dish they ordered - lobster roll, fish and chips and shrimp roll. I was excited to order the crab and uni linguini. That's exactly how it is described on their menu. 

So there was a healthy amount of crab that was placed right on top of my pasta dish when it arrived. It was glorious. I didn't see any uni but that tends to melt when you cook it. Fine. My first swirl of pasta tasted heavily of bacon. Bacon is listed as an ingredient but not as the star ingredient. The dish had SO much bacon! Seafood has such delicate flavor a that putting too much bacon over powers the entire dish. My photo shows the bacon aftermath. There must have been 6-8 slices in my bowl. I was severely disappointed and was having envy of the other dishes at my table. 

Nothing is worse than food envy at your table - when you wish nothing else but to have ordered something else - anything else that was on the menu with the assumption that it HAD to be better than the dish I have in front of me right now. 

Total San Fran seafood restaurant fail.
author: Amy L.

description: Great restaurant with the best food! I highly recommend for those who loves seafood. A little bit expensive.
author: Lisa G.

description:
I came here searching out a good lobster roll. I have yet to find out how that lobster roll is because I got lured in by a special they had on the board offering both fried pork belly and fried oysters in a poboy. 

I thoroughly enjoyed this special and I hope they continue to serve it because it was both unique and delicious. I'll have to come back some other time to find out how that lobster roll is.

I would give this place four stars, but they go way over the top on their pricing. $26 for a lobster roll is laughable.
author: Mark O.

description:
This place was definitely good, but also $$$, and the wait can be very long since the place is relatively small. 

I tried the lobster roll (small roll) - It came on a buttered toasted bun, and was filled with lobster meat with just the right amount of mayonnaise. The side of french fries and cole slaw were the perfect complement. However, I've had just as good if not better in the east coast for a lot less. I especially loved Luke's Lobster when I lived in the east coast, and that was $16 compared to $21 here. 

My group also shared a calamari platter and some oysters. Calamari was standard and oysters were fresh. Not much else to be said.
author: Cynthia X.

description: Love this place. Discovered it a few years ago. EVERYTHING here is amaze!!! Today I had oysters, Crab Iceberg Salad and the lobster roll hot. Yes I'm a fatty but I wouldn't have it any other way!!
author: Shanna A.

description: Very good, and very popular seafood place on Fillmore. It can be VERY busy during peak lunch and dinner hours, but I've been lucky going early or mid-afternoon. My favorite dish so far is a lightly garlicky grilled artichoke, split and stuffed one half each with bay shrimp and Dungeness crab. It is served with a salad of mixed greens, roasted beets, and garlic bread with toasted cheese, and mayo (or tartar/mild aioli) and cocktail sauce for dipping. Fish and chips is very nicely cooked and with generous portions. Fresh oysters have been excellent.
