I have not gotten around to ordering other dishes because the artichoke is such a perfect lunch, but everything I've seen other diners ordering looks excellent. They also have a number of beers on draft. Prices are reasonable for the area and for the food.
author: Cage H.

description: Came here with friends on a Tuesday for the $1 oysters. The oysters were alright, nothing spectacular. Ordered the small lobster roll, which was pretty good. The fries that came with it were amazing too. We all left happy and in food comas.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Good on you Woodhouse Fish - you've intentionally pared down your menu to what you do best. And though some folks may dig a Cheesecake Factory tome of a menu, I prefer something a bit more... edited. Ever go to an Egyptian restaurant and see a cheeseburger on the menu? Um, yeah - I can't.

Though starring as the poster child of delicious simplicity in the murky sea of those advocating the 'more is more' philosophy certainly takes confidence, it's definitely a premise backed by the necessary know-how. Well done, MacNiv boys!

So I'll cut to the culinary chase - two friends and I recently dropped by on a bustling Saturday evening for a dinner of seafood favorites. Two out of three of us started with the clam chowder, which conjures all the good associated with being rich and decadent yet somehow doesn't skew heavy. Fine, I'll just have to order you again.

Moving on: my friends split a whole Dungeness crab swathed in white wine and garlic and judging by what was left on the plate, that crab was very well loved. But the pièce de résistance of our meal had to be my large lobster roll served Connecticut-style. With huge, warm chunks of lobster drizzled with drawn butter struggling to be contained by a perfectly-toasted bun, this was beyond. Also, it was the first time I've enjoyed a lobster roll as much as my beloved favorite which lives at Boston's Neptune Oyster!

Dreams do come true. At last, I can stop babbling about the famed roll at Neptune and get a killer version right here in San Francisco!
author: Jelena Z.

description: Customer service was great, food not so great. Small portion wasn't satisfied. I love seafood but I'll take the L on this one. Fish taco was okay. Had better luck with Del Taco. Lobster roll was hyped up, so decided to try it out. Sandwich was a small portion. There was more cheese than there is meat. If you want a grill cheese sandwich order it. Wasn't satisfying. The wife and I got pizza right after.
author: Scott P.

description: Great birthday dinner with family. Lobster rolls were fresh and tasty. Good service and enough selections for a non-lobster eater (my Mom, who was paying the bill). Although they do not have reserved seating, we got there early and were able to seat 6 plus a baby around 515 pm on a Sunday, easily. We survived the baby and had a great dinner.
author: Debbie C.

description: This place is a must. I come down to San Francisco from LA often. This has become my favorite restaurant. Best lobster roll I ever had. Clam chowder is amazing. Fish tacos were delicious and the cioppino was hands down delicious.
author: Vanessa I.

description:
I feel so lucky to have not 1, not 2, but 3 different lobster rolls in the past 6 months, Ed's in NYC, Addendum in Yountville, and now Woodhouse in SF!!  I just ran across Jelena's recent review and after seeing John's comment, I knew that I couldn't go wrong following my two fellow "Jay Z's"!!  

My mom's b-day was yesterday and she was longing for some lobster so I treated her to 2 large lobster rolls which we split - one with just drawn butter (upon request) and one with the light mayo.  The mayo is your typical lobster roll that you often see but the drawn butter option really lets the natural lobster flavor shine through!!  Both were delicious and satisfying.  The regular one with 3 oz of lobster runs $18 but for an extra $8, you get double the lobster at 6 oz so go crazy and splurge!!  Just make sure to hover over your plate to eat so you don't lose a single morsel of goodness.
author: Joyce Z.

description:
Came here for lunch and thoroughly enjoyed myself. I tried their lobster roll and Dungeness crab sandwich. The amount of lobster and crab that come in both are hefty! The huge chunks of lobster were delicious. I personal liked the crab sandwich better. It was warm and buttery! Of course its personal preference, but I would recommend the crab over lobster. 

I spent $50 on two sandwiches...pricy, yes, but good! Probably not a place I could come to everyday for lunch, but when I'm the mood for some good seafood, this will satisfy my cravings.
author: Chris K.

description:
First time...
Pulled in by the selection of crab, clams, oysters, mussels.
Simple but a varied menu.
The lemonade and arnold palmer are a "make-it-yourself". It is served as a mixer to customize your drink with the right combo of simple sugar, spritzer water, tea, and lemon juice. This can be successful or an utter failure, depending if you can find the right mix. Concept is cool but I couldn't find the mix for my arnold so the staff accommodated my failure with a swap to traditional ice tea. That's service.
The rest of the meal consisted of the new england clam chowder filled with lots of clams.
The 1/2 dungeness crab was decent in size, pretty fresh, and the sauce was delicious. Very satisfying.
The last item is the steamed mussels. This dish was filled with so many little bad boys and no empty shell where I could not find the mate. This alone makes it a success. A savory broth but a bit peppery for my taste. The waitress was kind to offer some after dinner sourdough to dip with the various broths. A Yummy end to a delicious meal.
Overall, very satisfied and make sure you drop by this New England style comfy place with excellent service and food.
author: David H.

description:
Food taste= good anyone can Toss it up themselves 
Food portion= overpriced for the amount 
Customer service= casual mediocre 

Ordered to go and didn't have the common courtesy to provide napkins at all.
author: Karla P.

description: My go to spot when I am craving a bowl of clam chowder or calamari. Their clam chowder is really good and filling. They use lots of clams and it tastes very fresh. The calamari is good as well I just wish it had some sort of a seasoning added to it.
author: Darius A.

description:
I've had this placed bookmarked for a really long time and I finally had the chance to try it! My friend and I came on a Saturday at 10pm and there was still a 20-30 minute wait but the staff was so friendly and seated us right when a table was available. 

It took awhile for our waitress to come take our order but since it was our first time, we didn't mind the wait too much since we were trying to figure out what to order. We decided on clam chowder, 8 oysters, calamari, a lobster roll, and a crab roll. Our calamari came out first and by then, we were starving so we scarfed it down. It was really good and came with a decent sized portion! The clam chowder wasn't bad but it definitely wasn't anything special. The oysters, however, were so fresh and tasty! I was pleasantly surprised.

Now onto the lobster and crab rolls.. While we were waiting to be seated, I scrolled through a bunch of yelp reviews and most people said that the crab roll was so much better than the lobster roll. I was a little unsure at first because I've only heard people talk about lobster rolls when they mention Woodhouse Fish Co. We ordered both to try and let me tell you... the crab roll is AMAZING!!! The crab was warm, tender, and flavored to perfection. The lobster roll was a bit disappointing for me. It was good, don't get me wrong, but it didn't really live up to my expectations. I was really looking forward to a juicy bite of wonderfully flavored lobster but the lobster ended being cold and not as tender as I would've liked. 

Keep in mind this place isn't as cheap as you might think! A half order of the lobster roll is $19 and a half order of the crab roll is $18.

I'll definitely be coming back here but next time, I'm sticking to just the crab roll. Sorry lobster :P
author: Melody Y.

description:
Got called to work an early shift + had the evening free + decided to save RickyWillyFerrellyBobby for a spesher occ = din din at Milhouse Simp So..

[[ Niners vs Hawks Oyster Mashup $20 ]] Skip the BBQ; go #babywelikeitraw (http://youtu.be/ILXgpb6-b6M?t=1m20s) #BrBa #yellowsuits #honkifyouheartminions

[[ I Lobter Roll SF $26 ]] Not a typo. (http://www.yelp.com/user_details_quicktips?tip_id=uQlD8HfaA6mQraqXqenfsg&userid=eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg) Just order it.

[[ Iced Tea (Unsweetened) $3 ]] Mandatory in any sich.

Amusing to note the exec chef's name, August Schuchman. Back in Charleston, we had an oyster x seafood place named A.W. Shuck's. #itsasmallworldafterall (http://youtu.be/1xp2voNtXUk) #sicksadworld #lalalalala

!! Hold up !! I wasn't done telling you about the coley (coleslaw). It tastes like green seedless grapes. Yeah yeah no, just start chewing it and you'll see what I mean. Put this stuff in a pnah!pnah!pnah!pnah!pnah!pnah!pnahbutta! #nastosando; add sliced banana for real foodies only. #membersonly #putyourfoodiewhereyourmouthis
author: Dan B.

description:
Came here for the lobster rolls and ended having half the table order lobster rolls. We all opted for thr 3 oz. option instead of the 6 oz. and it was plenty. Delicious and only on the slightly small size, we were satiated but not stuffed.
The servers were a fun bunch and attentive.
I came in a group of 7 on a weekday, took them a while to seat us (considering we had written our name down an hourish before for a table at 8pm), so accomodate for that if you have a group of this size or larger.
author: Tina K.

description:
I was in the mood for seafood or pasta and this little spot was able to satisfy both :) The Crab Linguini was so so good. The waitress warned me that it had a strong smoky flavor. It did...and it was excellent. 

This place is pretty small and definitely felt cramped, but the service was very warm and friendly and I was attended to pretty promptly at the bar. I'll definitely go back.
author: Daniel B.

description:
First time eating here with a few of my friends, the food was good, fresh, semi big portion, at least it makes you full throughout the day. We ordered the lobster roll--$22, it comes with a small cup of Coleslaw and fries. Staff checked in on us once a while.

The reason I am giving this place a 1 star is because of their dishonest and unloyal behavior towards their customers, be aware when you come to this place to eat and make sure You make a COPY of your receipt. I specifically wrote $78.00 on the receipt, I checked my card today, they charge me $78.80. I double check with my friends and we all remember what we paid, my friends gave me each $26.00 .. 3 of us together. Even $78.00 was way too much for a place like this, I don't know what we were calculating. I usually pay even numbers everywhere I go, that is strictly super shady for them to do that. 

I will be contacting my bank to file a claim on this. Is not a matter of .80 cents is a matter of the owner of this company cheating on customers, who knows how many times they have been doing this.

Not a fan, won't be coming back ever again. Dishonest, rude, cheating behavior. 

BEWARE! You've been warned!
author: Yuri Y.

description:
Came here around noon on a Sunday afternoon and surprisingly it wasn't too busy. We were seated right away by the waiters and surveyed the seafood menu. They had so many options from pastas, to fried fish, to sandwiches. Even the desserts sounded scrumptious! After some debating, we ended up ordering the Maine Lobster Roll ($18) the 3 piece crab cakes and fish and chips (both were $15) and the Crab Louie Salad. I really enjoyed my Lobster Roll because of the savory element coming from the fresh lobster and the buttery element from the softness of the roll. The crab cakes were nice and crispy and tangy with the chipotle sauce. And the crust of the fish and chips was soooo flaky, yet delicious. The skin basically fell off when I picked one piece up. The creamy tartar sauce that comes with the fish compliments the dish well.

My only complaint is that the service was just on par, nothing too memorable. I don't think our waitress refilled our waters, especially when we needed it the most. Also the meal was quite expensive for lunch, though understandable since seafood is normally really expensive. I would recommend coming here for a nice dinner since the prices don't change.
author: Jessica E.

description:
Tuesdays happy hour = $1 oysters! Came at around 8:30 and it was still packed.. Left our name on the waitlist and headed to Le Mediterranee a block down for some drinks. About an hour later, we came back and they seated us right away with the next available table. Yay!
But after our little detour at Le Mediterranee, we, myself and 2 girlies, [only] opted for 4 dozen oysters, fries, and a bottle of white wine. The oysters were tiny, even for happy hour.. But even ordering 2 dozen each time, they came out really quick. So thumbs up to that. Fries were the best part--that is excluding the wine--and went well with the oysters.
I'd come back, not particularly for their happy hour oysters though. But for $1 each, I'm really not complaining either!
author: Athena L.

description:
The next stop for our group dinner was Woodhouse Fish Co.  As a newbie to Woodhouse, I looking forward to some delicious seafood based on Yelpers' reviews.  The restaurant is not large and they don't take reservations.  But we were fortunate to get a table of six without a wait at 6pm on a Wednesday. 

Bowl of New England Clam Chowder - a creamy thick chowder topped with some chopped chives.  Usually restaurants serve chowders with more potatoes than clams. Not this one. Clams were plentiful and they tasted fresh and tender.  One of best clam chowders that I've had.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/woodhouse-fish-co-san-francisco?select=B0pnfsTDIjiN6aM0ORGmYg#-8rb9vPSkre1xzlOw_mnVg)

Soft-Shell Crab BLT - this was a special on the menu board.  A deep-fried soft-shell crab with bacon and tomato served in a roll with a side of shoestring fries and a small cup of cole slaw.  Crab was tasty, but wished a different type of bread was used, maybe a bun, as it was hard keeping the crab in the roll after each bite. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/woodhouse-fish-co-san-francisco?select=B0pnfsTDIjiN6aM0ORGmYg#8t4pcxSKmkZ_MwuvpBlz-A)

Lobster & Hand-cut Pappardelle with saffron butter, pea pesto, garlic and cherry tomatoes. This was a delicious pasta dish.  Good portion of perfectly cooked lobster on top of wide ribbon of home-made pappardelle. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/woodhouse-fish-co-san-francisco?select=B0pnfsTDIjiN6aM0ORGmYg#FBFNKTWXDKGFLb9EaUgfAw)

Other items ordered by our group:
Bowl of Manhattan Clam Chowder - if you like your chowder without the cream, they offer this tomato based, Manhattan style as well. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/woodhouse-fish-co-san-francisco?select=B0pnfsTDIjiN6aM0ORGmYg#XTPlc0QToHEfiNm17xAypQ)

Cheddar Cheese Crab Melt with shoestring fries and a small cup of slaw.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/woodhouse-fish-co-san-francisco?select=B0pnfsTDIjiN6aM0ORGmYg#X0MxFlqUJCdsjBOxMNgGoQ)

Fish & Chips - three large pieces of golden brown fish on top of a bed of shoestring fries and a small cup of slaw.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/woodhouse-fish-co-san-francisco?select=B0pnfsTDIjiN6aM0ORGmYg#ykPB_uC7DNurXVP3BsJKHQ)

Crab Cakes - shared as an after dinner appetizer by our group since they forgot to serve it before our main courses.  Three cakes drizzled with chipotle sauce with a nice mixed green salad tossed in vinaigrette with chopped beets.  Wished the cakes were made with lump crab meat and it needed a little more seasoning.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/woodhouse-fish-co-san-francisco?select=I5uJGHsiy-3Pi9UcoMkRkA#I5uJGHsiy-3Pi9UcoMkRkA)

Overall, a nice dinner at a nautical decorated restaurant serving very good seafood dishes with friendly and efficient service. Only miscue was that our appetizer ended up being our post entree course.  Just remember, no reservations taken, so a wait is to be expected, but the food beats what you'll get at the Wharf.
author: Al L.

description:
Un-friggin-believable. 
"Clam chowder? Sure. Sounds great.  Mmm, delicious."

No. 
Talk about clams in every bite, about the perfect creaminess and mix. I ordered a cup of the Hartford which is a mix between the other two types. Ah mah gawd. Why I didn't order a bucket to begin with, I don't know. I was literally feeling weepy. Judge me, whatever. I don't care. 


Then came the main dish. Stuffed artichoke - with the most fresh cutest baby shrimp you ever laid eyes on in one half. The other? Crab. Of course. 
And wow. 
That's all I can say. 

Do yourself a favor and get at least a bowl of the stuff. I would go back. Regularly.
author: Sarah F.

description: Gourmet prices plus diner mentality and service don't create a good food experience... certainly didn't justify our long wait for a table.  Mediocre calamari that tasted more of fried batter than of the sea.  A tough tasteless tuna burger served with a lackluster bun on top a cheap tray with Syracuse college dining room china for $18 with an absurd $2 uplift for the (very respectable) ratatouille? Stiff French fries with a shoestring consistency? Expensive wine served slowly in cheap glassware?  At least the water was cold in the unairconditioned room.
author: David S.

description:
What a great little place. Cute and themed, it is a little small though! 
I love the crab sandwiches, the small size is enough for most people, and the large is a decadent amount of buttery crab. The people I've dined with have always enjoyed the stuffed artichokes and the fish tacos. 
I'm not crazy about their oysters, they normally only have two varieties, one east coast and one west coast - and I'm not really a fan of east coast oysters. Oh and on dollar oyster night (Tuesdays) there is only one variety. 
I love getting the do it yourself Arnold Palmer, it comes with straight up lemon juice that you can then add as much or as little simple syrup and iced tea as you want! Also their house white is not bad.
Lastly, I HIGHLY recommend getting the bread pudding, I haven't had a lot of bread pudding in my life so I'm not really sure what the consistency is supposed to be but this tasted phenomenal. So homey and well spiced with a generous helping of whipped cream on top. 
4 stars for the sometimes long wait, and small selection of oysters.
author: Kat M.

description:
Best version of East Coast seafood available in California. Honest to God clam rolls (with bellies for purists like me) as well as overflowing lobster rolls.

Funny thing is, at prices no different than you pay on Cape Cod, where I grew up. Go figure. 

And since they care enough to use good rolls instead of crappy hot dog rolls, it some ways it is better.

Can be busy but friendly and competent staff keep tables turning.

Now you can get a East Coast fix whenever you need it.
author: E F.

description: Best fish place in SF for local variety, ambiance and friendly staff.  Small, intimate setting so expect a little wait, especially on $1 oysters on Tuesday nights.  You want authentic lobster rolls, New England clam chowder? Look no further than Woodhouse.  If you want to escape the tourist locations, head to Fillmore and fall in love.  My pictures include soft shell crab BLT!
author: Mark B.

description:
I knew BBQ sauce tasted good on everything but on oysters? Brilliant! The oysters were so fresh and the BBQ sauce helped to mask any hint of fishiness. Also enjoyed that evening were the Clam Chowder and Stuffed Artichokes. The chowder was some of the best I've had and one cup was enough to split for 2 since it was super creamy and rich. The Stuffed Artichokes came served on top of a mixed salad with garlic bread. Although delicious, I don't prefer to be clenching my teeth trying to scrape the "meat" off the leaves. 

Minus one star because the restaurant is so small and cramped. There is only one restroom which is inconvenient with a full house.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Great Lobster roll and Cheddar Dungeness crab sandwich. I love finding restaurants off the beaten path and this would qualify. Cold beer, neighborhood atmosphere and good service. Thumbs up on this one! !!
author: Sandra H.

description: Great Clam Chowder with perfect texture. This is by far the best lobster roll in the bay, fresh and perfectly stuffed in the roll.
author: Daniel T.

description: Such friendly and quick service. Their Cioppino (I think it was $32) was delicious and really brought out the flavors in their seafood! We also ordered their oysters ($3/each) and grilled squid ($12), both of which were also yummy. Total of about $90 before tip for my mom and I to eat to our heart's content. Thank you for a lovely experience!
author: Jenny C.

description:
I had high hopes for this place but was left with nothing but disappointment.

Food
-Clam Chowder was disgusting. It was cold and was bland and too creamy. I've had better clam chowder in cans. Boudins has MUCH better clam chowder.

-Lobster Maine Roll was not yummy. It is mixed with some mayo dressing with celery and chives and it was not good at all. Taste was too mayo-e and I'd have preferred just a lobster roll with butter. 

-Calamari was good. Only thing I've enjoyed eating here. Comes with some zesty sauce with some cocktail sauce.

-Oysters were really tiny. I ordered 3 of them just to see how they would taste. Was decent oysters but not worth $2/piece.

This place was extremely overrated and I have NO IDEA how this place has 4 star rating. Definitely would NOT return and do not recommend people to dine here.

Had a lousy dinner and I wish I had just ate at Boudins at the food court in Macy's mall.
author: Michael H.

description:
Stacy Y. and her boyfriend were visiting from Dallas and only requested one thing from me, a good clam chowder place in the city. Unfortunately I had failed them because I hadn't found a place myself that I loved. So after a day at Muir Woods, Stacy Y. was one determined Yelper and found this place for us. We walked in to find out there was a wait for about an hour and a half for a group six because the place is small and accommodates parties of two, maybe four at max.

We came back close to the time and were seated with a friendly waitress. We all pretty much ordered the same thing, either a cup or bowl of clam chowder and either a single or double (referring to meat) of a lobster roll. The lobster roll was okay because the bread was awesome (I love butter) but the lobster didn't hold up and was plain to me. The chowder though... I got the cup and I have regretted it ever since. I should've gotten the bowl because it was so creamy and flavorful! Mad regret.

I'll definitely be back since this is now my go-to place for clam chowder!
author: Kat C.

description: The restaurant decor and seating and menu selection suggest diner, but the prices suggest fine dining. The food is extremely good, and I would recommend this as a treat, but just be aware of what you're getting into, because the bill is going to hit pretty hard.
author: Aaron P.

description:
Crab roll - yummy and the bread was good lightly toasted 
Lobster roll - wow real big pieces of lobster 
Calamari - yum light crispy seasoned just enough 




SERVICE
Good, nice and checked up frequently and refilled water regularly 




ATMOSPHERE 
it's nice kinda simple basic it's nice it's on Fillmore st pac heights side with shops and stuff to wall around to
author: Angela L.

description:
Great place to get your lobster roll fix! Our dinner:

Raw oysters: Fresh and clean.
Hartford Clam Chowder: Very tasty with generous chunks of potato and clam.
Lobster Roll: Tons of lobster meat. The garnish on the lobster was very good. I can't recall any other place that tasted this good. Bread was fresh and the fries were so addicting!

Friendly staff and the inside has a nice nautical/harbor theme. If you come on the early side during the week there shouldn't be a wait.
author: Josh L.

description: Pretty good. The lobster roll was smallish for the price but that's open to interpretation. What is NOT open to interpretation is serving wine in weird water glasses. It's not charming and it doesn't make WFC quirky. It's just a weird thing to not have more breakable wine glasses. Minus one for that. Otherwise, pretty good. Bring your own wine glass and it's a solid four star joint.
author: Brian B.

description:
I think some of the menu items change depending on what's in season/availability/whatever else, but I've had the clam chowder, oysters, dungeness crab roll, lobster roll, fish tacos, a dungeness crab/uni squid ink linguine (this seems like it's one of those items I mentioned above - some of the other reviews had similar but different variations), and a pork belly/shrimp po' boy off the specials board. i think that's it haha.

Everything's always pretty good and this is one of my top requested places by visitors but also one of the top suggestions I give/places I take people who are visiting. A few things to note:
- dungeness crab/uni squid ink linguine: The first few bites were very good, but I wasn't 100% sold on this pasta. The one I had isn't on the menu anymore, but the sauce was very rich, and since uni is also very rich it was kind of hard to finish the whole thing. It was still good! but a lot of richness for a whole plate of pasta if you know what I mean
- lobster roll: good, but I think they're a little heavy on the mayo for my taste, but I'm also not that big on mayo. I did see someone mention you can ask them for butter instead of mayo so I may try that next time!
- pork belly/shrimp po' boy: not a traditional cajun/Louisiana style po' boy if that's what you're expecting but very good/interesting! I loved the fried pork belly bits. I don't think I've ever had pork belly fried before and it's probably terrible for you but so yummy in yo mouth. I'd recommend trying this if it's on the menu!
- oysters: are always very fresh and yummy! they do a dollar oyster hh on tuesdays but I haven't been here for that yet so can't comment on that lol
author: Terra C.

description:
Where do you go for seafood and while avoiding those touristy spots in the City?  
Yes, this is definitely the THE spot.  
Having enjoyed their smaller, casual spot on Market near Church, my friends invited me for a midweek dinner here recently.  Arriving around 6 pm, there was a short wait for a table as it's first-come first-serve here.  Seated at a window seat, one of my dining companions asked one of the staff to lower the shade to block the sun's glare in my eyes.  The specials board was posted on the wall and, being summer, there was a must order selection on it:  Soft-shell crab BLT (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=lKOc6WDPU-3Tp578Kdra_w&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q).  

Here's was we dined on:

Appetizers
1) Soft-shell crab BLT (shared), fries well-done requested - Cutting this Sammy into quarters, it left me wanting more.

2) Fried calamari (shared) (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=K8o-Nuv1Kx8q_NoqZHoiXA&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - Lightly battered, my friends thought this was only okay and wished it were crisper.

3) Crab cakes. three (shared) (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=XLTRdS1wCnpr_Q55n-f8HQ&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - Evidence that we are spoiled, living in SF with its abundance of Dungeness crab.  I actually liked the salad (nice touch, having beets there) more than the crab cakes

4) Manhattan clam chowder, bowl - A heavy tomato flavored broth is always great on summery days.  Good amount of chopped clams here.

Main
5) Crab melt - Served with French fries and cole slaw, I could only eat half of my sandwich though I did finish the fries.  Warning:  They are EXTREMELY addictive.

Overall, the experience was pretty good as food was served in a timely matter, empty plates and bowls were quickly removed, and water glasses always filled.  The only hiccup was, when main course were served, either my mumbling order giving or the waiter's poor hearing led to an Ipswich clam sandwich to be delivered instead of my crab melt.  He quickly apologized and there was a short wait for my corrected order.   
They do a pretty bustling take-out business so, if I lived in the neighborhood (can't afford that yet), this is a great option.  As we wound up our meal, there was a family of four or five waiting for a table.  The patriarch of the family became impatient and led his flock across the street to another restaurant.  Too bad, as our table would have probably been his if he waited another five minutes.  
Don't make the same mistake.  This place is worth the wait!
author: Mike C.

description:
Fresh seafood..! Started with the steamed mussels that came with garlic cheese bread. Wow.! It made me order more garlic cheese bread, it was that gooOd. Had the lobster sandwich and the lobster meat was just overflowing out of the toasted roll it came in. Lobster sandwich paired with shoestring fries and homemade coleslaw. 

Girlfriend got the stuffed artichokes with shrimp and crab meat. Had her stomach smiling and me feeling super good. Looking forward to coming back.
author: Daniel C.

description: My boss took me to lunch at his go to favorite spot in SF for awesome lobster roll.  He was very right, and there weren't any complaints to be made.   The food was just as he said -- awesome -- and the atmosphere was so not San Fran...  Super low key and almost like a spot you'd find in Boston.  The service and everything else was also great.  It's my new favorite spot in SF too!
author: Samantha L.

description:
I came here with my boyfriend during my first week in SF, and it was a treat! Filling portions with a tasty and unique take on classic seafood dishes, but a bit too pricey.

Food: Delicious and generously portioned. We ordered:
1) Local oysters. Since it wasn't Tuesday (buck-a-shuck!) these were $2.50 each. Fresh and tasty, but small. Would pass next time.
2) Lobster roll. Meaty and satisfying, and while I'm not a celery fan (the flavoring is very celery-heavy), I can appreciate the uniqueness of this dish. The accompanying fries were delicious.
3) Cioppino. A HUGE dish (would recommend sharing!), we couldn't even finish this. Loaded with seafood of all types, and surprisingly spicy. The bread, while good on its own, clashed flavor-wise with the rest of the dish.
4) Sourdough bread pudding. Topped with a huge dollop of whipped cream, this one will make you kiss your diet goodbye. Warm and luscious, and definitely big enough to share. 

Service: Slow, but friendly. Were a bit slow on refilling our water.

Ambiance: A small place with low lighting, probably not the best for large groups but definitely a good date spot! I sat at the bar and it was just fine, but I'd recommend making a reservation.

Price: I'd put this one at $$$ rather than $$, personally. Was pricier than expected.
author: L H.

description:
Cute little spot! Food was good. The clam chowder comes with a lot of clams! Fish and Chips is not my favorite. It had a lot of batter and almost tasted burnt. 

The lobster roll and salmon burger were both delicious!! I would like to return and try the clam sandwich.
author: Angela D.

description:
This place never disappoints me.  I came at 7:30pm on a Saturday night and waited 10 minutes for the window seating! How sweet is that?!

For starters, we ordered the mussels w/garlic bread.  My companion ordered the grilled fish of the day and I ordered the crab cakes (3).  I should've ordered 2 instead. I didn't realize how filling it was going to be.  I like salads in general, but the side salad my dish came with tasted bland.  

The bill came to $58.75 plus tip.   Inexpensive for Saturday dinner!
author: Angelica C.

description:
(MARKET LOCATION) picked the wrong location

Love this place. Had the fish and chips the first time I came here which was good. I always get the buttered dungeness crab roll now which is amazing. A friend of mine had the bay shrimp and avocado roll and she enjoyed that as well. My girlfriend had the chedder cheese crab melt. Good but not as good as the buttered one. Oysters are yummy here too. Oysters are $1 on tues. Gets packed at night and weekends and there is usually a wait but so worth it.
author: Char L.

description:
We were supposed to go to Sotto Mare but there were road closures leading to Green St.  Times like this, you only have one option - YELP!!!  Searching for clam chowder, Woodhouse Fish Co. showed up as one of the results.  It turned out to be a good find because we were entirely satisfied with our dining experience.

We started off with the Crispy Calamari - the squid was so tender but the light batter gave it that needed crunch!  A few minutes later, we were feasting on the Hartford Clam Chowder, the Split-Top Maine Lobster Roll, the 3-Piece Fish & Chips, and the Cioppino.

Hartford Clam Chowder - Supposed to be half-and-half, but it appeared to be more like 3/4 New England and 1/4 Manhattan.  Creamy and tasty as it was, it did not come out as warm as it should be.

Fish & Chips - The Alaskan cod was fried to perfection and the accompanying tartar sauce was rich and enjoyable.

Split-Top Lobster Roll - Awesome, awesome, awesome!!!  They should build a statue of whoever came up with that concoction.

Cioppino - Whoever said that this can be shared by 2 was lying because I ended up finishing the entire bowl.  If the shells were edible, I would have eaten them too.  It was that good!
author: John L.

description:
After the art exhibit, stop by Woodhouse Fish Company. Ordered the lobster rolls because I needed it my fix since my Boston visit. It did the trick. Not the same, but close enough. The service was on par considering the place is very tidy. If you're in a rush then this isn't the place for you. Plus, I came on a weekend so that didn't help either. Make sure you have at least an hour to spare. 

I'm giving it a 4 star. Technically a 3.5 but I round it up.
author: Cheng S.

description: Came here for a second time and got the clam chowder which was AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!! One of the best clam chowder's I've ever had. Also got the stuffed artichoke with shrimp and crab which was also so good. Definitely coming here again for the clam chowder.
author: Jenna G.

description:
Mediocre clam chowder. The lobster roll and the fries that came with it was good.

We were there right when it opened, the guy flipped over the open/close sign and walked away, didn't even bother to open the door for us.
author: T L.

description:
Order the small lobster roll you will not regret it. This roll here freaken awesome!

Check out the picture I posted and you will see.
author: Steven C.

description: A little gem hidden in the buy streets of San Francisco! I love coming here anytime I'm in town. The lobster roll is small, but boy do they fill it up with a lot of lobster. It's never overcooked, always hits the spot, and thankfully the fries that come with are equally as delicious (cause nothing ruins a good meal like mushy or flavorless fries). It's a small place, and the line can get pretty long, so don't come hungry and if you do, make sure it's at an odd hour (2-5pm).
author: Jazmine A.

description:
Crab roll or Lobster roll or Fish Tacos? How could anyone ever choose with so many great options and so little room in my stomach! After long deliberation I decided to try the fish tacos. Luckily, my friend's ordered all the other things I wanted to try hehe. 

-- Crispy Calamari, we ordered the appetizer to share, it was served with marinara and a tartar sauce. Pretty standard calamari I would say.

-- Baja-style Fish Tacos, Crispy battered cod with cabbage, pico de gallo & avocado. The fish tacos really hit the spot! The fish was very fresh and the portion was just right for me. 

-- Maine Lobster Roll - My friend ordered the large assuming we would all like to take a bite to try (so nice of her to think of us!), this was probably my favorite dish. The lobster was so buttery and in some sort of lobster slaw sauce. Super heavy and delicious. 

-- Dungeness Crab Melt - The crab was steamed in white wine, lemon and garlic. Also a really great sandwich! I thought it was less heavy than the lobster roll. 

Overall I thought Woodhouse had great seafood and lots of delicious options! Definitely try and call ahead to make a reservation, the place can get pretty packed during peak hours.
author: Elaine N.

description:
Service=Not bad, a little short, but hey, they were a little busy.  They by kept my water glass full enough.  
Food= ok, but I just can't go higher than 3 stars when I pay $30, walking out still hungry, after ordering a marked up fish and chips type meal.  
Location= I love this spot on Fillmore St
author: Charles C.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here a few days ago (Saturday) right before opening and got seated right away at a table. I heard lots of good reviews about this place, especially from my sister, so I though I would try it out and treat my boyfriend here since he has never had a lobster roll before and loves oysters.

Ordered:
-Bowl of clam chowder $10: delicious! It was creamy and flavorful. They gave lots of clams (they were most definitely NOT stingy about it). They gave a small bag of oyster crackers to add to the clam chowder. I loved every bite of it! Would def recommend.

-Oysters $2.50 each: came on a basket of ice with some cocktail sauce. It was good and big, after eating 10 of these, my boyfriend wanted more!

-Maine Lobster roll $22 for 3oz: what we came here for! I do agree with everyone else that we have good lobster roll. The bread roll was not as buttery as other places and they gave lots of lobsters. However, it was a lot smaller than I had expected. This is def only for one person to eat and not to be shared. After all the food we ordered, I was still hungry for more food but our total was already about $64 including tax but not tips, so it is a little pricey but it is seafood. I would go elsewhere for the lobster roll for bigger portions for about the same price.

P.S. You can substitute the fries that comes with the lobster roll for onion rings for $2 extra but I thought it was worth it. It was super crispy but not burnt. When I bit into it, the onion did not come off of the batter like other places. You could actually bite into it and get onion and batter together in each bite you take.
author: Linda N.

description:
Hands down this was the best Fish and Chips I ever had.  Better than the shacks on the south coast of England.  Really. 

The fish batter is so light and flaky, like a dream. 

The dungeoness crab cocktail beforehand did set me in the right mood...

With a glass of Sauvignon Blanc on a school night, I am in heaven.
author: Nicolas S.

description: Attentive staff, but the fish and chips were absoluelty nothing to write home about. They certainly weren't worth the $20 bill I got for 2 pieces of fish and a glass of tea!
author: Ebony S.

description: Lobster roll is sooooo good!! Came here on a Saturday afternoon and there was no wait. Definitely recommend!
author: Kim W.

description: Really wanted to like this no frills place on Fillmore but can't go more than 3 stars. Short wait on a holiday evening. Small place so diners are packed in pretty tight. Friendly service. Crab cake dinner was disappointing. Three small crab cakes with a side salad. Cakes were rather thin and lacking in chunks of crab meat. Wanted to try the oysters but at $3 and $4 a piece no bargain.
author: Joe M.

description: Great, fresh food! I had the crab melt and want to go back to try many other things! The place is small and has only one bathroom. The fish tacos were highly recommend :)
author: Tianna W.

description: I've been here twice now. It's soooo freaking good. I get the large split top lobster roll and the wife loves the cheddar crab melt. Couple cold beers. Highly recommend.
author: James D.

description: The best lobster roll I have EVER had!  The service is very slow but the food is delicious.
author: Jose T.

description: Quaint little restaurant with fantastic food. We enjoyed their trout almandine and crab cakes. Salads had fresh beets, tomatoes and greens. Dish had micro greens - all good food for the gut.
author: Liz C.

description: I must say the service and the food is absolutely delicious! The atmosphere is very relaxing,clean and customer service is suburb. I will definitely recommend this place to anyone looking to eat seafood.
author: Iris H.

description:
I was invited to eat at Woodhouse on a Thursday night, not knowing anything about it or checking the Yelp reviews.  Funny that my review is right around the average - my experience was neither spectacular or terrible.  We ordered the shrimp cocktail, New England clam chowder, and lobster roll.  

Last thing first - guys, I know skinny fries are traditional with a lobster roll, but it doesn't mean people like it or they're a good option.  I'd like to have seen some creativity here - anything besides frozen little fries that don't have much flavor.  The lobster roll was tasty, however.  The bun it was served on was particularly nice, toasted perfectly.  Good amount of lobster salad too, but for the price, I would expect it.  The shrimp cocktail had 4 prawns - was good but not great.  The clam chowder was also good, but not Maine/Boston good.  I've had richer, thicker, and chowders with more seafood in them, so it's not something I would necessarily come back for.  I might come back to try the salmon burger - we had already ordered enough and I still want to try it.   

In comparison to a similar place in New England, this place is more expensive and not quite as good. I still would recommend it to people until I find something better, however.  Welcome to San Francisco!
author: Ben K.

description:
This place isn't as great as I remember. Came here on a Saturday night and sat at the bar. We received fantastic service and didn't have to wait too long for Saturday primetime. Ordered the smaller lobster roll and fries. The bun kind of dwarfs the amount of lobster, and it's not bursting with big, fresh pieces of flavorful lobster like I hope for. It is more like minced, smaller pieces of lobster mixed up with more mayo than I'd like. The side skinny fries are great, perfectly seasoned and really crispy. 

Good reliable place for a seafood dish, but nothing to write home about.
author: Sarah B.

description:
I've been here before but this time I had to write a review!  

1. Let me yelp you out here!  Come here! It won't disappoint hopefully no wait!

2. Get a good wine. 

3. Go with a special!

4. Come on Tuesday!  $1 oysters.
author: Garrett K.

description: Came here with my little sis when she was visiting town. We got seated right away from a lunch at the bar and got an Arnold Palmer and lobster rolls. The thin cut fries were delicious and the lobster roll was good as well. Super filling but the downside is that it may be a bit overpriced. It also would have been better if the bread was a bit more crispy or toasted.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Dined here with a group of friends during my trip to SF last year (Spring 2012). I'd wanted to try a seafood place and had found Woodhouse Fish Co. via Yelp, of course. When we told another friend where we were headed, she noted this location was in the fancier side of town (she explained it as San Franciso's Upper West Side--not sure if that is an exact match but I got what she was getting at). 

Our party of five was seated with no hassle on a weekday night. The waitress was friendly even though we were the youngest group in the restaurant (save the toddlers sitting at another table). I had the lobster roll which didn't skimp on meat and came with a generous side of fries. I remember the wine list being very affordable and enjoying the glass of white that I chose. 

Woodhouse Fish Co. felt like an upscale seafood restaurant, without any pretensions. I didn't feel like I was in a tourist trap, which I wanted to avoid when looking for a seafood place. Would love to visit again next time I'm in San Francisco!
author: Chey H.

description:
This has been one of my goto places whenever I am in SF.  I almost always come here and it has generally been really, really good.  

The past two times I came though I was really let down.  It just seemed like the care for the food had slipped.  Seasoning was off or non-existent, no one checked on the food to see how it was and when I said I was finished with nearly all of the food still on the plate (a good check for customer service) I wasn't asked if I wanted it to go or if there was something wrong with it (this was after I had to send it back and it was a new plate).

I really like this place, love the location and the staff is cool (all different people, a bit eclectic, great atmosphere) - hopefully this was just a bump in the road and I will update this next time if was.
author: Will N.

description:
I've been dying to try this place for ages and finally got around to it and seriously was missing out on all the yum. We got a table right away at noon on a Sunday. Started with the DIY Arnold Palmers which were so adorable and not too sweet! Thank you!

Ordered the special of grilled squid over spinach and roasted garlic. The squid was so fresh and tender, it was a bit too salty for my taste.

Crab cakes with the chipotle aioli were amazing and of course the crab roll. I got the 3 oz and was so satisfied. The buttery roll was to die for and so packed with amazing sweet chunky crab meat.

Service was great! Our waitress Bella was so nice and friendly! Would definitely recommend!
author: Christina P.

description:
I had never had a lobster roll before but after watching YouTuber Casey Neistat do a video comparing lobster rolls found in New England, I couldn't get them out of my mind.  On a recent trip to SF I thought maybe just maybe I could try one in the city. Yelped 'lobster roll' and Woodhouse came up...so happy to have tried them! We visited on a Tuesday afternoon and it was quite crowded with about a 10 minute wait.  The place is rather small but I didn't feel too crowded once we had a table.  The servers and employees we encountered were very friendly and quick with service.  

Of course I had to try their lobster roll and oh my gosh, it was amazing. Very flavorful and just the right amount of other ingredients added to the lobster as to not overpower the flavor.  Obviously I don't have anything to compare it too but I'm now a lobster roll fan and eager for a trip to Maine.  We also had the special $1 oysters and they too were very good and fresh tasting. I always try clam chowder wherever I go and while this one wasn't my absolute favorite, it was pretty good.  A slight sour flavor (sour cream maybe?)  that was off putting but with oyster crackers not bad.
author: Lisa L.

description:
This is one of those cute little restaurants that serve amazing seafood here in San Francisco. The interior decor is all about ocean, boat, and ocean creatures. Even the sign of the restroom has something to do with this ocean theme.

We went there mainly for the Drugeness Crab, but they were out of it. I guess an entire crab is hard to find when it's not the season. So in order to satisfy our craving, we've got Drugeness Crab Linguine instead. Other than this, we also ordered Cioppino, Spilt-Top Maine Lobster Roll, and Blackened Catfish.  I love all the dishes, but if I have to pick a favorite, I would go for the linguine. The lobster roll was good too. They put an entire lobster in a hot dog bun, you don't get to see this very often. This is my first time seeing this in my entire life. Not only it's special, it's also delicious. I'll feel sorry for you if you don't give this lobster roll a try when you are here.
author: Thérèse HC W.

description:
Why would anyone give less then 5 stars?! 

Delicious oysters, mussels and just everything was really great!!

Service, 5 stars!!

We will be back!!
author: Mark K.

description:
My first time at a fish and chips place! (although, we didn't actually get fish and chips but got other nummy things)

I'm never really in the Fillmore district much, so it was finally time to try a new place to eat since my sister was working around here. This is a pretty small yet a clean cut restaurant. We got seated immediately (with the choice of counter or table seating) during lunchtime and had enough time to look at the menu and decide. My sister and I shared their fish tacos and the lobster roll.

Lobster roll: Definitely a must when coming here. Their lobster is super fresh and isn't too fishy-tasting, which is nice because it didn't give me a headache or made me want to gag. The bread they use for the sandwich is toasted, buttery, and fresh as well. Also, their sandwiches come with a small side of coleslaw and fries so you're bound to be full! Their lobster sandwich comes with the option of it being 3 oz. ($18) or 6 oz. ($28). We got the 6 oz. one but personally I think the 3 oz. would have been good between the both of us (we don't really each much anyways..)

Fish Tacos ($14): They comes in threes with limes on the side. Fish was delicious! And again, not too fishy or bad aftertaste. It wasn't too oily either. Great flavor too! It's kinda messy since they fall apart easily, but it's not a huge deal. I would recommend this as something to share between two people. 

Only reason why I gave them four stars was the service. It took them a while to bring out the food, like about 15 minutes? But then again, what do I know about the prep for food at a fish and chips restaurant. And we were sort of on a time constraint, so maybe next time I come here I'll be more lenient about it.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
My roommate and I went out last week to treat ourselves. I wanted oysters and she wanted lobster rolls. It would've been perfect if we had just come here to get both but I didn't know they had oysters here too! Since it was a Tuesday, they even had their dollar oyster deal. Anyway, we came here after eating oysters elsewhere and had a lobster roll each here.

We were seated right away even though it was around dinner time, which was great. I looked around to the tables around us with oysters and the oysters were really big and looked so tasty, and that's coming from someone who had JUST eaten a dozen oysters. Anyway, we ordered the lobster rolls since they were what we came for and I was a bit underwhelmed. It wasn't that big and I wasn't even feeling that hungry then. I feel like a lobster roll in itself isn't really something that will fill you up. Anyway, the lobster roll itself was really tasty. I liked that there the big chunks of lobster in it. What I wasn't crazy about was the bread. It wasn't bad but it wasn't what I expected or anything special. I thought it was too buttery for my taste.

I'll be back for the lobster rolls AND oysters next time!
author: Jennifer C.

description: Everything was so fresh and delicious!!!!! Had the purple mountain oysters, fish n chips, cioppino, and crab cakes. One of the best dinner I had in awhile good vibes and great friendly customer service. Will be back for their Tuesday $1 oysters.
author: Betsy X.

description: Food was good. It really was, but it wasn't out of this world. Crab cakes were too citrus flavored but thick. Fish had a great breading, but heavy. Prices were perfect, on the other hand. Still, I recommend you try it.
author: Dilan P.

description: Best lobster rolls and crab rolls. They're served on a toasted garlic butter roll and you will not be disappointed! Also, they have the best Arnold Palmer I've ever had. They serve you fresh simple syrup and you can sweeten your own drink to your liking.
author: Jessie A.

description: Calamari, clam chowder & fresh oysters were delicious. The lobster sandwich was good but not my fav. The sweetness of the bun felt odd to me but the actual lobster was amazing!
author: Katya N.

description:
Came here for lunch had a lobster roll, my colleague had the fish tacos.  

Lobster roll -  bread was delicious perfectly buttered and warmed, cradled the lobster very nicely.  Lobster was mainly claws, would have liked more tail for $27.  All in all the roll was good, I think I'll go for the dungeness roll next time, I get the feeling the crab would have a fresher taste.  Till the next time :)

Fish tacos - colleague said they were a bit oily, but light at the same time.  Hmmm but all in all huge portion and looked very delish.  

This is a multi visit Resturante for sure.  Maybe that dungeness roll will boost to level 4 star
author: Jason M.

description: Food was right on. Clam Chowder is a must! Yum-O on the dungeness crab roll - wow us is all I can say. Oh and let's not forget the French fries so crispy and light melts in your mouth. Definitely going to visit again.
author: Eve V.

description:
Finally! I've gotten the chance to eat here after bookmarking this place for a few years!

Even if you're on a Paleo diet or low carb diet, I'd highly recommend you to cheat this one meal and get the lobster roll. DO IT. Yes, I'm a horrible influence, but cave in! You won't regret it.. it's an amazing sandwich packed with lobster and some mild sauce. It's on the pricy side, and you can stuff the sandwich with twice as much lobster for $8, but I think the 3oz. one suffices. The bread for the sandwich was so buttery and fluffy and amazing. Drool.

The sides that comes along with the lobster roll is just okay, though... the french fries were okay (reminded me a bit of crispier McDonald's fries) and the coleslaw was pretty good.

Also, be sure to get the clam chowder. Best clam chowder i've ever had! So flavorful, and lots of pieces of clam. Yummo. I was supposed to share this with my friend but I think I ate most of it. Oops.

My friend and I also split the stuffed artichoke with salad... that was quite an interesting experience. It was actually our first time eating artichoke (aside from artichoke dip)... we sure looked like noobs eating it, haha. I blame my friend for picking it! But it was ... okay. Definitely not worth the price. It came with shrimp and crab, but nothing too special. The garlic bread that came with it was really tough and hard to chew for me.
author: Janet H.

description: The line at Swan's Oyster Depo was SO long, we decided "IT" wasn't worth it.  So we went to Woodhouse on Fillmore.  I saw someone enjoying a cioppino so that's what I ordered.  My friend ordered a bowl of clam chowder and we shared each.  The Manhattan clam chowder was thoroughly enjoyable and hit the spot on this rainy day.  The cioppino ($32) had 2 Dungeness crab legs, 1 large prawn, 2 clams, & lots of mussels and teeny bay scallops, plus about 2 small pcs. of fish in a nice tomato-basil broth. It was enjoyable, ample, and would have been 5-stars if the fish had been a little less "done".  The toasted bread served with it was "pretty" but had none of the flavor it suggested (butter, parsley, garlic?)  The sourdough bread for the table had been warmed up in the microwave (ugh!)  Overall, we enjoyed ourselves . . .   Not sorry about Swan's.
author: Vera P.

description:
Great little place to eat seafood. 

Hartford clam chowder- combination of new England with a little bit of Manhattan red chowder. One of the best in sf.

Lobster roll- got the 6oz for $27. Totally worth if you like stuffing your face with lobster meat. The bread that came with it was deliciously buttery with the perfect crunch to it. My only complaint was the mayo base sauce on the lobster was on the heavy side.

Softshell crab with bacon lettuce and tomato- i expected more taste of their crispy softshell crab but the blt completley overwhelms the taste.

Both dishes came with fries and they were nice and crispy. Service was good. Place was nicely decorated.
author: Mav M.

description:
We love Woodhouse! Have been here at least 4 to 5 times over the last few years.
Stumbled upon it by accident while strolling through the neighborhood and fell in love.
There are a  lot of places to get seafood in the city but we like their smaller menu and 
attention to detail. We have tried many things but the two that stand out the most
are the lobster roll and artichokes with crab. Lobster roll is crispy and buttery
and artichokes I think are bbq and large portions. Wash it down with an anchor steam
beer and you can't go wrong.
author: Joshua B.

description:
We walked into this small restaurant.  All tables were occupied so we put in our names, there were two couples ahead of us.  The hostess advised us it shouldn't be long as several tables are finishing up.  Four tables departed at once and the hostess seated the first two couples ahead of us.  Then the hostess sat a family of four who had come in after us!!  WHAT!!!  There was still an empty table for four available and NO ONE on the list after us.  When I went up to see how long it would be, thinking that she should give the two of us the open table, she said we would have to wait for a table of two to open up.  WHAT!!!  What kind of restaurant seats people out of order (with the exception of large parties waiting for several tables) ?!?!  So we sat waiting for a table of two to be come available, 15 minutes goes by, finally a table for two came available.  The open table for four stayed available for another 15 minutes, that's right, 30 minutes that table went unseated!!!  Very FRUSTRATING!!

Our waitress provided average service.  She took our order, brought our food, and gave us the check.  The place was busy, so it was hard to get her attention when we needed things. Also when my husband asked if he could substitute the fries, she advised he could substitute with any side, he wanted a salad, she never bothered to tell him it would be an extra two dollars.  He didn't even like it the salad had way too much dressing.

As for the food.....

**3.5 stars** for the clam chowder, better than average, good flavor, thinner consistency than your typical clam chowder.

** 3 stars**  for the fried fish, fish was not bland which I like, but I didn't care that much for the batter.

** 2 stars for the fries, a bit on the dry side

** 3 stars** for the tartar sauce, homemade which was good, but it lacked a bit of flavor.

**2 stars ** for the coleslaw, not impressed, very runny sauce

Well it is always good to try somewhere new, but in this case it didn't pay off :(
author: Andrea B.

description:
We spent Black Friday enjoying a great lunch here in the Fillmore.  My daughter lives close by so she decided to take us here to avoid the holiday shoppers and tourist traps.

We enjoyed the 2 piece fish (huge) and chips, Baja Fish Tacos, and a couple Bay Shrimp & Avocado Rolls.  The fish was fresh and tasty with generous helpings of avocado on the rolls.

I can't wait to go back again and try the specials.  Since it was just lunch I didn't want to over do it but the Scallops sounded amazing!  Park over at the mall and walk the few blocks to seafood heaven!
author: Sandyann G.

description:
This place is great! It's very decently priced for the quality if you're not looking to spend a whole lot on a fancy seafood meal. I always order the Dungeness crab melt and split some crab cakes or oysters with someone. Oh, and I love their Arnold Palmers. They give you your lemonade in a glass and then tea and syrup (not packets of sugar!!) in these adorable little jars to mix yourself. Plus, the waitresses are always very friendly.

I highly recommend this place for people that love crab, shrimp, oysters, etc. If you're looking for Chilean sea bass, though, you won't find it here. Jurassic Park might have some. But if you want some fish and chips, or a delicious crab melt in a cozy setting, this will be just the place for you! At least there are no velociraptors.
author: Jennifer K.

description: Great food. Great service. Very cool decor. The clam roll was the bomb.com. Check out the bathroom for a cool view of SF. Highly recommend.
author: Andrew P.

description:
Awesome. Had stuffed artichoke, which was good. My friend had a Halibut special, which he commented was the best piece of fish he ever had. Despite being packed, we had a short wait and the food came quickly.

Will be back.
author: James L.

description:
A whole cooked fish on my table! Yuuummmyyy! and the side dishes were so well picked and prepared to compliment the fish! 

What else do you need to know? :) Daily specials on the chalk-board are intriguing, and very promising. 
Great relax place for lunch (crab rolls) or dinner (pastas, salads, fish dishes).  Didn't try dessert, but looked great...
author: Marianna K.

description:
HOLY JAMOLY!  The lobster roll here is freaken NOMSY and TO DIE FOR.  I was disappointed that I decided to halvsies the smaller size of the roll because I felt like I devoured my share in 5 bites and craved for MOREEE!!!  If you're sharing so you can try other items on the menu, I'd recommend getting the larger size.  WORTH IT.  (Even  though you're going to be totally super full, haha.)  Clam chowder was also on point and worthy of mentioning!  Raw oysters?  Yes please!  BBQ oysters?  They were good, but not to die for... tasted like they were just grilled with some tomato like sauce over it.

Wanted to try the crab roll as well, but from the opinions of those that I ate with, they all said that the lobster roll was much better.  Definitely will come again to try the Cioppino and some other of their seafood items.  SO SO YUMMY.  Definitely worth my wait to seat and wait for food.  I think I'm about to drool just thinking about it right now, haha.

Also, I almost tripped out with the giant tv/moving picture frame downstairs for a moment.  Thought I was in Harry Potter or something, hahahah.
author: Carena N.

description:
It was a-ok. but if you want quality sf seafood this is not the spot. There are much better places to go in San Francisco,such as Anchor Oyster Bar or Swans and there prices and portions are  fair. 
My husband is from New England and I am from the Bay Area we had clam chowder, fried clams and the crab sandwich. First,everything was overpriced and my the Clam Chowder was average. Not sure but, I think the crab in my sandwich was canned. On a positve my  husband did think the fried clams were legit and reminded him of New England. Look at it this way, If you are from California or New England this place will not impress it will disappoint. However if you know noting about good seafood you might give this place a good review.  Would we come back no, would we recommend this place to a friend no.
author: Susan S.

description:
Great great food! Growing up on an island in Taiwan, I've always been very picky about seafood. I'm so happy to find this place! We (3 of us) shared 12 oysters, Dungeness crab roll, grilled squid, and fish and chips. $1 oysters on Tuesdays is a great deal, especially it tastes awesomely fresh! The crab roll was filled with real crab, it melts in your mouth with the butter bread. The grill squid was so good - get it if you are a squid lover! Fish and chips are good, but nothing too crazy about it. Their fries are surprisingly crunchy and delicious as well. 

This is also a great place to take babies to. Next time I'd like to come back and try the lobster roll and chowder.
author: Caroline L.

description:
Woodhouse is an absolute must every time I'm in the bay. Even during a weekend trip, we'll manage to squeeze in at least two meals here. This review is for the most recent visit, literally 10 minutes ago. 

Food: A
We ordered the creamy clam chowder, Manhattan tomato, fried clams, and lobster rolls. What can I say, the soup was creamy and filled with a good amount of clams. The fried clams were nicely seasoned. The lobster rolls were stuffed with lobster meat and nicely buttered. Straightforward and simple, but keeps me coming back. 


Service: C
We came in on a Sunday evening at about 9:25PM and we were seated immediately by the hostess. Our waitress on the other hand, must have taken a break from being the butt of your stereotypical "dumb blonde" jokes to work tonight. She took her time sauntering around the dining room and staring at walls before finally coming to take our order 15-20 mins later (we had to flag the hostess down and tell her we were ready). Ordering went off without a hitch. We told her what we wanted and she wrote it down. She didn't come by our table again until it was time to bring out the food which she placed in front of me in a manner that brought back nostalgic memories from grade school and the lunch lady dropping my plate in front of me with disdain before screaming "next!" She also managed to write down two crab rolls instead of lobster rolls, but they were quick to fix the error. By the time we were done eating, we handed her out card and asked her to go ahead and ring us up for the bill. She must have forgotten because she proceeds to print out the check and bring it to us 30 seconds later...while she still has our credit card in her apron. All in all, not a terrible service, but definitely strange. "Drugs are bad...hmkayyyy". 

Overall grade: B
author: Eric L.

description: Lobster roll and the clam chowder are always on point, best I've had. I've also tried their Dungeness  crab roll but wasn't a fan of that one.
author: Kim S.

description: I've been to this place a few times throughout the years and still never fails to impress. Food is great, ambiance is chill, and service is excellent!
author: Miguel Y.

description:
My experience in a timeline fashion!

First time hearing about this place: Whoa! Lobster! On a toasted bun?! Where is this magical place? *clicks Instagram location tag* 

Looking it up on yelp: 4 stars!? A must try! Time to convince my boyfriend I want to go here

Going to the restaurant: It's on Fillmore-- parking is a hit or miss. Street parking is based on luck, so as a backup plan we decided to park at the parking lot located at Japantown and walk to the restaurant. 

Eating/Dining: The waiter was average. Nothing stood out which isn't a bad thing. 

The food: I got the spilt bun lobster roll with fries and some raw oysters. After all the reviews and everyone raving about this place, I expected more. The fries were perfect and delicious, but I can't say the same about the roll. I found that it lacked in flavor. Some people stated that it was covered in mayonnaise but I honestly hoped mine had more mayo in it because the lobster definitely didn't have much flavor to it. The cole slaw was good, but they gave you very little of it.The portion of it was so small that it was the size of a sample cup. For the price that I paid here, this was definitely not worth it. Granted though, seafood is very pricey.
author: Jenny N.

description:
This is quite a popular seafood place, but I've been lucky  getting a seat at a table or at the bar  during early afternoon. A few of my favorite dishes have been the artichoke which is grilled, split and stuffed one half each with shrimp and crab, and of course the oysters. Who can pass up $1 oysters that are rich in zinc with a side of cold beer? My gf had the smaller lobster roll with a side of fries and slaw. The roll had tender claw meat in it so I enjoyed sharing that with her. 

The service was warm and friendly although it felt cramped. My tummy was happy and I left satisfied.
author: Melly C.

description:
Chanced upon this little restaurant a couple of weeks ago. There was already a queue and the wait was too long. I wanted to come back again to see what's all the hype about and I'm glad I did.

Unfortunately I didn't prepare myself adequately for this meal (wasn't hungry enough) and only ordered a two piece fish and chips. Didn't try the lobster rolls or the crab but the neighboring tables did and it smells amazing.

What we had:
New England clam chowder: rich and creamy, can't go wrong with this appetizer 

Clams: not too sure what the clams were simmered in, probably reduced broth but it was pretty good

Fish and chips: forgot to check what fish it was but the meat was nice and firm, doesn't crumble in your mouth, nor is it too hard. Fried golden brown and served with fries.

Well, I'm gonna come back for lobster rolls and crabs.
author: Ryan K.

description:
Came here with my family. We ordered:

Lobster Roll - Best lobster roll I've had
Crab Melt - It was okay, the lobster roll was way better
Calamari - Nothing special
Crab Cakes - I liked how this wasn't made with bread crumbs on the outside
Fish & Chips - A little too oily, but was really fresh.

I would definitely come again, but I would probably only get the lobster roll.
author: Jocelyn M.

description: Delicious little restaurant! Cozy atmosphere, friendly and efficient service, and quality food. We had the "do it yourself" lemonade which was pricey but really yummy, a wedge salad, and the fish and chips. All were divine but the fish and chips were by far the best. My only suggestion would be for a better French fry with the fish and chips. The ones they have tasted pretty generic and didn't taste homemade (apologies if they are).
author: Cassandra B.

description: Great seafood selections.  Been twice now, love the lobster roll and calm chowder.  The calamari is a good choice too. :) Great atmosphere as well.  I do think I prefer the one on Market St.
author: Jantima B.

description: Tried this place when I was on vacation. The locals we talked to recommend this place for their seafood. The restaurant is very small but cute. I tried the lobster roll and it was the best I've ever had. I'll be dreaming of this roll. I wish I could get it back home in Chicago.
author: Jami J.

description:
We came all the way from Chicago and we had a wonderful crab cakes meal Woodhouse.
Fresh and delicious! 
We shall return.
author: Eduardo P.

description:
Cioppino! It's so so good. 

Always bustling and they don't take reservations, which sadly for me means I don't get to dine here that often (who likes to wait?!). One of the better and more lively restaurants on upper Fillmore. It's a little bright inside and since the best seafood dishes are eaten with your hands, I wouldn't suggest going for the romance... go for the shellfish!
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Seriously yelpers?! I'm starting to lose my trust in you. This place is definitely not worth all these good reviews. 

It's OK. The food was not outstanding at all! It was average at most. And it's pricey!! You will not be full here. The portions are way too small for that price tag. The oysters and pork belly po boy were dry, the tacos were ok... The only good thing is the fries! They know how to make deadly fries. 

Another Meh place.
author: Tamara S.

description:
I had friends visiting, and good seafood was a must-eat on our list. I took the chance to try out Woodhouse, and I am SO GLAD I DID. We split the dungeness crab roll and the lobster roll (hot butter version, not cold mayo ew). They were to-die-for. I actually can't believe we finished it all, since the rolls were so huge. The smaller ones are probably enough for a normal person (it's just less meat). The crab tasted really fresh and refreshing, and the lobster was buttery heaven. The fries were super legit, too.

We went for a really late lunch, so we didn't have to wait, but I can imagine it gets pretty busy here during primo dining times. Price is reasonable for what you get, I think. Go big or go home, son.
author: Vivian H.

description: This is my absolute favorite place for $1 oysters (only on Tuesdays)!!! I usually come around 8-9PM and there's almost no wait time at all. It's hard to find a decent place in SF for oysters that isn't overpriced or fishy. Another one of my favorites is the lobster roll. They either do half or full for the lobster rolls, but I find that half is all you need. I think there is another location in the Castro(?), if you aren't close to the Fillmore.
author: Jeanne C.

description: Friendly service but the crab melt is indistinguishable from chicken salad and just tasted like mayonnaise, chives and cheddar cheese. No hint of crab flavor. The liquidy texture ended up being too much and had to just call it quits halfway through. Won't be back anytime soon.
author: Scott H.

description:
The good: Tasty food, quick service once you're seated, and interesting decor. The food is 4 stars for sure. 

The bad: expensive price:portion ratio, and our quoted 20-25-minute wait for a party of 3 became 45 because the host kept seating about seven or eight (I stopped counting at six) 2-tops that added their names after us. 

I wouldn't have minded if the host gave us an accurate time estimate or explained that they wouldn't move tables together, but she didn't. We would have been fine on the counter, too, but they put singles and 2s there instead. 

In the end, we spent longer waiting on the sidewalk than eating. Another 3-top who arrived just before we sat down was being seated as we left, so I don't think we were odd ones out. 

Once we sat down: The only difference between the half and whole order crab roll is 3oz or 6oz of crab. The bun and sides are the same. $19 for half or $32 for whole. Granted, it's good. But I don't know if it's *that* good. Dungeness is in season and local. It just seems like too high of a margin for a dish served on a metal tray with paper on it. 

We also got the BBQ oysters, wedge salad and the sole special. Those dishes were good, too, but I was surprised they didn't serve the oysters in 6 or 12 (or 6/8)-- they come in 4/6, so our ravenous selves ordered 2 full orders so we could each eat 4. 

I liked the wine options, even if they didn't always match the cuisine (a Carol Shelton zin available by the glass?!) but I also couldn't see myself drinking Zinfandel with crab :/ 

All told-- worth a visit, but know you'll be spending a lot ($30-45/pp to feel full) and don't bother at all (or bring a lot of patience) if you're more than a 2-top.
author: Krista L.

description: Food was decent. We asked for grilled fish for our tacos instead of fried and the waitress said they could not do that. Really. Could not or would not. Bad business. The man who brought our order just dropped it in front of us and as he rushed away I asked for catsup. He seems annoyed. The waitress never appeared  again to see how our food was. Disappointing.
author: Annette C.

description:
I am from the northeast, these are the best lobster rolls anywhere outside of New England.  I like the onion rings, fries and cole slaw as well.

Can get busy though, and the lobster rolls aren't cheap.
author: T B.

description: Love this place. I had thier squid ink pasta it was great. This is one of my favorite restraints in sf.
author: Hong V.

description:
The service was great! Only one waiter/hostess on the floor but he did a wonderful job being very attentive! 
The Food was outstanding!!!!! Not an overstatement. My mother had the Toasted Butter Dungeon Roll. She said the crab was outstanding. I enjoyed the Grilled Artichoke stuffed with Crab and Shrimp. I had never had grilled artichoke and this made me want to go home and cook it myself! Delicious!!
author: Meagan A.

description: walked in an hour before they closed, we were promptly seated. cute little spot, friendly service, amazing seafood! we had the fish tacos (3) and fish and chips. crispy flavorful goodness. and the oysters, too! a must-go.
author: Ana J.

description:
MM what a great find!! I'd give it 4.5 stars if I could. I'm so happy I found this place through Yelp, it was the perfect ending to my amazing weekend :)  I came here around 6pm on a Sunday with a party of 4 and we waited about 20-30 mins to get seated. Our server gave us bread and semi-melted butter to munch on while we looked through the menus. Bread was alright, it would have been better served warm/hot. But I liked that the butter was semi-melted because it spread easily. 

I ordered the dungeness crab melt and split the Harford clam chowder bowl with my friend. What's Hartford clam chowder you ask? Yeah, didn't know what it was either until today. It's basically new england clam chowder with a splash of manhattan clam chowder in the middle. It was GREAT. Order this if you come here! It's served with lots of clam and it was really really yummy. Consistency was also perfect - not too watery or too thick/floury. The crab melt was also so delicious and it came with a side of fries and coleslaw. I was really really full after this meal. 

My friends' foods were also mouth-watering. They got the baja fish tacos, the ahi tuna sandwich (special for the day), and the iceberg salad with shrimp. I didn't get to try the first two things, but I did eat some of that salad, and it was wonderful!! They put a LOT of shrimp on that thing, probably 30 pieces if I had to guess. At the end we split the bill into 4 cards and they were really sweet about it, unlike some other restaurant waiters who roll their eyes and say they can't do it. I ended up paying $21.50 total after tip. 

Loved this place :) Highly recommend it!
author: Amanda C.

description:
My cousin and I would do anything for good grinds as long as its pescetarian-friendly for her. That means walking two miles from St. Patrick's after mass just to get there. After going through a couple of hills and streets we finally made it to the joint. Trust me, that plus the 20 minute wait was well worth it and here are our reasons why.

THE DIGS and SERVICE:

As small is this location may be, it brought a world-class, nautical charm with its white walls and dark floors. A beautifully dim-lit room helped to accent the sparsely decorated room, complete with an animated piece of art hanging on the wall. On top of that, the wait staff and hostess were friendly and attentive, despite having to deal with multiple parties waiting to grub on seafood. No missed guests here. No siree bob.

THE GRINDS:

Clam Chowder: I've had many a clam chowder in my day from canned to fresh, and this by far was the best I've ever had. The clams are thick, detectable pieces bathed in a thick, velvety cream and wine reduction sauce. Forget trying to soak the broth in oyster crackers. This soup is stand alone delicious.

Lobster Rolls: Had this been cheaper, I would have definitely grabbed the larger size. The lobster meat were thick chunks blended with little mayo sauce and shoved into a buttery roll, served with slaw and fries. My only setback, well.. my cousin's only setback was that couldn't switch out the slaw and fries. Understandable though. 

I'm glad we were able to take a chance on this place. This was the first time I've ever had a lobster roll and it was worth the experience. Hopefully if I ever make my way up to the bay again, I'll definitely come through again.
author: Myleen A.

description: 2nd time at woodhouse.... It's been excellent both times....  Very small, but casual.  The food has been second to none and the service is on point.  Had he lobster roll.  A+.... The guy next to me just ordered a second round of the fish tacos!  6 of them total
author: Cliff C.

description:
Woodhouse Fish Co. is the perfect place to go if you have a hankering for seafood without having to go to the pier or a fancy restaurant. The clam chowder was as good as any and the oysters were fresh and delicious.
