I didn't enjoy the sauce that accompanied the steamed mussels because there was too much thyme or something else (so much so that it was reminiscent of smelling like weed - then again, it is San Francisco). 

Having lived in Maine for a few months, I can now compare all lobster rolls to the gold standard. The rolls here were lightly dressed and packed with claw meat. The roll wasn't cheap, but surely worth the cost of not having to travel to the Northeast. And, no seafood dinner in the city is complete without a pint of Anchor Steam to wash it all down.
author: Bailey Z.

description: Wanted somewhere more convenient than the wharf for chowder and found this one here, of course. Sat at counter, a bowl of creamy, clam-filled chowder, and I'm sold. As good as Scoma's, the benchmark of NE clam chowder, but probably 3-4 ounces more @ Woodhouse. And at the same price. Dude next to me had a lobster sandwich and crab cakes and both looked amazing, as did the fish and chips, so flaky and fresh. Street parking relatively simple, at least for lunch. Nice people, stop in.
author: Art M.

description:
We went there Saturday and we were satisfied. The place is very nice, we went at 8:30pm so we found a place right away. We ordered 1 clam chowder, 1 fried clam plats and fish nachos and 2 beers.
The clam chowder was incredibly tasty, the fried clam not so good, and the fish nachos were also really good. 
We spent 100$ (tip not included), which was a lot for that 3 dishes and 2 beers, but if you want so badly a good clam chowder, this is the place to go.
author: Viviana D.

description:
*MICE** Last night after the rush died down we were paying the bill and suddenly saw mice running around under the tables!! 
I have really liked this place for a long time but last night was a deal breaker. I think the food is great and the service pretty friendly but to me mice means the sanitation is lacking...... Sad to go.
author: Christopher C.

description:
Solid seafood joint. Been to both this location and the one in the Castro - both good, though this place is more spacious. 

What I loved:
- Steamed clams: they have it listed as a starter but the clams are huge and meaty and they give you a big portion. I would eat it as a meal alone next time. Best deal on the menu for $15. 

What I liked:
- Lobster roll: Nice chunks of lobster. A tad too much mayo for my taste, but still pretty good. 
- Make your own Arnold Palmer! As someone who loves Arnold Palmers but find most premade ones overly sweet, I'm so happy you can customize the tartness and sweetness here. 

What disappointed:
- The shrimp cocktail: my friend got this. 3 shrimp for $14?! No way. Better get a second order of those clams instead
author: Han Z.

description: I highly recommend this place for lunch! Great ambiance and great food. Raw oysters are $2.00 each which is almost a steal for non-happy hour prices in the city! My boyfriend and I shared a large Maine Lobster Roll ($27) which was served with a side of fries and coleslaw, delicious! The lobster meat was fresh and texture/quality was great! I'll be back next time to try the Cioppino and clam chowder!
author: Lynn T.

description:
I thought this place was a-OK!

Definitely like the decor here.

Got here on a Saturday lunch time and it was not yet crowded. There was one server who attended to us. 

We got a beer to split, oysters (you order them in pairs) a bowl of their New England clam chowder and their crab melt. 

We got the soup first it was good- clams were good and it was on the creamier side but not bad! 

Next we got the oysters- they were pretty small but definitely fresh- I'd have to say the oysters from the pier 1 are tastier and fresher but maybe I'm just being picky. 

Our crab Sando came next but it came a good 10 mins after our oysters.. It was kind of a long wait for 1 sandwich considering it was not busy at that time and the sandwich is tiny and I wouldn't imagine difficult or time consuming to make but maybe they got tied up in the kitchen? 

The sandwich was not bad. Fries nothing out of the ordinary. Overall I'd say give it a try but nothing here blew me away.
author: Sam L.

description:
The other night i was craving some seafood and it was getting late so I found this on yelp. It was in a good location, surprisingly found parking across street too. 

Woodhouse caught my attention for the lobster roll, I decided to try the 6 oz big boy for 30 something dollars. It comes with french fries that are salty like MickyDs fries.:.weird. The side veggie was plain. The lobster roll was good, nothing special. I was disappointed for the pricing that it was missing better taste. 

I feel like this place is only seemed to be amazing is because EVERYONE is drinking their ass off to not care. I was only drinking a coke with my meal. Couple next to me pouring out their feelings with the bottle of wine they shared. 

The staff is very friendly and professional is why I rate it above 3 star. Awesome place to come to have fun, need to come back and try the other items on the menu. Maybe change my mind about it.
author: Yosof R.

description: The service at this place was really good, I went on a Saturday and got seated right away. However I was disappointed with my clam chowder order, i thought that place served it in a bread bowl. When my order came out it was in a small bowl, it was cold and it contained pieces of unwanted and unwelcome leaves which gave it a tangy aftertaste.
author: Bianca Mellado ..

description:
I went like two weeks ago again with a friend for dinner, we didn't wait too long for seating. 

We ended up getting the Dungeness crab roll and cheddar melt crab roll to split amongst us. The Dungeness crab was super delicious and soft and also there was a good amount of crab on it too. As for the cheddar melt, meh it was alright but I don't think I'd get it again. Be warned though it's small and it cost $2 extra for veggies in a small cup???
author: Christian R.

description: Been here twice and I'll have to drop the rating on this place since my last visit. When the server asked me what size I wanted for my lobster roll, I told her a large size because I was planning on sharing with my bf. However I did not know it just meant additional lobster meat because she didn't clarify on that. The lobster roll was good but I remember it being even better last time. We also got the clam chowder, half shell oysters and the salmon linguini. Everything we ordered tasted good except the salmon linguini, which tasted pretty bland. The food is a bit overpriced in my opinion but then again a location like this isn't cheap.
author: Joyce C.

description:
Food, good. Service, good. Hostesss: TERRIBLE.

We came here during the weekend of the Ramen Yokocho fest. We weren't willing to gamble 2-4 hours of our time in line to MAYBE get some ramen when we got to the front. So after wandering around, we came here.

My friend and I tried the Make your own Arnold Palmer. It comes with a glass with ice and unsweetened lemon juice, with tea and liquid sugar on the side. My issue was that the lemon juice was literally just lemon juice, so it actually started tasting better when the ice melted...

As for the food, we shared an order of calamari, full lobster roll, and fries. The calamari was delicious! The batter was perfectly crispy and the calamari itself tasted fresh. I mean, it's a seafood place, it better have fresh calamari! The lobster roll was surprisingly filling. The lobster roll here comes undressed, without butter and cold. It' so simple, and it's perfect with a little squeeze of lemon. The french fries were good, too.

The wait was long, but it can be 100% attributed to the really incompetent hostess that was working there. She'd just sit at her hostess booth and take down everyone's name without any regard for the open spaces available already. Half of the restaurant cleared out before she even called a party, which just backed up the line. Letting people sit down all at once also makes the servers busier and backs up the kitchen. That's actually why a lot of restaurants, when they open, let in small groups at a time, so that they don't get busy all at once. She needs to go.

But other than that, it was a perfectly delicious meal in SF!
author: Patricia L.

description:
Loved this place! Went there for my friend's birthday lunch, the service was great. We got seated pretty quickly. Our server, I apologize for not knowing his name, was great he was nice and super friendly and always made sure that we were okay. 

Food was delicious, oily but yummy! Fries were mm, I got a dungeness crab melt, which was really good! My friends commented on how good the fries were!

Prices are above 14, but it's seafood!

Overall, super yummy filling and friendly.
author: Sandy L.

description:
Daughter and her BF took us here for my birthday, very sweet of them. Taking the muni had brought back fond memories. 

We were happy to find the place not too crowded, probably because they don't have a big screen TV on the night of game 5 of WS.  It's a cozy place in a casual setting, our waitress was very pleasant and attentive. 

To start we shared the grilled squid appetizer, clam chowder and local beers, all excellent. The main dishes were Fish & Chips, Lobster Roll, Crab Louie and Cioppino. Fish & Chips were one of the best we've had for a while, lobster roll and the Louie salad were also delicious definitely worthy of 4 stars. The Cioppino I had high hope for was a little disappointing.... although very impressive looking i.e. large bowl filled with seafood in a spicy tomato sauce, the shell fish lacked the fresh sweetness I was craving for. I'd probably rate it as a 3.

Overall a very enjoyable dinner, will be happy to come back for what they do well.
author: Julie W.

description:
PLEASANT SURPRISE for a saturday lunch! 

Ordered onion rings, crab cake, split top lobster roll & dungeness crab melt sandwiches.

It may be a little pricey for a sandwich but worth every penny for such hefty loaded AND delicious lobster and crab meat on your sandwiches. I personally liked the crab sandwich, the bread was buttery and soft. The onion rings were crispy and superb too! 

Ambiance is fresh, simple, and actually bigger than what I imagined it would be. The service is not too friendly, but definitely won't regret tasting~ hands down one of the best sandwich places.

Will probably be going back soon!
author: Misha L.

description:
I came to Woodhouse Fish Co. with a craving for their lobster roll. The roll choice was interesting, though a bit dry (thankfully, it wasn't soaking in butter). The amount of lobster was generous...but then again, it should be for $28! The whole dish itself, I thought, was just average. My friend ordered fish and chips with the added malt vinegar. This was also okay...if you want good fish&chips, I'd recommend Loulou's Grille in Monterey.

Overall, I do find the lobster roll overhyped. I wasn't wowed by any of the dishes from my party. 

P.S I sat at the counter and there were hooks under the table for bags and whatnot.
author: Lisa Z.

description:
More like a 3.5. 
Had the crab melt and the lobster roll. Plenty of meat in both sandwiches although I ordered a small. Lobster roll was okay but I didn't like the sauce too much. Crab had the same sauce with cheese i think but didnt taste as good. The bread was great.
Fries were crispy and nice.
Oyster was excellent and really fresh. Got the kumamotos. Highly recommend.
author: Rachel L.

description: I was in San Francisco for work and wanted to try some seafood. I got their lobster roll and it is one of the best I have ever had! I highly recommend this place if you are ever in San Francisco. Can't wait until I come back!
author: Bernard M.

description: Just came back recently and was disappointed to find out that the lobster roll was smaller and the lobster didn't seem as fresh.
author: C L.

description:
Wow, wow, wow, wow, wow. Um, yeah, wow. I left this place and wanted to go right back.  I need swear words to express this meal, and it's because it's one of those "hot damn" or "holy $#1+" moments when you put the food in your mouth and your taste buds just light up.

We had dinner there. We tried the calamari, ceviche, clam chowder. crab cakes, bay shrimp roll, and cioppino. It was all good! The only disappointment came from my son who was thinking Asian when he ordered the "shrimp roll" and got a sandwich, so he just ate all of the inside and left the bread alone. My wife and I should have caught that, but oh well no one is perfect.

The place was busy, we were lucky to get a table but there were people waiting not long after we were seated.  The staff were friendly and checked in on us regularly. Not cheap, but not outrageous for SF.

One final thought. This place has the second best cioppino I have ever had (the other in SF as over in the Italian section of town). It's one of my favorite foods and I'm really passionate about it so being second place isn't a small thing to me (there are lots o places that make it and most of them are a great disappointment, not here!)
author: Sean S.

description:
I've been to @WoodhouseFish a few times now and they have had consistently great seafood, service and satisfaction.

There, got the alliteration out of the way.  

Oysters, fish and chips and even lobstah rolls and chowdah that stand the test of a formah Bahstun resident (that would be me, losah).

I'll be back even though I'm sure they follow another baseball team out here... #Chowdah
author: Jim W.

description:
Solid 4 stars, I was very happy with my meal! I ordered the smaller portion of the Toasted-buttered Dungeness Crab Roll, which was buttery and very fresh. This paired well with the fresh and light coleslaw that came with the order, and with my St. Archer beer of course! 
My boyfriend ordered the Lobster Roll and was equally satisfied. 

Would love to come back and try their Cioppino, along with their Linguine.
author: Valerie K.

description: The seafood is always fresh and delicious here! They rotate in daily specials on the board to mix it up but otherwise the menu doesn't change much. I always love ordering the cioppino as it comes with a large variety of seafood and the broth is really tasty. They have a few different types of clam chowder which I love, too.
author: Roberta V.

description:
Very casual cafe ambience but good simple food. We loved the fish tacos and lobster rolls. The crab cakes were good but not as lovable.
The do it yourself Arnold Palmer is fun to order.
author: Cheryl D.

description:
TUESDAY $1 OYSTERS ALL DAY. Must I need to say more?

The dollar oysters are oyster of the day. However, they do have other selections of oysters to choose from. The oysters come out shucked for you and presents on a bed of ice. They do a great job at shucking oysters, I've never had a grainy oyster or pieces of shell in it. They're oysters have always been real fresh.

I always got their calamari too. You must always squeeze that lemon on top your calamari! It's nice and crispy with that hint of acidity from the lemon. yumm delicious.

Their clam chowder is pretty good too. Good portion of clams and not too thick of a chowder. 

I have yet to try their lobster rolls, but I heard they're amaze-balls. 

Service has always been decent here.

Price isn't cheap, I mean you're paying for seafood.

I've always had a great experience here and I've never left unsatisfied and disappointed. I will definitely be back.

P.S they don't take reservations, so if you go on a busy day expect a wait. They try their best to accommodate as many people as they can in the little amount of space they have.
author: Stephanie L.

description: This is one hell of a place to have a bite and enjoy great seafood! There's nothing that we were unsatisfied with.....A must come back to and four stars for the great service! You guys rocked it out!!! Happy Thursday YELPERS
author: Danielle T.

description:
I have been wanting to go and try out Woodhouse Fish Co. for the longest time, but I've never made it over there yet. This past weekend, they had a booth at Outside Lands and as soon as I saw the Lobster Roll sign, I darted over immediately to get one. I've had Lobster Rolls here and there and typically they have been disappointing. But not the one from here - the lobster was fresh/delicious and the bread they put it on was heavenly - thick, toasted to a perfect degree and so buttery. Their Lobster Roll was so good that I had it TWICE over the weekend - for the second one, I wasn't even hungry but I couldn't pass it up since I was near their booth.

Now I definitely need to make a trip to one of their restaurant locations sometime.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
To be honest.  I don't know what the big hype is about this place. We came here yesterday 10/4 for my dad's birthday.  Not exactly what we thought it was. The menu is very limited.

The fried calamari was extremely bland.

My shrimp sandwich was just baby shrimp with mayo on a sourdough roll with slaw on the side and french fries. Nothing special, didn't have any sort of flavor.  Must be why they put so many condiments on the table.

My dad got a dungeness crab sandwich. It was so salty he could not even finish it. He even got some clam chowder to start off and good thing or else he would've have been left hungry !

My brother got the dungeness crab Louis salad. No big deal, salty crab and just some lettuce and tomatoes tossed together. 

One of the waitresses that was helping us with the red hair could've had a better attitude. I asked for iced water specifically. She brings me warm water no ice. When I asked her for some ice she gave me attitude and said yeah sure. Hey lady,  not my problem you didn't get what I ordered the first time I told you. Since then she had attitude the entire time we were there, which made the food taste worst  and environment even more uncomfortable. I felt so bad that this was my dad's birthday lunch. Probably could've gotten something better just down at wharf.

Maybe this place is a hit or miss type of place. We definitely came on a bad day.

Also, it did not help that the tables are so close to.each other, and they let a woman in with her dog sit next to us!! That was the cherry on top of how bad this place was.

Will definitely not be returning to this establishment.
author: Coraline J.

description:
We ordered the Split Top Lobster Roll and it was delicious. Amazing, fresh meat. This was the dish recommended to us by locals and it is definitely worthy of the recommendation! If you go to Woodhouse, go ahead and order the lobster roll. You won't regret it.

The Fish & Chips were also really tasty! I'm not a huge tartar sauce fan but my husband said it was probably the best tartar sauce he's ever had. I would have liked the batter to be a bit crispier but I really can't complain.

The service was also really great. The restaurant is fairly small but so quaint and so yummy!
author: Rachel F.

description: Went here for my birthday dinner. All I wanted for my birthday was crab and I got it. Very simple casual place. Was able to get a table quickly on a Saturday night. Crab was awesome! The broth was also very good. Will be coming back
author: Aaron J.

description: So stopped by here calamar was good lobster roll bomb but the fish sticks personally had to much batter and not so great but the clam chowder delicious
author: Javier P.

description:
I absolutely love lobster rolls even if it does put a dent in my wallet. The lobster rolls here are perfect; the bread is nicely toasted and there is no skimp on the lobster. The lobster meat was fresh and had great flavor. My friend has the crab sandwich and she said it was perfectly battered and she could taste the freshness and quality in the crab. 

Besides the amazing food, the service was exceptional as well; the server always came over to ask how we were doing. We came on a random say so it wasn't crowded. If you love fresh seafood this is a pretty perfect place.
author: Michelle H.

description: Came here after reading reviews, however was disappointed. Food was average, lobster roll, dungeoness crab and clam chowder didn't impress us.
author: Charmaine C.

description:
Not quite a 4 but rounding up.
Had the Maine lobster roll. Let me first say that I prefer the Connecticut style better than the Maine style but this is was good. You can choose from two sizes. I opted for the smaller one which was a good size for a snack.

It was pretty good except for the fact that the meat was slightly rubbery and chewy. 
The bread was well buttered and toasted.
The fries were overcooked and the coleslaw was average.

The buttered Dungeness crab roll wasn't bad either. 
They have raw oysters for $2 which were the Blue Points and Hendersons. And their premium was $3 which were the Kumamotos.  They were all good but I rarely meet an oyster that I do not enjoy.
author: Heejin L.

description:
Hands down best New England Clam Chowder on this coast.  It was thick, full of clams, just creamy enough and full of flavor. I only wish we didn't split a bowl three ways...but then again, we could not have finished our small orders of the lobster, crab and grilled crab cake rolls. All three were amaaaahzing. I also ordered their fresh lemonade which came deconstructed as iced juice of a few lemons, simple syrup and water with gas. It was refreshing and perfect for today's sunny weather. 

I cannot wait to come back. I'm unsure if I'd want to try these hits again or explore their other options.
author: Beverly R.

description: My lobster roll was just ok. The lobster is served cold. It would have been so much better if it had been warm.  The best lobster roll I have ever had was in Boston and it was $25. This one was $36 and really nothing to write home about.
author: Grace A.

description: Stumbled upon this spot in the Fillmore and their Lobster Roll is to die for. Hands down HIGHLY RECOMMEND. Also, their bread pudding - completely changed my mind about bread pudding. I am officially a fan. So good.
author: Lindsey K.

description:
MUST ORDER DISHES:
*Fried Whole Belly Ipswich Clams - Delicious!  We didn't know what Ipswich clams where so we asked our waitress.  She described them as a cross between an oyster and squid.  The Ipswich clams were large, chewy and full of flavor.  If you can't decide between the Ipswich clams and the calamari, order the clams!
*Cioppino - AMAZINGLY & DELICIOUS!!  Being allergic to fish, I'm not able to order cioppino at many restaurants because it contains fish or fish stock.  Woodhouse uses a tomato bisque broth and throws in mussels, bay scallops, clams, crab meat, a shrimp, and fish.  The bisque was extremely flavorful and has you wanting more bread. 

OTHER DISHES:
*Clam Chowder - The chowder was good and contained diced potatoes, small chopped clams, and topped with a dash of chives.  We split a bowl of chowder among the three of us and it was a perfect serving size.
*Fried Calamari - Good, but nothing special about it.  Both rings and legs were lightly breaded and deep fried and served with both a marinara and an aioli sauce.  
*Crab Cakes - Not a fan.  The crab was bland and the crab cakes contained too much bell peppers, therefore it tasted more like a bell pepper cake (if there is such a thing).  More of the spicy chipotle sauce may have helped the dish.  I ended up only taking a few bites and passing the rest to my friend.   

WHAT TO KNOW:
*No reservations - on a Thursday night, we were given an hour wait time, however we were seated about 30 minutes later
*Portions are decently sized - we had leftovers
*Parking can be a bit difficult to find
*Another location located on Market Street
*Crabs are decently priced, but unfortunately they were out that day

SERVICE:
Our waitress was nice and double checked with the kitchen to make sure the cioppino broth did not contain fish.  She wasn't great on the wine recommendations though.  I wanted a white wine that was on the dry side and she said all their wines were pretty dry...the house chardonnay was not...
author: Nicole S.

description:
Came here for brunch with a friend on a Saturday -- there was 0 wait time. The decor was quite cute and service was great. 

I ordered the shrimp and avocado roll and she had the clam chowder. We also ordered a side of garlic bread. Overall the meal was pretty good but I would say the fries were standard and the garlic bread was just okay.
author: Siv L.

description:
Arrived here as they were opening at 11:30 right after 18 holes at golden gate park. My first impression of the inside was that The establishment had a very comfortable vibe. Te walls are decorated with old times photos and fishing memorabilia, and they have an adorable little tv playing an old fishing film in a little fake window. 

Meow to the food...we started with 30 oysters since it was $1 oyster Tuesdays. They were VERY good and quite fresh. Unfortunately they were also extremely  tiny, so maybe don't go all out on 30 like we did haha ^_^ 
After which we had their calamari which was good, and their fish and chips. Only the two piece, which I'm glad about because the pieces ended up being quite large. Otherwise they weren't the best I've had but at te same time if you're hungry they aren't bad and they aren't over priced. I feel for me they just didn't have the most flavor. 


Ok so overall. GREAT place after hangin out with friends and you're all looking to go somewhere pleasant that isn't over priced and has a nice staff. 3 Stars!
author: Nicholas C.

description: Had to wait 1.5 hour for a random night for 4 people. Thus 4 stars. But the food was bomb! The best ciopino ever! We also got lobster roll and they def give you lobster. The clam chowder was also excellent. We were very satisfied after our dinner and would come back again when in town.
author: Kiara K.

description:
Lobster roll! Get the lobster roll. It has a good amount of lobster chunks in butter stuffed in a buttery toasted bread. Yay for butter! Sides come with some fries and a cole slaw. If you like aioli with your fries like me then don't order it here. The aioli was not super tasty, was watery with too much lemon. Ketchup with fries is the way to go or even some malt vinegar. There were smaller or larger options for the lobster roll and although I got the smaller one, felt that for a few bucks more could've finished the larger portion without a prob. 

I ended up sharing the chocolate mousse with raspberries and whip which was surprisingly delicious. I'd recommend ordering that to finish off the meal, since it wasn't too much and reasonably priced.

Good place for lunch and those craving some seafood.
author: Laurel P.

description: I love a good seafood spot and this little restaurant on the west coast gives a nice New England vibe. When I came in they had $1 oysters which my friend and I indulged in and ordered 8? Well worth the price! :D ordered their lobster rolls because all I want in life is a good lobster roll and theirs was a good heaping of lobster in a split brioche? Bread. It could have used a little more salt, but their service was great, so I gave them the extra star. It is a bit cramped so the table next to us was practically a part of our conversation, but we all know what the real estate prices are in San Francisco so not faulting the restaurant for that. But thought I'd give fair warning because my friend and I was obviously intruding the couple who was next to us who were trying to have a date night while we discuss our lives x), so I apologize to the couples who sat next to us. Will definitely want to come back to try their crab cakes and other seafood fare!
author: linda p.

description:
Solid solid seafood with little to no wait if you don't mind bar seating. A good lobster roll with a bunch of other seafood options. My clams were great and the fries that come with the lobster roll were solid.

Happy to find a nice restaurant with solid food in a nice walk able region of town. Standard good seafood spot that is way nicer than your Red Lobster or such, but won't compete with the high end joints. Not bad. Thanks!
author: Joseph L.

description:
BOMBDOTCOM!

I loved EVERYTHING about this restaurant.

[+] Lobster Roll (MUST GET) DELISH!!
[+] Decor is AMAZING!
[+] Service was excellent
[+] A little pricey but you DO get what you pay for
[+] They have specials that changes
[+] Coleslaw
[+] Fries were awesome
[+] Premium oysters = A MUST (I only had three because I'm on a diet) SNIFFF

[-] Prepare for long lines
[-] Hard to find parking
author: Tammy F.

description:
After biking along the Marina, my boyfriend and I were hungry. I asked if he was down to have a lobster roll... the only thing is that we have to travel 1 mile to get there. My boyfriend was down, so we made the trip. What our tourist asses didn't know was that the 1 mile included some of the steepest hills in SF... and we traveled on foot... WITH BIKES.

So the adventure going to Woodhouse was hell for us.. but the lobster roll made it ALL WORTH IT. We got the lobster roll with fries, with extra lobster lol. $26 for one. My oh my.... the lobster roll was bangin. The lobster was so succulent and the seasonings were perfecto. And with lemon? Wow. The toasted brioche that was served with the lobster was also delicious. You would think the fries were just a filler but no... the fries were also very good. OMG. We savored every bite with inappropriate sounds. It was THAT good.

On top of that, service was friendly and the restaurant was pretty cool... it had this super East Coast nautical theme going on. 

Overall, we had such a yummy experience. Woodhouse will definitely be one of the first stops we visit when we come back to SF. Thanks!
author: Felicia L.

description: Awesome food! Had the large lobster roll which is overflowing with delicious lobster meat. Seriously had to eat a significant amount of just the meat off of it just to be able to eat the sandwich! That's my kind of lobster roll. Had the whole belly Ipswich friend clams which were also fantastic. Clam chowder was excellent too. All in all everything we tried was great and I would gladly go back in a heartbeat! For the amount and quality you got I felt the price was pretty reasonable too. Fantastic seafood spot in SF!
author: Nick J.

description:
Definitely expect a wait here! The restaurant is not too big, dim lit and loud. The service was exceptional. I have to say the servers were very accommodating and friendly. They always had a smile on their face even when try brought the bad news that they were all out of lobster rolls for the night. But that was because we had a really late dinner. I think like 8:30 to 9. 

Anyways, I ended up ordering the dungeoness crab melt sandwich. The server said it's actually his favorite so I decided to switch. Pretty disappointment that I didn't get to try the lobster roll but the crab melt made up for it. The roll is about $2 cheaper than the lobster roll and filled with flavor and buttery goodness! It comes with crispy golden fries and cole slaw. I ordered a small and are everything! When the bill came I noticed a discount on the crab melt because we didn't get to have what we originally wanted. Which is definitely a nice gesture! 

I would definitely come back to try out the lobster roll.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Today I came in to have lunch with two friends. We were rapidly seated and were given menus immediately. 
There was only one Waiter during the busy lunch hour. I am giving this place 3 stars for the poor service. We waited a long time to catch the servers attention but he was so busy that it was impossible for him to even catch a glimpse of us. My friend had to ask the hostess to order through him instead. The food was great. I got a cup of the New England clam chowder which is so worth getting and an order of the crab melt that came with crispy delicious fries and cole slaw. Overall the food and price was great but I hope they work on getting more people to help during rush hour!
author: Stacy G.

description:
This is our new lazy Sunday afternoon go to/ post hangover spot. Also love the movie picture frame of the Bay!

GET:

- Clam chowder cup. They also offer half red half white chowder cups.

- Beer Battered Cod fish & chips! Bomb tartare sauce & fries!!

- XL Lobster roll. Our best bet outside of NYC. Don't forget to mix in some coleslaw.

- for veggies: Iceberg Louis salad with shrimp., comes with a boiled egg! Yum!!

- Strawberry short cake: wasn't the best I've had but surprisingly tasty! We picked on it non stop and almost finished the whole thing while talking...  If you can't stop eating it, that's always a good sign.

Service is awesome and attentive! Can't wait to come back for more yummy meals!!
author: Amber S.

description: Orgasmic experience! Lol.. My first time here, but not the last. Lobster roll, New England Clam Chowder and Fish n Chips were the Best!!! Even the tartar sauce was deelishus! The batter on the fish was so flaky and light. Fries were not greasy and very crispy! Plenty of lobster on the lobster roll. Overall, just Great Tasty food!...oh, did I mention "good service" too?
author: tk t.

description:
I ordered the fish and chips and was delighted with how the fish was battered. It wasn't too caked on where I was just eating fried batter and wasn't too too light where the fish wouldn't hold it's form if you picked it up with your hand. I always go for the perfect bite and use malt vinegar with tartar sauce after squeezing fresh lime.

Secondly, the french fries are well seasoned and since they are thin cut they are crunchy throughout. Pretty good spot but I think that it is a little pricy for what you get. Would be a five star location if there was a 10-15% price cut.
author: Jason W.

description:
Great place for a date. Cutest restaurant decor and nice atmosphere. 

They have a flat screen tv that is covered with a picture frame so it looks like you're just looking at a painting. They play a video of famous spots around the city- it's a pretty lengthy video too, I didn't see any repeats my entire meal. Also made me feel like I was sitting at the pier enjoying my meal by the water at one point.

Anyways, I ordered the ciopinno and shared with my boyfriend. It was a little pricey ($27) and the portion wasn't that big. But at least every clam and mussel was filled with meat, unlike many other places I've tried. It also had one large piece of crab, scallop, and fish in it as well. The soup (or sauce?) was delicious. I think I only got full bc I drank it all with the bread. 

Their service is very friendly and attentive. Always came back to refill our water and had recommendations on the menu. 

Although I do feel like you're mostly paying for the atmosphere of the restaurant. Felt like a nice restaurant ocean side of the pier.
author: Joanna T.

description: This is a great place. We moved to the neighborhood recently and have eaten here a few times. The jalapeno crab legs are fresh and delicious. The crab melt is also very good for lunch. I had the squid ink linguine with crab last night and it was fantastic. The atmosphere is very pleasant and the beer and wine selection is very good.
author: Doug B.

description:
I'd suggest making a reservation if you don't want to wait. Clam chowder, oysters, fish tacos and lobster roll were all bombbb. If I had to choose a favorite I would choose the fish tacos, sorry I'm basic. 

There is only one bathroom unfortunately. I waited so long at one point I gave up to return to my food then came back later to a longer line. That is the only con I can think of!
author: Holly N.

description: The sauce in BBQ Oysters tastes like Champagne! So delicious. We ordered BBQ Oysters, Fish & Chips, Crab Cakes with Salad, Tomato Claw Chowder. Love this Restaurant!
author: Vanessa Z.

description:
It's a little restaurant and decorated as if you're right by the sea. The tables were set too close together, but it wasn't a totally big issue; it probably made the restaurant a bit more intimate if anything. 

Service was okay. Our waitress didn't bring out our drinks after waiting for her for 10+ minutes, so we had to ask another employee. Appetizers came out LAST. 

I specifically wanted to try this place for their Maine lobster roll (and also because of great Yelp reviews), but left disappointed. Sure there were huge chunks of lobster, but overall, it just tasted so, so bland. I enjoyed the side of fries and garlic bread though.

Two entrees and a side came out to about $60. Was it worth it? Nope.
author: Robinne D.

description:
Been here twice and will come back again and again. The first time was after a shift at work (around 4:30pm on a weekday), and there were hardly any patrons and we were seated right away. The second time was on a Saturday night and we were a party of 5 (most tables are for parties of 2 or 4, since it's so small) and waited about an hour to be seated...but it was well worth the wait. Haven't tried other places like this around the city but since we're familiar with this place now, we like the "stick to what you know" idea.

Lobster rolls were definitely an A+ and a must when we come. Other dishes to make note of are the creamy and clam-filled clam chowder, and the tasty and plentiful cioppino. A fun thing they also do is a create-your-own lemonade or Arnold Palmer, where they give you the simple syrup and iced tea so you can adjust the taste to your liking. Also, I haven't tried them yet but the stuffed artichokes and the seafood pasta look amazing.

Don't know when we'll be back but can't wait til we do!
author: Veronica N.

description: This is an excellent casual fish restaurant. Everything was fresh and fantastic. My wife loves the oysters.
author: Michael C.

description:
The environment was pretty cool for a restaurant like this. The decor matched with the theme. 

We ordered clam chowder, crab cakes, fish & chips, and Sprite. 

Pricing: a little on the high side for the portion sizes ($10 for a bowl of clam chowder?!?)

Taste: if you're a fan of food tasting good, better stick to the clam chowder. The salad that came the crab cakes was really bad, tasted like plastic, and there was crab shell in the crab cakes. The fish and chips was a horrible recommendation by our server. The fish tasted like battered water and the fries were gross. Even the Sprite we ordered was flat. 

Only thing we ordered tonight that was worth anything was the clam chowder, and even then, would not recommend simply for the pricing.
author: Scott H.

description: Came here  on a Friday at 12pm for lunch celebrating a co-worker's bday. We were somewhat of a big-ish group, but we were able to be seated pretty quickly at the bar . Got the crab melt, it was sooo yummy! Service was great and they were all so kind!
author: Mirella E.

description: Hands down the best fish & chips in the city. Extra flaky Alaskan Cod, bacon-free clam chowder and a crab sandwich that is not drenched in butter. Thanks for bringing the PNW to The City.
author: Mack F.

description:
It's Christmas time. A time to celebrate the holidays with family with love and great food. Chestnuts roasting on an open fire, egg nog with brandy, fruit cake, honey glazed ham. These are holiday foods I would crave. But for someone reason right now I wanted fish! Seafood! When it's craving comes I have to satisfy it! So the Woodhouse fish company is what I decided on. An excellent choice I must say!

They had some delicious sounding stuff on the menu! Crab Stuffed artichoke, Cioppono, fish n chips, BBQ oysters, raw oysters, crispy calamari, crab cakes, lobster roll! What to choose?! I decided on the fish n chip and top split toast lobster roll! Delicious! The fish n chips was yumtastic. Big pieces of fish! Really flaky and full of fish! The breading was crisp and light. Dipped in the tarter sauce with a squirt of lemon OMG! Heavenly! The lobster roll was extra delicious! A buttery toasted roll split on top and stuffed with sweet refreshing lobster chunks! Another squeeze of lemon just brings it to another level of flavor town! 

For dessert I tried the sourdough bread pudding and that was amazing too! Served hot, surprisingly the sourdough bread had a nice sweetness to it with a hint of sourness at the end, very different! This is an excellent place to have lunch or dinner. The ambience is friendly, the restaurant itself is charming, not huge but comfortable. Most definitely a place I will be coming back to again for my seafood!
author: Roger P.

description:
CLAM CHOWDER and LOBSTER ROLL. They've got to be award winning here. 

Speaking as a clam chowder and lobster lover, Woodhouse Fish Co. did not fail to deliver me the goods. Kudos to them for meeting my high expectations for these specific food items. 

The chowder was perfectly made in my opinion, and I so rarely say this for any joint that I go to. A variety of little details gone awry can easily make me frown when it comes to clam chowder. For instances: I hate when places are stingy and try to cheat you out of a properly proportioned chowder- such as when clams and potatoes are not in good ratio. I hate when places oversalt or under-season their chowder. I hate it if the clams are ever too mashed or not chewy enough. I hate when I have any reason to believe ingredients are not fresh. See, I'm rather picky, which is why I'm so thoroughly impressed by WFC for serving me what I believe is the perfect clam chowder. Amazing. Round of applause to you, WFC.

As for the lobster roll, I loved the roll even more than I loved the clam chowder. They pack in so much lobster meat, it made me feel like someone in the kitchen has a really big crush on me. Paying twenty dollars ain't no thang if you get a whole lobster served to you. Plus, with such a fresh take on the sandwich sauce, my happiness made me want to pay them forty dollars for the roll. Jk, I wouldn't do that. I just walked away super thrilled that I got to eat a meal for half the price that it is worth. 


Yes. I loved my meal. Thank you, Woodhouse Fish Co.
author: Mimi N.

description:
WORST HOSPITALITY EVER.  IF YOU ARE A SINGLE DINER, AND WANT TO SIT DOWN HERE, DON'T BOTHER.  IF YOU ARE A LOCAL, LOYAL PATRON, DONT BOTHER.  IF YOU EXPECT TO BE TREATED DECENTLY, DONT BOTHER.  

I go here every time I'm in town to order a lobster roll, partially because it's walking distance to my apartment; the other because they serve lobster rolls; my favorite.

Two nights ago, however, I went in and asked if I could order something to go.  "Yes", Alecia, the hostess says.  "Do you need a menu?"  "No.  Just a lobster roll, to go, please."  Okay.  "Ten minutes."  It is 8pm on a Thursday night. After Alecia comes back, I see a couple get up, and there's an empty table.  I asked if I could sit down.  She says, "Well, I've already placed your order to go and we have people waiting for tables and that is a table for four."  She does not offer me a seat at the bar either.  The wait list is sitting before me, and turquoise marked lines are crossed out on all but one name.  Hostess moves from front to back of restaurant being busy, talks to guests at bar.  No one takes the table for four which are essentially, two tables pushed together.   Male host comes forward.  I asked if I could sit down pointing to obvious empty table.  He says, "Um, sure, let me check."  I said, "because she said someone was waiting for that table, and that is the reason I can't sit there." Checks with Alecia.  "No, I'm afraid someone has spoken for that table."  I said, "No one is waiting behind me, are they at the bar?"  He says, "well sometimes people go down the street to have a drink and they come back."  A couple comes in, asks for a table.  Sure, would they be willing to sit at the bar?" "Yes"  Off they go.  No name is crossed from list.  Another table for 4 comes available.  Three adults come in, with a stroller and a baby.  They are seated at table of four. No name is crossed from list.  Another couple enters. They are escorted to the bar.  No name is crossed off the list.  Four people people come in.  They ask if a table is available.  The table that was first empty is given to them after I waited solo for ten minutes.  I recount my experience to the waitress, note I've stood patiently by, and watched 4 parties ahead of me seated, with no names crossed from list.  I tell her, I noticed, they came from the street and no names were crossed off the list.  I tell her to cancel my order and walked out.

I have never been so humiliated.  I will never be back.  The face of that hostess is etched in my brain.  The way she treated me will never be forgotten.  I'm sad that I can't visit again and give my hard-earned money for a simple lobster roll that I love.

All avoidable.
author: Molly C.

description: Omg! This is my second time I have been here and this place is sooooo good.  I always get the lobster roll or talk someone into sharing half of it with me so I can order one more thing on the menu.  So my sister and I split the large lobster roll and the linguini pasta with butternut squash.  The lobster roll was so delicious and fresh and the large chunks of lobster was how I like it.  The buttered roll it came on was a perfect pairing.  The pasta was to die for, it was decadent and just like nothing I have ever ate, it is so good.  Our server was very helpful and nice.
author: Austi And London's Mommy N.

description: This is one of those charming sort of "hole in the wall" restaurants with wonderful food, a cheerful staff and a relaxing atmosphere.We took out daughter to a special dinner. The establishment exceeded all of our expectations.
author: Jack W.

description: Nice space in Pac Heights with decent food.  Started with raw oysters and BBQ oysters, both of which were pretty good.  For an entree I got the three crab cakes.  It's about what you would expect when three crab cakes costs you $16.  It was pretty good value for the price, but these definitely are not the crab-heavy versions you'd find at a fancy restaurant.  The side salad that came with it was pretty tasty.  Overall, this is a decent place to grab some affordable seafood in a nice environment, in a nice neighborhood.
author: Simon L.

description: Lobster sandwich was ok.  Not the best. It tastes much better with lots of lemon juice squeezed on.  Clam chowder had too much garlic taste.  I thought I was eating garlic bread.
author: Maki K.

description:
One of the best lobster rolls I have had in a while.  Fish and chips were great too. Can't go wrong with washing it down with a cold beer. 
Expect a 20 min wait on the weekends.
author: Gary S.

description:
I've been here twice now. The food is solid but has yet to blow me away. I've tried their crab, clams, and lobster. I've been most impressed with the clam dishes. I'll need to come back to try the oysters (they have them for $1 on Tuesdays!). Recently I had the crab melt. I thought the filling/cheese sort of overpowered the crab. And the bread wasn't as soft as it could have been. The fries were also pretty crunchy (some people prefer them that way but personally I like my fries a little thicker). 

The restaurant is very small but has a cozy, harbor feel (even though it is in the Castro not the Marina). It actually reminds me of an oyster bar I used to go to in Boston (which may be why I'm holding it to such a high standard).

Service is 5 stars. I have had consistently friendly and competent wait staff. 

Will definitely return!
author: Carson S.

description: Ordered the lobster roll and a crab sandwich. Honestly, I wasn't too impressed. The lobster was super fresh and tasty but the crab sandwich tasted like a school cafeteria tuna sandwich. I could barely taste the crab. If I didn't know any better, I could've sworn they served me tuna...but oh well. The interior is nice and the fries were pretty good for what it's worth.
author: Marny N.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here on a Friday night. Luckily we were early enough to miss the rush and only had to wait 20 minutes. We got seated at the counter, which was just as enjoyable as sitting at a table. 

We started with 6 oysters, which were great, and the scallop ceviche, which was ok. The ceviche was 50% beet and 50% scallop. The beet flavored completely overpowered the fish. I ordered the large lobster roll and I could not have been happier with my choice. My lobster roll was overflowing with delicious lobster, and the cole slaw was one of the best slaws I've had in the city. The french fries were also cooked perfectly. My boyfriend ordered the cioppino. The fish was pretty good, but I thought the broth tasted a bit too much like pizza sauce. Other than those two items on the menu, there wasn't anything that jumped out at me. I would only go back for the lobster roll; I wouldn't be too tempted to try something else. 

The beer selection was fine, as was the service.
author: Regina L.

description:
Absolutely THE spot to get your lobster roll fix! One of the places I miss since I've moved away from SF. I'm sad that when a random craving strikes, it's 400 miles too far to get my fix. :(

The reviews speak for itself, but here are some highlights:
+ Split-top main lobster roll ($18 or $26) - fresh, chunky portions of lobster. They definitely do not skimp on it, and it comes with a side of shoestring french fries and cole slaw.
+ Bay shrimp + avocado roll ($13) - if you're in the mood for shrimp, go for it. Plenty on that roll plus it comes with fries and slaw as well.
+ Crab cakes
+ Service: friendly servers, never had to wait too long for seating during lunch time, takes reservations, takes card
+ Located in the ever-so-trendy lower pac heights - it's a nice walk, and parking isn't too bad if you park over at the japantown parking garage

Overall if you want good seafood, come check this place out! Do your research via their online menu or yelp pictures, and be prepared to pay $$ for it! Worth every penny.
author: Loriel L.

description: I had dinner at woooside about 2 years ago and it was great.  This Saturday I stopped in after the Jazzfest on Fillmore Street and again had an excellent dinner.  I had the special which was blackened rock cod.  Cooked very nicely and very delicious.
author: Barry D.

description:
Yay I'm a fan for the food but it's an a-ok for service. 3.5 stars.

The BF and I came here on a Saturday evening for dinner. We didn't make reservations because it was last minute and the person over the phone told us it was a 20 minute walk in wait. We put our name down and waited outside because the waiting area inside is really small! His name was called in 15 minutes and we were seated and given menus. Woodhouse is a smaller, casual, yet intimate restaurant so it was perfect for the two of us.

For the appetizer we ordered BBQ oysters and for our main dish I ordered the lobster roll and he ordered the cioppino. The oysters were super good and were served super-hot. A few minutes later the main dishes were on the table. Lobster roll was divine. The bread was perfectly toasted and buttered and there was a good amount of lobster. I ordered the small and was glad I did. I ate half and gave the other half to the BF. The cioppino was also very good. The clams, scallops, and fish were my favorite. I was too stuffed and lazy to try the crab. My favorite was the garlic bread that came with the cioppino. It was so buttery and so good! I ate both pieces!

I do believe that the service here is usually great, but on the day we came, service was so-so. Our waitress forgot our drinks and we had to ask twice for a spoon for the cioppino, meaning we sat there starring at our dishes for a while. We also weren't check on pretty much the whole night. She did pack us our left overs but I do not remember her apologizing for forgetting our drinks and not bringing us a spoon. 

I may come back if I am in the area because the food was that good but I also love trying new places so it may be a while before I come back :)
author: Latda V.

description:
I absolutely love the lobster roll!

This place is a bit pricey, but it's definitely worth it! The food is delicious and the atmosphere is nice and comfortable (a bit trendy, though not so far out there where it loses its coziness).

I've been here a few times and will definitely be back again for more!
author: Brandon C.

description: Awesome little place for some good food. We had the crab cakes and fish tacos and both tasted great!
author: Nick B.

description:
Good eats

Got sea bass, "stuffed" artichoke, clam chowder, and some bread pudding.  Cost was $70 + tip. The sea bass was excellent, crispy skin, moist meat, everything you could want.  The artichoke itself was good, but the crab stuffing still had some shell in it.  My daughter didn't care for the clam chowder.  She also didn't like the bread pudding.  I asked for hot chocolate for her and a scoop of ice cream, but they didn't have either.  My daughter was the only kid in there.  I would not consider them kid friendly.
author: Daryl C.

description:
Uoscaled street food fish and chips 
I ate the perfect baja fish taco
Tortilla, coleslaw, avocado, fried cod, lime

Perfect
author: Gal R.

description:
Came here yesterday to celebrate my cousin's 26th birthday. We were going to go to Chez Maman but after 20 minutes trying to find parking in Hayes we decided to head to the Fillmore instead and what do you know, parking. 

There were plenty of empty tables but still took a minute for our table of three to get seated. We ordered the bowl of clam chowder, ceviche special, lobster roll, fish and chips, and the crab pasta. I think we ordered a good representation of everything they offer and everything was underwhelming. 

This place has been on my list for a while but I keep forgetting about it. Probably subconsciously warning myself it was going to be forgettable. 

The ceviche was way too sour. I did add extra lime juice that was provided so maybe that was the problem. The clam chowder was very good. My lobster roll was just okay. I don't think it was worth the $18 price tag and I am not a fan of pasta in general and especially not one with olives in it. The best part of the meal were the shoestring fries and I hate french fries! I couldn't stop eating it and I was totally stuffed by the end of the meal. 

Service was whatever. Can't say much about the ambiance since we were seated right by the door and I was facing the outside window. Total was $80. I wouldn't mind coming back here again, and my cousin loves this place but I'm definitely not in any hurry.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Uuuuuuumm I'm really torn. All in have to say is that the picture looks better than how it tastes. My boyfriend and I had the large lobster roll. $26 each. I wouldn't be complaining if it was actually good and worth the money. I feel like it's a disappointment because we heard so many reviews about this place. 

We got the oysters, calamari(both good), and two large lobster rolls. Total:$89. Didn't feel like we ate a $90 meal. Still hungry and gna get some pho after. 

Overall: Ehh..
It just didn't meet up to our expectations. The sandwich was cold and overpriced. But who knows, some people actually really like it so it may just be me.
author: Stephanie P.

description: Fantastic seafood in a fun atmosphere. Soups, crab, lobster, shrimps, clams, mussels, garlic bread - delicious! We went two days in a row.
author: P S.

description:
Mmm crispy fish tacos! They were delicious. Service was great and staff was really nice. I didn't see any evidence of extra furry friends scurrying around the night I went. 

I didn't go for the lobster roll. I will try that next time.
author: Lori M.

description:
I'm trying to convince myself to look past the dollar Tuesday oysters and rate this place higher.

But I can't.

I love this place.  I love the location, the vibe, the food, but alas...I was drawn here for the dollar oysters.  Maybe I came on a bad night, but there were no choices, you just had one.  If you had more choices, that would get the fifth star.

I'll come back, don't worry...the rest of the menu makes up for it.
author: Ron L.

description:
I never tried lobster roll before so I gave this place a try!

It was definitely a nice restaurant. I went during the perfect time of the day where it wasn't busy so the waiter assisted us the whole time when he was needed. Our water cups were never empty, let's just say that. Haha

For starters, I ordered a plate of calamari. Excellent appetizer! Calamari was crispy on the outside, which I love. 

I also ordered the 6oz split-top Maine lobster roll. It was the largest order for the roll. ($26). I'm glad I chose the 6oz because it was stuffed with huge chunks of lobster meat. If you had lemon to it, every bite is so delicious..it also came with a cup of coleslaw and a side of perfect, crispy french fries! I left so full and satisfied. 

I probably wouldn't come back in a while for lobster rolls because its so expensive in my opinion. Once in a while would be okay for me. But if you're ever craving lobster rolls, this place is a must! Good luck on parking though (meter parking). I was fortunate because it was raining that day I guess.
author: Darrell N.

description:
I know they're known for their lobster roll, but I honestly liked the pork belly and fried oyster roll better. The pork belly was flavorful and melts in your mouth. It came out nice and crispy, but still tender and not chewy! The oysters were plentiful and the batter was not too thick. It was not greasy at all. 

The lobster was chewy. I don't eat lobster often, but I don't remember it being that chewy. It's good in a sense that it was not drowning in some mayonnaise. We asked for the double lobster and they delivered.

Both had a side of fries and coleslaw. I loved the pickled jalapeño that the pork belly and fried oysters came with. 

By the way, all their sauces are house made. With that being said, they don't have ranch. Our waiter was kind enough to suggest that he'll mention it on their meeting. 

Customer service is good. It wasn't busy when we came. There was no wait.

A plus is the location. I love Fillmore.
author: Malou M.

description:
Honestly just thought this place was okay. Came here for their $1 oyster Tuesdays and was a little disappointed that they only had one type of oyster on the menu. We were told that the wait for 45 minutes but there's a lot of bars/restaurants with bars on Fillmore so we just ducked into a spot down the street for a quick drink while we waited. 

Restaurant is pretty cozy so there aren't a lot of tables. They do have bar seating so there's always options of whichever seating opens up faster. The oysters didn't seem too fresh to me even though they were caught locally. Half of em didn't have any "oyster liquor" but it might be because I'm also eating them in a month that doesn't haven an "r" so that's why they're probably subpar. No complaints about the grilled oysters tho! Lobster rolls weren't anything to write home about either. Would rather drive down to Old Port for a more satisfying roll. 

Overall food was just mediocre, but the ambiance is good and service is attentive. They show an oyster farming documentary on loop against one of the walls of the restaurant which is cool to check out throughout your meal. Restaurant is intimate and has cute nautical themed decorations so definitely worth a visit for the dining experience.
author: Maryann S.

description: So good!! Food was fresh & delicious! Very good seafood in the middle of SF. Would recommend & come back!!
author: Stefanie R.

description: Can I say The Best Cioppino in San Francisco? Also an Excellent & helpful wait staff.
author: Greg M.

description: Great place.  There were a ton of options on Filmore and this one is not to be missed.  Clam chowder and dungeness crab roll and an IPA to go with.   Buttery and delicious.   In a word Awesome.   Looking forward to a return trip to try the oysters and the artichoke that looked great.  I was dining solo and so could not try everything!
author: Liz C.

description:
Really great.  Good prices.  Simple menu ,yet a lot of good seafood items from fish and chips to raw oysters.  Tues secret oyster day deal !!
Worth it all .
author: gary m.

description:
After waiting for a good 20 minutes in the San Francisco cold weather, my tummy was growling and getting grumpy but even the wait couldn't spoil my appetite for dollar oysters and lobster roll! Upon sitting down, I salivated at the menu for a second and ordered everything on the menu... almost. Between Mr. Dubs and I, we ordered the following:

18 raw oysters ($1 oysters!!)-- can't go wrong with raw oysters. Woodhouse had the perfect mix of medium sized oysters with a sweet taste!

Cup of clam chowder-- we opted for the Hartford which is the creamy clam chowder with a dash of the Manhattan style tomato chowder. I wasn't too crazy about the chowder but wouldn't say it was awful!

Lobster roll-- sure it was $26 for a large but it was well worth every penny of that $26. The lobster pieces were so big and juicy. Definitely didn't skimp on the lobster chunks! 

Crab melt-- I was initially super stoked to try it but was disappointed at first bite. The crab melt tasted more like a tuna melt with no crab taste at all. Bummer!

Mr. Dubs and I ended up each paying $41 each.. definitely not cheap but was it worth every penny? Hell yea!
author: Tiffany U.

description: First time alone without the kids in 10 years for more the 2 nights. Our first trip to San Francisco. The most memorable meal was at this excellent restaurant. We came in for an afternoon snack at 3PM and was surprised that the restaurant was full. We had the Ipswich fried clams, yes, east coast clams in the west but it took us back to a great time when we vacationed in Boston few years ago. The taste was just like back east. We then shared the cioppino, great seafood broth however the crab surprisingly could have been more fresh, we had better crab in Toronto but expected much more when the ocean was right next door in San Fran. The other seafood in the cioppino was good. The sour bread used to sop up the broth was great.  We will be back very soon. When in San Francisco looking for great seafood this is your spot away from the tourist traps.
author: Sack S.

description:
This place is good if your looking for seafood! It's a small restaurant but it would be worth the wait if there was a line. 

We went for lunch. I got the shrimp and avocado sandwich. It was very good. Came with a big chunk of avocado. It came with fries and cold slaw which were good as well. 

The service was very good. They always refill your drinks quickly and the employees were friendly. 

The decor was very interesting
author: Paulina D.

description: If you are craving Dungeness or lobster sandwich this a a good place to go ! Oh yea make your own Arnold Palmer too
author: Anthony L.

description:
Delicious and worth the $. We had a lobster roll, crab roll, and cheesy crab roll. Don't be fooled. The smaller portion is by no means a small portion. The cole slaw was perfect. The french fries hit the spot, crunchy, skinny, salted just right. Yum. The BEST was how they serve Arnold Palmer's. Fantastic. Lemon juice over ice; tea, and simple syrup on the side.

Can't wait to go back.
author: Andrea K.

description: I REALLY wanted to love this place, and in particular, the crab melt sandwich (read about it as a favorite on Yelp)., but after seeing it in person--a small toasted piece of bread with crab inside the fold--looked almost appetizer sized.i'Sandwich' tasted quite good, but in all honestly, for less than half of the price, and more than double the size, I'd rather go the wharf fish/chowder stands for the real deal, sans the cheese and fries.
author: Buddy L.

description:
Amazing. We had fresh oysters, Fish&Chips, Cioppino.
Fresh oysters - Super fresh/briny. we ended up ordering extra oysters (in total, we had 5 each) because they were so good
Fish&Chips - the batter was light and not overly salty. The fish was huge.

Cioppino - MUST TRY!! broth is just perfectly balanced-has deep rich flavor from all the seafood+tomato soup. Crab always makes the broth so yummy. there are so many different types of seafood in this cioppino and it's enough for 2 women to share. 
We ended up over-stuffing ourselves but the food was just too good!
author: Giana T.

description:
This review is a little late in coming, but we came here towards the end of April.  We walked from our hotel in Union Square and stopped in around 5ish on a Wednesday.

We ordered the crab cakes with a side salad and a lobster roll with a side of fries.  The crab cakes were perfect - just enough tartar sauce drizzled on top, the crab cake itself was not overly salty (which in my experience, has a tendency to be at other places), and I love beets in my salad, so that was a plus.  The beets offered a nice complement to the savory crab cakes, as well.  According to my fiancé, the lobster roll was very good, though he might've preferred a bit less lobster (I know what you're thinking - is he crazy?!), but sometimes you need just enough lobster so that it's not spilling out the side of the sandwich and you need just the right seafood:bun ratio.  The bun was nice and toasty, very good bread.  Fries were nice too, not overly salted and thin and crispy - the best kind.

Much better than Pearl Oyster Bar in NYC.
author: Steph L.

description:
While airing out a screaming toddler, nothing says relief like fish and chips. The good people here at Woodhouse hooked us up with some excellent to-go fare. 

My lumberjack went with the classic fish and chips and I opted for the fish tacos. Both were good but I have to say that my fish tacos were a tad bomber than the fish and chips. Probably because they were good and there were three of them. Like happy musketeers. 

The stringy fries aren't my or my dude's favorite but the kid sure liked them. My dude liked his fish and I dug (and shared) my tacos. 

All in all, a great way place to satisfy all in the fam. Even if just from their to-go box.
author: Loli L.

description:
I love love love the decor here, especially the beachside mural with boat models on top and the giant squid above the front door. Just love the ambiance.

We walked through the door and saw quite the waitlist for parties of two. We were told it'll be ~20 minutes but by the time we figured out what we wanted to eat, we were seated. Guess everyone left because they didn't want to wait! There are a couple tables for four, quite a few for two and a bar that seats about five. Not quite the place for large parties. 

We ordered to share:
CLAM CHOWDER (cup)
$2 difference between the cup and the bowl size. We didn't want any leftovers so we went with the cup size. It was a delicious, warm starter that satisfied our chowder cravings. Though I wanted more...

CRAB CAKES
Read a review that the size of this was generous so we ordered two. It was about the size of a sand dollar and quite frankly, the size I expected it to be without thinking it was "generous". Despite the to-be-expected size, it was quite good! Soft and delicate and my favorite of the night. 

STUFFED ARTICHOKES
This was a whole artichoke split in half with the heart removed and replaced with cocktail shrimp and pieces of crab meat. It was gorgeously presented and we took 10 minutes to figure out how to eat the darn thing! All we saw and felt were the fibrous leaves so we peeled away the leaves and sucked on the bits of meat on each leaf. For $18, were we really going to leave an entire artichoke behind? It definitely wasn't worth just eating the bits of shrimp and crab meat! And so we sucked each leaf cleaned... and it was so much work for so little return. I wouldn't order this again.

There were several items on the menu that I wanted to try so I'll probably be back to try the others, like the lobster roll, crab roll, fish and chips (love em!), etc. So I'll give this place four stars for the promising food to be had and the delicious crab cakes!
author: Sandy T.

description:
As I sat down in Woodhouse Fish Company on Fillmore.  Looking at the decor and ambience, my mind started to wander... 

Then suddenly I saw Julia Roberts and Cameron Diaz, and the whole restaurant began to break out in song, here's a clip: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xLcmmBM15Sc&feature=youtube_gdata_player

"The moment I wake up 
Before I put on my makeup 
I say a little prayer for you 
While combing my hair, now, 
And wondering what dress to wear, now, 
I say a little prayer for you" 

"Forever, forever, you'll stay in my heart 
and I will love you 
Forever, forever, we never will part 
Oh, how I'll love you 
Together, together, that's how it must be 
To live without you 
Would only be heartbreak for me."

Much like the Crab Shack in Chicago in the movie My Best Friend's Wedding, I imagined this scene right in Woodhouse Fish Company on Fillmore.

That being said, the sister restaurant on Market is one of my favorite restaurants in the city.  So coming here I was anticipating eating more awesome seafood.  Here's what I ordered:

Fried Ipswich Clams: These little fried clams are fried to perfection, a great appetizer.  

Maine Lobster Roll:  One of my favorite things to eat anywhere.  I have nothing to really compare the lobster roll with.  Huge chunks of Maine Lobster with bread that is perfectly toasted on the outside, soft on the inside.  That combined with the savory french fries and coleslaw is a great combination of flavors.  Simple but completely satisfying.

Service: Friendly and attentive.  Kept my diet coke filled and checked on my table regularly to make sure I was content.

If you are looking for great fried seafood, great crab and lobster, Woodhouse is the place to be.  Like Aretha sang: To live without Woodhouse would only be heartbreak for me.
author: Michael L.

description: We came in on oyster Tuesday which is $1 oysters! The place was pretty busy but not overly crowded. It took about 20 minutes to get all of our food after we ordered. We aren't oyster connoisseurs but figured we would get some because they were so cheap. I didn't try them but my boyfriend said they were very fresh and tasted as if they were just taken out of the ocean. I ordered the crab roll and he got the lobster roll. I feel as though the crab roll is a little over priced.. There was a lot more bread compared to crab! But the taste in itself was delicious! Buttery crab stuffed into a roll, what more could you ask for?! Although the crab roll was good, the lobster roll is where it's at! It's mixed with green onions and I'm assuming mayo but it was definitely full of flavor! The fries were perfectly crispy and the coleslaw was fresh! If you stop by, GET THE LOBSTER ROLL!
author: Victoria C.

description:
YUM. I've never had anything here I didn't absolutely love. From the flavors to the presentation, a great experience every time. It's down the street from my abode, so I come often and it never disappoints!

If you are going to have a sandwich, don't screw around, just go ahead and suck it up and order that lobster roll! Don't be afraid of the $20+ price tag for the large, because you will see when it comes, that it's totally worth it. My other favorites include the clam chowder (creamy, rich, and a million calories), the fish & chips, and the strawberry cake, yum! Their fries are also some of the best in town. 

Service is generally up to par, however one time they did give away our to-go order worth $100 to some other patron recently, and we had to wait around while the situation was rectified. Oops...it happens, I guess.
author: Theresa C.

description:
Great little place to get amazing seafood! I came here with my boyfriend on a Saturday evening and got seated immediately. We ordered and split the 6oz lobster roll and the cioppino. It was more than enough food for two people! 
The lobster roll had huge pieces of very fresh lobster on a toasted, buttery bun. It was totally worth the $27! After trying to make our own cioppino at home and failed immensely, it was great to finally get to taste what it was suppose to taste like. It was piled with all sorts of fish and shellfish. Even though we were full we still scraped the bottom of the bowl for more!
Would definitely come back again!
author: Margeaux H.

description:
When people ask me where to go for seafood in San Francisco - I always suggest this place. When I came here with three other people, it was about a 20 minute wait. I think there's more waiting space at the other location near Church.

At this specific location, I had ordered myself a bay shrimp and avocado roll. It was okay -- but I would suggest to get another type of roll instead.

I'm quite sure the food is similar to that of the other Woodhouse, however, if you want to see what I ordered at the other restaurant -- check out my review at the other location.
author: Joanne W.

description:
That lobster roll with double meat is no joke. It was packed with lobster meat on a nicely buttered/toasted roll. The fries were crisped perfectly and the cole slaw complimented everything. 

There was something missing in the lobster roll but I couldn't figure out what... otherwise it would've been awarded an easy 5 stars!
author: Terrance M.

description:
Ordered the fish and chips and dungeness crab cocktail. 

The fish and chips were absolutely delicious. Tip: Alaskan cod is what you want when it comes to deep-fried fish, and here it was tender, moist, and flakey from the first to the last bite. Equally important is the batter, and the breading on these fish and chips excelled. Crisp, not too bready or overly crispy, it was light and flakey like panko but finer and more dense. The seasoning was excellent (that is to say, not noticeable in a good way) leaving the quality of the fish and balanced crust to excel. Great fish to breading ratio and mouth feel. Two pieces was enough for a meal, even without the appetizer. 

The crab was fresh but unremarkable and small. The server was polite but inattentive, to a somewhat frustrating degree. It was a slow 3pm, and he seemed more interested in distributing hot sauce bottles than checking on the several tables that needed his attention. The interior was quaint and comfortable. 

This place is borderline 3 star because it's clear that "okay" in many areas is a-ok to them, but I will leave it at 4 stars until I find a better fish and chips place in the city.
author: Eddie L.

description:
We've been wanting to try this place for quite some time but everyone we know who lives in Pac Heights is either vegetarian or doesn't like seafood so on a beautiful sunday afternoon after watching America's Cup, we drove to Fillmore to have brunch/lunch.

Although I hear there's usually a line for dinner, there was no line at all for lunch and we were seated within 5 minutes.

We ordered the Hartford clam chowder, dungeness crab roll, and baja cod fish tacos.

Dungeness crab roll-amazing!!! So delicious, I could not stop eating it. The difference in price is the more expensive option has more crab. I ordered the $18 option and was thinking, yes, I could stuff this sandwich with more crab! The bread was so soft and grilled to perfection. This was totally delicious.

Baja fish tacos-3 fish tacos were battered well and had a nice contrast with the tangy slaw against the friend fish.

Hartford clam chowder-a mix of the manhattan and boston (tomato base and cream base) so a ying hang clam chowder so to speak. It was pretty good, because of the tanginess of the Manhattan chowder it felt less heavy.

We really enjoyed our lunch here, it's not a very cheap option but the seafood was very good and I would definitely recommend the dungeness crab roll!
author: Betty C.

description: It's a small place across from Safeway. The waitresses were sweet and very helpful. I ordered a Jumbo Prawn Fettucine. It contained marcona almonds, cherry tomatoes, garlic and a splash of white wine. It was good, but a tad pricey. The oysters were very good.
author: Jerome M.

description: Delicious Lobster Roll.  Wish I lived around here, now im back in SoCal wishing I could eat ya!!!
author: Andrew J.

description:
Try: 

Toasted crab meat roll

Thats all i've ordered for the past 5 times ive been here

Never fails.

Delicious
author: Moto B.

description:
Loved this place! We had oysters to start with were amazing. We asked for a vinegarette on the side which was a nice accompaniment. For mains we had the small lobster roll which had a good amount of lobster meat and we also had the salmon burger from the specials. Both were very tasty and we will definitely be coming back.
The staff here were friendly and attentive.
author: Freya W.

description: We sat at the bar with our group of 4. I ordered a bowl of the new England clam chowder and a small Dungeness crab roll. The soup was delicious with meaty clams. The crab roll was a little depressing. The crab meat was really stringy not chunks of meat like I had hoped. Other than that, service was nice, food flavor was great and I will definitely come back.
author: Donna Y.

description:
One of my favorite seafood spots in San Francisco. Great atmosphere, great food and great service! 

They have something for everyone - traditional lobster rolls, fish and chips or chowder - or oysters, Dungeness crab or mussels for the more adventurous sea food eaters. 

My favorite dishes are the Dungeness crab in their delicious white wine sauce (goes great with a side of fries) and the Cioppino. Would definitely recommend the Dungeness crab for first timers
author: Grace J.

description: I'd score it 4.5! It took a bit to place order, and I git my clam chowder at the same time as my fish. Chowder was very good!  And the fish n chips were fabulous!  (A little greasy although it is deep fried! ) I'll be back to try lobster roll! Looks delicious!
author: Tammy F.

description:
Came in on a Sunday around 2pm and got seated right away. Based on other reviews, sounds like i got pretty lucky. I'm not from sf so i assumed this place might be less crowded than the market st location and i was right!

Wife and i shared the bowl of new england clam chowder to start. It was delicious! Had a slightly different taste than other clam chowders i've had, but was good! 

$18 lobster roll has a good amount of lobster. Had lobster in it down to the very last bite. I can only imagine how much lobster is in the bigger portion. 

Fries were crispy and hot, and the slaw wasnt dry nor bland nor over dressed. 

Not a big fan of oysters, but if that tickles your fancy, the table next to us were raving about their oysters, and from the looks of it they have a good variety to choose from. Sounds like the servers are more than happy to explain the differences if you're like me and thought there was only 1 type of oyster out there.

This place lives up to the hype for good seafood. Must try if your in the area!
author: Manny D.

description: This place has more than 1K likes. If you like lobster salads then try the lobster roll. It's pretty mucho lobster with cole slaw in a bun. Clam chowder was off the hook, delicious. Awesome animated frame.
author: Jessica R.

description: Waiting time wasn't very long when we arrived although the restaurant doesn't have alot of seating. I ordered the cheddar cheese crab melt. It tasted perfect and fresh! The price is a little bit expensive for the portion. But i'd have to say i would go back again just for the seafood!
author: Marian P.

description:
Clam chowder
Fish & Chips
Lobster roll
