Great local area place away from the tourists. Nice atmosphere and friendly staff. 
As soon as we walked in we were greeted and then seated. They saw me on Yelp and smiled.
"Oh you already know what to get here". Ha! 

Enjoyed the food and service the most. Everything order was great! Will I come back when in SF? 

You can count on it.
author: Ward A.

description:
This tiny place is great!  There was a bit of a wait, as they DO NOT take reservations, with that said, I recommend this place if you are in the area.  I would travel to get here if I had a reservation.  However, no reservations make sense because the place is pretty small.  Note, there is a bar in the back.  If you find a place to sit, do so!  It is beer and wine only.  Prices are reasonable on the booze.  

Food:
The food was excellent.  We ordered the Dungeness Crab which was on special for $18, it included, a whole crab, potatoes, greens and bread.  Excellent deal in my opinion.  My friends loved the crab, but like crab, it does take effort to eat, so be patient.  My other friend had the fish of the day.  He LOVED it.  I tasted it, it was pretty damn good.  I ordered the Stuff Artichoke.  It was excellent!  It was an artichoke split in half, topped with lumps of crab meet and baby shrimps.  The artichoke was seasoned with garlic, lemon, and other spices.  It also sat on a bed of salad, which was fresh and tasty.  

Service:
The service was good.  Friendly, informative.  This place is pretty busy, so they servers here do hustle.  Don't expect to strike up a conversation with the staff, they gotta make that money and server the people.  But overall, the team is excellent.

There is only 1 bathroom in the entire place, and it is unisex, so there is a line to use the facility.  Be patient.  

Overall, if in the area of Pacific Heights and you're hungry for good food, you should give this place a try.  

Cheers
author: Frank M.

description:
I went here on a week night and there wasn't much of a wait.  It's a relatively small place I wouldn't recommend it for a big group.

Food:

Crab roll 4 stars: forgot why we didn't get the lobster roll...it was good, the crab meat was fresh, but the lobster roll has better flavor. Spend the few extra bucks!

Fish taco  4 stars: the batter was light and crispy, the size was a bit small for the price. Good, but not as good as fish tacos down in Ensenada.
author: Thuy N.

description:
I ordered the 6oz open face crab sandwich. Comes with French fries and a small coleslaw. $32.00
The crab was awesome, super fresh, moist and shell free. You could tell the cook spent time on extracting it all from the shell. There was at least 2 large claw meats in there too. 
Great, attentive service. Very cool atmosphere. 
Pricey though, but that seems to be the trend these days with San Francisco seafood.
author: Brad M.

description:
Fab little restaurant. My lobster roll was good, lots of celery which i love.
My husbands cioppino was off the charts mega delicious, i would get that next time i go. Ive tasted other cioppinos in the city and this one is by far the heartiest. 
The service is ironic, everyone here was attentive to us besides our waitress. 
Other then that we thoroughly liked this place.
author: Ella A.

description:
Such a pro! Unfortunately a few cons. Thus a solid 3 star. 

The Pro: The best cioppino of my life. Massive chunks of seafood in a rich, slightly spicy tomato broth. Heavenly bread to sop up every last drop. Perched on top?  A huge portion of crab. I'm pretty sure the cluster of people by the door were not waiting for a table, they were all intently watching me elbows deep inhale the cioppino. I'd fly from Seattle again just for the cioppino. One of my favorite dishes I tried during my foodfest in SF.

I tried the lobster roll too. I've never had one before and instantly fell in love- light, fresh, not too much mayo. On great chewy bread along with very addicting fries. Both dishes were pricey, but rightfully so. 

The cons was having to wait for 15 minutes to be served drinks, just two beers. Coming off a plane, traveling to the restaurant, waiting for a table, finally ordering that first cold draft beer...and watching your server walk by your table empty handed for almost 15 minutes is kind of like a patron's torture.  Our food runner ended up bringing out the beers immediately. There may be my claw marks still on the table.

Perhaps service would be better on a slower night, and maybe I'd enjoy it more being sat less close to our neighbors. Having to closely listen to the server expensively describe vegetarian options to the next door table (!!!) while we waited to be served left little to be desired.
author: A.J. S.

description:
I don't know what happened in the two years since I've been here, but the food was dreadful.  No flavor.

We had the crab cakes. They were so thin, that all you could taste was the crispy outer part.

The Dungeness crab roll was flavorless.  It's way better at AT&T ball park!  For half the price!

Finally, the lobster roll was a huge disappointment.  Again, no flavor, blah, and the lobster itself was a bit mealy.

We couldn't beleive every single person  was disappointed with their choice,
author: Foodlover B.

description:
Mediocre. We had the tomato based and cream based chowders with an order of garlic bread. The tomato based chowder was good, the cream based was very bland. Both soups were barely warm when they arrived. Garlic bread was gross. Pretty pricey for what we got, too ($7/small cup of soup each, $6 for garlic bread).

Aside from the food, service and atmosphere were both good.
author: Tree J.

description:
WHY IS THIS RESTAURANT FOUR STARS: 
My two friends and I called this restaurant beforehand to see what the wait was because the other restaurants we called had a 30-45 min wait during dinner prime time and they said they did have tables opened SO WE SHOULDVE KNOWN 
we ordered clam chowder, oysters, calamari, and the lobster roll (18 dollars) and 27 dollars for double the meat 
Of course my FATASS friend wanted double the meet so we opted for the 27 dollar one 

Clam chowder: hospital soup has more flavor than this. The soup was served Luke warm and tasted like my oatmeal this morning 

Calamari: don't really have much to say just tasted like any other calamari 

Lobster roll: wtf was that dressing sauce that was mixed with it. Put warm butter and cheese and the lobster roll would be worth the 27 dollars. It had absolutely NO flavor and I felt like I was eating lobster mixed with air. Omg 

Oysters: fresh but the horseradish made my eyes water but that's my fault ^^ 

I do NOTTT recommend this place. It was one of the most expensive meals that I hated. I am not satisfied and I usually like almost everything so THAT SAYS ALOT ABOUT THIS RESTAURANT 

Service was whatever too
author: Sarah H.

description:
CIOPPINO - more like cioppinYES! I usually come here for the lobster roll, but one faithful Sunday after a night of too much drankin I came here and couldn't pull my eyes off the ciopinno on the table next to mine.. Soo aromatic and the smell would taunt me so alas, I gave in to my heart's desire and got the cioppino instead of the lobster roll. 

BEST.DECISION.EVER. I love love love the cioppino. Greatest taste, mouthful of flavors, warm soupy goodness filled to the brim with so much seafood! Crab meat, mussels, clams, scallops, shrimp, and fish all swimming in my mouth. First bite I was blown away, second bite I was still blown away! Still thinking bout this from time to time.. my mouth was like a virgin, being touch for the very first time~ YUM. Definitely would order this again when I come back - the desire is no longer for the lobster roll but for this aquarium in a bowl! My only regret was that my friend and I decided we wanted a whole adventure in SF so I thought to myself - must save stomach space for all the food to come. So I packed up the other half of my cioppino for lunch the next day (though I desperately wanted to eat it). The nice waiter packed it up for me .... in a PAPER TRAY?! All I thought was how will this paper tray hold my precious cioppino.. but alas, it did and my precious made it home safely into the fridge. The next day when I opened it however, I saw that the tray was lined with a piece of aluminum foil and a lot of the soupy saucey goodness had evaporated... My heart cried a little inside. Woodhouse, get better trays for your wet foods! I still microwaved it for dinner and ate it like it was heaven on earth, though it tasted a little strange and not as delicious. Learned my lesson later that night when my stomach was hurting for hours. Eeek! No more day old cioppino for me !! I knew I should've devoured the whole thing in one sitting when I had the chance. So lesson here is: don't pack the cioppino to-go, just swim in the goodness until there is nothing left. Lick the bowl at the restaurant, don't bring home the paper tray.. it won't be the same. Save your stomach the agony. Until next time my preciousss
author: Ngan T.

description:
Spent all day eating and decided to make this place a stop after reading the reviews.

My girlfriend and I split a bowl of clam chowder, the lobster roll and the stuffed artichoke.

The Clam chowder was pretty good.  There was a good amount of clams and the soup was thick and creamy.

The lobster roll was great as well, not too much mayo.  Fries were nice and fresh, coleslaw was average.

I was mostly disappointed in the stuffed artichoke as it really isn't stuffed with much.  I think there was probably 10 baby shrimp and maybe one crab arm stuffed in each half.

It was basically a salad, an artichoke, and a little bit of seafood.  For $17 (if I recall correctly) it just wasn't worth it.  I wouldn't pay more than $12 for it.

I got to see quite a few plates brought out and everything looked good.  Had I had room I probably would have ordered more, but I probably shouldn't have eaten the 36 oysters immediately before this :\
author: Nick N.

description: This restaurant was worth the walk.  Lobster roll, warm is amazing, as were the crab cakes.  Small place but very accommodating and polite staff.  Prices are not in the discount range for sure.  Lobster roll was $27 but tasted way better than the cash would have.  Salmon tartare had roe on top, I approved and so did my so.
author: Rob M.

description:
Everything is amazing.

Clam chowder is probably the best in the city. 
Stuffed Artichoke is my favorite. 
Clams are great!
Lobster sandwich is delicious.
Shrimp sandwich is a little too mayo-e for me... but still amazing
Fish tacos were too greasy. Only complaint!
author: Ann B.

description: First time trying a lobster roll and I was not disappointed ! My girlfriend ordered the fish and chips and they were delicious, so I'm giving them a slight edge over my meal but both were very good. The fries were nice and crispy, and overall the food wasn't too pricey for the portions they served. If your in the area, I'd definitely recommend Woodhouse Fish Co.
author: Brian A.

description: This place never fails me. The bread they use for the lobster rolls are so delicious I can order the bread alone. Their stuffed artichokes is the bomb, order it as soon as you sit down because it is a 20 minute wait for it to come out. Their lemonade is something else, a must get!! Everything else speaks for itself, so grub on!!
author: Karen R.

description: Great service, delicious food, and reasonable prices.  Would definitely go back.  I tried the lobster roll and fish tacos.  Both were delicious.
author: Paul W.

description: The lady waitress was not happy. But I saw her laughing and talking to the older white couple. The helpers did all the work. Bringing and taking plates away. Even refilling my soda. Didn't like the lobster roll. Wasn't my kind of taste. Had much better ones in Vegas. Crab cakes had no crab taste just  batter. One guy spill the empty tray of oyster Juice on my shirt and pants and didn't say sorry. Just handed me a few napkins. Would never come back. Only good thing was the Tuesday dollar oyster that my wife enjoyed. Good luck eating here.
author: Derren H.

description:
This restaurant is a must try. I definitely still feel that it is quite pricey but i feel like it is worth it because of the quality.

Must try:
Lobster roll-just so good. lobster perfectly cooked and coated with mayo and chives. who can ask for better. the roll was also buttery. I felt the roll was a little too small, i felt like the lobster was falling out of it. The cole slaw that came with it as a side was also very delicious. I really liked it.

Fresh Oysters- they have $1 oysters! very fresh! but some that we go were so tiny!!! 

Ciopinno- OMG! this cioppino broth is amazing!!!!
author: Dilys Y.

description:
Thought this place was cute... Got a weird vibe as soon as we walked in. Sat at the bar, where we were the only 3 people and it took 7 minutes to get service. These gals just walked by and walked by.  When our server finally came (her name was Bella), She was just dripping of "I'm too good for you" attitude. She was just plain rude. Felt so disrespected.  

Food was great, but there are so many places that serve Oysters that I can't see coming back here for them. I'd rather pay $2.00 for an oyster at the SF Marketplace than come here and have horrible service.
author: Jayme L.

description:
Woodhouse is fair to good. 

Came with my gf since our buddy raved about the Po boy crab sandwich. I checked out the menu day prior and decided what to order. We came about 20mins after they opened for lunch so it was not crowded. Got seated by this girl who I didn't know was just the hostess. As we were seated, she made no mention that our waiter was going to come shortly. Since we already knew what we were going to order, I looked over to her where all the workers just muddled around the bar area to get her attention. She smirked and told the waiters that I was staring at her as if I was expecting her to serve us. What nerve! And she said it loud enough for us to hear even tho we were about 3ft from her. Talk about being tactful...there were none. 

Our waiter came, he was okay. No introduction...Not overly nice nor overly rude. Took our order of crab cakes, fried calamari, melted cheese crab sandwich, side salad and cup of white chowder. 

Food came fairly fast but not as hot as I liked with the exception of my soup. This was okay. My preference is to have hot temperature food. Calamari arrived first and it was disappointing. Oily and not fresh calamari. (I was told by a seafood chef that fried calamari should come without oil of any sort) The rings were rubbery and tentacles were few in between.  Salad was fresh but I didn't like the dressing. Tastes like Paul Newman dressing. Some people love Pauls dressing but I don't. But, The crab cakes were a hit! My gf is from New Orleans and she said it was the real deal without much breadcrumbs. Lastly, the melted cheese crab sandwich came...luke warm. One taste, I knew that crab was not fresh. The sandwich is a crab Po boy but grilled with a slice of cheddar. 

Overall, I wasn't impressed since I had better even in Redwood City off Veterans Blvd. But, anywhere on Fillmore gets raves by people who don't seem to get out of that area much. Since my buddy loves anything that is overpriced and to say he eats at eateries on Fillmore is beyond me. 

For 58.30 for lunch to me is not worth the food and service that we received. Perhaps, there sister restaurant has better food and service. Don't think I will go to find out.
author: Jessica L.

description: On the plus side, great service and nice decor.  Disappointing food though.  Both the mussels and fish-and-chips were really bland.  Only the white clam chowder and garlic bread were flavorful, and I really enjoyed those two.  Years ago I went to the Market St location and loved the stuffed artichoke.  Guess I should have stuck with that.
author: Nancy B.

description:
Came here with my boyfriend on a Saturday night. I was craving a lobster roll so badly and hoped for this place to satisfy my craving. Unfortunately, my craving was not satisfied. I ordered the Toasted Butter Dungeness roll, which tasted really bland to me. My taste buds are on the saltier side, so this roll was just tasteless to me. My boyfriend, on the other hand, ordered the Split Top Maine lobster roll, which tasted A LOT better than what I had. BUT, it still wasn't good enough to satisfy my craving. We also had a bowl of clam chowder, it was whatever. 

The best part of my meal was the DIY Arnold Palmer! It was so cute and I got to control how sweet, sour, or tea-like I wanted it to be. Oh yeah, the fries that came with our rolls were perfect too!
author: Lina C.

description:
Fantastic split-top maine lobster rolls. I've had this place bookmarked for over a year now, and the bf and I finally made the trip up here for lunch. On a Saturday at 1pm, there was only a 15 minute wait - not bad at all considering how small this place is. 

We each ordered a 3oz lobster roll ($18), which came with a side of coleslaw and crispy fries. The rolls were soft and buttery, and the lobster was very fresh. I usually prefer naked rolls, but the mayo and chives weren't overpowering at all. I could still taste the lobster in all its splendor. I just wish they had stuffed the rolls with even more lobster. I've definitely eaten heartier lobster rolls at other establishments. However, the flavor was all there and I was overall satisfied. The bf was not as happy though. He was still hungry after devouring his meal, but it's my fault for not getting him the 6oz.

We also got a bowl of New England clam chowder, which was the perfect portion for 2 people. It was rich and creamy and packed with ingredients.

I would definitely come back to try the other items on their menu. The fish and chips and oysters looked excellent. The table next to us had ordered them and I was envious!
author: Nicole P.

description:
Nice restaurant in one of my favorite neighborhoods, the Fillmore/ Lower Pac Heights. It's small but we got seated in 5 minutes on a Saturday for lunch. Service was super quick and friendly.
We started witht he calamari which were perfectly cooked and tasted very fresh. And we really just had one goal coming here... to eat the lobster roll! I saw that they also have a Dungeness crab roll so I ordered that while my husband ordered the lobster roll. Both at 6 ounces ($26 lobster, $28 crab). For 3 ounces it's $18 each. Glad we ordered the 6 ounces because there were tons of lobster and crab meat! Lobster roll is cold, while the crab roll is hot. We loved both of them! But if I have to choose, I'd say go for the lobster roll. But you can't lose either way. There are other items in the menu but we'll have to try them next time. We'll be back!
author: Vol T.

description:
Cioppino. It's my dish of choice, especially when I'm visiting SF. I've tried cioppino all over the city. Woodhouse's cioppino, my friends, is one of the best. Spicy, thick, tomatoey base, plenty of mussels, clams, scallops, fish, a half a crab, and big prawn. It is a big meal, but oh-so-delicious. I've bookmarked this place and definitely will return. 

Also, I was happy to learn that it was $1 oyster night on the Tuesday night I visited. $1 each for Point Reyes oysters? Yes, why thank you, I will take advantage of that offer! They were awesome. I wish they were served with mignonette instead of cocktail sauce, but at $1, who can complain? 

Service here was fairly solid ... the busboy/assistant server was spot-on fantastic. The server seemed to be handling a bit more than she could keep up with.
author: Ryan L.

description:
After a nice walk with my wife on a park in the afternoon, when it started getting colder, we wanted to have a Clam Chowder.

Having recently moved to San Francisco (1 week ago!), I didn't yet know many restaurants -- just a few when we visited the city ~6 months ago. I opened up Yelp to look for restaurants serving Clam Chowders, open on a Sunday, 9 PM.

There were a few -- but Woodhouse Fish Co. was the one that caught our attention. Nice pics, nice reviews, not far from home.

When we arrived, in front of the entrance, my wife said: "we've been here before." I wasn't so sure, I knew we've been to a couple restaurants in Fillmore St, but didn't quite remember Woodhouse Fish Co.

As soon as we entered, I recognized the place -- we had indeed been there before! This was very good news: I immediately remembered the delicious meal we had there previously!

This time we ordered:
 - a Clam Chowder (bowl, $10 -- prices are higher than what's listed on Yelp as of 2015-04-12!)
 - a Split-top Maine Lobster Roll (large, $27 -- again a bit higher)

The Clam Chowder was new to us -- and it was fantastic! The Lobster Roll was what we had previously, and it's just so damn good! Looks like one of the most popular sandwiches in the restaurant, every table around had a *few* people with them!

When we were about to leave, we decided we would write a Yelp review -- not only to recommend to others, but also so that next time we look for Clam Chowders on Yelp we find our review and I will know I went there before :P

Highly recommended, we'll certainly return!

Bruno
author: Bruno R.

description:
After two years in Seattle, I've been on a mission to find clam chowder and fish & chips that rival what I had up in the great Pacific Northwest, at Pike Place Chowder, and Pike Street Fish Fry. And while there've been more missteps than successes, Woodhouse didn't fail me terribly.

Coming in for a very light dinner, my friend and I just ordered their Hartford clam chowder and fish & chips to share [ Photo: http://instagram.com/p/YHWDwkwfnR/ ]. Both were just alright, albeit for different reasons: we found their clam chowder to be a bit lighter (in taste and consistency) than we would have liked, and their fried fish, while fried very well (I'm personally a bigger fan of this frying style), was a bit on the bland side.

One of the better places I've tried in the Bay, but still nowhere near astounding. While I can see myself coming back again (infrequently), it's certainly not a place I'd wait more than ten, twenty minutes for.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - Woodhouse is a fairly small venue, with a mix of high bar counters and tables, and normal sit-down tables, all arranged fairly closely together. Combined with the long lines and small waiting area, you should be prepared for a bit of a cramped experience (though nothing near the point of being inaccessible).

Bathroom - Didn't check them out, so I can't comment.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Came here for lunch to satisfy my crab craving.  Started off with a cup of the New England clam chowder ($5.50), but it was lacking flavor that I had to add salt.  I say skip it!

I ordered the half Toasted-Buttered Dungeness Roll ($17) and my husband got the half Split-Top Maine Lobster Roll ($18).  It came with fries and coleslaw.  The crab came warm and it fulfilled my fresh crab craving, but there wasn't a lot of flavor that I wouldn't order it again.  I should have ordered the Lobster Roll as it was cold lobster in mayo and had much more flavor.  It was tasty enough that I ended up trading my sandwich with my husband after eating half of it.  The coleslaw was really good that I wish they gave us more.  Fries were a little overcooked that it reminded me of McDonald's fries.  

Lobster Roll - 5/5
Fries - 3/5
New England Clam Chowder - 2/5
Coleslaw - 5/5

Service was attentive, food time was decent.  I'll come back for the Lobster Roll and coleslaw.
author: Erica S.

description:
I love walking around the streets of Pac Heights. Parking is a whole different story though. I made some big circles around and around hoping to find myself lucky enough to find a spot. There's a lot of meter parking in this area.

This Woodhouse location is fairly cozy so i felt my group of 4 was lucky to snag a window table at the last minute. The menu is filled with so many amazing choices from clam chowder, to a lobster roll, cioppino... and fresh oysters! I'm not an oyster fan but i'm aware they have $1 oyster specials.

I knew what i wanted immediately when our waitress announced the specials for the day.  Once she mentioned the Bacon Wrapped Trout stuffed with mushrooms i just completely zoned out. It was as good as it sounds! A nicely seasoned whole deboned trout wrapped in several strips of bacon, stuffed with juicy mushrooms, laying over a bed of potatoes, and broccoli rabe on top. Don't know if this description is necessary as it's a "special" and not a concrete menu item but it has inspired a future home cooked meal at home.
author: Samantha L.

description: The food was tasty, fresh, and came within a reasonable amount of time. I did have to reorder my drink, but other than that the waitress was attentive throughout the rest of the meal. I've eaten here on a Saturday before and this time was a Sunday; both days are very busy for this place. I ordered the stuffed artichoke and it was pretty good. The roasted garlic on it was crunchy and salty; really good. But I wish there was some type of pesto mayo (or something similar) to dip my artichoke in. My dad ordered the salmon special and it was really good. I was a little jealous.  The greens that came with it were quite good as well.
author: Isabelle H.

description:
50 min wait! **dies**

I have had this place bookmarked for the longest time! Finally convinced my friends (who aren't really seafood eaters) to go. We arrived around 7pm and didn't get seated til 8pm ish. 

Crispy Calamari ($12): Not really crispy, it was a bit on the soggy side. I have had better. Downside is they don't really cut up the tenticles on the calamari. My friend had to cut it even more cause the pieces are just too big to fit into your mouth. 
http://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/-BH7DcU_QJ4eSPZQZkb-fA/l.jpg

Bowl of Hartford Clam Chowder ($9): Large bowl of New England Clam Chowder and 1/2 a serving spoon of Manhanttan Clam Chowder. Totally NOT what the server described as HALF New England and HALF Manhattan. Their clam chowder was pretty rich and tasty, you don't get a lot of the clams, potatoes and such. The soup is really creamy and yummy. If you are aiming to get an entree, skip the bowl and get just the cup. I was too full to eat my entree after this. It was very filling.
http://s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/hdhcjfnkbdFs0Q2-ri5Pgg/l.jpg

Small Lobster Roll ($18): I took a couple of bites of this dish and boy was it good! The buttery crispy bread and the moist soft lobster was just oh so good. The seasoning in the lobster salad was very light, the heaviness you feel afterwards is more from the over buttered bread (and the clam chowder). If you are trying to decide either the large or the small, take a look at my picture to see the size difference. the small was enough for me. My friend who got the large didn't even finish his food. He also didn't know how to eat it cause it was just overflowing with lobster. 
http://s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/WiwrwYSnCLiZxlCmiDf7Rw/l.jpg

Food Service was awesome! My cup of water did not go empty! Will come back for their $1 oysters!
author: Erica T.

description: Each time I'm in SF, I make it a point to stop by. This was my third time here and I'm sad to say that it's gone from a 5 star to a 3 1/2 in my books. The lobster roll is now a whopping $36 versus the $24 when I first had it and the service kind of sucked today. Today, I ordered the Manhattan tomato soup, fried clams, and lobster roll (large). The fried clams were a bit too oily for me and although the soup was tasty, it was kind of salty and tasted like chili, not the tomatoy soup I had in mind. Lobster roll was of course delicious but I just can't justify the cost anymore. I came on a Sunday night an hour before closing so there were plenty of tables. We were seated right away, but we had to flag down our waitress multiple times throughout our meal - first time to order, second time because she brought us the wrong order, and third because she took my credit card and handed me a bill, forgetting she had my cc in her apron. Place is still good, but I don't think it's worth the price anymore and the effort to come. It was ~$120 for 1 appetizer, 2 soups, and 2 entrees. On to the next.
author: Macy G.

description:
I almost always get the stuffed artichoke.  It is DELICIOUS every time!  There is a yummy salad that comes with and impossible to resist garlic bread.

I've also enjoyed a whole crab and oysters on different occasions, also delicious.

Many of my friends love the lobster roll.

The service is always 5 stars too.

Love this place!
author: Juliana L.

description:
We got to eat  some incredibly delicious food. We started off with some bomb ass clam chowder. It was very rich in flavor and creamy. I knew i had to get an actual bowl which was a good choice.

Then we ordered fish and chips which was very good as well. the best thing about it was thag it wasn't heavily covered in batter. I got to eat crab cakes which were pretty good. We also sat at the bar which was really cool since we got to see ourbfood made by the chefs. Only thing that sucks is parking and seating. We sat at the bar area because the rest of the seating reminded us of the scene from valentines day where u have no privacy and people are basically listening to your conversations. Other than that everyrhing we ate was awesome.
author: Mauro M.

description: We are regulars at the Woodhouse and love it for the fish & chips ( best in SF), fish tacos, lobster roll, grilled calamari app, crab Louie salad and fresh fish entrees. But the new mahi-mahi ceviche app was a disappointment as the bland flavor lacked zest or tanginess; there was also too much diced potato rather than fish. So, the $13 ceviche cost wasn't worth it.
author: Michael B.

description:
Wow. This place is amazing. I don't even like seafood and was forced to come but I'm so happy I did. I went late at night around 10 and there was still a 20 minute wait but the staff was extremely friendly. Not only that but whenever my water cup was low...it got filled up. Amazing. 

But let's keep going. The food. Superb. For a meal for two, we ordered the clam chowder, 8 oysters, calamari, lobster roll and a crab roll. Everything was good! I was craving calamari that day and it was a good portion which I was happy about. There were no complaints. I just want to go on about the crab roll...

....where do I even start about this crab roll. I split the rolls for dinner and started with the crab roll. Good lord I didn't know seafood could taste like this. It was so good. The reviews on here say it's amazing...BELIEVE IT. I ate the lobster roll after the crab roll, don't get me wrong, it was still good but the whole time I was wishing I hadn't shared my crab roll and just ate it all to my selfish self. I even picked at the scraps of crab left on my plate like my dog when my food falls on the floor. It was honestly just great. The crab was so tender...so good...so flavorful...so majestic. If I could roll around and be stuffed in a room of this crab and eat my way through to freedom I would. 

Definitely worth the try.
author: Alex J.

description:
I like this location better, has more tables and way more spacious than the one on Market. Either one serves one of the most delicious lobster rolls in San Francisco Bay Area. With the choice between butter or mayo dressings, you could never go wrong on that scrumptious lobster-stuffed roll. If you want your roll loaded with lobster meat for an ultimate satisfaction, get the $25 portion instead of the $18.

Must try before you die.
author: Lora M.

description:
I think I first bookmarked this place (well actually the one on Market) a couple of years ago, and just somehow never made it there.  That neighborhood has soooooo many restos, it's hard to select, but when my sweet friend G invited me to lunch for my birthday, this was my suggestion.  Parking was only slightly tricky, and when we arrived a bit before noon, it was about 85% full, but fortunately no wait for us.  The two tops are very tiny and crammed in there like, well, sardines.

We ordered 1/2 doz oysters to share.  They were very fresh tasting, but strangely lacking in the lovely liquor I like to slurp.  She got a wedge salad, and I copied her, even though I'm not always a fan, and was afraid it might be too much food with the rest of my order.  It was delicious.  The dressing was just the right amount, and perfect balance of blue cheese to liquid (in this application, I don't like the cheese to overpower) and not too thick.  The iceburg lettuce seemed as though it was a smaller than usual head, and the serving was about a quarter of it.  Not too large, so I thought I would still be able to stuff down the large lobster roll I ordered.

Should have gone with the smaller version, but my love of the big bug, which I so rarely eat, lured me in.  So I concentrated on just the lobster, and left the roll - they always seem like hot dog buns to me, despite how New Englanders rave about them.  There was a huge amount (6 ounces) of lightly dressed, impeccably fresh lobster.  I loved it.  I wish I'd had more room for the fries which were well executed in the "frites" style.  G. had the dungeoness crab melt, which she devoured.  Usually she takes half her lunch home for dinner, but this time she ate the whole thing.

It was a lovely sunny, brisk day, and we walked and window shopped.  What a great neighborhood.

Food:  35/40
Service:  18/20
Value:  16/20
Atm/intangibles:  16/20
85/100 = B = 4 stars
author: Diane B.

description:
What can I say.  I'll join the club ... of people who obviously love the food here.
Had dinner here recently on a Friday night with two friends.  We shared the following
Clam Chowder
Fish n Chips
Crab Roll
Fish Tacos

Safe to say that every food dish was absolutely enjoyable.  Tasty, well prepared, good portion sizes, nicely presented ... the whole package.  As soon as we were done eating, we knew we would have wanted to have tried other things on the menu (like the lobster roll), but we also knew we were stuffed.  We waited about 45 minutes for our table and yes it can feel a little cramped inside and yes the waitress was a little bit snooty with us (we told her we were first-timers).  But the restaurant had a fun atmosphere and who's going to complain when the food is this good?  Not me.

Will be back for sure!
author: Lewis C.
Free P.

description: We are only in San Fran for the night and I HAD to get my oyster fix!  I usually go to a different place, but we were in the neighborhood so I thought I would check this out.  Great choice!  Oysters were tasty and service was too notch. We sat at the bar for some rose and a dozen oysters.  I asked the server for a mix and liked everything he picked (4 different kinds).  I wish we came here for a full lunch because EVERYTHING looked great.  Warning though- nothing on the menu for those who don't want to eat from the sea (although who are those people)
author: Jackie R.

description:
The service here is HORRIBLE. We arrived with a group of 16 and they said they could not accommodate groups larger than 8 and the manager tried to TURN US AWAY!!! He said "it's the busiest night of the year and we won't be able to accommodate you. I only have me and 1 server." Why is there only 1 server if it's the "busiest night"?? A customer is a customer and money is money. 

I asked us to have my name put down anyway and asked to be seated in separate groups, even if they were smaller groups of 2-3. The first group of 8 was seated in 15 mins and the waitress was rude and tried to rush us to order, so we told her we needed a little more time. 

And that set the tone for this dinner...

We finally ordered and our food came 25 mins later and the other half of our party was still NOT seated and they kept seating other people ahead of them. After another 10 mins passed, they seated a few more from our group. There were 5 more left to be seated. 20 mins passed and they were still not seated, so I asked the same waitress from earlier why they weren't seated yet and why other people kept being seated ahead of them, she said "FIRST OFF, I'M NOT THE HOSTESS, SO YOU NEED TO ASK HER." Definitely put a damper on an already bad situation. 

The food is usually good, but the experience from the start is probably the reason the food was not up to par. The seafood in my ciopinno was overcooked and the lobster rolls were dry. 

As I was typing this up at the table, I'm
Sure they saw it bc the manager tried to apologize and say thank you even though he didn't talk to us at all during our meal. If you were really sorry, you would have shown more urgency to seat people who were waiting for over an hour or offered to take care of something on their bill.
author: Mimi A.

description:
Found this place on Instagram and I think I'll go with 3stars or 2:-( 
We went there for lunch time and I ordered dungeness  crab pasta and my boyfriend got split lobster roll ,lobster roll was okay but still no salty or spicy enough no spice and my pasta was awful I just had bite and omg Noo. 
I was very disappointed about my food and I asked them to bring me fish and chips so fish and chips was little better fish was good but still not salty enough :-( 
They have great ingredients here but I didn't understand why they didn't use a little bit of spice like salt and pepper :-(
author: Nastaran G.

description:
Not to shabby,,, getting as close to the east coast seafood as its been here,  here at the end of the continent .  We just had lunch ... i had the clam roll and she had the fish and chips.... looking forward to dinner and some steam clams or mussels...  didn't see the dinner menu hope thats on it....
Sure miss those Clam shacks on the east coast !!!
open face raw cherrystones and steamed piss clams .. sure miss them... maybe they will have them here later on...
Service was excellent....
author: Peter N.

description:
First time at Woodhouse and very pleasantly surprised; I'll definitely be back. 

Service was excellent and very friendly. I led off with the Shrimp Cocktail which was very fresh and served with a mildly aggressive cocktail sauce -- the way I like it. Next I had the grilled Stuffed Artichoke (highly recommended by Yelpers) which was arguably one of the best grilled 'chokes I've had and where the fresh shrimp and Dungeness crab pushed it over the top to greatness. I finished with their Sourdough Bread Pudding recommended by my server. I like bread puddings, and this too was awesome -- and large, easily enough for two.

Negative: parking in the area is a challenge.
author: Greg V.

description: The most delightful atmosphere. Cozy and warm service. I felt very welcome..  The food from appetizers to desert were simply fabulous!!! A must when visiting San Francisco!
author: Francine K.

description: We ordered the large lobster roll which comes with delicious garlic fries and the stuffed artichokes one half with grilled shrimp and the other half with crab meat! Everything was really delicious and the staff were very friendly! Definitely coming back
author: Anji S.

description:
Wood house is a cute casual neighborhood spot. Probably had the best lobster roll in the city. 
There's usually a wait at wood house during busy times but it's worth it especially with a family of a group of 4-5. You can usually share most of the menu items like crab, fish n chips and they're always made fresh.
author: Kaego R.

description:
The girls and I decided to try this place a month ago and I came here again last night for a dinner date. First time I was here I ordered their famous lobster roll, was a little disappointed because the lobster was a little cold and they used too much mayo. The fries were a little over cooked. However the clam chowder and oysters were amazing.

Came here last night with my date and it was his first time here and he went with the lobster roll and I decided to try their Dungeness Crab Linguine al dente. We also ordered clam chowder and a dozen oysters. The clam chowder was good and the oysters were fresh. I had a bite of the lobster roll and it was much better than what I had last time. The linguine was al dente but a tiny bit on the sour side.

The waitress was very attentive and came by multiple times to make sure our water and wine was filled. The bill came out to be $105.xx and I left a $20 tip.
Will definitely come back again!
author: Panchali S.

description:
Wow this place has some AWESOME seafood!!

I convinced my bf to have lunch here on Saturday and we were both impressed with the food. We arrived around 11 AM so there were only a few people in the restaurant, but by the time we left almost all of the tables were full. Our waitress was super nice and friendly and service was on point: water and menus were brought to us immediately and our food was delivered after a short wait.

We ordered a cup of New England clam chowder, the crab melt sandwich and the two piece fish and chips. I'm more a Manhattan clam chowder fan (the red one) but my bf is partial to the white one and Woodhouse's was awesome! It had a rich, creamy flavor with lots of clams and potatoes in every bite. I was extremely happy with my fish and chips, the fish was flaky and flavorful and tasted so good with the DELICIOUS tartar sauce that came on the side. Seriously people this was some of the best tartar sauce I had ever tasted; it was chunky but light and paired perfectly with the fish. Add a dash of malt vinegar and BAM you have perfection. The fries were also really good and the coleslaw was yummy too but my only complaint is that there wasn't enough lol. My bf liked his crab melt as well, two pieces of bread stuffed with flavorful crab meat and cheese. 

The food is a bit pricey but it's SF so I wasn't really surprised. It came to a bit over $30 for the two of us for lunch but the food was well worth the price. I was totally satisfied and look forward to coming here again soon!
author: Sam F.

description:
$50 for lunch (not including tip) a lil steep but well spent. 
1 Bowl of hearty clam chowda, 1/2 dozen oysters at $2/pop (henderson bay & blue point) the Henderson ones from WA were my favorite. Mmmmmmmm:-P Driving home to Tahoe on the Oakland bridge I regretted us not ordering more oysters...my mouth is still watering. 
A lobster roll ($18) with huge chunks of claw meat was good but not spectacular.
 DIY Arnold palmie ($5) & an ice tea. The slaw was great I wish there was more. I enjoyed it here but will probably try somewhere else next time I'm in SF:)
author: Olga H.

description: We went twice lately. The first time, I had their fish and chips. The fish batter was so light and airy. It was so good. My husband liked this avocado and shrimp sandwich. The second time, I had the crab salad. I couldn't find the lettuce. It was so good. Crab was so fresh. My lemonade was do-it-yourself and I loved it. I was able to put in how much of the sparkling water and simple sugar. I can't remember what my husband had because I loved my salad!
author: Diane H.

description: Woodhouse is a narrow/small restaurant but the small details in their decor adds so much personality to the place. I sampled their whole crab with garlic sauce, clam chowder, and oysters. They were serving Washington oysters and ran out of the Kumamotos which where their premium oysters. Their crab and oysters were fresh. No doubt about that.
author: My P.

description:
Woodhouse Fish is pretty darn delicious. It was hard to decide what to order as I wanted one of everything! I landed on the jalapeño crab special (half order) It came out buttery and spicy - just about perfect. It's been awhile since I've had crab - so I always forget you really need to work for your food - it is a messy meal and you will end up with butter everywhere - but still worth it. 

If you sit at the bar you may have some trouble catching the eye of your server when you are in need of a drink refill, but other than that service was great, friendly, and helpful.
author: Shannon H.

description:
Taste of food: 4 stars
Cost of food: brings overall review to 3 stars

This place is great because of convenience, right on Fillmore street so I can just easily walk in after shopping! Howeverrrr, this place is small! Super cramped and we were lucky to even be able to get 3 seats for all of us because the place was packed on a random weekday night

We were able to order pretty immediately and shared a crab roll, lobster roll, and stuffed artichoke between 3 people.

Food came fast and was pretttty good, but for the price? Nah. Ridiculously expensive. Probably won't come here again because I'm sure I can get just as good of seafood or even better for cheaper somewhere else.

But hey, I guess it's hard to find seafood in Lower Pac Heights because your'e not in the Marina or something so it kind of makes sense why it's priced so high.
author: Vicki L.

description:
Yawn, not impressed.

After having lobster roll at another resturant, I was craving for more.  If you type lobster roll in the search engine on Yelp, Woodhouse is first on the list which meant this was my next destination.

The fries were crispy but a little on the salty side.  The lobster roll didn't have much flavor.  I asked for more butter but that didn't help either- it turned into greasy lobster with bread.  

The salad wasn't as crispy as I wanted it to be.

Overall, I was quite disappointed.  I would've been a regular here- maybe if they improve their flavors.
author: Linda N.

description: I was so excited to try their lobster roll but unfortunately it didn't meet my expectations. For a 6oz roll that cost $28 the portion was really small. The extra condiments on the lobster roll took away from the lobster flavor. The bun was toasted and buttered perfectly though.
author: Sarina S.

description: I was craving a good clam chowder spot off the beat and path of fishermans wharf. Went onto Yelp and saw a few places and stumbled upon this place and read the reviews. Being that the reviews were good I decided to check this place out! Well it was worth the shot! Everything from the service to the food was good. We ordered the clam chowder ( of course) and the fish and chips with a dozen oysters! Long story short everything was better than expected! Hands down best clam chowder! Well pretty much everything was bomb.com  defiantly a place a to check out!
author: Adrienne R.

description:
I had to get my fill of cold water oysters before returning to Texas.  I was NOT disappointed.  I also had the lobster roll which was rather tasty.
My husband had fish and chips which he enjoyed.  
Service was great. I really liked it here.
author: Nikki A.

description:
I don't fancy myself as an avid lover of seafood, but sometimes places like Woodhouse remind me to also enjoy the fruits of the sea (instead of just land proteins!). I went last night on a whim with some good friends from out of town. I couldn't think of other spots in the area that didn't need reservations. Plus, one of my friends was craving seafood so this was a must-try! 

We (3 of us) got there around 8 PM. The hostess quoted us for one hour. We decided while wait we'd head to grab coffee nearby until it was time to return. We returned around 8:40 and as estimated, we were sat around 9. They put us at the counter which was not ideal, but hey, we were hungry! Luckily, the counter was spacious and the stools were comfortable (by the way, they have hooks under the counter in case you wanna hang your jacket, bag, or sweater). 

We were quickly greeted with a server. She took our drink orders (I had a glass for pinot gris for $8. EXCELLENT... their house chardonnay is only $6 which to me is stunning since this is in/near Pacific Heights!). We also placed an order for calamari. The calamari was lightly battered and the rings were thickly sliced. FRESH. FRESH. FRESH, I tell you! And the accompanying sauces (a slightly spicy aioli and cocktail sauce) were delicious to dip the calamari in. I had the bay shrimp and avocado roll. My gosh. I can't think of the last time I had shrimp that plump, juicy, and NOT overcooked. They pretty much put a whole avocado in between this buttery, slightly sweet brioche (that was also grilled!). UGHHHH AHHHMAZZING. The slaw is fantastic as well. I don't usually like cole slaw, but it was slightly tart, not drenched in sauce, and wasn't super sour like some bad quality slaws out there. The FRIES make life worth living: crunchy and thin (but not matchstick thin). To me, given the neighborhood and the food options available, this was $13 and ABSOLUTELY WORTH IT. 

My friend from Boston ordered the full lobster roll. I took a bite. Delicious. And as a former Bostonian, he wholeheartedly approved (that's some serious biz right there!). They also put a generous amount on the roll so it's definitely worth the $26 as well. My other friend ordered the crab cakes (3) and said it's one of the best he's had in awhile. 

Service was fine. Not much to report. They were minimally attentive -- not in a negative way... the server didn't check up on us regularly and oftentimes we had to remind them for things like plates, new silverware, water refills... So if not for the "meh" service, I would've given Woodhouse 5 stars. (I still wish Yelp would allow for half-star ratings... because I personally feel it's more like 4.5 stars.) Ambiance... very nautical... very New England-ish (which my friend who lived in Boston appreciated). Anyway, in case you haven't stopped by, do that! I'm just thrilled to know there are reasonably priced places in the neighborhood where I don't feel like I'd been robbed. (Trust. There is some overpriced, overrated food along Fillmore.) Enjoy!
author: James Z.

description:
I absolutely love lobster rolls! The lobster roll here at Woodhouse is outrageously good! Full of fresh, sweet pieces of lobster meat. The roll itself was soft and buttery. So good!

The clam chowder was rich and creamy. Just the right amount of clams and potatoes. I also was a fan of the calamari! It was crispy and paired with a nice aioli.

Service was friendly. Prices are not cheap but expected considering you are in SF. Either way, worth it for the quality and service. Only gripe is finding parking in this neighborhood. Overall, great place for any seafood lover. Can't wait to come back!
author: Paul C.

description: I thought it was a little overpriced for what you actually got. The lobster roll toppled out of the sandwich and the crab linguine was very heavy. It ended up being $73 for 2 people... And we just had waters.
author: Nicole A.

description: England does not stand a chance.  Woodhouse has the best fish & Chips I have ever had  - this side of the pond! The batter is light and fluffy and so was the fish.  I am not a fish and chips fan but for some reason it sounded good.  They were not just good  - they were outstanding!  I actually had onion rings instead of chips - outstanding too.  Service was so so however, the food made up for the lack of it. Honestly - the very best fish and chips on either side of the pond.
author: Margarete A.

description:
Very good seafood restaurant in the Fillmore. The oysters were super fresh, the squid was delicious and the side of seasonal vegetable was cooked perfectly. For main course, we had the artichoke with shrimp and crab, the Whole branzino and the lobster roll. All were very good. The Branzino was cook really well and the lobster roll had tons of meat (too much claw though). 
I came with my wife, my mother and my 3 years old twins and the staff was super friendly and they took care of us nicely.

We will be back.

PS: To Nicole B and Mimi A from HI, you should learn that you don't show up with a party of 16 to a small restaurant like that (the restaurant has 42 seats including the bar). The restaurant does not take reservation so don't try to force it by just showing up. You should be more considerate to the restaurant and Red Lobster would be more appropriate to your group (they can usually seat 150 to 200 people at the same time). Leaving One star review is just pathetic for not trying to understand how a small business works.
author: G R.

description: I ordered fish and chips and a bowl of clam chowder Togo. I loved everything. The clam chowder especially. It was brothy but also creamy, which was different from traditional chowders. The fish and chips were really good too. Definitely better than some that I've had by the pier. Definitely would come back... Every week.
author: Thanh V.

description: I really enjoyed this please make sure to expect to wait a little bit in line but once you get in the food is amazing I had a lobster roll or a shirt and amazing french fries great food great people that's what life is about definitely come back to this place.
author: Nick D.

description:
Had a pretty delightful dinner here, good environment, really lovely decor.

About the food. 
I ordered the fish and chips, and the fish WERE HUGE. Definitely only get the two (unless you're a sharer, then get three). I started with the calamari, which was pretty good, but heavily fried. Everything here is pretty heavy. My mom got the soft shell crab BLT which looked pretty delicious, but again, very fried. 

If you like heavy seafood, this is your place. If you are looking for something lighter, this may not be your spot. They looked like they had a pretty stellar bar, and would definitely go back for that.
author: Clinton J.

description: Loved this place I had the stuffed artichokes, really good. This isn't a big place and it fills up quickly so get there early.
author: Laura A.

description:
Ok, so Woodhouse Fish bills itself as a New England styled fish house. Great decor and attentive service. I ordered three things: New England Clam Chowder, Calamari and a small Lobster Roll.

Here's the details:

- Chowder was way too thick and basically flavorless. Either it had been sitting all day or there was way too much potato starch. It could have been from a can.

- Calamari had been fried so long it was tough and tasteless.

- Lobster Roll was made with frozen lobster. The texture of frozen lobster is very specific, like sawdust.

For a restaurant that bases its reputation on fish, you'd think they'd be a lot more diligent in using the finest fresh ingredients. This meal was a complete failure. Fresh seafood deserves better. Won't be back,
author: Perry V.

description: The toasted buttered crab roll is one of the best things I've eaten this year! So good. Get the small or split the large between two people. Not a cheap meal (think the large was $35 out something close) but totally worth it. The make your own lemonade is also worth it, I like being able to adjust the sweetness level by adding the simple syrup myself. Be prepared to wait 30 min to an hour for a table. I'll come back for sure, probably when I have visitors from out of town who want good crab.
author: Andrew S.

description: Went there Wednesday 8/3 with a party of 5 instead of pulling the tables together on a bench seat area the hostess has 5 of us squeeze in to a table with one of the chair right against the reception booth. Later on after our order there is a possible way to move us to a better seating but she refuse to accommodate on it. Food might be good but the attitude of the hostess is horrendous!
author: K W.

description:
:Little hole in wall places are always good. Get there early if you want a seat. The oysters were fresh and tasted great. The Hartford chowder was good but I should have stuck with the New England clam chowder. 

I got the fish and chips and the cod was breaded so lightly and flaky..Amazing.
author: Anne Marie S.

description: Yelp sometimes disappoints, sometimes anoints. This was deeeeelicious. I have to go back. The lobster roll was something to text home about for sure. My daughter enjoyed the do it yourself lemonade.
author: Melissa C.

description:
This place is so good I want to cry because I am not there right now.

I came here last Saturday around 2pm with my boyfriend, and we were seated right away. I had the lobster roll and he got fish and chips. Both were sooooooooooooooo good!!! The lobster roll was so fresh, and the fish was fried perfectly. We also got an Arnold Palmer, WHICH YOU CAN ADJUST THE AMOUNT OF TEA/SWEETNESS YOURSELF!!! They give you like this lemon juice thing, and you can pour in however much tea and sweetener as you would like. 

It was on the pricey side, but I didn't care at all because my stomach was so happy yay!
author: Alice H.

description: Probably the best lobster roll you would ever eat. I love this place, it is a little pricy but totally worth it!!!
author: Omar R.

description:
Decent, wholesome, fresh seafood. Drink selection was basic in a good way. 

Lobster sandwich and clam chowder were yummz. Steamed clams and Pappardelle was also worth mentioning. Would come back.
author: David P.

description:
Great seafood with a definite New England feel.
Chunky Clam chowder was one of the best I had with good portions of large clam chunks, bacon, potatoes, and secret ingredients.  Beer battered Alaskan cod that had both my boys fighting for the last piece and the lobster roll paired with coleslaw. All was exceptional. It is a neighborhood favorite and takes me back to my youth.
author: S V.

description: Excellent service, but very basic and pricey for what you get. If you want good fish tacos, go to Papitos on Hayes, a good tortilla goes a long way! I judge a place by their hot sauce, they only have tabasco. So their $2.50/oyster experience is so so, better oysters around SF for less. Their Ahi Tuna special, $21 and boooorrrinnnggg. Go to Bi-Rite on Divisadero. They know how to make an Ahi Tuna sandwich. Over all, fresh and clean & great service, but just plain boring food for the price.
author: Fredo L.

description:
Lobster roll or crab roll?  Mmmm, lobster roll.  Wait...crab roll.  No, the lobster roll.  Well, actually...
 
Can't decide like me?  Simple - convince your friend to get one while you get the other and share!  Done and done. 

Okay, seriously...when people talk about how great the Maine Lobster and Crab Rolls are here, it's no joke.  They really are that good.  Even the fries are terrific - nice and crispy!  Whether you choose the Lobster Roll (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PFk6k_hEGG0n6_FAJSm9EQ?select=pm3jXWAZfmH7eJ04y-dQVw#CW14rSIUVM_FPuLSMGSTmQ) and its huge chunks of deliciousness or the Crab Sandwich (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PFk6k_hEGG0n6_FAJSm9EQ?select=pm3jXWAZfmH7eJ04y-dQVw#OnhNXD4qYSMihErn6LStpg) and its buttery crab flavor, you really can't go wrong.  The only reason why I might say the Crab Roll was slightly better is because I just generally like crab more.  Otherwise, they're both really good....and really big!  Each one is offered in small and large sizes, but after trying the 3oz Crab Roll and 6oz Lobster Roll, I'd say spring for the upsize.  The smaller one is probably good enough, but if you're already paying $17 or $18 for one, it might be worth it to kick in the extra $8 bucks to double up on the good stuff.

As much as I would love to round up Woodhouse to five stars for their sandwiches though, the Clam Chowder and Iceberg Louie Salad (with Shrimp) is why it's four stars instead.  Both were decent, but they were slightly flawed.  For the Louie Salad (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PFk6k_hEGG0n6_FAJSm9EQ?select=pm3jXWAZfmH7eJ04y-dQVw#KeKz8yTjGbbn2dlIxdwc6g), I loved how much shrimp they included, but we both thought the salad was a little salty and kind of heavy on the dressing.  As for the bowl of Clam Chowder (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PFk6k_hEGG0n6_FAJSm9EQ?select=pm3jXWAZfmH7eJ04y-dQVw#k6pHrSQuCJCWIe4V9B7XhQ), it wasn't bad, but I wouldn't say it's the "the best one ever".  I liked the consistency/texture, but I wish it had more clams and flavor.

Regardless, you'll probably see me sooner rather than later Woodhouse.  Not only is your seafood good, but your do-it-yourself Arnold Palmer is pretty cool (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PFk6k_hEGG0n6_FAJSm9EQ?select=pm3jXWAZfmH7eJ04y-dQVw#A8sWN_9rCGYsIV2qOiL0_Q) and you seem like a nice place to bring date.  Hopefully I'll be back with someone special next time.  ;)
author: Mike L.

description:
S: This is a clean, fun, sea-side vibe restaurant with a grand sandy beach panorama painting on one side and tasteful ship-town memorabilia hanging from the others. Staff are polite and attentive but not overbearing. Service is spot-on and appropriately quick.

O: We ordered a (small) cup of Manhattan clam chowder ($7), which came with oyster crackers, and two entrees - fish tacos ($16) and a small Dungeness crab roll ($21 with cole slaw and fries). Limited selection of beers are $6-7. The food was fried and tasty, although the chowder was a bit too salty and quite a small serving for $7. The fish tacos were delightful, simple, and fresh, but seemed to be a re-hashed version of "fish and chips" without the fries and, rather, served in a corn tortilla with avocado and a chipotle mayo. Nonetheless, the three tacos were quite filling and did hit the mark. The crab roll was fresh, not too fishy, and also quite filling.

A/P: Service is perfect. The food is good but is almost too simple for the price, even for fresh seafood. Even so, I would up-rate this place to 4 stars given it's freshness, balanced plates, quick and clean service, and polite staff. Definitely recommended to anyone who is not afraid of gaining a couple pounds from these fried foods. The only gripe is that the price is a tad too high for the food.

Overall rating: 3.5. Points deducted for the (minimally) salty/lackluster food, which didn't quite meet the expectations given the high price.
author: Chris B.

description: I got the lobster roll and I'd recommend you do that too. The bread was especially tasty. It had an amazing aroma and complimented the lobster meat perfectly. Can't wait to go back.
author: Aubrey J.

description: Best fish n chips I've had in a while! I love the crispy outer layer and the super flaky interior. The addition of malt vinegar doesn't even make the crispy part soggy! And the tartar sauce definitely tastes homemade. I also tried the clam chowder cup, which had a rich, deeply developed flavor. Sitting by the window is nice, a great people watching spot on Fillmore. Really cute interior, tables are a bit close together.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Solid cioppino, though the broth was a little saltier than the other cioppinos I've had. Big chunks of fish, shrimp, and a quarter o' crab. Nice cheesy garlic bread chunks, though I'm not sure if the cheese distracted from the sauce sopping that the bread usually comes in use for. The bite I had of their lobster roll was amazing. Nice fleshy lobster and very light due to a good use of mayo.

Everyone around us was hitting up the fish and chips, so I know what I'm coming back for!
author: Kevin L.

description: The food was good and the do-it-yourself Arnold Palmer was fun BUT....they only had ONE waitress for the entire restaurant.  She did a great job having in consideration that she has so much stuff to do, but the service was slow (obviously).  I had the clam chowder and the lobster roll and both were delicious!!!
author: Juliana M.

description:
It was a nice day outside and this place is in a good area. After looking at smalls shops, we decided to try out Woodhouse from the reviews I've been seeing on Yelp. 

My boyfriend ordered the crab melt sandwich and I ordered the crab cakes. Fair selection of beers to go along with the seafood. 

When our food arrived, the crab melt sandwich looked disappointing. $13 for this?! But it did taste delicious. Crab cakes were good too, very fresh. 

I definitely would come back to try their Lobster roll sandwich, which I regret not getting after I saw the table next to us order.
author: Victoria K.

description: Came here with my cousin for late lunch. The restaurant is small but nicely decorated on the inside and its nice and cozy. We ordered a bowl of New England clam chowder and Crab Melt. The clam chowder was really good. It was really nice and hot and it hit the spot on the cold SF weather. It also came with a lot of clams surprisingly!! The crab melt was very yummy as well. The sandwich was pretty small though but tasted delicious! The bread was nice and toasty and the crab meat was tasty and the cheese on top was gooey and melted. The fries that came with it were thin cut and really crispy just how I like it! Would come back!
author: Juan F.

description:
I got the Maine lobster roll and it came with coleslaw and fries.

Everything was amazing!  Big portions of yummy lobster with minimal sauce. The fries were the best-tasting fries ive ever had and not too oily or salted as well. 

Staff was friendly. 

Will definitely return!
author: Alan L.

description: Excellent food. Oysters, a fried crab sandwhich. One friend hadthe  lobster roll, and wasn't too impressed. But my other friend liked the fish and chips. I was happy. Services staff don't seem to like their job. But otherwise I recommend
author: Mark E.

description:
Still not quite done with a late lunch here but felt compelled to share. The food here is amazing, plain and simple. Their flavor profiles aren't too complicated or involved, but everything is amazingly fresh and well prepared. I went with my wife and another couple and we ordered the following:

To start:
-4 raw Dabob oysters (fresh)
-New England clam chowder (excellent, could have been a bit meatier but tasted great)



Entrees:
-lobster roll: this was my entree. It was definitely pricey for a sandwich but it was delicious. 6oz of lobster, cold, for $27. Flavored very well but could have been bigger for the price. 
-stuffed artichoke: my wife got this one. She likes fighting with the artichoke leaves to clean the meat off of them and she REALLY enjoyed her meal. The garlic bread that came with it was amazing. 
-cioppino: my brother in law had that. Probably the best entree we collectively ordered. The sauce was delicious, especially when dipping the garlic bread in there. This was a very meaty plate as well. I'll probably be getting this next time. 
-blackened catfish: honestly didn't try it but the portion looked big and my sister in law thought it was great. 

Glad we picked this spot and would come again!
author: John M.

description:
If you know me personally, you would know that I think eating is a workout. The chewing, the swallowing, having to make room for all the yummies, etc. Some hard work right there! 

That being said, this place made eating a piece of cake for me. I don't even remember the labor put into consuming a meal here. 

I came here twice-- once with my homies, another time with family (my suggestion). 

First time, I figured.. alright, what's the harm in trying two things? My friend got the Dungeness crab Roll and I opted for the Lobster Roll. We split them. Lobster roll was mediocre (please do not quote me on that, for I am not a big fan of lobsters). But when I bit into my crab sandwich-- HO. MA. GOD. +fireworks+ 

My friend looked down maybe a couple minutes later, and I was finishing off my last couple pieces of fries. & he looked at me like I was inhuman. "YOU INHALED THAT. DID YOU EVEN TASTE IT?" 

:D hehe. Good stuff, guys. I'm drooling thinking about it. Nomz!
author: Andra C.

description:
Awesome! We only had to wait for about 5 mins at 5:30 on a Sunday, by it had a longer wait soon after. 

We started with the calamari, fresh and the house made sauce was nice. 

We then had the crab cakes--perfect balance of bread and crab, the salad with it was tasty too, even my husband ate the salad!

We also shared the cioppino-amazing I would have liked a little more bread to soak up the remnants, but they probably would have given it to me if I asked. So good I wanted to lick the bowl. 

Finally we had the strawberry shortcake--house made biscuits and whipped cream. Yum!
author: Sarah V.

description:
Service: Now this is what I call customer service. There was this old lady who fell right outside the restaurant. Instead of ignoring her, a waitress came out to help her up. Not only that, she brought out a chair and water for her. So nice! Not only of people would do that because they don't want to be involve. Also, when we walked in, they asked if we wanted anything to drink before we sat down. Nice!

Food: wow we waited for over 50 minutes for our order. Our appetizer didn't even come out! So they didn't charge us because the chef forgot about it. Oh, we ordered the calamari dish as our appetizer.

Lobster roll $18- it may come out looking all mayo-ish but it's not that bad. I usually hate condiments but it was good. Theres big chunks of lobster meat that sits in this really yummy bread. The fries however was whatever. It's super crunchy and I like mine like McDonald's...somewhat crunchy and somewhat soggy.

Dungeness crab roll $17- same review as the lobster roll. I love how it doesn't taste too fishy. It doesn't comes in all chunks but it also comes in shredded pieces. Squirt some lemon juice on, perfect!

Calamari $7-small perfect pieces. Squirt lemon...yum! Without the lemon and the sauce, it's really bland.

Water was nice and cold haha.
author: Tammy L.

description:
My partner and I had dinner here last Sunday and were completely won over by what we had!  We ordered both of their appetizer specials, grilled asparagus and grilled squid.  We also ordered the stuffed artichoke and fish and chips for our entree.  Though we were both pretty hungry starting out, we ended up having to box the fish and chips up virtually untouched.  

What we didn't realize was that many of the dishes came with generous serving of vegetables, such a nice surprise in this day and age when a dish is described to you in such detail that you are totally disappointed when you ended up with only a tiny bite of it.  The squid, for example, came in a skewer chockfull of tender meat on a bed of spinach cooked in such pungent olive oil it makes me wish for it again now.  The artichoke entrée was a generous portion, sitting on top of a beautiful salad mix.  The cheese bread that accompanied the dish was so tasty that my partner, who normally tries to stay away from carbs, finished her piece before I even had a chance to taste mine.  The fried fish that we tried there was probably the least exciting dish we had that night.  But, then again, we were already quite stuffed by the time the dish arrived, so that may have clouded our judgment of it.  

Needless to say, we'll be back!
author: Yvette F.

description:
I love everything i had here, fish and chips were amazing, the clam chowder is the best i've ever had. The shrimp and the crab rolls are great too!!
It's best for take out, it's always busy. But it's a great place for a late lunch at the restaurant.
author: Babs J.

description:
As far as I'm concerned, the more Woodhouse Fish Company outlets they open, the better the world would be. We'd be that much closer to peace, prosperity, the end of global warming, and really good shellfish. I was already a big fan of the one on Market Street because they serve world-class lobster rolls in a faux-rustic setting that definitely has the Cape Cod shack vibe to it. The Fillmore location reflects the upscale customer base that can be found traversing this neighborhood in their Skechers. I thought the Restoration Hardware touches would diminish the appeal of Woodhouse but not really when the food is this good. 

We came on a Wednesday evening before the Morcheeba concert at the nearby Fillmore. It was already fairly well-packed in there, but in the nick of time, we landed one of the tables for two in the front. Apparently, the emaciated, tailored-looking matrons at the table next to us didn't think of us as fit company for dining neighbors and promptly asked the waitress if they could be moved. Good riddance. May you always avoid undesirable people from your life and end up old, wrinkled and bitter. Oh wait... too late. The waitress herself was nice and not at all overbearing. Thank the seafood gods.

Jamie W. and I immediately split a $7.50 bowl of the Creamy New England Clam Chowder, which was pure, thick ambrosia speckled with chopped chives on top (see photo). Clams were plentiful and potatoes were used quite sparingly, just the way I like it. I was hoping to lick the bowl, but the two busybody matrons were still sitting next to us at the time. For my entree, I was predictable and went for the $26 Split-Top Maine Lobster Roll with Fries and Slaw (see photo). Yes, $26. I realize that's pricey, but I consider it an investment granted a short-term one with minimal return. But immediate gratification is important at times. OK, all the time. The upside is that the roll is just as richly delicious as the one you can get at the Market Street location. 

Jamie got more bang for his buck with a $13 order of the Fish & Chips, three good-size pieces of Anchor Steam beer-battered Alaskan cod that came with quite a pile of shoestring potatoes underneath and a soupcon of fresh tartar sauce (see photo). The pieces were so tender-crispy that I could have had a side order of that as well. Bottom line, I was just thrilled the food didn't disappoint here. While the place was abuzz with diners savoring their food, I was able to appreciate some of the offbeat decorating choices like the framed flatscreen that showed a streaming video of a fisherman's life in the Bay Area. 

FOOD - 5 stars...just as stellar as its Market Street twin and oh, that lobster roll 
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...nicer finishes here 
SERVICE - 4 stars...very friendly and helpful...handled difficult customers like the two old biddies with elan 
TOTAL - 5 stars...Woodhouse scores again...is a third SoMa location coming up...please?
author: Ed U.

description: Good place good vibes super busy, I recommend the crab roll or the crab melt. A little expensive but worth the money. Super fresh food and friendly staff.
author: AMIR H.

description:
We came by on a Friday evening at around 7PM. The wait was only 15 minutes long, which was great. I had the avocado and bay shrimp roll and my boyfriend had the soft shell crab BLT. Both came with a side of fries and cole slaw. We subbed out the side of fries for onion rings for an additional $1. The sandwiches were incredible! I believe the soft shell crab BLT is seasonal. If you see it on the specials board, don't hesitate to order! 

Both rolls are served on this fluffy, buttery bread--unlike the sometimes stale french bread you might get at other restaurants. My shrimp roll was perfectly seasoned and the generous slices of avocado on top made a good sandwich into a great one. 

The next time I want seafood in the city at reasonable prices (which is always), I will be back!
author: Anna N.

description: Wow. This little gem is big on great seafood. I am dying to go back and reorder this dish and everything else on the menu.
author: Tiveeda S.

description:
Truly one of the best clam chowders (New England is the true chowder) in the area. It's rich, chunky, thick, and fully of potatoey and clamy goodness.

The halibut special was delish as well. Plenty of tasty flavors with flaky halibut with crispy skin, tangy kumkuats (!), crumbled cauliflower, and carrots up the wazooo!

And finally, the pièce de résistance, the lobster roll omg. I couldn't juice that lemon fast enough to devour that delicious portion of juicy lobster on perfectly toasted and not too buttered up brioche bread. Couple that with perfectly crispy chips, and you're in heaven!

Try this place, you will not be disappointed! - Unless you're in a rush :)

Will definitely come back for the fish and chips next time!
author: Will C.

description: Great food. The  guy with a grey beard is a nice host. I'd give 3.5 only because it took a min before the back waiters noticed us at the counter tops. Nice spot though jazz music and great lighting.
author: Baby A.

description:
Heard about this place and been wanting to try the lobster roll. I was in the area. Parking was insane. Busy streets. Checked in around 1pm. Small cute place. It was somewhat busy with a few tables filled up. The host stand was literally 2 steps away from the front door. It was just me so didn't want to eat by myself. I ordered the small maine lobster roll to go. The guy host appeared to be a bit snooty & seemed annoyed that I ordered to go. 

After I paid for the food, the host said it will be ready in 10-15 minutes. It sounded like he wanted me to wait outside. I looked around for seats and obviously, this place is meant for people to sit down & dine in. No place for people to sit for to go orders. Thank goodness it was a beautiful sunny hot day in SF. About 10-15 minutes later, I picked up my food by a different guy host and he seemed more friendly & nice. His smile made my day. All customer service should always greet & smile at their customers. It really makes a difference.

Anyways, yes...everyone is right about the lobster roll. Oh my goodness, it's deliciously addicting good. Mmmm. For around $19, it's pricey but it's not that bad. Compared to LobsterMe in Vegas, their small lobster roll is around $18 with no sides. I say Woodhouse is more reasonable because it comes with a side of crispy french fries and small coleslaw. Yum. Everything was fresh, tasty & flavorful. I will definitely come back for more on my pay day :-)  3-star for the service and 4-star for the food.
author: Amy H.

description:
This is my favorite area fish place! They've big parts using a light beer batter. The stuffed artichokes are amazing also. I sub out the chips for the seasonal vegetables. Costs an additional $1. They're fascinating takes in the standard side dishes and fresh.

The area is quite modest so get here early, particularly on Tuesdays for $1 oysters!
author: James C.

description: Wow!!! This place is so damn good!!! That lobster sandwich was so damn amazing!!!! Great decor and great service!!!! Thanks you!!!
author: Cristian G.

description: I've been meaning to do this for awhile...this place is awesome!  My favorite sandwich, ever, is their Toasted-buttered Dungeness Crab Roll. I've eaten there several times and I have to order that sandwich every time. It's a perfect sandwich and the service is always great. I recently moved to Colorado but I will be back.
author: Adam S.

description: Baja fish tacos were delicious and the calamari was nice and crispy. Our wait and service was good.
author: Naomi D.

description: Arrived around 9:30 and dining room was still plenty full.  Were seated at the counter.  Wish they had a full bar, but beer and wine was OK.  Hartford chowder was delicious!
author: Jason G.

description:
Omg, some of the best crabs I have eaten in San Fransisco (aside from down south in Louisiana). They are really tasty and cooked to perfection. 

I will say cracking them open and serving them on the plate the way they do really takes away from eating the whole crab. You see I love the eggs and fat in the actual shell of the crab. But since this is a "nice" place I guess they don't want to hear or see the mess one would have to make to enjoy the full consumption of a crab.

A definite place to add to your list of crab eating joints. If you see a cute guy named Zia tell him "La Bestia " sent you ;)
author: Gabriella S.

description:
Finally had a chance to stop by this place on a friday night. They even served us beer as we were standing waiting for a table, superb.
