Ordered the Fish and chips, oysters, BBQ oysters, and the lobster Roll. 

Good choices of beer, ok service. The fish and chips were ok, and im not much of a raw oyster eater, but the BBQ tasted just fine. The lobster roll was pricey but tasted amazing. 

A little too expensive overall for the amount of food we got. but not bad.
author: Benjamin B.

description: What a great little place for an awesome crab sandwich. The only issue is that I wished it was a bit more toasted on one side as the other had a perfect toasting. We ordered the prawn cocktail and for 4 pieces of prawn for $12..it seemed a bit over-priced for what you get. The strawberry shortcake and chocolate mouse with hazelnuts were to die for!! Highly recommend the desserts.
author: Tina B.

description:
Oh man. I was really craving some old-fashioned seafood while strolling around in SF, and I happened about this cute little place. From the nautical-inspired interior to the 3D-moving images of ships sailing among the waves, Woodhouse Fish Company lives up to its image. 

I tried the crab cakes and the lobster roll. The crab cakes were some of the best I ever had - battered and fried to perfection, with some darn good aioli. The 6 oz. lobster roll definitely didn't skimp on the lobster, although the lobster was a tad too cold for my liking. The roll itself was buttery and wonderful. 

Prices are a little steep, but what else do you expect from a seafood establishment? I'l definitely be back when I'm in the area.
author: Crystal J.

description: Waited about 15 minutes for 2 seats at the bar at around 8:30 on a Saturday night. We started with a bottle of Boont and cup of Anchor Steam, which were perfect with our entrees of a large lobster roll and fish&chips. The lobster roll was moist and light. I would've liked a little more flavor in the lobster itself, but the bread was cooked perfectly. The fish and chips were also pretty good. Crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. I thought the price was a little steep - almost $70 after tax and tip. But I guess that's seafood for ya.
author: Mina C.

description:
The overall ambience its a busy and friendly place. We were lucky we went around 6:30 no line up and no wait time. The food is not greasy and not heavy which is great. 

The food is fantastic. The service is reasonable, nothing too special but no complaints at all.
author: Kmk H.

description:
I just didn't think the food was good and we were rushed so much by the staff that it drove me a bit nuts - someone must have tried to take my plate away at least 4 times before I was done. The lobster on my roll was overcooked and flavorless and I didn't care for the bread that it was served on. 

So, never mind. Wouldn't go back.
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
My husband and I hit this place up before a show in the city one night.  I was awesomely surprised to find that it was oyster special night-- bonus!  The oysters were very tasty and a buck each, which is about as good as you're going to get in the Bay Area, especially the city.  (I lived in Houston before moving out here and was quite spoiled out there with cheap and tasty oysters all around!)

I got a cup of clam chowder to go with my oysters, and I just wasn't impressed.  It had plenty of meat in it, but overall it was lacking some seasoning.  I dumped a ton of salt in it, which made it a little better, but definitely not worth 7 bucks for a cup.  I would pass on that next time.  My husbands fish and chips was pretty good, but nothing that blew us away where we would come out of our way to come back for it.  I think I would definitely be back for the oysters special on Tues nights.  They were awesome!
author: LyraM45 H.

description: Food was good. Clam chowder is probably the best in the city. Lobster roll was delicious. Oyster was very good，must try it cuz I love it's sauce.
author: Maggie T.

description: Took the family here, as I have been wanting to try their lobster roll.  Gotta say it was delicious. Trying to be good on portion, shared half with my daughter, and she wanted the other half. That only meant she enjoyed it as much as I did.  Will be back one day..
author: Mareny P.

description: A bit over priced considering the size of the portions. The lobster roll was good, but the cheesy crab roll takes the cake. They open some what late which I really appreciated.
author: Fernilla S.

description:
The lobster roll here definitely lives up to its hype!  The clam chowder and crab roll also do not disappoint.  This is a great casual and laid back place to enjoy quality seafood.  If you're thinking of getting two lobster rolls, order the 6 oz and split that instead, it'll save you about $6 for the same quantity.  They will also neatly cut it in half for you!  Expect an abundance of fresh and succulent lobster chunks.  

Is the lobster roll here the best l I've ever had?  Yes...it is!
author: Michele L.

description:
Being new to San Francisco, originally from New England, I REALLY wanted to like this place...

Sadly I was a bit disappointed. 

The clam chowder was excellent, don't get me wrong there, but from the staff I kept getting the feeling that they wanted us to leave. They rushed their service and we're not especially nice. Everything came out so quickly that we didn't get to enjoy them before the next thing came out. 

I really wanted the Lobster Roll but went with the Crab Melt because it was more affordable. It was... meh.
author: Zach B.

description:
Walking down to Fillmore and strolling into the Woodhouse Fish Co. is always a great experience. The staff is friendly and the service is quick, but it can be very crowded on certain nights, so be prepared to queue up. I've sat at the counter a couple of times to avoid the wait.

The fish and chips is tasty and I really enjoyed the crab cakes as well. I'm looking forward to trying other meals that I haven't had yet. This is a great casual seafood restaurant if you are in the Pac Heights area.
author: Kevin H.

description: Food was awesome and the service was great. The calamari is the best in the city. All the food is fresh and you will not be disappointed with anything you order. Highly recommend.
author: Brandon B.

description:
I wasn't in the mood for seafood at all, but my friends were. I was outnumbered so I reluctantly agreed. 

And boy, did my appetite get activated from the moment I sat down. I know it's going to sound like I got paid to write this review, but let me just make clear: I didn't. Woodhouse is just this good.

#1: The clam chowder is phenomenal here- not too heavy or salty. The potato bits were tender and melted in your mouth. There was the perfect proportion of clams to soup. If anyone ever asks me where to get clam chowder in SF, I'm directing 'em all here.

#2: I had the best oyster po' boy of my entire life here. Sometimes the fried oyster pieces are too heavy on the cornmeal; here, they were perfect and flavorful yet not overly greasy. And they came accompanied by fried pork belly (a surprisingly tasty pairing), jalapenos and fresh coleslaw.

#3: The lobster rolls are freakishly good. I actually just ate a bunch of lobster rolls last month when I was up in Maine, but ... (and Maine residents will probably kill me for saying this) this one was superior. And I'll tell you why: the secret is in the bread. A lot of the Maine renditions had insanely fresh, yummy lobster filling, but the bread was sweet and soft and meh. Here, it's crispy yet has a lot of pull. It made all the difference.

PS We came on a Sunday afternoon. There was a line out the door but don't be deterred. We put our names on the list -- the hostess explained they didn't call or give out buzzers, but names are never crossed out so you could come back whenever. We went across the street to shop at Steven Alan, came back after 30 minutes and our table was ready. So smart, and so seamless.
author: Tiffany W.

description: we stumbled in here on a rainy Saturday afternoon and we're pleasantly surprised by the variety of the menu and the quality of the food. I tried the lobster roll, and while it was pricey, it was damn good. My friend tried the fish and chips and also enjoyed them.   Another one tried the mussels -they were just OK, but that probably had more to do with the catch than the prep of them.  The staff were friendly - the service was pretty quick and all in all, it was a great meal.  I will be back again.
author: David Z.

description:
Great quality fish here. The fish and chips and the fish tacos were both fried with a thin battering, and the fish was so flakey and moist. 

BUT, when it came to the end of the meal, there was a pool of oil in the fish and chips that rendered half of the chips inedible. As we got down to the bottom of the bowl, the fries became so saturated with oil, that a slight squeeze would make oil drip all over your fingers. So we informed the waitress about the issue, since my partner used to work at a kitchen in the past and knew the process after deep frying is to drain the oil either on parchment paper or by shaking it off to not leave a cup of oil in the serving tray.

My problem wasn't with the nasty feeling in my stomach I had at the end of meal staring at a pool of oil, but rather the way the waitress handled the situation on a relatively idle day. We had said "There seems to be a lot of oil at the bottom of the fish and chips and we can't eat the rest of the chips." In which she responds, "Well everything is fried, the fish is fried, the chips are fried".. as she says this she walks away to go do something else.

This problem could have been easily remedied with even the smallest apology, but because of the poor service, and haphazard mistake of the cook, the nasty, greasy feeling in my stomach this place gives me will never go away.
author: Fiona Y.

description: Great New England style seafood place.  This is the place you want to go instead of Swan Oyster Depot (see my review of Swan Oyster Depot where I go over that restaurant's unhygenic practices).  Woodhouse Fish Company on the other hand is clean and has great food and fair prices (ya know seafood is not cheap).
author: Daniel Y.

description:
Finally got to try this place and it did not disappoint! Came around 6:30 and got seated within 10 minutes at the booth.

Ordered:
- lobster roll: has the right amount of mayo without being too overbearing. Add some lemon to zest it up
- crab melt: not my favorite but my boyfriend loved it. I didn't like the sour after taste
- clam chowder: creamy and garlicy just the way I like it
- fish tacos: I love the batter.. it was light and crispy.

Service:
The waiter was nice and accommodating. Never had my cup unfilled or a dirty plate.

Definitely will be coming back!
author: Lia L.

description: The lobster roll, fish and chips and the Hartford clam chowder were all amazing!  Can't wait to come back to SF and eat here again!!
author: Jason E.

description:
I'm still waiting and I was told to wait 15 min...it's been an hour :/
I'm patient, but I hate being lied to!
Went back to check and give them a second chance....they asked me to wait a few more minutes, a different party of people who showed up after we did, not only got seated before us, I asked to get seated before them and got a smile and no response! Very sad because I was looking forward to eat here! 
Save yourself a trip :(
author: erick q.

description:
My boyfriend and I took his kids here after the Exploratorium, we were starving and looking forward to great seafood. I started with the New England Clam Chowder and it was the right amount of creamy yumminess. 

For dinner, I had the Dungeness Crab Roll. The crab didn't have as much flavor as I would have hoped, the "roll" was a piece of sourdough, which was split in the middle, buttered and toasted. The bread was tasty and made the sandwich, the crab wasn't as flavorful as the bread. I think having the crab melt would have been a better choice. My boyfriend had the Shrimp & Avocado Roll, he liked his except he wanted two because it wasn't filling enough for him.
author: Cheryl M.

description: We've been here 3 times in a month. Lobster rolls here are the BEST!! The environment is authentic and intimate.
author: Claire T.

description: Pricey but food was good.  Came here on a Saturday before noon and did not have to wait for a table.  Calamari was perfect.  I had the 3 oz crab sandwich and it was warm, moist, buttery, and fresh.  Should have ordered the 6 oz one.  But had to leave room for the bread pudding which was good too.  Will definitely come back.  The staff was friendly and attentive too.
author: Winnie S.

description:
3.75 stars.

Food - 4 stars Oysters + Avocado/Shrimp roll + Onion Rings. 

Oysters-meaty and very flavorful. $1 Oysters on TUESDAYS!
Shrimp roll - a good amount of baby shrimp. Super fresh, great flavor. The roll that the shrimp were in was fluffy and nicely toasted. It's more of thick slice of toast, folded in half.
Onion Rings- cooked beautifully. Evenly coated, a good thick slice of onion. 

Wine: Their Riesling is not on the menu anymore...but they had it as a special on the special daily menu. Great choice!

Service - 3.5 stars 
Polite hostess, our server was gracious and accommodating as well. The manager however seemed aloof, disingenuous and at times a bit rude..

Space - 4 stars
Bar area is nice, seating is intimate. Restaurant has a good feel to it. No reservatiosn though! 

Price - 3.5
For the meaty size of oysters, the $1 is a good deal. However I felt that the rolls were just a teeny bit overpriced for the size.
author: Selina W.

description:
Bad service. If you have a big family, don't come here. Save yourself some time because you will be forced to spilt into smaller groups OR some people will eat first, others will follow after 1 hour. The waitresses and hostess need to learn how to "accommodate" families better. Why would you split a family up when there are visible open seats we can all see that we could have been seated at? 

1 star for the cooks AND ONLY THE COOKS, because my lobster roll was good and filling. &from where I was seated, the chefs were the only ones who had their heads screwed on right and were working hard. 

You can tell the host and waitresses obviously didn't like our group from the start, and it carried on through dinner.
author: Nicole B.

description:
I had been talking about clam chowder for an entire night before finally heading to bed. The weather finally turned back to a nice, normal, windy SF-appropriate temperature, so I decided that Monday night would be the day that I would get my clam chowder. The boyfriend likes the Manhattan stuff and I'm fond of the New England one, so I had assumed we'd have a bit of a showdown in this small restaurant next to Fraiche.

But then we saw that there was fish and chips. So instead of having that showdown, we agreed on a cup of New England clam chowder (aw yiss) and a set of fish and chips for us to share.

Now, I'm not a chowder aficionado. There was just a period of time as a child where all I'd agree to eat was clam chowder out of a can, so I thought that Woodhouse's was freakin' amazing. I still preferred the stuff from one of the many places on Pier 39 or Monterey, of course, but this was still excellent. And they serve it with your choice of crackers or sourdough bread. Boyfriend wanted crackers. I wanted bread. And the waitress was like, yeah, np, man. And that was good. But the boyfriend, who has been all over the US, decided that the clam chowder was just okay. Take that as you will; he went to uni in Boston.

The fish and chips, though. Oh my gosh. One of the tastiest, classiest, and amazingly barely-greasy-at-all fish and chips I have ever had. The fish was perfectly cooked and had such a light, wonderful flavor. What was it even fried in!? Was it fried!? And the chips that came with it were kind of like getting only the perfectly crunchy ones from McDonald's. I am a peasant, okay? I don't know how else to describe those so-called shoestring fries - they looked like McDonald's fries but were five bajillion times tastier.

To round off this lovely cold-weather meal, we got the sourdough bread pudding. I have never had proper bread pudding before. The boyfriend loves bread pudding. He approved. I proceeded to try and eat as much of it as I could because it was so rich and wonderful, but also very hot, so I basically ended up burning my tongue in an attempt to make sure I got some bread pudding before he ate it all.

Overall, this is definitely a place I'd go to again if I'm feeling extra-fancy for fish and chips. Going here is more than just sating a craving - it's feeling really, really good about it too, and being very satisfied in the end.
author: Robbin A.

description: Great food. Ordered a grilled trout and the combination of the fish juice, lemon, and capers was a delight. Definitely on the pricier side but definitely worth a try
author: Choi G.

description: Nice surprise! Great clam chowder. New England or Manhattan style or.... Get this you can order them mixed! Fresh seafood great price
author: Danine H.

description: I've been to Woodhouse Fish Co twice. The most recent time I went was on a Saturday night back in May before watching the Book of Mormon. The food is good. Service is good. Wait wasn't too long. I love their clam chowder.
author: Kayla O.

description: I was craving for some clam chowder and stumbled upon this restaurant on yelp.  Came here on a saturday night, was pretty pack but didn't had to wait long before getting seated for 2 people.  I had the lobster roll and a bowl of clam chowder.  The lobster roll was pretty good and there was a generous amount of lobster meat in it.  The chowder on the other hand was was just alright, nothing special but satisfied my cravings.  Overall, I'll come back for the lobster roll if anything.
author: Len L.

description: Great service. Great atmosphere. Greet food. The fish and chips was fresh and hot. The beet salad was one of the best. Sit at the bar and have a wonderful evening.
author: David S.

description:
You may as well stick a hook on one of my hands and give me a peg leg, because this old sailor just can't get enough of the sea! Well, seafood, at least. From New England clam chowder to freshly shucked oysters to gourmet grilled fish, I love it all and pity those with seafood allergies for missing out on such a tasty part of life. 

Lucky for me, the people at Woodhouse Fish Company seem to share this passion for las frutas del mar. I came here with some coworkers on a sunny weekday for lunch and though we were warned that the place gets packed, we were fine for an early meal and got a table right away for four. I tasted a bunch of things, from the crab cakes to the lobster roll to the fish tacos, and I gobbled up every last bite of everything with relish. It's hard to pick a favorite but I'd say probably the fish tacos, which were perfectly battered and crispy with a very fluffy, delicious fish inside (I can't remember what kind). 

My only hesitation from giving it a full five stars is that the menu isn't especially inventive. But then again, I don't think that's what this place is going for. They're more about mastering those classic dishes that you crave. My only disappointment of the meal was the make-your-own lemonade, which sounded so cool when the waitress described it (they give you lemon, sparkling water and simple syrup and you get to choose how sweet you want it), but was kind of blah when all was said and done. 

Let's call this a 4 1/3 star and say that I'm very very open to upping this review by the next time I visit... which I hope is soon!
author: Christina P.

description:
This restaurant was highly recommended by my foodie friend. She suggested the iceberg Louie salad and the lobster roll. Both tasty. We were able to split three ways and felt quite satisfied.
Service was friendly. Seating was adequate. Large windows allow for sunlight.
author: Liana T.

description:
Came here for the $1 oysters on Tuesday with some girlfriends. And boy they were delicious! We ended up getting almost 4 dozen between the 3 of us. Definitely fulfilled that craving. The waitresses were friendly and attentive even though we were clearly there only for the oysters, and not too overbearing. In fact, they refilled my water so discreetly that I didn't even notice...thus I managed to spill some on myself. Derp!

I would definitely come here again to try more things. Woodhouse seems like a solid place to get my seafood fix, and I'm rearing to try the lobster roll that it seems everyone recommends!
author: Denise C.

description: quality, service and a fun environment to eat in is what you can expect to find when you get to wood house! try the chowder and fish tacos and you will be an extremely happy camper, also any specials of the day tend be the best offerings! enjoy
author: John R.

description:
Like it a lot.  Really good fish and chips, crispy crispy batter with really flaky fresh fish.  Not the largest portions i've seen, but satisfies nonetheless.
The lobster rolls was great and dare say better than Sam's chowder house, so you know it's good.  Good service, good prices, great place.
author: Roni L.

description:
Great lunch spot on Fillmore! We liked it so much, we came here twice! 
Admittedly, every time we dined, we went... all... out. Ladies-who-lunch, hold onto your salads and lemon water, 'cause it's about to get ugly. 
 
On both occasions, we ordered a dozen oysters. Good, fresh. Not quite the magical specimens we had at Hog. For the location, it was the next best thing. The lobster roll was a quintessential hearty lunch- stuffed to the brim with claw meat, nice toss of mayo. Cioppino was spot-on with lovely offerings of the sea, loved dipping my crisped garlic bread into the tomato-ey goodness. The crab salad, fresh- though I would ask for the dressing on the side. You can't go wrong with anything off their menu. 

But the one dish you MUST have is their grilled fish of the day. For those who can't handle the sight of a whole fish (head, tail, bones and all), you are missing out! It was our last meal before leaving for the airport and 'til this day, I still get warm and fuzzy feelings when thinking about it. Chicago winters are a drab and I take my happiness wherever I can get it. I remember it fondly: branzino with a side of root veggies. Simple, flavorful, tender, a little smathering of basil-pesto. Bellissimo!
author: Jenny H.

description:
Amazing place....been wanting to eat here for some time and finally got the chance today while at the jazz festive. Had the fried clam sandwich and a cup of clam chowder, both were simply amazing and the best I have ever had. I have been craving fried clams for a while and these did not disappoint in any way. The breading was light and crispy and the clams so flavorful. 
Service was just as amazing as the food, just wish I lived closer to this place, I would eat there all the time. 
Love this place...worth every penny in my opinion!
author: Ki H.

description:
If you're in love with seafood you should be in love with this place.

Started off with a quite chipper Nolan who did a great job the whole evening. Friendly, attentive,  and totally unpretentious. 

We started with some grilled octopus which was superb. Meaty and seasoned very well. 

I had the whole roasted fish and it was a tad tricky to eat, but well worth it. To tell you the truth I can't remember the type of fish, but take a look at my pic and maybe you can decipher it! It's pic #175 or so.

The interior of this place reminds me of a chic coastal Maine fishhouse and felt very homey. If you're in the mood for seafood, I highly recommend this place. Great food for a good price.
author: Taylor A.

description: Just go! It's amazing. The crab melt, the lobster roll. The crab cakes. It's all just amazing.
author: Diana W.

description:
Yummy!! SF seems to make people crave seafood and this is the perfect place when you are craving fish! 

We went for a quick lunch. We ordered the fish tacos, the halibut (a special) and a lobster roll. Everyone loved everything! I asked for light mayo on the lobster roll and substituted the fries for spinach as I was trying to be a bit more healthy. The halibut was olive oil poached and SO delicious. Maybe one of the best halibuts I've had ever. It was served with thinly sliced tomatoes and on a bed of pesto couscous. So, so good. If they have this dish, get it. 

The lobster roll was quite awesome as well. The bread was soft, toasted and buttery and the lobster was moist and juicy. It did take a little while for our food to come out so I wouldn't go here if you are in a real hurry. Plus it's quite tiny so call ahead and put your name in if there is a wait!
author: Brittany F.

description: OMG....the blue point to were worth every penny. Easy, casual atmosphere. They made the right choice to offer a simple but delicious menu with daily specials. I will definitely eat here again. Oh and they serve wines from the central coast....my neck of the woods:-)
author: Tara F.

description:
Ahhh Woodhouse.  My go-to place when family or friends visit from out of town.  Where's better than New England when you think of seafood?  Nowhere!  This place has a menu straight out of the Northeast and a decor to match.

From the absolutely scrumptious rolls (Dungeness crab or lobster, though I recommend the Dungeness because it's served warm) to the yummy (and almost compulsory in the Bay) cioppino, everything I've had is fresh, simple, and just perfect.  Highly recommend the tacos as well.

And for appetizers, the calamari will pretty much make love to your mouth.  I usually add a wedge salad to whatever I'm getting, too, it's really delish.  Clam chowder (3 ways!) is also just fantastic.  Good selection on the wine list too.

Perfect place to bring your family or a date, it's an intimate but fun little place.  Don't change a thing, Woodhouse, I will always love you.
author: Ryan S.

description: I was very happy for finding wood house on yelp. We were looking for some chowda. It was very good and not salty. We had five lobster rolls. They even had the real lobster bread roll buttered and toasted.  Very good. Would definitely recommend. Nice atmosphere. Small but quaint. Thirty minute wait. Can't wait to go back. I couldn't believe the tasty the lobster chunks were.
author: Nancy F.

description:
The food  was awesome and in fact I would go back again just to have those again -- the fish was meaty and the sauce, flavorful. 

Great great great service with awesome recommendations and so attentive. We all remarked that we had drank so much water not realizing that they were stealthily coming by and filling up our waters without us even noticing!
author: David Y.

description:
My boyfriend have been wanting to go here for the longest time. I finally agreed to go, I was not disappointed with the food. The place was nicely decorated. It was mid-afternoon & we started with a bowl of clam chowder ($8). Then we ordered the Split-Top Maine Lobster Roll ($26) thinking it would be a good size to share. It was served with thin, crispy fries. 

It was very delicious, I couldn't get enough of it but it wasn't enough for 2. I love cheap delicious food. But this was not cheap. We were just looking for a place that served great lobster roll for a cheap price. 

I would definitely come here again, but only on special occasions.
author: Karla Marie D.

description:
Great food annnnnd great service. 

Game Changers:
Fish & Chips
'Hartford' Clam Chowder
author: Analee C.

description:
I agree with Brittany B: SF makes me crave seafood. Lobstah, oystas, crab, skrimps, sashimi, fish fillet ... I want it.

I came here for lunch with some colleagues, and the menu looked so appealing we decided to order a variety of entries and share. 

But what stood out for this chica: Fish tacos ...The batter itself is where it's at. Golden, crispy, crunchy and with a slight cornmeal flavor. Almost like corn dog batter. And the fact that it's served with sliced avocado ... hook a sista up with mo' of that!

I'm totes coming back here.
author: Farrah A.

description: Was craving fish and chips yesterday, so stopped in with a friend. We both had the fish and chips and just ripped into them when they arrived because they were so good, Huge servings, you can order 2 or 3 pieces. Two pieces are more than enough, neither one of us was able to finish our meal. The service was good too. The guy at the table next to us was having the lobster roll and it looked superb. I can't wait to go back and try the lobster roll!
author: Elzabeth G.

description:
With a friend flying in from DC, I whittled down my list of economical yet good dishes (and open a little late) to three for the night. With that dorkus managing to reach the City only around 9:20pm even though the flight landed at 7:15pm, the list was further reduced by one and my eight-ball decided "Woodhouse" it'd have to be for the night. 

We arrived with about a half-hour to spare and settled down to a drink and steamed garlic shell fish (we chose mussels over clams) with the french fries option. The fries were really well made and crispy on the outside. The steam garlic mussels too were really good with that garlicky "broth" offering a fine backdrop of flavor. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PFk6k_hEGG0n6_FAJSm9EQ?select=m5SJ-8pWVvuel7PStQzHJQ)

I was initially going for the seafood cioppino but was steered away by my friend who's allergic to crustaceans and on asking for options was notified of the special; a sauteed sturgeon with risotto. I immediately did an about turn and two "suateed sturgeons" it was for the entree.

The two pieces of sturgeon was pretty good though I'd say the flavors on the fish were pretty subtle; which may be the nature of the fish. The risotto looked like a cous-cous based risotto; I prefer the rice based risotto. I wish the fish was as rich as the risotto in flavor.
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PFk6k_hEGG0n6_FAJSm9EQ?select=B-VKqs_AY7qqLN8RI7DVEw)

It was pretty good but I will have to try another dish before I can think about rating it a 4-star. I hope the cioppino is as good as some claims it to be.

I will go back again for sure.
author: Umesh T.

description: Our fillmore favorite and occassional friday lunch together. Friendly staff, good beer/wine selection, and solid fare! Keep up the good work Woodhouse :)
author: Joe I.

description: Mehhhh this place was very high priced for what it was . Got the lobster roll which was mediocre . Best one I had was old porter lobster shAck in San Mateo .
author: d n.

description: Went late on a Monday night and sat at the bar. It took a minute for our waitress to get to us, but the food was worth the slight wait. We had the point Reyes and Kumamoto oysters, the lobster roll, and the Dungeness crab. The oysters were fresh and I would recommend paying extra for a few kumamotos. I'd never had a lobster roll before but it stands out the most to me about the meal. The lemon butter sauce for the crab was full of flavor but still light. It was a great meal!
author: Alixann L.

description:
The Lobster roll changes lives and saves people who have life-threatening injuries like a fountain of youth.  

One of the most consistently good restaurants I've ever found.  Ironically, I like Woodhouse because it is not very San Franciscan, it's very East Coast.  The lobster roll, fish and chips, crab Louie, Oysters, and fish entrees NEVER FAIL to please.  Woodhouse seems to have a very discerning eye over the QUALITY OF WAITERS they have, who are great at their jobs.  

Even friends from all over love me for taking them here.  Last, I am so happy this place isn't just another San Francisco seafood restaurant that's run down, grimy, and priced at triple its worth.  It would be all too easy to fall into line with some of the "famous" San Francisco seafood restaurants, especially ones along the pier (any of them). 

Woodhouse Fish Co. has struck the perfect balance: where you order seafood and get a lot of that seafood, proportional to the dish; the practice elsewhere is a very expensive, pleasantly displayed  2-4 oz size of seafood disguised by leafy greens and terrible spices for $30.  
The Woodhouse Clam Chowder is butter and tasty.  The Woodhouse Fish Co. has all kinds of fresh Oysters.  The Fish and Chips are light, flavorful, fluffy, with no fishy taste.  The crab louie is sweet, and if you hate crab, you'll love it after the salad.  I don't review drinks, but that's because the choice is simple: always get an Anchor Steam with all your dishes.

The Market location absolutely needs to stay open longer (till 10:30 even), I often choose not to go at all because it gets close to 8, and Market/Church closes at 9:30, but then there's always Fillmore Woodhouse.
author: Xander M.

description:
Visiting from out of town and had high hopes for this place from seeing all the good reviews. Not sure if I was there on a bad night or not, but the food is mediocre at best. The price they charge for the quality and taste of their food is outrageous. Below is a list of what we ordered: 
* Fried Calamari - Batter was flavorless. Came with two different sauces, basic cocktail sauce and the other I'm not sure what it was but it was gross. Skip this. 
* Clam Chowder - Barf. No flavor. Skip this. 
* Fish and Chips - Came with three good size pieces of fish. The fish had a nice crunch on the outside and was flaky and moist on the inside.  Tartar sauce was homemade and tasted good. Fries tasted like they were the frozen type (would expect fresh cut fries at a place like this). The coleslaw is bad, bad, bad. Try this if you like fried fish.  
* Lobster Roll - One of my friends ordered this. He said it was not the best lobster roll he's ever had, but not the worst. Said he's had much better for like half the price, but the roll it came in tasted good. Also came with fries and coleslaw. Try this at your own risk. 
* Oyster and Pork Belly Po'boy - Other friend ordered this, it was a daily special. She said the oysters were deep fried crisp, but was tender and juicy inside. The bread was the same as the lobster roll, which she said was soft and toasted to perfection. Also came with fries and coleslaw. Try this. 
All in all, the food kind of lacked flavor. The person working the deep fryer definitely knows what he's doing, as everything was cooked perfect. Noticed other tables ordering other items, so maybe try those things. They need to either lower their prices, or get a better chef.
author: Reid C.

description:
My boyfriend's best friend was visiting and, since Chicago doesn't get great seafood, we decided to take him to Woodhouse Fish Company based solely on the toasted-buttered dungeness crab roll pictures and their variety of oysters.

We came in on a Sunday, around 6 p.m., and the place was just starting to fill up. I'd definitely get here on the earlier side since they don't take reservations.

The menu is short but sweet and offers something for everyone. I'm not big on oysters but my boyfriend and his friend are. They ordered a half dozen oysters, which were Blue Point oysters, and also another half dozen of oysters that were offered as a special that day. They were very fresh and they definitely enjoyed them! Try oysters from different locations so you get different flavors. We also ordered the Fried Whole Belly Ipswich Clams which were crispy on the outside and very juicy on the inside. 

For our main dishes, we ordered:

-Anchor Steam Beer-Battered Fish & Chips (2 pieces): I loved the batter! The outside was very crunchy and crispy and the inside was very juicy and flavorful. My only complaint was that it was a little on the greasy side.
-Toasted-Buttered Dungeness Crab Roll (Half): The crab was fresh and very sweet and buttery. I liked the bread! The half size portion is a good size.
-Half Dungeness Crab in a white wine, garlic, and butter sauce: This is what our friend ordered and he loved it. He said it had tons of flavor and loved the wine sauce. The only downside is that it is a little messy!

I really enjoyed our dinner at Woodhouse Fish Company - the food was great and extremely flavorful and fresh, our server was very knowledgeable and always checked up on us. Definitely need to stop by here again to try the lobster roll!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
My husband and I were in SF looking for seafood and found this small place.  I asked the waiter for a recommendation.  He said part of the reason he decided to work there was because he got the free food!

My husband got the fish and chips.  Seriously, better than the fish and chips we got in London.  The fish was so fresh and the batter very light and crispy.  I got the crab cakes and was very hesitant, but the waiter told me how they made them and said there was more crab in them than other ingredients.  They were fantastic.  I compared them to the ones I had in Maryland and these were better.  Light and crispy and again, the crab so fresh.

I highly recommend this restaurant.  It was probably a little pricey, but it was so delicious, I don't mind paying for good quality food that is satisfying.  There are so many places where I've paid for food that is lousy.  This was a very pleasant surprise.
author: Dawn D.

description: Stopped in for lunch. Was pleasantly surprised by how fresh and delishious everything was. Splurged on the stuffed artichoke and a cup of chowder. They even have Manhattan style! And my hubby had the traditional fish and chips. So yummy! Will be back next time we're in the neighborhood.
author: Araceli L.

description: Fish was meh-- there was too much batter and it was quite oily. Chips were good but also very oily. My companion had the stuffed artichokes which was good but not filling. I might return and try something else, as they're not known for fish and chips.
author: A L.

description:
Small restaurant 
Busy 
Friendly and attentive staff

We ordered: 
BBQ oysters- YUMMY, first time trying! 

New England Clam chowder- lots of clams, I added salt pepper and tobacco. Overall good 

Lobster roll- big chunks of lobster, crispy side of tasty fries, small slaw. It was okay I think I like the taste of crab more depending on your tastebuds. 

I'll come back when I'm in the mood to pick at some crab!
author: Shivonne T.

description: Ugh, so disappointed and grossed out. Let me be clear, I like the food at Woodhouse Fish Co. But I hate rodents near me or my food. Yes, you read correctly, rodents. Today, around 4pm, friends and I tried to get drinks and snacks at the Woodhouse Fish Company on Fillmore. As our food was coming out of the kitchen, so did a little mouse, who came out of the wall and freaked us all out. So gross! They didn't charge us for the food, which we didn't get to eat, but the bottle of wine, they said they couldn't take care of it. We ask to bag it since we just started on the bottle. In any case, never going back again. So gross.
author: Michelle S.

description:
Yum Yum!  What a fun little restaurant!  Got there and it was only half full.  Waiter said we could have a pick of seats and said it was strange because it's usually full.  15 minutes later the place was packed and people waiting.

Ambiance: It's a small restaurant - long - like a fancy hole-in-the-wall.  More upscale nautical decor.

Service: Unfortunately there was a hair in the chowder - we notified the waiter and he immediately got us a new bowl.  My hubby was a little surprised that they didn't give it to us for free or offer a discount or something since they style themselves as a bit of an upscale restaurant.

Food: We got the fish and chips, the dungeness crab melt - good portion size - YUMMY!  Both were delicious - that melt was stuffed with creamy goodness (but you have to like cream cheese to like that one).  Oh and don't forget the Hartford chowder - it's got a dollop of this red stew concoction in the middle that gives it a wonderful depth and flavor!  I'd order everything again, but I'd also be excited to try something new there because everything everyone else around us were having looked good too.

A little pricier but I'd definitely go again if in town.
author: Hingdi B.

description:
so yesterday we were in the city in the Filmore area and checked out a seafood restaurant called the Woodhouse. The reason being? Fried whole belly clams are considered a New England favorite. 

My partner being a hard core Bostonian, has been wanting these seawater bottom feeders despite having visited back east a few months ago. They are real hard to find out here in the bay area as native Californians do not have an affinity for them despite the fact that this area is surrounded by ocean.

Woodhouse is one of the few seafood places in this city that actually serves them. We also had the crab melt which was absolutely delicious. 

The wait staff were professionals and no nonsense which is how we like it. Definitely going back.
author: Joe V.

description: The clam chowder here is great - smooth, tasty and the clams are not overcooked like in most places. They have a nice selection of fresh oysters at decent prices. I also tried one of their specials, grilled squid, which did not dissapoint. Great atmosphere, but understandably crowded.
author: Andrei M.

description:
This location literally screams "Bougie!' but don't let that deter you from visiting Woodhouse Fish Co! My boyfriend and I came here on a Saturday afternoon and found the restaurant to be quite packed and stuffy. The host/hostesses were very busy, but managed to take down our names in a timely manner and asked us if we wanted to sit in the bar since we only had a party of 2. Less than 15 minutes later, the friendly host seated us in the dining area instead of the bar, which we thought was very nice of him to do! My boyfriend and I were craving a crab melt so we ordered 2 crab melts and 2 cups of clam chowder, which totaled to be at around $50 - pretty standard for seafood, if you ask me!

Crab Melt - The crab was very fresh, however, something about the sandwich didn't really fulfill my craving! Don't get me wrong, the sandwich was great and was packed with lots of flavor, but I found myself wishing I got the Lobster Roll instead. Maybe not enough cheese? I don't know.

Clam Chowder - As usual, the clam chowder didn't disappoint! The clam chowder was flavorful, creamy, and really good.

Overall, I would skip the crab melt and go straight for the lobster roll!
author: Joyce E.

description:
the fried fish was pretty good but left me feeling slightly obese

otherwise good experience
author: Jon K.

description:
Such a great fish house on Fillmore. I have never had anything here I didn't like. Obviously their lobster roll can't even begin to compare with East Coasts Cyril's or Luke's, but it is rather tasty. I would recommend it.

Their fish and chips is great too, and I believe Mondays (?) they have an oyster happy hour! YUM!

Great beers on tap/bottled, all appropriate wines to pair with fish. Obviously more middle of the road brands but still good. Great casual date spot of lunch with friends.
author: Meredith M.

description: Wow, that Hartford clam chowder is genius. Add in some Tabasco, and you ascend into a state of enlightenment. Follow it up with a lobster roll, and you're done. Just go to sleep because you've already made the day worth it.
author: Stephen H.

description: My party of three got seated pretty quick considering we came in on a Saturday afternoon right around 1:00p. Both my friend and I ordered the small lobster roll, which was really fresh and packed with lobster. I was very pleased with my order though it was quite pricy for a sandwich, but can't say much when most times seafood is costly. My other friend ordered the Dungeness crab melt and I'm pretty sure she liked it, she mentioned it was really oily, but other than that really tasty.  I would come back, if I were in the mood for some fresh seafood!
author: Briana L.

description:
Finally got to try my first lobster roll! GOOD GOOD GOOD! 
The service here is really friendly as well! They usually don't take reservations, but I called in and the hostess was kind enough to put my name down, so that by the time we got there a table would be ready for us! 

My cousin and I shard the crab roll and the lobster roll. Personally, I actually liked the crab roll much better. The buttery crab was just to die for. They put a lot too so you get a good amount when you bite into it. The lobster roll was good but I am not much of a big fan of mayo so it wasn't as amazing as the crab roll to me. The lobster was still tasty though! There are big pieces of lobster meat. 
I loved how it was served on the bread too! There is like a thick slice of bread that is cut halfway down the middle and stuffed with crab/lobster. The portions can be small if you have a big appetite, but the food is pretty filling. You will leave happy and full! I am so glad I had a great experience eating my first seafood sandwich rolls. 

BTW. Make sure you get the Arnold Palmer! It is pretty cool because you can mix it yourself. They provide the ingredients and you just mix! It glassware they put it in is cute too.
author: Katrina T.

description: I'm so happy I got to try this place out while visiting SF! They seriously have the best lobster rolls and claim chowder hands down! Their lobster rolls are pricey, but its packed with chunks of lobster meat! The claim chowder was perfectly creamy and there were lots of claims rather than only potato. Give this place a try if you ever want a bomb lobster roll or some delicious claim chowder. It's seriously way better than the claim chowder at Fishman's Wharfs! You are pretty much paying for the quality of the food here.
author: Trüc T.

description:
The excitement for a large over flowing lobster roll went down hill after the waitress got my order wrong after giving  clear directions.... Once the right order came along it was so skimpy I got the large roll but looked extremely tiny!!!! Oh well the lobster wasn't even that moist! 
NEXT
author: I Know G.

description:
5 stars for the lobster roll.

3 stars for the crab melt.

3.5 stars for the service.

The lobster roll was absolutely delicious.  At first glance, this $26 sandwich looked small for the price, but once I dived in to this bad boy, there was a plethora of lobster crammed into the butter slice of toast.  In fact, the lobster pieces were huge!  What was nice too, was that WFC didn't over season the lobster meat, so you really got to savor your lobster experience.

The crab melt was a different story....in fact it was just okay, and I love crab!  They put too much seasoning in the crab/mayo mix which overpowered the delicate flavor of the crab.

Fries were good, but cold.  Onion rings good and hot, but a little on the greasy side.....slaw was nice and chilled....but hey, I was here for the lobster roll not the sides.

Service started out slow, we sat at our table for a good 10 minutes before we were even acknowledged by our waitress.  But once things got started, it got better.

Overall, a good experience.  Will definitely go back for the lobster roll! Want to try the stuffed artichoke next time too!
author: Heather K.

description: We stopped in for lunch, one of my favorite meals while in town. We had crab rolls and lobster rolls. Excellent. Great chowder as well. Service was fast and friendly. Recommend this place for sure.
author: Bub N.

description: The wife & I came to Frisco for our honeymoon after being married for just over 2yrs.  One of our priorities was food spots and this place was definitely the business.  Lobster roll was nothing but sweetness, and my wife had the fried pork belly/shrimp po boy which was off the chain.  Their bread pudding was also choice.  Also had great service.  Will be back on our next trip to SF.
author: Ryan S.

description:
Had this for take out on the way to see Beyonce and Jay-Z's On The Run Tour at AT&T Park and it was one of the greatest choices I've made. I got the fish and chips which came how and fresh in under ten minutes. The togo container was even dope.

Staff was friendly, and helpful.

Location is intimate and quaint, "I like it a lot"

Ate good and danced hard at the concert!
author: Sam Q.

description:
I did come back, a month later.  Bumped up the rating by one star.  That's for consistency.

Clam chowder & fish tacos were just as good as they were the first time.  My friend enjoyed the lobster roll.  He said it had lots of lobster in it.

I think I'm going to have problems trying something different the next time.  You know how that goes!
author: Debbie T.

description: Lobster roll was delicious! I ordered take out with my work and it was cold when I ate it but sooooo yummy!! I will definitely go back an get it dine in! The crab cakes were good, one of my co workers had it! And the crab melt was good as well according to my other co worker! Can't wait to try te clam chowder next time I go!
author: Mary W.

description: One of the best places I've eaten in San Francisco. Shared the fish tacos and lobster roll with my friend and there were still more things I couldn've ordered. I will tell everyone to eat here!
author: Abby T.

description:
The food was okay, three stars.  The highlights were dollar oysters - a good deal - and steamed mussels which were plump and juicy.  The lobster roll was decent, but I've had better and prefer buttered over mayo.

Minus one star because service was terrible.  We waited forever to be served, and our server didn't pay attention to our table all night.
author: Daniel Y.

description:
DOLLA OYSTER TUESDAYS!? 

My friend raved of their famous lobster roll during her last visit to the Market street Woodhouse location, so I was determined to put that in my belly!

Have you ever been to Boiling Crab in San Jose? yeah.. the wait can be identical to that.. Walk-in's ONLY and during prime time, the wait can easily be well over an hour. Whatever, I've waited almost 3 hours for Boiling Crab, an hour ain't nothing, and especially when our group of 5 is happily killing time browsing through Woodhouse's photo gallery on Yelp and painstakingly thinking what to order. (I wanted that lobster roll more and more by each passing second!)

(I apologize for the low-qual photos. Woodhouse's lighting isn't friendly to my smartphone camera.)

(24) Two Dozen Oysters - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=VIXCT94EswU1l7K0-Q_BbA&userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ
Damn comon.. some if these oysters shouldn't even be served because they were so tiny, even for $1.. (see photo -- compared the oysters with the lemon wedge). The sauce that went with the oysters were a nice touch though, but seriously, a good portion of our two dozen oysters were miniscule..

"Hardford" Clam Chowder - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=nFO_oit7L17W7QJyYbCC7w&userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ
It's $5.5 for the Cup or $8 for the Bowl. I'm a huge fan of clam chowder so I definitely had to order the bowl (all for myself). The chowder was very creamy, chunks of tatters, and spoonfuls of clams in each bite! This was the highlight of my dinner, and Woodhouse's redemption for their diminutive sized oysters! Shoot, I wanted to lick my plate cleeaannn! 

Split-Top Maine Lobster Roll - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=iNU0KoU4Rx77r18u2A7TRw&userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ
"Oh baby! here it is.. my 6oz lobster roll! wait, that's it..?" 
The roll came with a cup of house slaw (meh) and a palette of crispy (yet frozen) fries. The lobster roll itself, was loaded with a good handful of lobster meat, but was terribly unseasoned. Each bite was just filled with a mouth full of cold bland lobster meat.. The amce roll was nice and toasty though and thankfully, the trusty Tabasco and pepper shaker was close in hand to dowse the lobster, but I must've of hyped myself up for failure because $26 for a tasteless lobster roll just doesn't cut it.

Maybe I came on a non-lobster-rollish day or maybe I somehow got an unseasoned handful of lobster meat from their batch but whatever it may have been, it wasn't worth it. Our parties orders wasn't spectacular either: the Baja Fish Tacos were comparable to Rubio's Fresh Mex's fish tacos, the Dungeness Crab legs were overcooked (it's the second time my friend ordered it, and the second time they've overcooked it), and the Toasted-Buttered Dungenness Roll could have been butterier. 

For the hefty price I'm paying, I was expecting some damn food seafood, seafood that could rival some of my favorite fine dining restaurants, but it just wasn't happening. I would positively check out the Market street Woodhouse in the future because I do believe in hypes and love a good seafood feast, but as for this location, it's clearly missing the whole shabang (pun intended).
author: Albert L.

description: Excellent seafood. Had a stuffed grilled artichoke stuffed with fresh crab and shrimp. Yum! Their fish and chips were delicious too. Going back for the Cioppino !
author: Sadhna S.

description: Delicious amazing lobster roll! Details are in the bread. If your bread is crakin, your roll will come to life. It was soft, slight crunch from the butter , topped with great dressed lobster! Fresh fries, thin like McDonald but better flavor. cute and quaint decor. Friendly staff that's fast , and food comes out hot! Definelty coming back
author: cristina s.

description:
Good little joint in the area.

Service is average with the occasionally request to refill water. Dirty dishes was left on table for some time before server took it away.

The atmosphere is what you expect in the city. Small 
, cramped, and loud.  

But food was the reason I came and it didn't disappoint.  Their cioppino was delicious.  Big chunks of seafood inside.  Their fresh raw oysters also didn't disappoint.  

Overall I will be back.
author: Adam L.

description:
YUM. 

I love this place and I love the service. I come here often, and love all the food I have tried. If you like seafood, you will like this place. There are always oysters on the menu, for $1 to $2! Everything is always super fresh and cooked to perfection, and the menu has a nice selection to choose from. Also good to mention, the fries are delicious. I usually order the fish tacos, and usually can't eat all three (it's a big dish) but you can always take the third one home! I've never ordered any of the sandwiches, but my friends order them and they look amazing. 

This place is always pretty packed so come early, or get your name on the list and do a little shopping. However, on holiday 3-day weekends, it's not too bad!
author: Cindy M.

description:
My eyes opened wide like this O.O and I all could say is WOW...  with every bite I took into the glorious and famous lobster roll here. 

Did it hurt when I paid $22 (including tip and tax) for this lobster roll meal? Not at all because my taste buds and tummy and everything else were quite happy. I've been here twice and both occasions did not disappoint.


AMBIANCE/SERVICE: Casual (I would not recommend for big groups). Clean with nice touches of seaside decor. Good service with cool/attentive people.

PRICES: Check the menu! Around $10-$20 depending on what item you get. 

SPLIT TOP MAINE LOBSTER ROLL $18: BIG and I mean BIG fat chunks of fresh lobster meat that did not disappoint. Absolutely fresh and delicious. Probably one of the best lobster rolls I've ever had.

CRAB MELT $12: This was also bomb. Good chunks of crab meat and fresh meat. So good.

BUTTERED BREAD on the roll/melt: WOW, how did they make this? The bread had the perfect amount of softness with a nice toasted crunch on the outside. The butter was not overwhelming at all and balanced the freshness of the seafood so well.

FRENCH FRIES: This is what I call a bomb french fry! Skinny, perfectly crisp and well-seasoned. They know how to make 'em good! Possibly one of my favorite fries. 

COLESLAW: Once again, fresh, refreshing and not overwhelmingly mayo-filled like most slaws. 

FYI: Refreshing, fresh and delicious seafood. Especially the lobster! They do not skimp on their seafood meat here. You are paying for amazing quality food. :)
author: Nina K.

description:
AMAZING crab roll.  Seriously could eat 3002393 of them in one seating.  I even had to order a sign of the butter roll because it was sooo good.  

Great calamari!

Got the Cioppinno as well.  Not impressed.  Fresh seafood although some of the mussels seemed to have a little bit of dirt.  Regardless, the seafood overall was very good.  Did not like the garlic bread at all though, there was definitely something very different about it.

Regardless, would come back to try other dishes. Had to wait 30 minutes but was worth it.  I'm sure the wait can be much longer at other times though.
author: Shireen J.

description: The food was excellent but it was packed and the noise was too loud. But the service staff was friendly, albeit slow. But we would go with friends and/or a bigger party the next time. Not a place for romance but great for a night out!
author: William D.

description:
must get their lobster rolls! the bread is a bit plain though but still worth it! my boyfriend ordered the fish and chips and I loved how crunchy it was. with both of those and a coke, the bill turned out to be around $48 (not including tip).

their service was really great which is always a plus!
author: Tiffany H.

description: Best cioppino anywhere! You can tell they have taken the time to slowly develop a rich seafood broth with the juices of all the high quality seafood that goes into this. I love that they have added LOTs of lump crab meat in the bowl in addition to the crab legs- this means you can begin to chow down without having to bust open a shell first. Cool joint, amazeballs food
author: Joseph U.

description:
Hands down, the best lobster roll I've ever tasted. Nice sized pieces of lobster stuffed into a soft, buttery toasted Acme roll. I ordered the smaller 3oz version and was stuffed silly and believe me, I'm a girl that can eat. There's also a bigger version as well. Knowing me, I'll probably wind up getting that for next time! Ze eyes are bigger than ze stomach. 

The side of fries were extra crispy and perfect for sharing. The homemade coleslaw that came with was refreshing and light considering that coleslaw is usually tossed in a mayo base. Go figure. The clam chowder had generous pieces of clam.The whole meal for me was just incredible. 

Just a great place to chow on some of the freshest and simplest prepared seafood.

The Woodhouse Fish Company has me craving for their food at every meal of the day now. Good thing that they're open 7 days a week!

It's a cute little restaurant located on Fillmore Street. Note that parking is a challenge. It's also nice that it's located near so many shops because with the generous portions served here, you might find yourself walking a few laps to compensate for such a soul satisfying meal. So good!
author: Ann S.

description:
Best lobster roll in the SF... hands down!  Lobster tasted like it was just taken from the sea and inside a buttery soft roll it was amazing!   I can eat this everyday.
I also ordered oysters, but it was alright, you really come here for the lobster rolls.
author: Emmett B.

description:
Eaten at the one in the Castro was pretty darn good. 
This one not so good. 
Asked for clam chowder, waitress did not ask cup or bowl... Brought bowl. Ok no issue
Orders fish and chips and half Dungness  Crab. 
Fish and chips honestly they were lack luster and tasteless. No seasoning or flavor. 
Crab well first off was nowhere a half more like a 1/4... one leg and it was mushy to boot.
Honestly the best part of the meal was the lemonade and thats cause I made it! 

Very disappointed :-/
author: Bryan E.

description: Fabulous. Came here on recommendation of an owner of another restaurant in the area. Did not disappoint in the least. They were busy, but the 4 of us (2 adults/2kids) sate on the bar/counter top.  3 of us had the Cioppino. Tomato-based. Simply the best I have had for flavor, amount of seafood in the bowl, and value.
author: Tim B.

description:
If your craving Seafood, Fish & Chips or a Lobster roll, Woodhouse Fish Company is the place to go in San Francisco! My friend and I choose Woodhouse Fish Company for their high reviews and great looking food. It's a great place to dine with great food and a very vibrant atmosphere. 

Food:

   * Fried Ipswich Clam Roll - Sandwich, served with fries & slaw [$15]
   * Split-Top Main Lobster Roll - Sandwich, served with fries & slaw [$18 (3oz)/$26 (6oz)]

The Fried Ipswich Clam Roll was perfectly fried with clams on the larger side and a juicy flavor on the inside. The Split-Top Main Lobster was another great roll (my favorite) that's fresh, and delicious! I ordered the 6 oz and it just melted in my mouth. As I ate the lobster roll, I couldn't help but think of Luke's Lobster in New York! In comparison Luke's Lobster was more fresh, juicy, and simply salivating. However this place is not to be missed.

The Good: Lobster Roll | Great Service | Vibrant Atmosphere

The Bad: ...
author: Matthew M.

description:
First time eating there.  I had the fish and chips which were cooked to perfection, Fresh and tasty slaw (none of that wilted stuff!) and delicious fries.  My companion order the clam chowder, I sampled it and it wash delicious, rich and filling.  I sampled some of my companion's strawberry shortcake, they should consider half the sugar in the shortcake but overall it was very pleasant dessert.  
I have since recommended it to a number of people and I plan future visits.!
author: P O.

description:
Excellent food, ok service.  

Recently walked in for an impromptu Monday night dinner with a friend.  It was crowded, so we agreed to sit at the counter because we were quoted a 5 minute wait and we were starving.  But then, I looked over at the counter and it was completely empty.  So why the 5 minute wait?  Not sure...  Service throughout the meal was sporadic and could have been friendlier, especially for the price point.

About the food.  Very tasty.  I had the crab cakes and my friend had the lobster roll.  Very tasty and fresh!  There was so much lobster on the lobster roll!  They give you options where you can choose how many ounces of lobster you want (I think it was 2 oz vs 5 oz) and how many crab cakes you want.  That was a nice option, since sometimes you might be hungrier than usual, so maybe two crab cakes wouldn't be enough!  

Highly recommend to check it out, but don't expect too much with the service.
author: Sharan T.

description: Great little seafood joint. We came for the Dungeness madness so can't really judge the restaurant on the rest of the menu. Service was great  and so was the vibe. We would come back to check out their other items. There is no rsvp so either come early or be prepare for 1 hour wait.
author: Tracy L.

description: My friend's mussels were good, but my cheddar crab melt was very disappointing and almost inedibly salty.
author: KR B.

description:
Woodhouse is my go to seafood restaurant around Pac Heights. It is casual and fun, however, the price for the size of their sandwiches can seem a little on the high side. Regardless, their seafood is incredibly fresh and anything made with their crab (especially the rolls) are a must have! 

On a side note, the videos of crabs being caught and killed was a little intense for the dining room atmosphere.
author: Basile S.

description: It's cool place to hang out with friends and eatting some seafood. The baked oyster and  lobster sandwich were delicious.
author: Tina L.

description: Great dungeonous crab melt but the flavor and meat are packed into half of half a sandwich  that you'll remain hungry and have to order more.
author: Regina D.

description:
After a great hike in the city we stopped in here to grab a quick lunch, I was craving a good order of fish and chips.

This location is very clean and easy to find, we walked and were seated immediately.  We ordered fish and chips, plus some of their calm chowder.  Service was fast and food came super fast.  Portions are pretty hefty here so we had more than enough food.  The chowder was great on this day, the weather was slightly cool and made for a perfect day.  

The fish and chips were fantastic!  Exactly what I was wanting, the fish was crispy and tasty.  There was a lot more on the menu and when I return to the city I will come back.  If you are in the area, please stop in.

Also in the men's restroom there was a large panoramic photo of the fire that destroyed the city that I thought was really cool.  

Cheers
author: Robert A.

description:
Nice place with a good service but very mediocre food.

I tried only cioppino and it tasted as if you put ton of tabasco sauce into a plain water. For $29 I would expect more.
author: Rasty T.

description: Excellent! Excellent! Best lobster roll! Professional service, clam chowder is great and chunky, fish and chips are decent. A little pricey for me but worth it. Will come back to try others on menu.
author: Noel O.

description:
It was a pleasure having lunch here with fellow Yelper Jonathan W.  Between his school/work schedule and my work/work schedule, we finally found time to meet each other in the real world. 

For appetizers, we had 6 oysters priced at $2 each. Fresh and plump, it easily slid down my throat.  I enjoyed it with a squeeze of lemon and dash of tabasco.  

Not long after we finished our oysters, our waiter brought out our entrees.  Fish n' chips for him, crab cakes with salad for me.   I've been jonesing for those crab cakes the night before while I was perusing the menu online and they didn't disappoint.   3 crabcakes, about the size of a hockey puck, pan fried and drizzled with a chipotle mayo sauce.  Lightly browned crust with moist, real crab flakes (thank God no fillers!) with a little zing from the sauce.  Generous spring mix salad with cherry tomatoes and beets. 

Their beer battered fish had a nice, thick, crunchy crust.  Those babies are huge!   3 strips is definitely enough for a meal, piled atop a mountain of skinny fries.  

Our waiter provided okay service, except he forgot to fill our water towards the end. 

What a pleasant lunch on a beautiful day.  My only complaint was I had to go to work after!
author: Janice C.

description: One of the best lobster roll in town. Went here on a Monday around 4pm with the family and kids. Sat down right away without a wait. I had the lobster roll with fries...so good!!!
author: Phi N.

description: So good and so fresh- nice intimate setting. Nice crowd and fantastic service. The food was amazing. Crispy fish, crispy chips and the crab cakes were the perfect spicy. Also the salad was amazing! The dressing is so light and good. Definitely go here!
author: Isabelle A.

description:
Now I don't like seafood but woodhouse is amazing!!! The clam chowder is soooo good!!! Probably my favorite in the city! 

My sister is a seafoodie and I have to take her here every time she visits. This past visit she ordered a shrimp cocktail and she loved it!!! Unfortunately she dropped one of her shrimps on the floor...it was really sad. 

Sidenote the wait can be super long on weekends...but it's worth the wait!
author: Lauren G.

description:
long wait time for seating aside, woodhouse fish co is well worth the visit, for the crab roll alone. best crab roll i've had in the area - although it doesn't quite compare to the lobster rolls on the east coast (especially maine). 
the kumamoto oysters here are also among the freshest i've ever had and run $3 a pop, and are very well cleaned. nothing ruins a bite like a bit of grit or shell in my oysters. these are easily as fresh or fresher than Swans (ok, less variety). 
need to try the clam chowder and cioppino here (although i'm personally of the mind that you can't mess up cioppino, and neither does it ever become exceptional)
author: Xander C.

description:
I'm not a seafood lover at all, but I have to say that Woodhouse Fish Co. has convinced me to see otherwise.

I went here with my girlfriend on a Sunday, she got the Lobster Roll and I, the Crab Melt. The decor inside, makes you feel like you're on a pier or on the beach. The staff is friendly, and always there for you if you needed anything. I can't say enough how amazing the food is. I'll definitely be going here from now on, however, I'll say that it's best for an afternoon lunch date.
author: Mathurin K.

description:
Trying to find a reason not to give them 5 stars would be difficult. Someone like myself who is passionate about new food, this place rocks. 
My fiancé a friend and I all shared the lobster roll, seafood stuffed artichoke and fried catfish. Lobster roll was on point but the catfish and artichoke were absolutely amazing. 
Artichoke: stuffed with crab on one side and shrimp on the other. Loaded with garlic and cheese inside the leaves and BBQ'd so it had that great BBQ Flavor. 
Catfish: not overly fried but had a great crunch and flavor. It paired perfectly with the bed of corn chowder and roasted turnips that were equally amazing on their own.
author: David R.

description: Second time here and I was disappointed. The first time I ate here for dinner, the hosts were kind and the service was quick. The second time, I came here for lunch. A female waitress was quite rude to my sister and I. She hastily answered our questions and was not friendly at all. It took quite a while for the wait staff to refill our waters (and it wasn't even busy)! The food is always good here. It's fresh and filling. The 3 stars goes towards the service mostly.
author: Micaela D.

description: We were promised a 6 top in 5 mins. Instead of holding the table for us. They gave the table to 3 people and said it would 45 mins. All they could offer was an apology. I have dined here every week for almost a year. This is how you treat your repeat customers? No thanks....
author: Jonathan G.

description: Damn you Dungeness crab roll. You are too good. My favorite restaurant on Fillmore. Great service too.  And how can you beat $1 oysters on Tuesdays???
author: Louis D.

description: Best fish tacos I've ever had.  Made with Alaskan Cod, they were scrumptious!  My wife and I enjoyed the Dungeness crab which was steamed to perfection. Save room for desert because the bread pudding or the strawberry shortcake won't disappoint.
author: Jim H.

description:
My friend and I joked that this place was down to 3 stars before we even sat down.
Sadly, once we were seated Woodhouse wasn't able to recuperate any stars.

The hostess this evening seemed extremely lethargic. She said it would be a 20 minute. There were 3 parties in front of us and 4 different available tables. True to her word it took the staff over 25 minutes to remove the old glasses of water and finally usher the guests over to the seats. The whole team moved excruciatingly slow. Someone should introduce them to the term "sense of urgency".

However, our waitress once finally seated was perky and kind. The clam chowder was good. The crab sandwich was good but seemed to be missing something, garlic? I little mayo? I'm not sure what normally goes in that type of sandwich but it was underwhelming. Also we paid for the extra, larger sandwich but it didn't seem large, is it just like the normal size but with extra meat?

Either way, I enjoyed the sandwich but probably won't return anytime soon.
author: Alexandra H.

description: The clam chowder was perfect and I'll come back for that dish again. The batter for the fish and chips was too salty for me. I was hoping for an oyster po boy but I did not see it on the menu and was not told of any specials for the day. I'll come back for the chowder and give the rest of the menu a shot.
author: Scott K.

description:
Service : Excellent. Seated my party of two, 20 minutes prior to close and I never felt rushed, and was allowed to order another round of beer when most places wouldn't be bothered to serve. Our waiter was friendly and observant. No complaints at all.

Menu: Well crafted and great specials with thought put into it. Prices were what you'd expect to pay for a good plate of fish.

Food: We ordered two specials. First, Fish of the day, in this case Bass. Well seasoned, didn't need the lemon or their house sauce. Came with a side of fries, also good. Second, half a steamed Dungeness crab in a jalapeño and ginger vinaigrette. Delicious, the  jalapeño added a nice warmth without overpowering at all. Everything was evenly seasoned so all of our food had a solid flavor. Their broccoli was great.

Ambiance:  Hip but not obnoxious. A good size sitting area and a good crowd.

I have no idea what people complain about portions for, or quality.
author: Computer J.

description:
I asked the lobster roll, " did it hurt? did it hurt when you fell from heaven??" THIS IS SERIOUSLY LOBSTER HEAVEN!!!!!!!!!!! When I really like something, I pretty much preach it to my whole social network. This is the best Lobster Roll I've ever had the pleasure of stuffing into my mouth. The chunks of lobster are huge and juicy (that's what she said) and aren't overwhelmed by the taste of Mayo (which I hate, yuck)... the roll is actually a buttered slice of delicious moist bread. The blend of these two beautiful creations make this an amazing lobster roll that is DEFINITELY worth your $18.

Bye
author: Joyce M.

description:
Woodhouse Fish Co is the stuff that dreams are made of.  Yes I will admit this was a plan B a plan B none the less it was a remarkable experience. One that I am sure would never be replicated again.  Plan A was to try Swan Oyster Depot because of Anthony Bourdon hyping it up on his ever popular show the Layover.  We stood in line there for about 10 minutes when we jointly came to the conclusion that there was just no way we were going to eat there. Rather than be defeated we used my Yelp app to locate the nearest seafood restaurant with highest star rating and most expensive food offerings and that's when we learned about the Woodhouse Fish Co. 
  We started out with oyster that had just been caught that day. Slurping them down sent me to other terrestrial plane. For our entrees my boyfriend got the cioppino and I ordered not one but two whole Dungness crabs one in regular melted butter and the other in white wine sauce.  The waiter had to move us to a larger table to accompany all of our food.  If ever Woodhouse Fish Co was thinking of expanding into the East Coast they would have my 100 patronage.  The food was awe-inspiring and one of the highlights of our vacation. Everything was perfected we wanted for nothing.
author: Lucretiz C.

description:
Came here the other night. Had the cup of clam chowder and a Lobster Roll ($18 portion) 

The clam chowder was delicious. The Lobster Roll was good & very fresh. I would not recommend getting the $18 portion if you are really hungry. After I finished eating my meal I was still hungry. 

I will definitely return to try out the rest of the menu.
author: Michelle G.

description: YUM YUM.  My husband LOVES whole belly fried clams and they are very difficult to find in this part of the country but here they are!  A nice large portion on their appetizer menu.  Fried perfectly and quite scurmptous.  I wanted the lobster roll as the pics on yelp looked so good but couldn't resist their special of soft shell crab BLT.  Lots of thick crisp applewood bacon, whole crab and a perfectly grilled roll - heirloom tomatoes too.  Friendly prompt service, funky fun atmosphere in this little place.  We will be back!!!!!
author: Tina O.

description:
Excellent place serving up amazing seafood dishes.

Their Lobster Roll is truly one of the best things you can eat in San Francisco. Double down on the meat and wash it all down with a brew on tap.

Stop reading and go. Thank me later, or never, just go.
author: Leo G.

description: So delicious!  One of my favorite restaurants in SF.  I eat here almost weekly. I've had literally everything on the menu over the past 5 years and you can't go wrong.  My favorites are the mussels, the seasonal Dungeness crab with heirloom tomato linguine, the bay shrimp roll, the cioppino (I often split this dish with a friend -- it's a generous serving and very filling!), and of course the Tuesday night oyster special.  Love that they're sourcing those oysters from Point Reyes now!  They don't accept reservations, but the staff is quite accommodating and will bring you an adult beverage while you wait for your table.  There's a reason Woodhouse is almost always packed!
author: Emily W.

description:
Hands down, the best clam chowder I have ever eaten. Same with the crab cakes.  Ughhhhhhhyum. 

If you're willing to put up with really tight spaces for seating, everything else about the atmosphere is great.  Also, the specials and classics are both totally worth it. 

It's also in an awesome location so you can go shopping before/ after.
author: Julianne S.

description: I have nothing but great things to say. We wanted have some seafood and I saw this place on our walk through the city. I wanted clam chowder, I crave it when I'm in the city. I wasn't expecting the lobster roll...mmm. My order was for oysters, white clam chowder and the 6oz lobster roll with onion rings. The clam chowder is what I like. Lots of clams, great flavor, hit the spot. The lobster roll comes in 3oz or 6oz, but the bread is the same size. You might as well get the 6oz. It's served chilled and it has so much meat I was a happy happy customer. It was delicious! I've had my share of lobster rolls with much disappointment. You spend the same amount of money and you get little meat and it leaves you underwhelmed. That is not the case here. Next time I'm in town in going to get the crab roll. Served warm with butter. Hungry yet?
author: Candy D.

description:
The hostess is awesome. She somehow makes you feel like she is genuinely happy to have you there. Seriously special.

The food, not so much - granted I am mainly writing about the fish and chips.  The fish was heavily battered and exceptionally greasy. When you bite into it, you get a mouthful of oil and can barely taste the cod.  There is also no flavoring of any sort.  For me, a well battered fish is not so dense but instead has a thin, light and crispy batter that makes you forget  you are essentially eating a basket of fried food. They might also benefit from adding a dash of red pepper or even black pepper to the batter to spice it up a bit. The fries didnt taste fresh.

We had the wedge salad with blue cheese dressing which was decent but nothing amazing. 

If I were to return, I would not order the fish and chips.
author: Fsa A.

description:
Ever wondered what it tastes like to eat magic? Well, let me tell you, friend... it doesn't resemble the flavor profile of a nickel-plated brass key you've seen illusionists swallowing for the better part of a century... magic is the lobster roll at Woodhouse Fish Company. Think of a hot, sweaty, breathless David Copperfield smothered in mayonnaise and dill, wedged between a freshly-toasted Acme roll alongside a basket of french fries and homemade cole slaw. 

Actually -- scratch that image -- David Copperfield is gross. Just imagine one of the most intensely ambrosial treats you've had a chance to devour, and know this little vittle at Woodhouse probably deserves at least an honorable mention in a conversation revolving around your favorite comfort food items around. It's that good!
author: Ruggy J.

description:
