The ambiance of this place was really nice. Not too big of a restaurant, but designed nicely. 

Went there for dinner on a Saturday night. Packed house but only had to wait 10-15mins. Service was good.

Now to the food, for starters we had a local beer(forgot the name), fried calamari, and clam chowder. All were good, but the must try is the clam chowder! For the main course I had the split top lobster sandwich w/ fries. It was good, but I expected a little more flavor to pop out. And I think it would've been better if the lobster was warm also.

But all in all great place, great service, and great food.
author: Jeff I.

description: It wasn't awful but it wasn't the greatest either. I recommend the calamari, this was the best out of everything we ordered. We also ordered the dungeon crab melt and crab cakes, they seemed to lack flavor and were very bland. Our waitresses were very friendly and quite pleasant. I don't know if I would go back or recommend.
author: Kayla K.

description:
Once you walk in you're greeted and squeezed within the tables. The kitchen is open so you can hear everything that goes on. Let's start with the crowded restaurant and extremely small space, open loud kitchen, smacking the plates every 5 seconds in the kitchen, the heat level inside the restaurant( only one window is open and the AC is hardly on). 
The food is alright, you can definitely find better. The fish and chips was overly cooked the batter tasted burned. We received the food before our appetizer, which was pointless to get to begin with. The calamari was overly battered and fried. Was not juicy, soft and tinder. But it was hard, crispy and over chewy. I found better food all over the fisherman wharfs than this place. Avoid the mess and the noise and go somewhere better with more options, better price and less noisy.
author: Tete J.

description: Loved this place, lobster roll was delicious! Small little place but they have the best customer service!
author: Jasmine M.

description: The cioppino here is amazing! I'm sure there's other places in SF that are just as good if not better but I haven't had the pleasure of trying those places yet. I can say that every cioppino I've tried in socal has not even come close to how good the cioppino is here. I had a bowl of clams as well which were so good with whatever soup/sauce base they use. Definitely returning on my next trip.
author: Tina M.

description:
I discovered this place just by walking by when my wife and I were walking by, so we decided to pop in for dinner one night.  Thankfully, that night was a Tuesday night, where there are $1 oysters!  As expected, it was a little busy and told the wait would be about 20 minutes.  It was actually a bit quicker since we were open to sitting at the counter.  Our waiter was really friendly and gave us good pointers and recommendations.  We ordered a half dozen oysters, the large lobster roll, and 3 crab cakes.  

The oysters were good.  I'm not much of an oyster fan, but they were pretty creamy and not too fishy...  the wife is the big oyster fan in the family!  The crab cakes were pretty good, not the best we've had, but not bad at all either.  We really enjoyed the lobster roll.  It was amazing except for the $26 price tag.  

I was torn between 3 and 4 stars for this place, so I'd give it a solid 3.5.  But yelp doesn't do halves, so I'll round up because of the dollar oyster Tuesdays and our friendly and helpful service.
author: Jeff C.

description:
It was fine. I know seafood is pricey, even in the bay, so I don't really have an issue with their price point. 

We had the local squid and the daily whole fish,which was some type of sea bass. The squid was great, perfect texture and well seasoned. The fish was good too, just not enough for two to split. Which for $32, we hoped it would be. Oh and the seasoning seemed to essentially be the same for both. No big deal. We then ordered a side of slaw, which fortunately or unfortunately was the star of the show. 

Upon leaving, we noticed some dishes that looked much bigger and AWESOME. So I chalk some of this up to me not ordering the right things. I hate when I do that at a new place. That being said, I'm sure we'll be back and order something else and I'll adjust my review accordingly.
author: andy s.

description:
Adorable corner seafood shop on Fillmore Street with tall ceiling and bright glass windows. It is very bright even on a gloomy day in SF. Clean and has wooden tables, booth seating, and bar seating like at Swanson Depot. I think the most interesting decoration there is a large LCD mounted on the wall inside a classic frame. It looks like a window to the outside world. Or a living portrait. The TV broadcasted some video that looked like live feed from the Half Moon Bay. I thought this was a very clever décor and matched perfectly with the restaurant. 

Ordered: 

* Lobster Roll 3 oz $18 OR 6 oz. $26 (4 of 5) - yummy! 3 oz is pretty filling. I think 6 oz choice is overkill, but if you are up for the challenge GO FOR IT! The lobster filling was fresh and light. There was some chopped celery mixed-in to add texture. I liked it. It was light on mayo and fresh on lobster. I also really enjoyed the thick Texas bread slit in the middle to create a pocket that held the lobster filling perfectly. I strongly recommend ordering this 3 oz roll when you are the restaurant.

* Maryland Soft Shell Crab BLT $14 (3.5 of 5) - the lobster roll tasted just a little better. Definitely, this was also a great creation. The soft shell crab was fried perfectly and placed in the bread slit accompanied by his friend, the bacon, lettuce, and tomato. Too bad, the bacon's taste slightly overcastted the soft shell crab's taste. The soft shell crab was also a little oily compared to the lobster roll. And it made a bigger mess when you bit into the BLT and the tomato started to divide. This was really good, but the lobster roll was just a little better tasting and better executed. 

Choices of raw oyster when we went were listed on the blackboard and listed below:

Skookum is from Washington $2EA 
Blue Point is from Connecticut $2EA 
Kumamoto is from California $3EA 

I don't remember much, but at the end, I think the Kumamoto was smaller in size and pricier, but they were the better tasting and had a sweeter finish.
author: Janice T.

description:
Their cioppino is the BEST I've ever had. Seriously. And the broth that the steamed clams/mussels come in is absolute heaven. We seriously asked got more bread just to soak it up & not waste a drop (we didn't even ask for it, the great service staff just offered it up).

Really wonderful food, great service, (and a nice nod to a New England seafood place - this location is "prettier" than Market St, but both are fantastic).
author: judah m.

description: Lobster roll and fish n chips! Can't go wrong!!! Try to come with someone so you can split both entrees!
author: Heather D.

description:
Woodhouse Fish Co is indeed worth the trip! I came here on a Saturday afternoon around 2:00pm and did have a small wait but only because we had the inconvenient number of 3 people. Most of the tables inside the restaurant consisted of two person tables thereby making it a bit more difficult for larger groups to eat there. 

My friends and I ordered the: Hartford Clam Chowder, Dungeness Crab Melt, Top-Buttered Dungeness Crab Roll, and Split top Maine Lobster Roll. They were all delicious! The Dungeness Crab Roll had copious amounts of crab meat worth the 28$ you were paying for. The Lobster Roll was also amazingly refreshing and sweet! The coleslaw and fries were decent--but just as a side. We also ordered the DIY Lemonade--which came in a pretty cool presentation. 

Overall, it was a delicious experience and one that I would recommend to any seafood lovers out there!
author: K T.

description: Good experience, very crowed when we arrived. I had the lobster sandwich, it was very tasty and I really enjoyed it. My dinner companion had the fried clam sandwich and said it was very good as well. Service was good and very friendly. We were in town just for the day on business. We would come back.
author: Maria H.

description:
Wife say best lobster roll ever. I saw Lobsterme taste better than this.

But price is very reasonable.
author: Calvary D.

description: Oh m gee. Easily one of the best meals ever. Thanks to my handy Yelp app I brought my Mom and sister in prior to a spa day. We had a short wait for lunch. I am obsessed with lobster rolls and sadly there are few places that have them in Portland. Their lobster roll was perfect, I could eat it every day. The fries were great. The rose and sparkling to wash down my meal was terrific. The restaurant itself was very cute. Lunch and drinks for 3 was just over $100. See you next time in in SFO Woodhouse.
author: Alison M.

description:
Well, I preface this with saying it takes a lot of heart and soul to open a restaurant, and succeed at that! So in doing so, my hat's off to this delicious eatery. It's a cool spot.

I had the dungenness crab roll/sandwich. I took a cab down here from my hotel because some of the reviews said it was mind-blowing. I personally didn't think so, but I enjoyed it! I found the taste a little simplistic. I think the choice of bread/roll could have been much better, but I thought it was good. And its always hard when people rave about anything; sets the bar too high. 

Service was impeccable. Busy, but food came out timely. Really cool decor, loved it.

Here's my only thing, and it has nothing to do with star rating, but it may unfortunately be for some people and thus should be taken into consideration by management: 

I sat solo at the bar top waiting for my food to arrive enjoying the ingenious portrait/TV on the wall that showed all the beautiful views of San Francisco. Landscapes, aerial views, etc. Really stunning. My food arrives, and almost as if it were timed comedically, the TV shifts from gorgeous local landscapes to fishermen catching the crab and preparing them for slaughtering. I'm a pretty compassionate person so I was sitting there watching as trash bins filled up with barrels and barrels of live crabs, desperately trying to fight for their lives, as more barrels of crabs toppled on top of them, and, needless to say, I didn't finish my sandwich. And a few minutes later it shows the crabs in the bins being wheeled onto the dock, but they're damn near lifeless because they've given up on living at this point and realize their approaching demise. It all sounds funny but I found it really sad and a bit crude actually. It'd be like going to a steakhouse and having a huge TV screen in front of you showing the cows being lined up for slaughter. Appetizing? But, again, I don't feel thats anything to do with service and taste so I didn't grade with that in consideration. Will probably come again sometime and just face away from the TV ;)
author: Brad B.

description:
Oh hay hay, please get all up in my belly.  My stomach legit did a little dance as I was eating my lobstah roll.  The light buttery and toasty acme roll was the PERFECT combo for my SUPER fresh tasty lobster.   Alongside the little fella, it was accompanied by delicious fries and homemade cole slaw which I usually don't ever like but it was pretty darn tasty here. 

Also liked that the restaurant was low key and not one of those I gotta get all up in your face to have a conversation.  Left the place without losing my voice!

Very happy this spot is in the neighborhood.  I'm gonna come back and attack it like return of the mack, don't you know?  Mmhmm here I go, I'll be back.
author: Nho C.

description:
I am really happy that we came across this place!

We had to wait for about 20 minutes but it went by fast while we were overlooking the menu that they had posted outside on the window.

This place is quite small but decorated according to the name of the restaurant, fish. There was this really cool frame that was more of a moving portrait. It was quite entertaining to watch. 

Customer service was great, no complaints on our server.

For my appetizer  I ordered the crispy calamari. That was good. My boyfriend ordered a cup of clam chowder because I thought it would be best for him to get a small portion before our entree, I WAS WRONG! That clam chowder is probably THE best clam chowder i have tasted in a while! What a disappointment it was when the cup went empty. :(

For my entree I ordered the Prawn penne, I don't remember the exact name of it since it was sometime last month but that was delicious also. I do plan on making another trip back here next time we're in town.
author: Kim T.

description: Loved everything about this place. I'm a huge fan of seafood so there really isn't much not to like. The clam chowder was fantastic. Also had the cioppino which had tons of fresh seafood and really good garlic bread. Can't wait to go back again!
author: Debbie L.

description: Visiting for the weekend . Looked on Yelp for lunch . This place has the best fish and chips - and shrimp roll - and lobster roll . Brought our 4 year old grandson and staff was very "child friendly". Our hotel is only a mile away so I see more Woodhouse Fish Co in our visit .
author: Linda H.

description:
I've had this place in my bookmarks forever but recently just came here because Eileen H and Kathy V's yelped about it a few days apart and their yelps and pictures had me drooling and lured me in...  I started craving for a lobster roll and once I get a craving, I MUST have it.  i can't even imagine what I will be like once I get pregnant. haha.  

Came here for a late lunch with the hubby.  We shared the lobster roll and a crab louie salad that the hubby chose.  The lobster roll was yummy but felt small... I guess there are two different sizes... same size roll but more lobster in them.  Either 3 oz or 6 oz, but the waitress did not ask what size I wanted and just gave us the 3 oz..  it was enough... for me, myself to devour but I had to share with the hubs. LOL.  The salad was a good portion and had a lot of crab in it.  

The menu had a lot of great options like oyster po boy, fish tacos, and a lot more so I think we will be back again soon!
author: Kymberli C.

description:
I don't know, maybe it was the hype that killed it.
I've always wanted to try a lobster roll and looking at the reviews on Yelp, so many people loved it here so I decided to check it out. I was excited to try it and it looked great and all, but once I bit into the sandwich, the expectation wasn't met. It wasn't as flavorful as I thought it would be. Kind of bland actually. 
The only thing I loved about my meal here were the oysters. They were delicious, you could really taste the freshness. Other than that, everything else was MEH.
author: Lina L.

description:
I had at Woodhouse with my parents while visiting SF over Christmas.
The restaurant on Market has a small unassuming storefront, but as soon as you walk in, you get hit with the feeling that you're in a very classic New England crab house.

We got a half dozen Washington oysters, and a shrimp  roll to start. The oysters came with fresh cut lemons and cocktail sauce with a dollop of horseradish. They were fresh and briny, and quite a treat. The shrimp roll was densely packed with shrimp and quite a bit of fresh avocado. The roll was well buttered and had a nice crisp to it. All in all a great start.

Seeing as it was December and the Dungeness crab season had just started, we ordered a steamed cracked crab and a jalapeno-garlic-butter crab. Both renditions of the crustaceans were quite good, but the jalapeno edged ahead with the addition of a little bit of heat.

TL;DR: Great New England style seafood and crabs, good service.
author: Bernie Z.

description: Lobster roll was delicious. It's light & not as rich as some of the other lobster rolls I've had. It's light on a good note as sometimes a very rich lobster roll can be overpowering on the taste buds with all the mayo. I would definitely come back again and choose more ounces of lobster instead. Parking may be a bit difficult as it's in the Fillmore but it's worth it.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Overall, this place exceeded my expectations. I looked at the limited menu and the throngs of people on the street and honestly, I expected to be disappointed by both the food and the wait. 

The wait for a table of 2 was 10min or so on a Saturday night. For larger groups, it sounded like the wait was closer to 40min. But, we're talking prime time.

The food was delicious... better than expected.  I got the prawn cocktail. Prawns were great. Could have used the cocktail sauce and some horseradish on the side to mix your own, but overall good. The crab cakes were not fishy at all and came with a light salad. The strawberry shortcake was fantastic.. like I might go order a second fantastic. They served it as a warm biscuit, fresh whipped cream  and strawberries. I can't emphasize how good and NOT overly sweet this was. Yum.  The arnold palmer (make your own) was also great. Fresh lemonade, add your own sugar and iced tea. 

I'd go again as a party of two. Make sure whoever you go with can eat shellfish. If not, there are limited options (fish tacos, whole fish, fish & chips). There are NO non-fish options. I guess one could guess that from the name.
author: Amy L.

description: Ehh, fried food is always tasty but when there is a pool of grease at the bottom of the French fry basket it does make one realize how nasty it truly is. Fish was perfect with delicate batter on the outside, service on point, coleslaw average, just that end of meal feeling of blah.
author: Matt A.

description:
Came in at about 8:30 on a Saturday night and the place was pretty packed. Just me and the boo so luckily it was easy to find seating quickly. 



Appetizer: Ordered 4 the raw oysters. They brought out two types of oysters. The Tomales Bay oysters were so fresh and good! The other ones were so so, I think they were from Maine? I wasn't quite paying attention. 



Main dish: Large lobster roll and Cioppino.  I had a bite of the lobster roll, it was pretty good. My man was quite pleased. Cioppino was soooooo good! Nice rich broth, and a ton of seafood! Keep in mind it's quite a bit of work cracking the crab and taking the mussels and clams out, but it was worth it! 

Didn't want to get dessert because I wanted to try the fro-yo spot next door! 

Would def come here again !
author: Tran N.

description: We got here two hours before the place closes. We were interrupted countless times by many different people trying to finish their closing duties (two hours before closing time). "Are you using this ketchup?" One second after placing fork on napkin: "Are you done with this?". Just wait until people are finished eating. We had the linguine and fish'n'chips. Both OK.
author: Dalilah A.

description:
Review Long Overdue:

My boyfriend brought me here for my birthday (he knew that Woodhouse Fish Co. was on my list of must try restaurants in San Francisco). Isn't he sweet? But that was months ago and now my birthday is just around the corner, well not yet, but it'll come in 2014 with a snap of the finger and I remember my good experience with Woodhouse Fish Co. 

Ordered:
Steamed Mussels with French Fries
Fresh Linguine Pasta

Both really delicious and delicate but I would say that the portions are bit small if you decide to share so I would order a little bit more so everyone can get enough bites of some good food :).
author: Mona L.

description:
Very delicious dishes.  Nice variety in the menu, we had a hard time deciding. 
Nice ambiance and friendly service.
Only negative thing was that the crab cake entree, as delicious as it was,  wasn't really an entree. 
The artichoke dish though was and delicious. 
The salmon appetizer, again, was delicious but seemed a bit overpriced considering the size. 
But no complaints at all in regards to the quality of the food.
The mousse en chocolate was authentic, absolutely divine.
author: Pipi B.

description:
This sea themed restaurant has got you feeling like you're in the right city. It's a small place with tables bunched up. But has got a great flow to their theme with a moving picture frame that adds realness in what they are serving.

Their specialty has got to be the Lobster Roll which is 18$ for a regular and 26$ for a larger sand which.  It never fails and it's always tasty. They also serve large crab cakes which over here is a dinner and not an appetizer. 

A good seafood place to try if you're looking for casual and just trying to relax.


Not much beer on top or to serve, but a good selection of wine 

Good to try if you have money to spend as the bill of four people will always be at least 100$+
author: Ladonna A.

description:
We were essentially forgot about after our appetizer (calamari which was amazing). Our entrees made it out of the kitchen an hour after our main course. I watched as the chef and line cook stood there with nothing to do and our ticket in the window. Two staff members tried to explain to me how busy the kitchen was even though I sat there and watched the chef and his line cook stand there with nothing to do, literally waiting for someone to tell them to go ahead and prepare our entrees. Someone finally realized something was wrong and all of a sudden there was a rush to get our food out. The line chef couldn't stop smirking at me throughout the meal. I must admit that by the end of the meal I was tired of this random guy in the back of house staring me in the eye and smirking every time I looked up. We finished our food in a hurry ready to pay. 

I asked why things took so long and had a food runner lie to me first, my waitress came over at that point and initially tried to tell me that the kitchen was just busy until I told her that I had seen everything. At this point she informs me that the this (not sending entrees for an hour?) has happened before and she would talk to the manager about it. He comes over and initially offers to take off one of our lobster rolls. I tell him that it isn't about the money. I just want someone to be honest with me about what had occurred and I don't like the idea of being lied to. At the end of it we still get the run around and he takes off the calamari ($16) rather than one of the lobster rolls ($28). I paid and left. 

If the kitchen had been swamped and our food took four hours then that would have been fine. The fact that I watched them stand around and do nothing while I was sitting there waiting for my food is not OK. Lying to a customer about the situation is not OK. I would have been understanding if someone had just owned up to the mistake but instead I was told lies directly to my face and that was completely disrespectful. This was an awful experience and I hope that no one has to deal with a similar situation because it can truly ruin a vacation. Luckily for me this was the only negative experience I had in SF.
author: Tyler B.

description:
Based on Yelper recommendations and after talking with some patrons, ordered the lobster roll and the "Hartford " clam chowder. The Hartford is a combination of white chowder with a dollop of red chowder in the center. Both dishes were delicious. 

Went to the Fillmore jazz festival. (July 5, 2014). Great music and people. Save the date and go next year. Had a great time. Took the ferry from Vallejo to the ferry building and then the 31 to Fillmore and eddy.
author: KaeRae Art C.

description:
Showed up at 5 PM on a Saturday evening and were seated pronto!  We started with a bowl of clam chowder and fried calamari.  The clam chowder was really good, however looking around I noticed a handful of diners dash away at their chowder with a ton salt and pepper.  I liked it's creaminess and ample amount of clams.  But yea a pinch of salt would have upped the taste factor.  No complaints about the fried calamari - not greasy at all.

Sgt. Hotstuff ordered the cioppino - divine!! I on the other hand ordered the fried Ipswich Clam roll - It was ok - I felt the roll was too bready.  I think this was my mistake too - I should have ordered something else other than another "fried" dish.  I O.D. on fried seafood.  However, I did enjoy the slaw which helped decrease the fried factor.

So here's why they lost a star- I'm not the one to pull out the "race" card but several times our server overlooked refilling our water and iced tea - while table on both sides were refilled, not once but twice.  I mean did we look like camels, or something? we didn't have humps on our backs for water supply...it was odd indeed.  The server was actually nice, maybe it was an oversight BUT 2x....Just sayin'
author: Michelle B.

description: Talk about amazingly delicious! aah lobster sandwich was perfect & stuffed artichoke  was something i have never experienced in m life.  Everyone needs to t this spot! 5 stars all the way!
author: Val P.

description:
Great place, delicious  lobster roll, and calamari are good. 

Our sunday lunch place.
author: Anelya S.

description: I've had this place bookmarked for a while now, thanks to reading fellow Yelper Angel's review. Looking to eat some good seafood? Here's your spot!! Service was hospitable and the food was incredible. Reading through the menu and yelp pic's the Split Top Maine Lobster Roll looked soooo delicious. My man friend and I decided to order the same items, within 15mins later both of our dishes came out. Our meal consisted of a side of coleslaw, golden skinny fries, and tons of pieces of lobster on a roll. My first bite? FRESH!! like if there was a seafood market in the back. LOL The roll tasted like Sizzlers Cheese Toast-YUM!! I wished we ordered more food but I was so focused on the sandwich haah I'll be coming back to try out their Crab sandwich and oysters!
author: Kathy V.

description: Tuesday $1 oyster is a must go. Best clam chowder in the city. You can taste the sweetness of the lobster in the lobster roll. Their fries that came with the roll is just the right crispy-ness. Top of my list restaurant in SF. Can't wait to try other things on the menu. Oh and I tried steamed mussel with garlic and white wine. I have nothing to complain. It was a great Tuesday evening.
author: Yulin K.

description: Loved it!  Huge lobster roll. Great friendly welcome. Worth the wait and location fantastic.
author: E C.

description:
After I are here last night I got very sick with food poisoning. For breakfast and lunch wife and I had the same thing and she is fine. I get the lobster roll and she got fish and chips. For about 6 hours I was loosing fluids through two parts of my body. I have had food allergy reactions before and know the signs. I can eat all seafood except scallops. They either buy bulk lobster cut with scallops to increase profits or mix it in the lobster roll themselves and don't advertise. I have been to a few places that do this. Costco sells lobster shreds for rolls and hidden in the ingredients is scallops. I always ask about scallops being mixed and was told "no". No checking in back, no verifying just said "no"
I paid $75 to vomit my meal a few hours later due to their standards.Be warned!

Update:
Owner or manger contacted me saying to come back and they would it right. As sick as I got I will not risk it. They need to do a better job of putting exactly what's in each item they sell. Not all seafood is the same when it comes to allergies. Since they contacted me I raised my rating 1 star.
author: Kris K.

description:
First time here and it lived up to my expectations! Ordered the mussels with garlic bread for an appetizer and it tasted really fresh. The cup of clam chowder i ordered was creamy and had tons of clams in it unlike some chowder places. For my main entree i ordered the crab melt and it tasted great! The bread it arrived with wasn't hard either which can be a downfall sometimes when you order seafood rolls. Here however, the whole meal was perfect. I also got to taste a little bit of the stuffed artichokes and i give huge thumbs up on that meal. Artichokes were perfectly cooked and marinated with the crab and shrimp thats in it. 

Wait time was around 45min. The restaraunt is small so the place can get really busy at times. Service was good but not great. Overall, i would come back again
author: Lauren A.

description: Amazing lobster rolls, and a great oyster happy hour on Tuesday. I'm so glad I live right down the street now because Woodhouse Fish Co. is my new diet. There isn't one item on the menu I haven't liked. Minus a star because it gets busy and the wait time can be long as haaaayulll.
author: Ivy D.

description:
Came here two week in a row. 

Love the Crab melt,
Lobster roll was delicious, but my East Coast Friends say it's "ok"
Atlantic Blue Point Oysters... my fave. meaty, good size, good taste.
author: Lynn T.

description:
Loved every bite!

Perfectly browned buttery toast
Freshly caught bay shrimps
Lightly fried softshell crabby
Surprisingly McD-like french fries

More casual than a standard sit-down restaurant
Less casual than a fish'n'chip joint
Definitely a 2-star-casual, please don't wear flippy floppies and a wife beater.

Shrimp and Avocado roll.. $12
Soft Shell Crab roll.. $14
Small cup of chowder.. $5.50

For a big eater, I felt like portions were a tiny bit small, but they certainly made up in quality and taste.
Definitely better than any by-the-water tourist trap, and service was great!
author: Jade T.

description:
I DIED AND WENT TO HEAVEN. 

Came here for dinner on a Friday night around 8:30, and for how popular this place is, we only waited about 20-30 minutes for a seat. 

I am an avid seafood lover, so although I am picky with my seafood, if I can get my hands on extremely fresh and good-quality seafood, I go on a natural high on life. 

I was so hungry by the time I came here, my friend and I literally ordered everything we wanted. And everything we had ordered was AMAZING. 

1. Clam Chowder- the best! It's soo good! Clam Chowder is one of the few things I look for in a seafood restaurant because a lot of times, it can be too rich with too much cream in their recipe or too much filling of other ingredients (potatoes, vegetables, etc) and not enough clam, or the clam in the soup can be bad quality and chewy. BUT this one was just SPOT ON! Not too thick, perfect consistency, perfect clams, perfect ratio. 

2. Calamari- Again, really good! calamari is also something I look at because it's really easy to either use bad-quality calamari that turns out chewy and flavorless or just too much breading. Woodhouse's calamaris are just so soft and the breading is really light and airy so it's just perfectly crisp! LOVED IT. 

3. Clams in White wine & Garlic- If I had to be somewhat disappointed in anything we got that night, it's probably this one, BUT DONT GET ME WRONG: it was STILL really good. The only reason I would say I'm disappointed is because for the price, we didn't get too many clams. But dipping the garlic bread in the sauce was really good so I guess it still turned out alright!

4. LOBSTER ROLL- OMG IF YOU ARE GOING TO COME HERE, YOU HAVE TO GET THIS. IT'S LIKE A SIN TO COME TO WOODHOUSE AND NOT ORDER THE LOBSTER ROLL. the lobster is SO fresh, SO soft and tender but extremely meaty, AND BEST OF ALL, it's not completely DRENCHED in sauce, which for me can be a turn off. The bread is perfectly soft and airy and buttered and toasted. omg, seriously, words only just continue to make this item underrated. I just can't explain verbally how amazing this dish is! Even the fries that come with it are good!! I would literally make the journey all the way to SF just to eat this. It's THAT good. 

Even on top of all that, our waitress was so nice and so attentive, which is never bad! It can be a little be pricey, but for the quality and execution of the seafood dishes, it's TOTALLY worth the money. WILL BE BACK AGAIN SOON. ugh, salivated as I was writing this.
author: Judy B.

description: Ok, so I finally got to try this place on my recent visit to San Francisco . We went for the lobster roll which costs a whopping $40. Wow ! Yes, there was quite an amount of lobster meat inside. However , quite honestly it did not meet my expectations .i was hoping to have a jaw dropping finger licking experience based on the reviews I read about this place . But the flavor lacked, compared to even the lobster rolls that I have had on the east coast ( maritime and Boston) considering the price, I would definitely expect more.The price  did not do justice as the roll was honestly not that large.
author: Jay A.

description:
Woodhouse is one of those good, but not GREAT restaurant experiences. I've been several times and while the lobster roll is lauded, I've had better (hello Ed's Lobster Bar, NYC!). Get the small - or you'll be rolling home (in a good way). The large is packed full of so much lobster it's nuts.

This time, I had a Dungeness Crab Melt which was okay, but... just not that flavorful. 

My friend and I also had the shellfish appetizer which was good. No complaints there - the clams were large and delicious. Just don't expect "garlic bread" when you ask for garlic bread - it's more like cheese bread.

Lastly, I would like to point out a peeve of mine: any restaurant that makes onion rings with panko flakes (or fish n' chips) isn't doing it right. Panko should only be used for katsu, and that's about it. Recommendation: don't order their onion rings. They're panko onion rings.
author: Cameron W.

description:
We drove to the neighborhood with Fresca in mind but it was packed with a 30 minute wait.  We decided to check out other places.  We came upon Woodhouse and put our name down.  The host was very nice and the wait was bearable.  

They have a blackboard with today's specials - I had my eyes on the scallop crudo.  Once we sat down, studied the menu, we had the following:

Draft Anchor Steam ($5.50) for hubby and glass of Coppola chardonnay ($9) for me.

scallop crudo - $11 - it's ok, too much sea salt

half dozen of Blue Point oysters - $12 - ok

order of 2 crab cakes - $12 - too crispy and didn't care for the sauce on top.  luckily, hubby liked it.  

cioppino - $22 - ok, Gigi still has the best

onion rings - $6 - crunchy but too much batter for me, I had 1/4 of one and that was it.  hubby enjoyed it.

cup of Hartford chowder - $5 - this is a mix of Manhattan and Boston chowder, it's ok.
author: Gloria H.

description:
Woodhouse Fish Co.'s lobster roll is a dream come true. It's fresh and flavorful, and the restaurant has a great atmosphere.

Unfortunately, this place doesn't take reservations, so come early to avoid the wait. My party of 6 arrived around 4:30pm and were seated immediately, but if you have to wait, it's worth it!

I hear they have $1 oysters on Tuesday - can't wait to try!
author: Melissa W.

description:
AMAZING!!!!!  The ambiance is  nice and clean, the service is prompt and friendly, and food is fresh and delicious! I just started eating seafood and had their clam chowder and crab cakes. My boyfriend and I shared oysters- everything was incredible! One of the super awesome things they have here is their DIY  lemonade! It's fun to make and pretty much the tastiest lemonade I've ever had. Not to mention their strawberry shortcake, which is made with fresh strawberries, authentic whipped cream, and a sweet biscuit-cookie!

I can't wait to get back to the bay area, just to eat here!
author: Natalie W.

description:
Yummy fish...my personal favorite!!

We parked in the lot off California, and were seated right away.  They do a brisk lunch business.  Our server was friendly and efficient.

Tasted a Oyster Bay Sauvignon Blanc that was too grassy, so I settled on the Frogs Leap...delish!

We both had the 2 piece order of fish and chips...what a worthwhile splurge!! Tender wild Icelandic Cod, nice batter...great fries and slaw. Perfection.

A very cool section of Filmore....lots of great shopping around!!
author: Katherine F.

description:
Family and I were spending the day around the city and passed by this place and was ultimately captivated by the fresh scent of seafood and the looks for this restaurant.

Inside it is a bit crowded but we are after all in San Francisco.  The prices were a bit high but we are after all in San Francisco.

We ordered prawns appetizer, fish and chips as a main and fish tacos.

The fish and chips were really good, very small batter and tasted really good.  Something about those fries also, I ended up finishing my wives leftovers. 

The fish tacos are pretty much the same exact fried cod they use for the fish and chips on a soft tortilla, cabbage,  and avocado, but I didn't mind they were delicious!
author: Steve A.

description:
The food is very good.  Had raw oysters ($1 on Tuesdays) wedge salad, crab roll and oyster roll.  All excellent as was the value.  Will be back.

Service was ok.  Not bad but not memorable either.  There was a pretty long wait but there is really no place to wait other than on the sidewalk out front.
author: Chris F.

description: I wanted to come to this place for a while now because their lobster roll is on the "20 Epic Sandwiches To Eat Before You Die" list on Eater SF. I happened to be in the area so I decided to stop by here for a quick lunch. It's a fairly small place although it was fairly empty so I had no trouble getting a table. (It was prime lunch hour so that was very good news!) The wait staff helped me immediately and were extremely friendly. I decided to stay with the classics and order a cup of the clam chowder and the small lobster roll. I actually ordered the "Hartford" clam chowder, which is New England style chowder with some of the Tomato Manhattan style chowder on top. I regretted not simply ordering the New England as it was delicious by itself but the Tomato Manhattan was still good with it nonetheless. The lobster roll was excellent, exactly what you would expect from it: a toasted, buttery roll filled with buttery, fresh lobster. The fries and coleslaw went well with the sandwich. Overall a very good meal... a little pricey for a fairly simple lunch, but still good nonetheless, and well-deseved on the "Best SF Sandwich" list.
author: Kunal N.

description: This place makes the best lobster rolls and fried clams!!! I HAVE to stop here every time we visit SF.  Their lobster rolls are HUGE and there's just nothing like it.  I've had other lobster rolls before and it just wasn't as satisfying.  This place also makes the best Ipswich fried clams..definitely check this place out if you visit SF!
author: Tracie S.

description:
I came here for dinner on NYE.  I got off work late, so we didn't have much time for dinner.  The bf called around to find out what restaurants didn't have a long wait, and Woodhouse was the winner!  We were seated right away and proceeded to order the Stuffed Artichoke, Fried Whole-Belly Ipswich Clams, and the Split-Top Maine Lobster Roll.  

The artichoke was stuffed with Dungeness crab meat on once side and bay shrimp on the other.  I already like artichokes, but the crab and shrimp made it an extra special treat.  As I always say, you can't really go wrong with fried food, and the clams were no exception.  They were nice and crispy and served with tartar and cocktail sauces.  The highlight of my dinner was definitely the lobster roll.  The buttery roll was overflowing with huge pieces of lobster!  The bf and I split everything, and I had to sneak in a few extra pieces of lobster for myself.  =)

The food and service are great here.  I'd definitely come back for another mouth-watering lobster roll!
author: Patra I.

description:
We have tried the other Woodhouse FIsh Company in Castro for a few times before, they had good food there, but the service there totally sucked that it finally drove us away. 

We were strolling around in Pacific Heights one weekend, trying to spot a place for lunch, we saw this one, the other Woodhouse was ALWAYS packed, we were surprised to see there're available seats inside of this one during lunch hour. We decided to give it a try. 

There is a lot of light coming from the the front entrance, which makes the the room look cozy. I like the wall decor and wood-centric furnitures. The whole interior strikes us as relaxing, a perfect choice for a Saturday lunch. 

The menu looks identical to the other one. We ordered the crab melt sandwich and the bay shrimp and avocado sandwich. We also ordered one of their daily special starters, which was the grilled octopus salad. The octopus was light and savory, just enough to tantalize the palate. 

My bay shrimp and avocado sandwich was excellent. Not too heavy, but still flavorful. The shrimps were fresh, which well balanced with the intricate richness of the avocado. I especially like their sandwich bread, which was perfected grilled/toasted, crunchy but still had some soft texture to it. 

The crab melt sandwich my fiancee ordered was on relatively rich due to the melted cheese on top of the crab meat, he said I took the better pick, but we both think it was still delicious regardless. 

The service was good. As compared to the Woodhouse Fish Company in Castro, this one is a winner.
author: Kai Y.

description: My husband and I love this place. The lobster roll and fish tacos are to die for. All of their seafood is super fresh and well prepared. Definitely always busy so plan on waiting 20-30 mins for a table.
author: Yasi N.

description: I was driving around San Fran on holiday and my friend suggested trying some seafood since we were in the Bay Area .. Popped in at 1130 when they were just opened and there was already a crowd .. I ordered the clam chowder and as recommended by other yelpers and it was pretty good... My friends ordered the fish and chips and the fried clam roll and both were amazing as well... I ordered the small lobster roll and it was absolutely delish.. wouldn't mind coming back here again but the only thing is the parking in San Francisco is a nightmare !
author: FOong F.

description: Great seafood. Hard to decide what I like. I've had the lobster tail, the crab sandwich, clam chowder. Can't go wrong with any of these dishes.
author: Ed O.

description: Great seafood and location! I'm def coming back. I ordered the fish tacos which was more than enough food.
author: Des D.

description: The BEST $100 (including tip) we have ever spent on a meal... The Stuffed Artichoke is AMAZING! My husband and I split our meals so we both were able to try the 6oz. Dungeness roll as well as the 6oz. Lobster Roll, they were both Superb! Both meals came with fries, which we upgraded to Garlic fries, that was also a very wise choice. This was a filling meal. Our waitress BELLA was very attentive and kept our drinks filled. This is definitely our new favorite place to eat while visiting San Francisco.
author: Tiana H.

description:
Please, someone... anyone--I must find an invention that can teleport this restaurant to Cleveland, while also taking a piece of the ocean with it. It will be my life's work to figure this out. 

Why? Because I can't live without 1) that effing lobster roll and 2) the olive oil poached halibut. Fish lovers haven't quite lived until they've tried these things at Woodhouse Fish Co. 

I can honestly say I've only had a lobster roll maybe one or two other times in my life and they were bland and overly-coated in mayo (eww.) Not this bad-boy! Bread is very important in any sandwich and this place has nailed it with their roll. It's buttery, toasted and perfect. The lobster meat is sweet, fresh and delicately coated with mayo. It's one of the best things I've ever placed on my taste buds. And that halibut--light, flavorful, fresh and placed on pesto coucous. Now, I'm usually not a pesto fan, but I would be if every other pesto tasted like this! It was all topped with heirloom tomatoes in a vinaigrette and scarfed in literally minutes.  

Beyond all the delicious noms from the sea, their service was great! We called ahead and let them know we were on a pretty strict deadline. They were sure to serve us quickly and make suggestions as to which dishes would come out the quickest--awesome! 

Overall, this is not only a place that I'd want to go back to repeatedly this week alone, but one I'd want to visit every time I'm in San Francisco. Maybe Woodhouse Fish Company is the *real* San Francisco treat?
author: Cara L.

description:
Boston and San Francisco have the best seafood in the country.  Oh, and NOLA has amazing crawfish.  OK -- so that being said, the Woodhouse Fish Company has an amazing assortment of seafood for all of your seafood needs. :)  Tonight I ordered the fish and chips, although there were several other things on the menu (oysters on the half shell, crab melt, lobster roll) that will likely draw me into coming another time to check the rest out. 

Tonight happened to be a pretty rainy day (the first one in awhile), so it didn't appear that packed.  I can definitely see on a nicer day that you may have to wait awhile, and there is a cool (albeit small) waiting area in the front window there. 

Worth checking out, and the fish and chips were generous and tasty!
author: Mel G.

description:
No reservations in advance. 

Walk-ins only. They won't seat you until the entire party is present, but you can order drinks while you wait in their very small waiting area. 

Clam chowder was creamy, but lacked that seafood taste. Would have also loved it if it was chunkier with more clams, potatoes, etc. 

Crab Louie Salad. Love that they didn't soak it with dressing. 

Blue Point Oysters, fresh. 

Lobster Roll and Crab Roll were on point, the bread is nice and soft and buttery. Cheese on Crab Melt just hid the crab taste. All served with perfectly cooked and seasoned fries. 

Don't order the house chardonnay. Blech. Consider a glass of the Oyster Bay Sauvignon Blanc instead.
author: P. G.

description:
Came here with a friend on a Wednesday after work at about a quarter 'til 8.  No waiting for a party of 2.  Sweet.  The service was super friendly and attentive.  The food was even better!

We started off with half a dozen oysters.  They were fresh and served with the typical lemon wedges and a spicy cocktail sause.  Fresh and delish!

I ordered the lobster roll, and do not regret it!  There was no B.S. about this lobster roll, in other words, nothing but big chunks of lobster on a toasted roll, none of that filler garbage in this sandwich!  The sandwich is served with fries and a side of coleslaw.  You've gotta try it!

NO, this was NOT a date, but it would be a great place for a casual date.  This fish joint was casual, yet intimate.  

I'm a fan, and would definitely come back to try the other dishes that looked just as delicious as my lobster roll.  I'd just have to hold back from ordering the lobster roll again, or maybe I'll just order two entrées next time!
author: Matt S.

description:
My husband and I ordered the steamed mussels with garlic bread as an appetizer, split a Lobster roll and a bowl of New England clam chowder. Ended the night with strawberry shortcake. 

Highlights: the Lobster roll was expensive (28$ hey, we are budget conscious!) but packed with juicy *fresh* meat. Sauce was light... Bread was soooo soft and delicious. 

Steamed mussels!!! Mmmm!! Sauce was again, light but really flavorful. Garlic bread was way too buttery/seasoned to me but the hubs ate mine so he seemed happy with it. 

Clam chowder wasn't the most amazing in the world but it had a great flavor... Kind of like a caramelized onion taste. Needed a little salt so I kept eating it with the fries from the Lobster Roll. Delish :] 

Service was really good considering how packed the place was. Waters were always refilled before they got empty and dishes cleared to make room for all our food. We'll come again when in town!
author: Vix W.

description:
Crab Melt.  

If I could write a two word review, that would be it.  It was delicious and if I didn't mind looking like a sow in public, I would've gotten two.  The fries were forgettable and I wish they had more side options but I would go back for the crab melt for sure.  The hubby got crab cakes and they were two small, puny little things.  I kept urging him to get more and he kept telling me he was full.  I knew he was lying.  They were appetizer sized, not dinner size.  He said later they were weak and small so I'd skip those if you're really hungry and the salad was full of beets which he was not a fan of.
author: A. S.

description:
Cute place, with dollar oysters on Tuesdays! We ordered the lobster roll and the dungeness crab melt. I would say skip the crab melt unless you're a big fan of shredded crab (I personally prefer lump crabmeat). Definitely try the lobster roll if you're like me and enjoy trying different takes on the good ol' lobster roll. Not the best that I've had, but will surely give you your seafood fix. Fries were delish!

Very well lit, and cute Cape Cod-like decor with lots of natural light. My friend and I got there at around 6:00 PM on Tuesday and had to wait about 10 minutes to be seated at the bar. I would recommend bar seating if there's only 2-3 of you, as the counter was pretty spacious.
author: Christina T.

description:
My bff and I weren't very hungry when we were milling about Fillmore Street after catching a flick at the Kabuki, but by the time we were seated, we ate ourselves stupid and enjoyed every bite.

Based on the overwhelming consensus of Foursquare tips, I ordered the lobster roll.  Sure, the lobster was fresh, but the "chips" and buttery bread stole the show (mmm...death by carbs...).  My friend ordered the cioppino, which was a smorgasbord of various seafood items marinating in a heaping dish of sauce you will have wished you brought a baguette to soak up.

"I'll have a bite if you want to try the bread pudding," she says.

(Time elapses)

"You better start eating because I could order one and finish it on my own."

The service was very attentive and efficient.  Our server (Patrick) was a good sport about keeping our glasses full, and when we (I) told him he looks like Darren from WKUK.  I think I drank water as though I were preparing for/recovering from a drought.
author: Jenn C.

description:
Anchor Steam $5.50
BIG plus for carrying Ranger IPA  $5.50
2 pc fish and chips $11
3 pc fish and chips $14

The only time I've had fish and chips is at a Giants game or my ghetto processed fish sticks and French fries.  They weren't the greatest so you can imagine my reluctance when my friend recommended this place.  

All I can say is WOW! They used fresh cod and the beer batter was phenomenal.  I thought it was going to be doughy or too crunchy but it was the perfect balance.  I say get the 3pc unless you're a wimp like my dinner companion who couldn't finish her 2pc!  

Lightly doused with malt vinegar and you've got a winner.

Their "chips" were actually French fries and not the traditional chips you would fine in English fish and chips.

Service was efficient and our server checked in on us frequently but not pushy or annoying.

It can get pretty loud but not deafening.   $45 with tax and tip.
author: Sun T.

description: Oh em geee this place is good! I ha the cippino and I was literally liking my fingers. So good!
author: Nita C.

description:
So despite the fact that my bf got food poisoning from the oysters, I am still giving this place 4 stars...I figure seafood is always a little iffy, plus I've been here twice and enjoyed the experience both times and I like to support small local places. Because they don't take reservations I've heard the wait can be long, but we didn't wait more than 10mins either time. Lots of 2 person tables, so not necessarily recommended for a group.

Service was quick and water refilled sufficiently. Menu selections aren't extensive, but there always seem to be a few specials offered. Note: wine & beer only, but love the few selections they have. Food is a solid 4 stars - nothing too special or seasoned out of this world, but good quality. Fish tacos were deep fried, which I wasn't expecting, but tasty nonetheless. Fish & chips were a tad bland, but fries were addictive. Last time I got the whole fish, which was full of bones and a bit difficult to eat but worth it. 

Definitely love that it's a bit off the beaten path so doesn't attract the tourist crowd. Small and friendly atmosphere, and best of all not overpriced for seafood. Will likely come back to try again.
author: Natalie H.

description:
Went there with my bf on my moody day, and this place was so good that it even made me happy in a snap!
When we got there, we had to wait for about 10 mins to be seated. 
We had a clam chowder; well, given that I was living in New England, being fed by New England clam chowder at my school canteen for ages, I can't really say it was my fav but it was not too bad tho.
We also ordered crab cakes, which were averagely fab, but still not the best I've had.
HOWEVER, their fish and chips were the highlight of the night. The batter was perfectly seasoned. The fish was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Chips were great, fresh tasting. 
And all the food had a big portion. My bf and I shared all three of them, and going home, stuffed.
author: Joelle K.

description:
Great local find! Party if six and we tried just about everything on the menu. Started with BBQ oysters then moved to the stuffed artichokes. For the main courses, we had the fish tacos, crab cakes, lobster roll, 1/2 crab and everybody loved it. 

My only suggestion is to use fresh shrimp on the chotes..... The crab on it was great... Always go fresh!!

Highly suggest for all yelpers!
author: Bob P.

description: Came here with the bf on his day off to try the happy hour oysters. They were definitely a hit! We were looking at the menu to see what else we would want to try, but nothing really stood out and the prices made the menu even more unappetizing. It was about 3:30 in the afternoon and pretty much the surrounding tables around us were only there for the $1 oysters as well although a few split the lobster roll. It would be great if they had more happy hour items, which I'd be willing to return and try because I really love the neighborhood they're in.
author: Bonnie S.

description:
Saturday Date Night: April 9, 2011 at 4:55 PM

4:55 PM:  
Arrived at Woodhouse Fish Company. Found it empty except for mom and daughter having an early dinner.  Server asked to us to sit anywhere we wanted. Fiance took a seat by the window overlooking the bustling Fillmore Street. Got our water and drinks (bubbly water) few minutes as soon as we sat down.

5:10 PM: 
All of the sudden the restaurant got jam-packed! People were being asked to wait 10 minutes and put their names of the list, go window-shopping first the come back.

5:15 PM: (APPETIZER)
We got our appetizer of ROCK SHRIMP CROQUETTES W/ POLENTA CAKE.  Delish! The polenta was the smoothest I've had. The croquettes were crispy on the outside and nice with big pieces of rock shrimp on the inside. This was a main dish but we decided to share as an appetizer. ($17) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PFk6k_hEGG0n6_FAJSm9EQ?select=TWm_7KaoUhvuH7CFSLq7cg

5:15 pm, 5:30 PM, 5:45 PM.....(DECOR)
Admired the decor. Woodhouse is nautical: huge fish art pieces are suspended on the walls such as a giant blue marlin and giant squid with long tentacles. Model toy boats line the shelves. A rustic bar is at the far end of the restaurant. The ceiling is ornate and high.  The whole place has a whole rustic fishmarket feel to it. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PFk6k_hEGG0n6_FAJSm9EQ?select=zj0taFfcjrtCzB70k8d-MA http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PFk6k_hEGG0n6_FAJSm9EQ?select=cqh_hhQPo-KJvXGWD6_7hQ

Still no food after almost an hour. We amused ourselves by taking pictures of one another.  Fried food started to come out. We were the very first ones there but we still haven't gotten our  food along with others. We wondered if the chef was late for work today.

6:00 PM: (MAIN)
An hour later and fiance was suffering from hunger pangs. Our food finally came out;

ARTICHOKES STUFFED WITH CRABMEAT AND SHRIMP W/ CROSTINI:  My guy really enjoyed his dish and labored through each artichoke leaf until he was rewarded with the artichoke heart. The shrimp and crab were very fresh.  ($18)http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PFk6k_hEGG0n6_FAJSm9EQ?select=_0daxx3EHx9PLBMrrQZK5g

CRAB CAKES ON GREENS: I enjoyed my crabcakes which were crispy on the outside; creamy and packed with crabmeat on the inside. Definitely a generous crabcake and not a fake one with nothing but fillers. The salad was refreshing and lightly dressed. ($12) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PFk6k_hEGG0n6_FAJSm9EQ?select=XZtfu5uNB1TJKdrv3E8EzQ

SAUTEED VEGGIES: Good choice! I didn't know that my guy ordered this. The sauteed green beans, carrots and broccoli in butter complimented our seafood dish. ($6)

6:35PM (SOCIAL SCENE/AMBIANCE)
Our friendly but busy server gave us our check. The restaurant was packed with people waiting. Some are with kids in stollers. This is a family-friendly and casual date place restaurant.

BOTTOMLINE: 3.5 Stars for food and unreasonalby long wait.
Charming neighborhood  seafood restaurant. Trustworthy place for fresh good quality seafood. The flavors are not multi-dimensional enough and would benefit from more spices but solid. 
Does not accept reservations. Prepare to wait or come early. Super-super slow service. 

TAB: $71 including bubbly H20, tax and 20% tip.

6:40 PM:
PIcked up our reserved ticket for "The Source Code." Then tried to  catch the tail-end of  Cherry Blossom Festival but it was over. Woodhouse made us miss it. Booo!!!!

6:50 PM:
Shared a BANANA ICE CREAM CREPE at Sophie's Crepes at the J-Town Mall.  I also bought mochis and onigiri at Kissako Tea to sneak in to the theater later.

7:20 PM:
Drink at Kabuki Bar and Bistro before the movie.

7:40 PM:
Watch "The  Source Code."  A movie about violence (not graphic) but ended on a beautiful note and friendships with strangers. A good movie!
author: Leah E.

description:
Again, I had listened to check please's review about this restaurant and I have always been curious about it.

It was fine, not as GREAT as the people on the show made it out to be, but it was good.

The thing that I wasn't fond of was our fish and chips; the cod was moist, but it was very oily and one set of our fries were also greasy. 

on the plus side, I loved their split-top lobster roll. It had that sweet lobster flavor, and not that fishy after taste. And my fries were nice and crispy. 

Also, the service was nice and quick. We got our waters and drinks within minutes; our food came out soon too. 

I would not mind to try this place again, maybe check out their other location.
author: Bahar A.

description:
What could possibly improve a day spent making ten different types of candy with a close friend?  Woodhouse Fish Company, I think!  

When you spend all day making candy you also spend all day eating -  er... sampling - candy.  By 9 p.m. the sugar is coursing through your blood and you're dying for some vegetables, some protein, and a chair to sit upon and rest your weary feet.  

NJ and I walked 6 blocks over to Fillmore and settled on Woodhouse after she told me it was a favorite of hers.  The place was hopping and the hostess told us it'd be a 15 minute wait but it was actually only 5 minutes before we got a couple of counter seats.  From there, we each got a Louie (crab for NJ, shrimp for me) and shared a basket of fries.  The Louies were simple and pretty perfect:  fresh seafood, iceberg letttuce, hard-boiled egg, grape tomatoes, and that rich Louie dressing that pulls it all together.  The Fries, though not as salty perfect as Slow Club fries (my personal standard of fry excellence) were a pretty delicious accompaniment and they stayed nice and crispy even as they cooled.    

We were in and out of there, had excellent service, and left fully satisfied.  I adored the simple ambience and was distracted in the best way possible by the "moving picture" (a framed film, if you will; how do I get one of those in my house)?!?

If I lived nearby, this place would be my go-to spot.  Woodhouse Fish Company, please bring your deliciosity to the North Bay!
author: Tracey A.

description:
One tip: get there early and avoid dinner times. It gets packed!

Its a great place with great food. Fresh oysters and good seafood, what more can you ask for? It is pricey and its a good place to meet up with friends. Beer selection isn't bad.

Would certainly come back.
author: Justin L.

description: I have been here twice before and had the lobster roll which was very good. I tried the cheddar crab melt sandwich today and should not have. The crab was mashed and mixed with mayo and an overpowering and very salty seasoning. You could barely taste the crab. Lightly dressed fresh crab on sourdough would be much better.
author: eileen m.

description:
Friendly wait staff recommended oyster, clam chowder and lobster roll which turned out to be really good.  We also had fish n chips but it was boring and bland.
We also wanted to try uni pasta but it was out, maybe next time...
author: Susie K.

description:
This restaurant is located in the hip Pacific Heights district and is easy to miss since it's tucked between a variety of other shops. When you walk-in, you feel a little bit like you walked into a nicer Long John's Silver. It has this harbor feel to the decorations (makes sense since it's a seafood joint lol). We came at 6pm on a Friday evening and wear seated promptly. I noticed on our way out though around 7:30pm that there was quite a wait so the timing of when you come by can be critical.  

We ordered the 3 oz. (or whatever the weight is of the smaller portion) split-top Maine lobster roll and the baja fish tacos.  The lobster roll tasted amazing. The lobster was chewy and flavorful. Combined with the buttery roll, it was a definite win on the palate. The lobster roll came with french fries and cole slaw.  The smaller portion was $18 (which is what we ordered) and the larger one was $23 or $25 (I don't quite recall). I felt it was a bit pricey for the sandwich, but I guess since it's lobster it does call for a higher price.  

THe baja fish tacos were delicious. The entree was served with three tacos and the tacos had avocado on them. They were perfectly crunchy and delicious. 

The service was great as the food came out extremely quickly.  They did not appear to rush us either when we were done since my friend and I were catching up.  

My only gripe on this place is that I was not full when I was done. It could just be that I was extremely hungry but i definitely could have eaten more even though we split both of the entrees (that should equal to 1 entree each). Maybe next time I'll just have to order the larger lobster roll. :P
author: Sabrina C.

description: Great find! Delicious from start to finish. The oysters were fresh and delicious. The crab and lobster rolls were totally worth the drive from San Jose. We will definitely visit again. Services was great as well. Very tentative and helpful!
author: Gloria V.

description: Insane wait time, mediocre food, crowded space, and extremely high prices. I was really disappointed based on the raving reviews for this place. There's way better places in the Bay Area to get the same food.
author: John D.

description: First time trying a lobster roll here and it was FAN-FREAKIN-TASTIC!!!! Honestly worth a try when you come here! I also shared the artichoke entree which had crab and shrimp inside it. It was bigger than I thought it was and I would recommend Sharing it with someone along with a couple of appetizers if ya want a full tummy! Such a great place to eat at if you're in the area!!! So glad I came here!
author: Mai S.

description:
Sweet baby Jesus! If you love seafood you need to come here.  The lobster sandwich is a must-try.  Its served cold with some sort of aoli, on warm garlic Texas toast.  This place is always packed but some how the service managed to be impeccable! My water glass was never half empty.  Unfortunately they don't take reservations, so I'd recommend putting your name down and walking to wine jar (less than a block away).  The hostess is super accommodating and if you call hell let you know where you are on the list.  

I will most definitely be back!
author: Angelica  C.

description:
Greasy Goodness!!! :)

Great lil place on busy Fillmore Street.  Loved the themed decor :)

I had their lobster roll or should I refer to it as heaven in a roll.  LOL...  So freaking yummy!!!!  Decided to go against the norm and ordered their onion rings.  Now with onion rings they are either good or bad.  They were guuuud :).  Service was excellent and they were on top of everything.

I will definitely be back!!!!
author: Rigs R.

description:
Saturday, 7:30PM.

Packed. Walk-ins only...doh!

Quickie: 
+Good food
+Receptive service
*Crammed layout

Constructive comments:
*Any sustainable practices? 
*Accompanying carbs for the soup

And then...?
Friendly staff. Salmon special was a good pick. Will have to try the cioppino next time. 

**********
Stuffed my face in:

1. Clam chowder
     +Not too heavy
     +Lotsa' clams
2. Salmon special
     +Nice flavor
     +Grilled touch: crunchy exterior, tender interior
author: Chuck N.

description: Amazing food and service. My favorite atmosphere too - not pretentious and down right delicious food. You have to have the cioppino and anything with Dungeness crab. The fish tacos were perfectly battered and cooked and don't even get me started on the special burrata salad - wow- simple food that is cooked so well it doesn't need fluff. This is my new go to in the city for excellent seafood.
author: Laura H.

description: This place was pretty good. Not out of this world but pretty good. Between our family of four, we ordered the fish and chips, the chowder, the lobster roll, and the linguini. The chowder was by far my favorite of the dishes and was some of the best I've had. The lobster roll was good but I've had better. The linguini was strange. The bacon was slightly overpowering. The fish and chips were... Well fish and chips. All in all it was a good dinner and I like the neighborhood. The staff was very friendly and the atmosphere was good.
author: Jordan M.

description: Very enjoyable counter-service dinner with a friend.  The food was fresh and well prepared.
author: John F.

description:
Hay when your restaurant is 90% crab, and you're out of effing crab, you should mention that at seating. You shouldn't wait to mention that till after drinks and appetizers are served. When you do that, I kinda feel like you just stole that $50 tab from me. I'd have loved to argue with you about it, but I had to haul ass to another crab place that actually had crab to save the evening. 

Will never be back. Will make sure everyone who asks me never comes here. Totally unacceptable.
author: Michael G.

description: Their Lobster Roll is absolutely delicious.  Even the fries were crunchy goodness.  I'd love to come back and try other dishes.
author: Rose A.

description:
I found this place while having breakfast next door and knew it would be a great place for me a some friend to eat that night when we met up.  I was happy not to be disappointed.  This place is definitely worth the wait you will probably endure unless something changes and the place suddenly loses popularity (which I don't see happening).

The Food 
Ceviche - great starter, perfect amount of jalapeno
Whole Roasted Fish - When done right (and theirs is) you really can't go wrong here. 
Crab roll - my buddy demolished this
Shrimp roll - his wife took this to town and she's not much for sea food.

I'm not sure what the bill was(I was a client being taken out for dinner) but it whatever it was - it was worth it.  This is the best non-fancy sea food I've found in SF.  Looking forward to coming back.
author: Adam R.

description:
Came here for fish&chips, which were serviceable, but judging by the reviews it seems I should have opted for the other dishes. Also, it seems there's two locations but this is for Fillmore St.

For the fish&chips the frying was done well and fish was nice, so definitely above average. However, either the batter or prep must not have been very good because the thing kept disintegrating into a thousand pieces every time I put my fork or knife into it. The bread and fish kept coming apart and dropping through my fries which was a bit frustrating to pick up and eat.

However, that aside everything else was great so a bump up to 4 stars. Service and hosting was great and the restaurant itself is small but nice. Limited but good alcohol selection. All the food was spot on for taste/seasoning. I'm definitely interested in coming back to try their other dishes as well.
author: Jae Y.

description:
Came here for lunch & ordered the artichoke with crab & shrimp. I waited for over 15 minutes, and my order still didn't arrive. When I asked the server, she said the dish takes 20 minutes to prepare. Now why wouldn't you tell customers that when they order?

Food finally came and it was good. Then I get the check:

$18 entree
$1.58 tax
$19.60 total

I have no idea where the extra $0.02 charge came from, and neither did the server. Rather than wait to find out, I figured I'd give them my $0.02 on Yelp. 

Diners beware - check you bill and make sure it adds up. It was only two pennies extra for me, but if they don't know how or why that's getting added to your bill, God knows how much folks are getting overcharged.
author: Jorge M.

description: Service is always on par with the best in the business. Came here with my sister on her first outing as a mom with oversized stroller. They were awesome and made us feel at home. The fish and chips made with Alaskan cod are the best and not too heavy. Ask for extra tartar sauce and try the crab cake if you have room. It's wine and beer only and the wine list is small, but what they have is more than adequate to compliment their delicious seafood. Lunch can be busy but if it's more than 2 in your party come during slower hours. Love the bar seats too, very cozy!
author: Mike P.

description: All right. But I probably wouldn't go again. It's the perfect place if you crave high quality seafood sandwiches and/or clam chowder soup and don't mind paying a lot for them. Service felt a little inadequate for such an expensive joint. Their decorations are neat. The place is pretty small but it feels welcoming with cool decorations. My party waited ~10min for lunch on Sunday. Overall, enjoyed the experience.
author: Jane C.

description:
Wow, Woodhouse Fish Co. blew my tastebuds away. I came here for lunch today and had to try the Maine lobster roll sandwich. It was a party in my mouth! The bread was super buttery and soft, with large chunks of lobster slaw in between. We also had the calamari and the iceberg lettuce, both of which were really great as well. The calamari was fresh, crunchy, chewy like how goo,calamari should be. 

Great atmosphere as well. The restaurant isn't too big, but it's in a nice corner location on Fillmore street and has a homey feel to it. Next time I'm back I'm getting the 6 oz lobster sandwich! It's just too delicious.
author: Bonnie S.

description: This is my second time going to Woodhouse Fish Co. and both times I've ordered the Lobster Rolls. If you want the memorable experience I highly suggest getting the larger portion of lobster meat. Sweet, big and succulent lobster dressed to perfection on top of a buttery split top bun. Squeeze some fresh lemon on top and your taste buds will go crazy. Comes with a side of crispy French fries and a very small cup of coleslaw. Both very yummy as well. I really want to try the crab roll next time I go. So if you are in the city and want to try a great roll go to this place!
author: Maggie R.

description:
Came here for the lobster roll and it did not disappoint. What did disappoint was the prawn cocktail starter, I make better ones at home! 

However, the lobster roll was simply so delicious I will definitely be coming back! Restaurant is tiny and cute, they do not take reservations but put your name day and grab a drink nearby!
author: Karolina K.

description:
I visited Woodhouse Fish Company on a Monday evening, around 7:00 and the place was mostly full.  The place as a casual feel to it, but the lighting is a little bit dim, so it seems "warmer?" or "comfy-er?"  

Anyway, I was hungry and knew what I wanted pretty quickly, and I ordered the crab melt ($12).  The food came out pretty quickly and each half of the sandwich was about the size of my fist.  For a crab "melt," I expected this to be a hot, or at least warm sandwich, but it was actually cool/room temperature, which was a surprise (and not a happy surprise).  Whatever, it still tasted decent.  The fries were pretty standard.  They are on the skinnier side, which I like.  It's also served with a small serving of coleslaw.  I usually don't really care for coleslaw, but I thought it was okay.

The service was pretty friendly and helpful.  Waters were refilled regularly and the whole experience was pleasant.  So while the crab melt was just so-so, I would consider trying out other dishes and  I can see why Woodhouse is well-liked.  The prices are fair and the service is good.  

Note:
-They use the short ketchup bottles.  The ketchup comes out pretty easily and pretty quick.  My friend learned this the hard way, as half of the ketchup, ended up on the table.
author: Samantha L.

description:
BEST LOBSTER ROLL. EVERRRR.
This 5 star review is given strictly for the lobster roll...since it's the only thing I tried here.
I wish I had ordered the 6 oz (it looked like SO much lobster) but have to admit the 3 oz was the perfect portion size as I was able to fit in dessert too!
The lobster is very fresh and the dressing is not overwhelming. The bread is extremely delicious!
This location also seems larger / nicer than the other location (based on reviews).
We came on a weeknight around 6:30 and did not have to wait. By the time we left there was a line up and it kept growing and growing!
author: Julie P.

description: Had the crab melt with fries. A few things really stood out. The presentation the bread and the crab. The bread is a perfect pocket for the cheese and crab. The sandwich stares at you, overflowing with cheese and crab. It's cut from a loaf but not all the way through so it holds everything in together. The crab was fantastic. Sometimes they put to much mayo or aioli on these things but that wasn't the case here. It was wet but not too wet and had just the right amount of heat. The fries are average but the melt was fantastic. Can't wait to try other menu items.
author: Nate S.

description:
Definitely a favorite. We usually get lucky and don't have to wait too long for a table. Service is timely. Food is awesome.

If it's your first time, I would recommend the lobster roll (smaller size). It's good enough to share with someone if you want to order appetizers or other things to get a taste of everything. Clam chowder, fried ipswich clams, whole dungenness crab, oysters, get it all! Everything is so good.
author: Stine H.

description:
I've been here 4 times and this place has yet to disappoint.  

The first time and second time we had one of their fish specials which is a whole fish with seasonal sides. 

The clam chowder is rich and creamy and oh so yum.

I've also tried their lobster roll. It has a good amount of lobster and the bread is irresistibly chewy, soft and perfect. A 1/2 order is very filling. 

Today I tried the fish and chips. Let's just say I wish I ordered the crab melt instead. The fish batter consumes the fish and even for a person who loves fried batter, I was peeling off the batter.

Despite a bad choice today I will be returning soon to try the crab melt. 

I love the $1 oyster Tuesdays and it always seems to be the Miyagi oysters that usually sell for $3 a piece.
author: Ella W.

description:
I come here all the time and crave it all the time. Fish and chips and lobster rolls are some of my favorite dishes, and they do it quite well here. Most important thing is the freshness of the seafood, and while it probably isn't sushi quality, it's definitely delicious. Love the seasoning for the lobsterr rolls, and the buns are perfectly buttery complement. Fish and chips -- sometimes they don't do the batter perfectly (overcooked), but overall delicious.

Service is friendly and prompt considering the popularity of the place.

Would recommend it for all who enjoy the type of dishes they serve here.
author: Lars B.

description: Stopped in for lunch and noticed my favorite... Lobster rolls. East coast has the best but their lobster roll was very close. Bread used on the roll was terrific.
author: Aron S.

description: Don't come here unless you are Caucasian. We got skipped several times and the tall bald hostess couldn't give me an answer as to why.  Take your business elsewhere. Multiple guests approached me outside and warned me of the food not tasting good. We were quoted 20 minutes but an hour went by as we kept getting skipped for parties of 3. Which is understandable till we he came out and asked us if we were waiting for a table and answered no himself and offered our table up to another couple. I'm convinced I just was not the right color.
author: Vance K.

description: All I can say is the Lobster roll is oh-so delicious!!! Big chunks of lobster on a warm buttery roll served with a side of fries and coleslaw. A little pricey but definitely worth it! I usually phone my order to-go with no disappointments. The parking is a pain, but it's ok since it's worth it!
author: Anna P.

description:
Friendly staff, good oysters, next to Fraishe...all good
The place does a hell of a business too.

The bad...parking, no reservations, and a little pricey.  I know its lobster, but $18 for a little lobster roll? When you don't come to the shoe pavilion, you pay too much.
author: Chelsey G.

description: I wanted a lobster roll and we couldn't get over to Burlingame (New England lobster co.) so found this place and went here instead. It was good enough. Much better if u add the squeeze of lemon, some black pepper, and a little sriracha. Fries were the best!
author: M S.

description:
The food was good. The service was OK. The wait was LONG. Be warned, MAKE A RESERVATION. If you really truly want to eat here at any time that you think other people like to eat, you know lunch, dinner, dluncher (that's a word...), etc you will want one. This place is tiny and gets packed quickly. 

When we finally got seated we got put in a corner. Never put baby in the corner and by that I mean it's that dreaded seat where waiters don't naturally walk past on there own. They have to intentionally stop by so things like water refills or new beers get neglected. Besides that little downer the food was really tasty. I had the stuffed artichoke which was really good. I was expecting the crab and shrimp to be heated up but they were cold. No problem though the artichoke was warm, well seasoned and came with a very tasty dipping sauce. My friend got the lobster roll which came with fries. Also very tasty. We shared everything and left feeling full and happy...although not buzzed because I never did get that second beer.
author: Brittany N.

description: Deliciously delicious!!! We waited an hour to get in. And it was worth the wait. The food was fresh. The wine was chilled. And the service was fabulous.
