We had the oysters...fresh, sweet, and mouth watering. We had the brazino, the crab stuffed artichoke, the crab sandwich, and the the lobster roll. Every single morsel was fantastic. As good as it gets.
author: Michelle I.

description: Finding a parking space in this area was not easy. But food here really paid off for the time we used to find the parking. We had Fried Whole-belly Ipswich Clams, Calamari, Split-top Maine Lobster Roll and Manhattan Clam Chowder. And the taste was so good! We're not local people. If you are in SF for vacation and like this type of food, this place is recommended.
author: Tri L.

description: Update from my last review here. I saw a rat (not a mouse) run full length of the restaurant on the upholstered back part of the bench that stretches the size of the restaurant and hurry into a hole.
author: Bridget L.

description:
I've been here twice, once with a friend and once with my mother, and both times have been pleasant. Oh man, I have yet to try the lobster roll but what I've ordered so far has been excellent. The ambience is very relaxed, although the place is small you never feel crowded. And the service is excellent, a little slow at times but not unbearable.

The crispy calamari is so good, breading is nice and light and I prefer the cocktail sauce over the creamy sauce but both are still good. 

I've had both the New England and Hartford style clam chowder, both are excellent and although I like my chowders a little on the brothy side, I'll take it either way. Hartford style was a little on the salty side.

As for entrees I've had both the fish and chips, and the soft shell crab BLT. I love me some fish and chips but OH MAN, the soft shell crab with the heirloom tomato, bacon, and micro greens, I could keep ordering that! So when it's in season I suggest you do so. And this is just my own preference, Crispy ShoeString Fries. How great!!! 

I am looking forward to finally ordering a lobster roll, and maybe a whole fish.
author: Matt M.

description:
I love this place. What's not to like? Delicious fish, Awesome lobster rolls. I've had problems with their oysters though. 

Also, the fries are thin cut and not thick cut. No big deal.
author: Alton Y.

description:
The food was great but I am getting sick of using my credit card to pay for a meal and finding out my tip was changed when I get my credit card statement.  I keep my receipts and I think a 20% tip was adequate but someone at Woodhouse jacked it up another  $6.00.  Come on people, I already gave you a good tip, don't be so greedy.
By the way, the server's name on the receipt was Jessie.  Don't know for sure if she is the one that changed it or not.
author: Marilee B.

description:
This was our first dining experience at Woodhouse Fish Company and we had a great time.  It took a little while for us to get seated but it was a little bit later on a Friday night so it went relatively fast.  Our waiter had a lot of energy and was fun and gave great recommendations.

We started sharing a bowl of the mix clam chowder which was really good along with the wedge salad.  For our main meals we had the lobster roll (highly recommended) and the halibut special (also delicious).  Fro dessert we had the sourdough bread pudding which was unlike other bread pudding I've had but all in a good way.

Overall great experience I just wish they took reservations :)
author: Blake B.

description:
Came here to get some crab because its crabbing season. Boi the crab was juicy n had a good amount of meat. Its close to perfect!!!!' 

+3 for crab
+1 for service 

= 4 stars

Keep the good work up!!
author: Josh M.

description:
We were craving seafood and came here on a whim during a recent visit to San Francisco -- Woodhouse did not disappoint!

The boyfriend and I shared a Cioppino, which was absolutely delicious and satisfying. It was packed full of mussels, clams, shrimps, crab legs and bite after bite of baby scallops in a chunky and hearty tomato broth -- really tasty. We also ordered a Clam Chowder and Dungeness Crab Cocktail. Both were pretty good and nothing out of the ordinary compared to other seafood joints. If I were to complain, I would say the Clam Chowder was a tad too creamy for my taste, but at least they didn't skimp on the clams. Also, the restaurant is quite small and narrow so I wouldn't suggest lugging an entire army full of your couple friends with babies + baby strollers to jam up the place (Yes, it happened).

In conclusion, get the Cioppino and leave your babies at home.
author: Jamie H.

description: OMG! The butter toasted Dungeness crab roll was amazing the crab was moist and not dry ....the roll was buttered to perfection! Not a long wait time and the price is reasonable! I would recommend this place to anyone that loves seafood "Boston" style!
author: Zakiya M.

description:
It was Friday, we didn't really want to cook, so we decided to try this place after a recommendation from a friend. Called the original one on Market and found out the wait would be 45 minutes, so I called the one on Fillmore and they said it would be about the same, but they would take my name down. That worked out perfectly because by the time we got there, we only had about a 10 minute wait. Everyone was exceptionally nice and the place was bumpin'. A nice casual seafood place with a good vibe and great food. 

Apparently I was in the mood for something fried. Got the calamari to start. Nice, lightly battered, delicate pieces of squid served with aioli and cocktail sauce with a wedge of lemon. A good start to the meal. And the trout slayer wheat beer. The can graphics looks like someone made it on their home computer circa 1990 with some clipart, but the beer was actually really good. For the entree, got the fish and chips. 3 tender pieces of Alaskan cod with shoestring fries. They weren't really shoestring fries, but everything was very good. Clam chowder was also pretty good. Creamy, but not too rich, chunky, good bits of clams. They offer Manhattan, New England and Hartford-style? Not sure what Hartford style is, may have to find out next time. 

EDIT: The power of Google tells me that Hartford style is a mix of New England and Manhattan: 3/4 New England with 1/4 of Manhattan spooned on top. Interesting. 

I liked this place, the server was awesome, and eating at the counter was a good experience. It doesn't face the kitchen, but you can kind of see it. 

Their specials like the garlic Dungeness crab looked excellent.
author: Saunders C.

description: They offer a healthy selection of oysters. They tasted really fresh and they were shucked really cleanly. It paired really well with the clam chowder and fries.
author: Thomas C.

description:
Wonderful casual ocean-themed decor. Panoramic mural of beach south if pigeon point on one wall and framed video scenes of fisherman on the other wall.

On our first visit we had the crab and lobster roll. Yummy!! It's like crab (or lobster) between to slabs of butter - no need for dipping sauce!! We will be back!!
author: Brad B.

description: Never been disappointed here. Come early, try the grilled oysters. Dipping that chipotle sauce with some bread is just amazing. Also, fish and chips are perfect - bring a good healthy appetite for something on the richer side. Arrive early, the place gets packed real quick!
author: Stefan S.

description:
They have 3 different kinds of oysters (depending on where they came from). Since my boyfriend is from the east coast, we ordered 6 of the fresh oysters from Connecticut. They were very fresh and the sauce they served with it is great! (Be aware of the "kick' - it's horseradish)

I ordered the Dungeness Pasta Primavera (4 thumbs up!)

BF ordered the Maine Lobster Roll (inhaled it pretty much) They aren't so generous on the fries, however.

Had a couple beers and a house chardonnay with the meal.

Wonderful date night.

The only ding is that they do not take reservations. So make sure you plan accordingly. This is not a place you come and expect to be seated soon because of its popularity there will be a line during dinner hour. 

Advice is to get there early or just make sure you strike up some conversation with some others in line who are from out of town. Check out the "Specials" menu too and try something new.
author: Elisha Y.

description: Awesome.  Food and service were amazing.  The crab roll was insane and the chowder some the best I had on our trip.  Very cool, intimate little joint.  A must visit.
author: C M.

description:
My fam and I were up the street at the hospital for a family member and we were all pretty starvin .. middle of the week .. after work .. you know .. 
Couple of the fam hit this place up earlier .. when it wasn't busy of course .. did the IG thing .. and yea those pics look hella good .. 
When we got there .. placed was packed and we had to bring food back up so .. to go it was ..
Didn't wait as long as I thought .. everything seemed fine .. except Unc (did I mention we walked there) came out to the waiting room saying he only has bread .. no crab .. (he got a crab roll as most of us got .. $13) .. yea .. I got calamari too ..
Um .. the Fam hyped it up .. but it was alright ... not holy crap this ish is the bomb (mind u we were starvin) .. and we did have leftovers.  We ordered enough food for 12 hungry adults 

Pros 
great location
easy to get to (although I took the fam on a pedestrian scenic route)
quality of food was good
Unc's cc was credited for his meal
speedy service

Cons
For $ a lil more crab .. little less filler
lil pricey
kind of small spot
not enough seating
author: A Marie D.

description: Delicious lobster rolls! Excellent Fish and Chips! Enjoyed the ambiance. Small, but worth the wait.
author: R B.

description:
This place is one of the best restaurants around the Bay Area for fresh lobster rolls. The Split-top Maine Lobster Roll is the way to go with large and delicious pieces of lobster nestled between perfectly buttered bread. If you're feeling a little more hungry than that, the Fried Whole-Belly Ipswich Clams and Steamed Shellfish are amazing. The Steam Shellfish has a garlic-ky broth thats topped with parsley and goes great with the garlic bread. The half dozen oysters are worth it if you're more of a raw oyster kind of person. I tried the fresh Shigoku but to be honest, I can't taste the difference with any oysters. 

Parking around the area could improve a bit but then again, this is San Francisco we're talking about. It's definitely a little more difficult but you'll end up finding great shops to walk by on the way to the restaurant. The wait can run up to an hour long but service makes up for it.
author: Helen P.

description: My friend sha came to visited SF and she asked me for the Lobster Roll when I asked what she wanna eat. I asked a lot of friend and some of them told me about this place. I read some review from Yelp and Google so I really want to order Lobster Roll. When I went to the restaurant this evening many people waited in line but it not take to long to wait just 15 mins. We all ordered 4  small Lobster roll, Fried whole-belly Ipswich Clams, Fresh Oyster and a cup of Clam Showder. We like Fried whole-belly lpswish Clams the best. Clam showder a bit tasteless, Fresh oyster are very very small. For the Lobster Roll I like it but for friend she cannot finish it.The bread of the roll is good frilled with butter but I think they need more flavor in lobster.  The price is higher than the price that show in Yelp and in the website. It is $21 for small and $35 for large so.... I'm not sure if they have different price for lunch and dinner.
author: Orange S.

description: Great food- Claire was the best server.  Was in a group of 8 and we all enjoyed the meal
author: David P.

description: The fish and chips are good i would like if they eould have more seasoning they are a bit plain and kind of oily... I cant have shell fish but i would say most ppl come here for the soups and lobster rolls so i am guessing they are good!
author: Nadia K.

description: The place gets packed and is a little crowded in terms of spacing for tables and such, but no biggie since it was just me and my friend.  I could still hear her talk over the hustle and bustle of everything else going on.  Anyway, just thinking about the food makes me drool.  Definitely get lobster roll!!!  If eating here weren't so heavy on my pockets, I'd make more trips just for the roll (but then again, the lobster roll is pricey everywhere!).
author: Jae W.

description:
This was the best place we ate at during our recent weekend in San Francisco.

I got the split top Maine lobster roll, 6oz.  Came w/ french fries & coleslaw. It cost $26, expensive, but seafood usually is.  The lobster was fresh & wasn't overpowered in any mayo based sauce.  My husband got the dungeness crab melt.  It was much more afforable, $12.  I had a bite and it was very tasty.  The wedge salad was very very good, $8. 

The place is small, clean, & has nice decor.
author: AnneMarie N.

description:
I ended up Woodhouse because of the great reviews from my fellow yelpers. It didn't disappoint, get the cioppino, oysters and lobster roll. 

Good stuff.
author: Angel S.

description:
Meh. Is exactly how I felt. Nice place to have a casual dinner, catch up with friends, but the beer battered cod was extremely oily. the fish was fresh and had a nice texture, the pieces were big, but the fries and the batter was just very greasy. 

Mussells and Clams were good, but they are hard to ruin if you start with fresh ingredients. Also the softshells crab BLT was exactly what it says, but there was hardly any greens or tomato inside. Salmon was overcooked, although I guess we could have specified we wanted it less done, by overcooked I mean dry and flaky, I do not eat my salmon pink inside. Also, I wish they had more options for dipping sauces like Hog Island, regular (but good and chunky) tartar sauce and ketschup just solidified this places mediocre dining experience. 

If everything was priced at around $7-12 that would be one thing but at $12-$22 I would expect better, even in the bourgeousie Fillmore.

I will say the staff is very friendly, although a little on the slow side for service/responsiveness.
author: Lily G.

description:
In the immortal words of Liz Lemon: "I want to go to there."

And why not? Tasty, tasty seafood, with a well rounded menu, delightfully delightful service, a huge plastic squid overhead, and a famous member of 30 Rock has voiced her affinity for the establishment. Go, eat -- "...go to there."

Caveat: small establishment with a constant huddle of folks in line on the weekends - and elbow space in the dining area is at a premium.
author: Darrell L.

description: Overpriced for what you're getting in my opinion, but the food was still pretty good and I enjoyed my meal. Probably won't go back.
author: Andy K.

description:
Good food, casual ambiance. The lobster roll is amazing and so is the stuffed artichoke (although the latter was tough/awkward to eat). 

Not the place to go with someone who doesnt' like seafood. We went with a group and 3 of 4 of us love seafood. The only person who didnt was planning to get some sort of chicken dish, as most seafood restaurants have. No such thing was on the menu.
author: Mina E.

description: Tiny restaurant but the seafood was on point. Ridiculous wait but was worth every bite. Excellent steamed littleneck clams, lobsta' roll and chowda'!  We have dined here twice and never disappointed!
author: Hue C.

description:
I can't believe it took me this long to find this place. For someone who went to Lukes Lobster in lower east side regularly, I had given up hope of finding a comparable lobster roll here on the west coast. Until this place. 

Lobster roll - so good. What you expect a lobster roll to taste like. 

Shrimp and avocado roll - so good too. Fresh bay shrimp, topped by a hearty half of an avocado. 

Clam chowder - so thick and hearty and chock full of clams

Overall, one of my favorite new finds in the Fillmore neighborhood. Definitely come here early to snag a seat! Cute ambiance too.
author: Stella L.

description:
The space is small, which can make for lengthy waits on busy nights, but the wait is worth it. I had the grilled archtichokes entree -- two halves of an artichoke, grilled and well-seasoned -- one half stuffed with crab meat (fresh, sans mayo or other heavy condiments!), the other with fresh shrimp, and searved with mixed greens and garlic bread. Relatively simple, yet the ingredients tasted very fresh and the artichoke was grilled perfectly. They also had a chalkboard menu with daily specials: two additional appetizers and three entrees that were not on the regular menu. Was tempted by the fresh grilled squid appetizer...!

My only complaint -- for the price of the entree ($18), I would have expected a little more crab and shrimp in the artichokes. But overall, great dish. Did not try anything else (although I did have a side of vegetable ratatouille, also good!), so looking forward to returning to try more on the menu.
author: Willow A.

description:
What can I say that hasn't been said about this place.

This place is awesome.  Forget about the haters writing bad reviews.  Run, don't walk to this restaurant.

We were there last Saturday with our baby.  Although the restaurant is quite small, they were able to accommodate us with the baby stroller, and for that I am grateful.  

As for the appetizers, the Clam Chowder is a must.  Real chunks of clam in every bite and thick as hell.  We also had the BBQ oysters and the Fried Ipswich clams.  The fried clams were absolutely delicious.

For the main course my wife and I shared the Ciopinno.  The size of the portion was pretty big, it came with 2 large pieces of garlic bread good for soaking that ciopinno sauce!  The Ciopinno was very spicy and garlicy, the seafood in it was very fresh.

We were too full to get dessert although the sourdough bread pudding looked really yummy.  

Overall, fantastic place, 2 thumbs up!

Some warning: this is NOT a good place for large parties and you will need to get there early if you don't want to wait.  But if you have to wait you can go check the cool Prana store next door.  Lastly, this place isn't cheap, the ciopinno was $29.00 but it was well worth it.
author: Kitai P.

description:
Ok, the crab cakes were decent, and the crab-roll sandwich was tasty, not exceptional.
The french-fries were overcooked.  The Rose' vino on the menu was bad.

I understand there was a 20m wait for a table on a Sat night but don't keep checking in with our table to get us outta here.

We MAY go back if we are in the neighborhood since the seafood was fresh.

RIP Nettie's Crab Shack.......we miss you.
author: M P.

description:
I tend to judge seafood restaurants based on how good the clam chowder and lobster rolls are. I didn't try the chowder but the lobster roll was uh-mazing. Big chunks of lobster with a really light sauce stuffed inside a lightly toasted buttery bread. So so good.

The service was also really great.

I'll definitely be back!
author: Christina K.

description:
Ever since I had my first Lobster roll at Morgans in Truckee, I've been itching to have another one. Making the assumption that San Francisco has better seafood than Truckee and, therefore, better lobster rolls, I decided to go to Woodhouse to try out their version.
My friend and I got there starving and immediately smelled the unmistakable aroma of clam chowder. After a lot of walking up and down the hills in SF, my mouth started to water. We had a seat at the bar, were greeted quickly enough, and promptly ordered the 6oz version of the lobster roll.
I also ordered the DIY Arnold palmer which comes with tea, a tart lemon mixture, and simple syrup. This was a cool and fun experiment. It took a while to get the combination I desired, but I felt pretty good about myself once I got it just right.
My first observation upon seeing our lobster roll was that the 6oz is obnoxious. The excess lobster easily falls off the side and I ended up taking some off the top. I don't have the biggest appetite, but would still recommend the 3oz variety for prospective customers. Anyway, there are two types of lobster on the 6oz roll. Chunky pieces of lobster and shredded lobster. I had never seen shredded lobster on a lobster roll until I came to Woodfish. My vision of a lobster roll based on what ive had in the past and pictures Ive seen have always been actual whole chunky pieces of lobster. Not little shredded pieces of lobster. And of course, therer was more of the shredded variety than there was the big pieces. Long story short, the shredded lobster, in my opinion, affected the taste of my lobster roll. I wonder if this only happens on the 6oz version as a way to get the roll to make weight. Either way, I was somewhat disappointed as the shredded variety lacked in taste.
Overall, I thought my lobster roll was okay. I thought the roll I had at Morgans all the way in Truckee was hands down much better than the 6 oz version at Woodhouse. That being said, the clam chowder here smelled so good that I would still come back to try it out.
author: Reggie W.

description: My go to place when craving oysters and lobster/crab roll(s).  Happy hour oysters are a must while you wait for your lobster or crab roll.  The portions seem small when you first see the plate, but with the sandwich, coleslaw and fries it's plenty for one person.  As mentioned in other reviews the vibe is pretty positive and the staff is welcoming.  I've been to both locations in SF and had great experiences at both.  The only drawback is the price for the sandwiches, but this is expected when it comes to seafood.
author: Jay G.

description:
We had to wait almost an hour here for a table for 5.  They do not take reservations so beware.  I would recommend coming here with a group of 2 or 4 at the most.  

The waiter was super energetic and was Really convincing, he got us to order their special squid ink risotto salad thing, which was good and interesting but not amazing.  I ordered the fish tacos, which was your basic grilled salmon (I prefer lightly battered) with pickled cabbage, aioli sauce, cilantro and lime.  I honestly didn't think it was anything spectacular, I expected a lot more from them..

We ordered two different oysters, one of was pretty briny, the other was more creamy but cost a premium of almost $3 each.  I've had better but these were quality oysters.  Although my friends said they had sand in theirs :/  

I thought the ambiance was pretty cool, with their nautical themes and posters/tv and the service was good, but overall I think the food was something left to be desired.
author: Kevin W.

description:
DELICIOUS CRAB!!!!
(4 stars)

Just one of those days where you pick a place not knowing a darn thing about and order off of the menu what looks good! 

- Food, delicious 
- Prices, depends what you get
- Service, good
- Ambiance, clean simple and small

Was in the neighborhood shopping at the boutiques and saw "crab" on the outside sign which brought me straight in. I was craving for crab to begin with so all worked well. when opening the menu, WOW, many great selections but needed to keep with what first brought me in. Sat at the bar counter and had me a great meal.

HEFFER-STYLE STATUS

RAW OYSTERS ($2 per piece) - Ordered 1 miyagi, 3 blue points, and 1 kamamoto. I'm starting to know my oysters well and know how each tastes. Blue points have been my favorites. The miyagi was good, has a stronger taste than blue points. the blue points are light and creamy tasting. And the size of the blue points here are good sized (i first ordered 1 but then ordered additional 2)!! The kamamoto was pretty good two but reminded me kind of like the miyagi. 

DUNGENESS CRAB ($12 for half/$21 for whole) - was keeping things a little light and ordered the half. The crab can be prepared 3 ways and i chose "cracked & steamed in white wine, lemon & garlic butter" as i called it, the works. My crab came after i finished all my oysters. I asked for a side of sliced bread so i can dip it in the broth of my crab. OMG. this was was SO good. My crab legs had meat on them (you know some places don't) and that broth was heavenly. In reality a half only gets you about 3 oz of meat, i wish i ordered the whole. At least i know for next time. And yes, dipping the sliced sour dough bread that i had asked for on the side was such a great compliment to this dish. oooohhhh ssssooo ggggoooooooooooooodddd.

OYSTER BAY SAUVIGON BLANC ($6 per glass) - i'm not into white wine but it pairs well with oysters more than red, in my opinon. i really enjoyed this white and got a good buzz off of it. a bottle at the stores is only $10, may need to go shopping. It had that crispy refreshing taste that didnt have a very dry after taste. in the liking!!!!

Will I be back? Definately. There were many things on the menu i wanted to try. 

JABA APPROVED ... until the next review.....
author: Jane A.

description:
$26 for a sandwich!

Sure it had loads of lobster, but that's some crazy markup! Lobster is about $3 a pound in Maine right now, add overnight shipping, + 100% profit and there is still no way that sandwich should be $26.

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PFk6k_hEGG0n6_FAJSm9EQ?select=mGnU5SCe_xKSGwCP-L1b6g

If I had never had amazing lobster rolls in the north east for under $6, maybe this wouldn't have hurt so bad (I didn't even pay but I still felt ripped off). But the taste doesn't justify the price. Sure it was good stuff but $26! No thanks. 

Sorry California, add lobster rolls to the long list of food we can't do as well (and/or at the same price) as the east coast.
author: Eli G.

description:
Good food. 

Very good service. 

Prices as expected for a trendy place.
author: Richard H.

description:
Had a dinner date at Woodhouse with my bf on a Thursday night. We got here around 6ish and after seeing a free table for two, being told twice that we would be seated "in A minute" and also seeing the host offer stool seats to a couple that came in after us, I was already a bit annoyed before we even got seated. By the time our table was ready, the host didn't even lead us to our seats and just kinda pointed to them and turned to tend to another customer. Thankfully our waitress was nice but for some reason, she mentioned that day's specials to everyone else but us. 

We ordered half a dozen oysters (blue point, kumamoto, miyagi), lobster roll and the crab cakes. All of the oysters were fresh and my favorite oyster was the kumamoto which was tiny but subtly briny. The blue point oyster didn't have enough flavor for me and the miyagi oyster packed a bit too much of briny flavor. The lobster roll was hardly impressive, not enough lobster meat which was overly shredded. However, the roll was good and so were the fries served alongside the roll. The crab cakes were encrusted with flavor, although they were smaller than I expected. I eventually felt a "good full" from the crab cakes as they were served with a salad tossed in a balsam vinaigrette. 

Overall, I'm sad that our initial service wasn't great, and that Woodhouse's seafood doesn't have me hooked.
author: Maya S.

description:
When I tried Woodhouse Fish Co. about a year ago I didn't think it was all that great... I think the food was a little ruined by my bf's negative attitude (he was complaining about parking and had a poor attitude throughout lunch). I went again with some girlfriends recently and we had a great time. It's really nice how you can have drinks while you wait. 

We ordered the tuna tartare, lobster roll, cioppino, fried clams (highly recommend it!), and stuffed artichokes. Yes... we kinda over ordered for 3 girls.

Everything was good but my favorite dishes were the tuna tartare (really fresh and delicious) and fried clams. I've had fried clams before and I never liked them. They were always small and basically all you taste is the fried batter. Woodhouse clams are different. They are whole clams deep fried. The are very tasty and juicy/meaty. I don't think anywhere else fries whole clams like them so I highly recommend giving them a try.
author: Karen L.

description:
This place is a great spot in lower pac heights. Right on Fillmore, lots of metered/street parking. Probably best go around 6ish so you don't have to wait for 

Ambiance: Definitely mixed crowd - young and old. Definitely lively. Place isn't too big for large groups but is ideal for either 2 or groups of 4. 

Service: Very attentive and friendly. The wait staff attended to our every needs:

Food: We had the $1 Oysters special (Every tuesday from 4pm-close they have $1 oysters!!!!!) Standard, on the smaller side, but hey they're a $1
Got the Toasted Buttered Dungeness Crab Roll - They have 2 sizes (3oz and 6oz crab meat). I would recommend just getting the 3oz unless you have  a big appetite). My partner got the stuffed artichoke with shrimp and crab. Now that was just as AMAZING.  Quite flavorful and perhaps even tastier than my sandwich. They also serve it with cheese bread. 

We also got a side of onion rings, which is always a good compliment to seafood but it's not necessary. 

They had two desserts, Strawberry Shortcake and Bread pudding but we were too stuff to try it! (plus we wanted to go get cupcakes at Sift up the street). 

Definitely would recommend coming here again.
author: Phillip D.

description: Loved, loved, loved the food. I just cant get enough. Ive been here multiple times and I will continue to come back here in the future.
author: reza n.

description:
It's always a solid choice if you're looking for fresh, well-done dungeness crab, but the rest of the menu has some misfires, like the shrimp stuffed artichokes. Sounds great in theory, but the artichokes never come out as roasted and rich as you'd like. And the shrimp and artichoke don't really gel together either.

Service can also be a bit spotty. Last time I was here, we waited 20 minutes to be seated while I counted at least 3-4 2-tops that were unoccupied.
author: Minjae L.

description: I had to go to CPMC yesterday for an infusion (12 hr turn around trip......thank you Kim!).  We went to dinner here once again afterward and had another great meal.  A few oysters (Point Reyes and they were on special for $1 each!!), a great, great appetizer of Grilled Squid with a watercress salad.  Kim had a crab and shrimp louie and I had an Alaskan salmon burger and of course the lemonade (served with lemon juice on ice and side little pitchers of simple syrup and soda water, so you can make it as you like, controlling the sweetness).  I love this place on Fillmore st, just 4 blocks from the hospital.
author: David G.

description:
one of THE best lobster rolls i've ever had. I think it's sitting #1 at the moment considering the places I've been to are only in the bay area. 

I came on a monday night after work and running a few errands. The wait was not bad at all! I think it was only a 15 minute wait for a table or two. 

Ordered
1. Fish tacos
2. lobster roll
3. cup of clam chowder. 

expect to get your hands dirty. they dont play out here. Fish tacos were hella good! better than them ones i got on my cruise in mexico. Lobster roll was fresh. a bit too much mayo but still got to enjoy that lobster. clam chowder was good as it is, not too heavy or anything. PERFECT! 

It was an AWESOME meal and i felt so satisfied at the end. I left with a smile and some lobster bits in my teeth. IDGAF!
author: Kenny L.

description: Terrible service even though food is good. Have been here twice, bad service is  consistent. It's not busy inside, so it seems more like attitude issue. Another branch around market street & church is way better at both food and service, I'm wondering how this could happen since both are branches from the exactly same restaurant.
author: Zhiyong X.

description: Terrible service! Terrible terrible terrible terrible terrible terrible terrible service!!!!!!!!!!!!! Don't wanna give tips for this kind of terrible service!
author: Lisa C.

description:
Must re write my bad review! Food was great and the bread pudding was the best! The oysters  were  fresh fresh fresh! Go early , Tuesday is $1 dollar oyster day.
So Good!
author: anne c.

description:
Good West Coast sea food joint. I think they try a bit too hard to do the East Coast thing - too much Maine lobster on the menu and NE Clam Chowder... I'm from New England originally, so that's not what I was looking for in SF - stick to the local stuff in my opinion.

Came here last night with 2 friends - 1 had the Dungeoness Crab Roll and one had the Fish and Chips. I had the Full (Large) Dungeoness Crab.

Everything was good, we had oysters to start as well - very fresh.
author: Sasha B.

description:
I came here on a Tuesday, their most popping night because on Tuesdays, they offer $1 oysters, the true San Francisco treat! And in honor of $1 oyster night, my co-diner and I went for the cheap and this is our review based on the few things you can get for the biggest bang possible.

The Food: We ordered about two dozen oysters ($24) and two chowders ($6 cup, $9 bowl). The oysters were pretty good, not amazing, but still taste pretty fresh and the accompanying sauce is really good -- it has just the right amount of spice in there. My New England clam chowder really made me sad. Yeah, I know, this place isn't exactly near Fisherman's Wharf, but every now and then, I like to be reminded that San Francisco is an awesome seafood hub, but this clam chowder just didn't do it for me. It wasn't creamy enough or savory enough, even though it had quite a bit of clams.

The Drink: We also ordered two glasses of house sauvignon blanc plus refills ($20). And now, maybe it's just because I came back from Napa a couple days before this visit, but this sauv blanc was just not good. It tasted like some $8 on-sale wine that you can get from Safeway. So if you're selling this to me at $5 per glass, I'm just going to say that my sophisticated palettes will be insulted. 

Tip: The oyster dining experience requires delicate hands and focus, so make sure you don't down too much alcohol too quickly . . . you may just end up squirting lemon juice in your eye as you're aiming it atop the oyster. Not the greatest sensation in the world -- I speak from experience.
author: Linna L.

description:
I went to this place on a whim to pass time before a movie started at Kabuki cinema right down the road. I ended up getting the Dungeness Crab roll with fries and it was amazing. Really friendly and prompt staff. At first glance you might think its a bit on the pricey side ($17.00) but the quality is well worth it. 

Next time I am in the city I am definitely going to check this place out!
author: Bernard D.

description:
Seated after 15 mins for a table for 2. 15 mins isn't bad at all since the restaurant was very busy and a number of people were in line for a table. 

Ordered half a dozen oysters, Clam chowder, Fish Taco and a Cioppino. The Cioppino was amazing! Made with heart! You could taste every ingredient used in the soup, especially the fresh clams. The bread accompanied with the Cioppino was crispy, flaky, and tasty. The fish was deep fried very well with a good amount of batter and not being oily at all. Honestly, I loved everything I ordered that night. Can't wait to go again, since some items were out by the time I got seated. 

Fast Service!
author: Sylvia C.

description:
This is on the short list, due to location, variety and reliability.  Love that you can either get a nice, fresh, light, healthy dinner here or really grub down until you can't walk.  Great wine selection and we've generally had really good to excellent service.    
I've found the portions to be substantial, though it looks like someone got unlucky and received smaller.  I usually find that  a shared app and entree and some oysters are plenty for me and my BF without us doing the "who can be nicer" dance to give up the last bite.
author: Maria C.

description: Oh my gosh this place is awesome! My husband and I shared the clam chowder for a starter. Then I ordered the cioppino which was spicy and full of seafood. It came with some sort of cheesy garlic bread that was super delicious. Hubby ordered the larger portioned Lobster Roll. Same size roll as the smaller option, buy waaaayyy more lobster stuffed into that chewy, soft roll. Definitely a must! And, on a side note, there are lots of good shopping choices super close by.
author: Ellen O.

description: Started with  the "Clam" POTATO chowder. If you like the taste of potatoes this is the Clam chowder for you! Next up was the so called main lobster sandwitch. The lobster was slathered in either Kraft brand mayo or some white sauce that has been sitting in the open air for the last three days. High price low quality. If you want to sit in a place that looks nice while u eat really low quality sea food this is your joint.
author: Tiger T.

description: Great place for a variety of seafood dishes. Parking in the area can be challenging as well as finding a seat in this place not unless you arrive early. If you haven't had a Lobster Roll, try one here you will not be disappointed. One of the many dishes that was delicious and impressible. Along with the Cioppino cooked in a rich tomato broth with pieces of soft bread to soak up any remaining sauce. The portions where plentiful and arrived hot and timely. As for the desert, avoid the strawberry shortcake nothing to write home about.  Overall the service was good and professional in meeting all our dining needs.
author: Kurt C.

description:
Another great seafood place I got to try while in SF this weekend. 

Garlic bread- Mmmmm.
Calamari- More tentacles please! So good! 
Crab cakes-Not bad, but not great. 
Whole roasted fish-THE BEST! 

Great little place. I would definitely visit again.
author: Bianca W.

description:
I felt the urge to write this review while my dining experience was still less than a few days old (rare for me!).

My brother bear took me here for a "snack" when my friend postponed my real dinner for the night by 2 hours, and I had to eat something.  With the prices here, this is not my normal idea of a snacking spot, unless you're there for just an oyster or two and a drink.  

Anyway, brother bear has always wanted to try this and is super spontaneous with food, and never really eats at the same place twice.  So, since he never intends to come back to Woodhouse Fish Company, naturally he orders a lobster roll (A freakin' +), a fried clam roll with full, pop in your mouth clams (A freakin' +), one kumamoto oyster for me (A-, since I'm still easing into oysters and am learning how I can gauge them!), and a clam chowder (B).  

BEST SNACK EVER!  Because I feel guilty if I eat a meal without any form of veggies or fruits, and enjoy the balance of some good things with fatty buttery, fried stuff, some arugula or thinly sliced tomatoes up in that shizz would have been nice.  Whateva, though!   Also, staff sat us right away at the bar and was super nice and fun with us.  Even if my brobro doesn't go back, I definitely would when I feel the urge to splurge on one of those rolls.
author: Nadia D.

description:
After months of stalking this place on yelp and yearning to try it, I finally made it out to Woodhouse Fish Company and it did not disappoint. 

Woodhouse more than earns its accolades. I really wanted to try the lobster roll. But I'm mayo-phobic so I, unwilling to compromise the quality of their esteemed lobster roll, opted for the crab roll instead. My friend, however, is mayonnaise friendly and he ordered the lobster roll. Both sandwiches looked incredible. My friend's was piled high with fresh lobster, which was surprisingly not drenched in mayo. He said it was amazing and devoured it in under 10 minutes. My crab roll was delicious. Lots of fresh Dungeness crab in a perfectly soft and buttery roll which was seared to a crispy perfection. It was oozing with crab juice. The fries were also great--not too greasy and light and crispy. 

We also had the sourdough bread pudding. It was ridiculously good. But it was also really heavy. We couldn't finish one between the two of us. 

My only regret about our meal is that the table next to us seemed to order a meal that was significantly more extravagant than ours and I was constantly looking over in envy. It was a family of four (2 small children with their parents) and I have never wanted to steal a child's plate of food more. The chowder the kids had looked (and smelled--yes, we were that close) amazing. The parents ordered steamed mussels, steamed clams, and cioppino. I was having a mental dilemma deciding whether or not we should head into dinner #2 and just order more food. And I know yelp is about reviewing your own food, but man their food looked GOOD. Giant clams and juicy mussels and cioppino stuffed with yummy seafood goodness. I know what my next meal at Woodhouse is going to be. 

High marks for attentive service and beyond fresh, amazing seafood. I wish parking was easier, but that's a small price to pay for the awesome food we got. Who would have thought that one of the better seafood restaurants in the city would be on Market and not on the water? Woodhouse was a great surprise and I cannot wait to return.
author: Michelle Q.

description: Shrimp and avocado roll isn't reviewed as much as the fish and chips or oysters, but it's amazing.  Highly recommended, filling and awesome.  Wish it was tad cheaper($15), but worth it.
author: Charlie E.

description: This place is really pretty good, but sadly my boyfriend spotted a live mouse run across the floor while we were there last Friday. Hard to return after that....
author: Aly M.

description: Clam chowder is among my favorite one compare to other places as it has the right salt and cream level. Lobster roll is good too. Cioppino is moderate only. Seated within 15 mins and able to find street parking on Sunday evening.
author: CH T.

description:
When you see a 4 star rating amongst 900 something reviews, you know that place is good! I've been here twice: once with my family and once with my boyfriend. 

My first visit was a little less than a year ago. It was crowded around 3 PM and my uncle, who was from another country, was first put off by the plain appearance of the place, but finally realized why this place was so popular. He especially loved the calamari, and this was the first time I tried the lobster roll. It starts at $18 ($26 for more of that lobstery goodness), but it was definitely worth every bite: the bread was perfectly toasted and buttered, and the lobster was warm and had a creamy taste to it. A bit pricier than what I'm used to, but you get what you pay for. A great representation of the seafood here in SF rather than those tourist traps that sell clam chowder for $10. 5/5

My second visit was on 6/22/13 around 4 PM. We had just arrived before the dinner rush so we assumed we would be able to get in and out of there in 30-45 minutes. Welllll I was wrong. We ordered as soon as we were seated and 20 minutes passed by. Ok, I thought, that was bearable. Then passed another 30 minutes, and we saw the party of 5 next to us, which came in much later than us, receive all their food. When my lobster roll and my bf's crab cakes came out shortly after, it was barely even warm. I had already drank so much water in the waiting process that I was unable to really to enjoy my meal. It just really dampened my dining experience when I was served cold food. 3/5 

I will still come back to this place because their seafood is still delicious and fresh, but I really hope they step up their service and bring out dishes when they're done. No person should really have to wait an hour for two dishes during their off hours.
author: Kristi L.

description: Amazing amazing stuffed artichoke. perfectly charred stuffed with fresh crab and shrimp over a bed of beets and romaine. service was great. zach was great and very informative. thanks guys for an amazing dinner. will come again!
author: Ernesto M.

description:
We went here over the summer and had a great experience in the afternoon, really good crab roll and fish tacos.  I guess the best thing is to stick to the simple lunch-type stuff because we've come twice since for dinner and had pretty bad experiences.

The first time I would say the food was ok, and the second time a couple of weeks ago was outright bad.  We ordered brussels sprouts but they were out and offered to bring us mixed vegetables instead.  These were gross, drowned in garlicky oil that made them basically inedible.  It was nice of the waiter to take them off of our check since she could tell we didn't eat any of it.  The onion rings were fine, but they are onion rings so you can't really go wrong.  My dungeness crab pasta was also just ok, nothing exciting and also very oily and garlicky.  My husband's fish was dry and pretty tasteless, and my father-in-law's dungeness was also just ok and really overly garlicky too.  

All-in-all, we left pretty unhappy, and I wouldn't say it was cheap either for what we got.  I would save yourself this meal and go to one of the much better places on Fillmore or nearby Union Street.
author: Nicole D H.

description: Located in a cute neighborhood with amazing food! Very cozy atmosphere. We loved the clam chowder and toasted crab roll! Definitely the best place my friends and I visited in San Francisco!
author: Katelyn D.

description:
I've passed this restaurant many times while walking up or down Fillmore Street. My family and I finally had a chance to try it today for lunch.

With Labor Day holiday, I was expecting the place to already be crowded but I guess folks were having a late morning. My party of 4 was the 3rd to arrive (only two couples before us).

The waiter was flinting around the restaurant and as we entered, he went to fetch someone's take out order. Upon his return, he said we could take any table so we seated ourselves. The guy continued to flint around ignoring us so my sister got up to get the menus for us (strike 1).  We decided what we wanted and put in our order, most regular items from the menu like simple sandwiches, soup, plate of crab cakes.

Now, I'm the type of person who takes in the entire dining experience (ambience, service and food). I noticed that the waiter told an Asian couple that came in after us that they couldn't sit in the curved section of the banquette because it was set for 3 people. Later a single middle-aged Caucasian man strolled in and sat in that same table for lunch. The server never said a word denying him that seat even when there were plenty of tables for 2 open. (strike 2)

Two in my party had chowder to start and two of us waited for our main dishes. And we waited and we waited. Other couples came in and sat down, ordered, and got their fried clams and chowders before we got our main dishes. In fact everyone, who came in and ordered after us, got their food before we did. What's the problem with that? Is this server clueless? How much complexity is it to serve up a crab melt, a clam sandwich and a plate with 2 crab cakes??? I put the blame on the server for bad timing. He didn't even say he was sorry for the delay (unlike most other decent establishments). In fact, I had to ASK "Where is our food???" The waiter than said, "Oh, I see it in the pick up area now." Like how long was it sitting there, huh??

About the food:
crab melt sandwich - at a little bigger than my fist, the crab sandwich was soft and tender in a lobster-type bread roll. This dish though is full of butter and I could feel it hardening my arteries so could only eat half of it.

crabcakes - my companion thought they were salty and asked for bread to eat to absorb some of the salt (salt intolerant beware!)

clam chowder - very rich and had flavor. Is this thickened with potatoes or starch? After having Sam's Chowder House's version last weekend, WFC's was somewhat disappointing.

fries - skinny fries that remind one of French pomme frites; good flavor and texture.

Overall, I would not come back to Woodhouse Fish Company in Pac Heights. The service was one of the worst I've experienced and the food was mediocre for the price. In the future,  I'll just walk on by.
author: Joanna T.

description:
I went with a group of four people on a Saturday night, and they said the wait would be an hour. We put our name down, left and walked around the neighborhood for about half an hour, and by the time, we returned, the restaurant was pretty empty. So there seems to be a fast turnaround time.

The food was okay. My cousin got the lobster roll, and that was pretty good, but the fries it came with seemed pretty plain. Her boyfriend ordered the special that had half a crab. We spent the entire dinner just watching him trying to tackle that thing. Too much work, not enough food, IMO. But he did say the sauce was amazing. I had the crab cakes, based on previous reviews of this place. They were meh....Seemed too "starchy" to me. 

Overall, an okay but forgettable meal.
author: Cheryl L.

description:
Friday around 1pm, took about 10 minutes to get seated. The place was pretty packed. Another party was waited to get seated before us. 

Ordered:
Clam chowder: flavorful and had good chunks of clam and potatoes
Kumamoto oysters: $3 each, but so fresh and delicious. One of the smoothest and creamiest oysters I've had
Lobster roll: I love love LOVED this. The lobster wasn't over drenched in sauce like in other places. The bread was perfectly toasted
Crab melt: tasted like a regular crab cake to me. Not spectacular but still delicious.

The staff was very friendly and attentive. I definitely would come back here for the service and food!
author: Sophia H.

description: Birthday vacation in San Francisco! We ate here for lunch and it was delicious. I had the lobster roll. It was full of so much lobster-y goodness I wanted to scream! Husband had the shrimp & avocado sandwich and he was equally impressed. Great coleslaw, great fries. We ate at pier 39 the day before which was a real letdown. The food couldn't and didn't even compare to this incredibly fresh and yummy meal. When I return to SF, I will definitely seek this place out again.
author: Lisa B.

description:
Ciappino crush. 

Since I discovered ciappino this past June, we've had a solid relationship. Originally I thought our love was specific to one restaurant down in Laguna Beach, upon searching for warm fuzzies in other, more convenient locations, I've found our love can stand some distance. Woodhouse Fish Company has a PHENOMENAL ciappino. 

Apparently this particular love is inheritable. My mom is a ciappino fiend, and since she was in town, we decided to rock the lobster bib together and try this place out. Service was impeccable, vibe was hip, and ciappino couldn't have been better. 

A few things to note: Woodhouse Fish Company doesn't take reservations, so I recommend either showing up at an unusual time, or accepting your bar stool fate. 

Great place!
author: Zoey S.

description:
Just went back up to San Francisco and had to stop by at a staple in the city.

Used to live a few blocks from Fillmore St and would seriously crave the food here. I've had the Lobster Roll, Crab Melt, and their Baja Fish Tacos - all of which were phenomenal. Their (always rotating) choice of oysters is always a great addition to any of the meals I've eaten here. 

Warn family owned atmosphere and great food make this a highly recommended choice in my book!
author: Ameesh M.

description:
Really great! I had the crab melt, lemonade, 1/2 dozen oysters and bread pudding.

All were incredibly delicious and the service was excellent. I kind of wish I knew ahead of time that the melt had a lot of parsley (it probably should have occurred to me) as I don't like cooked parsley (one of the few herbs I don't like) but it was still generally good. I must give them extra props for making good coleslaw... or I should say making coleslaw edible. I absolutely hate coleslaw usually and I really liked theirs. I liked that it wasn't heavy and a it had a bit of fruity sweetness. 

Oysters and lemonade were as good as they could be. They were great too.

Finally, the bread pudding. OH the bread pudding. Literally the best bread pudding I've ever had. I don't know if I've just had crappy bread pudding or something but theirs is amazing. It took a while to cook but it was worth the wait. The crust is nice and heartily hard and the bottom was sweet but not too sweet. It was in one of those ramekins (?)/clay pots so the inside was piping hot. They added a nice little dollup of cream and caramel. UGH I want to go back just for the pudding. YUM.

Overall, great experience!
author: Tina M.

description:
Love the ambiance! Nautical themed. 

Bar area is so cute. 

Split roll lobster sandwich is to die for and all the sandwiches sound really good. 

Quick tip: Get the large lobster sando, you won't regret it
author: Ari C.

description:
I honestly don't know what the hype is or why this place is always crowded. Maybe I've just been unlucky on what I've ordered??

The first time I came here, the fish I ordered was way too dry. The vegetables were also mediocre. When the best thing on the plate was the risotto cake, you know something's wrong. 

But I came back and gave them a second chance and again left disappointed. The PEI mussels for appetizer was minuscule. Granted there were a decent number of them, but the size of the belly was the smallest PEI's I've ever had! I ordered the scallops special for entree. The scallops themselves were ok, but the entire dish was covered in a thick layer of oil. For what reason? I have no idea. For an otherwise ok dish, that just made it super greasy and unappealing. 

Sorry, 2 strikes is an out for this place.
author: Katie D.

description:
Let me just say that I'm jealous of all the lobster roll pics that everyone else posted.  On a recent visit, my lobster roll looked nothing like that.  Maybe I'm spoiled, but I'm used to a lobster roll having good chunks of lobster meat within the roll. The lobster roll that I got was maybe 75% leg meat and 25% claw meat; I did not see any tail meat in mine.  For the $25+ you pay for, you'd think you'd get a pretty good ratio of meat.  Very disappointing.

The only upside were the crab salad and mussels and fries that we ordered to save the experience.  The crab to salad ratio was very generous IMO.  The mussel broth was rich and tasty.

All in all, I think I'll stick to the Market St location...or better yet, Old Port in RWC.
author: JeFF T.

description: Stumbled upon this place before the airport.  Great send off.  Lobster roll and chowder were great!  The atmosphere was very cute.  Service could have been better.
author: Morgan G.

description: Really delicious place! We tried the New England clam chowder and the large lobster tail roll. YUM! Glad we got to try something new. Service was great and workers were nice .
author: Kassie D.

description:
Host staff is unapologetically rude. Got here an hour and a half before desired seating time and tried to put my name on the wait-list. Was told by the guy there that I could not put our name on the list, but to call 15 minutes before my friends arrived and they would put me on the list then. 

When I called - a woman answered and told me over and over that they did not take names over the phone. When I explained that I had been there earlier and was told by the male host it was ok, she went all broken record on me and kept saying "no names over the phone" over and over without offering any help or other solutions.

Rushed back to the restaurant and was then told it would be a 1.5 hour wait. I again explained the situation and I had been there 45 prior and that I was doing my best to minimize wait time when my friends arrived. Hostess was rude and unhelpful, refusing to acknowledge that I had been told IN PERSON that I should call in.
author: Erin L.

description: I came here expecting they would have halibut since it is called woodhouse FISH co. I am Aleut and wanted somethig that fits my culture...anyways the artichoke was descent and the crab sandwich was good with a side of fries. Service was really good too!
author: Vincent G.

description: Extremely good food. Extremely good service. Extremely fair price. I was a bit leery of the "DIY Arnold Palmer" but it turned out to be the best Arnold Palmer of my life.  extremely extreme etc...
author: pat c.

description:
Came here with my BFF for lunch and we thoroughly enjoyed it. I got the two piece fish and chips and she got the lobster roll. We shared the calamari appetizer and she also got a cup of clam chowder.

The calamari was light and chewy, just how I like it. I hate tough and extremely hard/crispy calamari. Theirs was perfect. I haven't had too many fish and chips in my life, but this has to be my favorite one so far. Batter is super light and crispy and the cod was flaky and buttery. It was cooked perfectly. I only tried a bite of their lobster roll, and I couldnt really tell if I liked it from that one bite, but my friend seemed to enjoy it. 

The only reason I docked off one star was because their service was kind of lacking. My BFF and I came on a Friday for lunch and there were literally 2 parties there and one solo customer, so 3 parties total including us. The service was really slow. We had to ask for refills and flag them down for to go boxes and our bill. Oh, and there were 2 waiters there, so that couldve already been a one waiter to one table kind of thing, but it still sucked. The waitress also forgot to put in the order for my friend's clam chowder, so we had to remind her when we were more than halfway done with our food and after that, I saw her put it in the system, meaning she didn't put it in at all. Other than that, I would go back.
author: Faye M.

description:
Great quality food here, including the homemade sauces.

I don't recommend coming for the $1 oyster Tuesdays, because it attracts a noisy, rude and declasse crowd that ruins the dining experience. 

Plus while the oysters we had this week were very good, they were also very small, so it's no great bargain.

The Ipswich Clams we ordered were divine and perfectly fried, without any excess oil, and surprisingly the Crab Louie was a really good value. There was tons of crab on the salad, and it was definitely more tasty and interesting than your typical order of Crab Louie. 

The service was fast, good and friendly, though they should be pushier about telling the overly loud and rude patrons to pipe down.
author: Jacqueline A.

description: Discovered this place purely by accident and so pleased we did. Great casual dining. Excellent selection of delicious oysters, great clam chowder and loved the salmon special. Highly recommended.
author: Simon C.

description: Got the calamari and lobster roll. Both really fresh and delicious. Great seafood place
author: Tim D.

description: Best lobster roll in the Bay Area! Great service. Best time to go is lunch, not very busy service is best.
author: Zach H.

description: Not many good fish places that are reasonably priced in the city.  THis one isn't bad.
author: Edgar C.

description: Food n service was honestly really great. Gf and i shared 12 raw oysters, clam chowder, dungeness crab roll 6oz, and fish tacos. All were fantastic! Pricey but if youre in the area a def go to for seafood craving.
author: Leiani P.

description: The food here was delicious! I ordered the fish and chips and my wife got the bay shrimp and avocado roll sandwich. Both were stellar.
author: Joe F.

description: Cute place with awesome lobster rolls! I've tried at least 10 different places between Boston and New York, and I would say this is definitely comparably good. It's a bit more buttery and "fried" tasting than your traditional New England lobster rolls, but it is delicious none the less. For anyone who loves lobster rolls, this place is a must. My friends got the crab grilled cheese/sandwich or something of that sort and both regretted it deeply while drooling over my lobstah roll.
author: Lisa H.

description: This place is sooo cute. Decorated with a really neat fisherman style and, they play old black & white fisherman movies. Great..great customer service and the food is amazing!
author: Debra A.

description: Super cute restaurant. Decided to come here for dinner on a Monday night. We were greeted and seated promptly. Ordered the famous lobster roll. I got the 3 oz and I was full. The roll came with a generous amount of fries and a small side of coleslaw. The service was excellent and despite the screaming baby that night, it was a great experience. Will definitely be back.
author: Sandy W.

description:
came here for dinner.. service was great and my waiter is nice.. and like Kathryn mentioned couple of posts down, it seems like a casual restaurant..

me and my buddies ordered a dozen of oysters.. they had 3 different kinds of oysters to choose from which i forgot the names of.. and we have 4 of each so we can try them.. it was fresh and good..

i ordered the lobster roll.. it came with fries also.. i do recommend trying the lobster roll here if you haven't yet.. it is very good and meaty.. they sure didn't cheap out on it..

this place is pretty good and i like it... altho its on the pricey side.. i thought it was worth it..
author: Darren F.

description:
I liked this place but I can't say I loved it.
We had to try the Lobster roll (of course), and it was tasty but not amazing. Then I also tried the Crab Sammie. That was just ok... not as good as New England Lobster in Burlingame though. My friends liked the fries but I'm generally not a big fan of skinny fries. And the calamari was too greasy for me.. so all in all Woodhouse was just ok...
author: Natasha I.

description:
Small place and tables are very close to each other. Food is awesome

Oysters are fresh

Skip the louie salad with shrimp-wasn't that great at all. Too much dressing

Crab melt-small, but so yummy! Lots of crab and melted cheese

Steamed shellfish-clams! My fave dish. The clams were huge and they give you alot. Dip the sauce in bread! YUM YUM YUM!

Stuffed artichoke with crab and shrimp-huge and so good.

WIll come back to try more!
author: Karen H.

description: Food is good! Seafoods are fresh and taste good. I ordered Oyster and it was reallt fresh and cool. I like it :)
author: Erica Y.

description:
Solid lobster roll.  My one friend in NYC might complain that there is celery (i.e., filler) in the lobster roll but I didn't mind it.  My only complaint is that the lobster roll isn't very big.  

It's a small restaurant, so it's important to bring your patience on busy nights.
author: Larry L.

description: They have a great dollar oyster night on Tuesdays, which gets pretty crowded. If that's the case, it's pretty nice to just put your name in and grab a drink across the street while you wait. Just a really good casual seafood restaurant in general. Try the fish and chips.
author: Ron A.

description: The freshest, most delightful place to get a bowl of clam chowder, sourdough bread, and some fish and chips. A go-to for seafood in this neighborhood, or anywhere really.
author: Sarah V.

description:
Good service, but I wasn't especially impressed with the food. The lobster roll was generously filled with chunks of lobster, but it was missing the fatty indulgent element that my favorite rolls in Boston/Cambridge had. Not enough butter? Missing the something special in the mayo? (I usually hate mayo, btw, but it is so good in lobster rolls.) I wasn't expecting New England quality, but was a little surprised at what I got vs the rave reviews on Yelp.

Giving them the benefit of the doubt and rounding up to 4*. I still want to try the crab roll!

P.S. I got the "large" roll, but it wasn't very large. It was enough for me, but I wonder how small the smaller size could be? Tea sandwich size?
author: Rachel Y.

description:
Lobster Roll - Kind of bland not much taste to it.  Though the lobster pieces are huge!!

Clam Chowder (New England) - Yummy!  Cooked perfectly...not too thick

Octopus Salad - Octopus was good...didn't care much for all the other veggies on the plate

Crab Cakes - Very good...nicely cooked

The staff is friendly and attentive.  Street parking is a pain.  

I will definitely come back one day on a Tuesday to take advantage of their $1 oysters...let's see if they get another star for that...??
author: Patrick C.

description:
yummmm oysters. They were really good! Had the artichoke and they were good too and the portions were nice. 

Only problem I had was with the make your own lemon-aid. Cool concept except when you show up to a restaurant buzzed. I just threw it all in my glass and hoped the lemonaid tasted good. Half of it fell on the table in my drunken stupor.
author: daniel s.

description: I wasn't up for any experimenting for the evening so I ordered their fish and chips, they we the best fish and chips I've had since moving here (I've had a lot of Fish and Chips here.)  On my next visit I hope to try their clam chowder or lobster roll.
author: Brett D.

description: Good lobster roll and thin cut fries, but kind of expensive given that they only use claw and no tail meat. Cute, walkable, and slightly posh neighborhood.
author: Suzanna L.

description: Got their New England clam chowder and lobster roll. There was nothing amazing about the clam chowder and the portion size for what you pay for was a little disappointing. I couldn't tell if the lobster roll was good or not since it the lobster meat was cold. I am not a big fan of a cold meal unless it's sushi.
author: Patrick N.

description: Love. Love.  Had lunch with my boyfriend on Tuesday $1 oysters.  Got us 2 dozen and lobster and crab sandwich.  Awesome service and amazing food. What more can you ask for. Got there right before a line hit @ 12pm. Yum!
author: Tiffany P.

description:
4.5 stars!!

I ordered the fish n' chips & lobster roll. Both to-go on a Saturday afternoon. The fish n chips were EXCELLENT. (ordered the 3 piece) Piping hot. Crunchy breading. Moist fish. Lacked flavor, but the homemade tartar sauce made up for it. Fries were piping hot also. Just the right amount of crunch to potato to salt. The only thing wrong was the fish was a little greasy. 4 stars for the fish n' chips.

I wasn't able to taste the lobster roll until much later. It too, was excellent. Nothing but meat! I can only imagine what it tastes like when the buttered bread is freshly toasted contrasting against the cooler lobster n chives.  5 stars for the lobster roll.

Definitely going back. Again & again & again.
author: M P.

description:
After an unsuccessful brunch attempt at another restaurant (ain't nobody got time fo' a 45 minute wait when your parking meter only has an hour and fifteen minutes on it), a friend and I decided to Plan B it here for some fish and chips. Definitely not disappointed--the beer-battered cod fillets were perfectly crisp, flaky, and not too oily and the shoestring fries were plentiful. My friend claims they were the best fish and chips he's ever had. Kind of a skewed perspective since he barely leaves the Sacramento area, but I'll admit the dish was pretty darn good.

Service was also great--super attentive and friendly servers. We were also seated immediately, which further convinced us that we made the right choice in skipping brunch. Pricing may be a bit steep for a casual lunch if you order anything other than the fish and chips, but it's a seafood restaurant so it's to be expected.

Overall a good lunch choice if you happen to be in the area and don't want to endure the Sunday brunch time crunch.
author: Greg C.

description: It is a crowd pleaser for dinner.  I like the crab salad appetizer and usually get trout or one of the fresh fish items.  My boy likes the fried calamari.  I wouldn't call it clean or minimal in the preparation of the food, so I give it a slightly lower rating.  No reservations and it gets crowded with no real waiting area.  Works out for us when we eat extra early with my kid.
author: Neal M.

description:
A bit out of range for my student budget, but holy moly, it was worth coming here at least one time for the lobster and crab rolls.  They seem a little small at first, but when you devour it, afterward you realize that you're actually pretty full.  Anyway, the meat is so fresh and flavorful, the roll toasted and buttery, the fries crispy and nicely salted, and a little coleslaw on the side (note a huge fan of this stuff, but I did appreciate it that it wasn't drench in mayo like many are).

When I'm richer, I plan on making more trips to this little place.  A must for seafood lovers!
author: Can C.

description:
Kind of loud but this place is wonderful. I got a crab roll which also has the split top roll like the lobster roll. It was delicious. The difference between the rolls if you like both creatures is that the crab is served warm. I got the large and it wasn't that large, fyi. 

The calamari is great and not greasy. The cocktail sauce tasted like ketchup with a hint of horseradish though. 

All in all, I loved having lunch here especially as the elite cafe and spqr are not open for lunch.
author: Tracy Y.

description:
This place is busy, but luckily we only had a short wait. Staff is really friendly here. Casual atmosphere and of course, great seafood. The decor is simple yet cute with fishing knick knacks, a cool pop out wall poster, and a fishing documentary playing in a picture frame.

- Grilled Wild Salmon: good flavor, nice flakiness, beans and veggies good, vinaigrette was excellent 
- Lobster Roll: their signature dish that comes in 2 sizes. big chunks of lobster, slightly creamy, celery gave it a nice crunch, bread was hella good - buttery and toasted just right. fries were very crispy
author: Linda C.

description: Lobster roll is NOT where it's at, sadly. Costly mistake to make at a seafood restaurant. Ordered the large lobster roll, meat was waaaay overcooked - verging on inedible. But everything else on the menu is pretty delicious. Crab roll, fish and chips, chowder, etc...which is the reason for the four stars. Everything else on the menu is consistent and the wine list is pretty good.
author: Emily K.

description: Really crab cakes, really good crab and good sourdough bread pudding. Service is a little slow.
author: Tyler K.

description:
Classic date night: dinner and a movie.  We came to Woodhouse Fish Co. on recommendation from my coworker and we were quite impressed.  I ordered the crab louie and my husband ordered the cioppino  Both were delicious.  The crab on my salad was fresh and shell free and the seafood cioppino had perfectly cooked fish and such a flavorful broth.  I was also a fan of the nautical decor and theme, it was charming without being over the top.  

I cant give Woodhouse Fish Co. 5 stars because the bathroom is co-ed and I find that to be disgusting.  But, since we were heading to the movie theater just down the street afterward I was able to skip it all together.
author: L. B.

description:
Not only does this place have the best quality $1 oyster in town, other items on the menu were terrific and our server was so attentive and friendly. 

We ordered:
* 3 dozens of raw oysters
* Crab spaghetti
* Fish and chips
* Bottle of Syrah

This came out to around $45 each between 3 people. A very happy tummy went home that night. I can't wait 'till next Tuesday!
author: Cheryl C.

description: one of the best seafood places i have ever eaten at!!! i ordered the fried clam roll and it was perfect. i had other fried clams from other places and it was too much breading or too salty. i also ordered the 2 types of oysters and they were delicious. would definitely go back here.
author: Michelle D.

description:
Fresh seafood, friendly and attentive staff. 

The place is small and quaint but they are able to accompany larger parties if needed. I had their seasonal ahi tuna sandwich. It was like a combo styled sushi and bahi mi style sandwich. it was pretty tasty since it had some of my favorite ingredients: cilantro and pickled ginger, served on  buttered texas toast.  I took the bread pudding to go but I have not eaten it yet. I am quite particular about my bread pudding so I will keep you posted.
author: Tamika C.

description:
I took my BFF Lauren T. here last night for her Birthday dinner and absolutely love it. We indulged in a Main Lobster sandwich and the stuffed grilled artichoke. Both were bursting with flavor and while Lauren didn't quite enjoy the plethora of garlic they slathered on the artichoke I licked every bite of cheesy garlic I could find off that plate!! (do have a look at the pictures)

The atmosphere is upbeat, clean, and simple save for the flat screen TV playing clips of local fisherman claiming their catch off the Piers. The service was friendly and super attentive, my water glass never went empty which I really like. 

Our two entrees and two glasses of the Malbec ($6 each) came to about $55. Not too shabby for fresh mouthwatering seafood!!

p.s. they don't take reservations and they tend to get pretty busy Wed-Sat so go in, put your name on the list, and grab a cocktail or beer at Harry's down the street.
author: Kristy M.

description: Ah~ a taste of the East Coast... Moved from Boston where I ate fried whole belly clams at least once a month. Was super excited this place delivered through postmates, so ordered "Fried Whole-Belly Ipswich Clams" and "Toasted-Buttered Dungeness Crab Roll". Both were super yum! The tartar sauce was just right and the coleslaw NOT swimming in cheap mayonnaise -- two thumbs up! Gonna try the lobster roll next time.
author: cassy f.

description:
Yum. Great seafood.

Cioppino was good, a ton of food for one person. The cheesy bread that came with it was amazing with the broth. they even gave us extra because there was 4 of us and it came with 2. 

Stuffed artichokes. = Great option if you love artichokes. half is stuffed with shrimps, and the other with crab. The crab was my favorite because it was sweet and flavorful. Artichokes were good but a little too much for me. 

Lobster roll = If i came back, I would order this. Really good. They don't skimp on meat. 

Fried clam roll = big pieces of clam but I would rather get the lobster roll.


Service is really great too.
author: Erica L.

description:
When I travel to the Northern East Coast and visit places like Boston, Cape Cod or Maine, I have to stop by and have a lobster roll..........back in the SF, I heard that the Woodhouse Fish Co makes lobster rolls as good as if not better than the ones I could get in New England.

So last week, I stopped by to check out their hype.  My colleague and I walked in at Noon and got a great window seat.....The restaurant is decored like a quaint, small eatery that you would find somewhere on a Cape Cod Street.....very casual and relaxing. 

Upon seating we ordered two loster rolls that came with fries and cole slaw.

The rolls came out a few minutes later.........the bread came toasted and filled with a HUGE slab of lobster.........yummy, yummy and super yummy.  The lobster flavor was intense and the toasted buttered roll was super soft and tasty.

With the fries and slaw...the Boston lunch was outstanding!  Throw in the great people watching on Fillmore and you have a wonderful Cape Cod afternoon.
author: Raider J.

description:
Small restaurant with great food.  The line outside was long.  Our wait was approx 45 minutes.  But, there's lots of bars nearby so, that's ok!  Saturday night in the city - you're going to wait regardless! 
I believe all coastal town restaurants should have a good list of wild caught fish entrees.  This place only had one!  The rest were farmed.
But, the one I had (halibut) was fantastic!  Hartford chowder hit the spot too.  The prices were reasonable and the service was very good.
author: Jeff L.

description:
Enjoyed a very delicious weekday lunch here with an old friend.  Both of us ordered the New England clam chowder and I had the fish-and-chips and she had the lobster roll.  Both of us were quite satisfied with our meals.

The New England clam chowder ran a bit small for a cup at $6 a pop, but, that's city life I suppose.  It was very good though.  My fish and chips were excellent -- the fish was tender and flaky -- just the way I like it.

Service was friendly without being over-bearing.  A nice neighborhood spot or a low-key dining experience for those craving seafood.
author: Marcin M.

description:
ordered:
-lobster roll:pretty good

-dungeness roll: had a bite of my friend's after i tried mine and i must say the lobster roll is better.. 

both sandwiches were served with crispy thin fries and coleslaw

if you order both, make sure to eat the crab roll before the lobster roll
author: Raquel T.

description: A few months back I had a hungering for a lobster roll.. Three visits later, I keep coming back wanting seconds! I recently came in for dinner around 7pm, jam packed! I was greeted by their hostess and was given the option for a 10 minute wait, which is nothing, or to dine at the bar and be seated immediately. We went with bar, it's nice cozy and shouldn't be mistaken with a "bar atmosphere". My date and I enjoyed their great energy, and happy service. Not to mention the whole point of going, their lobster rolls!! They were perfectly portioned and paired with fries and coleslaw. We each got their smaller sized dish, and were so pleasantly full, we couldn't move. This is one place I always bring my guests from out of town. I cantwait to come back! Thanks guys, for the excellent food and service.
author: Wilma M.

description:
-- delicious fried clams; so fresh and tasty, better than the fried calamari

-- fish and chips were good; the fish was tender and melts in your mouth, whereas the fries were fried to perfection except a bit too salty.
author: Tina R.

description:
Not great and I wouldn't bother going back. I had the fish and chips, my partner had a fish gumbo type dish. The food was pretty solid, but bland. The prices were exorbitant! The two dishes + a single glass of wine was ~$53! I had a fantastic meal the next day somewhere else and for the same price we had delicious food and two glasses of wine... and service. 
The Woodhouse had pretty bad service and layout. The tables are cramped together and the waitstaff is young and inattentive. I saw more employees hanging out at the host station than servicing tables. A waitress took our orders then our bill, nothing else. We had to flag someone down for more water. We tipped decent, but I kinda wish we hadn't. Just like the meal... we paid for it, but I wished we hadn't.
author: Sara B.

description: This review is just for fish & chips, which are way too oily. It's too bad cause the fish itself it high quality with big flakes and the garlic fries are good. But the puddle of oil at the bottom that smothers the fries at the bottom is a little concerning. This has happened on two separate occasions.
author: Philip L.

description: Great lobster roll. The $18, 3oz. version is perfect if you aren't famished. Comes with fries, coleslaw, and just enough lobster meat to keep you full. The bread was outstanding. Almost like lobster wrapped up in buttery flavorful texas toast. Yum.
author: Jessie M.
