description: Had the Maine Lobster Roll and the Grilled Squid. Everything was amazing! The lobster was fresh and tasty. The fries were good, but some of the ends were too crunchy. Highly recommend this place!
author: JamieLynn S.

description:
Love the food here. The lobster roll here is so buttery and soft, fish and chips are good, and slaw is refreshing.

The service is friendly and atmosphere is clean and fun. What more could you ask for from a neighborhood restaurant? Oh yeah, we saw the dude from The Bachelor so there's that....
author: Calvin W.

description:
My friend was craving crab cakes, so I yelped *crab cakes* and Woodhouse Fish Company showed up with 4 stars! 

We decided to come here for dinner!

Surprisingly, we came here on a Tuesday and it was $1 oyster all night! We ordered 3 dozen raw oysters! 

We ordered the soft shell crab sandwich, lobster roll, shrimp pesto pasta, mussels, crab cakes, whole dungeoness crab and fish/chips. 

Everything was delicious, especially my soft shell crab sandwich.  The waiter stated the soft shell crab was in season and it would be the best time to order it.  It was on the special black board menu and I had to have it. It was $18 FYI!

The soft shell crab sandwich covered the bread roll because it was that huge and it came with a side of fries/coleslaw.

The lobster roll, a bit overated, but love the idea of CHUNKS of lobster meat in a bread roll.  It's a must try, but I will not be ordering it the next time I come back.  

The crab cakes came with 3 patties and it was yummm,. especially with the side of salad it came with.  Perfect appetizer!

The shrimp pesto pasta,. I believe it was huge prawns?! because the shrimp/prawn was huge!!! The pesto pasta was topped with pine nuts, YUM!   

The mussels were EH,. very original,. will not be ordering that next time.     

The WHOLE crab,. everyone was fighting over it.  I don't usually like crab since it takes to much work to eat.  One complaint was my friends stated it was missing the joints?! where was the meat?! I am assuming they take the joint piece off the crab and use it for the crab cakes!? Good, but overprices $24 for a whole crab!

FISH/CHIPS = a plate you can get anywhere. DON'T ORDER IT

Raw oysters,. they were good, did not have the fishy smell to it and went down smooth.  Even none oyster eaters loved it! 

The bill came out to be $44 a person including tip.  We had a party of 5 and they added 18% Gratuity on it !  Make sure you walk in and put your name down on the clip board,. there is a wait! 

I will be back,. especially with the great staff.  I couldn't find any flaws,. the waiters were so nice and patient,.especially when they were taking our orders

I FOUND THE $10 on the floor woOOHOoo FTW!
author: Chanel L.

description:
Finally! After wanting to come and check this place out for a while, I was able to have dinner there last night. No reservations accepted here but we arrived ~ 7pm and only waited for about 25 minutes. Not too bad for a Saturday.

I ordered the crab cakes (3 - I was hungry!) and salad. It was delicious. I loved the light sauce they put on the cakes. My husband ordered the artichoke dish which was also delish. It's more work as you have to get the leaves out, etc. but it was very light and yummy as well. I also had lemonade last night and I bring it up because the presentation was really cool: 1 glass with a lemon and long spoon. 1 craft with the bubbly water and then a smaller craft with the syrup. So you could sweeten/tart as much as you wanted. Very clever and refreshing!

My friends ordered clam chowder which looked amazing and the Halibut special which was presented really beautifully. We had some wine too - nothing overly special but the food and atmosphere was fun. I look forward to going back!
author: Isabel M. L.

description: The service was extremely slow. It took an hour to get our food. The fish and chips was uncooked. The batter inside of the fried fish was raw. This was our third time to come here and we were disappointed at this place.
author: EunJoo C.

description:
Haven't had a decent lobster roll in a while (been in Atlanta), so my tastes might  be a bit biased.  However, I thought the lobster roll here was delicious - fresh lobster meat, light on the mayo, and a perfectly toasted buttery bread.  Also, the fries that came with it was surprisingly delicious, which made this experience even better.

Service was good, as it was nothing spectacular or bad.  The new england clam chowder was just okay.  I was not a fan of the stuffed artichokes -- would not get these again either.  Stick with the lobster roll, and get yourself an Arnold Palmer with it.  You won't be disappointed.
author: Winston G.

description: Fish tacos and oysters were delicious!! The manager is awesome too - he was working just as hard if not harder than his wait staff. See recommend eating here
author: maggie p.

description:
This place is a win win for me-fresh tastey food, and walking distance to potentially great music. 

We came here before a show at the Fillmore and I devoured a stuffed artichoke that takes a little extra time on the grill but 100% worth it.

I love the clean decor, the picasso on the wall and polite service.

This was a great choice pre-show as well. Light and delicious and filling enough without leaving me wanting any more and still able to shake a tail feather.

Love love love this place
author: Mandy L.

description:
Great food, good portion for the lobster roll, even though price high but worth it, I hate the most ordering lobster roll when you get fat rolls and little lobster, not the case here...will go back again and try something else...

4 stars because little slow, but the food is great.
author: Linda J.

description: Phenomenal clam chowder and fish tacos. Ambience is great. Intimate but not intimidating. Friendly, fast service. Wish we had saved room for dessert!
author: Sara S.

description:
Great little seafood restaurant! One of its kind in the neighborhood. 
Their seafood Ciopponi is epic, best in the city and lobster sandwich is to die for, or i'll leave another day to eat more of it ;)
author: Azam K.

description:
Stumbled upon this resto when visiting my cat in the hospital nearby. My boyfriend and I were pleasantly surprised. It was so packed for a Thursday night, but we were seated pretty quickly even though every table was full. We ordered:

- dozen oysters: very fresh!
- arnold palmer: they let you mix it themselves, so you could control the amount of syrup and tea in it = perfect mix suited to your taste
- whole grilled fish: we're both trying to eat healthy so decided to opt for the grilled option, instead of the famed lobster rolls and fish and chips. We weren't disappointed! The fish was very tasty and very well cooked. 
- grilled sole: pan seared, then grilled, the sole wasn't bad, but not as good as the whole grilled fish!

Service was pretty quick and attentive, so was pleased all around with the whole experience. Will be back!
author: Emily C.

description: I have eaten here several times.  I have always had great service, delicious food and always a good experience.  Close to my house, convenient place to get my oyster and crab cake fix.
author: Nilu r.

description:
* service was good

* food was good
  * i had the lobster roll - bread was yummy, lobster was abundant. it needed a little more of something...relish? salt?  just a little more kick to provide a little more flavor without compromising the clean taste of the lobster roll, which i do appreciate
  * my husband had the crab melt - i liked it better than mine
  * we ordered a side of tartar for the fries... it was sooo good!  i will come back and order the fish + chips, just to have more of the tartar sauce!

* prices not bad

* tables were a bit close, but i suppose that is SF. it puts a damper on your experience when all you can hear is the couple next to you talking during your entire meal. note: my rating does not reflect this, since it's not the restaurants fault i was sat next to a loud couple
author: Tina F.

description:
I would be willing to move to SF just for their lobster rolls *eyes roll to back of head*.

This restaurant is tucked away, nicely decorated, with a great atmosphere.

The staff was extremely friendly and the food is amazingly good.

I love the bread that comes with their rolls. It's warm, buttery, and oh so good.

I am not a heavy eater (I barely make a dent in a Chipotle burrito), but when I went here I finished the entire thing. That says something.
I had the lobster roll, which came with fries and their slaw.
The boyfriend had a shrimp and avocado roll, which also came with fries and slaw.

Not only are their sandwiches great, but their sides are too.

The fries were nice and crisp, while the slaw was refreshing to help cut the butteriness of the bread.

Found this place purely by chance thanks to yelp. 

There are two locations and as usual in SF parking can get pretty fierce.

Happy Eatings! =]
author: Audrey L.

description:
Attention fish and chip lovers! This is the place. Excellently prepared. Flaky Alaskan cod coated an deep fried. The batter is crispy and doesn't fall off the cod when you bite into it. Comes with shoestring french fries. 

My husband ordered the 3 piece fish and chip choice. Two would have been fine with me. Hearty pieces. Order is cooked to order and comes hot to your table. 

I had the baja style fish tacos. 3 to an order. The flour tortilla was nice and crisp, and it's the same fish found in the fish & chips, except smaller in size. 

We both had a glass of wine, and finished with the sourdough bread pudding. Two huge squares topped with a scoop of whipped cream which we pushed to the side. Sat on a bed of caramel rum sauce. We should have asked for more sauce. Will do so if we order again. 

Service was good, and dishes cleared promptly. 

Total inc. tax & tip for two was $59.00. 

Come early to avoid waiting for a table.  We were seated promptly at 6pm, but by the time we left, the restaurant was 90% full.
author: Shirley N.

description:
This tiny little place is a hidden gem in the big city.
Fabulous decor of fishing paraphernalia and cool tile tile in the dining room it is the perfect spot for a nice meal for two.
The short beer list has the right stuff, and the menu is an eclectic collection of everything from sandwiches, tacos and Ciopino to the standard fish and chips.
Our calamari was beautifully prepared with just the right amount of crunch, tentacles and ALL--i love calamari done right.
My crab sandwich was an incredibly seasoned crab salad topped with cheddar and placed delicately in a slab of yummy split top toast. This sandwich was not huge, but perfectly portioned and so original!
Don was stunned by the stuffed artichoke...a lovely balance of crab and shrimp in a split artichoke that was perfectly cooked. Served on a nice salad and complemented by two delicious crusts of cheesy garlic bread, this meal was awesome.
My sandwich came with nicely done fries, and a tiny cup of coleslaw which was just the right amount of crunch and contrast to the crab.
Overall this place was FABULOUS. It's not for big crowds or crazy loud groups, it's very small and intimate.
The service was great, with the waitress anticipating refills and knowing when to check in...
I am very pleased, and can't wait to return.
author: suzanne d.

description: Wife and I ordered the crab roll. Was expecting it to be dressed or at least season. It was seemed boiled or streamed with really no flavor. Overal a pretty bland sandwich. People next to use for the lobster roll which looked to like it would have been a better choice.
author: Edward M.

description:
VERY VERY GOOD!!!! EVERYTHING WAS GOOD! 

My friend and I came on a Tuesday for their happy hour (or day) as they sell 1.00 oysters! Very very fresh with horse radish and cocktail sauce and lemon. We got about 2 dozen. Next we got a clam roll? Crunchy fried and decadent with fries and slaw which was also perfectly fried and salted. I got the stuffed artichoke with shrimp and crab which came with a salad with beets and garlic bread. It was amazing! all was amazing! The ambiance is superb. I've lived in SF all my life..and this is one of those places that make you feel sf cultural. Its decor reminds you of the pier with boats and water across the walls. Plastered upon these walls are pictures of sailors and a flat screen tv on a frame showing pictures of the bay and the pier. It is an absolute experience to be here and I'm probably coming back next week!!!
author: Jason W.

description: We had a fabulous dinner at Woodhouse! Our mother / daughter trip brought us to a variety of places and Yelp helped us find Woodhouse Fish Co. We had the crab, crab cakes and fish and chips! AMAZING! Thanks for making our trip special!
author: Victoria H.

description: Wow!!! I've had a lot of fish and chips and this is by far the best I've had!! Also had their calamari. So fresh and a great time getting to watch them batter it, fry it, and deliver it!
author: Tonya M.

description:
If you are looking for great fish and chips, this is the place.

If you are looking for a delicious lobster roll, this is the place.

And you can even make your own lemonade.
author: Lisa C.

description: This place is yummy! Amazing New England clam chowder, fresh salads, and very tasty oysters and mussels. Their french fries are also very fresh and crunchy! We will definitely be back!
author: mary g.

description:
Love this place, will definitely be back again!  This place is nicely decorated and I'd love to come back here again, but it would have to be dinner. Good eats - great location on Fillmore too!  

We ordered:
- Kumamoto oysters
- lobster roll and fries
- cioppino

If you eat oysters, you know Kumamotos are the bomb. Not a whole lot of explanation needed here. 

Lobster Roll had about 1/2lb of lobster in it - it was absolutely delicious and the fries were cooked to perfection!

My fave - and what I ordered - was the cioppino. Let me tell you, it had such great flavor!  Mussels, clams, crab, and shrimp in a tomato broth...not something I would ever really order but it came highly recommended and I'm glad I didn't pass it up!  It came with their yummy garlic bread too that I sometimes dipped in broth :-)

Will I go back again?  That's like asking - is there a mustache in Mexico?!?!  :)
author: Angelie A.

description:
I was so happily pleased with this place. 

It was right next to fraiche and I was really craving oysters.

This place has fresh oysters that are so delicious and mouth watering each time. I also ordered the clams and fries that were seasoned so beautifully with wine, butter, and garlic.  You can dip the fries in the juices of the clams and it makes you just crave more.  The price is a bit expensive but is worth it especially if you are craving seafood.
author: Kristina L.

description:
Came here for lunch today, on a sunny afternoon.

We had a cup of their New England Clam Chowder and their half New England half Hartford, I decided to switch it up by getting the half half which was so satisfying.

Also, had the half dozen Oysters which were on point!  

For the main course, we had the Dungeness Crab Melt and the Fried Ipswich Clam Roll. 
Both were very delicious, but the clam roll was my favorite it literally melted in my mouth after the first bite! 
The Crab melt was good as well, but the clam roll was definitely the winner of the two.
author: Rebecca C.

description: We walked a pretty decent distance to get here because of amazing pictures. Every step was well worth it. The lobster roll was one of the greatest things have ever eaten!
author: JAMES L.

description: This place always seems to have a line with people waiting to get in, so I was expecting it to be pretty amazing. I must say, the service was good and the food was good, but not great. This is a good place to go if you want fresh seafood, but other than that I didn't think it was anything exceptional.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Cute little establishment with a great $1 oyster HH. The Tomales bay oysters were incredibly briny, like someone has doused them with salt. Sort of weird vibe all around.
author: Sasha H.

description:
I got food to go and my fish and chips were still crispy upon reaching my final destination. It came packed with any condiment you could want...lemon, malt vinegar, tartar sauce, ketchup. I kind of wished they had asked what toppings I wanted rather than giving them all to me because half of them went to waste.

It was also a little salty, but I think that was my fault...
author: Jennifer P.

description:
I love the sea. I love its salty smell, its expansive tranquility, and the sound its waves make crashing against the shore. But most of all, I love its creatures... more specifically, the way they taste. 

Woodhouse Fish Company serves seafood up right, for a very reasonable price, in a no-frills East Coast-esque enviro -- from killer fish tacos, to salmon cheeseburgers, to raw oysters, lobster rolls, and crab melts (add avocado - they are generous!). I realize French fries don't come from the sea, but damned if they don't do those right, too.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Ordered the Maine lobster roll, which came with fries and a small cup of cole slaw on the side. The lobster on the sandwich was SO GOOD, as was the bread that it was stuffed into. There are two sizes you can get: 3 oz (small) and 6 oz (large)...this refers to the amount of lobster meat that goes into your sandwich. I got the 3 oz size, and it was the perfect amount of meat for the size of bread they give you. Btw, both the 3 oz and the 6 oz come with the same size piece of bread. Cost of 3 oz at time of writing: $18. Cost of 6 oz at time of writing: $26. The 3 oz was more than sufficient in satisfying my hunger!

We also tried the fish and chips...came with 2 pieces of fried fish (with tartar sauce), fries, and cole slaw. The batter on the fish is AMAAAAZING. It's one of the best I've ever tried, hands down.

Service here was great, parking was a beez (it's SF, so this was expected), restaurant was clean and comfortable. We came in on a Monday around 2 pm, and there was no wait.
author: Lily C.

description:
Walked to this place twice now... AMAZING SEA FOOD!
They also have a giant squid sculpture hanging inside the restaurant. With a grappling tentacle reaching out the top wndow out onto the street almost, as their sign!!!! I loved that part as you could guess! But the food is great! Crab was perfect! Cippino was excellent as well...
Deep fried smelt for finger food was awesome! Ended with homemade strawberry short cake!!! GREAT PLACE!!!!
author: Kirk M.

description:
We were fitting for some good lobster sandwich while up in the City by the Bay.   Thanks to Yelp, I found this place.  

We got there on a rainy but then sunny afternoon...go figure.. it was raining while we were in our cab, then sun came out when we got to the restaurant, but I digress.  

We got our table right next to the window!  We watched all the BMW, Benz, Yuppie Hippies go by!  Nice!!  

20 - 25 bucks per sandwich is not cheap, so we opted for 1 lobster sandwich and 1 crab sandwich, and two beers - 60 bucks for lunch??  Errr I mean sandwiches??

Regardless, it was well worth it!  The sandwiches are the bomb!  The lobster and crab sandwich were tasty and perfect!  It was fresh and the bread was toasty but not crunchy!  

There are sooo many places to eat in SF, makes me miss the city!
author: Doug C.

description:
Delicious!  We came here because of a friend's recommendation, and everything was amazing. We started with the mussels and garlic bread, and split a large lobster roll. The fries that came with the lobster roll were perfect, as was the roll itself. You also should try the make-your-own arnold palmer, which comes with lemonade, simple syrup, and iced tea in separate container that you mix yourself--pretty cool.  

If we come back to the SF area, we will definitely be back!
author: Debbie C.

description: I've tried the lobster roll, which came with side of cole slow and side of French fries! To tell you the truth it wasn't as good as I though it would be, I think that my expectations were a bit higher. The French roll or plutot the bread was made with tons of butter which had an overwhelming taste over the taste of the lobster. The lobster meat in the filling didn't have a fresh taste of the fish at all! It was not fresh from what I could taste. I'm thinking it was left over or something if not then maybe they used frozen lobster which had no seafood flavor at all. I decided to go there because I love seafood and I always loved lobster roll as long as the French roll are fresh and French which has a crispy texture, so I decided to give this place a try! It was not worth the money I've paid for at all believe me! I ended up paying 40 usd for the lobster roll and side of French fries! I can get better things with 40 usd!
author: Mido E.

description: Solid delicious meal. Food was so good. Husband got the soft shell crab BLT and I go t the fish and chips. Everything came out hot and crispy. Fries are also really good.
author: Ann L.

description: Overpriced for substandard food. My girlfriend's clam linguine, tasted weird. It was a little starchy, as if they didn't rinse off the noodles properly or if they simply dumped some of the water that the noodles cooked in into the sauce. Additionally, the clams tasted a little funky too. Not sure what was going on there. As for me, I had the lobster roll after the wait staff told us that "they're kinda known for their lobster rolls." Well... I've had several lobster rolls in Boston and the Boston lobster rolls were way better. Bigger proportions, more lobster meat, tasted fresh and for less money. Woodhouse on the other hand... smaller proportions, less meat, didn't taste as fresh and for more money. The experience did not match the hype at all. The only saving grace was that their French fries were pretty damn good. Perhaps the only thing that my girlfriend and I enjoyed. I don't know... maybe we went on an off night or something, but our first visit / impression wasn't a good one.
author: Robert U.

description: I had a lunch date with my mom and decided to come here to try their lobster roll. Place was crowded and was expected due to a Friday. We sat at the bar seating within 10 minutes. Service was great and the lobster roll..........it was just ok. Nick's in Pacifica still is king in this category. New England clam chowder was delicious. Not salty/peppery and it had just the right thickness with clams galore.
author: Marcus Y.

description:
I came here for a late lunch on a Tuesday Afternoon. 

I started off with a couple oysters ($2/pop), which tasted reasonably fresh. 

Then I had the Bay Shrimp and Avocado roll ($12) which is outstanding.  I recently returned from a trip to New England, and the roll is exactly the type you can expect in seafood sandwiches of this type.  It is soft, fluffy, and lightly buttered.  And it can almost never accommodate its filling.   The avocado was very fresh with a hint of lime juice.  The shrimp was outstanding. 

I then had the Linguine Pasta dish ($17) with mussels, spinach, tomatoes, and basil in a red wine butter sauce.  The portion size was generous.  In the first bite you can tell the pasta is made at the restaurant and not out of a package.  I did not ask for any condiments because I did not want to adulterate the dish in any way.  

I would highly recommend Woodhouse if you are looking for solid seafood options.
author: Ravi M.

description:
Fish and Chips are my husbands favorite thing to order so we have made it a kind of gold standard in our house hold.  Our most memorable Fish and Chips were eaten in Kauai.....The Fish and Chips at Woodhouse now holds our second place trophy.  Here is a list of reasons why.....

1.  The breading- the lightest and most savory breading I have ever eaten (ever.)
2.  The fish- was in big hunks, very juicy on the inside, and was available in two portion sizes
3.  The tarter sauce- was the best I have ever had, it was clearly made in house, with chunks of pickles

The fries were standard, nothing to rave about, but the house salad was impressive in freshness and flavor.  Just another reason why I deemed this experience a 5 star winner.  I ordered the house salad mostly to feel better about the fried food, so I was not expecting it to be anything special.  I was shocked and my husband was too as we fought over the last bites.  It was so fresh with the right amount of tangy dressing, garnished with very flavorful heirloom pear tomatoes.  Simple salads are typically an afterthought, Woodhouse went above my expectation on this one.  The server and the hostess were beyond sweet, felt very welcome in a very busy environment. 

Lastly.....My husband noted that all of their beers, including the one he ordered had a fish/sea theme, what a fun and whimsical detail....we loved this place.
author: Veronica D.

description: After attending some major open houses in Pac Hts, we stopped by Woodhouse for some grub. Seeing 2.5 million dollar homes and how the rich live, left me wanting some nice cheap low down good food. A friend once suggested the lobster roll but once I caught sight of the fish and chips, I knew it was destiny. 3 piece fish and chips came w/ a side of coleslow and a heaping mound of french fries. The fries alone were amazing. Crisp yet soft on the inside. Fish was a litle overbattered but the size made up for it. Try a cup of the clam chowder. The soup is the perfect consistency and  comes with a heap of juicy clam chunks. Perfect with a side of cold beer and a glass of white wine. The bill came out to about $25. Service is top notch.
author: Katie Anne N.

description: Quite overpriced for a crab melt, but hey it was pretty darn good. The sandwich was baked and topped with cheese and chives. It also came with a small side of fries. Considering the portion of my meal and the price...it was not that impressive.
author: Surge C.

description:
I consider myself a pretty adventurous eater in the sense that I'd try almost anything once, so it's surprising to people that I had never eaten raw oysters before. To me, they resemble malformed and rotting vaginas that I had always imagined tasting like dirty socks. All fears aside, I decided to pop my oyster cherry here and my suspicions were confirmed: they taste like nasty feet.

Everything else I tried here was delicious, especially the deep fried items. DANG, they sure know how to make things super crispy. The fried calamari was perfectly crunchy and served with two dipping sauces, and the fried risotto cake that came with the ono entree was nom nom nom nom nommmm! I even found the Hawaiian Ono palatable, and I don't really eat cooked fish. My Crab Cake dish was yummy and filling, and even though I was completely full, I represented all of my fellow fat girls of America and kept on eating and eating and eating until I could barely move. Oh yeah, the crab cakes also come with a salad if you're plugged up and keeping track of your roughage intake.

The end!
author: Suany W.

description:
Skip the New England clam chowder. Salty n tastes like from the can

Lobster roll was good. Yummm. Full size about $28 had lots of meat and not too creamy
author: wolfie g.

description: I went with my friends last night and the place was spectacular, with ocean and sea themes prominent in the design. The place was clean, cozy and inviting. We definitely had a lot of fun. Their seafood dishes were to die for and I was pleasantly surprised with the serving portions and all the great vegetables that came with the dishes. This made me love this restaurant! They are definitely trying to please the customers rather than just make money. I really loved the lobster roll and Dungeness Crab linguine they tasted spectacular with a mouthwatering sauce.  I'm coming back to try more of their yummy options.
author: Ramon L.

description: I am a girl that loves seafood, and the lobster roll here is AMAZING. I left the restaurant wanting more and definitely coming back. For the price the lobster roll is filling, lobster is fresh, bread is soft buttery, and the flavor is on point. Can't wait to come back and eat another one.
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Was visiting the lovely SF for the day, and looking for something quick for lunch. Ran across this lovely place on Yelp!

First let me say I'm not a huge Lobster fan just because I find it's not as flavorful as crabs and shrimps, and a bit $$$$ 

After reading a few reviews I had to try to Lobster Roll, and let me tell you... IT was SCRUMPTIOUS. They do NOT skimp on the Lobster. I got the 3oz (smaller portion), was debating on the 6oz because I was HANGRY. Surprisingly the 3oz portion was very fulfilling. Even though it was served as a roll, you absolutely get the full flavor and lobster chunks in each and every bite. I also found the price for the meal very reasonable for what you get. 

The service was great and on point. Very friendly atmosphere, I would say we were in/out within the hour. Sooo another plus for those who are like me, that do not like to sit and wait around for food on a starving stomach.

When ya girl's hungry, she's hungry!

Would definitely recommend this place to all my lobster lovers out there!
author: sotheavy p.

description:
Second time been to the place, sadly to say both times service were mediocre. Food was good but not great, definitely over priced for the portion. Our server S. did not seem she wanted to be there, asked for the table to be wiped which she did but left the table wet for us to sit, we ordered the Lobster roll didn't bother to ask size, the whole time we were eating till entrees finished, she was no where to be found, when she came around to pick up plates, asked none caring way" how was it?" If something was wrong with the entrees, we couldn't even find her. When check was asked told her to wait for the credit card, she left so quickly did not hear us, another 5 min passed by with the card waiting to be picked up, found her at the corner talking to another server.
Bottom line, probably will not go back again!
author: Lubaba V.

description: We showed up without reservations on Friday night and were seated within 5 mins. We started off with a special appetizer of grilled squid. Excellent! I had the special fried crab roll. It was amazing. My husband had the the large lobster roll. It was good but not for the $27 price tag. Food came out quick and our waitress was very efficient.
author: Tammy S.

description: The food was amazing .i had never tasted oyster and crap before and it  was cooked so tasty and delicious .highly recommended
author: Sara M.

description:
Delicious seafood and a great staff. I met a coworker on a rainy Thursday night. Fortunately I got seated while he battled peninsula traffic, and the staff was super amenable and friendly

Enjoyed the steamed mussels. The mussels themselves were not huge, but the broth was amazing w the garlic bread, and they brought us more sourdough to sop up the rest.

I had the lobster roll, which was worth every bite. As others have notes, not too mayo-y, huge lumps of fresh lobster meat, and delicious bread. I'll be back!

They also have a nice wine list by the glass that goes well with the seafood, love the Frogs Leap Sauvignon Blanc.

There is also this amazing large antique looking frame that might house a painting of a marina or seashore... but then you realize that it's moving! It's rolling video of fishermen and ocean, pretty cool
author: Aki N.

description: We had to wait for a bit for a table, but it was well worth it.  Everything we ordered was great, including the unofficial kids menu items.  I had the crab roll, which was amazing!  My husband had the fish tacos and he said it was good but he wished the fish was grilled (his words, not mine).  Our relatives also tried the fish and chips and the lobster roll.  Both were described as wonderful.  We ordered the do it yourself lemonade and had fun mixing the ingredients.  I also noticed, too late to order, that they have Carol Shelton wine.
author: JADA s.

description: Epic seafood spot in SF. My roomie and I got the calamari for the appetizer and for dinner we got the lobster roll and fries. The calamari was amazing and the lobster roll was even better. The lobster roll is a little on the pricey side, but worth every single bite. The atmosphere in the restaurant itself was pretty chill and the decorations were awesome (moving paintings). Even though this spot is super tiny and is always crowded, the food is what this spot is all about. This place is definitely worth the long wait.
author: Cristal C.

description:
This place is pretty good. Although, after reading the stellar reviews on Yelp, I was a little disappointed. I had a cup of clam chowder for an app which was impressive. Really yummy... someone I was with had a salad, and it was pretty good. 

For the main course, one person got the fish tacos, another ordered the fish of the day (a whole sea bass) and I ordered the famous lobster roll. The fish tacos were the norm, fried fish in a soft tortilla. Pretty standard. My lobster roll was good, but nothing to rave about. I've had about the same quality at other places. Again, the fish was pretty good, but nothing spectacular. 

The restaurant is in a cool location of the City, and the food is pretty good. Its worth checking out if the wait isn't too long. But, with all the great food around I don't know if I'll be making my way back in here .
author: Malvika S.

description: Enjoyed the clam chowder as it lived up to the billing. The fish tacos were tasty but hardly the best quality fish, but a nice slice of avocado was tasty. The stuffed artichoke with crab meat and shrimp was not well prepared and looked like the meats were from a can. Some of the smallest shrimp I have ever been served.
author: S H.

description: Got in as soon as the place opened. Service was average. I got the lobster roll sandwich and crab cakes- lobster was really fresh but could have used more lobster meat! I did get the sandwich with extra lobster meat too so I was a little bit disappointed. Crab cakes were tiny. Hair in my water. Hmmm...not going back!
author: Mai L.

description:
Nothing special. That's really all I have to say for Woodhouse Fish and Co. The service was good, probably because we came at such a good time (a.k.a Sunday around 12:30), and there was no wait. The ambiance is very nice, especially with the open kitchen. 
Now on to the food. I got the Crab Louie Salad, which was pretty good, but hey, can anyone really screw up a salad? My sister got the Lobster Roll which was very buttery, and certainly a heavy sandwich. My mother got the crab cakes which were too infused with lemon for my taste. My family enjoyed it, but I think I was the only one who was left unimpressed.
author: Juli E.

description:
Small restaurant, large demand.  If you want to get a seat without waiting I suggest you get there before 6:30 pm for a Friday.   As soon as the minute hand hit the 5 I swear about 15 people appeared out of no where.  The menu isn't small but for some reason finding what I wanted to eat was hard.  

My girlfriend and I split the 3oz lobster roll, and the two piece fish and chips.  The Lobster roll came on a toasted, and buttered bun but the lobster pieces were cold.  It was kind of a surprise but I guess that's how it's done.  Minimal mayo was used which is a plus.  The little celery pieces added a nice crunch and I never thought of it as filler as some other reviewers mentioned.  Good sandwich with a hefty price tag.

The fish and chips were very well done.  I have nothing negative to say about the perfectly cooked fish and the crunchy not overpowering batter.  The fries were shoestring which I normally love but these were overcooked and crunchy.  Since we were in a relatively nice restaurant I decided to eat my fries with a fork but they were so hard that once my fork pierced it, both pieces went shooting off in different directions.  It was safe to say no one got hurt but let this be a warning to future patrons!

Our server was nice and seemed to be fine with the request of no slaw and to sub it with more fries.  He also volunteered to have our lobster roll cut in half.  Neither happened.

We ordered the brownie dessert on a mango puree topped with almonds.  This was a good mix of sweet, sour and crunch.  Can't go wrong!  Add two glasses of wine and our tab came to about $60.  Not bad...
author: Rosalind S.

description:
No reservations, but if you can get in GO!

The calamari is average, but my dinner was one of the evenings specials of Sole.  Special it definitely was as it was amazing.  There were 3 of us and no tables were available when we arrived, but eventually we were seated at the bar area which still worked out well.  The owner/mgr checked on us a couple times which is a nice added touch. 

One downfall if there is one unisex bathroom, but for a small restaurant it's all their required to have.
author: Carol O.

description: Go on $1 oyster Tuesdays. When ordering the lobster roll, opt for butter instead of mayo. I'm not a fan of mayo and the butter substitute is amazing. I ordered the dungeness crab melt the second time I was here and although it was good, I still think the lobster roll is better. The crab melt was a bit burnt tasting and the corners of the sandwich were a kind of hard. I also love that all the melts/rolls come with a side of fries.
author: Amy N.

description:
Lobster roll yummy but pricey and way not worth the wait. the service was also kinda bad...they made us wait forever for a table and wouldnt let some ppl order who were only a few minutes late. i understand that getting ppl in and out is important to a restaurant business, but it needs to be done with a little bit of service.

overal, i would recommend another seafood joint. we had a negative experience.
author: Thach N.

description:
Ive had better fish and chips..much better...so much better...

For the money that was paid and the quality of food that I was given it was totally not worth it. I mean if I paid like 8 bucks for this food I wouldnt really care so much. 

Woodhouse is a nice looking place, dont get me wrong. But the food just really sucked that night. The fish and chips were oily and somewhat soggy. It didnt have the crunch that fish and chips are supposed to have. The lobster roll was nice but either it was just an off night or maybe they were just running out of lobster. Lobster was almost non-existent . I dont expect a mountain of lobster but it would be nice to have some lobster in every bite. Bread was toasted nicely but it was only somewhat warm at most when it came out.

I feel somewhat left out here, everyone is raving about how good this place is and I'm the one with the bad one. 

I probably wont ever be coming back, unless I am invited to go to dinner here. And even then I'll ask to see if there are other options available.
author: phillip w.

description:
I was in the mood for some seafood and I didnt want the usual pier eating places so we decided on going in on this restaurant. The food that got me drooling for this place was their Lobster Roll...mmmm. I didnt get it but my brother-in-law did. I chose to get the Toasted Buttered Dungeness Crab Roll, OMG this was soooo good. The Lobster Roll and Crab Roll both came in this half sized Texas Toast that was cut in the middle so the meat could be stuffed in, and it came with fries and coleslaw. The thing that got me about our meals was the fact that the meat was all real, no imitation/ fake meat here. And all for 12-16 dollars, not bad for all the meat they give you that comes falling out once you take that beautiful bite.

The only thing I didn't like was it was kinda small, but we got seated pretty quickly and our food came just as quick. The waitress and hostess were nice and helpful as well. I'm hoping to try the one on Market St. and see how that one fairs.
author: Chris H.

description: The one star is for the service. When we arrived the restaurant, there was a table available in the back which is close to the restroom, so I asked for a table in the front, the waitress wasn't happy about my request, and gave me an attitude. Not going back ever for sure!!!
author: Linda J.

description:
I came here after being told the fish and chips are really good.  The fish itself was a disappointment, it was so bland that I needed a ton of tartar for each bite, it just wasn't as great as I had expected.  But the chips were crispy and delicious.
I also tried their crab cakes which were pretty good.  Much more flavorful than the fish, and very moist.
I would probably come back again for the fries, and maybe to try their crab melt, which looked delicious.
author: Karen L.

description:
I am a lucky girl. I live around the corner from this place, and now I know why it is ALWAYS filled to capacity on any night of the week. 

Woodhouse Fish Co definitely has it going on. The food is good, the service is friendly, and the menu offers enough options to keep everyone happy. 

I went here with the 'rents on a Sunday around 5:45pm. We were seated promptly, but within 30 mins, the place was PACKED.

We started with 1/2 dozen oysters ($1 each on Tuesdays), which were fresh and delicious. I ordered the stuffed artichoke (grilled to perfection), and stuffed with delicious fresh crab and shrimp. It came on top of a yummy large green salad, and I had plenty to take home with me for work the next day. 

My dad had the fish 'n chips...very good portions and yummy french fries. 

My mom had the swordfish special, that was equally yummy and fresh. 

We loved every minute and every bite.

YUM YUM YUM!!!!!
author: Misha F.

description:
Like like like. 

Casual, comfortable and homey. Great, affordable (yet super fresh and SUSTAINABLE) seafood. I want to go back and try *everything* on the menu! I had the Fish Tacos, which were so flavorful and filling.

Service was speedy, knowledgeable and cheerful, despite the fact that the place was packed.
author: Tamara B.

description:
I've eaten here many times.  This is the place I go to for affordable fresh seafood in a fun, casual environment.  This place is pretty busy all the time and it's first come, first serve.  I recommend getting here a bit early for dinner... before 6:30PM to avoid the wait.  

Lobster roll:  O M G.  The chunky lobster salad is so refreshing and addicting, not to mention spilling over the perfectly buttered and grilled bread.  The whole sandwich is just so delicious and satisfying to eat.  The fries that come with it are very good.  It is crispy and seasoned to perfection.  The coleslaw that comes alongside the sandwich is also very good.

Crab cakes:  These crab cakes are good, but not extraordinary.  I find it has a bit too much breadcrumbs and not enough crabmeat.  

Cioppino:  This delicious seafood stew is one of my favorite dishes of all time.  This particular one served up here is packed full of fish, mussels, clams, and a good amount of crab.  I just love dipping bread into the broth.  This dish always hits the spot.

Ahi tuna burger: The burger resembles a chopped up tuna patty.  The bread is so fresh and soft.  I enjoyed this very much.

Clam chowder:  This is absolutely delicious and creamy!  I betcha there is cheese in the recipe:)  

The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is laid back and casual.  This is a very cool place to enjoy quality food with friends or family.
author: Gloria Y.

description:
After running around all morning and dealing with school by the time lunch time came around I was starving.  I got home and tossed all my stuff down and left to meet Janice C for lunch. We decided on Woodhouse because it would be easier for her to get to work from there. 

We started off with oysters as an appetizer and for our main courses Janice had the crab cakes and I had been anxious to try their fish and chips. I went for the 3 fish strips instead of 2 because I didn't know how big they were going to be. I figured they would be small, boy was i wrong! http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/jn8DdE6UGBIJIHz5iwBkMQ/l
The fish strips were crisp and full of fish! there wasn't emptyness inside YAY!  Janice gave me a lil taste of the crab cakes and it was yummy, we both agreed that the chipotle sauce that was drizzed on top could have used more of a kick but noneless it was good.

Its was nice meeting Janice after reading her reviews and chatting with her on yelp. We had some awesome conversation and I would love to hang out with her again :)
author: Jonathan W.

description:
Such tasty treats! Please do try to the lobster roll- great portion and, honestly, such buttery goodness! 

FYI: try to go during the midweek, expect a long wait for dinner.
author: C M.

description:
O-M-G!
To die for! I hesitate to say this since the place is so small and I wish that I could have it all to myself. The seafood is so fresh its practically still swimming. 
The lobster rolls and crab rolls are out of this world good. The calamari is tender, sweet and amazing. And thier version of the Arnold Palmer is the way every restaurant should serve it. Fresh lemon juice, simple syrup and tea - so refreshing. It tickles my taste buds just thinking about it. 
You have to try it once, and then you'll come back forever.
author: Nicole V.

description:
For the Saturday night before Halloween, I didn't feel like the wait time was bad at all. The hostess was very friendly, and kept us updated frequently on our wait.
My husband and I both ordered the 3 oz lobster rolls. We both received our meals less than 5 minutes after ordering (for a $17 meal, I'd almost preferred they pretend more preparation was involved.) 
The rolls were good, though. There were big chunks of lobster meat, and everything tasted very fresh.
The fries were also pretty good- really crispy.
Bottom line, good service, pretty good food, a little pricey (then again, lobster is always expensive.)
author: Bri B.

description: Having moved the Northern Cal 4 months ago, we spend lots of time in he city.  I discovered this place many years ago while on vacation.  We have spend the last several months looking for great places to eat in the city.  There are a ton, but we really enjoy a truly great meal!  With family coming in to see us we felt pressured to find the best meal we could.  Out of the blue I decided to take them here.  I had been 5 years since eating there. When I called to check the wait times, the lady in he phone ask how many in my party and what my name was.  While they don't take reservation, she could at least prepare for us if the availability was there.  When we arrived she was all set.  And... BEST FISH and CHIPS I have ever had!!  Awesome!  Great clam chowder as well!  Small place but a must!  It's away from the city a bit so it's easier to get in.
author: K H.

description: Woodhouse, you had me at $1 oysters. So much so that we ordered a couple dozen and didn't look back. I did have to order the crab cakes as a change of taste for both of us but they were unremarkable. When I think of crab cakes ($12 for two), I think of the ones Adam Richman had in his Baltimore episode. Huge jumbo lump nuggets irregularly shaped in a cake-like form. Alas, these were disks of filler and breading with threads of crab interspersed. Very disappointing. My recommendation: Come for the oysters on Tuesdays and you'll be a happy camper.
author: Randy T.

description:
1 star for the seafood being fresh and the other for the dessert.

My dinner date and I shared the clam chowder, cioppino, garlic bread, cracked crab, bread pudding, and the strawberry shortcake. As mentioned before, the seafood was fresh but lacked flavor. The cioppino did have tons of shrimp, mussels, and clams however it lacked depth. The broth did not taste like a seafood broth, it tasted like canned stewed tomatoes. The garlic bread was not crispy, it was soggy and doughy. The bread pudding and the clam chowder were delicious but the strawberry shortcake was extremely bitter for some odd reason. As far as the service goes. it was terrible. Our waitress never came to check on us and we had to ask the host for more water. 

I could have eaten at Gary Danko for $85. Save your time and money and go to Anchor Oyster Bar in the Castro.
author: Jaz M.

description:
Do yourself a favor and get here by 6pm. After that you'll be waiting for at least 20 minutes.

It was one of those exhausting weeks for my bf and I. He works his tail off so I wanted to take him somewhere that would hit the spot. The fried clams have the crunch factor but also moist inside so you actually realize you are eating a clam, the oysters on the shell are creamy and refreshing, I had the crabcakes and he had fish and chips. It was a Friday and nothing brought me greater joy to look at across the table at my bf watching the giant's score on his phone, pounding down his anchor steam beer, and chowing down!
author: Leslie L.

description: I went back, to the Castro location. Did not get the fish and chips this go round, went with the fish tacos which were decent. The wait staff here should take lessons from the other location because they were less than attentive. So yea, no change...this place is still A-OK....but definitely not a first choice.
author: Ashley W.

description:
FLAKY fish and chips!
lobster roll, i dont know why i expected better.
try the fish and chips you wont be disappointed
MY SUGGESTION- ask for the fish on a separate dish, so the fries below don't get all soggy with grease
add a great white and you've got a great meal
author: Jill F.

description:
This place simply kicks ass. We were in a hurry to get to a show down at the Fillmore but only had about 30 min to eat. Nolan our server busted on the line cooks and they produced perfectly cooked:

- Lobster roll - bursting with lobster, awesome buttery toasted roll
- Fish and chips - not too greasy, moist rich cod
- Ipswich clams - a mix of texture/flavor of clams and oysters
- Tomato salad - great vinaigrette

in no time flat. We agreed, they sure know how to fry stuff here. The fries that came with our entrees rivaled that of Bouchon in Yountville and one of my other faves Joanie's in Palo Alto. It might not be the cheapest place for a quick meal but it's definitely a highly tasty one. I need to return for a longer meal and I know there is some chowdah in my future.
author: Kim N.

description: Second time visiting SF in the past year and made sure to return to this place. Clam chowder is ridiculously delicious. Every time I order the cup and end up wishing I ordered the bowl. The lobster roll is yummy as well. Had a bite of the dungeness crab sandwich which was really delicious as well.
author: Michael P.

description:
I've dined here for three times, and finally get the chance to write a review for them. Woodhouse Fish Co. is your family friendly and charming neighborhood seafood shack. Their dishes are affordable, and taste is quite on the spot as well. Beer choices are limited, but they have a good list of other drinks to choose from.

My favorites here:

- Wedge Salad with Maytag Blue Cheese. Yummy! The cheese could be on the heavy side, so if you're watching your weight, make sure to point out less cheese, or on-the-side cheese. 

- Steamed Mussels (with Garlic bread) You can get this with shoestring fries instead of the bread. Their mussels are those mini ones that you don't find very often. I thought they are tastier than the giant ones.

- Dungeness Crab Melt. Again, a very heavy cheesed sammy. Nevertheless, yummy! Generous amount of grab stuffed in between good brioche-like bread. Served with fries. 

Service is efficient, friendly and attentive. No blind spot in the restaurant, so the servers won't ever miss you if you need anything.
author: Rika P.

description:
My name is Christina & I'm an addict...

I'm addicted to their Shrimp & Avocado Roll :) & New England Clam Chowder. 

*Definitely a fan!
author: Christina D.

description: Tried the Hartford Clam Chowder! Mixed: mostly New England with a splash of  Manhattan Clam Chowder. Great Lobster Roll!
author: Dan C.

description:
Yum!  I tried the Dungeness crab roll & the Maine lobster roll - both served in lightly-toasted and perfectly-buttery bread.  The amount of crab & lobster was substantial.

I eyeballed my friend's oysters.  They were super cute.... which isn't a good thing in this case, because they were super tiny.  Not quite worth it for the price.  I felt too guilty to steal a taste.

The inside is small-moderate sized.  Not great for large groups (6+ people).  Service is fast, which is good for a quick lunch.
author: Jeanne L.

description:
The fish and chips are to die for. I don't know what they put in that batter, but it's perfect every time. Thin, crunchy, never weighed down by grease. The fries are the best fries I've ever had. 

The cioppino is fabulous. Broth was flavored very well. Not too thick, not too thin, not too tomatoey. Everything always tastes very fresh. Especially the shrimp and fish. The garlic bread that comes with the cioppino is to die for...

Oyster Tuesdays, I must give a fair warning and dock a star. I think the kitchen staff is so overwhelmed with the number of oysters being ordered that they rush through shucking and pay little attention to the bits of shell lodged in the oyster. I think 5 out of the 6 oysters I ate had shell inside. The oysters sans shell was very fresh and delicious.
author: Judy L.

description: Seemed like an interesting place until we met the waitress she was bland with no personality. Then the food came an that was bland just like the waitress personality.  I came with a friend an there was a piece of medal shard in his Crab Roll. Manager came and stated he will cover our wine.  So the bill came an  the bland waitress reaffirmed that all the wine was comp'd however the bill showed other wise an they declined to correct it stating oh we meant just the one party's wine was covered. In all very below satisfactory experience. I wouldn't come back if my meal was even free. Thee End :-)
author: Eric E.

description:
This place is awesome.  It has the best ciopino(sp?) in the city, by far.  the broth has a rich fennel flavor and there is tons of seafood in it.  

I love that the seafood is so fresh and simple.  The service is great.  And, a new found fact about them that I have been taking advantage of...they do take out!
author: Jenn D.

description:
After I wrote my previous review, the owner of Woodhouse Fish Company contacted me to apologize for the experience we had. I truly appreciate his concern and the fact that he would reach out to me. 
I know how tough it can be running a small business these days. I also understand how much tougher it is now that every Tom, Dick, and Harry has the power to write an unsubstantiated one star review on Yelp. So when a business owner contacts me after I have written a negative review (which I really don't relish doing in the first place), I know that he/she takes customer service seriously. I am looking forward to giving this business another try, especially given all the previous great reviews that led me here in the first place. Thanks.
author: Delilah P.

description: This place was a disappointment because of the over-hyped lobster rolls. I should have sprang an entree or another sandwich instead, the next table got the fried calamari and the soup, which looked so much better.  I've had fresher lobster, and this tiny portion was under-seasoned. Instead of having the lobster roll as the feature, the fries were 2x larger than the sandwich and as a result the meal was tantalizingly unsatisfying. Points for the busboy/server for always visiting and refilling my water.
author: Nancy Y.

description:
This place was excellent! 

Nice decor, friendly service, unique and interesting fish and seafood menu.

My friend had a cup of clam chowder and I had a shrimp cocktail to start. It was only four shrimp, but they were gigantic. 

We shared the stuffed artichoke, which was very garlic-heavy (in a good way), very lightly breaded, roasted and stuffed with shrimp in one half and crab on the other half. It was served on a bed of greens. Terrific.

The prices seemed a bit high - the lobster roll was $18 and didn't look very large. Nonetheless, I'll be back. 

It was packed by the time we left - just after 7 p.m. on a Thursday.
author: Kim C.

description:
My friend and I went here late on a Sunday afternoon just to try the lobster roll and we weren't disappointed!  The roll was soft and just lightly toasted and it had a HUGE mound of lobster.  It also came with some tasty matchstick fries and a small side serving of cole slaw.  Paired with a nice glass of Sauvignon Blanc, it was a perfect meal.  In fact, I literally ate everything they served me (except the wedge of lemon).  I'm posting a picture and you'll see exactly what I'm talking about...just looking at it makes me drool!

It wasn't too crowded when we were there and the service was friendly and attentive, so we'll definitely be back!  (Maybe for that $1 oyster Tuesday that I saw on the menu...)
author: Kimberly B.

description:
A really wonderful neighborhood seafood spot. The seafood is always extremely fresh. The lobster roll is the best I've had in San Francisco, and the ahi tuna burger somehow miraculously tastes like In N Out. 

They don't take reservations and they're usually pretty packed, so don't be surprised if you have to wait 30-45 minutes on a weekend night. But it's not too bad because there are a ton of places to grab a drink nearby (Wine Jar, SPQR) while you wait.

On Tuesday nights they have $1 oysters, which is totally worth it. Try the Kumamotos - small and sweet.
author: Rose S.

description:
One word to describe my food and experience here last night: Phenomenal

Came here with the boy, and we order an entire crab with the wine,garlic, lemon sauce and a side of garlic bread. The crab was soooooo scrumptious. The sauce was just perfect! The key is to dip the garlic bread in the garlic wine drippings from the crab. The garlic bread was awesome, it was different than I've has before in a good way. The bread it self is super garlicy but they sprinkle fresh shaved Parmesan cheese over it while its still hot. Its not melted by any means but I really enjoyed it that way. You could tell they use high grade cheese.

Oh and I dont like oysters but my boyfriend wanted to try one since they were only $2 dollars, and he enjoyed it. Damn only 2 bucks though that's pretty dang good. 

Now on to dessert, OMG the strawberry shortcake was divine! They put a hot baked shortcake on top with fresh strawberries and whip cream. I went to heaven when I ate this.

Will be back, I want to try their crab cakes, crab roll, clam chowder, and the sourdough bread pudding.

Thanks for such an amazing meal, oh an of course I found this place on Yelp!
author: Jess O.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night with group of six people. Hard to get seats for that large of a group so I definitely recommend calling in advance. Place gets crowded, you can see group of people outside.  We were lucky that someone had a cancellation or as the host said so. 

Let me jump into it! Some of the best oysters I've had. Opt in for the premium ones $3 a piece,  it was delicious. Had me wanting more. Even now I think about it and I ask myself how do I get my hands on those suckers. They were so good. Oh yes! 

And get the crab sandwich! You'd wanna spank yourself for not trying. I mean wow.  Talk about being so lucky that San Franciscans have access to this delicacy. This is great. Crab never tasted so good on a piece of bread. Too bad I didn't have enough space in my stomach after all those  oysters!
author: J C.

description:
$19 seems like a lot for a sandwich but I've tried similar, and was not as stuffed as I was here. I had the lobster sandwich which comes with a pretty good amount of lobster, on buttered toasted bread. Also on the side are french fries & coleslaw. (There's also a large portion option that has more stuffing inside for $26).

I went at an odd time (4:30pm) but heard that was a good idea because any other time, there would be a really long wait. We got seated right away. 

$2 mix & match oysters are a bargain, but come Tuesdays they are only $1.
author: Alysha K.

description:
Wow! Best lobster roll EVER!!!  I've tried almost everything on the menu cause I've brought a lot of friends and they love this place!  The dishes that really stood out were:
-Clam chowder: light creamy soup and very generous with the clams
-Crab Louie Salad: This salad is really light and very generous with the crab meat.  
-Lobster roll!! This is a MUST!  and get the larger sandwich.  You will regret getting the smaller sandwich.  This place is super generous with the lobster meat and its made with light mayo. OMG! the best Lobster roll I have ever had in SF!

Wow! Just talking about these dishes put me in a food coma.  Just so happy thinking about this place.
author: Ying F.

description: Unfortunately I had a really bad experience. I ordered a $30 crab roll dressed with metal shards in it.. Management only comped my wine and tried to justify the reason how a metal shard got in my roll. Not acceptable. In addition I was underwhelmed by the flavor and the service. It's overrated!
author: Jermaine K.

description:
I got a halibut dish, which was their special of the day. I thought it was definitely solid 4 stars, and I loved the service too.

Some things we ordered were too salty, but I find most restaurant foods salty so didn't really bother me that much. Blue point oysters were very fresh, and my sister's crab cakes were not too dry, perfectly cooked, a bit salty, but yummy nonetheless.
author: Jean C.

description: Woodhouse Fish Co sits in a category with those restaurants that you'll return to again, but only as a standby rather than a destination. Generally the meal was "no frills": the calamari was decent and the crab melt slightly bland. However, the fries were a solid flavor stand-in next to the crab melt (the sandwich was bland, but the side crispy and salty) and the cioppino was flavorful, with some kick. Still, I felt the items we ordered were overpriced (it is San Francisco, overall), which solidifies Woodhouse as a 3-star establishment in my book.
author: Justin P.

description:
This place, a hole in the wall. Looks are deceiving, butt the food and service is great. My husband and I started off with a fried calamari appetizer, which was excellent. He ordered crab cakes and a salad, and I ordered a crab melt which was so delicious, its comes with a very small side of coleslaw and good seasoned French fries. 

I will definitely come again for lunch, as it is not busy like the evenings or weekends. The price is right, you get what you pay for. However, the waitresses were not that friendly but their food was good!
author: isenia r.

description:
Softshell Crab BLT...MMMM!  

As a native Marylander, I'm pretty picky about my shellfish, especially softshells and blues...but I like this place and it lives up to my standards :o)  Not fancy, just clean, simple and friendly.  I would choose to eat here more often if it were within walking distance of my house.
author: Alex T.

description:
Coming from the east coast, I haven't had many places in SF with comparable clam chowder, but Woodhouse does it well! I shared the fish tacos and the crab melt. Both were good, but not anything amazing. The crab melt was delicious, except it was drenched in butter/oil (which I guess many people like), but it was a little too greasy for me. The fish tacos were also good, but the tortillas broke apart too easily. 

Otherwise, I felt our entire meal was rushed, there was a pretty long wait while we were eating and it seemed like they were trying to usher us out as soon as possible to seat new customers. Totally get that, but I'd like to be able to enjoy my meal without  being bothered every minute. The waiter asked to take my plate three times before I was done with my meal.
author: Alice W.

description:
Will not ever go back to this place again. They don't even deserve one star. The wait was too long and then we ordered dessert which took a long time. They said that they would take it off our bill, which we thought was a very nice gesture. Only to find out when I checked my bank account this morning they put it back on the bill and I did not sign that receipt with a new amount. We have called about it this morning and waiting for a call back. So beware when they tell you something will be off the bill because they will put it right back when you leave the restaurant.

As suspected we never got a call back from the manager.
author: M M.

description:
I've tried several things on the menu, so here are MY suggestions and opinions:

Fish Tacos are very good.  Definitely a must try.
Fish and Chips are also a must try...the fish is battered and fried just right.
Make your own lemonade: Mmmmmm, I sometimes come here and order a meal just so I can have the lemonade.

Chowder is not that bad.  Definitely better than fish market or (dare I say it) swan oyster depot.

I don't really care for the crab melt.  IMO there is too much going on.
author: Lylliam C.

description:
Quaint little restaurant right in the heart of the Fillmore District decorated with nicely framed black and white picures of San Francisco back in the 1930's. I had been wanting to try Woodhouse for some quite time now, so when we drove by and found a parking space right in front, we just had to go in. Thiis restaurant is small and very crowded, however our wait was only 15 minutes for lunch for my party of 4. The hostess was good and our server adequate.

What we had ~ 

Clam chowder ~ served warm, not bubbling hot, under seasoned.  
Garlic bread ~ good, but not very garlicky
Calamari ~ beautifully deep fried generous portion of calamari
Baked oysters ~ Yum!! Hot out of the oven and mighty tasty bluepoint oyster goodness! 
Fish and chips ~ Alaskan cod fish and chips ~ although the fish was fresh, it was too heavily battered for our liking.
Shrimp Louie ~ ample portions of large, fresh shrimp over a bed of iceberg lettuce drowning in dressing; It would have been better if the dressing was served on the side.

Overall an okay experience.
author: Sasha R.

description:
We had dinner here on Friday night, and I thought it was one of the best seafood places I have been to in the city. I only live a few blocks away, and I'm surprised it took me this long to try the place out!

We had a craving for seafood so we started off with a dozen oysters. We got the Miyagi oysters, which are smaller than the East Coast oysters they sold, but I think they're way tastier. They came served on a small cookie sheet of ice. Perfectly chilled. Awesome oysters.

My girlfriend got the full crab. You can get it chilled, steamed, and another preparation which I don't recall. She went for steamed. While steamed crab is always a messy affair, it was really awesome. LOTS of good meat in there. As a crab lover, I definitely approve.

On the waiter's recommendation, I got the cioppino. It was delicous. While many cioppinos are very soupy, this one was more of a pile of varoius shellfish with a broth on the bottom. So it's really just a great bunch of seafood with a marinara-style broth in the bottom.

While we were stuffed, we decided to get some desert, and we split the bread budding. Also. awesome. Everything we ate that nice was delicious.

The decor of the place is really cool. Lots of old maps framed on the wall. They actually have a relatively large HDTV in a picture frame that just shows old boats and seascapes and such. It's one of those casual, but classy, places. The menu is pricey, but it's not a ripoff. The "whole crab" was $27, and I believe that was the most expensive item on there. All in all, I loved Woodhouse Fish Company. I will be back, and next time I'll try something different!
author: Kevin H.

description:
Friendly service and good food. My friend and I split the stuffed artichoke, the pesto pasta w/prawns, & a side of fries. I wish they brought the fries out first rather than everything at once. We polished off a bottle of wine before getting any food..guess things we ordered took longer to do.

The pasta was very creamy and tasty. The artichoke was a little disappointing. Not much crab stuffed in there and it was a little undercooked in my opinion. I definitely want to try half a crab or the fish tacos next time.
author: Natassia S.

description: The lobster roll and crab melt looks alot better than how it tastes.  Was a bit disappointed considering we walked 45 minutes from the hotel to get here. But at least I can mark it off my bookmarked list.
author: lan n.

description:
I like this restaurant perhaps  just not this location

The staff seemed more interested in socializing with each other than serving the customers.
My order came out wrong.. and then i had to wait for a good 10 minutes to ask the waiter to bring me a sauce which i asked for with my order and a fork since mine seemed to be missing. 

Through out the entire meal we had to keep asking for things since no one was there to check on us.

The girls that took our order was nowhere to be seen after she took our order .. only to come back at the end of the meal to bring us our bill.

No one took our drinks orders so we just had water and had to ask for bread.

I had the crab roll and the  meat was a bit dry and overly shredded and bland..the time before this i also had the crab roll and it consisted mostly of chunks of crab meat and was very good..but not at this location.
author: Alecia R.

description:
Came for lunch here with a coworker and had a good experience.  

The service was attentive and timely and the food was tasty.  Had the fish and chips and my friend had the lobster roll.  

Would definitely return.  Thank you!
author: Jenny M.

description: Came here for lunch on a Wednesday. Wait staff seems very nice and attentive. Ordered the clam chowder and fish and chips. Chowder was creamy and had a lot of clam meat! Fish and chips were good. Light and crispy, but I like mine with more seasoning personally.
author: Edward L.

description:
Fish tacos, ahi burgers, lobster rolls, and mussels.  This place has everything I love about seafood, and more.

They don't take reservations, so the wait can be between 10 - 40 minutes, but its totally worth it.  The restaurant isn't huge, so its perfect for a party of two or four.

When you get the mussels (and you must), get the garlic bread.  You'll finish it off and crave some more.  They'll bring you extra bread, which isn't as good as the garlic bread, but works great for sponging up that extra broth after you polish off those mussels.

My ideal meal for two is splitting the mussels, then one order of fish tacos (which I can never finish) and one order of the ahi burger.  As an added bonus, they have Frog's Leap wine, so a nice chilled glass of sauvignon blanc completes the meal.

Definitely one of my top 5 favs in SF.
author: Ashley T.

description:
After all the hype this place got on Yelp, my expectations were set pretty high. I got the lobster roll (half) because that was what got the best reviews, and to my disappointment it did not live up to what I had in mind. 

First of all, the half size roll is really small. All the pics on Yelp make it look a lot bigger than it actually is. In fact, the amount of fries and coleslaw are also small. I felt like I was being served a kids meal... for $18. The lobster tasted really bland to me & the butter on the roll was a bit overpowering. I did not like the coleslaw & the fries were okay, but I feel like there were about 10 fries on my tray. 

The service here is also not great. It took a while for us to get served & it just wasn't impressive at all.

For the portion & taste, this place is highly overrated & overpriced.
author: Junel S.

description:
Not bad at all for Fish & Chips.  The fish is beer battered and falls apart easily which I think is a good thing. It is served with typical shoestring fries and coleslaw.  It's greasy but but not more than expected. The roll part of the lobster roll was distinguishably flavorful.  We placed an order for pick up and they were fast. Just kind of hoped to be more impressed.

As far as I'm concerned , we didn't order anything risky so it's tough to rate. 3 Stars are good enough for now..
author: Hannah A.

description:
I ate here with a friend a bit ago actually he made the review 3 months ago and he appropriately made his review on time.  LOL.  The service was very friendly and I like how they were social with us.  ^^  The food was really good.  I love the oysters we ended up eating first, but I had a bit of shell in it, but that was my bad.  LOL  
Unfortunately I don't remember what I ordered, but it was very tasty from what I remember and I definitely would go back here!!  I probably ordered something with fish... catfish or fish & chips LOL.  This is a cute restaurant to bring a few friends with! ^^
author: John H.

description:
I've been meaning to try this place out for the longest time after seeing the great reviews and the pics of the split top Maine lobster roll.  Finally made it there a few weeks ago, and I definitely wasn't disappointed.

I ordered the lobster roll and my husband ordered the fish tacos, and we shared both entrees.  After the first bite of my lobster roll, I didn't want to share!  I've been dreaming of that lobster roll ever since that day.  Succulent, sweet pieces of fresh lobster...so damn good.  Oh, and the fries were perfect;  just how I like them:  skinny and crispy.  The fish tacos were fantastic as well.  Lightly battered and fried cod with pico de gallo, cabbage and avocado.  Yummy.

I had their do-it-yourself-Arnold Palmer, which I thought was a cute idea.  They give you separate little carafes of unsweetened iced tea, lemonade and simple syrup so you can make it as sweet as you want.

It's a bit pricey (we don't normally go out and spend $50 on lunch, but once in awhile it's okay), but definitely worth it if you feel like splurging a little.
author: Eileen H.

description:
My friend recommended this place after a night out the next morning/afternoon.. Haha must I say, we were definitely craving some Pho, but since it was just a walk from her apartment at the Fillmore, we figured why not.  Plus, I've been telling her how I wanted to try the good stuff in San Francisco, and so here we were.

We started off with the chowder (mixed red and white), which I had no idea existed.  Yes, you can call me sheltered... Anyways, the chowder was good.  It wasn't out of this world, but it satisfied.  I've also been craving oysters for the longest time, so we ordered one of each.  Our waitress was great to provide detail about each, giving us a lesson of each type of oyster, which of course I would forget.  But I loved all the oysters that we tried.  If it was $1 each, I probably would've ordered more, but given that it was $2-$3 per oyster, I think we were pretty adventurous on our wallets with what we ordered.  Next, came our main dishes. My friend ordered the sea bass and I ordered the chappino.  Her sea bass was alright... in my opinion.  Don't get me wrong, my friend loved it, but I am not a fan of a fish on a bone.  I hate picking out the bones and on top of that, it still had that "fishy" taste to it so I was just glad I didn't order it myself.  So, I think that is just a personal preference.  As far as my dish, OMG.  YUMSKIS.  So my chappino consisted of fish, scallops, clams, mussels, crab meat, shrimp in a tomato based sauce with garlic bread on the side.  The crab meat was the best part of it as it seemed the most fresh and I was glad I didn't have to do any work as far as getting it out of its shell.  There was a good amount of meat to the crab and it was fresh.  The chappino was so good, I finished it all.  The rest of the seafood itself was fresh as well and the sauce did a great job complementing it.  

Overall, the food matched its price and definitely worth coming back again.
author: Wendy Y.

description: Hubby and I wanted to try the lobster roll so we headed down to this restaurant because of the ratings.  The wait was super long (call ahead for reservations).  After an hour plus wait, we were finally seated.  Ordered the Arnold Palmer, Crab Louie Salad, New England Clam Chowder and the Lobster Roll.  Food had absolutely no flavor.  Super, super disappointed.  The server never even came by to ask us if we were ok.   Never going to this restaurant again.
author: Amelia W.

description: Like fried fish? Of course you do! This place has the fryer fare covered, with excellent fish and chips, and onion rings that almost earned them 5 stars in our book. Sister-in-law said the chowder was pretty good, though not better than Scoma's at the Wharf (tough act to follow). Service was friendly and attentive. They did mess up our order, which left one of us without a plate for about 7 or 8 minutes, but they took the onion rings off the bill with a smile and without being asked: classy move. If the other fish dishes are just as good, these guys might merit five stars.
author: Dave S.

description: Amazing!!! They had three different types of oysters that day and they were all delicious. I definitely recommend the Japanese ones as they were the softest. They had a small selection of brews but they were all pretty good. I also got the mussel soup which had so much flavor!!! Coming back for sure!!!
author: Karen A.

description: Fantastic. Best breading fish and chips ever. Good quality oysters, shrimp and corn fritters were amazing. Very cool vibe, no wait.
author: Danielle C.

description:
Crab melt was not good, overly toasted bread that crumbled apart. Skimp on the crab. Fries were burnt, I thought I was eating fry chips. At first I thought this was their style of fries but then I looked at other people's fries. 

Will not be coming back.

New England lobster marketry in burlingame is way better
author: Han N.

description:
One dollar oysters on tuesdays!!!! Plus their lobster, shrimp, and clam rolls are so good. Not just that but it's all reasonably priced especially if you go there for lunch. I've walked by this place numerous times and I'm kicking myself knowing that i didn't go into the place sooner. The food is so good and the prices are okay depending on what you get (it is seafood after all). The service is also good and the place is spacious and clean. 

I will definitely come back.
author: Rylan C.

description: We lived in Boston before moving to SF, and one of the things I missed most about living in New England   were the whole belly clams. My friend suggested we stop by after having a few drinks down the street. I was ecstatic to see they serve whole belly clams. We also ordered the Dungeness crab roll. Both were delicious!
author: J. L.

description:
This place is absolutely awesome.  Delicious, fresh seafood at a reasonable price.  The service was great and very friendly.

We started with some oysters, a dungeness crab cocktail, and some clam chowder.  All of them were spectacular.  Being a New England boy I am realy critical of chowdah, but this absolutely met my standard.  

The three of us then split the lobster roll, crab roll, and the cioppino.  Again, all of them were amazing.  The cioppino was fulls of tons of seafood....crab, mussels, shrimp, clams....and the broth was SO good.
