Both rolls were really good on beautifully buttered and toasted rolls, although I would have expected more meat considering we ordered the double meat versions.  I would probably be seriously disappointed with the single meat versions.

For dessert we got a sourdough bread pudding that I didn't really care for, but at that point I am was already so satisfied that it didn't matter.

This is going on my short list of places to go whenever I am in SF.
author: Dan M.

description:
MMmm, fish and chips, Tuesday dollar oysters and lovely, sweet strawberry shortcake - need I say more?  Done!  ;)

We had a great time here last night catching up with a couple friends, and we were lucky to hit this place on their dollar oyster Tuesday - these were so yummy - dare I say yummier than Hog Island!  Woodhouse's oysters seemed heartier and tastier - hmmm!  We'll definitely be back for these.  

I got the ono fish with risotto cake, and this was quite tasty, but I think I preferred my bf's fish and chips.  Luckily he got 3 pieces of fish as he gave me one - YUM (and I kept reaching over for more fries)!  The fish batter was crispy and fried just right, and we loved their tartar sauce (I still finished all of my meal too, plus had a taste of clam chowder, full full, yum).  Our friend got the "fribs" (fish that's cut to look like ribs), and that looked pretty good too!  

And the topper was the strawberry shortcake w/ fresh whipped cream!!  Mmm!  I'm not a big dessert person, but this dessert was gone in seconds - more please!  

Our waiter was super friendly and made our dining experience very enjoyable -- we will be back!

2 dozen oysters+dinner+dessert for 4 divided by 4+tip+tax = $35
author: Maile N.

description:
This place is great.  It was a last minute decision, sparked by a conveinent parking lot on California and Fillmore and a very long wait at Delfinas.  It was a Sunday night that followed the most beautiful Sunday day which is what I will attribute to the wait at almost every good restuarant on Fillmore.  People did not want to go home!

We split half of the king crab, the plain with melted butter on the side.  It was amazing.  I should have gotten the full and ate it for an entree.  The cioppino was amazing.  The red broth so delish, it didn't even matter that it ended up all over our shirts.  The broth even made their amazing near perfect bread taste better.  I'll never understand though having to grab king crab out of a red soup and crack it with our hands.  This soup should have been eaten on the side of a beach, over sand, with a bathing suit on...rather than a nice restaurant;)  But if I go back I will order the soup.  Food envy was kicking in...

But I'll be honest, the baked stuffed artichoke sounded amazing, but didn't quite deliver.  The salad underneath with the beets was a pleasant surprise.  The crab on the one artichoke super yummy.  But the baby shrimp were tasteless as were the artichoke leaves.  I left most of it on my plate.  

Luckily the menu had at least four more things I'd like to try.  Next time I will also order from the wine list.
author: Kierstan G.

description:
Delicious!!! Had dinner there yesterday and it was mouth watering. Shared a mahi mahi ceviche that was a lil bit spicy, a lotta bit limey, and had me coming back for more. I ordered the cioppino and literally licked my plate clean! I wish there had been more garlic bread to accompany it, but it was still enjoyable. My date had the seafood stuffed artichokes. I tasted it and thought it was perfect, however there could have been more meat. 

I wouldn't give this place 5 stars just because its incredibly small! you will be elbow-to-elbow with the strangers next to you. The service is terrific! The food is delicious  and fresh (portions are a little on the skimpy side) . I'm already planning my next visit!
author: Nikki F.

description:
I was here with my eight-months-pregnant wife yesterday. 

It took almost 10 minutes to get service after we had sat down. Then we ordered a monterey squid appetizer, clam chowder cup, fish and chips and a Louis salad (with crab instead of shrimp). 15 minutes later we got our salad and cup of soup. Then we waited and waited and waited for the entrees. We finally asked about them 25 min after getting our apps. They said they had "staggered" the food for us on purpose, which made no sense because other parties had been getting multiple dishes together. What obviously happened is that they forgot to place our entree orders. It took another 20 minutes to get our entrees--and the Louis salad had shrimp, not crab. And by that time we were very hungry and annoyed. Instead of owning up to their mistake, they said they were "busy." But every single party that was seated after us--sometimes a half-hour after us--got their entrees before us. It's the disingenuousness of the staff's response to our complaints that pissed us off the most.

We also got to know the couple eating at a table next to ours. Get this: one of them had a rubber band in their fish and chips, and the other found a hair in her salad! (They were too kind and didn't even complain to the staff.)

For what it's worth, the fish in the fish and chips was great. And the staff comped us an entree. But given the terrible experience, they should have comped us the whole meal. As you can see, I almost never leave reviews so the fact that I'm doing so now means that I was pretty rattled by the experience. When you make a mistake, just own up to it and say you're sorry.
author: A E.

description: Dave brought me here tonight, my 18th anniversary living as a friend of Bill, and I love this place as well as their location at Market and Church.  I've been a fan since they first opened the Market joint, and the 2nd is equally good.  We both love the garlic bread and fried calamari as appetizers and both were tasty tonight, but they must have a shortage of lemons because the wedges were too skinny to squeeze.  The other shortcoming tonight was our entree's being delivered moments after we started the appetizers, as in "we're too busy for you to really enjoy your dinner with us", but aside from those two mishaps, the food was delicious.  I had their fish and chips with a from, fresh cod like fish with a great tempura style coating, perfect shoestring fries, a good tartar sauce and the poor aforementioned anorexic lemons.  Dave ordered his favorite, the lobster roll and he was in bliss with that, the salad and slaw served with it.  The waitress took our order and all the rest of the service was done very professionally by a busboy.  They have a single dessert, flourless chocolate cake, a pretty short by good beer and wine list.  I really love Woodhouse Fish Company.
author: Stu S.

description:
WFC is a great, inexpensive, seafood option with a decent wine and beer list, great service, and wonderfully warm "neighbor-hoody" vibe. So far I've tried the Dungeness Crab Melt, the Stuffed Artichoke, the catch of the day when it was halibut (mmm, came with great sauteed mushrooms and a turnip puree!), and the linguine pasta (which was just OK).

The wait staff is really friendly. I've always felt like I was walking into my local joint (even though I've only been twice). I've only been to the Fillmore spot, and its usually hoppin'! Seems a lot of people put in for reservations here even though it isn't "fine-dining." But if you don't have the wallet or patience (on a busy night) for Bar Crudo, this is the place to go. 

A definite go-to for a casual, inexpensive, yet scrumptious seafood meal!!
author: Raquel C.

description: Still one of my favorites.   Bit prices have come up and service has Gond down quite a bit over the last 3 years.
author: Genevieve B.

description:
We went here last night for dinner and everything was amazing!

We walked in around 7pm on a Sunday evening and there was a 30 minute wait. As we were waiting we decided to see if we could order a glass a wine/beer from the bar. The bar seating was packed and since they don't have a bar tender, the host went over as grabbed us a drink(glass of champange for me and beer on tap for the hubby). The host was very attentive and kept giving us an ETA for when we would be seated. 

We sat down about 20 minutes later and our server came right over. She informed us that they were out of their whole crab-which was a total bummer because that is what we wanted but there were several other things on teh menu I wanted to try so we just now need to go back soon and get the crab!. 

We started off with 12 oysters(they have about 4 different varieties). They were $2 each but on Tuesday they are $1 each.

My husband and I shared the Artichoke Entree(it is a very LARGE artichoike that is steamed and seasoned and then on one half there is crab and on teh other half there is bay shrimp. It is HUGE and comes with a big salad. very yummy!

We also shared the large order of teh lobster roll which is big chunks of lobster is a toasted buttered roll and comes with teh best fries! They are so yummy! I ate all of mine and then some of my friends! They are so cripsy and simple; i couldn't stop eating them. I actually had to ask the server to have her take it away

We ended the night with the chocolate pudding cake with habenero and whip cream with cayenne. So good. I didn't think it was very spicy but still delicious! 

Meal was on the expensive side(4 people, 2 drinks each, 3 entrees=$200) but it was worth it. so good! I can't wait to go back.
author: Whitney S.

description:
We went to Woodhouse Fish Company for lunch.  We were the first guests in the restaurant.  The young lady who waited on us was very nice and personable. 

We ordered the Calamari appetizer, Lobster roll, and Tuna Cheeseburger daily special. Sorry I can't remember the name of the particular tuna. It was very tasty though.

Calamari appetizer was very good. Nice tender calamari, not to much breading and not dried out nor overly chewy. The sauces were pretty good- one tasted like Thou Island which I normally hate but it had a smokey, bacon flavor that was quite good.

Lobster roll was delicious.  A little pricey but I was glad I ordered it. It was huge with lots of nice, fresh lobster in it. Not 'lobster-esque molded white fish substance'. Large, juicy fresh chunks of lobster in a surprising light mayo-y sauce. It was white like mayo but not heavy and cloying. You could still taste the lobster even with the sauce. So glad the husband doesn't like shellfish so I could have this all by myself.

Tuna Cheeseburger was tasty. Husband wished there was just a hair less cheese on it though.  Fish just seems like it shouldn't/wouldn't go well with cheese but this worked.

This is a nice friendly restaurant. It was fun to sit near the window and watch the San Franciscans go by doing their thang.  Can't wait for my next lunch date.
author: Mary P.

description: The food presentation and grade was great but I noticed a lot of little flies and insects that really made me question the cleanliness of the restaurant.if they could please rid themselves of all insects from their restaurant it would of been the best spot to eat at.
author: Federico V.

description:
Looking to celebrate a milestone with co-workers, we headed for lunch at Woodhouse Fish Company.  Upon walking in, we were seated right away and hooked up with menus and ice water on a warmer day.  The dining room was more diner than fine dining but very cool and comfortable.  
I ordered an Arnold Palmer and got one of the coolest APs ever!  A make-it-yourself version with a small iced tea, lemonade and simple syrup served together to be mixed by you!  It was really cool.
Then I started to spot the food at other tables and my mouth started watering.  I ended up with a crab sandwich and boy was I happy I did.  Fresh crab on warm sourdough with melted cheese.  Amazing!
The fries were crispy and hot and my co-workers salmon salad looked very good.  We wanted to order dessert but didn't have room in the end.  With food this good, I know dinner is popular.  I asked the server about dinner and he said there's usually a wait since the don't take reservations.  I don't know about waiting but if you drive by and don't see a line, I highly recommend stopping in for awesome seafood!
Parking is tough on this street.
author: Pablo R.

description: I guarantee you'll be happy with whatever you order. Food us amazing, fresh, and seasoned delicately stop you can really enjoy the natural flavours. Tuesdays have dollar oysters!
author: Caleb O.

description: First time trying the lobster roll and crab roll. Thought it was pretty good, but I wasn't too impressed. The bread was nice and buttery, but the meat didn't have enough flavor. Tasted a lot better after I drenched it in lemon.
author: Tina L.

description: This place knows how to cook fish, among other things.  The other couple of bad reviews further down the page are WAY off the mark and unreasonable, so pay them no mind.  I am a local and have eaten here twice..and CAN NOT WAIT until I can eat there again; mouth watering!!!!!  The first time I believe I ordered a pasta dish which was delish!  This time, I ordered THE BAJA STYLE FISH TACOS!  Baby BABaaaaaaY!  I love me some fish tacos!  These were the best I have had! Woooo!  Lightly battered and extremely crunchy Cod with a bit of cabbage, pico de gallo, avocado and chipotle aioli (fantastic, even though I hate mayo)!  They give you 3 generous tacos, the fish is moist with a light crispy batter and the flavor is FANtastic. The CRISPY CALAMARI is also fried in a light crispy batter, so one can actually taste the fish, served again with the spicy chipotle aioli; fabulous.  THE MANHATTAN CLAM CHOWDER was also done just right and the CHOCOLATE MOUSSE W/PEACHES (special of the day) was rich and just as delicious as it was unique.  My dad made some sort of noise after the first bite of his bread pudding, served with homemade whipped cream and "caramel" which is really more butterscotch; he said it was the best he ever had!  That's saying a lot, since he is not effusive! The service was pretty good too!  They get busy soon, so try to come early; especially for parking!  Oye! They also have oysters!
author: Delicious B.

description:
During a Girl's Weekend in SF, we were in the mood for a seriously good seafood lunch.  After reading reviews for this place, we decided to give this place a try.

Considering how many people raved about the Lobster Roll, several of us ordered them with the intent of sharing.  $26 for a 6 ounce sandwich isn't cheap, but we all desperately wanted to try it and decided to supplement our meals with various appetizers.  

For starters, we had calamari and clam chowder with Sourdough bread.  I can honestly say, we started the meal off wrong.  The calamari, which I would consider a staple dish when it comes to seafood, was absolutely disgusting.  It was undercooked, soggy, bland, and heavy on the batter.  Considering this place is called the FISH COMPANY, you think they would be able to do seafood justice, but NO, they couldn't get calamari right.  Seriously, I've had better calamari at boba cafes all over town than I had here at this place.  

As for the clam chowder, it was decent.  Flavorful? Yes, for the most part, but really heavy on the potatoes.  Don't get me wrong, I love potatoes, but this isn't called potato chowder, its called CLAM chowder.  Thus, I was unimpressed by their soup. 

Moving on to the main dish, we all had split Lobster Rolls.  Well, you can probably assume by my one star rating, this meal definitely wasn't up to par.  The Lobster roll sounded appealing when the waitress described it, 6 ounces of claw and tail meat tossed in an aioli sauce then placed into a Sourdough roll that is buttered and toasted.  Boy, was I wrong.  First, I was caught off guard by the fact that the sandwich was cold.  To make things worse, the roll was more like a thick slice of sourdough bread that must have been toasted at 6 AM in the morning.  The bread was soggy and just as cold as the lobster meat.  Then, to make matters worse, I found three pieces of shells in my sandwich.  Definitely a turn off to this restaurant.  

My recommendations: GO SOMEPLACE ELSE!!! The food is disgusting, the service is nothing to be desired, and the prices are definitely not worth it.  If you want better seafood than this place, go to Long John Silvers.  But, if you don't mind not having seafood, you're in Japan Town, so stop by some other local eateries, otherwise you'll leave this restaurant with an empty wallet and a dissatisfied stomach.  The only thing that helped saved my appetite was the short walk to The Fillmore Bakeshop half a block away.
author: Merisa M.

description:
Was feeling like crap from some sort of respiratory congestion so I decided, quite justifiably I think, to leave for home early from work. Then I realized that I had nothing in the fridge and couldn't bear to even consider shopping for then cooking dinner for my sad little party of one. 

Then Vincent K. recommended that I give this place a try now that they have a newly opened Fillmore location and I gave them a call to order the Lobster Roll and a bowl of Clam Chowder to go. I'll admit - $25 for your party of one dinner to be eaten on my bed in front of the TV is a little steep... BUT - worth it =)

The Lobster Roll was amazingly packed with shellfish goodness and smothered with a delicious sauce in an equally delicious roll. My only complaint: not enough!!

The clam chowder was also good albeit a little heavy for my taste. Best of all the person I spoke to on the phone and the servers I picked up from were sooo nice and genuinely love the food they bring out. I told them how I almost considered getting a crab sandwich at Fisherman's Wharf as my feel better meal and they both cried out in unison "Noooooo!! You made the right choice."

Oh boy! Did I ever!!
author: Christina L.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday for during their happy hour and got $1 Oysters.  We ordered 4 dozen. They were delicious!!

also tried the the LOBSTER ROLL: it was a sandwich that came with fries.  It's not too big in portion, but it was absolutely DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!!!!  The lobster was so sweet, juicy and buttery.  It was perfect!  I would go there again just to get this.  It is as good as all the other yelpers say it is. So definitely give it a try!

SEARED AHI TUNA WITH HEIRLOOM TOMATOES: lovely! the tomatoes were juicy and sweet the tuna was good, but was kind of lacking something in flavor. Can't quite put my finger on it. But it wasn't too bad.

FRIED CALAMARI: still as good as the last time I had it. 

For dessert we ordered:

STRAWBERRY SHORTCAKE: not your typical strawberry shortcake. I thought it was good, but the cake wasn't cake like.  It tasted more like a biscuit with a consistency of a scone.  I'm used to having fluffy shortcakes that are easy to fork out, unlike this one where it was hard like a cookie. It was filled with fresh whipped cream and strawberries.  It was still very very delicious, just not what I was expecting when we ordered it.

BREAD PUDDING: SOOOOOO goood. This was the better of the two desserts.  It came in stick form and each stick of bread had a somewhat crispy out side but when you bite into it, it's soft and doughy. Went very well with the whipped cream and caramel.  This won our hearts over the strawberry shortcake. YUMMY!

Our party was trying to chat it up and enjoy our food, but we felt really rushed. The bus boys kept on tryin to take our plates away before we were really done. They didn't offer a dessert menu until we asked. They rushed to give us our bill.  THAT WAS NOT COOL!!!
author: Sarah F.

description:
Because every meal is important... 

First Stop: On the whim we stopped here before a movie. There have been several times we wanted to try the cute little restaurant, but there is always a line out the door(must be good). Finally the "line" was a reasonable wait. We sat and had the most helpful, friendly waiter. He described the dish I inquired about as if he was making it for us. My mouth was watering! The food came out promptly and we were impressed with every bite. 

Second Stop: Pretty much the same amazing experience. 

Third Stop: My Mom and I enjoyed a little vino with our fish for a beautiful afternoon lunch... It was simply divine. 

Fourth Stop: Ut oh... Someone dropped the ball. We ordered immediately after being seated. I had an ice tea to start. We ordered a starter that came out in a reasonable amount of time. After we were done with our starter, I had a refill on my ice tea. We chit chatted and waited... I had another refill on my ice tea... We chit chatted and waited... My ice tea was empty, my water was empty... It was now 45 minutes after we finished our starter. A refill on my ice tea and wallah food arrived. My Stuffed artichoke was sparely stuffed and the lobster roll looked sloppy. Both of which we have had before and was amazing so we knew what to expect. Boo... 

Fifth Stop: Hopefully we will find out soon. For now it is still a "Woowhoo" in my book.
author: Dee C.

description: Food was 5 star, but the hostess did not understand how to do basic math so it took us 50 mins to get seated.  It should only have been 20 mins. One of the staff provided complimentary onion rings for the inconvenience.
author: Matthew D.

description: Marvelous fish restaurant. Small place, not too loud (perfect to take your visiting parents) and good service. Definitely recommend getting the premium oysters. The taste is just way better for that one extra dollar. Also the clams and ciopinno were outstanding. Don't forget their specials! Simply can't say anything bad about this place. It gets crowded at night but you can easily drop by for lunch.
author: Patricia D.

description:
We had dinner here on a Sunday. We both had clam chowder to start, which was excellent. Unfortunately it was by far the best thing about the meal. Both of us found our mains lacking in 'oomph' in the taste department - the ingredients were clearly fresh and good quality, and all was cooked well, but the flavours just didn't inspire as they should at this price point. 
Service was great and the atmosphere was good too. Shame about the food.
author: Gareth E.

description: Very neat place, although a little stuffy. The tables are really close together so you will probably get a butt in your face at some point. They also have no electronic way to call your name from the list, which in SanFran is something I expect. Food is good, a little on the pricey side. Staff is very nice and accommodating.
author: Mila G.

description:
Came in on a Tuesday and forgot to get me some $1 oysters. GAH so sad!

Lobster roll was delish! The flaky, buttery bread tasted so good with the lobster filing. I got the 3oz size because we shared the calamari, but I could definitely see myself finishing every last morsel of the 6oz one. Comes with fries and coleslaw, but I could've done without the fries. A little too over-fried and crispy for me, even though I love my fries crispy rather than mushy/soggy.

Fish and chips were very well cooked. The beer batter was light and not too..batter-y. Definitely one of the better fish and chips I've had in a while. 

Iceberg louie salad had a good chunk of crab in it. A delicious, healthier option if you don't want all the fried, buttery goodness of everything else on the menu :) Next time I'd ask for dressing on the side because it was a little too saucy.

Loved the novelty of the DIY Arnold Palmer!
author: Moraia W.

description: I really think this place is cute BUT have you seen the crab cakes?  They were the size of quarters. I should of taken a picture.  I'm sure I have more stars in mind for this place in the future but right now I'm reeling from the miniature crab cakes....do not order them unless you are a very light eater!
author: Wesley W.

description: I've only been here once but it was an amazing night!! The wine, the cheese, the fish everything was excellent. The flavors in everything were perfect, the portions and the dessert is also a must try!!
author: Meher S.

description:
Always a line in the evenings - give yourself extra time.   Close seating so if you're looking for something private/intimate, probably not the best place.   but the food is phenomenal and big portions. 

Oysters were amazing!!  So good.   Perfect start to the dinner. 

Ggot the lime scallop appetizer (menu of the day item) and it was fabulous as well.

Cioppino was delicious and enormous - get this to share (in addition to some other awesome items like the crab sandwich) and order another side of garlic bread for the broth because its just THAT good.
author: Brittany R.

description: Service & atmosphere were great.  Quality of food was very good. 3 Stars due to complete lack of flavor.  Soft shell crab BLT on old school east coast hot dog buns (think Texas toast  folded in half with ends sealed to form pocket-Wicked) but the crab had no flavor. Fish & chips were the same.  Excellent quality fish but batter had no flavor at all.  New England clam chowder was tasty but purist will find it had extra flavor youre not used to and a reddish tint to the chowdah. $60 tab with 1 can of beer & soda.  Not on our repeat list.
author: lynda m.

description: It was super busy and crowded on a Wednesday night (8:30).  I wound up just ordering some takeout....which was an order of calimari.  It was out pretty fast and I walked 8minutes back. To my hotel.  They were still crispy and hot!  Fried perfectly, light and airy....not greasy and heavy.   They were definitely fresh!  Loved the marinara and the ranch (???) dipping sauces!   Very craveable!
author: Grace T.

description:
amazing

living in chicago makes me want to get seafood anywhere coastal i go. so here we are and ordered

lobster roll extra lobster - fresh lobster piled high on the bun, heaven
clam chowder - so much clams!

will come back for more seafood!
author: Char Y.

description: We had clam chowder, lobster roll and crab melt sandwich! All were really good! I like lobster roll better than others :)
author: A Cream Puff With Apricots D.

description:
5 Stars means I would be very sad to never eat here again.

Am addicted to their grilled artichoke and sea food plate.  There is nothing not to like:

1.Artichokes roasted to perfection with great spices
2. seafood (shrimp and crab) fresh and delicious
3. grilled cheese bread yummm
4. and all of this on top of a lovely beet salad

Keep up great work folks!
author: Lev E.

description:
Date & Time:  Saturday April 11, 2009 @ 1:30pm
Company:  Michael
Crowd:  Small Groups of Hipsters & Neighborhood Peeps in Marc Jacobs
Atmosphere:  Charming
Decor:  New England Summer Shack.  Planked Floors.  Oyster Bar w/ Red TB Stools, Tightly-Packed Banquettes & Wood Tables for Deux & Quatre  
Service:  Friendly & Efficient
Imbibe:  Arnold Palmer & Lemonade.  Wine & Beer Available on the 20th When They Open for Dinner
Devour:  Clam Chowder, Cioppino & Lobster Rolls
Total:  $53.37
author: Genevieve Y.

description: This place is so good I can die! Lobster roll, crab roll, and NE chowder are all must try items. Not crowded sat eve and great staff.
author: Loraena J.

description:
What a wonderful place.  Feels like you're in the Hamptons as it reminds me of the movie "Something's Gotta Give" as they play "La Vie En Rose" while starring at a wall long picture of the beach while eating tasty seafood.

We've walked by Woodhouse Fish many, many times and have seen lot of people waiting in line and enjoying their dinner.  Finally before watching Avengers we got a table and had dinner here.  Three lobster rolls, one soft shell crab blt (I learned through GQ that soft shell crab is actually known as soft crab), fried calamari and oysters.  

The lobster roll at $26 is a bit pricey but it's lobster so what do you expect?  There are a ton of lobster meat that is for sure.  The hoagie bun was perfectly grilled.  There was so much lobster meat that it falls out when you eat it.  I'm a huge fan of soft shell crab and the blt is a great way to put the crab to use.  Big enough and lots of flavor, it is definitely a better deal than the lobster roll at $16.  It was a special so it may not be there the next time.  The bun again was perfectly cooked just like the bun on the lobster roll.

I'm not a huge oyster fan but the gf and her brother said it was good.  The fried calamari while on the smaller side, was well made, crispy but not over fried.  

Service was good and drinks such as the house wine for $5 is a good deal.  I'll definitely come back and try other items next time.
author: Pierre L.

description: This restaurant has fresh lobster and oysters. We like the food here much however our waitress provided very bad service. What a pity!
author: Angie H.

description: 25 min wait for dinner on a Friday night, not too bad. We had the grilled artichokes, the 3 oz (small size) crab roll, lobster roll, and the oyster/pork belly po-boy. My po-boy was ok, but not sensational - the oyster was better than the pork belly. My companions' meals seemed very good, and they seemed to really enjoy their food. The fries were sensational. Nice cute place.
author: June W.

description:
Went here for dinner on Tuesday for their $1 Oyster deal!  We ordered 38 oysters, and they were a great deal--if you're okay with having x-small oysters. In my opinion, for raw oysters, eating x-small ones are the best, because the taste isn't too overwhelming. But not filling at all because they were way too small. Some oyster barely had a half inch of meat on them. 

The oysters were tender and fresh, and the service was fast. 
We also ordered The Clam Chowder and Fried Calamari dishes. The Clam Chowder was kind of watery instead of the expected chunky and thick, but it was still good chowder. The seasoning wasn't too salty, and it was very subtle. The fried calamari was probably my SO and my favorite dish out of the three things we ordered. The batter they were fried it was just the right amount, and it stayed crispy around the calamari. The batter stayed on the calamari as you bite into it instead of falling off, so that was pleasant.

For the size of the restaurant, they do a good job of making sure their customers are comfortable and well-served.

I've been hearing and reading much about their lobster roll, so that's something I think I'll have to go back and try next! I would highly recommend this place for a nice dinner. Plan on heading back soon!
author: Jason T.

description:
GF and I came in for lunch after walking up from the Cherry Blossom Festival @ Japantown.  Our hostess/server was very cheery and answered our questions with a nice smile (not the creepy kind).  And for those wondering about the DIY Anrnold Palmer, it comes as a glass of lemon juice with two small carafes of iced tea and simple syrup, allowing you to add as much or little sugar as you please.  

We ordered a bowl of 'Hartford' clam chowder, fried ipswich clams, and a side of fries.  Very tasty - ALL OF IT!  Hartford chowder is the New England chowder with a splash of Manhattan.    The clams are fried with the belly so you get the same taste as eating oysters.  Breading was not too thick or oily.  The fries were cut about the same as mcD's but fried to a nice golden sunset brown.  Also was not too oily.

We would go back here for lunch or dinner w/o hesitation, maybe on a Tuesday when they have their oyster special.  The dungeness crab roll might satisfy my craving till next crab season.
author: Allen L.

description:
Totally yum (and affordable too)! I'll be back for sure.

Recommends:
-1st place: parchment baked halibut w/ spinach and tomatoes
-2nd place: baked sea bass with risotto, arugula, walnut pesto
-Sides! i really liked my spinach and corn off the cob :)

The low point of the night: tuna tartar (not bad, but not good)

Fun things:
-DIY lemonade - comes in 3 parts and you get to mix it how you want
-The squid on the ceiling and the $10 bill shellacked to the floor under a table
author: Priscilla T.

description: Cute little place in adorable neighborhood.  Menu was interesting,  had a hard time choosing.  Went with the mussels, they were great.  Also had the strawberry shortcake which was AMAZING!  Overall recommend for a casual night out.
author: Sarah E.

description:
First off, review of take out only. When picked up though the place is tiny and always busy (good sign!) Well finally found a seafood type place close to CPMC Pacific campus. YAY. First off 2 time eating there; first exceptional, second mediocre... but due to location and price of cioppinno will need more experiences to get a better understanding if the second time was a fluke?! Hoping they go 2/3! 

Looked at reviews said good fish and chips and good ciopinno (my favorite) so since im stuck in the hospital my mom (allergic to seafood except fried stuff) went and picked it up since they dont do delivery (boo! should delivery especially to sick patients in need of good food in hospital! haha). Mom was pleased with the fish and chips ($12.50 or so for 3 pieces), though only 2 bites of coleslaw. Both loved the cioppinno ($19)- spicy, full of mussels and clams and crab (though scallops little overdone) and huge prawns deeelish, hit the spot (Mom just sipped the broth). Got combination cocktail though for $15 was VERY disappointed 2 prawns and 2 bites of crab and a box full of lettuce... pussnuggets! 
 Next day mom and aunt went in for lunch and got clam chowder, heresay is good and a crab melt heresay is good that full of crab! 
Now to my second experience. Cioppinno again and tried just the plain prawn cocktail, asked said 5 were in it for $10 ( really wanted prawns mmmk) but when I got it there was 4. then I got half a crab for $12 I think. I "snuck" outta the hospital myself cause mom was gone and picked up my food... maybe cause I wasted about 20-30 minutes site seeing around fillmore street it affected the taste. Cioppinno had NO spice :( but still ate it and was still good relatively just loved that kick. The crab was steamed with white wine, didnt really hit the spot for me unfortunately... 
I ate it all that night though, no leftovers and even though slightly disappointed will be back to try clam chowder myself, cioppinno again, steamed mussels and/or clams, and artichokes and crab entree... will steer clear of overpriced cocktails though. 

Just so glad it opened and is so close to CPMC! I know their menu is online but still added prices so people dont have to click a million links to get an idea of costs. Also uploaded pictures of take out boxes. Also noticed that Market Street location is slightly cheaper and has couple more options on menu.
author: Tabitha E.

description: This place never disappoints.  I've tried nearly everything on the menu, but favorites are the clam chowder, the crab or lobster rolls, and the fish tacos.  They usually have some great specials too.
author: Jessica K.

description: I absolutely love everything about this place. Staff is very attentive and also knowledgable about the different oyster selections which is great. The food is to die for. I go between a lobster roll or the stuffed artichoke. Everything has so much flavor and very fresh tasting.
author: Amanda M.

description: Pretty good. Had the lobster roll. The bread was nicely toasted, buttery but not overly. It could use a little more lobster to fill up the roll for the price. The fish and avocado was good too. The fish was juicy and nicely battered. I like the place for the price but prob don't love it.
author: Carrie T.

description: Had the lobster roll and some oysters based on yelp reviews. I though both tasted great. They actually do French fries really well. Simple but good. Service was prompt but only sorta friendly. I will go back
author: Joel J.

description:
I was going through an oysters craze period for like, three months. Maybe four. Ok maybe I still love oysters. After going to Tomales Bay for oysters, I found out that the city has a bunch of places that do $1 oysters on Tuesday so I was excited to test all of them out. 

I went to Woodhouse one Tuesday and it was AWESOME. We got about a dozen and a half oysters each... and I got the grilled crab, which was amazing. So soft, so tender, so much awesome butteryness. My friend got the lobster roll which was alright. That's pretty impressive given I'm from Boston and hate lobster rolls. 

The next week, I meant to go to another place for oysters but... Woodhouse was so good that... I didn't see a reason why I should go somewhere else that I didn't like as much... And then a few weeks later... the same thing happened. So basically whenever I crave oysters and it's a Tuesday, I'll be at Woodhouse :)
author: Kara Y.

description: I loved this place.  The fish and chips are awesome!  But since I didn't order them, I enjoyed them from my husband's plate.  I did try the crab melt sandwich and it was awesome. Love the thinly cut french fries.  The service was awesome.  They made sure our drinks were filled to the brim at all times. Will definitely return soon.
author: Christine P.

description: The atmosphere here is ocean and boats. We had the fish and chips and crab with tomato linguine. The fish was moist and hot served with French fries. The crab was delicious and the pasta was also good. The space is not too big but we didn't have to wait long.
author: Jennie W.

description:
Tuesdays = $1 oysters.

Not convincing enough??

Fine.

1) Even though the menu is only one page, you get selection. 

huh??

Example - They serve clam chowder (no duhhh .. typical right?? ) Well, you get to choose between the classic, mild, or mix -- Try the mix, it won't disappoint.

2) The waiters & waitresses are so relaxed and attentive it gives off a home-feeling kind of vibe.

3) Once again, Dollar oysters on Tuesdays
author: Brenda C.

description:
Fried whole belly clams
Steamed clams

They were awesome!!!  I would come back for these items.  Unfortunately, those are the only two items that I would come back for.

Fish and chips...........it's ok.  I really do understand trying to be "all straight from the sea" and "don't do too much to the fish so that you can taste the freshness".  But come on!!!!  Season the damn fish!!!

The crab melt...........it was just OK.  The fries were good.  

I wasn't really too impressed with this place.  It's clean, the food is good, service is prompt.  I guess the unseasoned fish and chips really got to me. 

It's a 4 star place for sure..........barely.
author: jason g.

description:
I wasnt too impressed with their lobster rolls. the sandwich is ridiculously small for $18, comes with a small side of fries and coleslaw. the picture makes the lobster roll look so good, but it was definetely ok at best. 

the clam chowder was tasty though. ate here with my gf and ended with a $50 check....for lunch..shoulda just went to san tung and got wings haha
author: Whitney Y.

description:
This place reminds me of all the New England seafood places I went to growing up. Whether it's a clam shack on the side of the highway or a more upscale restaurant with a high-quality catch of the day, Woodhouse embodies the great aspects of many different types of traditional seafood restaurants. They even have the right sides to accompany everything on the menu (slaw, fries, etc.) and all types of fish and shellfish are done completely right.

This is by no means a trendy SF seafood restaurant so if that's what you're looking for, I think the trendiest thing you'll find on the menu are artichokes. But if you want traditional, dependable, quality seafood this is a great go-to that I will definitely be going back to.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Lobster. Rolls.

That's all I needed to see.

After attempting to eat at another establishment, my friend and I decided this would be the next best thing after such a disappointment. We stumbled in (literally because we were dying from hunger by then) around 7 and were seated at the bar after a 30 minute wait. We decided to split the lobster roll and two crab cakes and it ended up being the perfect amount of food for us. The lobster roll comes in two sizes, a smaller one with 3 oz. of lobster meat (for $18) and a larger one with 6 oz. of lobster meat (for $26). We chose the latter since we were splitting and I was pleasantly surprised at how much lobster was piled on top of that sandwich. Lobster was literally spilling out of the sandwich. It's definitely one of those things that you can't be all neat and proper about so don't try to. The crab cakes were fantastic as well. Great texture and flavor, and they were somehow both light tasting and filling at the same time.

The service was great too. I don't know if it's because we sat at the bar, but our water glasses were never empty and everyone was friendly and personable. 

I'm officially a fan.
author: Anna T.

description:
Came here for $1 oyster Tuesdays and it was crowded. Came around 6pm and did not have to wait. What's cool is that you can order any number of oysters that you want (meaning you don't have to order by the dozen). They do pick out small and big oysters into your mix but I feel like the smaller oysters taste better. 

Also had the Maine lobster roll which was the real deal. Loved it. The only thing I didn't like about it was the celery bits. The fries that came with it was good but some where a little overdone. Also had the fish tacos (comes with 3) and that was good too.

Decent pricing for delicious food. Friendly staff and casual environment.
author: Sophia K.

description:
I tried this place for the first time and thought it was pretty good. We shared the Octopus salad to start and it was plated with purple potatoes. The octopus was nicely seasoned and grilled. For my main dish I had the Hawaiian Tombo Tuna special..served on a heirloom tomato salad. I thought they went overboard with the pesto dressing on the salad..making the plate a bit too oily for my taste. However, the tuna was fresh and perfectly seared. 
I'd like to try their chowder and fish and chips at a later date.
author: Mimi T.

description: This review base on Tuesday special deal $1 oysters it's fresh and cheap we ordered couple dozens and fried. Delicious for lunch time. This place is busy on Tuesday ! But I be able to seat right the Way!
author: Katie E.

description:
Popped in here for a quick lunch the other day and liked it!  Had the three piece fish and chips ($14) and a glass of Frog's Leap sauvignon blanc.  Everyone was really nice and professional.  The staff worked together as a team and it seemed like my water was constantly being refilled for me...nice!    As I started on my wine, I discovered that my wine glass had something stuck on the inside and the waitperson took care of it immediately for me.  Not only that, but I noticed that when it came back, the level of the wine was actually slightly higher, not lower, so guessing she might have actually replaced it rather than just pouring it into a new glass.  During my lunch, my wine was served cafe-style in a regular glass which was fine, although the romantic in me longed for traditional stemware.

$14 for a three piece fish and chips sounded like a veritable bargain after the $23.99 at Fish (restaurant) in Sausalito recently.  There was even a two piece option at $12 for lighter appetites although I certainly would not fall under that category.  The special of the day was a whole bronzino for $25.  That sounded so appealing that I came so close to ordering it, but stuck to my guns and ordered what I originally came for.  I'm a sucker for whole fish, done right.   I still remember a most memorable whole striped bass with a bottle of Greco di Tufo I once had at Poggio in Sausalito.

Anyway, back to the fish and chips...the batter was light and crispy, the fish perfectly cooked.  Fries were good although there were a lot of little pieces towards the end.  Loved that long painting along the wall of a beach scene...thought it was really cool and thoroughly appropriate for a long and skinny dining room in a seafood restaurant.  All in all, a delightful place for seafood in the area...I will most definitely be back.
author: Roy N.

description:
We arrived on a Saturday afternoon to a packed restaurant.  I wasn't surprised because my coworker had warned me of how popular this place was.  I didn't mind the relatively short wait for a table and the time it took for the waitress to greet us at our table because it was visibly busy at the time.

Sadly, neither of us was impressed by the food overall:
- Clam chowder:  pretty good, nice big chunks of clam
- Lobster roll:  the bread itself was plain and the lobster was just okay.  Nothing to rave about.
- Stuffed artichoke:  I expected this to be a bit more filling, but it was essentially some artichokes on top of a salad.  It was good...but not really worth it for its price

When our food came, the lunch crowd had died down and there weren't too many people at the restaurant.  However, we still had trouble flagging down our waitress for water, and waited a good amount of time for our check...and then waited some more for her to run the credit card.  We left a bit disappointed.  I can see why people might like this place, (how can you not like a giant octopus hanging from the ceiling), but I don't think I'll be back anytime soon.
author: Suz S.

description:
Bad service makes my food taste bad.

It was my first time eating at Woodhouse Fish Co, and boy, did it disappoint!  The server was knowledgeable, and definitely took his time describing the specials, but I -- in my never ending quest to find the most delicious fried fish -- ordered the fish and chips.  Not being a fry fan, I substituted my fries for onion rings.  He told me that it would be an extra $1 to sub; I told him that was fine.  When our food arrived by a different server, I pleasantly told the guy that I had ordered onion rings, not fries.  He told our server, and our server came by and said that it was "[his] fault, [I] didn't put in the order."  I swear, I didn't b*tch him out.  I just don't eat fries.  It's a waste to give them to me.  So I tried to give it back, but he just had a side order of onion rings come by.

He spent the rest of our time there avoiding me and only talking directly to my friend.  When our bill came, to my surprise, he had charged the full amount for a side of onion rings.  What?  Wait, he freely admitted that the mistake was his, and he still charged me the full amount?  I thought he'd just charge me the $1 that he told me he was going to charge me.  And, FYI, if that had happened, I'm a much more generous tipper.

If I was eating at a hole-in-the-wall, I wouldn't expect good service.  I don't expect bad service from nice restaurants.  There are places where the food is average, but the service makes it a staple in my regular restaurant rotation.  This would not be it.  It always amazes me that service doesn't get any better in a recession because that's the only thing that can make me look twice nowadays.
author: marian p.

description: I don't think they make bad food.  My fiance and I come here almost every time we go to catch a movie at Kabuki and they have had fantastic food and good service every time.  It seems that they get busy but we have never waited too long.  He looooves their dungeness crab roll which I tend to steal a bit of and I always go for the crab cakes which come with a delicious salad!  They offer 2 or 3 crab cakes and I usually go for the 2 because the salad is so good I know I will eat that as well and that is plenty filling.
author: Christina H.

description:
Saw a review of this place on "Check Please, Bay Area" and had the chance to stop in this past Sunday after running the San Francisco Marathon.  WOW.  My wife and I both had the lobster rolls with fries and a beer.  I've spent a great deal of time in Maine with my lobster-man uncle who fishes in Booth Bay Harbour and I can honestly say the rolls at Woodhouse are every bit as good as the ones I get in Maine or Boston or anywhere in New England.  Great service from a smiling, friendly staff.  Customer next to use ordered the fish and chips and I was tempted to offer a small swap just because his plate looked awesome.

You can park for free across the street in the Safeway parking lot and avoid the costly street parking.

Don;t miss this place it's worth the trip.
author: Allan A.

description:
Woodhouse seems to always have a steady flow of people coming through.  Is it the big windows and natural sunlight? The $2-$3 oysters? The massive squid figure above the door?  It's definitely something that continues to pull people in.  For me, it's the feeling that Woodhouse would fit perfectly along the Santa Monica Pier or maybe Carmel -- it really does play the part of a neighborhood seafood spot. 

I like to think of it as the perfect place for lunch on a Saturday afternoon.  The oysters are consistently fresh and delicious.  Their fish taco (fried) and fish n chips (Alaskan cod) are both crispy and pair well with their beer options.  Also, their half-crab for $14 is a steal. 

Highly recommend Woodhouse if you're in the neighborhood and craving a little bit of ocean lovin!
author: Kimya P.

description:
Woodhouse Fish Co is a great seafood place on Fillmore. The food's great, service was great, and the restaurant's nice enough for a date, family, or just hanging out. Their menu is full of great options. We ordered the dungeness crab roll and the fish & chips and were very satisified. If you get a roll I'd suggest you get the larger size (6 oz. vs 3 oz.) because their seafood is high quality, delicious, and I have a healthy appetite. 

The service was awesome and although woodhouse had a long line outside, the staff were a well oiled machine in getting people to their tables as quickly as possible. 

The restaurant itself is very well kept and isn't stuffy. I looked around and noticed there was a first date type of situation to my left and a family celebration to my right. The majority of the crowd just looked like they were out and looking for a good meal. 

Overall, I'm a fan of woodhouse with only one nit picky exception. They don't take reservations here which could've saved us some time but the wait is worth it. We'll definitely be back.
author: Ken C.

description:
Stop by this place just to try to very much talked about lobster roll. I got the big size order of it since I was expecting goodness...but it didn't meet my expectation. Yes the roll was stuffed up with lobsters but taste way it was just a little lacking.  Needed some salt and was missing that extra buttery favor that a few had mention also. For the price it wasn't wont it for me as I wasn't satisfy fully.  Maybe I was just not a big fan of the lobster claw and 1/2 of the roll feels like it was that inside.

Well definitely go back to try the $1 oysters if I get the chance to.
author: Jackk Y.

description: Land lovers and ocean dwellers unite in this smaller-sized,  cutesy seafood bistro.  Staff is super friendly and made up for our longer than expected wait time with fried delights (no reservations,  call to put your name on the list,  small area inside to keep warm as you drool over served food).  Sea creatures beware!  You may end up sautéed with saffron,  fried to a golden crispy brown,  steamed with wine and garlic or shelled on a platter.  Reasonable prices and  hearty portions.  Tacos were yummy but modest in presentation.  Grilled artichoke comes with cheesy bread and salad.  Linguine was a winner.  Played eye spy with tasty,  sugary sweet endings with whipped cream and caramel on fellow diners' tables but couldn't squeeze in another bite.
author: Amireh G.

description: I had a small lobster roll.  The lobster meat was really good, but I thought the bread was bit on a greasy side.  I also had a cup of Manhattan clam chowder which was very yummy :)  Service was better than some other places in this city.  For seafood dishes, I'd come back for sure!
author: Peaceful S.

description:
This is one of my all time favorite neighborhood spots. Cioppino, crab cakes, crab rolls (which are better than the lobster rolls in my opinion), Scrimshaw, Anchor Steam, and onion rings.

Let's spend some time on the onion rings. Thick cut, golden brown and slightly sweet, with a healthy crunch. Add a dollop of ketchup and a splash of tabasco and you've got the world's most perfect onion rings. Yes, the world's!

The server with the striking green eyes (I forget his name) no longer works there, but the service is still great. 50 bucks will get you drinks and food for 2, incl tip & tax.

They don't take reservations and during prime feeding hours, you can expect a 30 min to 1 hr wait, but... TIP: Call ahead and add your name to the wait list. It's one of the few places that let you do that and be seated if you are missing 1 or 2 in your party.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Walked in here a little after 4pm for an early dinner.  I wasn't sure if it was too early but the place had a few sets of diners eating either a late lunch or early dinner themselves so it was okay.  Once our waiter gave us the menu and water, he didn't come back for awhile but everything went fine once he came back to take our order.  

Got the cioppino, soft shell crab sandwich (special on the board), 2 pieces fish and chips, and a bowl of clam chowder.  The chowder was pretty good, had more clam pieces than I remember getting from Boudin's on the pier.  Not watery and just the right thickness.  Still can't say it's the best I've ever had, but pretty good.  The fish was hot and crispy and didn't taste overly greasy.  Loved the coleslaw and fries that came with it.  Wish they gave a bit more coleslaw though cuz it came in a teeny tiny cup.  The fries were crispy the whole time.  Tartar sauce was great too.  I also loved the soft shell crab sandwich.  Who wouldn't love a deep fried crab sandwiched between two pieces of butter toasted bread?  Yum!  

The cioppino was huge.  Enough to feed two people.  It was good too, lots of fish, small scallops, giant crab claw and a smaller one, clams, and two kinds of mussels.  One of the mussels tasted yucky but the other seafoods were quite good.  The garlic sourdough dipped in the seafood-tomato sauce was fantastic.  I thought the prices were reasonable given that it's seafood and besides that one bad mussel, everything else tasted very fresh.  

Ended the dinner with the bread pudding.  I wouldn't be able to eat it all by myself but I had the folks to help so we finished everything except for the fish and chips, which we had packed to go.  Overall a very good meal.  I liked it more also because we were away from all the tourist traffic on the pier.  Soooo crowded.
author: Annie C.

description:
This place is definitely a great representation of San Francisco, the decor brings the restaurant to life. The food was great and service was excellent. 

Food: 
Clam chowder- creamy goodness and the perfect comfort food
Oysters- Fresh and good
Cioppino- Amazing, full of clams, mussels, shrimp, fish, baby scallops, and crab meat. The cheese bread that comes with the stew, is a perfect complement.
Sourdough bread pudding- the name says it all but it still does not do it justice. I did not taste the sourdough much but it was still amazing. The cream with the sauce on a crunchy piece of the bread pudding is to die for. 

I highly recommend this place!
author: Elliot T.

description:
Good. That's how I'd rate this restaurant all around. There was a bit of a wait for a table, and we were served beverages while waiting, which was a nice thought. The place is a little loud, and my dining companion is a little hard of hearing, so he was having a little difficulty with the noise level (there's nothing to dampen it). Speed of service was average, server has helpful but with a somewhat bland personality. 

Food: pleasantly surprised, the food itself would be 4 stars. Start was shrimp louie salad, which was OK, if a bit overdressed. Crab roll was tasty, buttery, really nice, although more slaw would be appreciated (as well as perhaps a lighter, more tangy, less mayo-based version). Fellow diner had halibut special with risotto, nettle pesto, sprouts, and toasted walnuts. THAT dish was outstanding. Dessert was bread pudding with whipped cream and caramel sauce. Very good on that. 

One minus: drafty. The windows were open, and chilling breezes swept through regularly. Not conducive to enjoying my dinner. 

Another minus: price. I feel it's a little overpriced for what it is. Especially for someone who visits relatives back east, and is familiar with the ol' crab shack offerings, these are on the high end.
author: C N.

description: Came here for dinner with the family. Place was packed and shockingly enough there was a reasonable wait time. Service was great, friendly, and attentive. They have specials listed on the board and simple menu but everything sounded and looked amazing. We decided that we would just order a little of everything and share. We started of with tostadas, classic clam chowder, fish and chips, stuffed artichokes, and a lobster roll. As much food as that sounds for a party of 3, we demolished EVERYTHING. The tostada was light crisp and fresh, chowder was perfectly creamy with chunks of tender clams, fish and chips crispy light and flakey, stuffed artichokes were UHMAZING flavorful and huge portions of crab and shrimp stuffed in it, and the lobster roll was meaty, light, and fresh. Definitely a place to come back to when in the area. Prices are reasonable for seafood, quality and portion sizes.
author: Arlene C.

description:
For being so close to salt water, finding a good fish joint in SF  is harder than it should be. At least one that won't serve you mediocre quality fish at inflated prices.
 Woodhouse to the rescue!  and in a bustling neighborhood to boot.  Woodhouse does a great job with all their dishes. We five dined on a weekend night,  ordered everything from simple (mouthwatering)  fish and chips to whole cooked fish of the day and it was all perfectly cooked ( Suggestion: they could and should have deboned the whole fish).
Started with clam chowder, with a  real clam taste and smooth and creamy and not too salty or floury. Had a few oysters  from WA, just to check them out also fresh and nicely served with a choice of horseradish and chili sauce or just lemon.
Mains were crab cakes,&  lobster roll ( small order)  the roll was like back east with a soft buttered white Acme bread with crispy crust and a good amount of meat in a tasty but not overpowering salad sauce. Most plates had fries or roasted root vegetables on the side, which were kind of a nice surprise. Beer ( Steam) and wines were well suited, they have a house Chardonnay which went perfect with the fish.
Service was prompt and pleasant. Prices are fair for the quality of the grub.
The place is small, and  ( No Reservations) the wait in the evening for larger parties is often long on weekends.Put your name in at 6- 6:30  and go have a drink at Harrys, you'll be ready to sit by 7:30. I'd go back anytime. Nice thing is you can take the out of towners to a place for fish that is not on the Wharf.
author: Aaron Z.

description:
Took my boyfriend here for his birthday because he loves clam chowder and fish and chips. Huge hit! It was perfect!

Don't listen to the haters here on yelp about the clam chowder: it's incredibly tasty and has a great consistency, as good as any clam chowder I've had in Boston. The mussels and calamari were also great.

My boyfriend said the fish and chips were the best he's ever eaten! Score! I had a couple bites and agreed: unbeatable! So crispy on the outside, so moist on the inside, perfectly cooked. 

I had the crab cakes, and they were just okay; I wish I'd gotten the fish and chips. The stuffed artichoke is great for anyone on a low carb diet (my mom was thrilled). 

Overall, fantastic food, fair prices (for SF anyway), good service, great relaxed ambiance, and just wonderful. It's not touristy (yet), and it's family owned and run. I highly recommend it for a unique and affordable SF seafood experience.
author: Morgan M.

description:
Both times I've been here, I had amazing food!

Both times I've been here, I've gotten sick to my stomach afterwards.

:(

I really do like the restaurant, and the food is absolutely delicious.  Unfortunately, I think it's a bit too rich for my tummy, so I have to say no.  This makes me sad.
author: Tamara N.

description: A M A Z I N G oysters and fish - so fresh and tasty I ordered a second round of the Henderson's Oysters. Had a great lunch in this little shop. Cool photographs in the restrooms of old SF - and the framed TV looks like a sci-fi moving picture wall. We even found parking right in front of the restaurant, so you know the location is perfect!
author: Irresistable U.

description: Whoa! this was an amazing experience. The lobster roll was fantastic!
author: Akshaya M.

description:
This place is very very very cozy, cute, and refreshing. The ambiance is sweet with little sail boats atop crown molded walls, video of the SF bay framed like a photo on another wall, and various art work fill the location. 

The food is just right. It's not overdone, or bland. The Cioppino is SOOOO GOOD!! we wanted to drink the broth! 

What a nice place to eat on a beautiful day. I wish there were more places like this in the city becuase these guys know how to do it right!!!
author: Serina H.

description: This company had a booth at the Treasure Island Music Festival, along with 30 or so other vendors.  I went back to their booth 3 times for clam chowder throughout the day.  I'm not sure what else I need to say.  Their clam chowder is bomb, probably the best I've ever had.  The only problem with the food is that it is too addicting.
author: Peter J.

description:
This place has the BEST lobster roll in the city!  Seriously, they are unbeatable! The chunks of lobster and the sauce is truly addicting; the roll is heavenly as well, perfectly buttered and toasted.   

Not only does this place have yummy seafood, but the wedge salad is the best I've found in the city as well.  Fresh, crisp, with perfect blue cheese, this salad is unbeatable.  

Minus one star for the wait and sometimes distracted wait staff.  Overall, a top SF spot.
author: Elizabeth R.

description:
A group of friends & I came here on a Saturday night. Since they don't take reservations, we had to wait an hour for a table of 6. But with a party size of 2-4, i'm sure the wait would have been half the time. 

At any rate, the hostess came out & told us they apologized for the wait and the service was attentive for most of the evening. 

We ordered the Clam Chowder, Calamari & Stuffed Artichoke to share. The clam chowder was delicious. They were generous with their seafood portions in the chowder & the creamy texture gave them an upper edge to some of the chowder I've had at other eateries. The Calamari was ok. Breaded nicely & a great sharing dish. The Stuffed Artichoke was also another winner. It was grilled, sliced in half and stuffed with one side crab and the other shrimp. The dipping sauce was also a plus - homemade mayo? and some other side that I can't remember because i was intently focused on stuffing my face with the mayo. 

I ordered the Top Maine Lobster Roll - $18 for 3 oz. and $26 for 6 oz., i opted for the big boys club and ordered the 6 oz. It was also delicious. The butter bread and the texture of the lobster was rich & well seasoned. The Fish & Chips and that was pretty good. The batter was a bit much at times but it held a nice texture. I also noticed that their fish was proportionately generous. 

The place itself is a little small but its worth the wait. The waiter/server was informative & attentive. The seafood was fresh & proportionately priced - a place I look forward to coming back.
author: Diana J.

description: Delightful Dungeness! The Woodhouse on Market feels warm and pleasant (more historical decor on Market, more model boats here), but this location is more spacious. Still arrive a little early to get a table.
author: Bunny C.

description: Great lunch today. Everything was fresh and cooked perfectly. Started with some bbq'd oysters and had the fish and chips for the main event. Service was pleasant and efficient. Great spot and a friendly vibe. I'll be back.
author: Dan G.

description:
I LOVE the crab here. We ordered a crab, clam chowder and fries.

The crab was delicious, we got the lemon and garlic butter sauce. We ordered a whole crab for $21, pretty normal standard pricing. The crab came out,, it was precracked making it easier to eat and the best part was the meat slid right out!! Saved a lot of trouble!

The clam chowder was good as well, though I thought $5 for a small cup was a bit too pricey. There were few potatoes in there which is perfect for me, since i don't like potatoes in my chowder that much.

I didn't order the crab sandwich, but the table next to us did...it looked realllll good, that's a must try out the next time i go.
author: Carmen P.

description: We stopped by during the Fillmore Jazz Festival for a quick bite. We decided to split the fish tacos and tuna burger. The burger was good and moist but the fish tacos were pretty atrocious. The fish pieces were tiny and WAY over battered. There was less fish than your average fish stick. It was so disappointing. The place is known for crab so maybe I'll give it another chance.
author: Alice W.

description:
Woodhouse 
is
the BEST
House.

Lord, where to start. Maybe with the cute outside with windows from ceiling to almost the floor. Maybe with the fantastic aroma you are met with upon entering. Maybe with the cute and friendly servers that are so happy to see you.
Any way you slice it, we were delighted from entry to exit.

We were seated by the window, so not only did we get the great smells of entrees yet to be eaten, we had people watching all around. A small list of wines, a bit of beer and juices and teas, surely you will find something thirst quenching. 

I love a great crab cake, and theirs do not disappoint. Served with a small green salad, these are flavorful, fresh and delectable little cakes which prepared me for the utter greatness I was about to embark upon.

LOBSTER ROLLS.

I had never, not once ever had this Girl a Lobster Roll, well now, at 30 it was time. Thick, toasted Brioche forms a perfect envelope to your lobster, which is literally overflowing from this decadent sandwich. God, is there anything more perfect than the Woodhouse Fish Co. Lobster Roll?
Served with crispy matchstick fries and a bit of coleslaw, this is the sandwich to end all sandwiches.

We loved each of our entrees so much, that we decided on dessert as well. All of the dessert they had. Warm Brownie with whipped cream and chocolate sauce, sourdough bread pudding with hard whiskey sauce and apple walnut crumble, hidden under it's blanket of whipped cream. Each was was more fabulous than the next. 

There was nary an empty stomach at our table, and we were never happier with the contents!
author: Katie W.

description: We've been to Woodhouse on Market many times, but had never been to the Fillmore location. What a treat! Our server was excellent, and our lobstah rolls were filled with the most succulent, fresh, and tasty lobster we've had in a long time -- and lots of it, no skimping here! Absolutely scrumptious! Years ago, when they first opened on Market, they had their own version of dressing the lobster -- with cucumber and lemon. Thank goodness that's history. There's only one way to do it, and I'm so happy they figured that out! Can't wait to go back!
author: E. G.

description: Grabbed takeout from here for the first time -- so good! I had the cheddar cheese crab melt. Totally hit the spot!
author: Chelsea C.

description: We tried this place based on all the great Yelp reviews (thanks, guys!) and I gotta say, it was great!  I got the Crab roll and my husband got the Lobster roll and we shared both. They were both so delicious.  I really can't say one was better over the other; it just depends on which type of meat you prefer.  I also ordered a cup of NE Chowder and that was fantastic as well.  My only complaint was that the restaurant seemed to be short-staffed that night, as our waitress was waiting on all the other tables as well.  Not sure if this is normal or just a one-time thing, but it didn't bother us since we weren't in a hurry.
author: Ashlee M.

description: One of the best seafood restaurants in the city. I love their grilled sea bass!! You will get the whole fish!! :)
author: Erdem O.

description: If you are in San Francisco, you must go here. Get the lobster roll. The lobstery, buttery deliciousness.....there are no words to describe its magnificence.
author: Kristen S.

description: Came here to try the lobster roll for lunch and after 15 minutes we were seated by the bar. Restaurant was quite crowded during our meal. Have to say lobster roll is definitely OVERHYPED here. The roll itself was made of white bread that was deliciously buttered. However the lobster itself was really disappointing as it was absolutely bland in contrast to the bread. The roll came with some really good coleslaw and crisp thin fries though. Overall decent roll and nice to try but you're not really missing out.
author: Tony C.

description:
4.5 stars. But my boyfriend really loved it and so we're giving them 5 stars. Dollar oysters special on Tuesdays. We got 14, then another 10 more. They were fresh, crisp and delicious. They were somewhere from Washington, which always has great oysters.

We also split the fish and chips. Fish was crispy and light. Really really really good. The fries were great. There was a small puddle of grease left behind, which would gross most people out, but we're a big fan of fried stuff, especially when done right.
author: Cake W.

description: I came here with a friend for dinner and it was so good.  The seafood is very fresh, the way it should be.  So my friend ordered the 2piece fish and chips and I had the cioppino.  The pieces of fish were huge, anything more than that would be too much.  The cioppino came out and the broth was incredibly rich and very flavorful.  Dipping the bread in the broth to let soak up the flavors was a treat for the mouth, I wish i saved the bread last.  I also wish they deveined the shrimp.  The service was attentive as our service filled waters when needed.  I want to make cioppino and I want to ask if they would sell me their tomato based sauce used to make their cioppino.
author: A L.

description:
It's crab season again!  

What better way to celebrate letting go of the carbs that no longer serve you?  

After our burning bowl ceremony at church (No, we didn't fire up a bowl.  It's a brazier, where we sent our old unsupportive patterns up in flames.) we decided it was time to have PROTEIN.  

We were seated immediately upon entering the store.  Under a huge, framed flat-screen TV playing scenes of fishing in S.F. Bay.  Along the far wall was a row of model fishing boats and lamps from real boats, which stimulated my memory and my imagination.  I remembered fishing boats coming into Kodiak harbor so laden with ice and fish that they might not make it.  

Cioppino for My Lady, a dungeness louis salad for me, and two glasses of chardonnay ($5 each) cost us $52 + tip.  What a treat!  The crab was fresh, and more delicious than it had been in past years.  The chardonnay complemented the seafood perfectly.  I had a taste of the cioppino, and I know it would have done any North Beach restaurant proud.  

The waitress and the floor manager both made sure that we were happy with our selection, which of course we were.  

Good service, good food, and CRAB!  What are you waiting for?
author: David D.

description: Easily the best seafood restaurant in the Bay Area, and there are a lot of them. Lobster roll is the best!
author: Guido R.

description:
My friends and I went here for dinner before a show at the Fillmore.  It's only a few blocks walk from there which is very convenient.  They don't accept reservations apparently and there were already people waiting for a table before us...all a good sign.

It was busy Sunday night and we waited a little bit but not too long since we said we're ok sitting at the bar.  We ended up sharing half a dozen oysters and uni and dungeness crab pasta appetizer and i had the lobster roll.  My friends had the roasted dijon fish and the crab melt.  

The oysters were incredible fresh and was a great start to our meal.  I wanted to try the uni and crab pasta since it sounded interesting.  It was in a very light cream sauce with the uni speckled throughout it and lumps of crab meat.  It's a bit pricey for an appetizer but at least for me I would've been satisfied with this as my entree since it was a good portion.  Although it was in a cream sauce it wasn't overpowering whatsoever.  Totally worked well together.

As for my lobster roll it was good with chunks of lobster and lightly dressed with mayo and some seasonings and served with some fries and slaw.  I was getting full so I didn't get to touch my fries and slaw but my friends helped me out.  I've actually had better lobster roll at Old Port Lobster Shack in Redwood City (who would've thought) so this one was a slight let down to me.  It's still very good but I just had better elsewhere which sometimes can ruin it for you going anywhere else.

I did get a chance to take a little bite out of my friend's roasted fish and it was AMAZING.  I've never had a mustard roasted fish like that which was packed full of flavor.  Very good.

Overall service was attentive and very helpful.  I'd definitely come here again and recommend others to give it a try.
author: Kim D.

description:
Randomly stumbled upon this joint...was taking a stroll along Filmore and stopped to check out the menu.  Options and prices looked reasonable so why not...

New England clam chowder - LOTS of clams

Steamed Mussels - Great flavored broth and only $10 for the same portion size as what I've had at many fine dining restos

Crab cakes - TONS of crab and very little bread crumbs...the best!  

Great casual place for great seafood at a great price!

One other thing to note...$1 oysters on Tuesday nights!
author: Tina L.

description:
This place is so great. Cold beer, awesome fish and awesome french fries. Services is great, not in your face, and they let you take your time. When they offer you two or three pieces for the fish and chips, go with three, you will not be disappointed. Oh so good!

Going back again tonight. Twice in less than three weeks. Place was packed when I was there a few weeks ago, reminds me I need to make a resy for tonight. mmm fish n chips so good!
author: sierra s.

description:
Seafood fare with great flavor.  Not a very vast menu.  What I've enjoyed here:

1. Lobster Roll - it's good, but not as good as the Lobster shack in North Beach, which has since closed.

2.  Crab roll melt - Meh, I've had better to be honest

3.  Fish tacos were pretty good and tasty.

4.  Fish and Chips - Filling and cooked to perfection, with the right amount of crispiness without burning the batter.

5.  Make your own expensive lemonade - I love this lemonade.  Dunno why since I get charged a good penny to make it myself.
author: Khristian B.

description:
After browsing through Yelp and noticing the strength of the positive reviews for this place, I visited Woodhouse with a friend this past Friday.  Arriving at about 7:15 PM, we ended up waiting about 40 - 45 minutes for 2 seats at the counter.  

For my drink, I ordered the DIY Lemonade, which was actually a pretty cool concept.  They give you some lemon juice in ice, and serve you some soda water and simple syrup on the side so that you can adjust the drink to your liking.  It was pretty cool!  

For my entree, I tried the 3 oz. buttered dungeness crab sandwich.  The crab was great, fresh, and simple in a very nicely buttered toast.  It was also served with nice crispy french fries and a standard, but good coleslaw.  All in all, a simple, but good dinner, especially for any seafood lover.  My friend ordered the crab cakes, which he said were good.  

The ambiance of the restaurant is great as well, and parking wasn't too problematic in the neighborhood on a Friday night.
author: Daniel C.

description:
This place was way more casual than what I expected.

The food was awesome though.

A friend and I split the oysters, lobster roll and crab cakes. 

One of the best lobster rolls I've ever had. Not that I eat that on the daily. Really though, it's good.
author: Kathryn V.

description:
Very unimpressed. Had the Fish Taco take-out. 95% batter, 5% fish. 
I've also had the Fish Sandwich from Burger King, 2 blocks away.
Much more fish, and only $5, instead of $18.
author: MILTON V.

description: Just stopped in for drinks here but loved it! I would love to go back and actually eat this time! I kept sneaking looks at everyones food they seemed to enjoy! Must make it back!! LOL
author: Chauntel B.

description: We had the crab steamed in the white wine and lemon (or white wine and something) and it was a little dry and made me feel sick, maybe too much of whatever they steamed it with. The clam chowder was ok, there's definitely better. We ordered fish and chips as well and those were better than both the chowder and the crab. The French fries were good. Overall not very impressive. I will return to try the crab and lobster rolls, hopefully they will change my mind about this place.
author: Brianna C.

description:
Nice little spot for some decent seafood without any frills. 

Stopped in on a Saturday around the lunch hour, didn't have to wait for a table at all. Shared the crab roll and the lobster roll with someone else, and each comes with a side of fries and a little bit of coleslaw for $18-ish.  

Lobster roll was packed with really nice chunks of lobster... but there wasn't a ton of that buttery flavor that makes a lobster roll a lobster roll. 

Crab roll had the opposite problem.  There was a tiny little portion of crab in the sandwich, but the flavor was out of this world. Unbelievably sweet crab meat. 

Fries were nice, needed salt, and the cole slaw wasn't particularly memorable.  

Fast service, nice staff and really interesting maps of the bay area while you wait for the bathroom.  Will be back.
author: Peter M.

description:
Nothing special to write home about here.  It's like I just walked into another restaurant down by Fisherman's Wharf.  My dinner date and I got here at 6 and were seated pretty quickly.  I was worried how we'd fare considering they take walk-ins only and it's always packed everytime I walk by.  Now that I've tried it, I can't say that I would wait in line for this.  In addition, I feel like while they were fast about getting our order and serving our meal - they weren't exactly "smiley, how are you doing today" kind of people.  More on the "are you ready to order?" side.  So minus points for that.

I had the clam chowder, the crab cake, and a few oysters.  Considering how much I adore the clam chowder at Hog Island and the seafood chowder at Bar Crudo - this clam chowder was like something I tried out of a can.  The crab cake was also pretty mediocre and nothing to brag about either.  I'm always a fan of oysters and they've got good meaty ones here - but it's not like they made these from scratch.
