Overall, I was disappointed with the experience and the food.  To sum up my experience here in one word ... it would be "meh."
author: Jean A.

description:
I came in at just before 6pm on a Friday night and was seated right away. The staff was great. I was in a bit of a hurry and they were super accommodating; I was in and out in a half hour. I took the waiter's recommendation and got one of their specials, the seared local albacore---it was amazing. Absolutely top-notch perfection. Seriously, I kind of wanted to cry a little bit I was so pleased with the whole entree. The price was really great for this level of quality. 

I would have to say that dessert (sea salt chocolate custard) was fine, but wasn't really anything special, I could've skipped it. Don't let that deter you though. This place is a true gem. I will definitely be back whenever I'm in San Fran., and I hope it's soon!
author: Melanie G.

description:
YUM!  My husband and I stopped in for lunch last Monday.  I had the Dungeness Crab Melt.  It was darn tasty as were the accompanying fries.  Also I'm not usually a slaw-loving kind of girl, but the here it tasty fresh and delicious.  Because the restaurant itself is cute, my husband was worried that the portions would be small.  Not sure about that reasoning.... but oh well.  He had the fish and chips and was not only happy with the portion size, but also with the quality.  "It's how fish n' chips should be." 

The space itself is cute and fun.  The wine/beer list has a great selection of local favorites - Everything from Gloria Ferrer bubbly brut to Anchor Steam beer. 

Also interesting to note - the bathroom decor is not only appropriate to a SF "fish company" but is also educational.  Check out the posters with various sailor's knots and oysters of the world, as well as the SF post-earthquake pics.
author: Jackie G.

description:
We had but 55 minutes to eat before picking up our daughter, and the service here was most accommodating, easily meeting our deadline.  We did get a glass of corked Muscadet, which was promptly replaced without hesitation.  Happy so far...

To start, we ordered six oysters, which were flawless, and a wedge of iceberg with the blue cheese dressing (which is hard to mess up) and this too was nicely done.  Though bacon often tops such things, there is only fish on the menu here, so lovers of pork bellies will have to get their fix elsewhere.  

On the down side, our clam strips were mostly bellies, which were soft and mushy inside (perhaps a seasonal thing?).  The tartar sauce was unique and very enjoyable.

The crab melt sandwich had nice bread (soft on the inside, toasty on the outside) was too highly seasoned (Old Bay?  and something with a bit of a kick), which over-shadowed the delicacy of the crab.  The fries were crisp and made a nice accompaniment.

The wine list is very short, but has some nice selections.  I was, however, surprised to see so many red wines in a seafood restaurant - are you guys really still drinking Syrah with seafood???

Decor
A wide-screen TV is hung on one wall, framed by a massive and ornate picture frame.  The night we were there, the programming consisted of shots of fishing boats, crab trappers, seafood being cooked, and the San Francisco Piers - up close and personal.  It was, frankly, quite mesmerizing.

All in all, we'll go back again to check it out.
author: Dave C.

description: My wife and I were on a food adventure, and decided to come here just for the lobster roll. We ordered the bigger portion of the lobster roll, which comes with more lobster which is always great. Lobster roll was on point! Definitely coming back next time we are in town.
author: Nate T.

description:
Came here on a whim when Swan Oyster Bar was closed on Presidents Day (and my out-of-town guest was jonesing for oysters).  I didn't have any desire to go to another tourist trap.

Anyway, Woodhouse was GREAT!  The best fish tacos - perfectly battered and fried with delicious fresh toppings and a tiny drizzle of sauce (so it wasn't a gooey mayonnaisey mess in addition to the fried).  We also shared 1/2 dozen assorted oysters which hit the spot - so fresh and yummy with great horseradish.  My friend tried the lobster roll and was equally as pleased with her meal.  

Oh yeah, and try the iced tea if you're not drinking beer - it's soooooooo good!  Love their ice!!! :)

I'll be back!
author: Taress H.

description: The bf too me here the other night because he has been craving lobster rolls. This would be the second time I've tried any seafood roll. The ambiance is nice. It seems loud but its not bar loud where you have to scream across the table to be heard but just loud enough to create an enjoyable lively environment. I ordered the small dungeness crab sandwich and he had the large lobster sandwich. We also shared a bowl of clam chowder. The chowder was alright. You can definitely taste the difference in clams than when you compare it to Boudins. But I've definitely had better clam chowder.  Onto the sammies. My roll was SUPER filling for a small and I am no small eater. The bread was filled with crab meat. I was defintely surprised because the other placee where i had first tried the lobster roll i was like "wow this is it?" So after seeing my small, i wondered what a large would look like - and bam there it was.  the same size bread as the small BUT it was LOADED, and i mean PACKED JAM worst than LA traffic jam packed with nothing but LOBSTER. he was so happy. If only i could show you the face he made when he saw what his dinner was about to be. Service was also great. I always had water - never once had to ask! Expect to wait long at places like this. Its pretty worth it in my opinion. Once we got to the car, all he said was - Cravings satisfied.
author: Kristina L.

description:
Oh man, I really love the fish and chips here. They're perfectly fried, flaky, delicious, gigantic pieces of fish. Yes, perfectly fried fish in perfect Anchor Steam beer batter...with what must be panko flakes!! Whatever it is, I love it. The fries are alright. I'm no purist so I like to substitute the fries with cole slaw or salad (was told that it was an extra $1 to sub in for salad or whatever other apps they have). They also have a killer tartar sauce. 

Sadly sometimes they give kumamotos that are lackluster, negligible service, inconsistent dishes. 

I otherwise love it here a lot.
author: Margaret S.

description: Don't take your visitors to touristy fisherman's wharf for a crab sandwich, come to this trendy SF neighborhood instead. Visit the shops while waiting for your table. Small vs large crab sandwich was not much larger in size.
author: Abby H.

description:
Urrrg.. the deliciousness..

Came back with the BF to get my muckers on that lobster roll that I'd been dreaming about. Oh my crap, it was delicious. The lobster itself is served cold, with toasted bread. I was confused because I thought it was going to be a hot sandwich, but as soon as I tasted it I knew I had made the right choice.

The boyfriend had the sturgeon rueben, which was the special on the Monday evening that we went. Our delightful gentleman server (whose name I forget) described it so appetizingly that he couldn't resist.

Be sure to pick up a little side of chipotle aioli to go with your fries. It's the bee's knees!
author: Rachel H.

description:
Good fries, fast service, nice inexpensive wines, and $1 oysters on Tuesdays. What's not to like?

In my opinion, the sandwich options are a *tad* overrated (but popular, judging from the rave reviews), but the fish and chips and other seafood dishes are heaven on a mighty, mighty plate. I like that a more casual place has opened up down the street, and the fact that it's not too expensive. Problem is, I don't go all that often, because I know I'm going to have to wait.

Surprisingly, I hopped inside for a 6:15 p.m. dinner on a Tuesday (dollar oysters, woot woot) and got seated immediately. Could have been because it was raining, though.
author: Amanda F.

description: After hearing from my friends that they have been wanting to try this place I decided to go... Without them haha. I actually went with a coworker. I would pass this place on a daily going to work and also wondered about it. I went on a Thursday night. There was a short wait before we were seated. It's a small place so I can imagine how busier I could have been. I saw they had a special on Tuesday for $1 oysters so I may have to come back on a Tuesday. This night I tried the Large Lobster Roll and a cup of clam chowder. You get a lot of lobster but shoot you better for the $26 price tag. Since I've now tried that I want to try other things on the menu the next time I stop in. The service was good. They gave us the option to sit at the bar or table. Either would have been ok. The clam chowder I ordered came out super fast. The sandwiches we ordered came and I was pleased to find a mound of lobster wedged into a thick slice of bread that reminded me of cheese bread from sizzler. Shoe string French fries and slaw came with the orders. The next time I come I may try the other location on Market to see how that place is. I imagine the menu is the same. Overall I had a good experience here and like how close it is to my work.
author: Elvin T.

description:
I wanted a great experience. The wait staff was friendly. But a few important components was still missing. 

Ordered a Pasta with Uni and Dungeoness Crab. Pasta was way over cooked (pretty much melted in your mouth kind of overcook). The Uni was decorative at most. It really played not part in the dish. Because the pasta were overcooked the crab blended in. This was a $16 mess. Sorry to be harsh. But it reall was. 

Fish and Chips were oily. The fish absorbed oil and the batter absorbed oil. No bueno. I made reference to the old Taylor's Automatic Refresher's Fish and Chips as being how it should be done. We all agreed. 

The service was friendly. But they left our water glass unfilled until I asked. Maybe it was because we sat at the bar. They werent busy when we dined here. There was no reason why our glasses were left emptied for such a long time. 

Sorry WFC, the most impressive thing about our experience was the antique framed TV and the restaurant looked great.
author: Denis K.

description:
Had 6 hood canal oysters, 6 kumamotos, crab cakes, lobster roll, fish and chips, cioppino...

Cioppino was the winner...

Hood Canal Oysters took second

Will head back for their $1 oysters for sure!  

Overall thought the place was nice for a Sunday dinner.  The price wasn't bad for 3-ppl with wine. Walked out at about $50 per person for all of the above, which in my opinon is pretty good.
author: Jennifer B.

description: Best fried clams I've had since I was a kid dining at seafood shacks on the east coast. Market squid, fresh oysters, crab cakes perfectly cooked with lots of crab meat and not overloaded with spices and fish tacos the way we make 'em in our own kitchen. Skip the wines and try the Scrimshaw pilsner beer. Go early or be prepared to stand in line. The seating's a little cramped, but worth it. Charming ambiance includes scrimshaw, panoramic sea scene and fish mounts. Top-notch service.
author: Jack And Barbra D.

description: The food is great, lobster roll awesome. Fresh fried fish all good here. I came with my kids and the service is awesome too.
author: Eduardo F.

description:
Woodhouse Fish Co looks like a place with that name should look. It's called atmosphere (not cute) and attitude (not quirky).
The menu is fishing-shack distinctive and it's priced to the gentry of Fillmore street.  
The do it yourself lemonade definitely shows attitude -- take care not  to mix yourself into a diabetic coma.
For its unpretentious fishing-shack pretense, it deserves five stars. But we seem to reserve five star ratings for places we can't really afford.
So, four stars.
author: Peter N.

description: This place is great! My boyfriend and I came here on a Sunday night around 6:30pm for dinner and we only had to wait around 10-15 minutes to get seated. Our waiter was friendly and service was very quick. For my drink I ordered the DIY Arnold Palmer, which was pretty cool. It comes with lemon juice in a glass, along with small bottles of the iced tea and sweetener so you can customize how sweet your drink will be. We ordered a bowl of clam chowder and mixed salad for starters. For our main dish, I decided to order the lobster roll and my boyfriend ordered the ciopinno. The clam chowder was really good, the mixed salad was OK; nothing special about it, but the lobster roll was amazing! The dish came with toasted buttery roll was packed with moist, juicy lobster with fries and cole slaw on the side. So delicious, I'm surprised it wasn't in the Yelp highlights. My boyfriend loved his cioppino too, which was packed with seafood and had garlic bread on the side. I really enjoyed this meal, and I would come back!
author: Stephanie G.

description: Just a solid place all around. Great food, service and atmosphere. Ahh...the dungeness crab roll, my old standby! You can work your way up and down that menu and you won't go wrong.
author: Dan B.

description:
Oh my goodness, crack on a roll...... I had the shrimp sandwich and my friend had the lobster sandwich (loaded of course).  This was a quick middle of the day lunch and I have to come back with more people so they know what I am talking about.

We did start by sharing a dozen oysters - really fresh.  Actually I went a few weeks ago, and I shouldn't be writing this now just before lunch time, my mouth is drooling and I have to go back NOW!  Do yourself a favor and check it out.
author: D B.

description:
I lied.

Piccadilly Fish & Chips is not my favorite spot for fish & chips. 

I only use them for sex.

Woodhouse is where it's at!

The look and feel of this place reminds of something that you would stumble into on a wet and rainy night in London. 

Great beer selection and awesome cioppino! And if you are a lover of onion rings, then you will be in ring heaven. They only give you four or five per order, but trust me, this is all you will need. They are hugegigantic and perfectly cooked!

Clam chowder fan? I've taken friends from New England here and they have told me that Woodhouse's version is just as good as anything you can find in Beantown.

The menu here is limited, but they do have enough to keep you interested. Come here for a nice causal afternoon on the town!
author: V B.

description:
Love this place. They have the best fish & chips, the best clam chowder and the absolute best bread pudding w/chocolate and caramel and whipped cream. I'm from Chicago and can't get reasonably priced fresh fish. Woodhouse is so good. I've been there the last 2 times when in San Fran.
Warning -- this one in Pacific Heights is the best. Do not go to the one in Castro. Their fish & chips/fish tacos are very very greasy and the bread pudding is a completely different recipe and disappointing after having it in Pacific Heights.
author: Jane M.

description: Came here on a Friday night without any reservation so we waited about 30 minutes. We were seated at the bar area which was okay because it would've been another 30 minutes wait for a table. My hubby & I shared a bowl of clam chowder, I had the crab cake with salad & he had the cioppino. Our food came out quick, tasted fresh, and yummy. Service was also good & the staff were really nice. We will definitely be back to try out other items on the menu.
author: Katherine H.

description:
It was good but nothing I'd wait in line for.  I had the small lobster roll which came with fries and cole slaw and also had a glass of sauvignon blanc.

The lobster roll itself was yummy. It was buttery and sweet and made better by a squeeze of fresh lemon.  The fries were really good. Nice and warm, crispy and salty. Perfect. The cole slaw was good too.

The wine was disgusting. It was like the sweet horrible convenience store wine you sneak as a kid. I hardly ever send anything back but it was foul. I asked to switch it for the other option of the same grape. 

Funny thing was, as it went back the person sitting next to me at the bar said "did you get a sauvignon blanc because mine is gross too." Unfortunately he ordered the other one that was now on its way to me.

I'm not a wine snob but this stuff was undrinkable. I didn't say anything and just left it after one sip.  Really, this close to wine country there's no reason.  And they missed out because I likely would have had two glasses and maybe dessert. Instead I paid and left.

The service was ok. I went early so it wasn't even half full but it took me making eye contact with three different people before one ran off and got my waitress to order.  Also I sat at the bar next to a wall that was pretty dirty.

It's kind of a shame. It could be a lot better. I'd go again if it was not out of the way and I didn't sit near the dirty wall.

(I went to the one on Fillmore)
author: Jen M.

description: lobster roll was solid.. cool ambiance and good apps. I plan on going back.
author: Kenny S.

description:
Living in Kansas doesn't give me the opportunity to feast on fresh seafood.  When I went to SF for job training I wanted a good clam chowder place.  Apparently there's a bunch to choose from in the Bay area.  But my brother-in-law and girlfriend recommended this place.  

We got there when it opened so there was no waiting and very few people there.  My first regret was my wife and I ordering cokes, my brother-in-law and girlfriend ordered Arnold Palmers.  The waitress brought out a cup with with some kind of lemon syrup in the cup then two small bottles 1 with sugar water and one filled with iced tea basically you could build your own.  They commented on how delicious the Arnold Palmers especially the iced tea, but since I'm not a tea drinker I had to take their word.  Of course the whole time I wished I had a lemonade.

After about 20 minutes we got our order clam chowder and garlic bread.  My wife got the cup and I got the bowl, I totally made the right decision.  Man was that good.  Very creamy and the clams....oh my goodness the clams were so soft and delicious, melts in you mouth.  Everyone in our group agreed that the clam chowder was the bomb!  Garlic bread was OK, too much garlic for my taste but brother-in-law and girlfriend loved it.

I can't recommend the clam chowder enough, although someone in a different party ordered some fish and chips and that looked pretty good.  Of course its in downtown SF so it is a pain to find parking.  But trust me well worth it.
author: Brandon L.

description:
This place was pretty good. I came here for dinner tonight and it was pretty good. We had to wait a bit because it was pretty busy and it's also a small restaurant so it wasn't uncommon to see people waiting outside since it can get pretty warm in there. 

While waiting, at the corner table near the window there seemed to be a 10 dollar bill glued to the floor and one guy tried picking it up. It was funny because he couldn't get it and realized that it was stuck to the floor. I don't think that it was part of the restaurant but it was funny. 

Now onto the food! I ordered the fish and chips and it was delicious. The fish had a very nice crunchy outside and filled with soft and moist fish. The chips were pretty good too but I like mine salty so I had to add a bit of salt to it. I also ordered a make it yourself Arnold Paulmer which was pretty cool. They give you half a glass of lemonade and sides of ice tea and sugar and you can put as much or as little of the stuff as you like. 

Also the garlic bread is AMAZING. I think it was my favorite out of the whole meal. 

The table next to us also seemed to really enjoy their meal of crab and some kind of salad. They kept conversing with us about how good our food looked or how good their food was. 

I would come back again to try some of their other stuff.
author: Jenny L.

description:
I love this little place. 

If you want some yummy crab without breaking the bank (yah, I'm talking to you Nettie's Crab Shack), this is the place.

I really enjoy the subtle nautical theme since it's not overdone and campy.

I've only had crab here so I can't speak to the other menu items but I did see the lobster roll and the artichoke filled w/ shrimp and crab and now I want to go back just to try those.

Staff is also very kind and accommodating.  There's a nice, casual feeling about everything here.  

PROS:
-Fun, nautical themed decor.
-Cozy but not too small that you have to wait very long for a table.  
-Very nice staff (waitress, busboy, and host!)
-Affordable for seafood.

CONS:
-You're not going to get the largest portions but for the price, who cares.
-Parking in this area kind of sucks.
author: Ryan T.

description:
Warm Tuesday night with roommate and we walk in 30 mins before closing, sit down , order 36 oysters, a couple of Sierras and walked out full and smiling.
And without batting an eye, the friendly staff at Woodhouse made us feel right at home in our PJs (seriously, we walked in our PJs and ate oysters. How is that for class??)
LOVE this place in the neighborhood!
author: Kathy K.

description:
We had some guests visiting from out of town who wanted some seafood, so we decided to go to Woodhouse (since we also have been wanting to try it for awhile).  We were a bit dismayed by the no reservations policy at the restaurant, but they estimated a 35-45 minute wait for our table of 4, so that wasn't too bad.  The wait took a little bit longer than that, but nothing unreasonable.  The place had a nice feel to it -- nice seafood decorations, loud-ish but not too noisy, friendly servers.  

Considering how busy it was, the food came out pretty quickly and everything was tasty.  We started with the fried calamari, which was good, and had many more of the little "monsters" than calamari rings, which I liked.  My wife's aunt really enjoyed the clam chowder as well.  I had a dungeness crab roll, which tasted SUPER fresh, and the roll was the perfect complement, with its rich buttery-ness and crispiness.  The fish and chips were good (but nothing special), but the crab cakes were really tasty.  My wife's aunt said "I don't know what I've been eating all my life, but it was not a crab cake like this..."  They said Woodhouse would blow the fancy seafood restaurants in Missouri out of the water, and I know that's not saying much, but it shows how much our guests enjoyed the meal.
author: Pilan C.

description: Lobster roll was awesome! So were the fries and the make your own Arnold Palmer. Service was good too. Would definitely go again.
author: Katie A.

description:
I was really looking forward to this place because I absolutely love fish and chips, but...

The fish and chips are too oily/greasy as well as the fish and breading (or whatever it's called) not being one cohesive unit.  The breading starts falling off when you pick up the piece of fish.  No good.

The fries, however, were a-m-a-z-i-n-g.  I love thinly sliced, perfectly cooked and seasoned fries.  

4 stars for the fries and 2 stars for the fish and chips so I'm giving an overall 3.
author: Kristine B.

description:
What started out as a quick dinner at the last minute in the Fillmore turned into an amazing 4-course two-and-a-half-hour experience! We lucked out and got a table right away as other larger parties were waiting. Our server was fantastic (and friendly and funny)! He first helped this red wine drinker select a nice white (damn those migraines!) and even brought me a sample to taste to see if I liked it. My partner ordered his usual Arnold Palmer, which came with a glass half full of lemonade, a separate carafe of tea, and another carafe of simple syrup to sweeten it to your own taste. Sweet. 

The server also was very thorough in describing the menu and the differences in the oysters. We ended up trying two different kinds of oysters (the Humboldt Co. ones were the best, IMO). They were served with lemon and a cocktail sauce with horseradish. The horseradish was a bit spicy for my taste, but the oysters were were really tasty. 

We also had a crab louie salad, which was very good and perfectly dressed. By that time I was already nearly full, but that feeling subsided when our entrees came out. I ordered the fresh Alaskan wild salmon with chevril sour cream and cherry butter. Coupled with mustard greens and a potato thingie (yes, that's the culinary technical term), it was absolutely incredible. Everything balanced really well and I tried eating very, very slowly to savor it.. My partner ordered the whole dorade, which was also delish (especially the skin!). The best part, though, was the rum-soaked sweet potato patties that came with the whole fish. I really think it was one of the best things I have ever tasted. 

Although stuffed and happy, I can never resist a bread pudding when I see one, so I ordered the sourdough bread pudding with a huge scoop of fresh whipped cream and caramel sauce. It was HUGE and I could only eat about half.

In addition to the great service and amazing food, the atmosphere is neat, too. Along one wall is a long panoramic shot of the beach and on the opposite wall is a very large digital frame showing both pictures and video of where the fish are caught. Also along the wall near the restroom are really cool pictures of planes over the future location of the GG bridge in the 30s. 

Woodhouse is the newest among my favorites in the city! I will absolutely be back. Hopefully sooner rather than later!
author: Amy B.

description:
This cute place is tiny. We waited a short time to get in on a Fri night, and were tended to quite nicely by all of the waitstaff and hostess. The garlic bread is TO DIE FOR. The crab melt sandwich was pretty amazing too. Fries were "OK" and I tasted my friend's pasta which was lovely too. 

I'm going to be bringing my dad here to check it out. He'll love it!
author: Natasha M.

description: Alright so keep in mind that this place has mostly greasy/fried options.  That being said, WOW.  I had fish and chips and my girlfriend had fish tacos.  Both of which absolutely killed it.  The fish tacos were incredible -- some of the best I've ever had I think.  The prices are ok and the service is good.  Overall it's a great little spot for dinner and I'd highly recommend it.
author: Yan L.

description:
Came here on a Sunday evening with my girlfriend.  Prior to selecting a restaurant, we had a mutual moment in which we both had an epic craving for clam chowder.

Seeing as though Woodhouse Fish Company is a few blocks away, it was a no brainer.

The place was pretty packed for a Sunday night, so you know it has to be good!  We got a small, private table in the corner of the restaurant.

We both ordered a bowl of clam chowder, and a side of sauteed vegetables to share.

They also brought out a small loaf of warm sourdough bread.  I don't believe it is something they usually do, but if you ask I'm sure they would gladly offer it.

The clam chowder was amazing; probably some of the best I've ever had.  The portions were HUGE as well.  Neither my girlfriend or I were able to finish our bowl or the sauteed vegetables.  So full!

As far as I can tell, your money goes a long way at Woodhouse Fish Company.  You definitely won't be leaving feeling hungry, and you might have some leftovers depending on what you order.  But honestly, get the clam chowder.

I will definitely be coming back to try some of the other great looking things on their menu.
author: Javin L.

description: We decided to take a little day trip to San Francisco and try this place based on their photos.  How'd they do?  They delivered!  Their oysters on a half shell was so fresh and slid perfectly down our throats.  The lobster roll was even better than the one I had at Sam's Chowder house.  Get the Fish & Chips, so crunchy and totally satisfying.  Service is good, not overly attentive or friendly...but good!  I would definitely come back here.
author: Deborah S.

description:
Fish-heads, fish-heads, rolly, polly fish-heads....

I decided to treat the boyfriend to dinner on Friday night prior to a movie (my treat too) at the Kabuki. We wanted to try something new, and didn't want to venture out the the way prior to the movie.

We left our place at 7:50p and caught the 22 up Fillmore. While on the bus, the boyfriend called to place our name on the waiting list. They said it would be 40 minutes..so we figured we'd be seated at 8:30.

WRONG. When we got there at 8:00, we were seated 10 minutes later. Our 40 minute wait was only 20. Lesson learned: WHFC sucks at estimating wait time! But thats ok- it worked in our favor!

We sat the counter and ordered:

-Calamari (He's a bigger fan than I am, but I certainly did enjoy it!)
- Baja Fish Tacos (these had the potential of being REALLY good, but they had this vinegary taste to them which kinda disgusted me. I ate the first two, but only picked at the third.)
- Fish N' Chips (these were delicious!)

One can only eat so much fried food without feeling disgusting, but they did make good leftovers!

Our server was a little slow on the uptake (we're both out of water, and he walked by 3 or 4 times, talked to the couple next to us, but didn't notice we were out of water until right before he gave us the bill). 

It was a good meal and I'll probably be back to try something else. (Dungess crab, prawn pasta, etc...) That being said, I wouldn't order the fish tacos ever again.
author: Annalise F.

description:
Came here on a nice sunny day in SF, we tried the Oysters, Cioppino, and Crab Cakes.

There was no wait when we arrived, we had the choice of the high tables/chairs.  The waiter was very courteous and informant about the dishes.  He constantly checked on us to see if everything is okay.

Atmosphere/Decor - very homey, bright.  

Oysters were very fresh.  Cioppino was a lot of work, but spicy and delicious.  It was filled with so many clams, mussels, crab legs and two sticks of garlic bread. By the end of the meal, I had made a pile of shells that amounted greater than the serving size. It is definitely a cold-day entree.  The Crab Cakes were cooked to perfection, the exterior was a nice thin crisp with a moist interior.

It was a bit pricier for lunch, but great food quality so I was extremely satisfied with the price.
author: Steph L.

description: Awesome place to try cioppino. Also they have one of the best lobsters. Don't waut - go and get it!
author: Mikhail M.

description:
I'm always in search of the perfect calamari and this place has it! Crispy and tender with a wonderfully spicy sauce. It really doesn't get much better. 

I ordered the crab cakes which come with a small salad. They were a light tasty lunch- I would certainly eat them again. 

The crab roll was tasty with toasted bread and melted cheese. The fish and chips were great. The fish was so tender it would fall apart if you tried to dip it into the tartar sauce. 

The only thing I didn't really care for was the shrimp roll. Cold tiny cocktail shrimp in a sandwich just didn't do it for me (although others may like it).

The disappointment for me was the pricing. Lunch for the wife, me, and two youngsters ended up being right at $100 with tip. Dropping $100 for a lunch just isn't something I can do with any kind or regularity. Maybe my problem is that I moved out of San Francisco a few years ago so I'm no longer used to the SF pricing. I'm guessing I could find a similar meal in my area for about $50.
author: Bill C.

description: I have visited both Woodhouse locations for 4 or 5 meals at each location (also on Market St), and they are both excellent.  Their meals are consistently delicious- they feature a number of nice seafood dishes on the regular menu, and my favorites are usually their specials.  I have enjoyed most consistently the crab & lobster sandwiches, as well as the tuna burger- which are always on the menu, and served with tasty, crispy fries.  They feature a very nice fish & chips- which I believe is usually cod.  Most recently, I had an excellent special- a poached halibut dish served with a couscous-like pasta with an herby pesto garnish, cherry tomatoes and walnuts. So good I went back and had it again a week later :-) My most recent lunch for two with my wife, which included a sauteed corn appetizer, two entrees, a beer and a soda was about $50 w/tip out the door- so not cheap as far as lunch goes- but we were well fed and it really was excellent.  In the seafood category, it is probably a tad different and less formal than down-town classics Sam's and Tadich Grill, maybe similar to Yabbies on Polk Street to some degree.  Anyways, I have had consistently great meals there and would recommend this ALWAYS to anyone looking for a superb lobster or crab sandwich, and a stellar fish and chips.
author: Andy S.

description:
soft shell crab BLT was on special. it's hard for me to turn down crab or bacon so i knew this had to be mine. a whole fried soft shell crab, fresh tomato, micro greens on a well toasted bun. it was pretty darn good. the fries  and slaw were spot on as well. my friend got the artichokes. i'm not a huge artichoke fan (blasphemy in california, i know) but i tried a piece and i really liked the seasoning.

a few beers on tap. one of them, fortunately for me, is scrimshaw. wine as well. good service. i probably wouldn't specifically seek woodhouse out again due to the 4599298 other seafood places i want to try in this city but would definitely go back if a friend wanted to try it out.
author: Becky B.

description:
My first visit: fish tacos.
My second visit: fish tacos.
My third visit: fish tacos.
My fourth visit: fish tacos.

My fifth visit? I am trying to venture to other things, but from the record, history seems to repeat itself. 

Tips: 
- Go before 6 pm during the weekend, the wait can be ridiculous.
- Tiny waiting area in the corner, so if you are waiting prepare to stand outside.
- Did I mention the fish tacos are amazing?
- Ask for jalapenos on the side with your tacos along with Scrimshaw.
- Coupon for Fraiche on your bill for a free topping (value at 50 cents), that's a different review (http://www.yelp.com/biz/fraiche-san-francisco).

Great fish and seafood place, you must check it out.
author: Enji L.

description:
Good cioppino.  Mine had a couple funky mussels.  You know when you bite and they sort of crumble like powder instead of have any bite to chew?  Other than that it was good but expensive at $22. 
Others had crab cakes which were also good. 
Overall a good, hearty lunch.
author: Kev M.

description: Since it looks like this place doesn't need another great review, I'll keep it short:   You must have the lobster roll - it's delicious.  Order the large one unless you're a model, dainty eater or want to save room for something else.
author: Yumm Y.

description: You can never go wrong with the Maine lobster roll! They give you a very generous amount of lobster and the bread is light, lightly buttered and toasted.
author: Beca P.

description:
OMG!!! So yummy! Came here on a busy Saturday afternoon. Waited 20 minutes to get seated and it was worth the wait.  They have Lobster Roll and it was delicious!!!!  
We also ordered fresh oysters and fried clams.  The oysters tasted super fresh and the fried clams were so yummy!! I would definitely come back here again!
author: Anna S.

description:
It's yummy but a bit expensive for a lobster roll or crabby melt. I'd heard such wonderful things about it and it was delicious but for the size of the sammies and the prices we paid I wish it was a little more affordable. I'm glad we ordered both though because after trying the Crab Melt and the Lobster Roll we definitely decided that the Lobster Roll was mouthwateringly to die for while the Crab Melt was a bit too fishy and just not as divine as the Roll
Ces la vie, I suppose when I am rich and famous I shall eat all the lobster rolls and crabby melts I can get, until then I shall just have to concede to sharing with my own fish in the sea.
The service was fantastic and the ambiance was great too.
Great place for:  Casual but impressive date or Dinner/ Lunch with the G'rents or 'Rents (so hopefully they can spring for the bill).
Not great for: Peeps with empty tummies and empty wallets
author: Mary Ella D.

description: I had 3 kinds of oysters, crab cake and clam chowder.  I loved them all!  All classic and all well_done!  It is Superbowl Sunday, so only 3/4 full. Got lucky :-)
author: Jennifer Y.

description: Came here one day with my friend and we tried the crab cakes and lobster roll and both so good! Crab cakes is a MUST!!! Place gets crowded and it's a tight little space. Staff is super friendly and are great. Can't wait to come back and try something different! The whole menu made it so hard to choose!
author: Michelle N.

description: Being a fish and chips geek, I was surprised I had never heard of this place until yesterday. Had their fried clams appetizer (which was generous and tasty) and fish and chips for dinner. Ordered the three piece instead of two which would have been perfect if I hadn't ordered the clams. Again generous pieces and tasty. All with a couple pints of Drake's Hef to wash it down. Gotta try it for yourself...
author: Jae C.

description:
If you're looking for watered down Coke, here's your place. Let's not that spoil the goodness of the Lobster roll. 

I finally understand all the hype about Lobster rolls. I know I'm late to the party but I finally made it. I never knew it was possible to bundle a succulent piece of lobster into a piece of bread and make it taste sooo good. 

The bread was great, toasted just right and lightly buttered. Decent portion of plump, juicy lobster from a faraway place where it's bountiful. 
French fries were not any regular fries, they were those tasty shoestring fries that walked the walk and talked the talk. Small portion of Cole slaw which was a nice compliment but they need to make some adjustments with that small portion size. 

On a side note, for a Fish co. I didn't see that much fish which was a big surprise to me. Overall this place is a no brainer. If you want a great Lobster roll in the City, look no further. 

Will I go back? 
Hell to the Yeah...
author: Lou G.

description: Loved my large lobster roll- split bun was perfectly buttered and crusty, the lobster perfectly cooked, and the sauce a light mix of lemon, celery and mayo! Craving satisfied!!
author: Morgan C.

description:
The crab cakes and scallop special were definite mouthgasms. Very flavorful dishes. My fusilli pasta w/ crawfish was pretty damn good too.

Went on Saturday around dinner time, but it hadn't gotten too busy yet and there was only a minor wait for 2-person seating. Had a really friendly waiter--Nolan, I believe--serve us. Really appreciated him taking the time to chat with us about the dishes, especially with how busy it eventually got.

Would definitely return!
author: Thuan N.

description:
While a few of my favorite places to eat on Fillmore have unfortunately closed over the last several months, I am so happy that this place opened and have been striving.

I actually have been eyeing on this place for a while now every time I walk past it.  But given that they are serving casual-yet-high-quality seafood, the price was kind of discouraging to just casually stop by alone on a random weekday. 

But just the other day, after I got off my ballet class at 8pm, my husband picked me up in the city and we thought we should break our terrible routine of resorting to Subway sandwiches every week after my dance classes and try something new.  It was a chillier evening compared to the last few nights and the timing and the temperature seemed to be right for some good, cozy seafood.  

So I mentioned this place to my husband and we decided to check it out.  We sat at the bar... and because we are addicted to Dungeness crab roll at Fish in Sausalito, we just had to try it here too to compare.  So we got a large (meaning sandwich stuffed with more crab) crab roll to share, plus a mixed green salad and a cup of chowder plus drinks.  

We saw white chowder, red chowder, and Hartford.  "Hartford"??? We were not familiar with it so we asked our waiter and learned that it's white and red, half & half.  Because white is thicker than the red, they stay somewhat separated until you mix them up to your liking.  We thought that was interested so we gave that a shot.  And lemme tell you... I am HOOKED.  It kind of tastes like... lasagna. LOL.  I know it sounds wierd, but to have that rich creaminess of white clam chowder with a bit of tomato based chowder mixed in?  You catch my drift.  This chowder if definitely something I'll have cravings for.

The crab roll was great too.  I may prefer the one at Fish in Sausalito slightly better in terms of the buns (they use Acme torpedo roll there, Woodhouse uses an oldschool hotdog bun type bread.  Very yummy nonetheless but it's really personal preference) and also the fact that you get to choose fries, slaw or salad at Fish but at Woodhouse the sandwiches come with fries by default, and overall portion is slightly less too.  

I'm not trying to complain at all, in fact, their fries were REALLY good (light, fresh and crispy!) but I do appreciate that at our other favorite we have choices.  That aside, crab meat was plump and wonderful and sure did not disappoint : )  There really is a hefty amount of crab meat stuffed inside that bun for the "large" size order!

I also must mention their mixed green salad too... this is IMO a VERY delish mixed green salad.  With sweet beets, heirloom tomatoes and goodies.  And their vinaigrette was perfect, just tart enough and sweet enough.  I felt that that helped balance out the rich chowder, butter drizzled crab roll and fries a bit : )

The bill was not cheap, but we saw on the receipt that you actually get a discount at Fraiche next doors for froyo if you show them the receipt!  Definitely an added perk.  We totally went over there and made dessert out of froyos to call the dining experience of the evening a smashing hit : )

We would love to try their lobster roll and other dishes the next time... and definitely come back for their yummy chowder too!
author: Sascha O.

description:
Lobster roll - 5/5
Fries - 4/5
Crab cakes - 2/5
Crab cake side salad - 4/5
Calamari - 3/5 nothing special
Garlic bread - 2/5 gross, so freaking cheesy

Next time I will only order the lobster roll
And I wanna try the singleness crab roll

Service great!
author: Cindy L.

description:
I really like grabbing a solo spot at the counter for lunch, but it's a good date night option as well.

Lobster roll is fresh and flavorful with perfect toasty bread. The fries are perfectly crispy. And I'm not even a huge Arnold Palmer fan but I crave their do-it-yourself one! You get a glass of ice and fresh lemon juice and two little baby carafes, one of tea and one of simple syrup. Mix to your exact specifications.  

For dinner, the stuffed artichoke is where it's at. The fresh fish special hasn't let me down either. 

if my boyfriend ever moves away and I'm no longer regularly within walking distance, I'll cry.
author: Bethany M.

description:
So yummy !  We got the crab melt sandwich came with slaw and the best part French fries.  Fish tacos were also excellent. 
We called a 5 minutes before we showed up and the host was nice enough to put us on the wait list even though they were super busy. Service was fast and attentive. 
Will be back for $1 oyster Tuesdays!
author: Sam S.

description:
3.5 Stars.

Grounded along the tree lit lane of Fillmore, this fish house reflects the deep flavors beneath the sea.

Perched like a cottage within a bustling city, this small venue wraps you in from the get go. The aromas of the sea trickle out of the kitchen and lazily linger in the front. You'd think you were sitting along a pier from the scent alone.

Visiting on a Wednesday evening, I met  a friend around 9 without reservations and was able to grab a table fairly quickly. 

The specials chalked up on the board were a colorful combination of local ingredients highlighting a prized piece of the bay. Simple, yet direct, and layered in a smooth tone, the menu is an easy read.

What I should've opted for were their famous and well known fish and chips, but a very rare voice within me, concerned about my arteries for Sunday's Marathon led me to the dungeness crab melt. ( in all honesty, I don't think the melt was any healthier... )

Served on a small tray with a side of crisp fries, the dish was satisfying but lacked an inherent uniqueness. The crab was rich but the heavy melted cheese damped the flavor of the main show.

The staff embodies a neighborhood spirit and warms up the space gently. 

Woodhouse is a solid choice for seafood along Fillmore, and while I'll be back to devour the fish and chips soon, I'd suggest a few other places for sea dwellings in the city.
author: Mike K.

description: Stopped by while at the Jazz Festival/Street Fair. Wait for two was minimal. The place was packed. Food was really good service was really good.
author: Angela B.

description: The lobster roll is wonderful. I get one almost weekly and it always delivers. I take-out a lot because it is hard to get a seat during rush times and while the restaurant is cute, it always feels a bit crowded. As an east coast girl who loves a good lobster roll, Woodhouse is my go-to spot in SF.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: Fantastic fish tacos. I've been to all of the top places in the city for fish tacos, and this one, by far is the best! Only let down is that you have to order frys on the side.
author: Giuliana K.

description: Food was good not GREAT!  Service was subpar.  even after asking, the staff did not adjust the blinds so our table could see. Perhaps that was their intent to turn the table faster.
author: J R.

description:
My husband definitely picked a winner when we tried Woodhouse for the first time, 1/22/11.  We were on a "sketchcrawl" event in the Fillmore area and had lunch.  It was fabulous!
He had the crab melt and I had the 2 piece fish and chips.  
Both were great.  My fish wasn't swimming in oil.  The pieces were large, so I did share with my husband, although his crab melt was a good size without being dominated by way too much bread.
We had wine by the glass because they offered a good selection that was not run-of-the-mill.
Our server, Sarah, was pleasant and attentive.
We will return, which is an accomplishment for the restaurant.  There are so many restaurants in SF, you don't have to return unless you really want to!
One word of warning...we got there AS SOON AS THEY OPENED and we were thankful we did.  Woodhouse quickly filled up and people were waiting outside when we left.
author: Carol H.

description:
I'd heard about Woodhouse Fish Company from three different people - all raving about how great the food is there.  So, I bookmarked it on Yelp.  Apparently, A had also heard about how good the food is there and he also bookmarked it on Yelp.

Fast forward a few months, a year even, and, wow, it's our anniversary!  Where should we celebrate?  Seeing as I didn't have a clue as to where to go as late as the night before (too late to get reservations at any "good" restaurants), A suggested we try Woodhouse Fish Company.  They don't take reservations, so it was perfect for us.

He picked me up at 5:30pm and we headed over and circled around the area for maybe 10 minutes before we found a metered spot.  Not wanting a ticket, we stuck a quarter in the meter to pay for the 5 minutes we still had before 6pm.

When we got to the restaurant, there were a couple of tables available, but we chose to sit at the bar.  The tables just seemed a little too close to the other tables for my comfort.  Sitting at the bar meant we could sit next to each other and really enjoy each other's company.

Drinks:  A had the "do-it-yourself" lemonade and I had the "do-it-yourself" Arnold Palmer.  Without the sweetener, boy is it SOUR!

Food:  We started with the grilled artichoke stuffed with shrimp and crab over a bed of mixed greens.  Oh.  My.  Stars.  So good!  I love artichokes to begin with, but this really tasted good.  We then split the halibut steamed in parchment with fingerling potatoes and two crab cakes with fries.  The halibut was melt in your mouth goodness while the crab cake was very flavorful.

Service:  Very attentive and quick.  Also very helpful with food suggestions since we'd never dined here before.

Price:  It was about $70 pre-tip for the two of us, so it's not the most inexpensive restaurant around, but we both thought it was oh-so-good.

I'll definitely be back.  I want to try their super popular lobster roll!
author: Kris L.

description:
i don't usually believe in second chances, especially with restaurants. serve me a bad meal? expect a bad review. i'm kind of like the henry hill of yelp; i accept no excuses. produce order was late? F you, i'm yelping. oh, your staff called in sick? F you, i'm yelping. the walk-in broke down, huh? F you, i'm yelping. 

but for some reason, i couldn't let it go when my lobster roll at woodhouse turned out to be less than impressive. it wasn't bad, by any means; it just didn't wow me the way i expected from the slightly excessive praise in other reviews. and a few days later, still unable to shake the feeling that this place had more to offer; i opted to give woodhouse another try, rather than yelp my disinterested sentiments. i'm glad i did. 

the cornmeal-crusted cod special was a much better option than the lobster roll. sure they're famous for the lobster roll, but lobster is not always in season, and it certainly has traveled farther than other choices on the menu. my advice? ask your server for a recommendation from the specials. you'll likely end up with an inventive and delightful dish full of fresh and seasonal ingredients.
author: Kris G.

description:
3.5 stars (round up for benefit of the doubt) 

Happened to find this place while dropping some clothes off at crossroads. I believe they have another store located on Market. 

One reason to go here is there $1 oyster Tuesdays, because who can say no to that? Upon entering you'll notice the old wood decor (much like a woodhouse) who would have guessed? We were greeted and seated promptly among the other patrons, after which we were kind of forgotten. 

Against my better judgment... I asked the waitress for their "most popular" dishes and went with that. We ordered the lobster roll and the fish tacos. What I REALLY should/wanted to order was the fish and chips, oh well.  If I remember correctly, the lobster roll with extra meat nearly goes for $30 (definitely not worth it) There was really nothing special about the sandwich at all. Be forewarned that the lobster is also served COLD, which kind of caught me by surprise. I can't penalize them for that though. The fries, to me, were a bit tough and stale tasting. On the other hand, the fish tacos were excellent. I just wish they were either bigger or more plentiful, but I guess that is everything I eat. The tacos were nice, light, and crisp.  I couldn't help but stare at the party next to us who had ordered the fish and chips. The plate looked like they made sure you weren't hungry at the end of the basket.  drool.
author: Steven T.

description: Delicious! A friend of mine started with oysters (we grabbed some from Washington state), I had the crab linguine salad and my friend had the lobster tail roll. Everything about our dish was delicious and the service was fantastic. The atmosphere is loud and fun (definitely not an intimate dining experience) and laid back. It felt cozy, definitely a great neighborhood restaurant. It is more spendy then what you would see on this street, but I think worth it overall. The fries are good too!
author: Sherry F.

description:
Best Wedge Salad!

When trying order gluten free though that experience was not the greatest.  There are only 2 items on the menu that are gluten free and the one I had (the crab legs) was a bit overdone.

My partner had the ship/avocado roll and said "The best part was the buttery roll"
author: Julie C.

description:
Small little quaint fish joint.  Came here with friends for dinner one time for early dinner and enjoyed ourselves.

We had the clam chowder, oysters, dungeness crab melt,

I would like to come back to try the bay shrimp avocado roll and spit-top maine lobster roll and louie salad.
author: JJAMZ C.

description: Good but oily/greasy. I would have have given it a 3.5 stars if it was an option. Had the lobster roll. Pickled veggies yum!
author: Logan N.

description:
I'm a sucker for good seafood. And this place delivers just that. 

The crab stuffed artichoke, the clams, the oysters, the calamari, the clam chowder and of course the lobster roll are all incredible. The prices are fair and the service is great. Got to eat dinner a table from Mr. David Chappelle on my first visit. (seems like that guy always picks amazing restaurants) I can't wait for my next visit. 

One note: The Oyster Tuesdays are very, very crowded. Be prepared.
author: Joseph N.

description:
I hate it when I set expectations that just can't be met. Much like most people with proper sense of taste, I love fried foods. A guilty pleasure that  we all love, but not everyone is open to admitting it.

Went with my wife and her cousin to this location. The weather was great and thought parking might be a bit better here. Not much parking in the area except a bunch of street parking.

We got there at the right time; they must have just opened as we were the only customers...minus the loners at the bar area.

The servers were great. They were very attentive and quick to get to you. It probably helped that we were the only ones there, but even 15 minutes later when the place completely filled up, they were still "Johnny on the spot" --- well the servers were all women, so more Janes, then Johnnys.

We started with the crispy calamari. I thought it was strange that they would call it that as I assumed the batter if fried would be crisp. Well, the reason they call it "crispy" is that the batter has some crunch granules...almost like it was covered with Special K cereal. There was a crunch, but definitely not "crispy". Regardless, the squid was bland. It had no flavor. It was lifeless in flavor. You dip it in the saffron-like aioli or the cocktail sauce and that is all you taste. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND GETTING THIS.

I had the 3 piece fish and chips, Mrs. had the crab melt and the cousin had the lobster roll.

the fish and chips were very disappointing. The fish, much like the calamari, had very little flavor. The batter was sloppy and over-battered. It was crunchy, but again no flavor. The tartar sauce had chunks of goodness in it and tasted fresh, so that saved the fish, but goodness...what is the deal...why not even a touch of flavor and why so  messy on the frying? 

The crab melt looked good, but same situation. Just bland.

The lobster roll had promise, but when it came out, it was overly red in color. By that, I mean the meat was red which is usually a sign that it is mostly meat from the claw. The sweet goodness found in the tail was sadly not in the sandwich. You got the lobster flavor, but it didn't burst in your mouth.

The reason I didn't give this place one star is that the fries were awesome. They were crispy, they were tasty and had a nice hint of garlic on them. They were the stars. The rest was just blah.

All this blahness for $80 (total including tip). Not worth it. Don't bother. I left bitter...So sad.
author: Andrew C.

description: This place was really good. Nothing extremely memorable about it, but good. We had the lobster sandwich and fries. The lobster was cold, which I didn't really like, but the sandwich was perfect.
author: Jazmyn W.

description:
How much do I love Woodhouse? I have to pace myself b/c I would go every night if I could. 

I always go on Tuesday for $1 oyster night and then get the following:

To Start:  Grilled Artichokes - stuffed with crab and shrimp on a bed of delicious salad with garlic bread on the side.  So messy yet so good.

Main Course:  Fish Tacos!  Comes with 3 (can I pay for an extra?) that are probably the best I've had outside San Diego.  Describing those amazing tacos won't do them justice so just order and enjoy.

I've also had: 
Halibut Fish Special - served in parchment paper.  Girlfriend loved it but I was just sorry to waste valuable stomach real estate better spent on Fish Tacos and Oysters.

Go...go now!
author: Arnie P.

description:
Went here to meet some friends for dinner on a Friday night.
Cons: small menu + no menu items for non-fish eaters (yes, I know it's a *fish* house but it's nice if you can bring your vegetarian friend), 45min wait, overly huge portions.
Pros: tasty food and great service.
Everyone liked their food a lot, all the main dishes were well done.  The only 'off' item was the onion rings appetizer, they were more like onion doughnuts with about 3x more batter than needed.  Service was attentive and funny.  I would recommend this place.
author: Jeanie C.

description: I will give this place another shot for a higher rating because I think I ordered wrong (Lobster Roll). The two dishes my friends had, Soft Shell Crab BLT and Cioppino, were amazing.
author: Kelso H.

description: Excellent food here. I came here on a Tuesday and they had $1 oysters of a reasonable size. I also order the clam chowder and it was very tasty. Get the bowl and share it with another person. We also got the mussels/clam mix and it was fantastic. The flavor of the broth was incredible. Two thumbs way up! They ever brought us bread after we finished cause they saw us liking our chops as we stared at the broth haha.
author: Lenny C.

description:
I live above Woodhouse and its awesome, but it has created a lobster roll addiction in  my house. I always love when someone new comes to town because its an excuse to get a lobster roll. We went to Cape Cod on vacation and I can easily say with out reservation that the lobster rolls at Woodhouse are BETTER. 
$1 oyster Tuesdays.
Great friendly staff...we have a little one and they always accomadate us.

love it.
author: Lovin S.

description:
The fish & chips here are uber delicious and perfectly fried. Crisp on the outside and flaky goodness on the inside. The fries are always delicious. Thin and perfectly salted. And the tartar sauce is chunky with crisp veggies. A perfect complement to the fish.

The lobster roll is served chilled. It's not chinzy on the meat. I think the buttery bread is a bit overwhelming compared to the sweet lobster meat.

The oysters are great. Always fresh. Get there early for the $1 oysters on Tuesdays.
author: Malisha J.

description:
I really like this place. I come here mainly on Tuesdays because they have their all day dollar oyster special. Yum! The menu is short and sweet, but every day they have specials (I think they stay specials for a week or until they run out, then there are new ones). 

I've tried so many items off their set menu and their specials. 

- Clam chowder (new england) 
* Only ok to me. I like something more creamy.
- Oysters
* Always fresh and delicious, add a little tabasco and horseradish and it's just delicious
- Split top maine lobster roll
* Really good and you get chunks of lobster. 
- Fish & Chips
* The fries are really good. I love crunchy fries and this is what you get with these. The fish is always moist inside, and the outside is crispy, never burnt
- Stuffed artichoke
* This is really delicious. You get one half of an artichoke stuffed with shrimp and the other half stuffed with crab. Both the shrimp and crab are really fresh. The artichoke is seasoned well
- Dungeness crab (cracked and steamed in white wine, lemon & garlic butter)
* This is one of my favorites, it was just really good. The crab is fresh and the sauce is so buttery and garlicky. It just goes together very well. It definitely takes time to enjoy all of it. 
- Baja style fish tacos
* My bf DEVOURS these. It's one of his all time favorites and he almost always orders this. I never tried it but believe me, they must be good if they are gone in ten minutes flat. 
- Clam pasta
* They had this clam linguini on the menu that doesn't seem to be there anymore but it's really tasty. This is saying a lot because I'm forever in love with Ernesto's clam linguini. 

Their fish specials have never disappointed. So venture off the menu and check it out. They also have make it yourself Arnold Palmers. Yum!
author: Jeannie L.

description:
I Was VERY excited to know that one of the places I previously bookmarked to try was just around the corner!! We were attending the Fillmore Jazz Festival (LOVE it and can't wait for next years) and there it was. So after lots of walking and listening to great music we decided it was time for lunch.  I had the Lobster role (6oz.for $26) which came with cole slaw and a huge amount fries.  Great dish just wish it wasn't soo expensive.  My boyfriend had the stuffed artichoke with crab and shrimp on a bed of salad.  We both loved it! To wash down all this yumminess we had the "do-it-yourself" Arnold Palmers..pretty darn good if ya ask me.

A meal for 2 at lunch cost us about $56 and that's not including tip. But still a good experience.  Can't wait to come back and try the crab melt!
author: Charlene D.

description:
This place was FANTASTIC! Had some friends in town from Georgia who wanted a taste of some great seafood, without having to go all the way to the embarcadero. 

Great service and we actually didn't have to wait at all and 7:30, which was outstanding! 

The waitress knew her menu and was open to talking about the different items and suggesting her favorite and the most ordered food. 

We started off with the clam chowder, oysters and prawn cocktail, which were all delicious! The prawns were plump and the sauce had just the right kick! 

I was forced upon splitting what I was told was "the best thing on the menu," the Cioppino was out of this world GOOD!! Fresh seafood in a red sauce that was flavored with garlic, oregano and spices! Served with warm cheese bread to lap up the remainder of the sauce! The mussels and clams were so flavorful and there were pieces of crab in in the shells too!! YUMMY!! 

We also had crab cakes at the table and the lobster melt roll - all were great and we finished dinner with a savory bread pudding with homemade whip cream!! 

SOOO good and will def be going back for my fill of fresh fish!
author: Kelly B.

description: Good service, reasonable prices, nice setting, so...my fish and chips were terrible (almost). Fish ok, BUT batter fried not to a light golden brown but to a dark dank crustiness, creating a suit of armour for each piece . If we hadn't been in a hurry I would have sent them back (probably should have to give the fry cook  a chance at redemption). The one piece I took home for the cat was swimming in a greasy box .- compost!
author: mile s.

description: Awesome place. I have tried the Dungeness Crab Melt (I think its called...) and also the Fried Clam Roll (I think) and they were both delicious. The portions are deceivingly large. They look tiny but I was stuffed when I left! I only have one check-in here but I've been here multiple times and I love it. I recommend going for lunch!
author: Erin M.

description: Mmmmmm mmmmm mmmmmm.  You expect this kind of quality on the embarcadero but you have to go deeper into the city to savor delicious varieties of seafood.  I have had 5+ items on the menu: calamari, Cioppino, Bronzino, hot crab, crab roll, etc.  ALL DELICIOUS.  I have brought business contacts here for lunch, friends for dinner, and I've come myself when I've need to fulfill my need for fresh delicious seafood on the fly.  I can't wait until next time....see you soon!
author: Catherine S.

description:
One star for the lovely people who work here.  Very kind and attentive.

The mess was the "lobster roll".  UG!  Stringy, tasteless lobster.  Thought it may have been frozen?  Lacked seasoning.  Slaw (all three bites!) was made primarily with the thick middle portion of the cabbage.  Not edible.  The fries were overcooked to the point of no potato left - just crisps of oil.  UG!

The roll was good - ate that and left.

I guess the bar is low so far as lobster rolls go in S.F., however, I cannot believe someone in this town doesn't do a really good one.  I'll keep searching.
author: Judith S.

description: I love Tuesday!! 1 dollar oyster and they are so worth it! make sure you get some crab salad too and french fries. Yum o yum!
author: Aylee G.

description: I've been to Woodhouse twice for dinner. Casual, consistent food. I've tried the crab cakes and fish and chips.  It can be pretty noisy and the waits can be long but worth holding out for to try at least once.
author: Brianna M.

description: Have wanted to try for ages, as I live I the neighborhood.  Tonight was the night.  Had the artichoke stuffed with crab and shrimp.  Happy to say it was one of the BEST artichokes I have ever eaten.  Grilled, marinated and stuffed with crab and shrimp meat. Not "salad".  Meat. So good.  A little untoward to eat, but worth the effort.  Why did I wait so long???
author: J J.

description: Crab roll and clam chowder are amazing. Service was pretty good. Solid dining experience. Tried some lobster roll and that was pretty good too, but I prefer the dungeness. There are two sizes for the rolls. You don't get more bread for the larger size, but the crab/lobster serving is doubled. Great stuff!
author: chris s.

description:
Not too busy on a Monday afternoon, I got a seat in the sunshine by the window, yay. I don't get to indulge in shellfish too often, as the boyfriend is allergic and I try to be mindful, but since I was taking a "me" day, I wanted to go at it.

I started with the mussels (which were nice, the sauce was garlicky and subtle) and ordered a lobster roll, which was also pretty good. I think the sandwich would be improved if it were on a softer bun rather than rough, toasted split-top bread but that's my pref. 

My servers were great, attentive, and helpful.

Will stop in again sometime and try some of their other yummy looking sandwiches and entrees (cioppino here I come!)
author: Faith C.

description:
I loved Woodhouse Fish Company - everything from the decor to the service to the food. My family and I went there for dinner. Although the wait was a bit long - it was definitely worth it.

I got the dungeness crab with garlic/wine/butter sauce - AMAZING. Kept you wanting more that's for sure. The sauce was delish! The crab was easy to crack open and was sweet n juicy. My dad got the crab cakes - which were nothing special - I would skip them - not enough crab meat, too much filler. My sister got the fish of the day that was roasted in parchment I believe - fish was cooked just right and was delicious. We also got the stuffed artichoke - a popular item, my brother enjoyed it. My mom got the special. Everything was delicious, the experience was great and even though we were one of the last ones in the restaurant, they never rushed us. The host/server even stopped to talk to us before we left. 

I would most definitely come again if I visited San fran again!
author: Ha-ti N.

description: Creamy fresh chowder. Amazingly fresh fish & chips. Great service.
author: Chris L.

description: Great food but often there are long crazy waits. Its a pretty tiny place and can be a bit on the loud side due to it's size. Try the crab roll, fish and chips or a SF favorite - the Cioppino. Oh and don't forget about the fresh oysters!
author: Leanne S.

description:
So good. Went on a recommendation from a colleague who lives nearby. Mom and I had just finished "shopping" her apartment for furniture and walked up to Fillmore. After walking by a handful of restaurants we decided on the recommendation and were seated at the bar in Woodhouse. Not really a bar, just the counter seating, I guess you would call it. Everyone was super nice, the restaurant was full, but didn't feel crowded, and it wasn't too loud, I could enjoy decent conversation over the meal.

We started with the stuffed squash blossoms & heirloom tomatoes, Oh My God this is so good, was about all we kept saying. I wanted more, and more, and more. 

I had the fish taco's and Mom had the scallops. Both were very tasty. My tortillas were so wet though they all fell apart in my hands so my napkin definitely got some use, but since they were so tasty I would order them again, with a fork. The scallops were good too, I don't remember anything special about them though, very simple. Maybe because they weren't seared, I like mine seared. Anyway, we were very impressed, our tummy's happy and I will be back.
author: Jaime H.

description:
We stumbled upon Woodhouse Fish Company after driving around the city looking for a place to eat (I know, were we driving around for 3 days or what?!). We decided to stop on a super cute block of Fillmore, and saw that WFC had oysters, which was exactly what I was craving. It was a hot San Francisco day and all I wanted was some seafood and beer. WFC more than delivered. 
First of all our waiter was very nice. We ordered some oysters which were spot on, and also had crab cakes and the bay shrimp/avocado sandwich. The bread was the best I've ever had. I can say that confidently. So buttery and thick. I can't concentrate right now because I'm daydreaming of that bread. The sides (fries/slaw) were well seasoned and tasted great as well. 
I can't wait til I'm back in the city to have their delicious seafood again. With all the incredible restos in SF it says a lot that someone is excited to come back.
author: Trisha T.

description:
My visit to San Fran included one of the most delicious seafood places I've visited in a long time. We drove around quite aimlessly, but with some Yelp Help we located Woodhouse on Filmore. (There is another location.)

We tried calling ahead, but no use. We just had to wait it out. For about an hour, we jostled and teetered at the front (there was no room for waiting, and it was cold outside). But finally we got our table about 45 minutes later. We sat smack in the middle of all the action.

Our first order was the lunch-tray size of oysters. They come to you on a bed of ice and are perfectly tasty and super-fresh. With it a bottle of refreshing white wine. When it came down to mains, I tried the stuffed artichoke and my partner in meal the cioppino. Both were excellent. My first time trying the cioppino was heavenly with the all the flavors blending in so perfectly.

To top it off we were sat next to a lovely couple who had a house in San Fran. We chatted them up for quite a bit. That just makes dining and traveling much more enjoyable. Definitely want to try this place again.
author: Don H.

description: Consistently fresh seafood and great service. Their everyday menu is awesome and their specials are always worth a try!
author: Anthony M.

description: Nice and cosy, fresh seafood.  Great place to visit for authentic San Francisco foodie treat.
author: Marina R.

description:
Great place to come to for lunch when you need a break from shopping on Fillmore. I love the interior of this place with the chalkboard, the tv with "live" fishermen on it pulling in crabs and the Pablo Picasso fish picture. 

The fish and chips here are very good. They come out hot and fresh. We also had some great Kumamoto Oysters here (run $3 each) with cocktail sauce and horseradish. I need to try the sandwiches next time that people rave about. 

Service is prompt and friendly. They serve you pretty quick, so let them know if you want it paced out a bit. Overall a great lunch spot.
author: Natalie N.

description:
Been meaning to write a review for a long time. This is our favorite local spot in San Francisco, we always go to the Castro location and order the same things from the menu, haven't even tried any specials. We can't help it, it's just that good. The steamed clams are the best I've ever had, the clams are fresh, fat and juicy; the garlic/butter/white wine sauce is to die for, we save the sauce for dipping garlic bread, regular bread, shoestring fries, lobster roll, crab roll. 

I discovered WH whilst on the search for a lobster roll as good as Pearl's Oyster Bar in NYC and got more than I asked for, I think it's even better. Just the perfect mix of lobster, mayo, celery & tarragon with buttered brioche bun toasted to perfection. We also love the Dungeness crab roll for its warm buttery fresh crab meat also in a toasted brioche bun. 

Another thing to love about WH is that it's a family business and they actually care about being environmentally responsible; they only serve fish deemed "Best Choice" or "Good Alternative" by the Monterey Bay Aquarium Seafood Guide. We have yet to make it to $1 oyster Tuesdays but we plan to in the very near future! Take it from a seafood queen, Woodhouse is the bomb!
author: Connie W.

description: Fish and chips absolutely perfectly executed! The vegetable sides was also delicious! Love that place.
author: Benedicte L.

description: Just came back here after 2 years. It was so good that I can't believe we forgot to add this place to our  list of regular San Fran spots! Started off with 1/2 dozen oysters (fantastic - particularly the Kumamotos) and clam chowder (outstanding flavor and great clams). Husband had the fish and chips and I had the cioppino. My favorite cioppino is at Anchor Oyster bar, but this one is a contender - large portion of impeccably fresh seafood and a delicious broth. Definitely 5-star fare.
author: Eme L.

description:
The Woodhouse Fish company became our go to place because I was REALLY craving some crab but didn't want to go to any touristy spot by the wharf or Crustacean (you know the seafood place kitty corner to Magic Johnson's used clothing store with the flashing HIV testing sign staring at you while you eat?).   We were in the area, the Yelp reviews looked pretty good.  We decided to check it out.  The wait to be seated was pretty long. So by time we sat and ordered, I was no longer firing on all cylinders.  What do I order for my meal?  A stuffed artichoke.  **Facepalm**

But no worries, after a few minutes, I realized my mistake and decided that why not make the stuffed artichoke the second appetizer (for only 2 people) and then get crab as the meal.  The waitress, knowing that the total tab was about to hit triple digits graciously obliged the change.  All that food sounded great at the time, but by the end of it, I was stuffed and felt gorged...my own fault.   My dumb story doesn't take away from the real point of my review .  Their crab was great, and the stuffed artichoke was even better.  About the only thing that isn't awesome about this place is the wait  to be seated.  With the size of the restaurant and the type of food they serve, tables don't really turn that fast...so be warned.  My only other beef is that the decor is kind of chincy for a very design conscious city.  It reminded me of something that they might have picked up at an auction from a closed Red Lobster restaurant.  All and all though, Woodfish is a solid 4 and I'd go back.
author: Jeff G.

description:
if you yelp for crab and/or seafood anywhere near this spot, it will jump pretty high up on that list of options you'll get. and for good reason. this was a fun eating adventure when we were on a hunt for some seafood to conclude my quick trip to visit family in SF. 

what we ate: whole crab with white wine sauce, fish and chips, clam chowder
the crab is what we were really after and it was delicious. messy as expected, but a lot of fun to eat. we split between 3 people along with the other items, but i could probably eat one on my own as a entire meal. 
the fish and chips were well done. and very popular, seemed like most tables had an order. and probably the best bang for your buck too. 3 large pieces of fried fish and a pile of frech fries was a sure way to fill us up alongside the crab. 
the clam chowder was creamy and full of large clam pieces. cant go wrong here either. 

all around the food was a hit and at fairly reasonable prices as well. service was friendly and the place has a nice casual vibe. if there is a wait or you need to walk off some of the fish and chips after, take a stroll up the hill. great view from the top!
author: Christina H.

description: I really love this place. I live around the corner and I think we come here so often that they've started recognizing us. The owner/manager (Jake?) really go out of their way to ensure that you have a great dining experience. For example, we had a party of 4 and were waiting for a table for a long while, because even though they had paid their bill and were done eating, they wouldn't leave. When we were finally seated, Woodhouse gave us a platter of oysters on them as an apology. We were blown away. Even without this sort of service, the food is spectacular. The clam chowder is spot on and the fish and chips are the best we've had so far. We tend to come on dollar oyster Tuesdays, and their pick of the day is always delicious. At this point, I'm pretty sure we've been here with every family member who's visited from out of town, and no one has been disappointed. Keep up the good work guys - I'll see you next week, I'm sure!
author: Convict T.

description: Unbelievably good crab sandwich.. I highly recommend
author: Terrence T.

description:
The food was mostly great, as many other reviews have said. (The batter on the fish and chips fish does need a little more seasoning.) 

However, my 5 stars is mostly about the service. Our group was every waitperson's worst nightmare: two super light eaters, two people with English language issues, one cheap, ahem, value-conscious guy, a tired 5-year old, and two others. And  most of our group were tourists.

To begin, we got there about 6 pm on a Saturday. We didn't beat the rush. It took about 25 minutes to clear out the quarter of the place to seat us. The staff were upfront about the wait, but nice about it. 

Our waiter was just wonderful. He took it all in stride despite the low tip per head possibility based on how we ordered. Between the 8 of us, we probably ordered about the same as 4 normal customers. None of us ordered drinks. But he chatted up the 5-year old and refilled my water three or four times. He didn't treat us like we were tourist-scum. He even showed my sister a little trick on how to get the backbone out of her fish. 

So, he did get a much better than average tip. 

We will be back the next time we are here.
author: Patti K.

description: Amazing clam chowder, decent garlic bread (a bit too much Parmesan cheese infused into it), and solidly flavored whole fish (albeit a little pricey on the whole fish). I wish the menu had a few more options that weren't batter fried. But this place is good if you're in the mood for New England style fried seafood.
author: Art W.

description: Delicious food, really hits the spot! Nice waiters too.
author: Joshua B.

description:
WOW!

What a cool little place. Love the decor and the service was friendly.

Stuffed artichoke, crab melt and halibut in parchment were ordered and promptly devoured. Excellent!!! 

We've already recommended Woodhouse to friends, family and random strangers... Can't wait to go back!
author: Tysen C.
