    -Ordered a dozen oysters. 6 were Hood Canal oysters from the west coast and 6 were Blue Point oysters from the east coast. 
     The west coast version had a very "oceany" taste. Not bad but they did have a hint of seaweed flavoring but with an awesome texture. 
     Now the east coast oysters were meatier, had no oceany flavor and were our favorite. Regarding the west coast oysters; I'm not sure if you can knock the oyster preparers for having pieces of shell in the oyster that made it hard to really enjoy it but if they could keep an eye on that, everything would have been perfect with both oyster varieties. I don't mind a small shell or two but I had to pick at my tongue at least 6 times to get the shell out. 
     -We both ordered the daily specials, my honey ordered the "Sauteed Salmon" which came with summer squash Au-gratin and smoked bacon & leeks over spinach. 
     - I ordered the "Grilled Mahi Mahi" which came with mango salsa, mixed vegetables, and jasmine rice.
     -My husbands choice was beyond great. His salmon was sauteed to perfection with a light and crispy crunch and then leeks with a little bacon served over spinach and a side of squash Au-gratin. The flavors mixed well and he stated that he would definitely order it again.
     -My mahi mahi was light and was served over rice mixed with vegetables. It seemed like something that a person with stomach issues would order because it was so light. To be fair, mahi mahi is a light tasting fish but it tasted like it required something more. What would that something be? I'll leave that to the cook. I would rather have something with more substance for dinner....but I would order that particular mahi mahi dish for lunch. 
     ++++Overall this place was amazing if a little pricey with a total bill of $80. For dinner...not too bad. The oysters were awesome with lemon, horseradish and cocktail sauce, the waitress and host were friendly and helpful, our dishes were awesome (my husbands) and pretty good (mine) and the chowder was pretty great on a cold night in SF. Take a honey or take a friend but be sure to stop in for good fare at a decent price. We will definitely see you there. : )
author: Tabitha R.

description:
The friend I came with suggested this place because he was craving seafood and he heard a lot of goodies about this place. It was easy to find this place, but parking was a b*tch. Took me a while to find parking, unless you're lucky, obviously I wasn't that night. I came on a Friday, so there was a little wait, but 30min, not tooo bad. We were seated quickly, the place wasn't very roomy, felt like the whole time I was talking the table next to me was listening and laughing along. I guess the place isn't that big so we can't expect too much privacy, but it's not that bad. Our waitress was very friendly so I guess they get a plus for that. The menu isn't that big so we were able to decide on what we want pretty fast, even though I wished I had more options because I like options but that's just me. 

He had the lobster sandwich and I had the crab cakes. His lobster sandwich came with fries, I took a bite of his sandwich, and it was pretty good. He really liked it. I only took a bite so I am not able to say much about it in full, but I thought it was delish, the lobster was juicy and buttery, I will definitely order that next time and make the person I'm with order the crab cakes. =]

As for my crab cakes, they were good! I ordered three...haha it came with a salad, luckily it did though, because for me at least, the more crab cakes you eat the more "dry" it feels, even with lemon juice and the sauce, so with the salad it helps balance it out because if not I do not think I would be able to finish the crab cakes, even though it was good. 

Would I ever come back? Yeah I will. Id love to, esp on a nice night, walk along the street, drop by bars or sit in there and chit chat.
author: Helen T.

description: Came here last Saturday with my gf. It was a full house with a 35 minute wait...that wasnt bad but we just didnt have time to wait so we ordered to go. She had the Dungeness crab roll, I ordered the Bay shrimp and avocado roll and together we shared the roasted whole trout. We waited about 30 minutes in total before we got our order. Let me just say we dove right into everything when we got to the car and everything was delicious. Shrimp and crab was on point, especially being for on the go but we both agreed we needed to eat there next time. We're coming back again very soon.
author: Aaron C.

description:
This was an okay experience.  The ambiance of the place is great, the service was lovely.  I should have had the catch of the day, really.

My meal was a bit too heavy for me.  Started with a cup of New England clam chowder, it was very very very thick and glue-like.  I cannot imagine someone eating a large bowl of this.  That said, the clams were tasty.  My entree was crab cakes and they were on the greasy side.  The accompanying salad was delicious and not over dressed (the beets were a real plus).  Our party shared a plate of garlic bread, I defy anyone to tell me there was even a hint of garlic on it.  

In a city rich with seafood restaurants this will not be a place that I would put on top of my list.
author: Donna H.

description: Came here on a Saturday for lunch and was seated quickly.  The fried clam roll was delicious--a big healthy portion.  I ordered a fancy Arnold Palmer--tasted just like a not-so-fancy Arnold Palmer but cost double.  Shame on me.  Service was adequate...not particularly friendly but we received everything we needed.  It's one of those places you'd go to if you happen to be in the area--not a place you'd go out of your way to frequent.
author: happy t.

description: Ate here for lunch yesterday & was kind of expecting a lot more... Collectively we ordered the lobster roll, crab melt, & clam chowder. The clam chowder was delicious, but the sandwiches were really expensive and not up to par in taste for the price. The crab melt was pretty salty as well. The service was fine & the ambience is really fun.
author: Alexis K.

description: Restaurants must be improving.  I'm so used to eating crappy chowder, but recently I found decent chowder.  Come here for decent chowder and a beer.  Make sure the beer doesn't come out of a can.
author: Byron L.

description:
Eh, this place was quite the disappointment. When I first walked in, I thought it was super cute for a small fish restaurant, but right from the start the server gave us trouble for wanting to seat 10 people. We were willing to divide up into multiple tables (better... no group tax/service fee), but he was still being really odd about it... and it wasn't even crowded yet! We made sure to beat the dinner crowds and got there at 5:30pm on a Saturday. My table (1 out of 3) ordered some appetizers and dinner. I ordered the lobster roll, others ordered the fish tacos, seared tuna special, and stuffed artichoke special. 

My table was having a good time laughing, talking, and eating our appetizer when we realized how much time has passed (an hour).... and we still didn't get out food yet. That's when we looked at the other two tables and realized they were FINISHING their meals! When we asked our server about our food, he didn't apologized or anything-- brushed it off as if one of our orders, which was on the special menu, took awhile.... uhhhh... if it was on the Special/Food of the Day menu, wouldn't you think that item would be faster to prepare? 

When we FINALLY got our food, we had to rush to eat it because our friends at the other two tables were long done and just waiting for us. We spent over two hours in that place. 

Sure, the food was good, but the service was horrible. We didn't feel bad holding up the three tables during Saturday rush dinner hour because it was their fault. 

Awful server, bad service, and long waits.... no bueno.

Not good for groups. Doesn't take reservations. Crazy street parking.
author: Lisa T.

description:
Update - 

Man, these guys have the most AMAZING Lobster rolls.  DP and I went in for an early lunch, we were the first to be seated after they opened up.  Both had the lob rolls (large size, well worth the price!!!), excellent slaw and fried calamari.  Doesn't get any better than this, folks...at least on the West Coast.  Will be back - again and again.

Oh, the pics don't do it justice either.  These lobster rolls are large and filling.  I was surprised!  Yummm!
author: GJ C.

description: I must admit this is my new favorite spot for lobster rolls and fish and chips. Their seafood is always great quality although this is more of a whole in the wall (highly decorated and with hardwood details in this case) and it's on the Fillmore main strip, but beware come with plenty of time, you'll need it.
author: Carolina S.

description:
If you ever want to tell whether or not a restaurant is a good restaurant, try tasting the cheapest things on the menu.  I ate; a cup of clam chowder (5$)and a crab melt (11$).  The waiter (guy with beard) suggested I mix the chowder with two types on the menu.  The suggestion was write on point.  Also, the French fries are well seasoned and crunchy.

Two drawbacks; it is too busy and they don't take reservations so, go here during off-hours, they do not take reservations.

Otherwise, I am looking forward to eating there again.
author: Mo H.

description: Aside from their $1 Oysters on Tuesdays, I'm not sure there's anything else worth going for.  Sorry.
author: Kristen S.

description:
half a dozen oysters: we had some from the east coast and some from british columbia, which were much better.  i'm sticking to west coast =)

bowl of manhattan clam chowder: reminded me of chili b/c it was so thick.  i was pretty disappointed as i thought it was going to be like the manhattan chowder i had at newport beach's crab cooker.  i would not get this again.

6 oz lobster roll with fries: this is so amazing.  the buttery toast, seasoned mayo and huge hunks of lobster made every bite a mouthgasm.

bacon-wrapped scallops with japanese sweet potato, wild rice and string beans: this was one of the specials and the scallops were incredibly savory and tender.   the sides were perfect with each bite of salty goodness.

this is definitely one of the better places i've been to lately for fresh seafood.  we spent $82 including tip/tax, but every penny was worth it (well except for the $8 chowder).
author: Jen Y.

description: $1 Oyster Tuesday is my favorite, but still a good deal all around.  And the quality of food is always great.  Can't go wrong with the crab roll
author: Young P.

description:
My wife and I really enjoyed our food.  Place is a little bit on the smaller side so definitely come before your typical dinner rush.  No reservations either :(

We had the whole fish special and a lobster roll.  Both were quite yummy.  We were able to sit and watch all of the entertaining activities that were go on on the street.  

Food is a little bit on the pricier side, but you don't always find as good of quality at that price; you have to hunt for it.

Limited desert menu, but that is okay.
author: Dan W.

description:
Coming from Houston, I have to say that I was quite disappointed in the seafood here - I thought San Fran was know for good seafood? We had the New England clam chowder to start. Big bowl, lots of clam meat, but really uninspiring and lacked any depth of clam essence. For dinner, I opted for the lobster roll and indulged in the 6 oz of meat (I'm in SF, why not?). Big mistake. There was a lot of meat, but it was ALL claw meat. And it was overcooked and did not have ANY flavor. The bun was nothing special either. Was not dry but was not as buttery and soft as some rolls I've had on the East coast. We also had the fish tacos which, again, unfortunately lacked any true flavor or depth. I am surprised at the rave reviews. 
The atmosphere is great. I love the feel of the place and we had a really sweet and delightful waitress, but I would definitely not come back and am a little disappointed that our first dinner started off a bit lackluster...
author: I N.

description:
Despite the slow service, this joint was otherwise delightful.

No frills decor and a casual vibe = the perfect atmosphere for a light snack of fresh local oysters and rich, creamy chowder. 

With so many wonderful seafood establishments in this fair city, I'd prefer to try somewhere else next time, but I enjoyed my food here immensely.
author: Sarah M.

description:
I've been to each location with my boyfriend, and that's why I decided to take my dad on his one night in the city.  He's a retired navy, East coast kind of guy.  He wants a place that's nice without any pretension.  

They don't take reservations, so I called ahead and put my name in.  My dad finally showed up right before they gave away the very last table (parking is rough in this area).  While I waited one of the staff brought me a glass of wine which he even helped me select.  They have good reason to insist that the whole party be there before they seat you, so they try to make you comfy while you wait.

I love the food- when I think, 'I want seafood' this is the kind of stuff I think of- pure unadulterated seafood.  No fancy stuff, just good and fresh.

The service is also good and casual.  My only problem (4 stars and not 5) is the noise level and how crowded it is.  We were practically on top of the next table.  I understand that space is valuable because I also work in the restaurant business, but it was so hard for me to hear my dad, and even harder for him to hear me.  I don't know that there is a solution, but it will make me think twice before I take anyone of an older generation there again.  

In conclusion: very noisy, very nice staff, very good food!
author: Theresa H.

description:
We wandered in for a casual lunch, and were immediately seated with menus.  Everything looked so good we had a difficult time deciding what to order.  I had my heart set on the cioppino, but the server sold us on the pacu fish ribs.  What an ingenious idea, to cut fish into ribs, baste it in bbq sauce and grill it like it's turf-wandering counterpart?

My girlfriend and I agreed the cioppino was delicious.  Hearty and more substantial than some of the thinner broth-type cioppino's we'd tried in the past, and loaded with all manners of marine goodness upon which were placed two slices of garlic cheese broiled toast.  SO GOOD!

The fish ribs were just as tasty, and we were surprised by how moist and succulent they were.  The server had described them as being like swordfish, but they weren't as 'meaty'.  I'd say the texture was between swordfish and black cod.  Firmer than cod, but there was a little bit of that melt-in-your-mouth quality too.  The bbq was perfect with just the right bit of smokiness and tang.  The only thing we didn't touch much of was the coleslaw.

And you have to try the fruit crisp a la mode if they have it as a special.  The plump berries were nice and sweet with the buttery crisp topping daring us not to dive face-in.  Fresh out of the oven, it was absolute heaven!

A pleasant lunch experience with solid service!
author: Janet L.

description: Decent midweek dinner spot if you're a seafood lover - seems popular but our wait was short. Service is fast, but the fare is a bit too expensive for the quality. Shortbread pudding for dessert was killer though.
author: Sandra S.

description: I came here for dinner with the girl because we saw pictures of the lobster roll and we had to make it ours. I ordered the bigger size roll and she ordered the cioppino and we shared. The roll was toasted perfectly, the shoe string fries were just perfect but then we get to the actual lobster part. It was pretty much lobster with a bunch of mayonnaise just thrown on top. If you want a lobster roll that highlights the flavor of the lobster with what they mix with it, this isn't the place for you. If you love smothering mayonnaise on everything because you are a fat American, then by all means spend your $26 on this. Maybe I came on an off day but I was not satisfied with it and it border lined gross. Since all the other components were there it helped make up for the lackluster lobster. The cioppino was tasty. I have had better elsewhere but it was nice and warm broth with tasty seafood. There were scallops which were nice, the shrimp were perfect and there was no sand in the clams and mussels even though they were tiny. The crab was also tasty. So overall a good product that came with garlic bread to soak up the juices. After leaving we were full but the lobster roll is what we wanted and we left disappointed because we wanted to like it from all the positivity we've seen on it. May come back to try it again but not anytime soon. Not for $26.
author: Jeromy G.

description:
Been here twice. I couldn't resist having the fish & chips both times. I appreciate the tasty coleslaw and feel like they should give you more than a shotglass sized cup of it. 
Last time I came here was on a Tuesday so we tried the dollar oysters. Fresh! So good! If i'm ever here again on a Tuesday i'll be ordering a bunch of those and something else small. 

The do it yourself lemonade was a cute concept, but at the beginning I couldn't get it sweet enough... maybe the simple syrup took a while to mix in? Then at the end you're left with extra soda water and simple syrup so you have to make a sweet water drink. Kinda pricey too. 

Someone next to us ordered the bread pudding for dessert. So tempting... It looked amazinggg. I'll be coming back here when I'm feeling like fish & chips! Or maybe I'll cave in and try something else on the menu for once :)
author: Michelle R.

description:
I have been here twice and both times have had no resistance to the fish and chips. Now this is not a British Pub kind of place (Thank God) so the chips are really french fries in disguise. But the fish is heavenly. The first time I was here I burned my mouth I was so excited to try the tasty morsel. 

A few swear words later I continued with my meal, which was delicious. 

I recommend if you are in a hankering for some great deep fried fish (my precious) come to Woodhouse and get your grease on.
author: Fuji F.

description:
Finally decided to try Woodhouse and was pleased with it all. Friendly staff and cozy decor. We walked in close to 8pm on a Thursday night and just got the last open table. The clam chowder was hot and creamy, not starchy or salty. I tried their specialty, a half and half new England/manhattan blend. Yum!!! 
Fried calamari was tasty and hot. 
The only problem we had was two of the 4 orders were wrong, but because of the prompt fix and quick apologies it didn't bother me so much. The salmon special with mushrooms and arugula was perfect. Nicely cooked, the vinaigrette on the mushrooms was a nice change and the portion size was substantial. Lobster roll and crab roll were stuffed full of meaty goodness. Slaw needed a bit more flavor. Baja fish tacos came out hit and crispy. 
All in all a great tasting restaurant with reasonable prices. It's so nice to see a restaurant with under $20 entered for seafood. I'd go back for sure!!
author: Susan Z.

description: Came here with a group of friends on a Friday night. Food was ok, wish I could rave about it like everyone else, but we were all unimpressed. Maybe they're better for lunch!
author: Caroline D.

description:
Definitely a nice place to go on a date. Especially, if you are catching a show at Yoshi's after. The environment is not too formal but yet not casual (basically, anything works). My gf and I sat at the bar and were immediately greeted by a warm smile. 

We shared the butter crabbed sandwich ($26) and soft shell crab salad ($15). The crab sandwich was off the chain. Flavor was on point, you could definitely sense the butter but it didn't feel heavy when it went down. I guess what I'm trying to say is that the amount of butter was perfect. The slices of bread weren't soggy at all either. Sandwich was also accompanied by fries and coleslaw.

The soft shelled crab salad was good as well. I definitely enjoyed the corn that was included with the salad. 

I would go back. Only draw back is pretty pricey.
author: Andrew C.

description: I've had dinner here two times.  All I can say is that the food is bland, and the service is below average.  The first time I asked for my lobster roll to be hot.  They refused to just put the damn thing in the microwave.  Nice..thanks alot.  The last time I went there, they had run out of forks.  So I was given a cocktail fork with my fish and chips.  Really?!
author: Kurt L.

description: Went for dinner. Had oysters, NE clam chowder, and the fish and chips. Oysters tasted as expected. NE clam chowder was super thick and chunky the way I like it. It had clams with every spoon full. Also came with store bought oyster crackers. The fish was thick crispy and greasy but did not taste fresh. Fries were average as well.
author: Derek M.

description:
why??...

first time i ate here, fell in love.  great food, great atmosphere, great service...
the lobster sandwich used to be $15 for maybe 5 oz of meat...
now, u have to choose 3 oz for $17, or 6 oz for $25, holy mother...!

littleneck clams tonite were overcooked.
the garlic cheese bread was over-overbaked; cheese was tough, bread was tough, and very salty...

i can't freely endorse this shop now.  wat happened???
author: Ethan L.

description: Good service, good food, nice decor, small portions, overpriced. I wouldn`t pay $25.00 for a crab or $23.00 for 5 ounces of scallops. Very good food just not enough of it.
author: Martin B.

description:
I've come here a couple of times -- once sat at the bar on a weekday and once had a table on a weekend. Both times for dinner.

The service here is EXCELLENT. Not to say it's stuffy or overbearing, they just hire NICE people who really seem to care about the food the are serving and know the wine and beer really well. The food is also great -- good portions and a good mix of healthy and not-so dishes. 

It's laid back and pleasant. A great neighborhood place.
author: Abby P.

description: Had the lobster roll, which was pretty good. I think there was too much hype because I thought it was just a'ight. It had a bit of a fishy taste, but the bread was good. I would probably try the crab rolls next time. What was really good though, was the clam chowder! There's no sourdough bowl, but you can ask for a side of bread and dip it in the soup. Delish!
author: Spam M.

description: The lobster sandwich is very good.  The location is pretty clean and service was fast and friendly.
author: Matthew P.

description:
Last night I was craving Fish and Chips so we decided to try this newish restaurant in our hood (we had not gotten round to it yet).
The waitress was very friendly and attentive and the food was delicious.
I had 2 pieces of fish, which was plenty for me. Instead of salad I ordered a side of brussles, sauteed in garlic. YUM!
My husband had the seared tuna special with spinach, which was really tasty too. 
Beer is a tad expensive, 5.50 for an Anchor Steam draft - steep!

All in all, a really good experience.
author: Alexandra D.

description: i really enjoyed my date here! we shared some very fresh oysters, he had the fish and chips, which was delicious, and i had the pasta with grilled squid. the sauce was very flavorful and the grilled squid also surpised me with the amount of flavor it had. i can't wait to come back.
author: Sabrina L.

description: The DIY Arnold Palmer is fresh and delicious, and the crab melt was one of the best articles of seafood I have ever eaten. Can't wait to go back!
author: Adam R.

description: I had their fish and chips twice! I would recommend this place to anyone who likes fish and chips or seafood. Two different locations and both of them are just as good. Oh! And get the clam chowder.
author: Tim M.

description:
Two words - lobster roll. The hubby and I were craving some serious lobster one day. In Yelping, we discovered Woodhouse. We drove all the way from the East Bay just to satisfy our curiosity and craving. It surely didn't disappoint. It was so good, we went back the following week. 

We've tried:
Lobster Roll - yeah baby!
Steamed Clams - awesome. big and juicy. that cheese toast that comes with it is amazing.
Dungeness Crab Melt - ok
Toasted-Buttered Dungeness Crab Roll - pretty good
Crab Cakes - ok
Clam Chowder - may be bias because we make our own so this was just ok

We'll definitely be back even though it's a bit of a trek. 

Thinking about this just makes my mouth water!
author: Anesia C.

description: Service was good. No quarrels about that but food was lacking. Crab uni linguini didn't have a sliver of uni nor did it have a hint of uni flavor. It wasn't bad but it was nothing more than 3 stars worth.
author: Adrina W.

description: Great lobster roll, not to heavy or buttery. Perfectly cooked and seasoned side of spinach, worth the extra dollar to sub for frenchfries.
author: Laura M.

description:
1 dolla oysters and a stool @ the counter: what's more a girl to ask?

Strolled in 'round 9 on a tues post-cinema, needed a little protein and ended up with zinc as well (oysters pack a serious nutrient punch!). Easy service, great lookin' menu (i am SO all over the stuffed artichoke on next occasion.. how do they put so many all star ingredients in one place? did they dream of my delight?)

Also had the crab cocktail (sauce on the side..) which was yum, though I can always do with more of the meat.

Didn't sample the wine list on this occasion as we were both @ tail end (the power of positive thinging-- the END) of a cold but will be back for some bubbly to compliment the food de la mar al proximo. (What it is about yelp review that make me break into random languages, only the gods know..)

Solid, easy spot in Pac Heights where the window shopping aint even tough on the wallet ;).
author: Rachel S.

description:
Lobster roll is a must!! Love their thin fries that it comes with as well.  The bread is toasted with butter...so good.

$1 Oysters on Tuesdays.

Great service.
author: Mina B.

description:
I haven't had a decent oyster po' boy in a long, long time. Imagine my surprise when I found one on the very last weekend in my Lower Pac Heights neighborhood. 

We had an early dinner; we walked in and were seated immediately. The three of us shared a deep fried squash blossom appetizer filled with shrimp and eggplant. My companions ordered the dungeness crab melt and California sea bass risotto. The crab melt was nice, but nothing extraordinary. My mother compared it to her tuna fish salad sandwich (which, after taking a small bite, I found strangely true). The risotto was smooth and flavorful and only marred by the slightly overcooked sea bass that sat a little too stiff atop its savory bed. 

I have to say, my oyster po' boy was the best of the bunch, with plump and crisp oysters wrapped in a soft toast bun served with a ramekin of dilled tartar sauce, crispy french fries and a refreshing, tangy cole slaw. 

Yes, my friends, after 4 years in the City, I am moving on across the bay to the beautiful neighborhood of Temescal, where I found a spacious Victorian flat right in Oakland's hipster foodie central.

Amidst the excitement of having a real honest-to-goodness flat with an in-unit washer/dryer, 3 large bedrooms, a formal dining room and a large eat-in kitchen, and a really cool/sweet new roommate, I couldn't help reminiscing about the time I spent in my lovely Lower Pac Heights studio.

Still, I'm excited to discover new territory, new faces and making new neighborhood acquaintances and I can always come back to visit my old haunts.

Woodhouse Fish Company will be one of them.
author: May T.

description: It's hard to find a good fish restaurant in the outer neighborhoods and Pac Heights is no exception. If you are looking for a non-Japanese fish restaurant in this area, this is your best bet (if not only choice). I eat a lot of fish, so I rate this as just OK in comparison to restaurants outside the hood. It's not bad, it's pretty good, but not outstanding. If you don't eat seafood often and/or if you're not that particular, this may be a good choice for you. They don't take reservations so get there early and/or be ready to grab a drink elsewhere.
author: Cathy P.

description:
Major fail!  'nuf said.

I came here after my friend raved about their clam chowder.  Frankly, it tasted bland, and it was nothing special.  Fine, they have soft chucks of clam, but if the flavor is not there, it doesn't matter!

Fish and Chips was greasy, like others have commented.  fish was fresh and juicy, but batter was tasteless.  Fries were good, I'd give them that.

Crab cakes were unimpressive.  Not enough seasoning and spices, and were served "lukewarm"!!

Service was slow.  We waited 15 mins between clam chowder and our entrees.  Overall, bland, expensive, greasy food.  Will never come back again!
author: M F.

description: Awesome food! Great service and fair price! Will come back for sure!
author: Juan C.

description:
Well...I'd have to say that this place wasn't very good. We came Saturday for D's goodbye dinner and while it was great hanging, both the food and the service were a disappointment. Our waiter was oddly snarky (J asked for no coleslaw with his sandwich and the waiter responded with 'Oh, it'll be fine it's just a little coleslaw' and then brought it anyway wtf). We had three tables and one of the tables didn't get any food until after the other two had already finished. 

And to top it off, the food wasn't that great. Calamari was what you'd expect. Lobster roll was okay but it was cold! No comparison at all to the brioche one that I had at Anchor and Hope. Tombo tuna was hopelessly bland. No good guys. :(
author: Samantha C.

description: Its Sunday 2:15 pm. We got so lucky with parking. Happy Day! Then we enter the restaurant, its pretty busy with about 30 people but luckily there are still tables available. We are greeted right away, given menus & order. We ordered a bowl of Clam Chowder which came right away. Thank goodness cause we were hungry. The bowl is big enough for 2. It was tasty & thick just how I like it. Then came our entrees. We got the crab sandwich & Fish&Chips. It was good but... my tummy ached soon after =(
author: Donna D.

description:
This place is amazing!! It is a tiny hole in the wall place with about 8 tables, but we went on a friday night at 7pm and we got a table. 

The clam chowder was AMAZING. Best I had ever had! I am still craving more of it.

We had the stuffed grilled artichokes....so yummy!! Stuffed with crab and shrimp, with pesto between the leaves. Then they sit it on a bed of lettuce that has a sweet dressing, and 2 pieces or garlic bread that was tastey.

We also shared the lobster roll that comes with fries and slaw. I don't eat slaw, but theirs was good. The lobster roll had a LOT of meat on it and they but it in half for us to share. 

We had 3 items shared, 1 beer, and 1 wine for $63. Better then the dinner we had at Market Stret Grill for $85.

I will ALWAYS go back here.
author: Nicole B.

description:
Came for dollar oyster Tuesdays! had a contest with my girlfriend's main squeeze...we drew the line at 4 dozen each. Again, a little small very tasty and briny, no sand.

I converted my friend and her man to the diy Arnold Palmer. My date came late, and this time he had the fish tacos. They were delicious, New England style: fried fish tacos. Still, he said they weren't that filling. They brought him a lobster roll by mistake, and they put the rush on the correct order and brought him a free second round. 

Kind of like the other location's decor better. This is more upscale, but more ordinary and boring. Its a little narrower too, but a bit more space at the bar than the Castro.
author: Maria A.

description:
Last night I was planning a trip to Tomales Bay and was thinking about eating oysters the entire time.  Luckily,  I was meeting some friends up for dinner at Woodhouse!  

The oysters definitely hit the spot.  So fresh, so smooth.  

I also ordered real food this time.  I shared a bowl of Clam Chowder (white) and a Bay Shrimp and Avocado Sandwich with a friend.  The Clam Chowder came out lukewarm...which is a big NO NO.  I HATE lukewarm food!  I asked to have it reheated, which was no problem (I hope!).  Even when it was cold, it was one of the best clam chowders I've ever had.  It was not too salty and the clam taste is distinct and present.   When it came out steaming...I inhaled it.  The sandwich was messy but still tasty.  A little too much mayo for me...but I should have expected it.  The fries and slaw that came with the sandwich were addicting.  I couldn't stop eating them!  Thankfully..the night was busy and the server took the fries away from me before I got a chance to clean off my tray. 

Overall, a solid seafood restaurant.  I will definitely come back to try more things.  CBLT looked amazing and so did the pasta! Can't wait!
author: Helen V.

description: I came here for dinner around 7pm on a Thursday Night. Place was packed.. About 8ish, some tables were clearing out. However, the host was walking back n forth from the front to the kitchen. He was not seating anyone. There were about 8 tables open. Guessing they were having problems expediting orders?? Other than that..food was alright ..
author: Christopher L.

description:
I do not deviate from my go-to fish and chips at Woodhouse.  They are just that good. 

I did manage to persuade the bf to deviate from his usual with an order of Fribs (fish ribs).  Those things are awesome!  Who'd have thunk there was a fish that could produce such a remarkably meat-like flesh? Rib sauce, coleslaw and all...

Also, had never had the bread pudding thing and that alone is worth coming to Woodhouse.  HOLY crap that stuff is amazing.
author: Gabrielle J.

description:
Been here a few times now 

Love it

They honestly have some good quality seafood dishes

Short and simple menu but almost everything I have had here is good

Its a little on the expensive side but nothing worse than going to any usual seafood comparable
author: Charles C.

description: Such a solid non-pretentious seafood place!
author: David F.

description:
I heart seafood as much as the next person so imagine my delight when I heard of WoodHouse Fish Company.  My friend has been raving about them for their dishes like they were the best invention since chocolate cake so there was no way I wasn't going to give it a try.

I came in on a random weeknight and there was a wait.  Well, it is Fillmore afterall.  What do you expect?

After about 30 minutes of waiting,  we were finally seated in a tiny two top in the middle of a crowded room.  Did I ever mention I detest close knit tables with a PASSION?  Oh wells.

We ordered:
Crispy Calamari
Fish & Chips
Crab Cakes

The crispy calamari was fried to perfection and served with tartar sauce and marinara(?).  It was good but nothing to write home about.

Although I didn't get to eat the fish and chips, it looked so delicious in all its glory.  Huge crispy pieces of fish with a hint of fresh squeezed lemon, dipped in a creamy tartar sauce - it was enough to make my heart skip a beat...in a good way!

The crab cakes were stuffed with crab and all things tasty, just the way it's supposed to be.  There were more crab than there were filling and it was dressed with a nice, spicy chipotle sauce and paired with a crisp, spring salad.   

Even though it sounded like everything was fried (in this case, it was), the meal was surprisingly light yet fulfilling.  Everything was solid but in no way was it earth shattering the way some people made it seem...All it is is good, solid seafood dishes made well to taste good.

Originally I was going to give them a 3.5 star rating but because of our awesome server, they deserve 4 stars!  She was quick, attentive (knew when to come back to offer me a 2nd glass of wine), friendly, outgoing, bubbly, full of smiles...basically EVERYTHING A SERVER SHOULD BE.
author: Lisa W.

description:
Exploring Fillmore street, my wife and I arrived at the Woodhouse Fish Company restaurant on a whim for early dinner.  We were greeted warmly at the door and offered our choice of tables - a pre-8pm luxury.  The bar seating looked inviting and afforded a nice view of the classically framed flat TV showing clips of the fishing industry, then and now.  Our affable server, Zia, welcomed us and recommended the BBQ Oysters and the Roasted Fish of the day (Sea Bass).  We added a couple cups of the Clam Chowder, opting for the creamy tomato Hartford and the creamy New England (an all tomato variant, the Manhattan, is also available).  A couple of beers and the evening was set for a tasty experience.  
The restaurant, decorated with a nautical/fish industry vibe, is very welcoming, relaxed and inviting.  On par is the fast, friendly service complemented by the delicious execution of the fresh food.  We thoroughly enjoyed the well proportioned cups of Clam Chowder followed by the delicious BBQ oysters (4 to an order).  Our efficient food runner and busser kept our water glasses topped and cleared the bar for our shared main course of roasted sea bass.  The whole fish was charred to perfection and was neither dry nor over seasoned.  The accompanying cauliflower and sauce was an excellent compliment to the overall balance of flavors.  While not intending to, we indulged on dessert, ordering the Sourdough Bread Pudding - a concoction of texture and subdued flavor that finished the meal perfectly.
Great service and scrumptious food served in a well designed and casual environment.  Overall we enjoyed the dining experience at Woodhouse and would highly recommend the restaurant.
author: G M.

description:
Another Fillmore spot, another score.

Woodhouse has a solid selection of good seafood plates and fresh fish. Our table had fish tacos, stuffed artichokes, fish + chips and clam chowder and everything was very tasty. The servers were very attentive and kept checking up on us.

There was an interesting moving picture frame that dominated the left side of the room. It's places like this that only reaffirm what I already believed -- that this area of Fillmore has the highest concentration of high-quality eateries in the city. There aren't many 5-stars, but everything is in that 4-range.
author: Brian B.

description:
Dylan and crew have done it again..............this time on Fillmore Street between Pine and Bush.

Delicious seafood in their second location. We're big fans of their fish and chips, lobster rolls, clam chowder, seafood pasta, and are always happy with the different fish specials each night. The larger wine menu is also a plus. 

We love taking our seafood loving friends to Woodhouse, it's like our "home away from home."
author: Mickey A.

description: They have descent /fresh food, but wish they accepted reservations.
author: Monica R B.

description:
I cannot say enough good things about this place.

So far here are the dishes I've tried and my reviews respectively....

Crab Cakes....delicious and decadent with just the right amount of delicate greens and beets, I just wish there had been more of the crab cakes!  Guess I should have ordered a "double double" order - LOL.

Fish and Chips.....deep-fried heaven on a plate.  I prefer steak fries to shoestring but the fish is fried to perfection and the portion is just right.  You can order different size portions depending on how hungry you are.

Lobster Roll.....also an option of portion size depending on your level of hunger.  The roll itself is special made for the place.  It is buttery and soft and provides the perfect cradle for the moist chunks of lobster.  This sandwich has absolutely no filler, it's just pure ecstasy in a bite.

Fish Tacos....ok, so I might have liked a little more filling but I don't think it would have fit in the petite vehicles of corn tortillas.  Very simple and delicious.  A great option if you feel like eating light.

Overall, this place deserves well over 5-STARS especially considering how reasonable the prices are.  I have only done lunch at this place so far but I would go there for dinner in a heartbeat.  I can't wait to go back - this place is PURE YUM.
author: A H.

description:
Loved it, very quaint and cozy. The food was outstanding, the beer selection is limited but good, same for the wine. 

Had some TASTY calamari and pepper lobster special that was mouth watering the entire time. If I lived near by I would eat here all the time.
author: Tommy H.

description:
I was a little worried about going here so close to closing time the other night, but worry not my friends.

I've been here twice now, and enjoyed my food both times even though both times I ended up without bread and butter. Eh, the first time I guess my friend and I didn't need it, and the second time, it was brought promptly with lots of butter as soon as I asked for it. Also, both times the service was super friendly.

The first time, I had the Dungeness crab melt which had plenty of crab and plenty of melt - melty cheese that is. I enjoyed that thoroughly and had a refreshingly biting fresh lemonade. My friend had the DIY Arnold Palmer; I like that since I think there's usually not enough lemonade.

The second time I was fiending for seafood, and with most other places in my neighborhood closed or serving sushi which I just had, I opted to return here. I was the last person seated and decided to go for the gold. I had a few oysters - very fresh - served with lemons and cocktail sauce with horseradish. I like my cocktail sauce a bit more chunky and spicy, but mix in the horseradish, a squeeze of lemon, and some dashes of Tabasco, and it's all good. I also ordered the wedge salad which was ok. It was actually drowning in dressing, I mean like at least 6 oz, but the dressing had lots of bleu cheese, and I just scraped the extra dressing off to the side. Better too generous, I guess. Then came the half Dungeness crab cooked in white wine and garlic. Very tender and delicious. That's when I had to ask for bread and butter to sop up that white wine sauce. Geez, I made a mess. Picked a sauvignon blanc to a sip alongside made for nice late meal.

As a fan of seafood served from the humblest cart by the beach in the tropics to high end, I am glad to find a comfy and clean moderately priced spot in my hood that is reminiscent of family seafood shacks close to the water with its decidedly angler bent decor. Next time, I'll put the fish and chips to the test.
author: Myla A.

description:
My gf and I had a craving for fish and chips, so we hopped onto Yelp and found this place. It's a small place and can fill up very quickly. The seating is particularly tight and high stress if you're seated by the hosts' stand, which is situated smack dab in the front of the restaurant. The orientation of the restaurant is a bit odd, there's a bar in the back which doesn't seem to have much room for a bartender let alone drinks on shelves. We were situated pretty close to the bar, but somewhat comfortably. Here's my abbreviated rundown to save you time:

1. Ordered fish and chips, everything is deep fried (as expected), but the batter if fluffy.

2. Ordered 2 crab cakes, comes with a side of salad w/ beets. The beets were a nice touch as well as the chipotle sauce.

3. Ordered a bowl of clam chowder. This was ok, but I wouldn't get again since it had a strong flavor of butter (cook was maybe trying to fix something?)

4. Ordered the fish tacos. These came as a slight surprise since they were deep fried as well. The taco shells are soft, but hard in some places. Still a good choice despite the shells flaw.


I'd come back again, the food is pretty good and the fish and chips are legit.
author: Wil M.

description:
I have been to this Woodhouse Fish location a couple times now, and while it is not a bad place, I think that the food is somehow undistinguished and I can't even remember clearly what we ate.

It's also busy seemingly all the time, which is a bit mistifying to me, as the prices are a bit on the high side for what you get as well.  Service has always been pretty good, however.

I guess two stars is a bit harsh, 2.5 stars is probably more like it.  I just can't find a compelling reason to go back, however.
author: Dave N.

description:
Blech.

WoT
Wo$
WoC

They also need to hire more staff-saw 3 people walk out in the time I was there to eat my tasteless luke warm food.
author: Cassie G.

description: Went here with my two sisters and we all loved the food that we got. We got a bowl of New England Clam Chowder, the Dungeness Crab Melt, the Split-Top Maine Lobster Roll, and the Fish & Chips. The highlight of all our food was the Lobster Roll, with the bread perfectly toaster. The Clam Chowder was next but it doesn't match the Clam Chowder found in Pismo Beach off the 101 going down to Los Angeles. The service was great but I did kinda wish they gave us more room from the host station and our table. Definitely not a great place for groups during busy period unless you like to wait a long time. Wish we went here during their oyster special.
author: Tam V.

description:
Went for lunch, nicely decorated place with friendly staff.  Really was in mood for good seafood. Really wanted to like this place and was happy when food arrived and they looked like the pics on yelp. Everything LOOKED delicious.  We ordered the large lobster roll, crab cake, and fish n chips.  Unfortunately, all the dishes were not salted enough and lacked flavor.  Couldn't taste the crab in the crab cake, the lobster in the lobster roll, the fish in the fish n chip.  What hurt most was the lobster cos it was $26. I think this is because the seafood is brought in frozen and not fresh.  When you bite into lobster its waterlogged.  What was good was oysters and fries which were more like pomme frittes. Also batter on fish n chip was one of best I've had as it was light and crispy.  If I go back maybe i'll stick with pastas or specials and see if those are fresh.

For seafood i'd stick with Swan Oyster Depot.
author: Fei C.

description:
i love lobster rolls, so after paying a little more at anchor and hope for an AWESOME one, it's hard to go back to a-ok.  the flavors are just not as bright and the bread was a bit too toasted, could have been softer.

french fries are very crispy and double fried, but remind me a bit of the oreida extra crispy.  definitely frozen.

friendly service, and froyo handy for dessert next door.  but if you can make the drive for a lobster roll, go to anchor and hope instead.
author: Josie M.

description:
I really enjoyed lunch here. Nice intimate setting and great service.  As for the food, everything on the menu looked great so I had quite  a difficult time deciding. 

We ordered fish and chips which were delicious and huge. We got the three option to share and weren't able to finish them all, despite how amazing they were.  It might be because we ate the garlic bread too which was incredible! 

We started off with the BBQ oysters with spicy apricot habenero sauce. YUM!!

I will most definitely be back to check out the $1 oyster happy hour and to order some of the other dishes!
author: kathi k.

description:
Went here last night on a random occasion and boy was I pleasantly impressed.  The decor inside fits in with the upscale neighborhood of the Fillmore district but didn't feel too ritzy.

Came here with a few friends last night and ordered some oysters and a shrimp cocktail for an appetizer.  While the shrimp cocktail was decent, the oysters were phenomenal.

I ordered the crab cakes (3 and a side salad for $13!) which were exquisite and complimented the Merlot I was drinking.

If you happen to be in the mood for seafood, are in the Fillmore district, I highly recommend checking out Woodhouse Fish Company
author: Natan O.

description: Definitely try the fried clams, and the artichoke hearts. I also had the lobster sandwich, which was good, unfortunately the sandwich was really small for me. The only problem is the place is really tiny and it gets crowded. The line can get really long during lunch/dinner service. I recommended everyone to come and try a little bit of something different everything you come here, cause everything on the menu is delicious. Beware of the prices, it can be pricey...but you know it's well worth it, cause it's truly one of the best seafood restaurants in the bay area.
author: Jenny W.

description:
While reading through the other Yelp reviews for this place, there's one thing that caught my eye - Lobster Roll.  After I saw that, I was pretty much sold on the place.  The actual sandwich lived up to all the attention, and I'm just a sucker for toasted sandwiches.

The clam chowder was creamy, but needed a sprinkle of salt.

The cioppino was excellent and had a good variety of seafood - shrimp, fish, mussels, clams and crabs.  The accompanying garlic bread was rich with the cioppino soup.  Personally, I would have preferred just a plain cut of toasted bread instead.

I'm excited to go back and try the crab melt and stuffed artichoke.
author: Chanelle W.

description:
This place has awesome decor and really laidback, cool staff. Loved their fresh oysters, and oyster po-boy sliders appetizer. The french fries are delicious, specially seasoned. My friend ordered the crabcakes and loved them! They're open right between lunch and dinner, which is great because moss other places are closed until 5ish for dinner.
I ordered the fish and chips (something I don't normally do), but their fish was surprisingly good, a little on the greasy side, but their dipping sauce was good. Will be back for more oysters!
author: Alyssa G.

description: I've been here on a couple of occasions and have enjoyed myself each time. It feels like you're at the beach when you walk in and see all the aquatic decor and bright sunshine coming through the large windows in the front. I've tried the mussels with garlic fries (extremely amazing), the branzino whole fish (will knock your socks off), fish and chips (pretty decent if you ask me), and the shrimp and avocado roll (okay, but a little too mayonaise-y for my liking). I also highly recommend the Trout Slayer beer in a can. It's quite refreshing to enjoy with a seafood meal. Staff is friendly and patient. I'd recommend coming early so you don't have to wait. This place can get pretty busy right around dinner time, and I've heard up to hour and a half waits at some points. I came around 5:30 and got right in.
author: Ashley D.

description:
I said I would be back, and I was. We took advantage of the $1 oysters, and did it right this time around with the lobster roll, chowder, and calamari.

The Lobster roll was amazing, huge bites of lobster hung off the sides of the buttery grilled roll (thick toast). In my opinion, it was better than Waterbar's and more reasonable priced. Both the New England and Manhattan clam chowders were thick and chunky and had really good flavor. 

The servers and owners were really nice and accommodating. We were a little impatient, and they allowed us to order our drinks while we waited. Our group got in the way of servers and guests in the wait area and walkways, but they smiled and kindly excused themselves past us in the tight spaces, which speaks volumes when you're carrying trays of food and beverages through a busy restaurant.
author: Deanna T.

description:
9-21-10
Atmosphere: Seems pretty small and tight for my liking especially when you are at a 2top right next to other 2tops and you feel like the boring couple next to you is listening on your great stories...and then your suspicions come true when they jump into the conversation! Might actually sit at the bar or convince the waiter to give me a 4top
Service: Our waiter had great knowledge of the menu and actually paired some oysters with some wine which I didn't like but my date did.
Oysters: Decent, nice presentation
Food: special (crab/shrimp stuffed egg plant) date liked it, I got the waiters recommendation (fish tacos) eh...i guess they were ok. 
Overall: Its kinda a middle of the road seafood place which isn't too pricey, so for that it was good, but not idea for special occasions. 3 STARS
author: Kevin B.

description:
This micro-chain seafood restaurant is one of the best I have been to. This intimate fish house has one thing in common with Luna Park, one of my other favorite SF restaurants: value. The food is fresh and delicious and reasonably priced. And I must say much better than anything the tourists are eating over at Fisherman's Wharf.

I started out the evening with the special appetizer: Tuna Tartare. I know...I know, it's a culinary cliche and overdone, but it's yummy. This was good, but could have done with a touch more acid. The tuna was delicious and fresh, but the fat from the avocado and tuna seemed to mute the flavors of the dish overall.

Next came the Lobster Roll which was fan-effing-tastic. The roll was buttered and grilled with tons of lobster meat that was perfectly cooked and dressed. The lobster was tender, sweet, and chilled just enough to give a nice contrast to the warm buttery roll. And a bargain at $16.00. It is served with coleslaw and fries. The slaw was a slam dunk. I'm not a huge fan of coleslaw, but if it is on the plate, then I'll usually eat it. This was perfectly balanced with a slight sweetness (from a little bit of apple I think) that really brought out the sweetness of the lobster roll. The fries were tasty - you know the kind, lightly seasoned with a light dusting of cornstarch before frying to give them a little texture.

And for dessert...a buttermilk panna cotta with sliced mango. I'm not a huge fan of dessert, but this rounded off the meal with just the right tanginess from the buttermilk to cut the richness from the lobster.

They don't take reservations, so plan on waiting for a table. When we arrived the wait was 40 minutes, but the host took our cell number and called us when a table opened up. Service overall was excellent, but I must say what keeps them from that fifth star was the timing. Our courses came a little too close together and our entrees were fired much too soon. The hot food in our entrees wasn't so hot when it arrived at our table, which was shortly before we finished our appetizers. The kitchen may have been having an off night and prices are so reasonable at this place that I'm guessing they rely on fairly quick turnover to keep the lights on.

One thing that has to go is the 'DIY Lemonade'. When you order the lemonade, it is brought in three glasses. The lemon juice in a glass with ice, a small decanter of soda water and a smaller decanter of simple syrup. To get lemonade, just pour and stir. It's hokey and it doesn't taste any better than when someone in the kitchen does it for me, so I don't get it. And all those glasses and decanters clutter up the table.

Three appetizers+Three entrees+Three desserts+Three DIY Lemonades=less than $130.
author: Joshua R.

description: Jesus Christ, of all the deliciousness in the deep blue ocean this place totally brings flavor. I had a lobster roll that was served cold and it made my mouth water, I've never had something so perfectly cooked and so light yet extremely fulfilling. The lobster roll was served so beautifully I couldn't even begin to process how I was going to eat something so beautifully crafted. The roll itself was so soft and buttery, it was fresh out of the bakers oven. The lobster tasted to fresh and was so flavorful and succulent that went beautifully inside of the roll. Moving forward, my boyfriend has a simple fish and chips order that was to die for. He said he's never had fish that had been so well breaded and cooked perfectly ever. This meal was complimented by a bead of French fries and a side of Tatar sauce that was house made. This place is extremely affordable and has a beautiful atmosphere. All employees were extremely sweet and on top of their customer service and showed interest in everyone. I give this a 4/5 because of the tight seating, I felt my boyfriend and I were sitting back to back with another couple and we kept disturbing each other when getting up.
author: Elba G.

description: I literally annihilated the calamari in such a fury that the appetizer experience is literally a blur. Then being the super ambitious person that I am, I decided to order the large lobster roll and came to a sad realization that I was really too full to appreciate all of the lobster goodness. The calamari yellow sauce went really well on the lobster roll.. that I can definitely recall.
author: Karen H.

description:
This place is SOOOO Yummie!
We started with oysters & the bay shrimp salad-yum
We then had the special which was an amazing piece of tuna-yum
garlic bread-yum
Not to mention ALL the boys that work there are Super Yum! 
Service was stellar & they were sooo busy!
Can't wait to visit Woodhouse again!
author: sarah k.

description: the mega lobster roll with fries for the boyfriend (i got a side salad) in under 3 minutes flat.   how could you be mad at that?  worth every penny.
author: Jenny B.

description:
Actually it is a 3 1/2.  The restaurant takes no reservations.  The long wait, people coming in and out does not add to the ambiance of the place or the enjoyment of a meal.
The food is very good.  If you like oysters, apparently many do, there are  plenty for you.
We shared the little necks in a wonderful broth.  The clams were bigger than the usual little necks, but tasty and fresh. The fish and chips, their specialty, was good but a bit greasy with the batter.  Wouldn't order them again.  The lobster roll was very good, fresh and tasty without the heavy mayo. Two sides: cole slaw was excellent, fresh, crisp and not mayo laden.  The  corn with tarragon, butter  and sweet peppers was awful.  Cloyingly sweet and very little corn taste. If the corn can't stand on its own, don't serve it.
Service was good and efficient.
author: george k.

description:
This place is everything Nettie's Crab Shack wishes it was but isn't. Good menu variety, more than reasonably priced, generous portions, no pretentious attitude, and oh yeah - great food. 

Lobster Roll - One of the best we've ever had.
Wedge Salad - Excellent. 
Cioppino - Sauce was extraordinary. 
Halibut - Again, one of the best we've ever had. 
French Fries - I don't know what they do to those things but they're amazing. 

The two cute boys who seat/bus table/smile a lot are adorable and definitely add charm.  

I took one star off because of the tv screen that runs footage of catching crabs and other things - it's distracting and makes me feel really guilty about eating anything from the sea. Also, they seemed a bit understaffed and while the wine is pretty cheaply priced, a bit mundane in selection. I don't mind paying a few more bucks for a superior wine.

But the place is awesome. I can't wait to go back and try more items on the menu.
author: Gina L.

description:
This COULD HAVE been the place where I tried my first oyster, but I was too scared to do it, despite the fact that my bff tried to convince me I would love it for about 10 minutes and doused it with all kinds of sauces...but in the end I chickened out and she was the one to eat it! Oh well, love it or hate it...

Good thing I braved the peer pressure and stuck around for the three cheese and crab melt, though...holy hell that was good! ($8.95). We also got the lobster roll ($15.95) which was bursting with lobster meat and totally yummy (although I honestly prefer crab to lobster). The DIY strawberry lemonade was another great experience...they bring all the ingredients out to you and you make it to your own liking...

Very good seafood, reasonable prices, a nice environment and not too crowded (on a weeknight). Excellent staff and service as well. A really good meal that felt a little bit east coasty!
author: Shannon R.

description: This place has the classic fish counter atmosphere of lore. Traditional fish and chips and lobster rolls. However, they have bowed to contemporary tastes and have a reasonable wine selection and some slightly more sophisticated dishes. Primarily, though, this still seems like a blue-collar traditional seafood restaurant with a selection of oysters, lobster sandwiches clam sandwiches and such, all fresh and served with a smile.  The person dining next to me at the bar seemed like a regular, and really endorsed the lobster rolls, so that's what I will get next time. I ordered and enjoyed the blackened cod special, with a hash of vegetables sautéed in butter. It was subtle (as blackened fish can be), if not an exquisite dish. I am used to a more New Orleans style blackened, which would be much more spicy than this, but I still found it quite pleasant - cooked to perfection albeit under spiced.
author: whit e.

description: This place gets packed and for good reason. You must try their calamari and fish and chips! Their fish tacos and ciopinno soup (served with garlic bread) are some of the best! They don't take reservations so you may need to wait for 30min for a table but there's some near by bars to grab a quick drink while you wait. You can also bring in your own wine (corkage fee).
author: Tyana G.

description: Been here for the second time today! First time, I got the lobster roll and it was great! And got a clam for an appetizer which was really good too. Today, I got the 12 dozen oyster and omg it was fresh!! Soo good! The calamari was good as wells. Crunchy. And again I got the lobster roll again. My friend got the dungeness crab melt which he said was ok. I let him tried my lobster roll and he said he shoulda gotten that. My other friend got the fish and chip. I've tried some of that and it was really crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. It was really good. I would definitely come back and wanna try their ciopinno. Hopefully it will be as good as their dishes!
author: Nhung C.

description: This is a great seafood restaurant in a casual, neighborhood setting.  The calamari and oysters were great, as well as the chippino and stuffed artichoke.
author: Larry P.

description: A little pricey but lobster roll was bomb dot com.
author: Daniel N.

description: Best lobster roll I have every had on the West Coast!. It comes in two sizes. I was greedy. I ordered the larger one.
author: Robert L.

description:
Went there on a Saturday on a friends advice.  Good Choice!
Had the lobster roll, they put a lot of lobster in there!  Comes with fries and slaw.  Even the fries were good, slaw is slaw.  Gf had the crab melt, which I don't recommend, it's good, but tiny.  Fried calamari and cup of clam chowder, gf had the combination clam chowder, half New England and half Manhattan style, it tasted good too.  I just had the regular New England style, which I was fine with that. I also had the Arnold Palmer, when they separate the lemonade and ice tea so you can mix it yourself and simple syrup.    I saw other things I wanted to try the next time.  Yes, there will be a next time.
author: Peter L.

description:
3.75 stars.

gotta keep a close eye on woodhouse credit card charges from now on.

my card was charged twice.  ...lucky i checked my bank statement.  i was told that the amount in question will be refunded to me by today or tomorrow.  hopefully, this will be the last that i hear of this incident.

s'ok.  i still lurrrv you, woodhouse.  well, as much as my frigid heart will allow me to, anyway.
author: Ting A.

description:
This place is pretty good.  But for some Odd reason, we felt that the crab melt sandwich was much better at the Castro location.  Fish & Chips were yummilicious and service was really attentive and friendly.  

Both had Scrimshaw beer, me more than my companion ( I have issues).   To start I had a cup of their New England Chowder . . . Mmmmm....Mmmmm.....Mmmmmm.....GOOD!!!

Overall, it was a good experience but even though it's the same restaurant, I think I liked my Castro location meal better.
author: Karen B.

description:
If I could, I would give it 3.5 stars because the clam chowder and steamed mussels are fantastic. The soup was creamy and chunky, with the right amount of flavor. And we couldn't get enough of the mussels broth, finishing it off with bread and spoon in hand. I highly recommend any of the starters, sides, crab cakes and the petrale sole. Everything else is just so-so. 

The place isn't that big so be prepared to wait on crowded nights. However his location is much bigger than the Market St. location. A great place to come with a few friends but too loud for date night.
author: Kimmie N.

description:
Lobster Roll: Full of claw meat (don't tell anyone: I prefer the claw to the more popular tail) and perfectly grilled hot dog bun. The size was a bit on the small side but you can't say they skimped on the meat. The dressing on the lobster wasn't drawn butter; it was something light and fresh tasting and.I.loved.it.

Fried Clams: These are real fried clams (not quahogs like they serve out here) bellies and all. The bellies were pretty small and the batter was too thick and crispy. It's supposed to be thinner. More like a beer batter. Overall though, I was happy to taste that belleh meat.

Oysters: My dining companion had the dozen Hood oysters and even though I only marginally like oysters these were pretty tasty to me. 

It's been a long time since I've been in such a state of happiness at dinner. For a girl from Small Fishing Village, MA, eating lobster rolls and fried clams in early spring in SF transported her right to August in Westport. 

PLUS: the price is right, y'all. $15 for the lobster roll. That's cheap considering it's Maine lobster. The entrees are all in the $16 range, which for SF / Fillmore St. standards is downright discount. 

The service was friendly and good. 

There will be a wait, at least on a Tuesday night. Put your name in, go get a beer across the street - they'll call you when the table is ready. Take that SPQR!!
author: Andrea S.

description:
make sure that everyone in your party is there or you won't get a seat (this isn't a new concept).

the oysters are delicious, and on tues $1/ea. the oyster po-boy is delicious, and there's no daily deal on that. my friends shared a seafood soup something which looked awesome as well.
author: Ameer N.

description:
Food, decor, ambiance, drinks were all great - had a yummy lobster roll and some really good oysters, all fresh and simply/classically presented. Really frustrated not to have discovered this place earlier - looking forward to trying their fried things!

There can be a bit of a wait, but they're very courteous and will take down your number and let you hang out elsewhere nearby while you're waiting.

Two small snafus prevent me from awarding 5 stars: our server forgot one of the 2 appetizers we'd ordered, and the tip I left was over-charged on my credit card bill. Both of these were remedied very quickly. I'll be back.
author: Chrix F.

description: I love the down-to-earth and friendly folks who work here - and I love the stuffed artichoke.  This is a great, great place.
author: Christin A.

description: Somehow I really expected to be blow away. And wasn't.  Their lobster roll was pretty tasty and that was a winner... as were the bigger of the oysters they brought us.  And the clam chowder was good (but dare I say, not as good as the Le Boulanger chain in the South Bay?).  But the dungeness crab was quite a chore to access and not really life changing and there was something fried that was not so memorable.  This is all still fine and good, until we saw it was $63 per person including one glass of inexpensive wine per person.  Basically, this place should be just perfect for oysters and the lobster roll.  And then call it a day.
author: Aaron M.

description:
Thoroughly enjoyed this place.  Keep walking past it every weekend and finally took the plunge when in-laws were here to watch the ankle biter so we tried this out for date lunch.

A little wait as they don't take reservations, but if you're willing to take the bar seating, it's quick.  We don't mind bar seating when it's the two of us.  

Big, airy, bright, clean.  My husband commented it reminded him of the Hamptons.  I can see that.  All the servers were so nice!  Nice servers really make a good first impression - more so than the food, I think.

We had the calamari, my husband had the crab melt and I had the tacos (I had to put tabasco on it).

I saw a table of two women indulging on oysters on the half shell and I drooled.  I will try them here after the baby comes out.

Clean, bright, efficient, no frills good food and service.  We like!
author: Mrs F.

description:
$1 oyster tuesdays?  yes please
scimshaw pilsner on tap?  yes please
dungeness crab roll and ciopino with garlic bread?  yes

fantastic place for fresh seafood...not quite at Swan's level, but it's open for dinner which is a big plus
author: nick g.

description: this bathroom is just ok. it makes an effort for the restaurant theme, with fish and boat  stuff on the walls.
author: Fzarond K.

description:
this review is based on a single dish.

woodhouse has EXCELLENT cioppino.

not quite sure why one would roll to a high-end seafood joint
such as this 
looking for fish & chips, 
but I vouch for the cioppino.

a moderately spicy tomato stew
loaded with fat chunks of assorted sea meat
with toasted, buttery garlic bread that soaked up the goods perfectly.  

a solid meal, well executed, 
after which the breeze wafting up fillmore
complemented my generally warm and satiated belly.

quite honestly woulda been pissed if I had ordered the lobster roll, 
and would've affected my review.  
it just didn't bang for the buck.  so be warned on the lobster roll.

but the cioppino was something else, among the finest i've had.  
they hooked me up with a free glass of wine 
cuz they lagged on getting my dish out, 
after whisking my girl's up to her in no time.  
good look.

solidly frisco-style yupster ambience,
not hating on that cuz i was trying to showboat my lil' lady.
sometimes you want to steer clear of the taco universe 
esp. when you're rollin' up to SF from LA.

if you roll to this establishment, MOS DEF COP DA CIOPPINO my friend.  anything else and you're on your own.
author: S S.

description:
$1 oyster Tuesday! 

I was excited to see this restaurant open in my neighborhood. My friend and I took full advantage of the $1 oysters, which were fresh and delicious. My only criticism is that some of the oyster shells were not cleanly shucked, leading to some of the oysters having a bit of shell on them. Otherwise, the oysters were briny delights.

We also shared the fried calamari (yum, accompanied by cocktail and aioli sauces) and a crab melt sandwich with french fries. The sandwich was a bit on the small size but delicious, as were the crispy french fries. 

We washed everything down with a bottle of the house white - $19 Fish Eye.

This restaurant is on the quainter side so you may have to wait to be seated. The service was friendly and prompt and the atmosphere is bustling and loud, but adds to the casual appeal.

An excellent addition to the neighborhood restaurant scene.
author: Jenny K.

description:
We went there this past Friday night and were VERY happy. We walked over and put our name in (for 4) then walked over to Harrys for a couple of drinks. When we returned we were the next table to be seated. At this point we were hungry! 

The atmosphere was cute, great for a date night or a small group of people- tables were closer together- which was fun bc we got to see what our neighbors ordered! We got the mussels and calamari to start off with. Both were great. I ordered the artichoke with crab and shrimp on top of a salad- AMAZING! My husband got the halibut and he thought it was great as well. The service was good. 

With all of that being said, we will definitely be returning!
author: D and I W.

description:
We came here on Tuesday $1 oyster night. 

The host said the wait would be 30 minutes, but a table was available in 10 min. If they recommend waiting at another bar, I would suggest waiting around.

The oysters were good, but like some others said beware of shells. We ordered the clam chowder which was full of yummy clams, but just wasn't seasoned very well. The fish tacos were yummy with the perfectly fried tender fish and avocado, but also under-seasoned. We also ordered the lobster roll which was a bit spendy and just ok. 

Overall, a decent place to go to, but a bit pricey. The restaurant staff is very friendly and the place has cool posters.
author: Vanessa W.

description:
Traditional Fish-
House, Reasonable Prices, 
Can't wait to go back.
author: Brian J.

description:
Arrived 5-ish on a Saturday.  Not early enough; still had to wait about 20 minutes.  But hey, i wouldn't down-rate a place for being popular.  Staff was good about looking for an opportunity to seat the 4 of us by moving adjacent tables together.

I ordered the fish and chips.  I figured it would be better here than at other places where i've had it.  It wasn't.  Too much greasy dough around the fish.  I didn't really enjoy it.  Wife didn't like it either.  I was going to rate this place 4 stars because the petrale sole that my sister's bf ordered looked nice and moist.  My sister told me afterwards that while it looked good, it was cooked in too much butter.  Too much butter becomes a flavor-enhancer, just like MSG.
author: Sun W.

description: cool place -- wedge salad was delicious -- loved it! grilled stuffed artichokes were so good we went back the next day for more! Fried fish was lightly breaded, yet crunchy --excellent fish tacos and fish and chips! Gonna try the crab melt and crab cakes next time!
author: Mike F.

description:
I checked out the woodhouse fish company today after reading all the wonderful reviews. I concur with what's been written. The place is nicely decorated, the food is fabulous, the staff is friendly and the prices are totally reasonable. 

I was also pleased to hear that they plan on having $1 oysters on Tuesdays! Giddy up
author: Armando G.

description:
Woo!  So happy this place opened up a block and a half from my place.

ordered the oyster po'boy sliders, steamed mussels, oysters, and the onion rings w/ my sister.

The sliders are to die for, it's a shame you only get 3 with each order, but definitely my favorite of the night.

FYI if you order the mussels w/ garlic bread it comes with 1 little slice of garlic bread, which is tasty, but not much when it's an appetizer?  I wonder if they'd only provide like 3 french fries if you ordered those to accompany it instead

Onion rings are crispy and delicious. I overheard the guys next to us saying they looked really good as I crammed one into my mouth.

I can't wait to come back!
author: Naoko M.

description: I enjoyed the crab roll and the oysters were fresh. Great lunch!
author: Annie C.

description:
WFC has a good atmosphere but I was pretty disappointed in the lobster roll. I ordered the three ounce split top lobster roll ($18). The celery and green onion (or scallion) chopped up and mixed with the lobster masked the flavor of it. If you're having a lobster roll you want to be able to taste the flavor of that expensive little hunk of shellfish. Eveything else (the fries, roll, cloeslaw) were good. I love that they had Great White beer available. 

So disappointed in the lobster roll. Although I did not try the fish and chips they looked very good.

Will consider going here again but not for the lobster roll. Also, not sure why but the lobster roll pics where you see nice hunks of fish under reviews isn't what you get. The ones where you see the lobster chopped up is what you get.
author: Steven P.

description: We went to the Fillmore Jazz festival this weekend and not being familiar with the area at all, we chose to have lunch a Woodhouse Fish Co. just because we love fish. Man, oh man!!! We were so pleasantly surprised that we found this place. Everything on the menu looked wonderful so it was hard to choose but the couple next to us had the stuffed roasted artichoke so we decided to try it. Soooo scrumptious! and so much food. We also had the fried calamari appetizer and that was wonderful as well. I'll definitely go back again next time I'm in the area.
author: Christie B.

description:
What a great place!  I was in the mood for some cioppino, so we decided to check this place out.  I can't say enough good things.  The food was amazing, the cioppino was spicy and full of garlic, which I really enjoyed.  The cheesy toast on the side had lots of herbs and was perfect for the broth.  My girlfriend had the crab cakes which were also delicious.  They have do-it-yourself arnold palmers which I think is great.  Everyone's food around us looked incredible as well. 
The service was also quite good.  Our waitress was outstanding and made me realize how bad most waitstaff can be in comparison.  She seemed to have almost every table in sight and managed to be polite and attentive to everyone.  Will be back to try more!
author: Nate W.

description: I used to really love this place, but now not so much.  Everything was fine--but that's the problem, I expect a little more than fine. Really should have crossed the street to Elite.  Staff here is still super nice, though.
author: Robert M.

description: I was underwhelmed by the Woodhouse Fish Company.  I had the crap melt, which you would expect to be a signature dish. It was dry and not particularly flavorful.  And the service was a bit spotty.  On the positives, it has a nice interior.
author: Brian M.

description:
3 stars for food (oysters, artichoke plate, clam chowder, spinach side) 
-.5 for slow delivery of half a dozen oysters to our counter...and it was oyster night!
-.5 for extremely slow service when we wanted to pay and get outta town...and the place was about 2/3 full.  I had to flag down the host (and only then, the 3rd time he passed by), as our server (who raced by 3-4 times) was busy with others.

Kind of bummed about the service - hope that can improve as they work out any kinks on high-demand nights like oyster night. :-/
author: Liz K.

description:
Wow - just wow.

We just got back from a long weekend in SF and this was by far the best food we ate there. I had the Dungeness Crab roll and my wife had the pasta & prawns dish. Both were out of this world good. 

Not to mention the clam chowder was the best I've tasted (and I had tasted 3 other highly reviewed clam chowders in SF before eating here) and the Oysters were perfect!

Cannot say enough good things about this place - if you go definitely order the lemonade as they serve it in a very unique way. Even the tartar sauce is awesome!
author: Mark S.

description:
So here's the thing. For all the talk of this place, I really expected it to be pretty spectacular. And my rating reflects that - missed expectations. 

The food was perfectly fine, the service perfectly friendly, and the atmosphere perfectly nice. But that's it. I would have been really unhappy to have waited 1+ hours as many people do to eat here. Thankfully, my husband and I arrived just past 6 on a Saturday night and were seated right away. Under those circumstances, I was satisfied (though the prices on the menu need some adjusting downward).
