Bradford T. is right about the clam chowder - it's not rich and creamy enough for my taste. And the crab roll at Nettie's Crab Shack is better (though honestly, it's hard to mess up crab on buttery toast). Bottom line: if there's no wait, go for it. If it's going to be more than 15 minutes, meh.
author: Kiesha R.

description:
Came here last Saturday night after a day of oysters at Hog Island Co north of Marin.  We walked along Fillmore and was looking for a place to have dinner.  We passed by Woodhouse and noticed how clean and busy it seemed.  The word 'fresh' came into my mind, so, we decided to try the place out.  The wait took about 10 mins and we ended up at the counter.

We tried the calamari and the clam chowder initially.  The calamari was good although the chowder wasn't as good....

For our main course, we had the Crab Melt Sandwich and the Fish & Chips.  They were both good and the crab melt concept was a good one... tasty.  The Fish and Chips were good, but, I had gotten tired of it after eating a bunch of battered squid for appetizers.

Overall, this place is great for a casual out.  I would definitely return as I look walking along Fillmore and within the city.  

Recommend!
author: Edward L.

description:
I frequent their Market location but since I was in the area, thought I'd give this location a try. A definite winner! We came in for an early dinner and was immediately seated. The classics - lobster roll, crab sandwich - were in the menu but the specials sounded really good and that's what I went for. 

I had the whole roasted branzini (european sea bass) served on a bed of garlic croutons, arugula, kalamata olives and rich tomato sauce. It was to die for! The branzini was hand-carved in the table and the fish was perfectly cooked. The crunch on the outer skin served as a great texture contrast to the delicate and moist inside. Superb! They should consider putting this on their menu. It was a great presentation too that when the diners surrounding us saw my plate, they were all very curious and some of them immediately ordered it. 

My boyfriend had their cioppino which was also good, but I'm such a big fan of Phil's in Moss Landing that it's really hard for me to "oooh and aahh" over any other cioppino. 

Had a great time...wonderful food, very attentive wait staff (when told we were going to a movie, our check came in like 2 seconds), great ambiance. A must try!
author: Erika I.

description:
Checked out Woodhouse after seeing it on some bay area TV show. Although there are two locations, the Fillmore store's prices are about $2 higher per item so I visited  the Castro location with my friend.
Its pretty cozy inside with a very friendly wait staff, we had the regular size crab roll and lobster roll. And while both were delicious they were kinda  pricy! especially for just sandwiches. I would figure their costs at $3-4 cheaper for the amount you get to eat.
Otherwise everything was pretty good and would recommend this spot for the occasional fish indulgence but I'm sure you can eat comparable food cheaper elsewhere.
author: Brendan H.

description: This place is really FUN.  4.5 stars for me.  I usually hesitate to order fried or buttery things at restaurants since they can be oily and heavy.  But Woodhouse Fish Company, they do such an excellent job.  I loved BBQ Oysters, Fried whole-Belly ipswiCh Clams, toasted-Buttered dunGeness roll (large) and Cioppino.  Their half shell oysters are just ok for me but prices are cheaper side ($2 for regular ons, and $3 for premier ons).  Servers are nice and friendly.  Only complain was that I wish they used reasonable glasses for wine.
author: Akiko O.

description:
This place is fun and tasty. I wish it took reservations. 

I came here for a girl's night a few weeks back and had a great time.  Two of the ladies are vegetarians and the server suggested several items on the menu that could be turned into veggie options.  Both ended up having the HUGE artichoke filled with butter, garlic and vegetables.  I had a bite and it was delicious.  I would have had more if my friend wouldn't have downed it so fast.  

I had the whole fish (which was a sea bass) and it was delicious.  The cute waiter de-boned it for me (which us ladies giggled about for a few mins and he merely smiled at us).  One of the other ladies got the crab and said it was great.. minus the crab jokes all night.  The last lady got the lobster roll.  She liked it, didn't love it but that was probably because it was not the source of any joke. 

All in all, great food and a lot of fun!
author: G A.

description:
Came here after seeing the great reviews on Yelp. Was terribly disappointed n will not be back. Hubby ordered crab cakes n I ordered fish n chips. Also ordered some oysters for appetizer. Kids were with us and I asked for kids' menu since review says it good for kids. Server says no kids menu but they offer kids meals which includes pasta, grilled cheese or fish and chips. Checked price with server. He went to the computer, punched in some details and told me it was $6 so we ordered a fish and chips. Strange that he does not know the price but anyway...

Waited, appetizer came. Next came the longest wait in any restaurant I have ever been to. 45 minutes later, still no entree. Some restaurants just don't get it, you need a certain rhythm in eating, not filling ur tummy with water while waiting in between course.

Told the server to give us the check for appetizer, we were leaving. He disappeared into the kitchen and told us our food was coming in two minutes. We stayed and had our dinner. Fish n chips was a-okay, portion was small, as for the crab cakes, we've had better. Server offered us dessert to make up for the long wait. Asked for the check, gave a 15% service charge even tho the wait was ridiculous. Thought the story was over. 

The next day, , saw the itemized receipt and found that they charged me $12 for the kids meal and not $6. Called up restaurant n were told that kids meal for fish and chips is the same as a 2 piece fish and chips from adults menu. Told the manager that the server told me it was $6. Manager insisted that only grilled cheese and pasta was $6, without even checking with server. In good faith, I ordered the kids meal even tho no menu was available. Cannot believe that a kids meal is a kids meal charged at grown up pricing,. Felt cheated. No wonder, they do not have a kids' menu so that they can charge kids meal at adult prices. If only pasta and grilled cheese is $6, server should have told us. Or could have told us that they only offer grilled cheese and pasta for kids. He should never even say fish and chips is a kids meal at all, let alone charged me from an adult menu. 

Told the manager we already had a bad wait yesterday n manager said he already offered us dessert. Said there was nothing he could do. Told him that his server made a mistake and he needs to rectify that. Manager said something that made me feel like I was trying to get a good deal, n said that the restaurant was now very crowded now n that I was making him cry in front of his customers, he yelled and said "How much $ do I want, $10, $ 20? I told him that all he had to do was credit me back $ 5 (the difference between the price) and that if he is so uptight and upset about it, don't bother. 

Oh well, maybe I should have asked for the taxes and service charge on that $5 too. I have not checked my credit card statement yet but I have no high hopes. Will not be back, no  no no.
author: Dione K.

description:
This place rules! The fish is always super fresh, the staff is very cool (ask to taste the wine before you buy it) and it is super affordable. They are constantly changing their specials too - but start with the mussels. 

By far my favorite casual night out with my wife! Check it out.
author: Chris M.

description:
It was semi sunny this Sunday and I needed to find a place to cheer me up since last night's dinner sucked. We sat at the bar and it was nice! There was an Asian waitress and she was just the sweetest thing. Very attentive in a non pestering way. Everything was soooo great and fresh

-Oysters (forgot what kind but still Yummy. No mignonette!!! Grrr I need it.
-Crab cocktail ( sooo fresh)
-Onion Rings ( Ok,  it's been YEARS since I've ate these. And they were so delicious)
-Lobster Roll ( tasty)
-Make your own Lemonade. Love this idea. Add as much simple syrup or soda water as you like. I don't like mine too tart.

$100 lunch...well worth it
author: Lola D.

description:
Gotta say, I'm not often impressed with restaurants in Pac Heights, especially sea food. I have been known to say there is no good seafood in SF at all - perhaps a harsh judgment, but I am happy to say that it is not the case anymore. Woodhouse takes their seafood seriously, from the simple yet scrumtuous menu to the interior decor. 

Oysters are tasty, and the clam chowder is delicious - I am saying it as someone who is usually disappointed in clam chowder elsewhere. 

Now, the place is kind of small and can get crowded, especially for the happy hour Tuesdays. Some menu items are a bit expensive, and the staff is a little on too-familiar side with the customers. But these small glitches aside, it is a great addition to the Fillmore street dining scene.
author: Evg R.

description: Mmm first 2 dozen of oysters! Absolutely love the $1 oysters. It happens on Tuesday. So here I am, after seeing the place a while back, I finally made it down to my Tuesday to have two dozen oysters. The first dozen was very yummy, and the second seemed to not taste as fresh. Overall, the ambience was very good, the waiters, and waitress were quite attentive. I also had the clam chowder, which tasted alright. Great combination with after the cold oysters.
author: Monika T.

description:
Very clean restaurant (from what I could see), polite service, and an open, chatty, happy atmosphere.  The host was nice enough to try to settle a dispute b/t me and my friend as to whether the large fish hanging on the wall was a swordfish or a marlin (I say marlin).  He went on line and discovered that the answer was...that it is hard to tell!!  LOL!

Oh, should I actually review some food here?  I can push the cioppino on you, because it was spicy, flavorful, and easy on the salt.  The garlic bread that comes with it is so crispy and tasty that my companion and I ordered a side of it.  I also liked the mini brussel sprouts too.  

The fish and chips looked amazing, and I wish we ordered that instead of the fish tacos, which were...meh, okay.  I'm definitely going back here, because all-around it was a great restaurant.  I will probably up the stars to 5 if the rest of the menu is like the cioppino.
author: CAKE E.

description:
This place is awesome. After a failed morning of trying to hit up brendas (long ass line) then to Mama's (another long ass line) to get breakfast at 2pm YES breakfast at 2PM, we finally hit up this place hoping they wouldnt have a 2 hour line on a sunday like the first two place.

Went to fillmore location and walked right in, got a table nd was seating by a friendly server eager to help us with the menu.

We got the clam chowder, manhattan style, and that was SO GOOD. I think it was probably the best clam chowder I have ever had. It was rich, a hearty, full of ingrediants, clams, tomatoes, potatoes, etc...and the broth was thick just like I like it. Bowl was $6.95 but well worth it. I shared it with my BF as a appetizer and almost licked the bowl clean.

I had the 2 piece fish and chips and that was tasty too. Great deal for only $9.50 had 2 large pieces of cod and skinny french fries accompanies by a small thing of coleslaw.

My BF had the oyster po boy, and that was really good-deep fried and breaded oysters wedged inside a buttered bread that was grilled..also came with fries and coleslaw. Between the two of us there were too many fries, so next time perhaps I will ask for a side of salad instead.....

the lobster roll sami looked good, but at $15.75 we decided to save it next time to try. The fish in parchment paper and the coppinio (at the table next to us) looked really good too. A decent place to go with good service and a clean atmosphere. 

A must try if you love fresh seafood!
author: Petri Y.

description: I'm up visiting family for my birthday and was craving seafood! Working at a seafood restaurant in Tahoe I'm VERY picky and WAS NOT disappointed at all when I had dinner here. I ordered the Shrimp and Avocado roll and sub-ed Veggies for Fries (only an extra $2) and the boyfriend had a Large Dun. Crab roll ($28) Everything was great! Service was awesome! Only had to wait 5 minutes on a busy Saturday night. Food didn't take long at all to come out..which was perfect since we were hungry! Everyone was very professional and welcoming. Will def be returning!
author: Lauren M.

description:
Everything was great.  Service could've been a little bit better.  The waitress seemed a bit of an airhead, but that's ok.  We were in a good mood.

Lobster roll was good!  the bread was soft and buttery and there were lots of lobster! Not a lot of mayo, which is good.  
Fries were not as great though.  It was a bit too crunchy overall.  Was in the fryer for too long.  We were a bit disappointed by that.  Fish tacos were good, except for the fact that they used one tortilla to wrap it instead of 2 and everyone knows you're suppose to use 2!  

Then the dessert portion! We all loved it. That's what transformed it from 3 to 4 stars. The strawberry shortcake was great!  We also tried the apple something and that was warm and yummy.  

FYI, the place is small, so be ready to wait awhile, esp. if you have a big party.
author: AhLin C.

description:
This place is seriously the BOMB .... (is that even a cool phrase anymore or do I sound too much like Randy Jackson?)

Last week, I had a doctor appointment in PacHts so I begrudgingly hopped on the 1 Muni.  As I arrived in PacHts with 30 mins to spare, I thought I should treat myself to a fun lunch.  Why not? I deserve in IMHO.

What a treat this truly was!  Woodhouse is the quintessential example of why I love San Francisco.
- Great Food
- with Great People giving Great Service
- in a Great Atmosphere

I grabbed a seat at the counter and ordered up a "do it yourself" lemonade and a lobster roll.

When the waiter brought sparkling water for my lemonade, I nicely asked for flat and within seconds, he brought over a small carafe of flat water.  After giving me a lesson in lemonade making, the friendly waiter chatted with me about my day.

A few minutes later, he delivered my lobster roll which is nothing short of HEAVEN ON A PLATE.  It was so beyond delicious.  With each bite, I wondered "Could I eat this on a daily basis? Is that financially sound? How much would I weigh if I ate this every day for the rest of my life?"  I started negotiating in my head ... "well maybe I could take the bus here every other day? Maybe just on Fridays?"  

Before long, I had devoured my roll and the perfectly crisp fries.  I left the coleslaw, but appreciated that it was included.

I am grateful that 19 city blocks separate Woodhouse Fish from my office or so help me, I would be there every day ... sitting at the counter, munching on the lobster roll, sipping my lemonade, and mumbling to myself  "I have died and gone to heaven." 

Do yourself a favor ... tomorrow tell your boss you have a doctor's appointment and go for lunch.  You won't regret it!
author: Sho O.

description:
LOVE this place!
LOVE the 1 buck oysters on Tuesdays!

Reminds me of a younger sister version of Anchor and Hope.

Was there for gals' night out. We split a nice icy tray of oysters as well as a bottle of the Malbec ($23), reasonably priced. For entrees, two of us ordered the crab melt ($9) which was packed with yummy, lump, crab meat, topped with melted cheddar cheese. Came with perfectly done shoe string fries and coleslaw (could have had a dab more of this as the serving was puny). My other two friends ordered the stuffed artichoke (which she loved), and cioppino (looked fantastic!).

The service was attentive. The place gets heavy-packed on Tuesdays with the oyster craze and we were a bit rushed because of it .

The "ding" ...Taking a full star away for sloppy oyster shucking. Many of 'em had shrapnel of shells that you have to fish out of your mouth - not very attractive or classy.

Bottom line ... look forward to heading back here!
author: Kimbalee W.

description:
The food and prices were decent.  The service could have been more attentive.  The major failing was the wait for our table.

If you dont take reservations, you should know how to forecast how long people will have to wait.  We showed up at 7 pm with a party of 5 -- not that big last I time checked.  Were told 30-45 minutes so we had a wander and checked in 30 minutes later.  Were told 15-20 more minutes.  Had a drink and checked in 20 minutes later and were told ANOTHER 15-20 minutes.  At the conclusion of that 20 minutes we  all just waited outside for 25 minutes.  

Let's add that up: 30+20+20+25 = 95 minutes!  Or 50 minutes longer than the high end of the range we were given.  Was it our bad for waiting?  Dinner felt like it was *just* out of our reach.  It was definitely not worth the wait.
author: Erin A.

description: Perfect score of 100 for the lobster roll.!   Great big chunks of lobster claw and tail as part of the mix and just the right amount of mayonnaise and spices.   In an excellent soft and toasted bun.   Just can't get any better.   Also great score for the fried whole belly clams.   Feels like you're back in Cape Cod..!!
author: Mark S.

description:
I am finishing my food as I write this review. Staff is friendly and food is great. While we were waiting for the next available table, our party couldn't help but notice the delicious food being served to the table in front of us. 
We ordered 3 dozen oysters, clam chowder, fish n chips and fried calamari. The oysters came out first and we only got 34... not quite 3 dozen so we were confused. Then halfway thru our meal the server brought back 2 more. We were surprised they remembered the 2. Awesome. Food came out in fair time and everything tasted great. Definitely coming back on $1 oyster tuesday
author: Sam L.

description:
This place rocks.

Start off with the do-it-yourself lemonade, a lotta lemon and this one goes a long way.

We had the lobster roll and the stuffed artichokes. We ate way too much as there was a mix of flavors and textures that made it very easy to do so...

If the person youre with starts picking the lobster out of your sandwich from across the table, usually that means you've picked the right spot for lunch.

All in all great to have a place like Woodhouse on Fillmore, welcome to the neighborhood we'll be back soon!!
author: Ross R.

description: I was craving a crab sandwich and we were in the fillmore so we ended up here. I had the toasted cheese and crab sandwich, which was basically a delicious version of a grilled cheese sandwich, with crab. Mmm. I also started with a cup of clam chowder that was also very good - lots of clams. The garlic bread, for me, had too much seasoning, but my friend liked it a lot. The DIY strawberry lemonade was nice too. My friend complained that our food took forever (we were both really hungry) and that the people that were seated next to us got their food a lot faster. Other than that, it was a nice filling lunch without being too pricey.
author: Micaela G.

description:
Excellent food at reasonable prices? What a concept. This place hits that concept on the head. 

We started out with 3 dozen oysters ( at a buck each ) , The wine list is short but the few that had were good in price and were tasty. The fish and chips were great. Delicious, perfectly cooked, and not too oily. We also had the scallops and steamed clams. Everything tasted really fresh. We'll be back.
author: Alden H.

description:
Went here last week and yummmmmm.

I ordered the fish tacos which were out of this world and my boyfriend ordered the scallop special and both were amazing.  The staff was super nice and the atmosphere was good too.

The calamari was ok, but then again I'm used to the calamari from Blue on Market Street and theirs is the best.
author: Diane N.

description: Stopped by with family for early dinner 5:30ish with no res and they squeezed us in ...very cool.....Had a dozen oysters that were delish, wish there was better stuff to put on em besides dead horseradish in tomato sauce though.  Wife's olive oil poached halibut was insanely nummy...wish Idve ordered that!  Mom's clam chowder was great.  Looking around me looks like I just ordered the wrong thing (crab cakes) which were pretty weak in my book.   Not much as far as beer/wine list.  Id go back and stick with the specials board or the fish/chips.
author: Ken B.

description:
We came here on Sunday for dinner and were seated quickly.  The restaurant was full but there were some seats at the bar so we ate there.  We had to wait awhile for our food but our beers came quickly.  Service was fine.
We had the following:
Fish & Chips-very good
Cioppino-very good

We plan on returning soon and trying other items on the menu.
author: Lizete S.

description:
Great fish and chips and plentiful shoestring fries. Paired with a pint of Scrimshaw, this made for some good dinner last week. We're not in the Fillmore very often, but this place is very convenient before heading to a concert. We found easy parking on one of the side streets and only had to wait about 15 minutes for a couple spots at the counter on a Friday night.

The fish was not quite worthy of 5 star status - it was just a little more oily than I would prefer and I'm a much bigger fan of halibut than the usual cod - but I'll be happy to visit the Woodhouse again.
author: Phil K.

description: I was at SF last sunday and i thought "hmmm oysters sounds good right now!" so i went on yelp and this place was the first one on the list. We ordered fish taco that was pretty amazing, crab melt was okay but the oysters...... well i didn't know that they sold four different kinds of oysters and that they were different prices so i just asked for "oh i would like a dozen of sweet oysters" and later i found out those were $3 each.. i was like no waaay :[ she could've at least warned me that i chose the premium ones but they have $1 oysters on tuesdays so I am definitely coming back on a tuesday to satisfy my oyster craving! I also want to try the lobster roll!!
author: Jen S.

description:
After a quick search on Yelp to find a good seafood restaurant, I was lucky enough to find Woodhouse Fish Co. We parked at the Kabuki parking garage and walked up the couple of blocks to the restaurant lucky enough to have a table for 4 ready for us! How fortunate because it was Friday night and a line was forming fast behind us.

Yes, it's true. The food is tasty and reasonably priced. The crab cakes, whole Dungeness crab, oysters on the half shell, and salad were all fresh and yummy. You could tell that the butternut squash pie was freshly hand made and never haven eaten one, it was great! Kinda like pumpkin pie, only smoother.

The service was efficient and we didn't wait very long before food starting piling up on the table. Our server was very sweet and attentive, and tipped very well accordingly. We definitely will make this a favorite spot.
author: Hieu D.

description: We ordered french fries, crab cakes and the fish tacos.  The french fries were the best thing on the table.  The crab cakes were decent but very non-descript and the fish tacos were heavily breaded frozen fish type with more breading than fish.  Trader Joes frozen breaded cod is much better if you want this.  Waiter said none of the fish was fresh so all frozen and he recommended the pork :)    It was just ok -  none of us would go back.
author: JL S.

description: After catching a flick at CaamFest at the Kabuki theater, I was on the hunt for seafood.  Within walking distance, Woodhouse called us in and after a 15 minute wait (Friday late evening) my HB and I sat down for dinner.  I had the whole crab and he had the Ciopinno.  The crab wasn't the largest I've had but sufficed and the Ciopinno was chalk-full of seafood delight!  The waitress was really nice and attentive despite the crowd and a not-so-nice-patron couple that dined next to us.  I would return if I were in the area, parked in the underground J-Town lot and in the mood for seafood.  I'll definitely try either the lobster or crab roll next time!
author: Jen G.

description: $1 oysters on Tuesdays is my new favorite indulgence-  The seafood is consistently fresh, no apprehension!
author: Liz Y.

description:
I finally got a chance to try this place out; I'm always looking for good fish & chips.

Anyway, the decor is quite tasteful - nautical, but not cargo netting hanging from the ceiling with pink starfishes and lifesavers nautical.  More like old-school ship's stateroom nautical.

The fish & chips were so-so.  The fish batter was greasy and overdone; the chips were crispy, which I know many people (not me) like.  The cup of New England clam chowder I had was excellent, though.  The "handmade" lemonade  seemed much ado about nothing, but it was fresh to be sure.

I suppose sometime in the future I'll try Woodhouse again for their other dishes (I hear the lobster roll may be worth a shot).
author: Brandon L.

description:
Pluses:

- Our server, she was great.  Very knowledgeable and able to answer all our questions.  
- Prices were reasonable.
- Portions were perfect.  If you go hungry, you won't be disappointed.
- Love the tables with the high stools in the back.  Comfy!


Only bummer,  and this is a normal part of the food biz, was they were out of Halibut.  This disappointed my friend visiting from North Carolina, as we picked this particular Woodhouse location because they had Halibut.  Can't get good Halibut in NorCarolina!

I will be back!
author: Yelper H.

description:
Can I give this place 4.5 stars?? The Fillmore location is absolutely adorable :) The service was quick and our water cups were always filled quickly. We actually didn't have to wait at all for a table but it was definitely packed the whole night. We split the lobster roll and the fish & chips since we read so many reviews on both. You cannot go wrong with either!! The fish had a great, crispy yet light batter...probably one of the best fish&chips I've had in a long time. The lobster roll is out of this world with its buttered, thick slices of bread that surround chunky amounts of fresh lobster. Absolutely delicious! I can't wait to go back again. Perfect dinner date!

Looking forward to coming on Tuesdays for the $1 oyster deal.
author: Angela S.

description:
When I lived in Boston, there was a trend to make seafood upscale.  Or to be more exact, there was a trend to make rustic seafood dining in to fine dining.  The lobster boil would be poured on to your table, potato, corn, the lobsters, and clams.  All of this was ceremoniously dumped on to a picnic table covered with brown paper inside a huge warehouse decorated to look and feel like an old time New England lobster shack.  You got a plastic bib.  And you roll up your sleeves and dig in, bracing your feet against the picnic table posts.  When it came time for the check, you paid as much for that "rustic" experience as you would at Gary Danko.  

This place mimics that feeling.  Wanna be rustic, simple, wholesome, hearty food, but priced like an upscale dining room.  

I ordered a lobster roll.  $17.  It had a lot of lobster and the bread was so deliciously buttered and split down the top.  In the end, I liked the bread more than the lobster filling.  

It was served on a F**King 1/8 baking sheet.  An aluminum baking sheet.  What?  Am I not paying a truck-ton of money for this?  Why can't I have a real plate?  I don't want a stupid baking sheet.  I don't care if that's how they do it in New England, they don't charge $17 effing dollars for a trucking lobster roll in New England!  For a while, McDonalds was serving lobster rolls in New England too!  Since it's not New England, and you're graping me up the ying yang with the price, would it kill you to serve that roll on a plate?  Please?  Who's brilliant idea was this?  Who thought this'd be "cute" and "exciting"?  

At least the server was really really nice.  He deserved better than I.  

We ordered 1/2 dozen oysters that arrived at our table in worse condition than Lindsey Lohan on Oprah that time.  I thought instead of an oyster knife, maybe the shucker just used his teeth.  There was no briny juice left in the shells.  The oyster was mangled and the gills were torn asunder.  Also served in a trucking aluminum tray.  

The server deserves the 3 stars.  If ever I get rich enough to hire random people to tell me I'm beautiful, that server is the first to get hired.
author: Christina C.

description:
If I had to give Woodhouse Fish Company ("hereinafter "WFC") a name it would be "Old Reliable." I say this because WFC a well located nice cozy restaurant where you will always good a good meal at a fair price from friendly people. There is not much of a variance here. You would get a good fair priced meal every time.

I like the Fillmore Street location because there is ample street parking and plenty of places to have a happy hour drink prior to going to WFC, which has a limited wine menu.  I also like the fact that WFC serves Manhattan clam chowder, just as they do on the East Coast. My only regret is that I got a cup instead of a bowl. The crispy calamari was really good and the portion generous. The same was true of the fish and chips. You can get three pieces of fish or two. Next time I will opt for two because after three pieces I was stuffed and did not have room for the chips. They make a pretty good cioppino that is served with garlic bread.  The garlic bread is among the best I have ever had. The cioppino is another matter and I find it hard to rate. People rave about the cioppino and my feeling is that it is slightly above average for $25 and would be very good at $20, if that makes sense. I guess, stated another way, the cioppino was overpriced and for $25 the roasted fish of the day is a better value.

In sum, I think that for the most part WFC, which by the way does not accept reservations,  is a good reliable restaurant that I see myself going to three to four times a year.
author: Chocoolate I.

description: Hands down, one of my favorites restaurants in the city. Their fish is always fresh, the food is delicious and the the service is great. Their lobster and crab rolls are amazing - not too dressed up with mayo and loaded with meat. They don't take reservations (which I like and don't like) so go early if you want to get a table, especially if it's more than 2 people.
author: Allie Q.

description:
I came to this restaurant with my family a few months back and probably should've gotten the lobster roll instead of the crab melt, but still was more than happy with my order. First I'll start with the lobster roll. The bread on the lobster roll was to die for and absolutely the perfect combination with the lobster.  It is a bit pricey for the amount of food you get, however I pretty much savored each and every bite that my cousin would let me steal of his roll. My crab melt was also very delicious. I do wish they had used the same break on my crabmelt (more of a bun) than on my lobster roll (more slices of bread) but both were still absolutely amazing. Another friend ordered the Ciopinno and that was also spectacular. It was very clean, very fresh, and not too salty as many are. It also came with a good amount of seafood which is fantastic with Ciopinno's since they are usually one of the more pricier items on the menu. Really a delicious restaurant with a great casual feel to it.

Also another great thing about this restaurant is the location since it is located central on Fillmore. It is a pleasant wait because you can just kill time by doing some nearby window shopping until they call you to be seated (they will take your personal cell and literally call you once a spot opens up). Excellent service for excellent food. 5 stars!
author: Stacy L.

description:
I had pretty good crab cakes here, but those are difficult to mess up.  The service has unfriendly and hasty.  The waiter for the table next to us read the specials for his patrons, ours was rude by comparison.  My fries were extremely overcooked, just way too crispy and had all of the flavor cooked out of them.  My GF's fish tacos were way overly breaded and greasy.  Having recently had the fish tacos at Nopalito, these were a huge disappointment.  Plus, they're cod, which is not ideal for a fish taco.

Overall impression:  this place pretends to be a quality seafood establishment, but the food is sub-par and the service is a joke.
author: Lester B.

description: My mom came to visit for a weekend and I took her here for a lunch date. I was so impressed! I had yelped "good fish sandwiches" which led me here where we ordered the lobster roll, as well as clam chowder. It was delicious! She loved it. It was a win win. The place is so cute, a great place to go for lunch. I'll definitely be back.
author: Danielle R.

description: This place is awesome! Lobster roll is best thing on the menu, and the linguine pasta  is a close 2nd (which i don't think a lot people know).  Oh, and of course their oysters!  Just wish they took reservations.  Also, food aside, the TV in a picture frame on the wall is kinda weird and distracting.  Just saying.   But logistics aside, the seafood is great here and this casual neighborhood seafood restaurant is just what San Francisco needs.
author: Nat H.

description: Aside from the two hour wait ... The food was really good and the staff was really nice. They even gave us some free apps for the wait. I highly recommend the ahi cheeseburger and crab cakes. Stuffed artichoke is good too (comes with really good garlic bread) but I didn't think it was as tasty as the other stuff I mentioned :) everything is fresh and delicious though!
author: Shirin M.

description: The lobster rolls and dungeness crab melt are soooo good though a bit pricey for a sandwich ($18-24). The place gets packed at dinner so expect a wait - we waited about 30 minutes on a Friday night at about 8pm. Service was good too. I'd come back, but only for those 2 items (the stuffed artichoke was nothing special).
author: Melissa P.

description:
Our group had six different things to take in, each one was better than the other. What a delight!

You will find no better chowder outside New England.

The salmon special in pumpkin pesto was amazing!
The mixed green salad was perfect and enough for two.
The crab cakes were outstanding and as good as the great ones we had at The Waterfront.
The calamari was good....not the very best we had but good.
author: phil s.

description:
lobster roll is great, $1 oyster tuesdays is good. fish tacos are excellent....

seating time sucks but well worth the wait...
author: Jw T.

description:
Delicious! My husband and I both went and tried the Crab Roll as well as the fish & Chips....mmmmmm! After eating a vegetarian diet for about a year, this food just hit the spot! 

the sandwiches are a little pricey, but worth it.
author: Caley Alyssa Y.

description: After a movie we headed over for a late lunch....fish and chips are off the hook. nuff said
author: Dan P.

description:
OMG we stuffed ourselves silly last night. It's been a long while since I went to an American seafood restaurant. Every Tuesday is their $1 oysters special. I was hesitant as to how good of a deal this was. $1 per oysters? There must be something fishy going on. I was pleasantly blown away by how fresh and how succulent the oysters were! They were big cool briny and slight sweet. Shucked properly too because the edges of the shell didn't fall into my oysters, which is a pet peeve of mine. They'll give you extra lemons and cocktail sauce if you ask. Yum oh yum! From Washington State. We had 24 oysters for $24. What a deal! 

We also had their fried Ipwich Bellied Clams with tartar sauce. Absolutely divine! It wasn't overly fried. The clams held on to their tenderness and to their inkiness. AGH! SO GOOD! 

Got onion rings too. The onion rings were clearly thrown into batter and then thrown into the fire right after. You can see the sizzle leave holes in the batter, which means it was just freshly made on the spot. It wasn't like they left the onion rings in the batter overnight. I'm not a big fan of onion rings but they were very respectable. 

Then we had the artichokes s with shrimp and lobster. They gave us one HUGE artichoke sliced in half and stuffed with shrimp in one half and lobster in the other half. Served over a bed of yummy herbal salad. Yummy as well! The artichoke was grilled so it had a nice smoky tinge to it while the interior was melt-in-your-mouth soft. It was a lot of work to graze off the edible parts from each artichoke leaf. But that's how it is with artichoke! 

Then we topped it off with their strawberry shortcake! This is the real-deal strawberry shortcake done right and classic. The old-fashioned way. The shortcake was still warm and crisp from the oven. The whipped cream was made from scratch. None of that from-a-can thing going on. Absolutely light and creamy and soft whipped cream! And their strawberry drizzle was sweet! Altogether, the combination was superb! This is an authentic strawberry shortcake. It was pretty big for one serving, so do share it with someone else. Enjoy!

I'd come back here again for their $1 oysters on Tuesdays and their strawberry shortcake. Haven't tried other items on the menu but I kept eying other people's dishes. They sure looked yummy!
author: Pamela L.

description:
We drove by and realized it was open for business. The space is airy and filled with sunshine. On the wall, there is a board with the daily seafood specials. You have three options for seating; counter seating, bar table, or regular dining table. Currently, they are only open for lunch, but will open for dinner once they receive their liquor license. 

I ordered the the lobster roll  and the "do it yourself" lemonade. The lobster roll was bursting with huge pieces of lobster on a slice of thick buttery toast. The lemonade came with a small carafe of water and sugar so you can blend the lemonade to your own taste. My bf ordered the fish and chips. 

The fish was flaky and melts in your mouth. I was trying to eat my lobster as ladylike as possible, but there was so much lobster that it literally dropped into my carafe. I only realized this after I continue to make my lemonade. No lobster shall be wasted! After my first mouthful of crustacean bliss, I declared to my bf that this would not be a bad way to die. His response was "you can pay for the bill."

While I may have small eyes, I have big ears so I overheard the conversation at the next table. Turns out the original Woodhouse in the Castro have Tuesday oyster specials for $1. God, I hope they have that at the one in Pac Heights! Oh, I was informed that the artichoke is highly recommended by the staff so I gotta come back to try that!
author: Sophie C.

description:
Came here with friends for dinner/catch up.

We had:
- 1/2 Dozen oysters. These were NOT my favorite, I've definitely had better, but they were still OK and refreshing.
- Crab Cakes for appetizer (AMAZING! MUST HAVE). I loved them because they were not as greasy as usual and very light
- Fish&Chips. These were also amazing, and very light and non-greasy making them thoroughly enjoyable.

The location is key and the interior is very welcoming but at the same time casual.

Highly recommend coming to Woodhouse Fish Company to get some quality seafood. I'm definitely heading back to try the Cioppino and Lobster roll!
author: Jung-Ah Y.

description: We got cod tacos which was ok-good and also tuna which was good. But I think this place is a bit overpriced for its quality...
author: Ali E.

description:
$1 Oyster Tuesdays all day!!!  so worth it!!  When we went, they were serving Hood Canal Oysters (from Washington State).  my oysters came in a variety of sizes and they were all sooo very yummy!!!

My son ordered the fish and chips and that too was good!  it was a thick slice and lightly breaded.

We will go here again and try other things on the menu.  The crab looks good.

Came back to try the crab a couple months after my first experience.  The crab was thin and not so meaty.  Go to R&G lounge for crab instead.

Service was great though.  The host knew what he was talking about.
author: R M.

description: This was a good and solid spot for lunch if you are in the mood for seafood.  Not exceptional by any means, but still well done with excellent service.  I started off with a cup of clam chowder and my friend had the wedge salad.  We were both very happy with our choices, but I wasn't really wowed by anything.  B/c it's still crab season, I ordered the salt and pepper grilled crab with jalapenos.  It arrived cracked and full of buttery goodness with great flavor.  My friend loved her lobster roll.  Again, very happy and would come again if in the mood for basic seafood.
author: Alison E.

description:
We ordered the clam chowder and it was fantastic.  The best ever and you must order at least a cup!  The stuffed artichoke and steamed crab were also incredible.  The wait staff were very friendly and the cost was very reasonable for great seafood in the city.  This was by far the best restaurant we went to on a short weekend in the city.

If you want fantastic seafood at a very reasonable price, we highly recommend Woodhouse Fish Company.
author: stacey S.

description: I would HIGHLY recommend this place!! The fish and chips was really good, the food came out quickly, which I was surprised about. The fries were perfectly crispy, just the way I like them. The do it yourself lemonade is also pretty good, an interesting concept. The clam roll was good as well. There is also a parking lot not too far from this place which is pretty convenient.
author: Autumn B.

description:
Lobster roll is amazing. Try it whenever you visit.

Also, I'm a big fan of oysters, I came by on a Tuesday night when it was dollar oysters. My sister and I loved it. We ate about $50 worth of oysters, it was fantastic. Definitely coming back here again.
author: Carissa E.

description: Lobster roll perfection. Splurge for the large. You will enjoy every bite.  Buttery garlic bread surrounds cool chunks of lobster.  We went twice during our visit and will definitely return the next time we are in town.  A must for anyone visiting San Francisco.
author: Angela S.

description: The seafood at this restaurant is great!  Cioppino is one of my favorite dishes, and at $25 this did not disappoint. There was a good amount of meat, and the broth/sauce was great.  I went here on weekday and the oysters were $1 each (1 kind of oysters, on the sweeter side).  I was going to order fish tacos, but the waiter refused to (1) serve them without breading or (2) substitute shrimp.  All in all, I got the distinct impression there were going to be no substitutions that night---and I offered to pay more!  Though, this didn't stop me from really enjoying the dinner I had.
author: Joel F.

description:
A great little gem of a place, nestled on Fillmore.  They don't take reservations, so I was a little worried, but I went around 8 pm on a Wednesday night and was fine.  We got seated immediately.

Ok, my disclaimer:  I had a late lunch!  So, I wasn't very hungry.  Not to be *that* girl, but I ordered the mixed green salad and some oysters.  The oysters were delicious, and the salad was fresh and tasty.  We had some beer on tap, too.  I wish I was hungrier, because the fish and chips looked amazing- mouth watering.  My date had the salmon, which was cooked perfectly.  

Can't wait to come back.
author: Sarah F.

description: One of my favorite "go to" spots... wedge salad with blue cheese dressing is always great... had my first and only soft shell crab BLT the other day, real hit, plus you have to love a place that serves Brozino! Great service too.
author: Sarkis S.

description:
Their crab cakes were fresh and tasty and the salad that came with it had a sweet vinaigrette dressing that I loved.  Their crab melt was yummy and not at all greasy.  The fries that came with it were a bit overdone but was good nonetheless.

http://blog.junbelen.com/2010/01/28/crabs-in-clement-and-crab-cakes-in-the-castro/
author: Jun B.

description: Cute and friendly. The lobster roll was super good. So were the fries and slaw that cAme with it. The crab cakes were good, but I like bigger chunks in it.
author: Philippe S.

description: Been here a few times with my wife for lunch.  The fish and chips are excellent as are the fish tacos.  I also liked their lobster roll and clam chowder.
author: Leo V.

description:
Yeah... this is good stuff. I have had the new england clam chowder, the fish and chips, and the crab roll, all on different occasions, and I was pleased each time. 
They also have anchor steam beer on tap, which is possibly the best complement to seafood IMHO. 
Service has been fast, but don't try to come in a large party during peak hours without having to wait- I watched a party of five wait at the door the entire time we were eating our meal, and I only saw them seated as we were leaving. This is hardly the fault of anyone or anything except the enduring popularity of the restaurant, and the somewhat small quarters it occupies on Fillmore street. 

Overall, a good time!
author: James W.

description: I love this restaurant.  The big lobster roll is to die for, and reminds me of being down East in Maine.  I only wish that they took reservations . . . .
author: John H.

description:
Great spot! Tuesday is $1 oyster night... not to be missed!

I got a special de-jour which was seared ono atop a very interesting fried "risotto cake" with grilled boc choy. 

The food was divine, and I'd say the portion was perfectly sized. My ono could have spent 45 seconds less on the heat. It was very flavorful, but perhaps the tiniest bit on the dry side (which I'm told is hard to do with ono, such a naturally moist fish). Perhaps a follow up visit / review will tack on the final star ;-)

Decor was upbeat, modern, and fun. There's a neato slow-moving movie-frame thingy that reminded me of Mr. Rodgers picture-picture playing a loop of maritime stuff -- neat touch. 

They've also got plenty of great drafts for you beer lovers.

I highly recommend Woodhouse Fish Company if you're in the mood for seafood -- you won't be disappointed!
author: Matthew J M.

description:
Wow.  Sixteen reviews so far, and all say that the place is perfect.  Is that possible, knowing yelp?  Is the place really wonderful?  I go to find out.

First let me say that the place is new and still working out opening day kinks.  Also, the food represents good value and is a real addition to Fillmore Street.

On entry I am asked whether I would like a table, or seating at the counter.  I opt for the counter and am seated facing a wall rather than at a seat where I might see the chef at work.  Given that the counter is empty, this seems a poor choice on the part of the host.  

I start with an ample and well-priced caesar salad.   The romaine is fresh but the salad is overdressed.  While I am halfway through the salad fried calamari arrive.  Timing remains a bit off in the kitchen.  The calamari are not greasy, but bland and coated with too much breading.  

Crab cakes arrive, minus a fork.  My waitress kindly permits me to swipe the utensil from a nearby setting.  The crab cakes are sided with a small salad in which not all of the cherry tomatoes are ripe.  The crab cakes themselves are nice but a bit greasy.  

The place is spare, utilitarian, with bric a brac here and there and the requisite swordfish on the wall.  Sort of reminiscent of the Anchor Oyster Bar in the Castro.  But rather than being populated by the somewhat eccentric Castro clientele, Woodhouse has a tamer group from Pacific Heights.  

The place is new and plainly still shaking out the bugs in both the food and service.  So no, to me it is not five star.  But Woodhouse does have potential.
author: David D.

description: Good fish tacos, friendly service and a solid value. Last time I had the fish special of the day and it was better than I was hoping for. They do fish right!  Casual vibe makes it a nice option for Fillmore.
author: Roberta W.

description: This is my favorite place ever! We cannot go to San Fran. or even near the are without dropping in for their lobster rolls. You must try this place.
author: Alicia S.

description: Really worth the wait!  Casual, yummy, and cheap!
author: Honest Y.

description:
Came here with fellow yelper, JolieCrush J., and a few other friends last weekend and did not leave disappointed.  The restaurant is really small, so if you have a group bigger than 4 people, be prepared to wait for a bit (ours was about an hour or so).  

At first glance, the menu was not that pricey for a seafood place.  The most expensive items on the menu were about $25 or $26 dollars for an entree, not too shabby.  

To start, we decided to share the stuffed artichoke entree, some calamari, and the chowder, which I wasn't entirely sure was for the entire table(due to the fact that they only have one unisex bathroom and the line can be quite long especially if there are females in front of you...oh, forgot to add the detail that they ordered the appetizers while i was in line), but in any case, the bowl was passed around and I was able to have a spoonful.  The chowder was nice and creamy and had real clams in it, and for the price, it was a pretty good portion.  The calamari was just ok.  Tasted pretty ordinary to me.  The stuffed artichoke was excellent.  One of them came stuffed with dungeness crab and the other one was stuffed with shrimp.  I personally liked the crab one better, but the shrimp was just as good.  The artichoke was grilled to perfection and it came with some homemade mayo, which was much better than that crap you buy in stores.  Little details like this make a huge difference in flavor.

For my entree, I decided on the whole roasted fish special.  Delicious.  By the time I was done eating it, it looked like the plates that those cartoon cats have with just the bones laying there.  On that particular night, they coated the fish in cornmeal, roasted it, and served it over a ragu made with tomatoes and squash.  The fish skin was nice and crisp, the meat was cooked just right, and like I stated earlier, I ate every last morsel on my plate.  Around the table, the other orders were mussels, poke, lobster rolls and fish and chips.  If you just took a soundtrack of our tables noises, it would sound like we hadn't eaten for days, even though the wait for our table was just one hour.  Nom nom nom's all around as everyone was enjoying their dish.

The service was really good and our waiter knew the items really well.  Since I ordered the special based on his description, I would have to say that he was pretty accurate in describing the menu items.  Random story, so since I was going to be using my hands to eat this, I was given a wet nap which was stolen by one of my fellow diners.  I asked our waiter for one and he ended up forgetting, so I reminded him, and instead of giving me the standard packaged one, I got this towel dipped in hot water with a lemon wedge on a plate instead.  Pretty damn cool!  Details restaurant folks, pay attention!  I should probably add that the reason I requested a wet nap instead of washing my hands in the rest room was because, yes, you guessed right, someone decided to spend about 15 minutes in the one person bathroom and I got tired of waiting.  

Overall, a great restaurant and I will surely come back here again, with a smaller group of course.

Side note, the ketchup comes in those fat bottles with wide mouths instead of the old school tall and skinny ones.  My friend decided that he would violently shake-weight-shake the bottle to get the ketchup out and was rewarded with 80% of the bottle on his plate.  Hahahaha.  Luckily, he requested a side plate to put his ketchup on.  Moral of the story: lay off the shake weights a few weeks before eating here.
author: JP T.

description: Fantastic food, great Scrimshaw beer, fish and chips was the best ever.
author: Anthony Y.

description:
This is where a Yelp half star would be reallllly helpful!  3.5 would be just about right.

OK, this place is REAL casual.  This is both a good thing and a bad thing, depending on what you are expecting.  Therefore, please expect paper napkins and causal dining experience!

4 stars mainly because of the attentive service, the yummy menu (if you're a seafood FANATIC, such as myself), AND the $1 oyster Tuesday (this cannot be beat).
author: Lauren K.

description:
Last night's dinner was just solid. The fried whole-belly Ipswich clams starter was not only generous, but truly delicious!  They were tender, perfectly fried and seasoned . A friend who's a seafood broker was raving about it so we just had to try them. He was right ! 

I finally got to try the cioppino and LOVED it! It had  tons of baby scallops, salmon, mussels, clams, dungeness crab, topped with a large prawn and a wedge of cheesy, garlic toast. The broth was just right and all the seafood was cooked properly.  The portion was big enough for two.  Best one I've had in SF!  

Service was flawless and very friendly. She took very good care of us and was quick to get our check when we informed her that we were trying to catch a 7pm showing of Inglourious Basterds at The Kabuki.  We were in and out in less than an hour. Very impressive.
author: Jane F.

description:
My friend and I had a lovely dinner here. The service was terrific, great atmosphere, and food was very good. A great find - I love how unpretentious it is, especially for its area on Fillmore. 

I will definitely be returning!
author: Nicole M.

description:
today we had a terrible horrific experience!!
used to be yummy....today for example we ordered 1/2 dozen fresh oysters...yummy...
ordered ipswich clams....not bad...
4 glasses of sauv. blanc...yummy...
shrimp louis...heres where it went bad...yellow lettuce...yuk...we sent it back...got some kind of dumb explanation on why iceburg lettuce is YELLOW!!( WRONG)...the short,extremely large male...balding and hairy growth ( on face )... ( guessing new manager) was insinuating we were wrong and he was right...about yellow iceburg lettuce is normal...etc etc...brought us a wedge of iceburg that was green!!! but couldnt turn that into a shrimp louis!!?????????????.....we were taunted into him wanting us to agree with him...but we didnt and realizing something has gone terribly wrong...we paid out bill knowing they just lost a good customer!!!! :( ;(
author: Sarah B.

description:
now, i've read all these great review about this place but when i actually went there. . . I wasn't quite impressed.  

The clam chowder was very flavorful. It is one of the best clam chowder I've ever had and I'm not a chowder kind of girl. but 5$ for a tiny cup of clam chower... I don't know... 
Also got the fried calamari. nice, chewy, crispy, but ordinary. Not much of a WOW factor.   
For entree, We got the crab cake and the fish and chips.
Fish and chips had a nice color to it. nicely battered and fried. the fish is flaky and soft. But oh, so much oil. Way too oily for my taste. 
The crab cake is alright. I didn't taste amazing or anything. It was savory, nicely fried, with a 1000 island - like - sauce on top of it. The salad that came with it is pretty good tho. but the crab cake.. not my cup of  tea.

I had high hopes when i went in. but the food is ordinary. and way over price. I know it's seafood but 5 dollar for a cup for clam chowder? maybe if the cup was bigger...
author: Winne L.

description: very casual seafood diner like restaurant.... decided not to deal with the parking and so I just parked at the J town parking lot at Fillmore and post. My favorite dish... the mussels with fries.... and ask for some plain baguettes/bread to go with... so yummy..garlic bread was ordered for the table but with the mussels, plain bread was good enough....
author: Jay S.

description:
Was craving some fish and chips so I checked the yelp venue to see where the reviews were good but still close to home. Saw over and over again about Woodhouse.

Ok, the solid recommendation was for the lobster rollm, but I'm not a big lobster fan, and fish & chips was on my mind. So down to Fillmorte I went.

It's Superbowl Sunday just after kickoff, and the restaurant was near empty. Maybe the cook wanted to watch the game rather than cook because the dish I was served was dark-brown, grease-soaked batter around a tasteless overcooked piece of cod. Too long in the fryer, guys. I tried to take napkins to pull out some of the grease, but even then it wqas hopeless. So I pulled off the batter to eat just the fish. Overcooked fish is just dry and tasteless. Left it all on the plate and chalked it up to a $13 mistake!

The fries looked pretty good. I wasn't in the mood for fries, so I didn't try them...but they looked good. Looked better than the fish, but then again, that wouldn't have been hard to do.

Service was non-existant. Guess they were watching the Superbow. I was pretty much ignored. If it weren't for tre fact they had to give me a bill, they probably won't have spoken to me at all.

Might have been something to do with the time of day, or Superbowl or something, but My meal was lousy, the service was lousy , and I won't be going back.
author: patty p.

description: The wait could get dangerously long with no reservations but I'd recommend waiting anyways, The Ipswich clam sandwich and Dungeness crab sandwich were delicious.
author: Jon I.

description: Ordered the crab sandwich and it was alright. The waitress seemed really pissed when we walked in and gave us kinda of an attitude. "Hey lady don't take your anger out on customers, if you don't like your job..quit." Anyways prices run from $8 for a large bowl of chowder to $18 for a lobster roll. My order was $12 for a small crab sandwich a very tiny pint of coleslaw and some small fries. I think I've had way more bang for my buck for $12 on just a tease....I don't think I'll ever come back
author: The V.

description:
Just had dinner here for the first time.   Arrived at about 7pm and had to wait about 20 min.

The servers were very friendly, but ours disappeared at the end and we had to flag down another one to get a check.  The place was busy and the service was a bit slow.  Had to wait a while for dessert.

I had the Cioppino which was wonderful.  Lots of seafood, rich delicious broth.  One of the best best dishes I have had in a while.  My wife had the crab melt sandwich which was good and my son had the lobster roll sandwich which was also good.

The desserts (strawberry shortcake and bread pudding) were ok,  but not up to the standards of the rest of the meal.  I am pretty sure the strawberries were frozen.  They definitely didn't look fresh.

This is a crowded, noisy, informal neighborhood place.  The tables are pretty close together.

This meal ran about $40/person without drinks.

We will definitely go here again, but will maybe avoid prime dinner hours.
author: Alan B.

description: This place was fantastic. I had the Crab Cakes with the wedge side salad. My wife had the New England Clam Chowder. I'd come back here anytime.
author: Jeff S.

description: I forgot I'd been here before. First time I came here, I had the crab roll. It looked delicious, but tasted very bland, nothing memorable. Came here for dinner again last night with the bf. I had the 2 piece fish and chips and shared a bowl of the clam chowder. The clam chowder was sad. It was very runny and weak in flavor. The worst part of the meal were the fish and chips. Very heavy and tasteless. All the lime juice and malt vinegar couldn't cover up the lameness in this dish. My bf and I left there feeling sick and wishing we had that hour back. Yelp is usually good about recommending good eats, but in this case, this was a big fat FAIL. I'm checking this off my list and never coming here again. Also, the prices are ridiculously expensive for the quality of the food you get. The only positive is the place is very clean and the service was very friendly. Still, it's not like you're going there to eat the tables or the sevice.
author: Shoua T.

description:
Excellent.  Exactly the Crab Louie Salad that I wanted.
I love when restaurants deliver exactly what you expect, and they are friendly to boot.
I've been here twice and everyone in my party is always pleased with what they've ordered too.
author: Robyn S.

description: The oysters are deliciously fresh and the buttered dungeness crab roll is fabulous! One downside is that they do not take reservations and sometimes the wait is out the door..it is, however, a testament to the excellent food served here!
author: Diana B.

description: Quality food - fresh and delicious. Fun decor. It's probably one of my favorite neighborhood spots. I'm a dedicated fan of the crab cakes, white wine and sourdough bread.
author: Sarah T.

description: The restaurants on Fillmore are all good. Really enjoyed this one. The atmosphere and food are quintessential.
author: Howard S.

description: This place has fantastic food! The clam chowder was incredible, the fish and chips were so delicious --the batter was so fresh.  The second time I went the clam chowder was still out of this world amazing but the fish and chips were a tad greasy....they were ok but not as good as the first time.  The service is friendly and atmosphere is great.  I highly recommend!
author: Emily H.

description:
this place is pretty tiny so expect a wait on most days, especially since they do not take reservations!

me and my boyfriend went on a sunday around 730, and we had to wait about 30 minutes for our table. that was fine since we could walk around fillmore street, and that the host took our phone number to call us when our table was ready.  

the food we ordered was great! although, it did take a little while for our food to come out, but it's expected for seafood anyways. we shared the lobster roll and the cioppino. delicious! the lobster roll wasn't the biggest portion, but it was satisfying and the cioppino was a little spicy, which i liked a lot.

the service was alright, wasn't the best, wasn't the worst.  the thing that bugged me a little was that the server took another table's order before ours when we sat down before them... but it's okay, we got our entrees before they got their entrees.

total was like $38 something minus tip.  not too bad!  we did leave a tiny bit hungry after our meal, but we just went out for dessert anyways.
author: Dominique L.

description: I'd give this place 4 stars bug I got food poisoning!   Tasted great going down.... Can't say the same about the reverse.  Everyone else at the table loved it and did not get sick though.
author: Lauren O.

description:
I have recently tried the 'fribs' - whoa, these are good! 

They're actually quite deceiving. They are 'fish ribs' yet look similar in shape and size to baby-back ribs. But they are, in fact, fish ribs. The sauce/glaze on them is quite delectable and each rib has about 3 long, thin fish bones and the fish falls right off. 

These are served with cornbread and cole slaw. The two times I've had these, I've substituted vegetables for those. The first time they came in a dinky cup; the last time it was a plate almost full of them!

Oh! And I also got the Manhattan clam chowder this past time. Super thick and chunky - just like it was the very first time I had it! Nice kick to it - one of the best I've had!
author: Jen N.

description:
When I went here for the first time, I really loved the artichokes stuffed with shrimp and crab, and the service was fast and good. 

The second visit was like a bad second date. Service was super slow and evasive even though the place was relatively empty at 2:30 on a Saturday afternoon. 

I couldn't help but try the artichokes stuffed with seafood again. When they were finally served to us, they weren't cooked well, the seasonings were uneven, and the artichokes weren't trimmed properly so we poked our fingers on thorns when trying to eat them. Yikes, it's not like the staff didn't have ample time to prepare these properly.

I ordered the ahi burger and was shocked to receive the burger smothered in american cheese. If you're going to use processed cheese on ahi, you should really clearly state this on your menu so your customers are warned first. I was barely able to get a hold of my waitress to ask her about this. In a snotty tone she asked "Is there something wrong with the cheese itself or is it just your taste?" What?! 

Bad service and poorly-prepared food aside, I just can't trust a restaurant who would douse ahi tuna with American cheese and give you attitude about it.
author: katt a.

description: Best crab roll ever...this place is highly recommanded if you like lobster or crab....
author: Mohammad A.

description:
Sayonara Toraya...Hello cooked fish, etc. from WOODHOUSE!! Just opened April 7, 2009.

Rory is sooo cute and sweet. He makes you feel welcome and works the front with his brother. It is a casual place and yet tastefully decorated and just easy to enjoy. Check out the HUGE SQUID. Just look above you when exiting. It is kind of like something to be expected at the Monterey Aquarium.

They now have the beer and wine license .
Check out the chalkboard because the salmon was sooo yummy with sides of fries. The clam chowder was great and almost just want to go back for that alone. It is really easy to eat too much and roll away like a round fishball. 

Unfortunately, I am allergic to lobster (sob-sob) otherwise I would have loved to try that with the clam chowder, but that is okay. There is the Ipswitch fried clam sandwich which is also good...my friend allowed me to take a nibble...yeah...he is a hungry whale of a man at lunch.

The make-it-yourself lemonade works.

Hey there is also a new parking lot on Bush Street for $10, but we found parking on Post Street and just walked up three blocks for this old Castro street part deux.

Check it out. They are really nice and the food is pretty good for lunch.

There is also counter service towards the middle of the place. When it is windy and cold I wouldn't choose the front, but hey, it is longer days in San Fran. Wear some clam diggers and get your chowdah craving on...
author: miriam b.

description:
Came here for lunch this afternoon. I have to say, it was worth the visit.

My friends for the half-crab in broth, fried clams roll, and I got the lobster roll. Calamari to share, and backed gratin on the side.

Calamari was just right, crispy and not too much batter. Crab was tender with awesome garliky broth. Clams were juicy and stuffed in a lightly toasted garlic roll. Serveral lobster claws were stuffed in a garlic roll for me.

Why only 4 stars, you asked? Well, I took the last star away because of the slight watery lobster. I do expect quality crustacean at this price.
author: Lois W.

description:
As a local, I find myself at Woodhouse fairly often.  I've been here for lunch and I've been here for dinner, but I always get the SAME thing - the stuffed artichoke!!  It's just so darned good that I can't ever order anything else (why mess with a good thing?).  

I like that Woodhouse is casual and that it's always full (it's a good sign of a good restaurant and FRESH seafood).  The wait can be a bit long on a weekend - I'd expect at least a half hour wait - but it's worth it for good, fairly priced seafood, and Fillmore is a pleasant street to walk around on.
author: Diane E.

description: I have tried many things on their menu and I have to say stick to the lobster roll and you won't be disappointed!  THAT lobster roll is to die for and it would be in my top 3 last meal of my life...YEP it's THAT awesome!!
author: Mao K.

description: Terrific! Delicious everything. Calamari and crab cakes both great, the artichoke crab appetizer is a must - could be an entrée!
author: Savina V.

description:
I just cant get enough of Woodhouse! Especially Tuesday nights...nothing like a great bottle of SAV, $1 oysters and fantastic halibut lobster roll and the new FRIBS (Fish -ribs)...what a concept!!! 
YUMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM. GO there soon, its a real treat for the senses. Great for dates, familes whatever...
author: Brooke H.

description:
I've been here about a dozen times since they opened, and the quality has dipped just a touch.  The stuffed artichoke (which used to be my fav) has come soggy, wet, and inconsistently grilled/cooked/sauced the last few times.  The lobster roll, while still delish, seems to be getting smaller and smaller every time.  The fish and chips are still pretty solid.  The cioppino was overly spicy and salty and the seafood was overcooked when I had it last (a few visits ago).  

However, a couple nights ago I dined there with a girlfriend and while the artichoke was not the greatest, we got a black cod special, and it was cooked to perfection:  crisp skin, super tender white meat, all over some braised fennel bulbs, broccolini, purple potatoes, and sprinkled on top with delicious deep fried bits of fennel.  That dish was a true winner.  It's hard not to like this place (Chad one of the hosts is super nice, and Shelley one of the waitresses is just a pleasure), and it's easy to see why people (including me) keep coming back.  

Drinks:  Arnold Palmers and Lemonades are pricey, but come with little carafes of simple syrup and carbonated water (tea if it's an AP), making it a fun delight to mix it yourself.  

Plus, I'm down for supporting all the neighborhood restaurants on this side of Pine.
author: Isabel M.

description:
Setting: late 3pm lunch.

Atmosphere: cool, check out the picasso piece at the bar. bathroom clean and interesting maps, seats nice, lighting great, location great.

Service: laid back, patient yet attentive and helpful. Dude even gave us some hiking tips for point reyes and oyster farm tips.

Food: excellent. we ordered a half dozen of miyagi oysters - fresh delish! sole w/ mashed potatoes and asparagus - delectably awesome; bowl of clam chowder - not as chunky as the ones at touristy Fish Wharf but definitely a more refined taste and just as fresh. We also ordered some garlic bread - tasted like pizza bread also tasty a bit on the oily side. I tried the trout slayer beer - awesome - apparently a typical fisherman's beer. DIY lemonade is a great concept. I'd check out the daily specials - they looked awesome. Oh and I spied on someone's stuffed artichoke.. and it's gigantic - enough for two.

My only complaint: $6 dessert was small for my standards, but was still delicious.. some black velvet apricot butter something tart... I won't dock any ratings because the price of the meal is as advertised. We spent about $28/head (including 20% tip) and left feeling totally satisfied, happy, and not overly full. I'm definitely coming back.
author: Acid B.

description: OMG. Delicious! Went there last night and we didn't have to wait long like everybody else. Their Cioppino was slammin'. I'd definitely go back and try their fish and chips. Everything on the meny looked amazing! Parking wasn't a problem either.
author: Patty P.

description:
the french fries were freaking amazing.  i would go back for that.  the crab cakes were decent....they are small, so if that is your main, then get the larger portion.

i would like to get the lobster roll the next time i'm there.  it's kinda funny watching some people try to figure out how to get it in their mouth...it's kinda awkward shaped, and makes for great dining entertainment.

the service was okay....outside of the waiter forgetting about us for the last 45 minutes we were there.  my dining companion told me that we just needed to "wait our turn" when i commented that we had finished our meal and had waited about 20 minutes already with no sign of our waiter....i guess we all have different standards in terms of service.  nevertheless, he was pleasant, so whatever....
author: Miss P.

description:
The fish and chips are hugeeeeeeeee and delish!
And then it all went downhill from there.
I had the crab melt which was okay, nothing amazing. Their lobster roll is smaller than Sam's Chowder House in Half Mooon Bay, it was okay also. I was really excited to try this place because I love seafood but I was disappointed.
author: Mimi L.

description:
I came to Woodhouse Fish Co. hungry, excited, and hopeful that Yelp wouldn't let me down, and left full, sleepy, extremely satisfied and anxious for my next return.  

Honestly, the Maine lobster roll was one of the best I've ever tasted -- buttery bun, toasted on the oustide, and heaping amounts of delicious lobster to fill up your belly, along with a hearty helping of French fries.  The price, at $16.75, is pretty standard, but I didn't pay for the meal and even if I did, it's worth it for the sheer amount of lobster packed in there.

The decor really is reminiscent of what I would think is a typical New England coastal scene.  It's airy, there's lots of wood and rope, but it's a little more up-scale than one would think.  The floors are swabbed clean as though a sailor himself did it.  Very pleasant all around.

Just one tip: there's the inevitable wait, but just go in, put your name down, and travel a hop, skip and a jump to Harry's down the street for cocktails.  Woodhouse will call you when your table's ready.

Next time I'll be coming for $1 oysters on Tuesdays, and to try their "do-it-yourself" lemonade, Hartford clam chowder, and sourdough bread pudding.  Yuuummmmo - I'm salivating just thinking about it all!
author: Kira K.

description:
Went again on Sunday with the fam -- impressions as follows:

-Clam chowda still holds up.
-Lobster roll yummy, but did need hot sauce. Generous portion.
-Crab cakes were generous and the chipotle sauce we spot-on.
-Crab melt was decent and the boys loved the fries.
-Petrale sole was *meah* and the broccoli WAY overcooked. Way prefer Hayes Street Grill's petrale sole (which is marine crack, imo)

I'm thinking the cook on shift just didn't realize that overcooked brocolli is unappealing. Othewise it stood up. Do have to admit that $90/lunch for 4 isn't something we'd roll every week, but it's important to educate the kids' palate!
author: Layla P.

description:
Wow. 
Delightfully surprised by this place. It's not that I didn't think it was going to be good... I just wasn't it expecting it to be SO dang good. The kind of good that you walk away from and can't seem to stop talking about it. 

Yum. Went for an early dinner before catching a movie at Kabuki. Saturday night - maybe 6pm. We were surprised that we barely made it in without a wait. The place was packed. We grabbed the last two spots at the bar and had a great time looking at the space. The tv/picture with SF sea and bay views, a giant squid above the door, and panda bear next to some seashells and shark teeth. Brilliant, fun, and classy...the marble countertop, that is. 

Started out with some oysters - fresh, delish. Then, the special squash blossoms with pesto and heirloom tomatoes - blew my mind and tastebuds. Oh my tummy, it was good. Then, the ever delicious lobster roll. Perfect - even better than - those in Maine. (gasp!) It was lighter, not much butter, and way better than Netties. Also had the Ciopinni. It was awesome. Spicy, flavorful, rich, full of good seafood - it's not messin' around good. Oh dear god, it was wonderful. 

To top it off, the service was impeccable. I like a place where the servers have charm and personality. 

The wine list was a little lacking, but when a place has great food, you don't need to "wash it down" anyhow.

Can't wait to come back and try the chowda and fish 'n chips.
author: Erin M.

description:
We arrived on a busy Saturday night at 6:30 and the wait was for an hour for a party of 6.  We weren't seated until 7:50.  

Service was good - quick and efficient
Food was not great  but okay
Price - decent for seafoood and quality

Here is what I tried
1.  Steamed Clams - Nice and plump.  Served with Garlic bread which we left in the broth too long and became really soggy.

2.  Lobster Roll - I never had a lobster roll before...so I can't compare.  The bread was nicely toasted.  The lobster slathered with mayo was okay but nothing special....maybe a little bland...needed more salt or something.

3.  Halibut cooked in parchment paper - Fish was light and flaky but the herbal/tomato flavor was too strong for my boyfriend...

4.  Clam Chowder - It was good...similar to what you will find at Pier 39...

Conclusion:  Probably won't come back due to the long wait.  I'd rather go to the Pier....
author: Cin T.

description: This is definitely in the running for our favorite restaurants in SF. Delicious, fresh seafood, pretty good atmosphere.
author: Cami J.

description:
A 5 star restaurant in my book. Super fresh fish, and awesome dishes.

I went to Woodhouse right before my flight out of SFO, and I only had 30 minutes. I told my waitress this and she worked out the meal like magic. We were out of there in 25 minutes.

Clam Chowder = Prolly the best I've ever had. Beats the Wharf IMO.

Crab Cocktail = Wish there was more crab... It was just that good. Stunning dish. Never had a crab cocktail before, but it works out as well as shrimp.

Fish and Chips = Whooo-weee. The beer batter is so clean and the fried fish is perfect. Bite it and it's juicy and steamy. Chips? Perfect shoestring fries. So damn good. Put some malt V up on it. 

and last but not least...

Lobster Roll = Got the $26 one. It had maybe 4 5 full claws up in that piece. Buttered, cheese crisped toast with that cool, creamy lobster meat. So good makes me wanna give daps to the chefs back there.

CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK! and try the cioppino*!
author: Bear R.

description: the lobster roll was highly recommended by a friend and being an avid yelper i always look at pictures first to whet my appetite. what i saw were hit or miss of the dish...some pictures show big pieces of lobster meat, others show minced lobster drenched in white gu. so i crossed my fingers and hoped to get a latter version of the roll, but instead i got the former(of course.) although it was still decent, the overall flavor was lacking something. i'm not exactly sure what it is, but it could definitely use a little extra sumthin'. same went for the ahi tuna tartar, which was essentially flavorless. this place has been bookmarked for quite some time and i'm glad i finally got to try it and cross it off my list, but unfortunately i will not be returning.
author: Melissa Y.

description: What can I say, the service was great, the food was delicious. Great crabmeat sandwich for lunch. Always a go-to when in the city.
author: Tyler S.

description: Good service, good food. I had the stuffed artichoke and even though I'm sure I ate it wrong (fork? Fingers? I chose fingers and I'm not sorry about it), it was so good I didn't even care that two small children were looking at me funny. I saw a couple sharing a cioppino and I kind of wish my boyfriend and I had done that. The dish looked way too big for one person.
