I also got a do-it-yourself Arnold Palmer and even though I tried to be good about the sweetener, I ended up adding almost all of it. I really liked the decor. I'd definitely go back, but probably not on a weekend as the place is relatively small and gets pretty packed.
author: k h.

description: Loved the casual atmosphere, friendly service and good food!
author: Erik M.

description: the fried clam appetizer was good. the cioppino was good.  the lobster roll that i had been craving forever and came for was not good.  i just like knuckle meat in mine and this had the claw which is fine.  but when the claw meat is soooooo dry i had to spit it out in my napkin that is really no bueno!  $20 or whatever for the roll and a 1/4 of it is bad?  booooo.  hope its an isolated incident.
author: l l.

description: Small, crowded, very noisy, very casual, spottily attentive service, good oysters, great Branzino, good lobster roll.  A bit pricey for what you get.  Good spot for a quick nosh.
author: Howard B.

description: I ate here a while back. I honestly can[t exactly remember what I ordered, so it wasnt all that memorable. Here's what I DID take home with me though: the server was VERY kind and my dining partner could not decide on her alcoholic beverage , so she brought a few samples for her to try to make up her mind, which is not done very often. Also, the shrimp louie salad started was grubbin. No ressies- so get there early or be ok with a bit of a wait.
author: Tara M.

description: Love the lobster rolls, they also have a very tasty side order of steamed vegetables my kids love...
author: Bogee B.

description: Good little place to grab some lunch. I had some oysters and the crab sandwich which was pretty good. If I'm in the neighborhood and feel like seafood I'll look for this place.
author: Lauren N.

description: Holy shit the food is delicious! Tried the calamari, shrimp avocado roll, and the lobster roll, all soo fresh. You bite into the lobster roll and the bread is crunchy, buttery, and soft. The lobster couldn't be any better, and if it could let me know cuz that was pretty damn good! Thin cut fries and coleslaw tied the whole thing together. Maybe a little overpriced, cuz I've had some good quality seafood for less but, I'd still come back and pay 18$ for the sandwich if I had money to spare..
author: Elvin F.

description: somehow we got very slow service at this location while the place was not packed.
author: Paiyu G.

description: Yummy tacos with fresh ingredients. I had some fish tacos that were out of this world. I had the grilled not fried fish to avoid some oil and it was perfect.
author: P G.

description: My issue is with the lobster in the lobster roll as it was all claw meat.  A lobster roll should have some tail in it!  (It's typically a natural proportion of claw, knuckle and tail meat.)The top split roll was perfect and one of the best I have had.  Great fries and decent chowder.  I will be back!
author: Who D.

description: Good service but the food was not up to par.  Overpriced, fried, small portions, overall not good.  If I am going out for something unhealthy, I atleast want the calories to be worth it, this place was not.  I am clueless why it is so popular.  Would not go back.
author: M R.

description:
First I have to talk about the service.Our waiter was clearly getting over a sore throat and had very little voice to use. That did not prevent him from going over all of the blackboard specials and answering my usual "which is better" questions. He was never far from reach, but never annoying. We gladly tipped 40%!

In terms of the food, I stuck to a menu staple. I was tempted to go for the skate, something that I have never tried, and the waiter said was his favorite of the specials. While trying to decide, I looked at the table next to ours and they were looking very happy! Both were having the lobster rolls. Both had been to Woodhouse 2 times. Since this was my first time, I wanted everything. 

I shared with the waiter that I was a Woodhouse virgin, which was why I was having such difficulty deciding. Well, upon hearing my revelation, he changed from Skate to lobster roll. Lobster roll is was. My friend had the crab sandwich. Although I love crab, even though I did not taste it, I am so glad that I chose the lobster. Huge chunks of the real deal and no nasty mayo filler. Perfect! The fries were nothing special. Shoestring fires have never been worth the calories to me.

I can't wait to go back and try one of the specials or the salads. It's nice to be able to trust the quality of the fish. And with the friendly service, I can see myself as a regular!
author: francez M.

description:
they are one of the few good restaurants in that area open for lunch on weekdays.

- awesome clam chowder
- parents loved the oysters
- i like the crab louie... it's expensive for a salad but comes w/ a pile of crab.  my 2 friends thought the crab didn't have much flavor, but i drown mine in dressing & lemon so, whatever
- lemonade is good but unfortunately lemon essence is not fresh (comes from a jug)
author: Miss K.

description: Yum! This place rocks. Came here with a couple friends on a weekday night (not Friday), but there was still a line, so you know it's good. The inside is really cramped, no surprise (we were wedged into this weird triangle corner area of the room, that's the only reason why I noticed it more). We ended waiting about 20 minutes, so it wasn't too bad. I recommend ordering family style so you can try a little of everything. We got raw oysters, crab cakes, clam chowder, and fish tacos. The service was a little on the slower side, but it was a popular night (I guess in SF it's always a popular night, especially in the Castro) so I suppose that can't be helped. Everything was really fresh and flavorful. The crab cakes were my favorite, all dense and crispity, but the clam chowder and fish tacos were equally delicious as well. GO HERE if you're craving good, fresh seafood at a (relatively) reasonable price and can't be bothered to make it to Fisherman's Wharf or North Beach.
author: Tiffany C.

description: I took a year and a half hiatus from eating at Woodhouse but rebirthed last Tuesday for lunch. First off, $1 oysters are almost too good to pass up. Not sure what type they were serving that day, but they were fresh and ice cold. The ahi tuna burger was really good and my buddy's crab sandwich looked on point as well. For a student budget the $22 lunch is a bit steep, but it was definitely worth it.
author: Jonathan G.

description:
5 stars for their lobster roll - AMAZING!  Lobster was fresh, tasty, and plentiful, with a light dressing that complimented the lobster meat very well.  Split top toasted bun w/ butter yum.  Best lobster roll I have had besides the clam box in ipswitch, ma.  And reasonably priced; for those who haven't had many lobster rolls before they usually are $15-$16 on the eastcoast at hole in the wall shacks.  Fries were ok.  Coleslaw was really good too.

Clam chowder was good, much better than other clam chowders I've had on the westcoast, but I've had better on the eastcoast.

Will definitely go back for the lobster roll!
author: Ali G.

description:
Went with my dad for an early dinner. Grabbed seats at the bar after only a short wait. Everything was great!

lemonade: came with lemon juice, simple syrup, and water. was fun & really tasty.

new england clam chowder: rich & delicious, although on par with the prepared chowder you can buy at whole foods. 

calamari: large portion, very good.

we both ordered the Cioppino which was wonderful! Flavorful broth with tons of seafood. The garlic bread it came with was some of the best I've had. It was, however, very messy to eat!

It's a cute, small restaurant with a kind & attentive staff. The host was particularly helpful. Will be back.
author: Kelly Kate W.

description: Amazing lobster roll! The Bun was perfect and huge pieces of lobster in the Roll! The sea bass was great too!
author: Bridgett H.

description: i had the steamed white wine crab and crab cakes. both are fantastic!! next time ill be doubling up on the crab cakes! the service was great our waitress was very fun!
author: Velvet C.

description:
Really cool spot to grab a quick eat.  I had the fried clams, which I wasnt too impressed because it tasted like mostly batter.  Couldn't really find a clam, but the appetizer portion was huge!  The clam chowder was tasty, not too thick not too thin.  Perfect consistency.  The crabcakes were the bomb!!  A little on the salty side, but it was still good!!  My friend had the lobster roll, which looked good too because it had a huge chunks of lobster on really buttery brioche.  YUM!

Service is EXCELLENT.  Very nice staff and accomodating as well.  I would definitely go back for a quick fried food fix....and great service.
author: Gina S.

description:
I'm kinda hooked on this place, and their lobster rolls. I've been twice now, and I find myself craving it all the time. The service was great. I've had the same host/waiter both times. He's very polite, and makes me feel like this is my local spot after only being there a couple times.

Highly recommended for lunch. I'll update with a dinner review soon, since I just might be on my way there tonight!
author: Bjorn P.

description: Ahi tuna-cheeseburger and Ranger IPA; great atmosphere. We'll be back soon for sure!
author: Brian C.

description:
This is the greatest neighborhood restaurant and I'm so excited to only be two blocks away.  The food is incredible, the service is always great and it's a fun, upbeat atmosphere.  The price is a little high, but it's totally worth it because the food is so fresh, high quality and very tasty.

If you're not counting calories, the fish tacos are mouthwatering!  If you're trying to be a bit more conscious, the stuffed grilled artichoke is really filling and very creative and different!
author: Chelsea N.

description:
Tuesday nite dollar oyster nite! Space: cozy, casual, service:  bit of a line since walk-in only but very attentive host and waiter had great recommendations. The place reminds me of a mix between Sea Salt in Berkeley (which has happy hour dollar oysters everyday 4-6) and Anchor Oyster Bar in Castro, but I think I like this place more.

Shared:
Oyster bay sauvinon blanc 

Dozen dollar oysters // tasty.. would have ordered more//

Bowl of clam chowder and side of garlic bread // enjoyed this very much. thicker than hog island's and more filling/comforting//

Anchor steamed Alaskan cod fish tacos // these were sizeable- they used the same fish as the fish and chips- order came in 3 and were very good//

Smoked ono salad with persimmon //meh but I'm biased because I don't really enjoy salads or persimmon or bunny food type things//

Stuffed artichoke w/ Dungeness crab and bay shrimp //this was good serving and if you love artichokes, theres lots of it//

was unfortunately too full for dessert :( but would come back again!
author: Monica P.

description: The food is great, and the service very good too.  The seating process is painfully slow and the hostess women - honestly have unpleasant attitude enough to make you consider leaving before you even sit.  But if you can muster that patience, the rest of the experience will make up for it.   Could use more non-alcoholic drink choices, too.  But on balance, very good restaurant.
author: Gabby M.

description: I was still breaking my self in to seafood then this place got me hooked. We ate family style. We had the chiopino, which was filled with masterfully cooked mussels, clams, fish and crab legs all swimming in the best chiopino sauce I've had to this day. Not only did I order more bread to sop it up, i tackled my pregnant sister to stop her from eating it.  Next we had the whole sea bass, it  was amazballs. Stuffed with aromatics and coated with corn meal it was a perfect party of flavours all in my mouth. We also had the ceviche and oysters which were both very fresh and exactly what you'd want and love.
author: Graeme B.

description: We loved everything about this place. The atmosphere was great, the staff was friendly and knowledgable and the food was really great! A hip, swanky and affordable seafood joint. Will come again.
author: Morgan M.

description: Absolutely awesome crab steamed in white wine sauce. Super fresh. And the whole-fish was fantastic as well. Best seafood in town - strangely, SF is a town that should have all sorts of incredible seafood but for whatever reason, it just isn't so. WFC is a find. The whole crab and the whole fish were plenty of food for two people. No cocktails and it came to $70 - a pretty good deal but not a bargain.
author: Phil L.

description:
Woodhouse is a great place for a casual seafood meal! Been here twice for dinner and loved both times.  

First time, hubby and I came at 5pm on a Saturday so it was pretty empty, which worked out for us because we were hungry. We ordered half a dozen oysters to share.  Hubby got a cup of the clam chowder.  Then we shared a lobster roll (smaller size) and crab cakes.  Everything was delicious, especially the lobster roll.  You can get it in the smaller size, with 3 oz of lobster meat or the larger size, with doubled the meat.  It comes with this buttered brioche bread that was lightly toasted and oh so soft.  The oysters were also super fresh.  We opted for the kumamoto oysters and they were plump and juicy.  The chowder was also creamy and tasty with many pieces of clam.  The crab cakes were so so, nothing too special, so I probably wouldn't order them again. 

The second time we went, it was with a larger group at 7ish on a Thursday night.  They don't take reservations but I called ahead and put my name on the waitlist. When we got there at 7, we were the first on the list but ended up waiting 30 minutes for a table to clear up.  This time around, hubby and I shared the 3 oz lobster roll again and also tried the dungeness crab roll.  We also got a dozen oysters to share with our friends.  As usual the food was yummy and everyone had a good time.  We even ordered 2 desserts to share: the bread pudding and chocolate custard.  Both were YUMMY, especially the bread pudding.  Even though it was made with sour dough bread, it didn't taste like sour dough at all.  It came with this rum caramel sauce drizzled on top and around the bread, topped with a generous helping of whip cream.  We all thought it was pretty amazing.  I'll be back again for their $1 oyster Tuesdays!
author: Kat M.

description: I was looking for a good fish restaurant to take my friend who flew into SF...turns out that this place is mediocre. Not worthy of 4 stars. You can get better tasting fish and chips from Gordon's Frozen fish filets. As for their Cioppino, it was 3 STAR quality. Not bad but not the best in SF. Everything we ate from the fish n chips to the Cioppino to the fried calamari was okay, but nothing to rave about or take someone from out of town to.
author: Nick C.

description: Great fries - skinny, crispy, delicious.  The lobster roll was tasty, and that butter toasted bun was almost decadent.  The fried clam roll was even better than the lobster roll.  The oysters didn't taste like they were freshly shucked, but they were fine.  Service was prompt.
author: Bella G.

description: Very friendly staff and the food was great.  I wish they took reservations, but this place is worth waiting for.
author: Dim S.

description:
My girlfriend and I were spending the day in San Francisco and we wanted to find a small family run business that would give us a cozy, homey feel with a modern day atmosphere and I believe we found it! You can eat here without having the hassle of finding parking, thanks to a convenient nearby parking lot ($4 for 2hr max). 

We came here on a Saturday around 6:45 pm and it wasn't very crowded at the time. We waited for about 5 minutes before being seated. My girlfriend ordered the Sturgeon with Ravioli which came out great. It was cooked so perfectly, tender and juicy. I ordered their Crab Cakes that came with a side salad. The crab cakes are to die for. The only downside, the portions of our dishes were quite petite. My girlfriend and I weren't full so we decided to go with what seems to be their most popular dessert. We ordered the Sourdough Bread Pudding and it was phenomenal! Two cubed pieces of sourdough that was topped off with caramel and whipped cream. It was a little sweet but totally manageable. I thought about it and you know sometimes you want to try dessert but you're just too full? After we finished the dessert, we were comfortably full. I guess the smaller main dishes weren't such a bad thing after all.

Towards the end of dinner we noticed that there was a crowd of people waiting around the front and place was really packed. It seemed all the customers were locals because waiters and waitresses were calling some customers by their first names when asking what they wanted to order. It was pretty cool. On the way out we were told "Thank You" by at least three employees. Everyone's just so friendly!

In conclusion, if you want an atmosphere with good vibes, excellent service and superb food for an affordable price. Look no more. Woodhouse Fish Co!
author: Don V.

description: I had the bay shrimp and avocado roll with a side of slaw and fries. The bread was delicious; buttered and toasted perfectly. The shrimp and the avocado were extremely fresh and all the ingredients combined created an awesome sandwich! The fries were also cooked perfectly and the slaw was also good (although I wish they would serve a little more slaw). Overall, I'm definitely going back for another meal and I recommend this to anyone looking for a good seafood lunch spot!
author: Austin C.

description: This place is a bit over-hyped I think.  Very average fish and chips, crowded and cramped, decent clam chowder but not as good as the East Coast.
author: Elton W.

description: I always wondered what a lobster roll was.  Friends ans family in the east say you haven't lived until you've tried one so I did.  AMAZING!  Stumbled on Woodhouse purely by accident but will be back for more.  Friendly staff, simple comfortable atmosphere and fresh and tasty fare.
author: Laura M.

description: Looked on yelp to find a seafood joint around the area we were in and came across this small bundle of goodness.  Ordered the lobster sandwich, BBQ oysters, fish tacos and crab cakes to split amongst us and we were impressed on the quality of the seafood they had. Great atmosphere with friendly staff members. Definitely will return and try out the others in the future.
author: Darren Y.

description:
I think Woodhouse may have been reading the recent reviews of the lobster roll being a bit skimpy, because when I was there yesterday, it was PACKED with delicious, lightly dressed, huge pieces of meat, so much so that I had to take some out in order to get the sandwich in my mouth.  It's the first lobster roll I've had on the west coast, and it was as good as any I've had in New England.  I've been dreaming of it ever since lunch yesterday & may be back today.

I'd only ever been to the WHFC in the Castro, once, before I stumbled upon this new branch.  I don't recall what I had there (it was 2 years ago) but I do remember it was good enough that hubby & I kept saying we were going back.

This place does have a much nicer interior (befitting it's Pac Hts location) so we'll probably come back to this location.
author: Allison K.

description: After just two weeks the wife and I had to return for more. I had ciopinno and she of course had grilled stuffed artichoke salad. The ciopinno was awesome. The cheesy garlic bread was, umm gooey cheesily, orgasmicly yummy. We had sourdough bread pudding for desert and that was very good as well. My new favorite place!
author: Steve B.

description: Cute, charming, good service.  Food is always super tasty.
author: Mike W.

description: Best. Meal. Of. My. Life.  I came here unplanned, enticed by the promise of a good clam chowder.  I didn't end up trying it, so I can't speak to that.  However... what I did order... wow.  It was unfortunately just a special, so I'm not sure if they will have it again.  But I ordered this seared scallop dish over truffled potato puree and brussel sprout leaves and pomegranate seeds... mmm!!  Literally, it was all I talked about all night.  I hope to go back one day, and that they have that dish.
author: Amy H.

description: I like their fish and chips. It's fresh and perfectly crisp (the fish *and* the chips). The tartar sauce is awesome and their coleslaw is the first coleslaw I've ever enjoyed in my life. Fish and chips is simple, and they kept it that way and kept it perfect.
author: Elben S.

description: I give it 5 stars for the Maine Lobster Roll. Amazing. Perfectly toasted bread and a lot of fresh lobster meat.
author: Chris P.

description: Came here with some friends from socal who were looking for some great fish & chips.  I ordered a lobster roll w/ fries.  Both were amazing.  The fish was moist and the lobster was seasoned beautifully.  The bread was a perfect warmth and the fries were crisp as could be.  I enjoyed the nice and warm atmosphere as well.  The staff were friendly and the food came out pretty quickly considering how long it takes to prepare our dishes.  Definitely will be returning, just wish it was closer to home!
author: Robert I.

description:
My boyfriend and I went to Woodhouse for a relatively quick bite to eat last night. We strolled in to the place at 9 PM and were given the seat by the hostess stand. Not my favorite location, but the host said they had a 30 minute wait all night, so I was happy.

After waiting around 10 minutes, we got water, and put in our order: Fish and chips for him, fried Ipswitch and a salad for me. 

And then we began to wait. And wait. And wait. I saw a huge table of 13 come in, be seated, and receive appetizers, and wondered, what the hell is going on?

40 minutes after sitting, I recieved my salad, and I almost started laughing. 40 minutes for a salad that was clearly pre-chopped? Well, at least it was good. A bit too light on the blue cheese dressing, but the beets made it delicious.

It took another 15 minutes for our actual food to get there... Yes. We ate around 10:10, almost a full hour after sitting. I actualy made a "Hell's Kitchen" joke because I didn't understand how fried food could take so long to serve.

The reason this place gets 3 stars is because that fried food was FANTASTIC. I'm a East Coaster, and these clams were the cat's meow. Even knowing that this place takes forever, I want to go back today. 

If you want some really wonderful seafood, come here. If you want to get it in a timely manner, go elsewhere. I will give this place another chance in case this was a fluke, but man, was it really annoying.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: Been here a few times already and I really like the Do-It Yourself Arnold Palmer.  Tried the half dozen oysters (12 or 2 ea) which were ok.  Ive also had the toasted-buttered dungeness roll, split-top maine lobster roll, fish and chips and baja-style fish tacos which were all very good.  They had the roasted corn for a special side dish and that was just full of buttery goodness.
author: she q.

description: I had the crab roll, which was fresh and great.  The food is a little pricy, but it is seafood and is within the typical price range for SF.
author: S D.

description: I needed a close fish restaurant one night . So I checked with Yelp and found this place and boy was I happy. The fish tacos are killer because  that's all I've had so far but I do plan to go back.
author: Mark L.

description: Great seafood for the money, and nice friendly service.  My girlfriend and I had been looking for local oysters for a while and came across this place by chance.  The oysters were amazing and so fresh.
author: Ryan T.

description:
The atmosphere and service were top notch. The servers here are so friendly and welcoming! Fresh seafood and classic seaside shack type food. My friend and I tried the fried soft shell crab appetizer that was the highlight of the meal. A nice sized crab came lightly breaded and fried on top of a bed of arugula, corn, and baby heirloom tomatoes. Yums! I ordered the stuffed artichoke which was only ok. There was a generous amount of crab and bay shrimp, but the artichoke lacked flavor and could have used a bit more of that garlicky butter sauce that it was basted with. My friend's bay shrimp and avocado sandwich looked pretty basic but the fries that it came with were knockout. Like McDonalds without the over processed taste. 
The iced tea is brewed perfectly and they offer the option of creating your own Arnold Palmer with simple syrup and tea in little separate carafes. Genius! 
Would definately come back for dollar oysters on Tuesday! We came in on a Monday around 6pm and it filled up fast at 6:30 with a good mix of families, dates, and people catching up.
author: Stacy T.

description: We had a crab coctail, fish and chips and the lobster roll.  There wasn't enough flavor in the crab or lobster for my taste.  I've had a lot of crab and lobster at other places and found them both to be on the bland side at this restaurant.  They lacked a real depth of solid flavor.  They were fresh but that didn't replace the need for more taste.  One of the pieces of fish was ok but the other had way too much batter which obscured the taste of the fish.  Service was nice and accommodated requests nicely but the food was disappointing.
author: Larry R.

description:
I love Woodhouse Fish Company.  The food is great but for some reason the prices at the Fillmore street location are more expensive than the Market street location.  You can't go wrong with the dollar oysters on Tue nights.  The lobster roll is amazing.  The host and service were great and the kitchen was spotless.  

Yes this location has better decor and a chef, but the prices should be comparable between locations.
author: Maggie K.

description:
Yum! Yum! Yum! Woodhouse Fish Company in San Francisco has to be the best seafood restaurant in the city. It's not overpriced like the Farrallon or dirty and bird infested like the stalls at Fisherman's Wharf. It's the real deal. Woodhouse has two locations, one Castro/Market and the other conveniently located by my house on Fillmore and Bush. The restaurant clearly was designed by someone who has been to an actual New England town like Newport, RI. Its quaint, white walls with pops of color (very Pottery Barn) with a nautical theme. The only thing about the ambiance that throws me off is the large 'electronic picture' hanging by the special board that displays a bunch of random nautical-type pics. It really doesn't jive with the overall New England theme. They don't take reservations and the restaurant is small but the tables turn over quickly. There is a nice long bar with 10 seats if you don't want to wait for a table. Come early, around 6pm for minimal to no wait.

I ventured to the Pacific Heights location with my friend Kerstin last night. It's a great place to have a meal with a vegetarian (pescatarian) friend because they can order anything off the menu and you don't have to feel bad about the limited non-meat selections. Since neither of us could decide on what to get, we split the Ciopinno and the Dungeness Crab Special, a whole crab grilled with cracked pepper and sea salt with jalapenos and green onions. OMG delicious. We both couldn't decide which was better but after much deliberation and eating, I liked the crab special the best. Some other highlights on the menu are: Crab Cakes, Stuffed Artichokes with Dungeness crab and bay shrimp, clam chowder, fish and chips and the $1 oysters on Tuesdays. Everything I have tried is great, so I am sure the other half of the menu is just as delicious. This is the best spot for seafood in the city and the beer/wine is reasonably priced. 

It's Crab Season in San Francisco so go now why the little guys are fresh!!!
author: Alice S.

description: This review is SOLELY based on the front desk hostess.  Train your staff please.  Do not throw newbies to the Pacific Heights post-work hungry hoards and think that it is acceptable.  She was absolutely clueless as to how to talk to perspective diners.  Clueless and rude.  Double whammy.  The restaurant is half empty.  Triple whammy.  Had to call over the manager to tell him about her attitude and his answer, "well, she's nervous because she's new".  How about training her to greet, smile and acknowledge.  Simple.  It's not rocket science.  And by the way, it's called the service industry -- and it's all about customer service.  I know you're a pretty model-like Chanel Iman doppelganger, but this ain't the catwalk, and no, you won't be discovered here.  So hostess-girl, drop the attitude, wipe the stink-face off and understand no matter what your parents may have said to you, no you are not special.  As for the folks who hired her, please re-think your methods of hiring for your front of the office because this one is doing a good job of sabotaging the goodwill this restaurant has built with the local residents.
author: Hannah H.

description: Wow! All I can say is that we recieved some of the best service we've gotten in a long time and the food was excellent!
author: Andrew B.

description: I fasted all day just so I could pig out at dinner. Btw, the halibut filet and potato gratin with pearl barley risotto was totally worth the starvation.
author: Alex H.

description: This restaurant is great! Intimate, very friendly and accommodating servers. Food was out of this world! We had the best crab cakes we have ever had. They weren't doughy like most restaurants. Lots of crab! The lobster roll had chunks of lobster and a little aioli. Excellent, excellent place. I highly recommend it!
author: Carmen e.

description:
Oh, golly golly golly. Mr. Lobster Roll, there is no replacement for your giant mound of whole claws, sopping with butter and served up on a toasty slice of texas toast. You knock my socks off every time! Your french fries are PERFECTION, and your girlfriend, Ms.Clam Chowder is HOT and TENDER ;oPP Don't go here on a Saturday at around 2 or 3 pm unless you want a freaky chick sitting down with you to eat your fries and pick the claws out of your sandwich. I will do it...I'm not kidding... 
 The staff here is first rate...cool people with a sense of humor, and good taste in beer.
Pssssst: don't let them poison your lobster with mayo...get it with BUTTER and you will feel so happy and fulfilled.
author: Kathryn E.

description: I was probably unfair of me to order the crab cakes for as a native Marylander I'm a bit of a snob.  I was disappointed, but then again I have very high standards...  I plan to return and try something else for it's a cute place and I like that they have a decent chard for just $5!
author: Kara H.

description:
Maybe it was a mistake to go there with a New Englander; however, I also found the chowder too thick with not enough clam flavor. The $26 lobster roll was overflowing with lobster meat and served in a nice soft roll, but I found the filling a little bitter.

I had their fish ribs at A Taste of Fillmore a couple of weeks ago, and those were pretty tasty.

Overall, I thought that the service was friendly and that they had nice light beers to go with the food. Perhaps next time I'll order something fresher and have a better experience.
author: Peng A.

description: Visited this restaurant for take-out a few weeks ago because it was so busy that we couldn't sit down. Fantastic lobster roll.  Looking forward to returning!
author: Ashley C.

description: This is your typical American fish and chips place. Definitely recommend ordering that with a glass of beer on tap. The dungeness crab roll was really good too but you really can't screw up dungeness crab sandwiches as long as you have fresh ingredients. My friend and I split the fish taco, that was really good too. Friendly staff and great place to kick back and hang out with friends!
author: Keara C.

description: It's a convenient location, but not certain why it has such high ratings from others?  The "make it yourself" lemonade was a nice touch, but not enough to bring me back.  I had the fish and chips and though it is a greasy option, I found the fish lacking flavor and the coating to be especially greasy.
author: Miranda O.

description: Alicia is friendly and informative. The New England clam chowder was average and the trout special was light and satisfying. Stay away from the Tentacle Syrah.
author: Sargeant T.

description:
I like the combination of casual dining in a pretty environment with the high quality food. The oysters are delicious. The crab grilled cheese sandwiches are sinful. The lobster rolls are scrumptious. The cesar salad is perfectly dressed. And I will fight you for the last bite of bread pudding. 
Yum. I wish I had some of it right now.
The family that owns and runs this restaurant is lovely. They care deeply about every diner's experience.
I highly recommend both Woodhouse Fish Company locations and their restaurant in Woodside, CA called Buck's.
author: Susan B.

description: Like all good seafood places, go early to avoid the lines. Popped in yesterday for an early dinner around 5pm and we were lucky enough to snag a corner table by the window. Ordered a cup of New England clam chowder and the lobster roll. The chowder had an impressive amount of clams in it, but could have been thicker and needed a hearty dose of salt and pepper. The lobster roll arrived on buttered Acme bread with a side of perfectly crisp fries and coleslaw. Really tasty, but the portion size was disappointingly small for the price - I felt like I was eating a kid's meal. The lobster roll is priced at 3oz of meat for $18 and 6oz for $26. I could have easily polished off another serving. 1 cup of soup, 2 orders of the 3oz lobster roll, and 2 iced teas with refills for a total bill of just over $51 - not including tip. Overall, service was excellent and food was delicious, but pricey for the portions - also, we were still hungry afterwards and ended up buying some yogurt at Fraiche next door and some sandwiches at La Boulange across the street.
author: Elaine W.

description: I want to like this place since I love lobster rolls but when I went there for lunch earlier this week, I got the lobster roll and unfortunately bit into a sharp piece of shell. That kind of ruined it for me since I spent the rest of the time having to be very careful about the bites I was taking and I couldn't enjoy it. I think if you are going to charge $26 for a sandwich, you should make sure it is perfect.
author: Jessie H.

description:
I've been here twice with my family and both times I had a great experience. The fish is as fresh as can be, the staff is very friendly and attentive, and the overall ambiance is lovely. The oysters are amazing - we always order 18+ for 3 people (especially on 1 dollar Tuesdays)!

I have dietary restrictions, and not only did the waiters I had both times check with the kitchen about ingredients, they actually tweaked the dish for me! Definitely a must have on a favorite restaurants list.
author: Emily E.

description: Yummmy lobster rolls, clam chowder and a kids menu! this place was delish! The lobster rolls were awesome , but I recommend they put a side of butter with the plate next time oh and to heat up the rolls before them serve em' because my wasn't all that warm however the lobster was fresh and the chowder was creamy ! Just the way I like it!!
author: April m.

description: My husband decided to visit the Woodhouse Fish Company yesterday for lunch. Since it was Monday and raining in the city...we were seated immediately. We ordered fairly quickly. The clam chowder was good but not the best I have tasted. I ordered the large Lobster Roll and my husband had the Dungeness Crab Sandwich. Both sandwiches were cut in half for us to share. Sandwiches were good but nothing to drive 50 miles to, pay bridge toll and pay a tab of $83 with tip for. It was an experience but one I wont be enjoying again anytime soon. Their bar selection was lacking what I needed to help me enjoy my sandwich- a beer named Corona or Blue Moon!!!
author: Chryl R.

description: I have yet to come here and be disappointed. This place is always busy and there is a reason for it: it is super delicious, fresh, the waiters are friendly and the location is awesome. I have had the fish and chips, the shrimp louie, the lobster roll and every now and then I try their special. You can mix your own lemonade or Arnold Palmer...I have never tried any of their desserts and I must admit I probably won't - there is the fro yo right next doo!
author: Conny F.

description: I've been here probably a half dozen times or so and it is one of my favorite places in the city. Woodhouse is like one of those crappy seafood places at Fisherman's Wharf except it isn't crappy and it's not in Fisherman's Wharf. None of the food is too out there, but it's all fantastic. I've had the lobster roll, the Dungeness roll, and the fish and chips. The Dungeness roll is probably my favorite with it's buttery roll and generous pile of crab meat. I usually get the make-it-yourself Arnold Palmer (they bring out little bottles of simple syrup, tea, and a glass of lemon juice and you get to mix them together) which is really fun, but I always question if it's actually worth it. The one in the Castro is pretty much the same.
author: Jeremy J.

description: I've eaten oysters just about everywhere in the City.  Raw oysters must be FRESH and these are perfect.  The best time to go is before 5:00pm on Tuesday (?) when they have $1 oysters...otherwise be prepared to wait for quite awhile.  The space is intimate.  My friend's who I met there a few weeks ago had the lobster rolls and gave it two thumbs up.  I was already stuffed with oysters and white wine...perfect combination.  YUM!  Service is excellent too.
author: Ann G.

description: Now, before you say, "I've already been to Woodhouse over near Church Street," you need to shut your pie hole and come to the newish Pac Heights locale. While indeed owned by the same family, they offer delicious variants on their respective menus ... and are openly competitive with one another for top honors (which only benefits all patrons). Standouts here include the Manhattan Clam Chowder and a BBQ-fusion concoction called 'FRIBS.' That's right -- fish ribs -- fashioned to look like a mammal dish, and even served with cornbread. A-ma-ZING!
author: Gregor G.

description: Love the cioppino and the stuffed artichoke.  They were superb! I would definitely go back.
author: Rhosel D.

description:
Went here with my friends on Saturday night because the wait was waaaay shorter than Fresca down the street. This place had a very cozy feel and service was friendly and attentive. 

What we ordered:
 - 1/2 dozen oysters: Great!!! Huge fresh oysters with good fresh horseradish
 - Calamari: Very tasty and good portion size
 - Fish & Chips (3): Huge, wonderfully breaded and fried pieces of Alaskan Cod. Great tartar sauce. The show stopper were the PERFECTLY MADE FRIES!!! There is only 1 other restaurant that makes them this way and it is in Wisconsin =) BEST FRIES EVER!!! (now i'm hungry)
 - Shrimp: Huge shrimp. I downgraded from 5 stars because they didn't take the poo out of the shrimp (huge pet peeve of mine)
 - Something encrusted halibut: Looked great. On top of home-made ravioli. 
 - Sourdough Bread Pudding: Very good size. Amazing texture and flavor. 
 - Espresso Pot de Creme: Very espresso-ey. Woke me right up. 
 - Blueberry Crumble: Didn't even get a chance to have this since my friend stopped talking and inhaled it. I think it was good. 

Overall, I really enjoyed my meal at Woodhouse. Cozy atmosphere, friendly service, great food. Couldn't ask for more. I'll be going back for those freaking amazing fries!
author: Matt K.

description: I proposed to my girlfriend here at Woodhouse today, she said NO, but damn the fish tacos were G O O D, u should try it!  The tacos that is...
author: Jeff L.

description: Just so good all around.  From the do-it yourself lemonade to the service we got (I believe from Shelly?  Sorry if I got the name wrong) it was a great dining experience.  The garlic bread is a must have and the fish and chips are freshly battered and fried so that its cripsy but also slightly flaky unlike something you can tell was breaded before and just fried up.  Also had a taste of the lobster sandwich/roll which was also great.  Very fresh tasting and not overly seasoned.  Great sea food all around.
author: Johnson H.

description:
This place exceeded all my expectations. I went with Jenny and Justin (not that you know them, dear reader, but you should). We split the calamari, which was fine (though the chiplotle sauce was awesome), and garlic bread, which was disappointing. 

Jenny got the lobster roll, which was quite good; Justin got the fish and chips, which were awesome; and I got the crabcakes, which were really amazingly awesome - hands-down the best I've had in the city, and definitely the best I've had in a while. Strongly recommended.

Oh, and our friendly waitress recommended the very good Scrimshaw beer, which we all enjoyed.

The garlic bread keeps this from being an automatic five-star (I'm waging an admittedly idiosyncratic war against review inflation), because it suggests inconsistency. I'll definitely be back, however, and anticipate adjusting the rating upwards.
author: Josh O.

description:
Wow wow wow.  Randomly swung by for lunch and cioppino looked mighty tasty.  It was cold, rainy and just plain nasty outside, so it looked like a homey place to land.  Upon arriving, I was stoked to see the place decked out with an East Coast feel.  Being that my wife and I are both from the East Coast, it appealed to us even more.

We ordered the chowder, lobster roll, crab cakes and cioppino and it was awesome.  Even my 13 month old son liked the chowder, but hell, he's like Mikey and pretty much eats anything.  Cioppino was hands down, the best I've ever had.  No overly spiced, tons of flavor, not too tomatoey and with a little bit of kick.

I'll be back and will comotose myselff on more cioppino.  Well done!
author: Andy S.

description: Basically, I like this place, yet, their fish and chips are a perfect example of REALLY BAD - crispy on the outside, but, you bite into raw batter.  I use their fish and chips in my class when teaching batter frying to show my students how NOT to batter fry fish - then I teach them the way to do it right.
author: Alan F.

description: Woodhouse is known for their lobster roll and I can see why. It's absolutely delicious in all aspects. The thick buttery crunchy Texas toast is split and stuffed with juicy lobster. Definitely something to try but at $28 a pop, it'll put a dimple in that wallet. Fish and chips are the best bang for your buck 3 large strips of perfectly fried cod on a bed of crunchy fries. Kick that back with a beer and you'll be greased up well for about $15. $1 oysters on Tuesdays is more of a headliner given the oysters are the size of clams. Nonetheless, it is still freshly shucked and  goes well as an appetizer. Solid seafood without the unnecessary extravagance.
author: Ed L.

description: We love seafood and try to get out to dinner at least a few of times a week, one is always seafood.  We decided to look for someplace that had lobster rolls on the menu and came up with this one.  Seemed like a good idea.  Honestly, I can say once was enough.  It was OK, but I know of better places were I can have a better culinary experience.  Waitress very knowledgeable. Must have had 4 different interesting specials. Looked great but wanted to stick with the standard menu.  For appetizers we ordered the New England clam chowder and crab cakes (it's an entree but you can get it as an appetizer).  The chowder was very potato cheese almost a fatty taste to it.  I didn't taste clam and very few actual clams in it.  The crab cakes on the other hand had a little more flavor, even though also a little starchy and dry.  For the main course we ordered the lobster roll and fish & chips. The lobster roll was just OK.  I honestly have had much better.  If I was in the Fillmore and REALLY wanted a lobster roll then I would probably show up there but, again, I would go to other venues.  The fish and chips were good.  The fish batter was like funnel cake batter which was very good.  I would say that was the best dish honestly. We attempted to stay with staples since that is pretty easy way to gauge the restaurant.  That being said I have to hope some of the other dishes were better as other people seemed to be very pleased with their meals.  I might try it again and go for something different but my experience wasn't good enough to warrant a second visit any time soon.    .
author: Sarah O.

description:
So another day, and another foodie adventure. My friend said she felt like oysters so we start heading over to Woodhouse since I've been dying to try another Lobster Roll after the orgasmic experience of it at Sam's Chowder House. Not wanting to constantly drive all the way down to Halfmoon Bay from SF, and hearing good things about the Lobster Roll here, and the fact that it's a stone's throw away in SF, this was a must try for me.

It's located on Fillmore, maybe a few blocks from Geary, and it's on those blocks where it's packed with different kinds of stores and businesses so it can be easy to miss. If you're going during a time where the meters are enforced tho... ughh what a hassle. One hour max and quarters only give you a few minutes. I had to go out 3 times during our meal just to keep feeding the meter! Decor was nice with nifty pictures and decorations on the walls. The place itself is not that big though and you might feel crowded when sitting at the tables if the place is packed.

Lucky for us we went during a weekday, maybe around 2-ish and the place was almost empty. Which is good because we overheard them telling someone that they don't take reservations. Server mentions their off-menu specials and what's this? $1 oysters? Seems we lucked out coming on Tuesday which is when they have that special. We also ordered a bowl of chowder, calamari, onion rings and of course my Lobster Roll.

It would have been nice if they gave us some kind of bread or something to munch on while we wait. Wouldn't be much of a deal except it took a while to get our oysters which came out first, and I know Sam's Chowder House was always on top of it with the pre-meal bread the couple times I went there. Keep in mind there was only one other couple in the restaurant at the time. Oysters were ok, but damn were they small. Guess I can't complain since they're the $1 dollar variety, but still... 

Finally after another meter feeding, I come back to see everything on the table which was good since I was starving at that point. Alright, the Lobster roll. They actually have 2 prices on there... 18/26. I asked the server what the difference was? At 26 bucks... that better be ONE MINDBLOWINGLY DAMN GOOD SANDWICH. Like seriously, that's a steak dinner right there, a whole crab, etc. Not to mention the Lobster roll from Sam's is just 20 bucks. He explains to me that it's simply a matter of size. I go for the lesser variety and upon seeing it, I'm admittedly slightly disappointed. It's smaller than the one at Sam's and definitely less Lobster meat. They also have more celery chunks in there which almost make the sandwich have a more salad-y feel. Still good, but not OH-MY-GOD-THIS-LOBSTER-ROLL-IS-MAKING-LOVE-TO-MY-MOUTH kind of good at Sam's, whose sandwich was basically stuffed with big generous chunks of Lobster. The bread was of a different variety. Some sort of toasted buttered bread which almost reminded me of a cheese sandwich melt kind of bread. Sam's is more of a traditional roll. It did however, come with french fries which I prefer over the lays-variety potato chips that Sam's included with their roll both times I went. Fries were good... and if I didn't know better I could have sworn they were McDonald's fries... except slightly crispier. Not a bad thing, since I do love me some McDonald fries.

Onto the side dishes, the onion rings were very good. Some of the best I've had, big, crunchy and the onion doesn't pull out in its entirety leaving an empty breaded husk like other onion rings I've had. You get a basket of them... but even though I liked them... have to question the value of a small basket of $6 onion rings. We had also ordered the fried Calamari, which I have mixed feelings about. I'm of the belief that you'd have to fail pretty hard to do Fried Calamari wrong, but it takes a bit of... something to do it extraordinarily well. Unfortunately in this case, it wasn't the latter. It was only ok. The pieces were a bit on the small size, and so much so that some pieces I wasn't even sure if there was a piece of calamari lost in the breading... The fried breading itself was crumbly too, and felt too soft. It was literally falling apart at times. 

My friend had ordered the chowder and while she liked it, I was annoyed that it was served almost in a plate. We had ordered a bowl of chowder and while I wasn't expecting a bread bowl or a giant cereal bowl... well you know what I mean. 


We also ordered some sort of bread pudding for dessert and it was pretty good, a bit similar to french toast. Again good, but not great. And that pretty sums the experience here for us. Not as good as Sam's Chowder House which I was hoping it'd be as good as, and value-wise not quite there, but it is in the city...
author: Peter W.

description: As a professional chef I'm a brat. I almost hate eating out and my friends or dates hate going with me because unfortunately I critique everything while I'm eating. If I can do it better or the creativity is lacking I will most likely never return. Nor do I usually take pictures for future reference. Well at Woodhouse I had the Sauteed Skate with a parsnip puree mashed and wilted spinach. I was almost in tears as I enjoyed the dish I had in front of me for lunch. Couldn't be much better then having a fantastic lunch in San Francisco. I certainly suggest this place on yelp. Shit Ive been talking about it the last couple of days to any of my friends who had not been there. I will return and I will try something off the specials list again. Either that or one by one I will certainly try every item on the menu.
author: Pat W.

description: Excellent food. We ordered mussels fish and chips chopino and crab melt. They were all flavorful. Our server is wonderful helpful and accommodating. We will definitely return.
author: Rose O.

description: We feasted at the Market Street location with some out of town guests and we all really enjoyed the fresh seafood. We didn't want to pay out to nose for fresh seafood so we ended up here, thanks to Yelp, of course! The mussels are to DIE for. Sometimes you can get mussels that are fishy and chewy, these were melt in your mouth and the broth and crusty bead was ohhh so tasty. The service was also very good, attentive and accommodating to our large group. Free garlic bread didn't hurt either :-) We had crab cakes and the cioppino, both fresh and flavorful. The only thing about this place is that it is TINY and not very good for large groups but the fresh sea food for the price is hard to beat!
author: Jaimie B.

description: My favorite is their clam dish w/ garlic-- absolutely tender & delicious! Fish and chips-- fish was crispy, tender & big, however, a little greasy! Clam chowder-- decent; I love that they also have a mixture of New England chowder topped w/ Manhattan chowder. Cute place to hang out w/ friends.
author: linh d.

description: Being from MA I am so pleased to now have a place with real fried clams.   With bellies.  So happy
author: Mary M.

description: This place use to be great until the owner show up in the picture! The food is also not so great on sundays, mondays and thursdays I am guessing that the chef is not around! My scallops today where totally undercooked, the cauliflower was also burnt not caramelized. In regards to the owner  he  has decided that 9$, for 2 cents worth of pasta, 1 cent worth of spinach, 25 cents worth of cherry tomatoes , 1 $ worth of black cod and 50 cents  worth of labour was no longer worth serving my toddler - to quote him "I  don't make enough money out of that dish!" - FROM NOW ON WE WILL NOT BE SERVING THIS!  I guess that Woodhouse Fish Company supports child obesity in America. Their children menu is composed of a fatty grilled cheese and a pasta dish loaded with greasy butter and parmesan cheese. The owner ruined my evening and  that is why I am giving them a 2 star review.
author: Elizabete Maria T.

description: The fries are good, the oysters are good (can't be $1 oysters on Tuesday), and the service is great. Only thing I didn't like that seems to get great reviews is the lobster roll - it was drowned in mayo so I couldn't finish eating it.
author: Jenny K.

description:
Everything was delicious from start to finish.

A dozen Kumamoto oysters - very fresh 
Prawn Cocktail - 4 huge prawns
Fish Tacos - added a dash of tabasco, yummy
Whole Dungeness Crab steamed in Garlic Butter - small but very sweet and tasty
Lobster Roll with Fries - TO DIE FOR!
Chocolate Pudding - definitely a far cry from JELL-O pudding!

Things that I must try next time, Soft Shell Crab BLT (if available), Clam Chowder, and Crab Melt.

If you can only order one thing on the menu, let it be the lobster roll!  It was delicious *licking fingers*
author: Julie W.

description:
If you're craving some seafood, but not sure what exactly you want, or where to go, you should check out this place.

The oysters were delicious and fresh. I also had steamed clams, which were good but were nothing special. The lobster roll has chunks of lobster meat in it, and it comes with good fries. I also recommend the clam chowder.
author: Kelly G.

description: Cool little spot on the awesome Filmore Street. Fresh, high quality seafood. The Lobster roll was really good. Was craving seafood and it hit the spot.
author: Jonny J.

description: Very good clam roll! Service a little slower than I'd like. But overall good experience. Quaint and cool fisherman vibe.
author: Casey C.

description: Entree and specials are very well thought off, the presentation of the dishes are superb with colors splashing all over, good height and the flavors are unbelivably delicous. The restraunt is small and it could get tight at times, the prices could be a little on the expensive side. They also served two kinds of oyster one is local and one from the east coast. both great  and fresh
author: Jude J.

description: I only go to get the Fish Tacos and I think they are winners! I haven't eaten anything else there though....I guess I need to branch out.
author: lisa b.

description:
UPDATE 2: My husband and I had the pleasure of going back to Woodhouse. We shared the calamari, yum, then we each got the dinner specials...one was a Halibut with potatoes and veggies, the other a penne with shrimp, bacon, peas and more. Hats off to the chef!

We really enjoyed our evening there and will go back. We're actually looking forward to checking out Oyster night with some friends soon.

Thanks Dyan! Cheers!!!
author: jennifer c.

description:
So I think they're a little on the pricey side, but I like them anyway. =) I generally get a cup of the clam chowder, Hartford style. I just like a bit of each kind on my spoon. No mixing. Followed up by the fish and chips. I really love their fries. And the batter on the fish is flakily crisp, never soggy. I also really like their crab melt. Yum!

That being said, I've had a couple negative experiences here. They won't stop me from coming here, but they're perhaps worth mentioning. I'd advise against going when they first open for the day. I went before around that time and the chowder was cold. Not lukewarm, but cold. Everyone was sending their chowder back. They were very apologetic - their service is always excellent, but the chowder should never have been served in the first place. I think it's because they were still getting setting up and getting situated. Most other restaurants start prepping before they open, but I'm thinking that perhaps they don't. And one time, the size of the fish in my fish and chips was half of what they normally would've been. They looked like fish sticks. =( Perhaps they were running low on fish? In any case, I was wishing that I had chosen to order something else that day.

I like the concept of the do-it-yourself lemonade, but for me to really mix it the way I want, I'd need either a bigger glass or less ice and more of the sugar water vs. regular water. That being said, I like the lemonade more than the do-it-yourself palmer. I like my tea to be stronger.
author: Tammy L.

description: This is a charming place away from the water front in Pacific Heights. Though small on the square footage, Woodman's scores huge on charm. Decor is great in keeping with that whole ocean, nautical theme but not overdoing it. The framed flatscreen with B-roll of ocean and fishing footage was the best. To say nothing of the decor the food was worth the trip. Fantastic chowder, great halibut and fish & chips. SOURDOUGH BREAD PUDDING! Are you kidding me. We waddled out of there, but it was worth it! Oh and the wait staff was fantastic.
author: Chris M.

description: I came here with a party of 5 for a friends birthday. The wait was kinda long but it's understandable because the place was small, plus it was a Saturday night. Our server was super friendly and so adorable. We started off with the oysters and the mussels, both yummy. For the entrees we shared everything, family style. We ordered 2 lemon butter crabs, the cioppini, the crabcakes, and the crab melt roll. Everything was very tasty but my favorite was the Cioppini..yummm. I would definitely come back here again. Made my tummy happy.
author: Van N.

description: The place felt authentic, but it was so fishy and greasy.  It sort of made we want to go back to being a vegetarian.
author: Camiel B.

description: Definitely make sure you try the Hartfood clam chowder - it was outstanding! Service was impeccable and it is a fun atmosphere. Recommend highly!
author: Laura G.

description:
i don't know about you, but i love scaring small children. with that said, we came here because the octopus decoration, with its tentacles branching out to the exterior from within was enough to send my 2 year old octo-phobic niece into a clawing/ climbing/ whiny fit in my arms. what can i say? i'm a big fan of immersion.

and it's been awhile, but i agree with phoebe p. regarding the lobster roll-- totally overseasoned for my liking.  words cannot convey my disappointment. but for the price, you can be damn sure i ate it all. shiiiet. :) the fries were spectacular, and the arnold palmer i ordered was perfect because it came with a separate serving of lemonade and simple syrup to add to the iced tea, so it was all DIY and fabulous.

the SO ordered the 1/2 dungeness crab and she was mmm-ahhing during lulls in her thorough dissection-extraction method. she also had clam chowder, which is better than most in the bay area. 

maddy was enthralled by the flat screen tv's slideshow and ate various bites of clam chowder, oyster crackers, fries, and strawberry shortcake. i guess the dessert was good, because she forgot all about the octopus trauma. :)
author: Vanessa D.

description: Wow.  This is an amazing restaurant.  The food was delicious.  I highly recommend the stuffed artichokes.  The artichokes are grilled with some kind of parsley-garlic spread, and they were the most flavorful artichokes I've ever had.  The service was spot-on, the drinks were tasty, and the atmosphere is cozy and welcoming.  I was impressed.
author: Ruth Ann M.

description: I don't ask for much, just give me high quality, good tasting food, and a decent atmosphere, and I usually forgive getting ripped off when the bill arrives. Not here; the food is a disappointing second thought to how over priced this place is. Have we lost touch with reality? $11 for a small plate of rubberized calamari!? And did I mention the haze of kitchen fumes that delightfully irritates the nose and throat? Give me a flippin' break.
author: Kathleen K.

description: I ordered lobster rolls $26 each for pick up on a Thursday night.  The place was still full at 9:40pm (closes at 10pm) when i walked in.  A couple that was waiting at the door just got seated despite the time... so i guess business is good.  The host was very nice and courteous.  The 15mins wait time for pick up was pretty spot on.  It was thoughtful of them to leave one edge of the takeout box open to let the french fries breath.  The aroma was irresistible!  Finally I sat down and bit into the lobster roll.  Delicious!  The meat was fresh and the lumps of leg meat were all in tact and really juicy.  I drizzled a little bit of Sriracha sauce on it which gave it a little more heat and dimension.  The bread was also nicely toasted with a slightly chewy texture which was perfect for the lobster salad in it because it held the moisture very well. It only took me 2 minutes to finish it....
author: Adele W.

description: Had dinner at Woodhouse on Fillmore for the 3rd or 4th time last night.  Every ... single ... bite ... was delicious.  Went simple, with the bay shrimp & avocado roll with slaw and fries on the side.  Arnold Palmer to drink, from fresh tea and fresh lemons.  I've never tried their more serious food but I love the fish tacos, love the fries, love the friendly service.
author: Cindi L.

description: THE BEST CLAM CHOWDER I've ever had! Seriously! It seems like they're always busy and by the yelping reviewers, you can see why! The fries look delicious but haven't had a chance to try them. I'm a pomme frites fan so, I shall try them sometime soon and I can't wait. The service is really nice with prompt service. The wait is usually 15 minutes because they don't seem to have enough seating because they're so popular. The garlic bread was was crunchy but I think that's how they make their garlic bread. Shrug. Not really what I'd prefer though. The garlic butter crab was very good. I hear the oysters here are very good too.
author: Mayana P.

description: My friends live down the street from this place and I have been here twice so far, but I will definitely be going back often.  The first time I went I had 2 oysters and the dungeness crab melt.  The oysters were on the shell and looked fresh from the ocean.  The dungeness crab melt was exceptional and full of flavor.  Their sandwiches come with fries and cole slaw, which are good but nothing special.  However, I give this place 5 stars because of their above average service, and the LOBSTER ROLL.  The lobster roll might be the best lunch I've ever had, as you may see from the many other reviews here.  There are so many other things on the menu I really want to try, so I can't wait to go back to the city and indulge in some delicious seafood.
author: Mike W.

description: Decent but not extraordinary chowder. Delicious garlic bread. Delicious sea bream with fingerlings and a mediterranean vegetable saute. The fish and chips looked good. Friendly service, but the kitchen was slow. Overpriced, but not more so than I'd expect in this location.
author: David K.

description:
Hey woah, this place was pretty GD delicious.  I was a little put off at first by the fishy smell when you walk in, the prices on the menu, and the fact that since I've only recently become a fish eater, there was a lot stuff that I'm still not quite down with eating (mollusks, I'm looking at you).
They have really reasonably priced wines by the glass, which I really appreciated.  The mains might be a little spencier than I had anticipated, but are on par with most SF restaurants and portions were huge.  
I had the special - a Hawaiian ono with a soy glaze and some baby bok choy and risotto cake.  I tried to be good and ignore the risotto cake, but I caved.  It was delicious.  The pickled onion garnish was a perfect complement too.
I also got a chance to try the pecan crusted halibut with maple thyme butter and some tasty gratin potato dish.  
Service was quick and friendly and we walked out pleasantly full but not stuffed.  I will certainly be back.
author: Jennifer D.

description: I feel like I'm in Nantucket when we eat here. Food is fresh and delicious. Love the Louie salad and the belly clams! Neighborhood favorite- must try For seafood.
author: Samantha H.

description: You know how for the past 7 years whenever someone would visit SF and ask you for a great seafood restaurant recommendation, and you would mumble something about Pacific Cafe hoping they wouldn't be willing to drive that far and test your reco?  Well, fear no more.  Woodhouse is great, consistent, and affordable.  Finally SF has a seafood place that isn't pretentious, doesn't require sitting outside, and is not in fishermans wharf.  The only reason I'm giving 4 stars rather than 5 is that they don't take reservations - I'm game for walk-ins, but not on weekends.
author: Lane K.

description: Cute and cozy, very clean and super fresh, what more can you ask for?  Came here a few weeks ago for the lobster rolls, very expensive, about $26 for each lobster roll, but well worth the price.  Definitely will return to try other items on the menu.
author: B J.

description: Was disappointed today when we went for lunch. The lobster roll had too much mayo in it. Was more like lobster salad, not bad but def not worth the price they charge. We ordered the 1/2 crab special and it was about 1/4 crab at best. 2 legs were ok. 2 were so small you couldnt eat them. No body...otysters were ok but not great..although its not oyster season so cant complain too much.  All in all pretty good but definatly not as good as it used to be. Portions are way to small and quality has dropped off quite a bit. Its a shame, used to be one of my fav places
author: Steve B.

description: The food was tasty but portions are small.  I advise over ordering here.  You can definitely hold an appetizer in addition to your main course and even dessert.   My son had the crab melt which he felt was too oniony.  I liked it.  I had the lobster roll and was still hungry.  Husband had a salmon special and he could have used a bigger portion too.  There's a cool cupcake store a few blocks up if you don't care for their dessert options.
author: Sara K.

description: If you don't like fish, then stay away from this place, I'm sure you would feel like I do when i go to a steakhouse.  Got the fish and chips, and the stuffed artichoke, which was stuffed with shrimp and crab.  The fried fish was a bit greasier than i like, but still good.  The stuffed artichokes were great.  Not a big fan of crab generally, but the shrimp was very good, the bread was great, and suprisingly so was the salad.  It was arranged kinda weird though, a little difficult to eat, but i perservered.
author: Phil J.

description: Cute, good food, good service.  The portions are not huge, and the quality could be a bit better.
author: Rebecca W.

description: Great restaurant!  Had the fresh Salmon, crab cakes, wedge salad and a couple Kumamoto oysters in there last Friday evening.  No reservations so you have to wait for a table.  No problem and the wait was worth it.  Great cold Scrimshaw draft too.
author: Hawk M.

description:
What a find! I'd heard of Woodhouse's sister restaurant on Market Street but never had the chance to visit. I stopped by the Fillmore Street location this weekend and I'm glad I did. 

When I first walked in it reminded me of several little places in New England I had been to before. Intimate restaurants with a few tables and counter seating. The only thing missing was a view of the water, which you can see "virtually" on a plasma screen on the wall. A nice touch. 

As for the food, I had the Steamed Crab and my friend had the Lobster Roll. The crab was cooked perfectly and I was surprised by the large portion, especially for the price. I tried the lobster roll which was also quite a meal. The plentiful lobster was falling out of the roll and seasoned perfectly. And I agree with the last review, the fries are great! We accompanied both of our meals with a couple of pints of Anchor Steam and left Woodhouse extremely happy. 

Kudos Woodhouse, now I'll have to make the trip to your Market Street location...
author: Cary D.

description:
OMG LOVE THIS PLACE! I personally am a huge seafood person.  My friends and I tried to get as much as we could here, we pretty much wanted to try everything!  And everything we got was AWESOME!
We got the oysters and fried calamari to start.  The oysters were fresh and really good.  I would love to go on a Tuesday when they have $1 oysters, it's normally $2 an oyster.  So worth it.
The calamari was good too, perfectly fried and yummy.  We then got the baja fish tacos, lobster roll, crabcakes, and my personal choice, half dungeness crab. 
The fish tacos were amazing, so crispy and amazing.  Totally made us want to try the fish and chips, which will be a must on our next visit.
The lobster roll was good, kinda like tuna salad but lobster salad with no a lot of mayo which was good.  It was nice and refreshing tasting. Loads of lobster which is always a plus.
The crabcakes were good, I'm not a huge fan of crabcakes but these were good.  I liked the salad that came with it too, but I love any salad that comes with vinaigrette dressing.
Lastly was the half dungeness crab, first off I love the fact that you can get a half instead of a whole.  It's cheaper and it feeds one perfectly!  I'm a huge dungeness crab lover and I will pretty much want it if they have it on the menu yet not everyone does, so being able to get a half order just enough for myself is heaven.  I got it with the white wine, butter, and lemon, oh man so good.  Buttery, but not too buttery.  Smelled so good and tasted so good.  I was so eager at eating it, it flew out of my hands a couple of times.  I apologize to my friend next to me who got some of the butter sauce on her pants.  
I also got an iced tea which was very refreshing and they also have a do-it-yourself arnold palmer.  My friend got it and it was really good.  I liked the concept.  

Overall, LOVE LOVE LOVE this place and will definitely be going back each time I visit SF.  Man I might even move up there just to be closer to this place! haahaa
author: Yvonne W.

description: This place was OK.  very popular place so we tried to get here early to try and beat the rush.  Seems like a lot of people do that... luckily we got a table pretty quickly.  It's nice inside.  Tight quarters... fish-house feel... very clean and well run.... I was expecting the food to be fabulous.  It was pretty good, but not fabulous.  The calamari was breaded nicely, but the calamari itself was quite chewy..... the two sauces it came with (cocktail and some creamy aoli) were perfectly tasty.  I got the lobster roll with fries.  The fries were perfect...crisp and thin.... the lobster roll was very good... ton of lobster meat, perfectly toasted bun/bread... but I feel like it could have used a little more flavor.  Maybe a tad more butter or some salt or some kind of seasoning.  I'm not that sophisticated when it comes to seafood, I  don't know what makes a real good lobster roll, and it could be that that was the perfect one with just a few simple ingredients that really lets the lobster shine, so I feel like that's how it was meant to come out.  Either way, I wolfed it down and enjoyed it.  Server was friendly and fantastic.  Price was pretty standard.  I'd come back here any chance I get and try some other stuff b/c it's stuff I don't eat all that often!
author: Easter E.

description:
fun and casual place to get your seafood fix.

avoid the tables near the front especially if there is a crowd of people waiting and standing over you - one table is propped next to the host which is a wee odd.

giant plastic sea creatures are mounted to the wall along with a framed moving picture.

they have a couple of oyster options.  served the american way - no mignonette in sight.

the clam chowder was tasty - choc' full of clam bits and potato.  the cup is small so go for the three ladle sized bowl if you are hungry.

the crab was ok - the white wine sauce overpowered the crab taste a little but that is because i'm a purist.  i like clean and simple food preparations unless you roast it like crustacean does...yum.  
moving on...

the stuffed grilled artichoke was split in two.  half was stuffed with bay shrimp and the other with crab.  quite hearty enough for an entree - you'll find yourself rolling out of there by the end of the night.

so i have to confess that we came back a few nights later.  yes, i am a seafood junkie.  

the crab louie salad was fresh and delicious!
it's a light iceberg lettuce with egg and tomato and topped with fresh crab and a creamy dressing similar to thousand island.

but the show stopper was the lobster roll.  chunks of seasoned lobster claw stuffed into a buttery and lightly toasted bun was just heavenly.  so much so that i'm already planning my next visit to order it again!

if you are lucky to get nolan as your server - the firecracker from philly, he talks food and wine like nobody's business.
author: Anh V.

description:
came here for a late dinner with my boyfriend. even though this place was semi packed, service didn't fail. the decor was very nice and my boyfriend was just fascinated by the decor of how nice it is. 

 we ordered steamed shellfish in clams, fish and chips, and black mussels & chorizo. food came out fresh and good. nom nom nom!!
author: Valerie N.

description: I took my parents here slightly before the rush on a Thursday night and we were seated quickly by the window.  There was a wide range of selections considering it was a relatively small menu.  The stuffed artichoke was halved and served with crab and shrimp.  The crab cakes were moist and just the right flavor and consistency.  The au gratin was delicious as well.  A nice solid restaurant boasting fresh ingredients and incredible flavor.
author: Krista C.

description: The overall experience wasn't that good. The waiter was attentive...the food was less than average. PLEASE lay off the salt on the fries!! WOW..I love salt, but this was way overboard. The fish...I have had better. Too pricy for what you get.
author: R H.

description: I ordered a bowl of New England Clam Chowder and a Lobster Roll Sandwich.  The bowl of clam chowder was so small, I swear it was a cup, and it was $8!  The lobster roll was okay, but it was $18!  So the food was pretty decent, but I don't think I'll be going back because I felt like I got ripped off.
author: H. L.

description:
Stumbled across this place on our way to Japantown and stopped in for a quick lunch.  The service was lacking- 2 girls on duty & only one of them had any skill (sense?)  I hate it when you have to ask them every single time for a refill or napkins or the check....I mean, the place wasn't even half full.  While we were there we saw 2 people walk out after waiting for a full 5 minutes without anyone approaching their table once.  But, since this was my first time here, I am willing to accept it may have been just an off day for the servers.
Besides that, the food was quite good. I had the large sized lobster roll ($26?) which came with fries and coleslaw.  It was delicious !  Not too much mayo, and the bread was nice and toasty with butter :)  I've been to Maine and think this was up there with the quality.  A little pricey, but there are much cheaper options on the menu that looked equally tasty.  I just happen to have a thing for lobster...
Cute little place & very casual.  I will try them again and hope for better service!
author: Autumn C.

description: I used to live in the east coast and would make regular treks to Maine for fresh seafood, particularly lobster rolls. This place is the closest thing to reliving that experience. Now that I live in SF, it's a deal to pay $20 for a fresh tasting lobster roll than to fly across the country.
author: Liz H.

description: $1 Oysters on Tuesdays!!  Love the Hartford clam chowder and wedge salad...I am amazed at how great that salad is.
author: Lisa S.

description: Woodhouse Fish Company was exactly what we were looking for: a small, casua, and local San Francisco restaurant serving fresh food with reasonable prices. We ordered some oysters, half of a dungeoness crab, and fish and chips.  The restaurant was crowded, but we had to wait for only about 10 mins. The food was decent, excellent service, friendly neighborhood vibe, and reasonable prices. The food was decent, but not impressive, perhaps we didn't order the right stuff. If we were in the area again, we would come back to try something new.
author: Ling Ling Z.

description: If I had to describe this place in two words I would say fresh and delicious!!! The atmosphere is open, bright and clean. The service is great! The food is surprisingly even better! I ordered the fish tacos and I would highly recommend them to any seafood lover! My boyfriend ordered the fish and chips although when he tasted my fish tacos he wished he had ordered his own. The fish tacos are the bomb!!! This place was an all around winner! The one fall back is that it was pretty busy and the wait was about 20 minutes while it was raining out side. Definitely a place worth checking out!
author: Holly P.

description: I went there for the first time after hearing about it from my friend.   We went there for dinner around 6pm on New Years Day.  They were busy but we got seated right away.  Our waiter was great, courteous, and knowledgeable.  She made the dining experience better.  I ordered a grilled mahi mahi which came with some rice, pineapple, and veggies.   The fish was cooked well but it was incredibly bland along with the veggies.  I doused my food with hot pepper sauce to enhance the taste.    All in all my food was incredibly tasteless.  I would have like to have the fish and veggies seasoned, marinaded, or something.  Nice ambiance though with lots of young kids with parents.
author: Saj B.

description: Ahhhh I feel bad about this review. I'm a chef so I'm pretty much on the side of the establishment. But...Ok.here I go. I think the place is very unique. The wait staff are really nice (the few that are there) One main waitperson???? for about ten tables? I don't get that. One waitperson helping deliver plates. I thought the fish from the fish and chips was great. The chips...nothing to speak of. Had a crab/shrimp louie.  Sorry. I'm from San Francisco and this was a poor excuse for a louie. Much better to go to Swans on Polk. Don't know if it had anything to do with it...but got home and got sick.  OK..this could happen in your own home...but I had to pay for it. . Sorry guys!!!!
author: Linda A.

description: Had dinner here tonight before heading to the movies. We had  a great server (mostly because he laughed at my jokes) and the food was great. Go for the Fish Tacos or Louise Salad!
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
mega lobster roll w/ fries and cole slaw: $26
