-salty, salty, salty, salty! i dont know if the chef was having an off day, but everything was SUPER salty! i didnt taste the natural sweetness of the lobster, at all. three stars because we did get a lot of lobster in our sandwich.
-served in a nicely buttered and toasted roll, but sadly, ive had better at old port lobster house!
-fries were perfectly crisp on the outside! complimented the roll very nicely.

crab louie salad: $15
-large portions, lots of crab. dressing wasnt too overpowering. again, crab was salty!

pretty pricey, about $64 with tax and tip (FOR ONE). wouldnt come here again for the lobster roll, maybe to try their crab melt. i would probably stick to old port in redwood city for my lobster rolls from now on.
author: Lucas N.

description:
I feel like I've just stepped into a rich relative's east coast summer house- the wooden floors, the pretty white trim, the huge, hi definition TV posing as a (moving) picture in a golden frame & toy tugboats lined up on a ledge. Only, I don't have rich relatives (in the east coast or anywhere) & this isn't a summer house, it's a seafood restaurant in the heart of the Fillmore. It is very well lit, thanks to all the windows & feels very open, with a clear view of the kitchen as soon as you walk in. I give two thumbs up to their variety of seating choices: at the bar if you're on a quick lunch break, at a table for two on a romantic date, high up on bar-like stools & tables for a group of friends or against the comfy looking bench if you are dining solo.

Service- polite, but a little slow bringing out our dishes, despite there not being a huge lunch rush.

Prices- a little high, even for a seafood spot & definitely for a lunch spot. $49 (without tip) felt way too steep.

Food- maybe it was what we ordered, but the BFF & I were less than thrilled. We shared the artichoke with bay shrimp & lobster, which was awesomely fresh & plentiful (This was the dish we liked best.)
- The BFF had half a dungeness crab & observed that you get very little meat for the price you pay & that the buttery sauce is not at all buttery, but in fact, watery. 
- I had the petrale sole. The fish itself was fine, but it seemed there was all that "brown butter" for nothing; i couldn't taste a buttery-ness. If I'm going to eat that many calories, I want to at least KNOW it. The spinach was ok but the mashed potatoes really ruined my dish- it was whipped smooth, leaving ZERO texture to the dish & was smeared everywhere. Every bite of sole or spinach had mashed potatoes (which had no flavor & a texture I disliked) running through it. I think a suggestion for them would be to put it on the side instead of underneath the fish.

I am going to come in once more to try their lobster roll because the table behind us had it & it looked delicious. I'm willing to give them another try, but if they fail at the lobster roll, I won't be returning.
author: Fancypants X.

description: Good service. Cute decoration.  I'm from the northeast so I've been spoiled with seafood.  So....I find this place just ok. Lobster roll was pretty good but I've had better. Food isn't the best but not bad.
author: Bayarea K.

description: Good food, fair pricing. Choose the fish and chips, fish tacos, crab cakes. No bad choices.
author: Eric M.

description:
Maybe 3.5

Showed up for dinner at 8 and got amazing parking (I'm assuming it was a fluke because I usually have a horrible time in this area). My friend and I were seated immediately.
I really wanted to try the lobster roll but was not hungry enough for it and settled upon the crab cakes, while my friend picked out the fish and chips. The service was well timed, though they never refilled my water which was frustrating as I was really thirsty.
On to the food, it was good or maybe a little better than good. The batter on the fish and chips was tasty and crunchy and fish was light and flaky. My crab cakes were pretty good too. Nothing extra ordinary. They had green onions in them which surprised me every time I took a bite, I'm not sure if it was good kind of surprise. 
The food was well priced and maybe next time I'll get alittle more adventurous with my ordering and go for the spring roll or a daily special. The halibut in parchment sounded tasty.
author: prachi v.

description: I decided to write a review after my third visit.  Overall, I have been happy with the food and atmosphere, but I've been dying to try it out on $1 oyster night.  I'd come to expect good things here but was  disappointed with the $1 oysters.  I guess you get what you pay for... some had pieces of shell in them, others had a mucky white film on them.  The service is great and fast and atmosphere is great as well.  Bottom line - steer clear of the $1 oysters and go for the standard fare.
author: Nico B.

description: Woodhouse, you are slipping.  Favorite place to go, especially on Tuesday.  Had Fish Taco, ugh...Deep fried and all batter, where is the fish?  Loved the place when first opened, went often, which will now be seldom.
author: John B.

description:
Amazing amazing amazing night here. 

When we got to the restaurant, the hostess informed us that there was an issue in the kitchen and the restaurant was a little backed up. Thus we'd have to wait about 30 minutes. Since it was a Sat night and it was 7pm, the 30 min wait seemed perfectly reasonable. While we were waiting the manager came over explaining the situation and apologizing once again for the wait. 

I really appreciate this kind of honesty. It was clear that the restaurant is committed to delivering a great dining experience to its patrons. 

We were seated pretty soon after and the food was delicious. I had a really hard time choosing from the menu because it ALL sounded really good. Eventually I settled on the soft shell crab BLT sandwich and simply put it's as good as it sounds.  

Can't wait to come back and try the fish and chips!
author: A K.

description:
Delicious!

Seriously good fish and chips.  The breading is perfect.  Not too thick, and tempura crispy!  The lobster rolls are also delicious, as are the crab rolls.  Love that bread they bring from the East Coast.

Some folks here complain about the prices, but heck, your eating seafood in Pac Hghts, not a Baja street corner.  (That's good too)
author: Moz R.

description:
I have had several meals there and they were all perfect. Let me tell you by subject why I love Woodhouse.
1. Convenience--Open from 11:30 on allowing me to have a late lunch or early dinner if I want. 
2. Amazing food--My first meal was a half crab. I ordered a potato gratin as a side, but the crab was plenty on its own.  It was succulent, flavorful and fun to eat.  I had never cracked a crab on my own before but it was easy.  The next time I brought my husband.  he had the crab, which was plenty for him too.  I had a fish special of the night, a well prepared tasty sea bass. On my third visit I had the lobster roll. Oh my! I've tried lobster many times and it never did anything for me.  I'm a crab person, I guess.  But this roll was amazing! Huge whole pieces of lobster in a lemon aioli, not too much sauce, just the right amount to make it moist and well-flavored. M husband had the fried clams appetizer as his entree.  There were plenty and he loved them. Everything was well-prepared, fresh with attention to detail.
3 Service.  The service was wonderful and efficient, no matter how busy they were.  I went in alone and was treated as well as if my husband as with me. We do not order booze and we were still treated with care.  This is unusual in the city.
I highly recommend Woohouse Fish Company.  Try it!
author: renee j.

description:
Delicious!! I would definitely recommend this restaurant.
We came at 6:30 on a Wednesday and there was no wait. The three of us ordered oysters, cippino, lobster roll and crab cakes. Everything was delicious. One star off for my cippino - it was a tiny bit too salty and there was only one scallop and hardly any white fish - otherwise great. The garlic bread was amazing, too. Ambiance is very simple.
author: W D.

description: yuuuuuuum! London has NOTHING on the fish and chips here! The fish is cooked in an beer batter which tastes even better than panko bread crumbs. I think it's an Anchor Steam batter. The fries are like a refined McDonald's fry. Not too thick, not too thin. It's $9.50 well spent.
author: Venessa M.

description: Ate here recently for the first time and had a good time.  A very casual atmosphere and fun surroundings.  Had the stuffed artichoke, which was tasty, but a bit greasy for my liking.  Overall, a nice place to go for a casual, decent tasting meal.  With all of the great restaurants in the city though, not sure if I will return here.
author: Carolyn D.

description: The Fish and Chips are amazing. And you must try the lemonade as well! The way they present/prepare the lemonade is very unique. I love it!
author: Caroline C.

description: Walked in with a friend and was seated immediately at the counter.  The waitress did a nice job of describing the specials and we were off!   Ordered a few small plates (oysters, Fish Tacos and garlic bread) and enjoyed wine and a beer.  The oysters were fantastic, Fish Tacos couldn't have been better and the garlic bread was just plain naughty good.  I've been told the line can get crazy long here but we didn't  have that experience at 7:30p on a Wednesday evening.  Absolute must place for a casual meal with an ambiance that says welcome and stay a while!   I highly recommend the Woodhouse Fish Company.  I can't wait to go back and try some of the other dishes that have got so much attention in the other reviews.  Great find!!!!
author: Kelly K.

description: Fish and Chips were declicous.  Fish tacos were also delicious.  Price for portion size, not so good.  Was there before dinner rush (about 4ish) and service was less than desirable.
author: Michael R.

description: Parking is a bitch but that won't stop us.  Ahi  tuna tartar was good but I have had much better.  Very nice house salad.  Dining companion had salmon which was good.  He did not care for the clam chowder as the broth did not taste especially clammy.  I feel like we need to go back and try a few more dishes.
author: Bleep S.

description: I was in Pac Heights and looking for a place to eat dinner with my dad and brother.  This place was recommended by my brother's friend and was it fantastic!  I had the grilled stuffed artichoke, my brother had the fish tacos, and my dad had the special of sturgeon and they were all delicious!  I'll totally go back and I see on yelp there is one in the Castro too!  High five for this place!
author: Jessica C.

description: Love it, went for the first time about a month ago. Welcoming staff, wonderful food, super cute ambiance. The clams were really great. I could eat everything though we enjoyed everything we ordered. As mentioned by a few other yelpers, the prices are a bit high, but in my opinion worth it!
author: Julie K.

description:
Holy Mary mother of god my children behave here!   Do you hear me???  I mean really hear me?  This is huge.  We come to this restaurant and for some unknown reason I am able to enjoy a glass (okay who am I kidding) three glasses of wine and my clam chowder while they scarf up pasta with parm, fish and chips and reposition their vegetables like it's their job.  I don't know what it is about this place:  Energy vortex, carbon monoxide, higher power- but whatever it is we go to this place A LOT, because while I may have been a foodie in another life, I now am thrilled to get through a full meal.
The food here is alright.  Nothing fancy, nothing bad, nothing super memorable (though the clam chowder is tasty).  Oh and they have this supercool television that shows videos of the sea in a picture frame- very Harry Potteresque.  I could stare at that thing for hours.  Or at least until the first whine, spilled drink, scream...etc. and we quickly bustle out the kids and prepare for life as usual.
author: Cort T.

description:
Fresh Simple Seafood

New England Clam Chowder - ok
Mussels and Fries - yum
Lobster Roll - made my night
Bread Pudding - perfect! not to sweet.
author: Stacey S.

description:
I love lobster... I would eat it all the time if I had more money!! But once in a while, it's nice to treat yourself to some expensive foods.. Having said that, I shared the large lobster roll w/ my husband (Which was enough for two if you aren't starving).  They have two sizes, a small for 18 and a large for 26, but the only difference is that the larger one has more lobster in it.  It was delicious.  The lobster roll consisted of a buttery toasted bread bursting w/ tons of lobster.  Every bite was absolutely flavorful and succulent.    

The lobster roll also comes with fries and coleslaw, both of which are a very tasty and fitting complement.  The prices aren't too bad for some of the other sandwiches. It was just the lobster roll that was a little steep.  I would give this place a five stars if the lobster was served warm & if it was bigger.

Check out bunny's experience w/ the lobster roll here:
http://fishandbunny.tumblr.com/post/794699459/last-night-i-went-to-woodhouse-fish-company-and
author: Freya B.

description: Really great food.  The chowder is good, as are the fish and chips.  The lobster sandwich is yummy and they always have good stuff on their specials menu.  The staff is also really nice and friendly.
author: Priti M.

description:
I generally try not to write negative reviews after just one visit to a newly opened restaurant, but I must make an exception here. Super excited about having a casual seafood restaurant open in our neighborhood, we came in with an hour and 45 minutes to spare before a movie we already had tickets to at the Kabuki. We figured that was more than enough time to grab a quick dinner. Tables were turning when we got there so we didn't have much of a wait. Unfortunately, after ordering our food, we ended up waiting and waiting, all the while, witnessing the tables that were seated way after us getting their food before ours. I eventually had to tell our server that we had a movie to get to. When our entrees were finally brought out, B's halibut was mixed up with our next-door-diners' petrale sole (this couple had been seated, oh, about an hour and 15 minutes after us).  The chef came out to apologize for the mix-up to the diners next to us, but left us with nothing but 15 minutes to suck down our entrees before we ran off to the theatre. That lack of apology, dear readers, was the most disappointing part of the whole experience.

That being said, we are still excited to have this restaurant in our 'hood because I like the atmosphere, the food was delicious, and the service, in general, was good. I would chalk this up to breaking my rule of never dining at a new restaurant until they've been opened for at least 6 months, but no one else seemed to have any problems with service. And I *liked* our server. I just wish he followed up more, like checking to see if we wanted another beer, or explain why our food was taking forever, or even telling the chef that we'd been inconvenienced by the entree mix-up as well. Honestly, if we didn't have somewhere to be, we would probably have taken this in stride, but this experience was too damn annoying to not share. Hopefully our next visit will be a better one.
author: Lisa C.

description:
I almost don't want to write a review about this place, because it might be harder for me to get a table! 

The food is simple and straightforward. But every ingredient and every item is perfected down to the garnishes. The Maine lobster roll is real fresh main lobster, perfectly dressed to showcase. Fresh and perfectly cooked lobster. This was so good I wanted to slow down and savor every bite. The Cioppino was huge had lobsters, clams, muscles, all in an incredible Italian sausage tomato sauce. Appetizer portions are huge and very well made. The mussels and fries were perfectly opened and had plenty of liquid underneath to be soaked up with bread(this stuff is the ambrosia of the gods people!)

The only thing that knocked off that last star was they ran out of  clam chowder. They rushed to heat more, but they didn't saltn it or finish heating it up, and the bowl portion was maybe 6Oz of soup.

I look forward to going back over and over again and giving them that last star.
author: Max M.

description: Delicious!  The wine selection is limited, but they have some very good choices.  We had the fish and chips.  The portion was a good size and the fish was perfectly cooked.  We also had the lobster roll, the lobster was delicious, but the portion was on the small side.  On Tuesdays they have $1 oysters, great value and very fresh/tasty.  The restaurant has great decor, I felt like I was in a restaurant in a fishing town.
author: Marisol H.

description: Love this place! It just opened up in our neighborhood, and my fiance and I are quickly becoming huge fans - we love the seafood, the service, the atmosphere and the OYSTERS! YUM. Great oyster happy hour on Tuesdays from 4-10pm (a window I can work with!) and the clam chowder is amazing. This is coming from a local Bay Arean with a penchant for seafood! Also, the make it yourself Arnold Palmer - awesome! We'll definitely be making this a regular in our rounds of the neighborhood restaurants!
author: Katie D.

description:
Just stopped in tonight for a late dinner.  My friends and I arrived around 8:30 and were seated w/in 15 minutes (which was w/in the estimated 30 minute wait time that the host projected) and I have nothing but praise for the service, location and food.  

Located in the Fillmore St. shopping district, there is a casual, yet stylish crowd wondering around.  The location doesn't take reservations (first come, first serve) and parking is a bit difficult to find, but it is definitely worth the effort.  There is a very small waiting area, so if you come during a BUSY time, be prepared to wait OUTDOORS.  

The menu is broken up into Salads/Soups/Apps and main courses.  I chose to have ALL appetizers tonight.  I started off with a cup of the New England style clam chowder, which was solid.  The clam pieces are visible, the cream not too heavy for the stomach. The cup is a small cup, but it is a nice way to start a meal.  The 1/2 dozen oysters can be mixed and matched.  Tonight they carried 3 varieties and I had them do a 2X2X2 combo for me.  They were fresh and tasty.  Not the best oysters that I had, but decent for the price point.  For my main course, I just had the FRIED calimari, which was DELICIOUS.  The cocktail sauce provided was tart and tangy and the aioli sauce had a hint of smokiness that paired well with the crispy calimari rings.  The STRAWBERRY SHORTCAKE dessert was absolutely amazing.  Fresh strawberry with syrup, handmade whipped cream and a warm shortcake biscuit was literally "to die for".  LOVED IT.  Plus, the LEMONADE was like a science experiment for me.  They brought out a glass with ice, fresh squeezed lemon juice and soda water and sugar SYRUP to mix to my particular taste.  SO MUCH FUN.

My total came out to be approximately $35.00 (incl. tax sans tip).  I can't wait to go there again.  Next time, I want the FISH AND CHIPS.  Plus they have a list of daily specials that sound great.  Even a land-lover like me can deal with the seafood that they serve!!!!
author: Hiromi N.

description: Food is good, price is right. Management was suitably apologetic when there was a problem with my entree. They are really trying to please their customers and we are very happy to have this restaurant in our neighborhood.
author: Erica J.

description: Came here with my brother on a beautiful and warm Monday so we were not here for their $1 oysters. We weren't craving oysters. What we wanted was their crab sandwich and lobster roll! And you bet your @$$ that's what we got. Both of the sandwiches comes in a small or large size. It's the same sized bun and everything but just double the meat. We ordered large for both. He is a big lobster fan so of course ordering the lobster roll was his choice and I, being the crab lover, chose the crab sandwich. We ordered both to be split in half to share. Funny though, when we were finished, my brother told me that he preferred the crab sandwich and I actually preferred the lobster roll instead. They both come with french fries and plenty of it. The sandwiches get pretty pricey but it was worth every penny. I believe it was $17 for the small and $26 for the large. Definitely worth going for the large. Brother also had a beer (forgot which one exactly) and I had a glass of the house white. Great meal and with great friendly servers. You bet I'm coming back!
author: Elaine L.

description: Their crab sandwich is the best I've ever had.  The clam chowder is delicious and the lobster roll is another favorite. There's usually about a 20 min wait to get in and they don't take reservations but it's definitely worth the wait.
author: Kristen H.

description:
i love this restaurant. though there is usually a wait, it is typically short and well worth it. you can't go wrong with any of their entrees. my favorites are the ciopinno and the grilled artichoke with shrimp and crab meat.
the staff here is super nice, and i have never been disappointed. their prices are very reasonable, too, with entrees ranging from $12-$18.  a couple can go out and have  appetizers, entrees and drinks for less than $100. without apps, the meal is never more than $30 per person. 
i highly recommend this place, if you're in the mood for some seafood.
author: kim g.

description: This place is unreal.  Some of the best, freshest seafood I've ever had.  Lobster roll is out of this world!!
author: Christie S.

description: This place is money -- especially for lunch.  I think the ambiance is even better than the one on Market (with the silly nautical hd video playing in the picture frame, etc.) -- same great menu.  You can't go wrong with their chowder or their make-it-yourself arnold palmer.
author: Tim G.

description: Went for a late lunch on Wed and had the best fish and chips in town, calamari was excellent with a side of spinach  What was a little disappointing was the crab melt too much like a salad spread. I prefer crab and melted cheese on toasted roll or bun no filler needed.. That means I will definitely go back and order any thing else but crab melt and I would be happy. I cant say enough about the fish and chips very very good.
author: William S.

description:
i came here for dinner last night w/ my friend before catching a film at the kabuki.  we weren't meeting until 8, but since i was in the area, and this place does not take reservations, i went in and put our names down around 7:15.  they will take your # and call you when a table is ready.  good thing i went early, b/c we weren't seated until 8 anyway!  if you are in a large group, be prepared to wait, but if you have a party of 2, it's not too hard to get a table.

i had wanted to get the lobster roll to compare w/ the one i got at old port lobster shack a few days prior.  however, after looking around, i decided to get the cioppino instead.  my friend got the crab cakes, and both were delicious.  they are not skimpy w/ the seafood here.  my cioppino was a huge bowl of mussels, clams and dungeness crab.  usually places would never have crab in cioppino, but this cioppino had 4 big pcs.  i need to come back and try the lobster roll next time!  the fish and chips looked great as well.

there are a few wines by the glass on the menu, and all of them are about $6 or $7 a glass, which is super reasonable.
author: Helen T.

description: I"ve yet to have a bad meal at Woodhouse. I've eaten there twice now. I ate a half cracked dungeneous crab, cooked in white wine and garlic. Delicious. I opened up with half a dozen bluepoint oysters. They were good although for some reason not as tasty as the first time I ordered them. Then I ordered a grilled octopus salad. It too was tasty. Washed it all with some pale ale. Yum. Staff were friendly. Wait didn't seem too long, but everything was made to order. Be patient and you will be rewarded.
author: Lord G.

description: Nolan!  That is the funny waiters name!!  Request him if you can!!  This place would be 5 stars if all of the servers were Nolans!!
author: blair k.

description:
I have been to Woodhouse twice this week. 
I had a wonderful lunch. I ordered the salmon and it was cooked to perfection. My friends had the crab salad, which was just okay. Another had the fish and chips and again just okay. 
I went back tonight to try the lobster roll that everyone is talking about. 
Well, I have to say, forget about it. Yes, it is served in a great bun, with cole slaw and fries, but the lobster had no taste. You get big chunks of it and honestly I thought it might be me, so I had two other people taste it and we all agreed that this is something that the restaurant should pay some attention to. There are other items that the restaurant does well. Any of the fish dishes coming out of the kitchen looked great.  The oysters are a slam dunk. The staff is friendly and very attentive, just don't have the lobster roll.
author: Sari S.

description: Viewed the menu while at the Fillmore Jazz Festival and vowed I would come back to the neighborhood soon to patron this restaurant.  A few days later got a craving for good seafood and decided to take a walk over, glad I did.  Went around 2PM on a Tuesday and they had a pretty decent crowd.  Had the lemonade, which they give you glass of Lemon juice and a side glass of simple syrup and soda water - fancy.  Had the whole belly clams appetizer and was in heaven.  Definelty would go back to try some of their other items.
author: Mayying W.

description: I just had fish tacos for lunch today. It was absolutely delicious. The fish was fresh and crispy. General portion and reasonable price. The service is pretty good.
author: Foomin U.

description:
Okay.  I admit.  Woodhouse does get a 5 star rating for a few things.  Lobster roll with coleslaw.  Wow.  Decadent, homey, light, and buttery all at the same time.  
Their other 5 star rating is for the ability to wholeheartedly buy in on a theme.  Mini-scaled sail boats line the crown moulding, a gilt framed flat screen plays scenes from aboard, sea faring maps line the walls, a playful mock Picasso of a fish hangs by the bar, and even the crew dons facial hair reminiscent of fish stick sailerman logos.  

Why only 3 stars then?

I dock them 1 star for the inedible crab cakes I had last visit.  Bleh.  

I dock them another star for the last visit.  Again, the waitress was sweet and pretty.... But didn't quite hit the service I was expecting.  I do give her an a+ for brewing me a new pot of coffee, but when I took my first much needed sip, I was let down by the bitter burnt taste that bit back at me.  I think they need to change their coffee brand.  I asked my waitress to make some suggestions giving her my feedback from previous visits and she suggested the tacos while admitting at the same time that she had never tasted two of the items on the menu!  Now, there is no excuse for that.  With a small menu, each employee should have at least tasted each item!  Thennnn I got my coffee.  1 min later I got my Hartford clam chowder.  1 min after that I got my tacos.  WTF.  I have to say that I do hate it when you feel like you have to rush through your appetizer so your entree doesn't get cold.  Whatever.  Finished all the food I wanted and sat waiting for her to notice I would like it togo.  She didn't.  Another cardinal rule about serving.  People sitting alone generally don't need time after a meal to do some catching up.  Then I get my change and I look down.  Presumptuous.  I love it when thy give you dividends of change that require you to drastically stiff them or reward them on tip.  It always makes me feel cheap to ask for more change to tip the appropriate 20%.
author: Shannon S.

description: This neighborhood really needed a place like the Woodhouse Fish Co. It is casual, the nautical atmosphere is clean and quite pleasant (great lighting, and the colossal squid over the doorway is really awesome as you munch on your perfectly fried calamari), and the prices are most appropriate. You get hardy portions of your favorite crab shack specialties, and the waitstaff just might be more pleasant to be around than the people you're out to eat with. The atmosphere along with the food is, well...one must wonder if they have captured some "wicked" Atlantic fishmonger to work his magic in the back. Love it. (oh, and by the way, best clam chowder I've ever had...seriously.)
author: Kristen v.

description: I feel like i had the wool pulled over my eyes with this one. i've been to new england. you can't simple put a roadside hoagie/lobster roll/grinders whatever you want to call it on a plate and call it fine dining and then charge me $16. The food wasn't gross but it definately wasn't good. the best thing about this place was the sign out front.
author: Stephanie C.

description: I had a great Ipswitch fried clam sandwich,  I definitely recommend this restaurant as a lunch or dinner location,  its upscale causal and beautiful inside.
author: Doug D.

description:
great place to get good seafood at affordable prices and with casual atmosphere.

the clam chowder is off the hook. very chunky. they usually have a few specials and they are usually unique dishes. for example, one time they had a grilled octopus salad that came with purple potatoes. 

they usually have 2 different types of oysters on the menu, i usually get one of each to try every time i go. always good quality. they have $1 oyster on tuesdays, but i've yet to go (im assuming its super packed on tuesdays). 

 the place can get crowded. they have some bar seating and you can eat there. very friendly servers/bartenders.
author: Yevi A.

description: My new favorite fish spot.  Great food - Maine lobster roll is as good as I've had in Maine!!  Best fish and chips, fresh fish and crisp, not a hint of soggy yet soft and flaky fish. Attentive and cheery service, love the ambiance and the window table.  We'll be back!
author: Ruth R.

description: What a wonderful addition! LOVED the lobster roll, clam chowder and fish&chips. It's super cute and a great location for a light lunch/mid-afternoon meal.
author: Adrienne C.

description: Sourdough bread pudding. I would fly down there just to eat this again. Considering my strong opposition to all things sourdough related, I was more than a little skeptical about this dessert, but I figured that I had to eat at least one sourdough thing while in San Francisco. I generally like bread pudding, so this seemed like a good compromise. Though it's thought to be a fairly easy dessert to make, bread pudding can also go very wrong. Too chewy, too gooey, too bland...I've tried (and made) quite a few less than satisfactory ones. This bread pudding surpassed all of my expectations. Everything about it was amazing...not too sweet, very flavorful (probably due to some combination of sugar and sourdough) perfectly moist and surrounded by a delicious housemade caramel sauce. I'm looking at tickets to San Francisco as I write this. Before dessert we did actually have dinner...crab cakes, fish tacos and scallops. All were excellent, if a bit smaller than what we were expecting for the price. Obviously very fresh and well prepared. My crab cakes had big chunks of crab throughout as opposed to being fishy-flavored breadcrumb balls that some places try to pass off as crab cakes. Scallops were also delicious, but two medium sized scallops hardly a dinner make. The wait at this busy spot was long...but I would wait around all day just have to have some more of that bread pudding.
author: Martha M.

description: 2.5 stars, really. Three for food, two for service. I get that this place is trying to channel a New England seafood shack. The food is fine (it's San Francisco after all) but for the prices I frankly expected something more than a very basic interpretation of New England seafood shack food. And while the portions for appetizers were ample, main course portions were not. In addition, the service was rushed and poor: I got attitude from our waitress for asking for a minor change on my lobster roll. With so many other great restaurants in San Francisco, we won't be coming back here.
author: Jessica S.

description: This is the go-to neighborhood restaurant for my husband and I. It is delicious and accommodates whatever mood you are in, whether you want a light seafood dinner, or a hearty lobster roll and fries!
author: Elizabeth K.

description: At least the service was really good.  However the food has taken a turn and not for the better.  I haven't been here in a year or so, i really liked it in prior visits, but went last night and the food seems to be off.  I ordered the crab melt and was shocked at how tiny it is now, when they first opened this was an entire sandwich now it's half a sandwich.  Ok, so i figured they would make up for it with the amount of fries....they use to give a huge portion of fries, well...NOT anymore. Was really surprised about the small amount on my plate. And the melt just didn't taste that great.  Once this was a satisfying meal, now i was left hungry.  Good thing my friend ordered the fish tacos...well, after having one of the tacos, i was really disappointed. Only tasted oil and no other flavors.  Definitely would not order the fish tacos again.  The staff was great, but don't think i'll be back any time soon for the food.
author: Dilly M.

description:
Definitely not good for groups of 8 or more.

Had a party of 10 people come by this place for early dinner on a Saturday afternoon. Place wasn't packed yet and I thought it'd be easy to push tables together or add some extra chairs here and there....but that was a no go here.

Minor problem I thought, however, the staff was not helpful at all in devising a strategy that would put my friends in close proximity together. The staff didn't bother to offer any suggestions, just stood there and shot down any idea that came from my friends.

We ended up breaking apart to 3 separate tables. Not a huge biggie in the end, but it would have been helpful if the staff proposed that idea in the beginning.

The food was ok, and I'll give them 2 star for the lobster roll (deserves more stars for the food, but good food is overshadowed by poor service).

tl;dr:
Pro: lobster roll
Con: horrible for groups of 8 or more; staff; slow service
author: Danny N.

description: This place is the bomb! Small hole in the wall with great service. Oyster were very fresh and tasty. Fish in chips were delightful. Crab cocktail was very fresh and the fried calamari was also very good. Very reasonably priced will definetly return. The lobster roll was also very good. There was 4 of us so we ordered a bunch and shared!!!! Can't edit to go back...
author: Carlos E.

description: Amazing artichoke, AMAZING lobster roll. Service is good, its a nice clean place and its decorated very oceany.
author: Cristina M.

description:
Since my initial review, I've been here 6 times, each time the lobster roll, which is fantastic. But, yesterday, my first gigantic dissapointment, which has to do with more management/admin matters.  

After a tough gym workout, I was looking forward to getting a lobster roll to go.  It was 9pm and I called to place an order, as they are speed dialed into my cell phone.   (I had planned my daytime eating around this decadent lobster roll and even timed my gym workout to make it to Woodhouse before their 10pm closing, so that they wouldn't be out of lobster.  Plus I worked out extra hard to pre-burn off those Woodhouse fries). BUT the phone just kept ringing and ringing.  I thought, maybe they are busy with takeout orders.  Then I got to the place (still on my cell phone, ringing Woodhouse) and discover that the place is CLOSED!!!  It was 9PM!! They are supposed to be open, 7 days a week!  The phone message didn't indicate that they were closed.  I suddenly understood what  was going through Chevy Chase's mind when he got to Wollyworld, found out it was closed and punched the moose.  Argh!!
 
Woodhouse management: please be open when you say you're going to be open.  I trekked here for no reason!
author: Caroline I.

description:
We went to this place on a Monday night and it was easy to get a table.   Maybe that's because the food was okay, not great.  I had an eggplant dish with prawns and scallops and, although reasonably tasty, the dish was way too greasy.  So greasy, in fact, that I didn't finish it.  

The Viognier I had was served in a beaker, not a wine glass, but even if it had been served in a decent glass it wouldn't have tasted any good.  I didn't finish the wine either!  

The waitress was really friendly, however, and that is definitely worth a star to take this from 2 to 3 stars in my book...
author: Fs A.

description: Great seafood. A lot of shellfish right now, but we'll see how the menu changes when they start opening for dinner. I really like that they have added some good seafood to Fillmore.
author: Scott F.

description:
Came here for dinner last Friday night, and it was great!  We did have to put our name down and wait for a table, but they were happy to take a mobile number and call us when our table was ready (we ended up having a bottle of wine at the wine bar down the street).

We started with the some oysters, which were fresh and very tasty.  We also had some of the fresh off the cob corn, which was good. Between the four of us we ordered:
1) The lobster roll- which was very good.
2) Halibut en papilote which was perfectly seasoned, and cooked very well.  The sauce (from the fish, veggies, butter, and wine) was excellent.
3) Sole, which was very good, not sure about the setup (with mashed potato) but it was still very good.
4) I had the excellent  cioppino- spicy, and packed full of various different seafood.  The broth was well flavoured and delicious.  Well worth it.

We had a bottle of J Pinot Gris, and a couple extra glasses by the glass.  All in all was around $150 for all four.  Well worth it, and completely delicious.  I will definitely check this place out again.

P.S our server was awesome, not sure if we should really name people's names on a public forum, but lets just say he shares the same name as a famous Texas baseball pitcher.  He was informative, knowledgeable, and very attentive.
author: Danian P.

description: Clam chowder wasn't great, but just about everything else on the menu made my mouth water with potential deliciousness. The crab cakes were amazing. Cannot wait to go back to try to the lobster roll.
author: Heidi K.

description: Good food. The artichoke was great. Not too expensive and way less touristy than many other places in the city
author: Daniel C.

description: The dungeoness crab roll and the scallops were absolutely amazing. They were the best scallosp that I have had in awhile. The oysters were average, I'd skip them and try them somewhere else. But really, check out the crab roll- a lot of meat for the price and the butternut squash puree on the scallops was to die for.  Four stars, because the wait was a bit long after ordering, probably about 25-30 minutes. However, I'd go back in a heartbeat.
author: Glaciala A.

description: Woodhouse is simply the best seafood in SF. I for one cannot live without the Lobster roll with fries. I recommend highly.
author: Nathan T.

description:
Went there last night with kids & another family. Service was great, atmostphere good, and food was somewhere between good and excellent.

Cioppino - fantastic
Lobster roll - very good
fish tacos - very good

Only thing that keeps me from 5 stars was price - it's not cheap, though I think it's worth the money. Look forward to our next visit :-)
author: Carl B.

description: Love the food, but be warned that it's a small place, so you'll probably wait for a table during busy times, and the kitchen can be a bit slow. I'm particularly fond of the cioppino, but everything I've had there has been good.
author: D V.

description: I'm giving this five stars but for now it's just for the lobster roll and the great service I received.  I haven't tried anything else on their menu yet.  I went well after the lunch hour so there were few patrons dining at the time.  I ordered the lobster roll and it was every bit as good as I expected.  My roll was absolutely stuffed with chunky lobster goodness.  For comparison, I've enjoyed lobsters rolls at various restaurants from Maine to Boston.  I think WFC's version can stand up to any that I've tried there and even surpass some.  I'm also a big fan of the lobster rolls at Sam's Chowder House which seemed a bit more buttery.  WFC's is slightly different, perhaps slightly sweeter, but it's every bit as good.  Service was excellent and the waitress even took the time to chat with me a bit about the restaurant and other items on the menu.  I'm looking forward to trying this place during peak hours and sampling more items on their menu.
author: G W.

description:
Had lunch with my wife and a friend on Mother's day.  Had their shrimp and pea risotto which turned out very nice.  It had a little too much lemon, but that did not overpower the seafood.

The clam chowder was excellent.  The clams and potatoes and ham went well together and it was not overly salty.

Seating is limited so come early.
author: Adrian K.

description:
Very casual, very good (at least the fish and chips were). Just a word of warning the 2 Piece fish plus chips is a big lunch. I ordered a 3 piece and couldn't finish it even though I was starving before hand.
Interesting side note: This is the very first restaurant where they poured a little lemonade (likely fresh squeezed, with no sugar) and gave me the rest of the ingredients to make 'my own' Arnold Palmer. I thought that was a nice touch.
author: Craig M.

description: Woodhouse rocks the fish taco. I've never been a fan of breaded fish in fish tacos but the light flaky crust on the fresh cod is amazing. Everything else is great so far. We had a crispy soft shell crab salad that was to die for, my dad had a Halibut sandwich, also TDF. To top it off, their french fries are perfect, what more can you ask for?
author: Christina A.

description: This is the second time I've been to Woodhouse and I LIKE it!  It's solid all around - the food is grub, the service is attentive (and that means a lot coming from a former server!) and I like the casual dining atmosphere.  I've tried the lobster roll, the oysters and the fish and chips.  All very delicious, all fresh (though the lobster roll was not what I expected; there's a unique twist on their sandwiches).  I also appreciate that the servings aren't enormous and the staff is more than willing to give you useful advice.
author: Kerry P.

description:
Tried their lobster roll, definitely can't compare it to the great Neptune's lobster roll in boston!! i was quite disappointed.. the sauce on the lobster was unappealing (mayonaise i guess?).. tried the crab melt too.. it was normal.. nothing special about these 2..

however.. their sauteed summer corn side was nice..
author: Cherish S.

description: Been to both locations. Great fresh seafood. Fav is the shrimp and avacado roll. For some reason i think shimp and avoc are the ultimate combo and you get plenty with their homemade mayo. Nice on the budget too. but all their dishes are great, love the make your own lemonade.
author: A L.

description: Awesome spot on Fillmore. can get pretty crowded so be prepared for a wait. The staff were great and knew the menu very well.We had fantastic calamari, artichoke, halibut ,and fish and chips. all fab.
author: Carrie A.

description:
The two brothers behind Woodhouse Fish Co. on Market Street, Dylan and Rowan MacNiven, have opened a second location in Pacific Heights.  Just Tuesday, these Peninsula natives opened their doors for lunch, and what a welcome addition they are to the neighborhood.  Located on Fillmore Street near Pine, this seafood haven is more spacious and offers a more evolved menu than its sibling.  It's a bright, comfortable, simple yet well-decorated spot executed with the help of Jamis MacNiven, their dad.  Jamis owns Buck's in Woodside and has built restaurants like the Hard Rock Cafe which used to be on VanNess Street.  When you go in, check out the big fish overhead and the framed flat screen featuring a boating and fishing video.  Rowan and Dylan, whose middle name is Woodhouse, were friendly hosts who were rolling up their sleeves alongside their employees, greeting, seating, serving customers and answering phones.  Gotta love that.                      
                                        
Chef Jon Hearnsberger, formerly of Anchor Oyster Bar, turns out some seriously satisfying grub.  My parents and I had a great meal there yesterday.  The cup of clam chowder was very flavorful, creamy, and filled with clams.  It wasn't as piping hot as it could have been, but the recipe is a winner.  The crab cakes were pleasingly light and crispy on the outside,  filled with crab and had a nice crunch from chopped celery and green onion.  Two crab cakes come with salad greens, tomatoes and beets in a light vinaigrette.  The crispy calamari was equally impressive.  Again, it had a perfectly light and crisp coating that wasn't greasy or heavy, and the squid was incredibly tender.  The Ipswich clam roll and lobster roll were both piled high on a hearty toasted bun and came with thin-cut fries and slaw.  Hearnsberger uses local and sustainable ingredients wherever possible so you can feel good about indulging.
                           
Look at their chalkboard for daily fish specials. Yesterday, they featured health-conscious dishes such as halibut prepared in parchment light on the oil, as well as grilled salmon with asparagus. They don't have their wine and beer license just yet, but for now, you can order a make-your-own lemonade to wash down all that tasty goodness.

I can't wait to go back with my husband and kids and try everything else on their menu!  They will be open for dinner service soon, once they get that liquor license.  And they're not taking reservations right now, so feel free to walk right in.   For now, their lot of two-tops and four-tops and 10 stools at the bar are enough, but once word gets out that they're open for business, I can imagine lines out the door.
author: Dina B.

description: We were lucky yesterday that we just walked in at lunchtime and was able to get a table right away.  I had the swordfish (well it is still Lent) and Gussie had the Fish & Chips.  We thoroughly enjoyed the meal.  It was my second time there and glad I came back.  If you're in the Fillmore area, you definitely should try it.
author: Mark L.

description: Decided to dine here at the last minute on a Sunday evening.  The services was slow, and then we were told they had "missed" our order. It's a pretty small place, so I'm surprised the waitstaff didn't "team up" and look out for each others' orders!  Two other tables received their meals before we did.  The flavor of the fish for the fish~n~chips was good, but the fries were cold and soggy.  My honey's calamari was overdone.  I was looking forward to a nice simple meal, but this place didn't even meet that expectation.
author: Frankie G.

description: It's the next day and I still can't stop thinking about that lobster roll!  SOOOO good!  We got there around 7 and didn't have to wait at all, we were seated right away.  The staff were all really nice.  Calamari was good, stuffed artichoke was amazing, and the lobster roll was absolutely fantastic!  If you like good  seafood, good prices and a cozy atmosphere you should definately come here!
author: Jacquelyn M.

description:
This place gets a big zero on everything from service, food, preparation, and lastly value as well.  Two of us decided to have dinner there and  walked in for a table. The gentleman at the door asked our name, by the time we gave it we sat he walked over and asked again as he did not seem to pay attention the first time. This by itself is no real big deal, and I do not fault this to be honest but it does set a tone of carelessness. Lets skip to food. I ordered clam chowder and fish and chips, and my date ordered a wedge salad with "may-tag blue" and a side of garlic sauteed veggies. My soup landed first and was cold. I told the waitress and she immediately took it back. I assumed that it would come back out quickly but for whatever reason it came out 10 min later just as the food came out as well. At first appearance it all looked good. I began to eat the fish and chips and within about 4 bites realized that the fish and the chips should have been called "Grease, a little fish and some oily fries" it was terrible.I eventually got ill form the oil and did not eat most of the food. I asked how my dates food was and she shrugged. I tasted the so-called may-tag blue cheese wedge salad, and there was a salad with a creamy dressing but nothing at all that tastes like may-tag blue cheese. In fact it tasted entirely like parmesan. I can not be 100% sure if it was or not but I have eaten my fair share of blue cheese and salads of this type and none but this tasted like parmesan.  So at this point it was just bizarre. I asked how the veggies were and she indicated they were NOT SAUTEED in garlic at all in fact they were boiled, tasted frozen and had no salt and no garlic clove was ever anywhere near these veggies. We called the waitress and told her and she agreed that she can tell it just seemed boiled and that they had not sauteed it ! well at this point i pointed out the fish and oil chips, she mentioned the salad did not taste that good, and to our shock the waitress said "I mean, the fish and chips are like the best thing here" I really don't give a @#$ what is " the best" it was all very bad, including the service and the attitude. She went back and showed the man who forgot our name, who shrugged in a "who cares" kind of way, and came back and gave us the bill and said that she removed the $5 veggies. WELL,  I have some advise for the woodhouse fish company. In the future, I would advise you to care about every customer. If  a customer has a bad meal, come over, apologize, and invite the customer to come back for a entree on you. This will not only save your customer and maybe change they're opinion, either by your gracious attitude , or the better food next time, but mainly it will keep you in business, by keeping a customer from telling  10+ people not to eat there. Well nobody ever said anything about taste, or business sense.. oh well..

UPDATE: CAN YOU BELIEVE NOBODY HAS EVER BOTHERED TO REACH OUT FROM THIS PLACE.. JUST REINFORCES HOW BAD IT IS...
author: oliver g.

description: What a gem! We love it here. Great service - both the host and the servers. Love the setting - fun mix of old and new. Love sitting at the bar, really has that "neighborhood" restaurant feel. We've tried the New England style chowder, the fish and chips, the crab cakes, the stuffed artichoke, and a softshell crab appetizer special. Only thing not a fan of so far is the crab cakes - too much breading/greasy. LOVE the artichoke stuffed with lump crab, what a perfect entree. Also huge fan of the softshell crab, wish it was permanently on the menu! Great Sancerre as well. Combine with the Kabucki movie theater for the perfect date night!!! Highly recommended!!!
author: Sarah R.

description: Been here multiple times.  It is nice to have "New England" style seafood available and I will be back again in the future.  It is not totally authentic but who has time to be a purist - rather live here anyway.  I think your opinion will depend a lot on what you order.  The fried clams are legit (I'm from Maine) but the lobster rolls are all claw meat (not tail meat which is superior - not sure where the tail meat goes).    The dungeness crab (hot, no sauce) is simple but really clean and good ($12 for half a crab).  Service is great - never had an issue.  Some decent wine.  Usually busy, but you can out in your name and have a drinkl nearby.
author: Glenn S.

description:
i did not think they could improve upon the market street WFC but alas, they have.
soooo good!
dollar oysters all day tuesday!
the shrimp / avocado roll is perfect warm weather fare.
author: william m.

description: Bland, tiny sized portions and expensive.  The Mahi Mahi with rice and veggies topped w/ pineapple relish was nothing to write home about.  My husband ate the teeny tiny crab butter sandwich with an even teenier tiny amount of cole slaw and McD's fries. So blah. So sad. So not worth the cash money.
author: Zeena B.

description: My brother and I trekked halfway across the city to come back here again and again on our last visit to SF...great neighborhood...super cute design...not crowed at lunch(never went during dinner)...wasn't expensive...food was fantastic...and I love the make your own Arnold Palmer's...
author: d v.

description: Awesome dungeness crab sandwich! Good service! Reasonable prices! What's not to love?
author: Jay L.

description: Love this place. Their whole roasted fish is always amazing. Lobster Roll = delish. Fresh lemonade is THE BEST in the city. You cant go wrong with  pretty much anything on the menu. The only dish that isn't so great is the crab melt sandwich. They don't take reservations, but we've never waited longer than a 1/2 hour.
author: Melissa B.

description: Excellent fish and chips. Very hospitable, efficient staff. The place was packed with Saturday night diners, but service was fast. Pleasant, very informal atmosphere. My only complaint: They use a bland, California malt vinegar, not one of the tangy English imports. Given $14.00 for 3 pieces of cod, they can afford better.
author: Pam J.

description:
Simply delicious!
The portions were so generous and so scrumptious I needed to take a break on my post lunch short walk. The staff...from the owners to the servers were extremely friendly...going out of their way to make sure everything was going well. I can't wait to go back! By far my new "go to" destination.
author: Evelyn R.

description: Great food. I had the stuffed artichoke and ate everything on the plate. The place was packed even for a Thursday night which was a good indicator of the food (I thought). It did make it a bit loud was the only thing. The food made it worth it.  They also had one of my favorite wines - Bonny Doon's Cigar Volante! Yum!
author: Sheree E.

description: I went with a bunch of fun girls, we ate a ton of 1 dollar oysters, then I inhaled a crab melt (sorta small but still totally filling).  Very accomodating server.  Sort of a long wait, but we just went to Harrys for an hour and fifteen so no big deal.
author: Poppy C.

description: Love it! I've eaten here twice so far.... 1st time with the lobster roll, 2nd time a bowl of NE Clam Chowder. AWESOME both times. The lobster roll had great flavor (not all bread with 2 tiny pieces of lobster like some places), and the clam chowder was really tasty! I was questioning why they don't rock a bread bowl option, but that is just personal preference.
author: Kirsten B.

description: very good fish and chips and although I am not a tartar sauce fan, theirs was pretty tasty... excellent french fries that reminded me a bit of the french fries I use to get at the Texas state fair. Good arnold palmer ice tea where they bring you the brewed tea in a small carafe, the glass of shaved ice and lemon juice and a smaller carafe of simple syrup. We had mussels for an appetizer and they were fair. Small space, cute decor. Decent waitstaff.
author: elliemae r.

description: I had a good fresh dinner. The oysters were good and I really enjoyed the halibut. I sat at the bar and had good service once my waitress found me. I would highly recommend this place, but be forewarned, the menu is limited.
author: Mar E.

description: love it!  we tried the dungeness crab roll and the lobster roll ... the roll was drenched in butter and absolutely delicious!  this place is worth the wait! :)
author: Janice M.

description: Ok I like most things about Woodhouse. The food is East Coast seafood which is tasty and reminds me of Cape Cod. Servings are not large but the quality is good. Four of us sat at the bar on Saturday night at about 9pm. The service was good and the food was as expected. I had the lobster roll and a cup of clam chowder. Both were solid 4.5's. The fries that came with the roll were good and crispy too. So now to the real reason for this review... the beer selection. Three of us there were beer drinkers and I wouldn't even say we are picky beer drinkers. There was nothing we wanted. We would have each drank 3 beers with dinner but instead I had 2, one guy had 1 and didn't finish the 2nd and the 3 guy only had one and didn't like it. So you know, these are the beer choices: On Draft, Scrimshaw, Anchor Steam and Ranger IPA. In a bottle, Amstel Light, Great White. In a can... Trout Slayer. Okay, so there are two of the six that anyone has heard of... Anchor and Amstel. I understand if you want to try to be hipster and have a can of beer on the menu and ever a "nautical themed" draft beer like Scrimshaw. It goes with the fishouse. So, I pay attention to beers and beer prices when I go out. One of my questions to bartenders is "what beer do you sell the most?" and "which do you sell the least?". Amstel is almost always the least sold. Anchor is not much better and is many times the least sold draft beer. So, not only do they have too many "no name" beers but they picked two of the least popular "normal beers". Seriously, they would make a lot more money. Some customers want to try something different but a lot of us like to have the same drink or at least something we know we like. Just add a bud/coors/miller light and a stella/heiniken to the list and you are all set. It really isn't that hard and trust me I am representing the silent majority here. Hope this is read and understood by the nice people at Woodhouse. Cheers!
author: Jim M.

description: The east coast fish shack concept still makes me a bit nostalgic for Cape Cod and I'm happy to have another fun, casual option in the Fillmore hood. The first time, I loved my dinner of cioppino and J Pinot Gris. I returned a couple of days ago and shared the BBQ fish ribs - a cute concept, if a little bizarre, and very enjoyable. The Oyster Po'Boy didn't deliver though. It was way too greasy (aioli + thickly breaded and fried oysters + heavily buttered roll), and the same slaw that came with the fish ribs. Next time I'll try the crab melt.
author: Crissy G.

description: This place is super close to our house, and we always walked by it so we decided to finally try. It was actually pretty good and a cheap place to eat. Had the blue cheese salad wedge witch was big enough to split, then the fish tacos, which are my favorite and a must to try EVERYWHERE they are served. They were pretty good, as well. Extra plus is the super fast service! We sat down right away, ate, and were out the door in like 20 minutes! So if you're in a hurry for a quick bite that's decent, this might be the ticket.
author: Carol B.

description: The dungeness crab melt was delicious.  However, I felt it was a bit small and bready.  The fries were good too.  Overall I recommend the place and will go back.
author: Phong N.

description: Wow! Wanted like snack ordered mussels... Yum..great service...
author: Liz D.

description: The fish is good, but not amazing. IMHO a bit overpriced for what you get. It's also rather noisy. If you want better seafood you are better off at Florio across the street.
author: Steven G.

description: Nice decor and casual ambiance. Good price point and good location on Fillmore.....only knock is that some of our dishes were only just OK. We really liked the bass and the halibut....thought the Manhattan clam chowder was pretty mediocre as was the ahi tuna starter....we'll definitely come back...but the overall food quality prevented the 5th star.
author: Greg A.

description: Decent enough - the dishes were quite uneven and the service was poor.  I had the cioppino and it was pretty good, but not all that memorable.  The food was a little heavy and greasy - it's easy to make seafood tasty when using all that grease and frying oil.  It takes skills to make seafood sing without these things.  No evdience of these skills at Woodhouse.
author: C.M. L.

description:
The wait may be long, but toatlly worth it!  I came in with a party of 5 (girls night out) we ordered a bunch of stuff the yelpers suggested:

1. come on a TUESDAY because it's their $1 oyster special, i think we ordered 30+
2. their fried calamari is FRESH, most places you can only taste the crunch but this this place you can taste the calamari with a light crunch
3. We couldn't decide to choose 1 of their 3 chowders, so we ordered 2, CLAM CHOWDER and MANHATTEN CHOWDER, both are GREAT, the clam chowder tastes better than the pier itself
4. The waitress and waiters are SUPER NICE =)  We were the last ones to leave and she was very nice about it.

I'm most def coming back here one of the following tuesdays =)
author: Linzy T.

description: Great freshest seafood accompanied by fresh veggies. Good prices and big portions. For kids - best in a city 'fish and chips'.
author: Lana B.

description: I had the beer (anchor steam)  battered fish and chips and they were fantastic.  Good, friendly service.  I will be back. I thought the pricing was good.  Quality food and less expensive than a fancy place.  See you there!
author: Pete L.

description: I did a search for lobster rolls in SF and Woodhouse popped up. I didn't want to get my hopes up, but browsed the menu MANY times before going. Not knowing whether I'd be back, my friend and I decided to try a little of everything. We started off with the half dozen oysters. They were fresh, but a couple had some sand in it. We shared a lobster roll and boy was that a big mistake. The golden toasted split top roll with the buttery lobster was fabulous. We wished we each got our own. My friend got the grilled fish of the day, a well seasoned fish with generous portions of vegetables. I ordered the stuffed grilled artichoke. The artichoke was grilled and seasoned, then stuffed with shrimp and crab. It sat on a bed of salad accompanied with two pieces of cheese bread. Wow, was that a big plate of food! We still managed to find room for dessert, vanilla bean panna cotta. It was quite a feast and worth every penny.
author: Adelina W.

description:
This is a great spot for a casual lunch on Fillmore street. The setting is such that I almost felt like I was dining by the sea! 

I came for the lobster roll and, unfortunately, was disappointed that the roll was only composed of lobster claws and legs (no tail). At $26 a roll, I expected some tail! This made a significant different to the texture and bite of the roll and so I suggest not having the lobster roll here if you're looking for a real one. 

Fries and Onion rings are freshly hot and crispy. Steamed vegetable sides are slightly overdone and bland.  

Service is unpredictable. My table was served in a timely manner but the table next to us left since they felt they were waiting a long time before any waiter came to take their order.
author: STEPHANIE L.

description: Went for lunch and had the soft shell crab BLT sandwich and my daughter had the lobster roll.  We also had oysters to start with.  Pretty much everything was yummy, except for the price, there wasn't a whole lot to the crab sandwich.  I would order the lobster roll again.   Got a lot of lobster meat, which you should for $26!!  So if you want to splurge, go for that!!  French fries were really good too...hot and crispy, just the way I like them!!
author: Bellabee L.

description:
It's a wonderful corner restaurant in SF Fillmore area.  Went in at 5:30pm and seated immediately as still pretty early dinner time.

Calamari is definitely fresh but a bit on the small size (the squid itself not the portion) and slightly overcooked (rubbery).
Tried the Scallop special and it was so succulent wishing there were more than 4.  The fruit flavored sauce was very tasty with just the right hint of sweetness.
The crabcaked was simply fresh and delicious.

Will certainly return to try other items as this is a much better place to dine than the superly over priced FishermanWharf.
author: Frank P.

description: Great place.  Tuesday is $1 oyster night.  Reminds me of a New England fish dive.
author: Zaula D.

description:
yes. this place is reasonable for what you get and DELICIOUS.  the fish and chips was so crispy on the outside and flakey and soft inside.  fries weren't over salted and thin. the tartar sauce definitely tasted fresh and was perfect.  coleslaw was really fresh and good.  still not as good as chic-fil-a's slaw, but one of the better slaw's i've had.  

lobster role had huge fresh chunks of maine lobster on a beautifully toasted hotdog role.  

all in all, reeeeally good.  was looking for a go to fish and chips place and i think i found it.  will definitey be back to try other dishes.  everything is fresh and the atmosphere is nice.  not pretentious at all.  love it.
author: shar d.

description: Never had heard of this place until it was suggested tonight.  I love seafood and Woodhouse didn't disappoint.  Started out with some oysters (miyago and blue point I believe) and followed up with their pasta special of the night (shells, shrimp, bacon, tomato, red pepper), both of which were delicious.  Everything washed down with a couple of Trout Slayers from Montana.  Altogether excellent with only a few drawbacks.  Shared some calamari which was pretty good, not great.  And the mignonette for the oysters was light on the shallots, which I love.  Arrived around 6:45 so didn't have to wait.  Will definitely be coming back.
author: Chris H.

description: Loved the lobster roll - so delicious and buttery. I'm withholding the fifth star only because they don't take reservations (why not??). Great atmosphere, reasonable wine list, and everything we ordered was tasty (cioppino, fish and chips, chowda).
author: Kate R.

description: I went here a week ago for my brithday dinner.  The service was  great and staff was very accomodating.  I had the Ciopinno which was OK.  The reason it was just OK was that it had items in it that I do not particulary like (muscles, so my fault for ordering it).  The garlic bread was a little too buttery but I guess some people like it that way.
author: Chuck Q.

description: everything i had here was really good. lobster roll with skinny fries, fish and chips and calamari. all good. all greasy. the main reason for making my way to Woodhouse was to dive into a lobster roll. it was great and fresh, but i don't think it beats Sam's Chowder House's roll. and Sam's doesn't beat Pearl Oyster Bar in NY. i would definitely come back though. quality food.
author: Regina C.

description: Stay away from the shrimp sandwich. The crab was amazing as well as the ciopinno. Fish and chips was highy recommended.
author: Nick C.

description: I like this place for the whole dungeness crab. It's work but so good. My husband wasn't crazy about the crabcakes but did enjoy the steamed oysters.
author: Christa D.

description:
bangin food
good location
friendly staff
nice interior while not being stuffy

added bonus: guy who seated us had interesting facial hair
author: Lei E.

description: I went to this place for the first time, about a week ago. It's clean, the service is excellent and the food is superb. I highly recommend the halibut.
author: Cassandra B.

description:
Stuffed Artichoke is the best thing ever!  It sits on a salad with beets. I couldn't believe how good the meal was!  I'd go back all the time if I could.  

We did get a bad oyster and they didn't even take it off the bill. The oyster seriously smelled awful.  Yuck!
author: Rosemary C.

description: GREAT FOOD !!!!! and it's reasonable price.  Sevice is ok.  I just go there for the food.
author: Nan P.

description: The oyster was pretty good.  The first batch we had was a bit sandy but the second was absolutely delicious.  The halibut entree...the best fish dish i've ever had.  The bread putting was small in serving but was tasty.
author: Audrey L.

description: Yum and YUM.  Woodhouse is my ultimate "go to" place for a great, casual and "no-fuss" dinner.  The service is wonderful, and the $1 oyster Tuesdays are a treat.  I highly recommend the split and grilled artichoke with shrimp and crab.  Perfect light dinner with a great glass of chardonnay.  The specials menu changes daily, but guaranteed it's always something wonderful.  5 stars from this happy-Yelper.
author: Lauren M.

description: Excellent Fried Calamari and Lobster Rolls.  Friendly and efficient service.  Will definitely come back.
author: Mickey S.

description: Went here because I was craving a lobster roll. Roll ok. Lobster was not the freshest I've had. Fries were good. Would consider coming back to try something else. Service was ok.
author: T L.

description: Woodhouse on Fillmore is pretty good. First off, the restaurant is designed right and love the overall look of the furniture and the model of a fishing boat. Not the deadliest catch but kind of like The Eye of the Storm boat. The condiments of malt vinegar, tabasco and ketchup in a shiny tin is a pretty nice touch. The food matched the surroundings pretty well. The fish and chips are just great. How'd they get that batter nice and crunchy with the right golden color? That's execution right there! The chips were extra crunchy and we even took it home and popped them in the oven for a late night snack and they came out even better. I had the fish tacos and loved the salsa relish with the lime squeezed over to give it that right flavor. The calamari was damn irresistible and the Seafood Ciappino was pretty good. Two things wrong though, one, it was a little salty and secondly the bread they served it with wasn't enough. Lastly, the lemonade was pretty inventive. Lemon juice, club soda and simple syrup you're at the captains wheel for mixing this concoction to your preference. Nice... just get here early for dinner or the wait can get to be unbearable. For you women, there's a Crossroads across the street if you're impatient (men, that'll give you some time alone with your iPhone game while you wait for your table outside or in... you could thank me later it's better than having her complain about the wait)
author: graham c.

description: i'm giving woodhouse more like 3.5 stars. don't get me wrong...i like them and all, but wasn't wowed! everything is tasty, the fish & chips and lobster roll, but i feel like i've had better. however, this is a place i might think of coming back to, but may not the first that comes to mind.
author: Marjie T.

description: Shocked to see this place has such good reviews.  It's the kind of cozy place where you can get a seat quickly when all the other restaurants on Fillmore have a wait of more than an hour ... which is great, except that there's a reason why.  When I went, the seafood was not fresh.  Plus, the preparation was clumsy -- sandwich bread was heavy, the crispy calamari had too much breading, etc.  Definitely have had better.
author: Mónica H.

description: All the best features of Woodhouse One: classic East-Coast fare like lobster rolls, fried clams and chowdah, friendly staff and a fun atmosphere, and cold Anchor Steam  in chilled glasses; plus the Fillmore location has lots more fresh fish options, a classier dining-room, and more oysters!  I'll be seeing you soon, WFC!
author: Poppa W.

description:
Awesome at its finest...
Went to the new Fillmore location for a birthday dinner and was SOOO pleased with everything:

the atmosphere was awesome - stampled ceilings and classy decor mixed with a bit of funky giant squid and personality. all the staff were incredibly kind and the service was fast. 

but the food!!! in our table of 4 we witnessed someone's "best crabcake ever" and "best bread pudding ever." The clam chowder is light and delicate and amazing and you can taste the fresh cream. The crabcakes have a bit of a kick and you just wanna die. The fish and chips - MY FAVORITE - not only perfectly cooked and well portioned, but the tarter sauce is obviously fresh and the coleslaw is perfect - not overly sweet, but again fresh and perfectly spiced. the ceasar salad also fabulous and not overly fishy. ingredient quality shows in the taste.

but it was details like the Arnold Palmer that make me swoon - it comes served as a fresh lemon squeezed over ice with a garnish accompanied by a carrier with two small glass bottles - one with unsweetened tea, and the other with simple syrup so you can make your own alchemy of perfect sweetness. 

last phase - desserts. strawberry shortcake served with quartered strawberries and a light syrup with a fresh warm short bread and fresh whipped real cream. no BS here - strait amazingtown. and the breadpudding was perfectly crisped on the edges, warm and puddingy in the middle, served with vanilla bean ice cream.

absolutely worth checking out!!!
author: Creek H.

description: If you are looking for the best Lobster Roll ever look no further.  Born and raise in Boston and Woodhouse has the best Lobster Roll I have ever had bar none!  The service is outstanding and most ever night the guy that meets you at the door is one of the owners.  The place is small but the food is grand.
author: Timothy L.

description: This was a good place to eat, but not a destination unto itself. The food was tasty and the atmosphere good, but the chowder wasn't good- and that was a bummer based on location and our mood.
author: Carly K.

description: the clam cowder was ok. the lobster roll also ok..
author: Roger W.

description: Based on the food alone, this restaurant would rate five stars.  My son and I had dungeness crab, which was wonderful.  My wife had grilled artichokes stuffed with shrimp and crab, which she raved about, and we also enjoyed an heirloom tomato salad.  I don't want to be too critical of the decor because it was pleasant, but this is a neighborhood-type place, so it doesn't have the type of ambience you would expect in a five star establishment.  The desserts looked nice, but we really couldn't eat anymore, partly because had wine and appetizers before we got there, but we'll try them next time.  This place is well worth a visit.
author: Geoffrey K.

description: DELICIOUS!!!!  I have always walked by and thought that I should come here some time and last night was my some time.  We waited for 50 minutes or so to get a table for 2.  Tuesday is $1 oyster night so I understood the wait.  We started with oysters - they were fresh and big.  I had the Hartford New England Clam Chowder - a mix of the red and white and it was yummy in the tummy.  The bf had the white clam chowder and followed it with the crab roll which was very good.  I went with a special - the softshell crab BLT - yes it is as or more delicious as it sounds.  The crab was huge and the combo of it with the BLT ingredients was amazing!!  We ended the night with their bread pudding - it was so good I had to fight the food coma.  To top off the great food, our waiter was awesome and we totally enjoyed our experience.  We will be back for more on another Tuesday - you can't beat $1 oysters!!
author: Arica V.

description: Just had a great meal of the fish of the day (salmon with two very yummy sides- greens and a cheesy, bacony squash dish) and the ciopinno.  My husband and I split, and the overall meal was excellent.
author: T W.

description: Delicious. My friend and I shared the stuffed artichoke and the crab melt, both were amazing and the perfect amount of food. Everything was fresh and perfectly seasoned. Cool atmosphere with a decent beer selection and a lot of menu options. Can't wait to go back and try more!
author: Caedmon P.

description: Food was pretty good, however the service left something to be desired. It seemed as though there was only one waitress for the whole restaurant. The manager/host kept walking by our tables, but paid no attention to us even though it was clear we were ready to order.
author: Roger R.

description: I definitely plan on visiting this place again and again.  It's a great addition to Fillmore Street.  I've eaten here twice in two weeks.  Very reasonably priced, great food, fun location.  The lobster roll was fantastic--big pieces of lobster, not overly dressed, served on a buttered and toasted roll (not a hot dog bun).  Wait staff is friendly and attentive.  Overall, I think it's a winner....it has the three winning ingredients...great good, great staff, great prices.  Looking forward to my next meal here.
author: Laura D.

description: went here for dinner with my fiance on a tuesday. about a 30 minute wait. Skip the crab cakes....they were bland, and ive had way better elsewhere. The food was very good. We started with the clam chowder...yummy. I had a lobster roll which was also very good. I would go back to try some other stuff. Our waiter was also very nice :)
author: laury g.

description: A deceptively simple looking restaurant with great service and fantastic food.  Next time I'm in San Fran, I'll go out of my way to eat here again.
author: DL W.

description: Read all the reviews on yelp, and absolutely agree on the lobster roll. A bit pricey for the smaller roll, but you do get a good quantity of lobster. Overall, the sanwich is superb! Damn, I want one now...
author: George H.

description: great food. great service. awesome decor! a little odd that they require the whole group to be there before being seated. they were a bit lenient with us (with our 2 yr old who needed to walk around outside). but, overall, it was awesome. the TV with the movie(s) of boats and fishing were a bonus!
author: Loren L.

description: I had lunch here recently and it was delicious. I got to try the Hartford clam chowder (a combination of white and red) and it was actually really good. The onion rings, iceberg wedge salad, lobster roll and stuffed artichoke were a hit. The dungeness crab was a bit of a disappointment but that is probably because the other items were so good. Will definitely come back.
author: Keromi K.

description: Great Pacific Heights restaurant.  Went there with my parents.  The cioppino was fantastic.  My wife loved the stuffed artichokes.  Small restaurant with an excellent neighborhood feel.  The only difficulty was parking.
author: Sean D.

description: This place is easily worth 4 stars.  I had the chowder, crab sandwich and fish and chips.  Everything was wonderful and the  price was right.  My only complaint was that the chowder was a little too thick; I would thin it out just a tad.  But I would still order it again.  I wish we had a place like this in Oakland...
author: Anthony W.

description: not a fancy place but wait untill you taste the food! i had the stuffed artichoke and loved every bite. they take the choke , marinate it overnite in spices , olive oil and the next day its ready to be grilled on both sides and then 1/2 is stuffed with bay shrimp and the other 1/2 has crab. wow is it good. the waitress was also very pleasant and helpful.
author: Lee M.
