description: Woodhouse (two) is a classy affordable joint with tasty food.  I love open kitchen restaurants, it really makes it feel like the chef is cooking for YOU.   Looks like these guys have done it right with a nice atmosphere, great service and great food.
author: Trevor P.

description: Woodhouse Rocks!  Great seafood at reasonable prices.  Perfect for a tightwad like me.
author: Todd W.

description: I've been several times, mostly on Tuesdays for the $1 oysters, and I've loved each visit.  Great mussels.  I am otherwise not a fish person, but the fish is fresh, a great selection, wonderfully prepared, and the price is right.  Service is very good, wine & beer choices very good, location and atmosphere fun, nothing bad to say.
author: Bob M.

description: Possibly the best wedge salad ever.  Caesar-like dressing piled high with shrimpies.  The naked lobster roll on a warm, buttery bun was simple & delicious without being too heavy.  My date had the maple-pecan-crusted halibut with the potato-leek gratin. Little too carmelized on the bottom of the gratin. Pricey, but excellent quality.  Fun staff.  Gratiuitous Trawler models line the picture railing.  Must be a pain to dust.
author: Jon L.

description: I've been twice and happy with both visits.  The Ipswich clams are insane.  The lobster roll and fish and chips are also fantastic.  The Cioppino was alright, but not as stellar as the remaining items we ordered.  Service was good, decor is cute.  I'll definitely be back.  Oh yeah, the New England Clam Chowder was also delish!  :)
author: Melissa I.

description: They deliver on consistently good fish.  Their shellfish (esp the baked clams if you're into those) is awesome and I also recommend the oysters.  I can't say I love the ambiance - not a ton of charm, but it's ok.
author: Lisa K.

description:
$1 oysters Tues. nites--clean, no sand, creamy, briny = good enough for me. we lucked out w/3 different varieties when my bff & i stopped in that nite. my bff mentioned last time she went, they only had 1 or 2 varieties...so it depends on the restaurant's oyster purchase of the day/week. so, good luck...

crab melt--like a tuna melt but better...heavy though. had half other sammy to bring home. fries were good!!!! shoestring fries..my fave! 

lobster roll looked good from afar & heard great reviews but for $16 price, i can get a whole lobster at a fish market (yes, it happens when asian markets sell $7.99/lb lobsters--grab a 2 pounder & u have enough to make 2-3 HEARTY lobster rolls! stupid restaurant prices for a lobster sammy?!)

service was nice, waiter was friendly & offered great recommendations. 

street parking can be difficult but i have a parking god so no worries for me. 

p.s. arrive early (like before 5:30pm on tuesdays) b/c it gets packed w/the pac heights/marina/fidi/SOMA yuppies, ewwww....like a scene of "the hills, " gross.
author: Yolanda L.

description: I went in with a craving for some great oysters, and unique seafood, and left underwhelmed.  I was a bit worried about the oysters when I noticed that they didn't actually have an oyster "list" or mention what type they were serving, as most positive oyster experiences I've had that has been the norm.  They weren't very good.  Not up to the quality I've had at Anchor + Hope and Bar Crudo in SF, and I missed the mignonette they're usually served with.  To be fair they were $2 a piece when they are $3-$4 at those places.  I also had the crab melt, which was "meh", kind of like tuna salad but with crab.  It didn't have much flavor.  The fries were the highlight of my meal, very crispy.  We saved room for the sourdough bread pudding but our waitress basically insinuated we'd probably like the yogurt place next door better, so we passed.  You know it's bad when the staff suggests you go elsewhere for dessert!
author: Cliff B.

description: I brought my boyfriend and his parents to this restaurant because they were craving seafood ... and we were extremely impressed.  kudos to this place for serving delicious food!!!  Me and his dad had the ciopino and it was excellent .. i was pissed because i couldnt finish the dish because i was too full.  we would definitely go back here!!!  It's affordable too .. thought the quality was byfar more than that we paid for!!
author: Joy G.

description: Although I liked the decor and service very much, the food was average. Our appetizer (steamed mussels) was very good with a light sauce, but the entrees were too greasy and too much sauce for a delicate fish. I won't go back here since there are other better options in the city.
author: Ichiban S.

description: The food was great, the specials were numerous, and the service was fast and friendly.
author: Adam L.

description: Decent prices and portions. Had the crab cakes, which were pretty good, and my friend had the special (roasted halibut with risotto). Very flavorful and moist, without being underdone or chewy. It's crowded and noisy, and the service isn't very attentive (our waiter took our order and then we never saw him again - not even to get our check). Overall, not bad.
author: Lemon S.

description:
this is THE platonic ideal of the fried fish restaurant - so much so that the art directed props & faux tin ceiling might make you walk out shaking your head tsk tsk - but don't leave just b/c a restaurant concept professional is on the payroll! just order a glass of white (husband didn't like the malbec), fish & chips w/ extra slaw& iceberg w/ iowa maytag blue - i almost hate to say it b/c i like mom&pop too & i hate the man--but they get it perfectly right. 
notes:
--the kitchen is reaching out of the typical fish fry menu w/ their bacon wrapped shroom stuffed trout - but they hit it out of the park.
--only tiny beef (ha ha) w/ the place:
i know the italians do it & it's in keeping w/ the folksy vibe, but i do like wine in a proper glass, not those sturdy tumblers.
--and thanks for serving real portions@ reasonable prices, nothing worse than having to eat 2nd dinner at home.
--i was so sated i couldn't even think of having dessert next door  @ fraiche, the yummiest yogurt purveyor in sf.
author: Kim Y.

description: We tried this place on a whim when we were in the Fillmore area this weekend.  We were blown away by the delicious, fresh, and perfectly prepared food.  I had the pasta with crab and my husband had the whole roasted fish (dorado, also known as sea bream, I think).  My pasta was made that day and was perfectly al dente.  There was plenty of crab meat in large yummy chunks and the sauce was very light and not overpowering.  Basically, a bowl of yummy, perfectly cooked seafood pasta.  My husband's whole roasted fish was equally delicious.  It was flacky with a subtle vinegrette-like sauce and delicious veggies all around (the grilled fennel was incredible).  The waiter was very helpful with suggestions on how to tackle eating/deboning the whole fish.  We had a yummy spanish white wine to go with the meal and finished off with an amazing chocolate mousse with caramel whipped cream.  Be prepared to wait a bit for a table if you don't have a reservation, but it's well worth the wait for some amazing fresh seafood at pretty reasonable prices.  Definitely a new favorite.
author: squirrel l.

description: I had my first dinner at Woodhouse last night and it was fantastic! Service, atmosphere, and food were all top notch. It is just what Fillmore needs and I can't wait to go back.
author: Leah T.
